quest.name: 月影の導き
journal: Jacke has just the job for a dimber mortcove like yourself.

Impressed with the work you have done for his guild, Jacke tasks you with looking into a group of suspicious individuals who have attracted the attention of his men in recent days. Travel to Wineport, where the dodgy types have been seen, and rendezvous with your fellow rogue, Perimu Haurimu.

Perimu elaborates upon the target of your investigation─what little he has gleaned, at least─when your conversation is interrupted by the sound of a scream coming from within the town. Head into Wineport and investigate.

You enter Wineport to find a milkmaid─the source of the scream─standing over the bodies of three ruffians. She explains that she was almost mugged, until the brutes turned upon each other in a drunken scuffle which incapacitated all of them. Finding her story a bit too convenient, Perimu heads off east of Wineport to investigate. Follow your guildmate and see what he has found.

Perimu finds a couple of farmhands lying on the ground, equipped with weapons and suffering from mortal wounds. Convinced more than ever that the innocent milkmaid is not what she appears to be, he heads off in pursuit. Accompany him to upper La Noscea and ascertain the girl's true identity.

No sooner do you and Perimu happen upon the girl than are you ambushed by an eccentric Easterner clad in red. A comrade of the girl's arrives, and the would-be assailant retreats, strongly implying that you've not seen the last of him. Conversing with the two reveals them as Oboro and Tsubame, shinobi from the Far Eastern land of Doma, come to bring their traitorous countryman─the man named Karasu─to justice. Upon seeing the soul of his fallen brother respond to your touch, Oboro offers to instruct you in the art of his people in exchange for information that might assist him in his mission. Should you care to take him up on his offer, seek him out at the Raincatcher Gully docks.

Oboro is heartened by your arrival, and invites you to step inside the storehouse where the two of you may speak in private. He gives you the necessary password: when the gatekeep Byakubu speaks Ayame, you are to answer Kaede.
Your pronunciation of the Doman language seems to have satisfied Byakubu, who grants you passage into the ninja hideout. Speak with Oboro, who awaits you within.

Oboro expresses his gratitude for your cooperation, and gives you a brief summary of the ancient art passed down among his people for generations. As he tells it, the art─called ninjutsu─involves channeling the powers of heaven, earth, and man, given physical form through the use of hand gestures known as mudra. He teaches you your first mudra, Ten, and invites you to attune yourself to the soul of his brother and speak with him again to commence your training.
objectives: Speak with Perimu Haurimu in Wineport.
Investigate Wineport for suspicious activity.
Speak with Perimu Haurimu.
Speak with the queer maid at Bronze Lake.
Speak with Oboro by the storehouse at the Raincatcher Gully docks.
Speak with Byakubu.
Speak with Oboro.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Keepin' yer stabbers sharpened, I hope? 'Cause I've got a job to be done, and I reckon the dimber damber what put the Executioners on the choppin' block is just the one to do the doin'.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: My men have sighted some shifty types 'round Wineport o' late. Not code-breakin' curs, so far as I know, an' that's the rub─we don't know half as much about them as I'd like.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: They claim to be simple peasants─refugees from some far-flung realm─but I don't know many peasants what skulk about in the darkmans as much as they've been doin'.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: So long as they're not breakin' the code, they can do as they please. But bein' who we are, it falls to us to look into the matter an' make sure that all's bob.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: As my gut tells me this may be a two-rogue job, I've sent Underfoot on ahead. So pull on yer best beater cases, head to Wineport, an' meet him there.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: This ain't the time for prittle prattle, Forename. I'm countin' on you and Underfoot to snilch Wineport and make sure that all's bob.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Forename! When Jacke said he'd be sendin' one o' the guild's canniest mortscoves along after me, I had a feelin' it might be you.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Now, I'd love to tell ye ol' Underfoot's already whiddled the whole scrap on our friends, but truth is I've turned up more questions than answers.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: They claim to hail from the south sea isles, but me little birds at Mealvaan's Gate swear to the last man that that's some piss-poor mummery. There's no record of any such ship sailin' into port.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Looks like it falls to you and me to take a closer snilch, aye? I hope ye brought yer sharpest stabbers, as there's no tellin' who we're─

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Did ye hear that, lasslad? Either ol' Underfoot's gone daft, or some mort just screamed out for dear life.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Somethin' tells me our little task is about to take a turn for the interestin'. What say we go see what's what?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: H-Have mercy! I am but a simple milkmaid, with not a single gil to my name.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Rest easy, lass─my friend and I don't mean ye no harm. Though I must say ye've got me curious─just what in the name o' the Twelve happened here?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I had just come to town to purchase some supplies. No sooner had I walked through the gates than I was suddenly accosted by three burly drunkards who demanded that I hand over all of my possessions.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: To my good fortune, it seems the men had partaken a bit too heavily. When they saw the meager contents of my coinpurse, they began to squabble among themselves. A fistfight ensued, and before I knew it, the three men were lying on the ground as you see them now.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Sounds like Nymeia smiled upon you today, lass. Though might I suggest ye be a bit more careful on yer next visit. All manner of scurvy sorts frequent these parts, and you'll find that not all of them are blundering lackwits like yer friends here.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Thank you for your concern, good sir, and rest assured that I will take your words to heart. Good day to the both of you.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Well, Forename? How did the girl's whids strike ye?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What did you think of the girl?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Mummery, I say.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Seemed like an upright lass.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: You too? I was thinkin' the very same. Squabblin' amongst themselves? Just look─there's barely a scratch on any o' these louts.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Ye reckon? As for me, I've got me questions. Squabblin' amongst themselves? Just look─there's barely a scratch on any o' these louts.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Aye, I'd wager there's more to the rum doxy than she's lettin' on. Come, let's go on the drag and see what she might be hidin'.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: ...And a right mess we've got here. Ye reckon these coves got on the wrong side of our lass? One thing's for sure, they're no more peasants than you an' I─one look at those stabbers tells me as much.

dialogue.name: NINJA00212
dialogue.text:
(-Man in Peasant Garb-)I have...failed...
I beg of you... Take this, and return it to Master Oboro...to Lady...Tsubame...

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: ...It's too late. The poor sod's dead. As for this stone, yer guess's as good as mine. A lucky charm o' sorts, mayhap?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Anyroad, we'd best start movin' our dew beaters afore the lass gets away. Her footprints lead in the direction of upper La Noscea.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-???-)She hides behind a tree...as if that could hide her from me!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Eccentric Easterner-)She didn't really think she could fool me with those silly rags, did she? Or did she? Perhaps she's not as clever as we believed?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Eccentric Easterner-)And a mysterious savior rushes to the damsel's defense! Such braverychivalry! Such compassion!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Eccentric Easterner-)...Such folly! Little does shehe know that the girl is more than capable of taking care of herself.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Eccentric Easterner-)...And right on cue! Oboro the dim leaps onto the scene to save his dear little swallow in the most unsurprising surprise attack the realm has ever seen!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Cease your ramblings, Karasu, before I rip that tongue from your bloody beak!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Karasu-)Yeeeow! Our hero is wounded! A stab through the heart! His childhood friends stand before him, blades drawn and hate in their eyes! Oh, the tragedy of it all! The audience sobs!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Karasu-)...And what's this? A couple of bit players who have forgotten to leave the stage? Did no one tell them their part in the play is long since over?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Karasu-)Oho! And the faceless rogue shows surprising skill! Perhaps shehe yet has a role to play? I will say this much: unlike a certain someone, at least you...intrigue me.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Karasu-)...But other matters demand our hero's attention, and so the first act must draw to a close. Come, my pet!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Wait! Karasu! ...Ever quick to retreat, that one.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: (-Queer Maid-)The twotwo gentlemen from Wineport? Did you...follow me here?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Beg pardon, miss. My friend an' I are here on behalf o' the Dutiful Sisters. An' you, Sister, have some questions to answer.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: I've lived on the underbelly o' society long enough to recognize when a man's more than he seems. So make this easy for us, lass─just who exactly are ye, and what are ye doin' here? And here's hopin' for both your sakes that it doesn't involve breakin' no code.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)...So you are the rogues of whom Lady Yugiri spoke. Forgive me─we were remiss in not seeking you out sooner. Very well. You shall know all there is to know.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)...So you are the rogues of whom I have heard so much. Forgive me─we were remiss in not seeking you out sooner. Very well. You shall know all there is to know.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My name is Oboro, and she is Tsubame. We hail from a village in Doma, several thousand malms across the sea. We are─ah, but perhaps you have no word for what we are. In our own tongue, one might call us shinobi.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Doma? The imperial province!?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: ...The same, though it did not have to be so. Our countrymen fought with honor against the might of Garlemald. What we lacked in number, we made up for with martial prowess. It was a battle we could have won...had we not been betrayed by one of our own.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Our every secret, our every move known to our foe, the tide of battle turned on the morrow. Thousands of our countrymen were slaughtered, and at day's end, Doma remained under the imperial yoke.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The traitorous cur joined the imperial ranks as chief of their covert operatives, or so they say. That is the man you just met, Karasu─though I am loath to call him a man.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: To this day, he whispers in the ears of the Garleans, making a mockery of those who once called him friend and brother─but no longer. We have come to Eorzea at our village elder's behest to see that Karasu pays for his crimes...with his life.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Come to mill a treacherous rook who blew the gab on his comrades? You sound like a right bene cove─consider ol' Underfoot impressed.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Forgive me─this land and its tongue are still new to us. Nonetheless, we were able to lure Karasu here, but more than a few of our comrades gave their lives in the effort. And now this... Was their sacrifice for naught?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah... You have my gratitude. When one of our kind falls, tradition dictates that we return their soul to the village, that it may rest with our ancestors.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What!? Our fallen brother's soul calls out to this womanman? Could it be a sign? Are we fated to fight as one?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I would make you an offer. We will instruct you in our art─the art of ninjutsu. In return, you will share with us your knowledge of this land, that it might serve us in our mission.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: B-But, Oboro! SheHe is not Doman! SheHe is not of the village!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Look around you, Tsubame. Our brothers and sisters are fallen or gravely wounded. And today's failure makes it all too clear─we cannot hope to stand against Karasu without knowing the lay of the land.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Can't say I'm thrilled at the prospect o' losin' a dimber damber like yerself, but hells! In my younger days, I'd like been keen to try my fams at some o' those techniques myself!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: An' the more my wattles take in, the more these two strike me as benar and benar folks. If yer keen to lend them yer daddles, I'll not be the one to stand in yer way.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: If you would know more, come to the dock storehouse at Raincatcher Gully. We shall await you there.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Who'd have figured, eh? Anyroad, the choice is yours, Forename. In the meantime, I'm goin' to head back to Limsa and report to Jacke afore he comes an' gives me a good clout in the nob.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Tradition forbids us from sharing our art with those from outside our village. Yet watching you hold your own against Karasu today, I cannot deny your potential...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And so we meet again. Am I to take your presence to mean that you have chosen to accept our offer?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Accept Oboro's offer?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Thank you. I speak not only for myself and Tsubame but for our entire village when I say that you have our profound gratitude.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What I would tell you next, I would tell you out of the earshot of strangers. Byakubu has been instructed to let only trusted visitors through the doors behind me.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: When he speaks to you a-ya-me, you are to answer ka-e-de. You need not know what the words mean, only that they will grant you entrance.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I see. This disappoints me, yet it is honorable of you to deliver the message in person. Should you ever have a change of heart, pray return to us.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro has chosen to accept you, and it is not my place to question his judgment. From this day on, you are one of us.

dialogue.name: BYAKUBU
dialogue.text: A...ya...me...

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: How will you answer?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Kaede.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Kaeru.

dialogue.name: BYAKUBU
dialogue.text: ...Enter.

dialogue.name: BYAKUBU
dialogue.text: ...Begone.

dialogue.name: BYAKUBU
dialogue.text: ...Master Oboro awaits.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Welcome, Forename. You stand within the provisional base of operations my people have established in your land of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It may not look like much─either without or within─but that is precisely the point. We find it an ideal vantage point from which to observe the comings and goings of Karasu and his men without attracting undue attention to ourselves.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My fallen brother saw you as a worthy inheritor to his soul. To honor his memory, I entrust it to you. But soul alone will not make you a shinobi. No, this will require training of the body and mind.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Our art─the art of ninjutsu─originated with our ancestors many years ago. Since then, it has been passed down with each generation...mother to daughter, father to son.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We draw power from the world around us─the heaven, the earth, and the hearts of man─and channel this power into physical form. I am told that this is similar to your concept of...ay-ther, was it? I must confess that Eorzean words and ways remain unfamiliar to me.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: How does one channel this power, you ask? Through the use of mudra, hand gestures that call forth each of the three forms of energy of which I spoke. The first mudra I will teach you will call power from the heavens. In Doma, we call this Ten.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You are eager to learn, yes? Attune your soul to that of my fallen brother, then approach me once more. It is then that your training will begin.

quest.name: 刃と心で為すがもの
journal: Oboro would give you your first lesson in the art of ninjutsu.

Sensing that the soul of his ancestors is strong in you, Oboro willingly imparts to you a basic form of ninjutsu, the Fuma Shuriken. Form the mudra for heaven, or Ten, then unleash the technique and channel the energy forth as a flaming projectile. As your first task, demonstrate the technique for Oboro on the mokujin, or training dummy, that has been set up outside the dock storehouse.
Your Fuma Shuriken strikes the mokujin true. Speak with Oboro to hear his evaluation of your technique.
Oboro deems you ready for the next phase of your training, which will pit you against live opponents. Prepare yourself as necessary, then speak with him when you are ready to do battle.
By holding your own against Oboro and his summoned minions, you have passed your latest test with flying colors. Speak with Oboro, who is doubtless pleased with your efforts.

Oboro and Tsubame are most impressed at the swiftness with which you have mastered your first mudra. In return for the lesson you received, you instruct the Domans in the finer points of the Eorzean bow, a gesture that─despite its seeming simplicity─does not come easily to Oboro. He encourages you to continue to hone your technique until you are ready to receive your next lesson.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Tsubame upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Use Fuma Shuriken on the mokujin.
Report to Oboro.
Speak with Oboro to begin your training.
Speak with Oboro.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Yes... I can sense it. Though you are not of our blood, the soul of my people is strong in you. You are one of us now, a shinobi.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...And yet your training has only just begun.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Heed my words well, Forename. For the shinobi, blade and mind are one. The weak mind gives rise to a weak blade. The false mind gives rise to a false blade. But the mind that is strong and true? That blade will know no equal.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Such were the teachings of my master, his master, and his master's master before him. The shinobi must keep presence of mind at all times, or his blade may as well be one of grass.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That is the lesson of the mind. Now we shall begin the lesson of the body.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You will recall that the art of ninjutsu involves using hand gestures called mudra to summon the energies of heaven, earth, and man─Ten, Chi, and Jin in the Doman tongue.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Myriad techniques can be unleashed depending on the mudra you combine, and the order in which you do so... But perhaps I am getting ahead of myself. A child must learn to walk before he can run.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: To begin, I would see you master your first mudra─Ten, the mudra of heaven. Summon the energy of heaven and project it forth, and from your hand will fly a flaming star, or Fuma Shuriken.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Outside of the storehouse, you will find a mokujin─a wooden man of the sort traditionally used in Doma for training. Do as I have told you and strike it with a Fuma Shuriken. I will observe your technique from a distance.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Form the mudra Ten to summon the energy of heaven, then channel it from your hands in the form of a Fuma Shuriken to strike the mokujin. I will observe your technique from a distance.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: The art of ninjutsu is easily learned, but not so easily mastered. Be patient, and heed well Oboro's words.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A training manikin of Far Eastern make has been set in the ground.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Yes, that will do, Forename. Clearly we did not misjudge your potential.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Perhaps you have also felt your body becoming lighter. This is but another benefit of your training. You may find yourself able to dance through the air with your blades drawn. But be mindful: the true shinobi sees that no movement is wasted.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You demonstrated your skills well against the wooden man, but wood does not strike back. Your next opponent will not be so docile. Prepare yourself.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Beneath that dour expression, I know that Oboro finds you a worthy student. But do not think for a moment that he will hold back his strength.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Your aptitude for our art is nothing short of astounding, Forename. The soul of our ancestors chose wisely, indeed.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I see. Lady Yugiri spoke true.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I see.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: What Oboro means to say is that he's not seen anyone master the fundamentals of ninjutsu with such swiftness. Is that not so, Oboro?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I am capable of speaking for myself, Tsubame. But it is true: Forename has exceeded even my own expectations. HerHis blade slices through the air as a fish glides through water.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But that is enough training for the day. Now, it is my turn to be the student, and you the teacher. I would learn the ways of Eorzea. You will instruct me, yes?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You have my gratitude, Forename.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: First, I would better know the terrain of La Nosc─hm? Is something amusing?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My bow!? I see. Who would have thought a simple gesture of courtesy would be so complicated? Like this, is it? <cough> Urk...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Forgive him. Oboro has not been quite himself since coming to these shores. It would seem that neither the food nor the climate agrees with him.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And let us not forget the stink of those infernal horsebirds! All the more reason for us to complete our mission swiftly and return to more hospitable environs. Anyhow, Forename, that should suffice for the day. Practice well your ninjutsu, and return when you are ready for your next lesson.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: It would seem you have some practicing to do as well.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the onibi!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the ogama and onibi!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Oboro!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The onibi will attack in waves. Use your Fuma Shuriken to dispatch them from a safe distance.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Excellent, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I shall summon a great beast for your next challenge. Remember: you must maintain presence of mind, no matter how fearsome the foe!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: For your final challenge, I shall be your opponent. Let us see how well you have learned!

quest.name: 新たな印
journal: Tsubame appears quite pleased with your progress.

Tsubame is deeply impressed at the aptitude and affinity you have shown for the way of the shinobi, and she muses that your skills might one day rival her own. Now, the time has come to receive your next lesson. Enter the storehouse and speak with Oboro.

After proudly displaying his own mastery of a challenging technique─the common Eorzean bow─Oboro teaches you your second mudra. Known as Chi in the Doman tongue, this gesture will allow you to call forth the power of the earth itself. When you are prepared to learn how to wield it in battle, speak with Oboro once more.
objectives: Speak with Oboro.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Forename! Why, I did not even hear your footsteps as you approached. You are becoming more and more the shinobi with each day.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro has been awaiting your return. Please, enter.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Hand before the torso, bend at the hips... Presence of mind, presence of mind...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: The ease with which you have grasped the basics of our art is impressive, to say the least. Neglect not your training, and I can foresee the day when your skills rival my own.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. It is clear from the manner in which you carry yourself that you have been most diligent in your training.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But you are not the only one who has mastered the technique imparted to you. Behold my Eorzean bow, perfect in balance and form!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. Now, it is time for your next lesson. Watch carefully my hands, Forename. With this mudra, the shinobi can summon the energies of the earth─Chi, in our tongue. Etch its form in your mind, and I shall show you how to employ it in battle.

quest.name: 朧と鴉
journal: Oboro would impart a new mudra to his promising pupil.

Having learned your second mudra from Oboro, you are now capable of wielding mudra combinations. By forming the mudra Ten and Chi─in that order─you can channel the power of heaven and earth to wield the ninjutsu Raiton, or lightning release. Demonstrate the technique for Oboro on the mokujin outside the storehouse.

You have successfully wielded Raiton, sending crackling bolts of lightning coursing through the mokujin, whose wooden limbs thankfully feel no pain. Speak with Oboro to hear his assessment of your technique.

Duly impressed with your prowess in wielding your first mudra combination, Oboro imparts to you a second. By reversing the order and forming the mudra for Chi followed by Ten, you can wield the ninjutsu Katon, or fire release. Unleash the skill on the poor mokujin, who clearly has not taken enough punishment.

A flaming inferno flies from your fingers and torches the mokujin, who, being the sturdy sort, appears to be none the worse for wear. Speak with Oboro in front of the storehouse and see if your technique meets his satisfaction.

Satisfied that you have grasped the basics of mudra combinations, Oboro would have you continue your training in the traditional Doman fashion. Accompany your instructor to Fool Falls in upper La Noscea.

What was to be a peaceful and meditative training session amidst the tumbling waters is interrupted by Karasu, who mocks his erstwhile countryman before assailing the both of you. Wielding your newfound talents to the best of your ability, you and Oboro manage to stand your ground against this formidable foe, who departs the scene with a swift stealthiness reminiscent of his namesake. Take a deep breath, calm your mind, and speak with Oboro to hear his thoughts on these events.
Oboro expresses his displeasure at his own carelessness and inability to foresee Karasu's ambush. Accompany him back to the dock storehouse to regroup and assess your next course of action.

Oboro reflects upon the events at the falls, and surmises from Karasu's words and actions that your foe sought not to kill you, but merely to test your strength. At the same time, he reaffirms his belief that you will prove a valuable ally to the two Domans in their mission of vengeance, and encourages you to continue to hone your skills.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Use Raiton on the mokujin.
Speak with Oboro.
Use Katon on the mokujin.
Speak with Oboro.
Speak with Oboro at Fool Falls.
Speak with Oboro.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Chi, or “earth,” marks the second mudra that you have learned. With this, you are ready to begin the next phase of your training.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It is through the combination of mudra that you will find new techniques. The first technique I would impart to you is Raiton, lightning release.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: “When heaven joins with earth, lightning will flash and thunder will roll.”

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: In other words, form the mudra Ten followed by Chi. Channel that energy forward, and bolts of lightning will surge from your hands to strike your foe.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: As this is a more formidable technique than the Fuma Shuriken you have wielded thus far, I have taken care to reinforce the mokujin outside the storehouse. Strike it with Raiton, and I shall observe.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Form the mudra Ten followed by Chi, and channel that energy forward as Raiton, the release of lightning. Go ahead, practice the technique on the mokujin over there.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Mudra combinations can be quite complex. Master them, and you will be well on your way to being a full-fledged shinobi!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This mokujin appears a bit sturdier than the one employed in your first lesson.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Very well. Now, recall what I said during our first lesson: the techniques at your disposal are created not merely by which mudra you form, but also the order in which you combine them.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: “When earth joins with heaven, the skies will rain fire and ash.” In other words, form the mudra Chi followed by Ten and channel those energies forward, and searing hellsfire will engulf your foes.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But be forewarned: these techniques require considerable exertion of your spirit. After performing one, you will observe that some time is required before your mind settles and you are able to wield another. Now, demonstrate Katon for me on the mokujin over there.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Form the mudra Chi followed by Ten, and channel that energy forward as Katon, fire release. Demonstrate the technique for me on the mokujin over there.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Splendid! Your grasp on fundamental mudra combinations is firm. But knowing the how of the technique is only the beginning─you must also understand when to employ it.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Chunin is our word for a shinobi who has attained full mastery of two-mudra techniques. In our tradition, when a student is deemed by his master to show such potential, shehe is led to a waterfall outside the village to conduct intense training.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I cannot take you to Doma, of course, but my maps tell me of a place in upper La Noscea that should suffice: Fool Falls. The name is less than auspicious, but it will have to do. Meet me there, and we shall proceed.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Until today, I knew this place only as letters on a map. Gazing upon it with my own eyes, it is even more beautiful and powerful than I could have imagined. Yes, this will serve us well.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My people do not worship your deities twelve. Our gods are all around us─in the trees, in the soil, in the crashing waters before you. Close your eyes and open your heart to the sound of the rushing falls, that you might purge your mind of all worldly thoughts and distractions.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The techniques you have learned will serve you well in battle, but confuse the order of your mudra and you can just as easily turn victory into defeat. It is imperative that you keep a single focus of mind.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: So it is that masters have brought their students to falls like this one for training since my ancestors' times.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-???-)Who is the more foolish: the fool of Fool Falls, or the fool who comes here without realizing he's been followed?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Karasu!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Now here's a curious scene! The dim one is accompanied today not by his swallow, but by a chirping horsebird chick who fancies herselfhimself a shinobi.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The dim one is displeased! This, after our hero postponed two assassinations to make this little journey! Could his friends not greet him with a smile and some crumpets─or whatever it is Eorzeans take with their tea?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The dim one ponders: how did our hero know to find him here!? Yet the answer is plain as day. The dim one is a creature of habit and tradition─where else would he bring his prized new pupil?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Tradition! Our hero spits on tired tradition! No, for he is a shinobi of a different feather! Ever changing, never predictable...but always─always─in style!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Those who cling too closely to tradition are bound to suffer the fate of their forebears. Or are the lessons of the past so soon forgotten?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ready yourself, Forename! It appears that your training today will be of a more practical sort.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: But of course! All you had to do was ask nicely. It would be my pleasure to be your teacher for the day.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Your first lesson, little chick: Raiton's lightning will strike a single foe, while Katon's flames will raze many. Wield them wisely, or don't─it's only your life at stake! Kah hah hah!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oh, how generous is our hero, putting aside his killings and spyings to play mother hen to the horsebird chick! You will try to keep me entertained, won't you?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You fought well, Forename. I, however, should have known to expect the traitor's attack. I was careless, and put you in danger. It will not happen again.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It appears that Karasu has taken an interest in you, and I fear this complicates matters some. Let us return to the docks. There is much I would tell you.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Ambushed by Karasu!? I... I am simply glad that you are safe, Forename.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I would tell you a story of our past. A story of the traitor, and why he must die at our hands.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Growing up in the same village, I have known Karasu since we were both children. When we came of age, we began our training together under Master Gekkai.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: From a young age, it was clear that Karasu possessed an innate talent for our art that few could rival. I spared no effort in my training, yet struggled to grasp techniques that he would master effortlessly.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: In his own way, he possesses a mind singularly devoid of wasteful thoughts. A mind seemingly unclouded by concepts such as right or wrong, good or evil. Despite this, deep down, I always thought of him as a brother.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: All that changed on that fateful day when Castle Doma fell to the Garleans. Someone had betrayed our homeland, sold our secrets to the enemy. Looking upon my friends as their bodies lay broken and bleeding, I saw a figure flee into the hills...it was Karasu.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Were I younger, more naive, I might have pursued Karasu as he fled, in an attempt to reason with him. But it was clear that this man─this demon─was no longer one of us...if, indeed, he ever had been.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Even Master Gekkai did not survive the slaughter. Did Karasu bear him some grudge, or was it merely a student's ugly pride? For our master's fate was the grisliest of all─his body mangled, his once-proud face shattered beyond all recognition.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I once held out hope...hope that if I crossed blades with Karasu in battle, that I might understand something of what it was that made him do those horrible deeds. Yet each encounter only raises more questions.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: One thing is clear, however. Karasu could have killed us back at Fool Falls had he seen fit, and yet chose not to. It was as if he were testing us. Testing you...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Needless to say, this does not change our mission. For his crimes against Doma, Karasu must pay with his life. And yet, his thorough knowledge of us and our art has put Tsubame and I at a grave disadvantage.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But you, Forename...your thoughts, your movements are still unfamiliar to him. Yes, your presence might just serve to break his focus and afford us an opening.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Yet to accomplish this, you must become stronger still. Promise me that you will not let up in your training.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Karasu!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Karasu's foot soldiers!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Karasu's minion!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The lesson begins! You will
try to make this fun for me, yes?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I was there, but now I'm here!
Can you not see?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Must they be so slow?
Our hero tires of this dull dance!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
If you're going to kill me,
could you be a bit quicker about it?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Alas, I fear your teacher has better places to be!
But worry not─my pawns will continue the lesson.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Karasu! Come back and face me with honor!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Do not let their numbers daunt you!
Keep your focus, and your Katon will blaze a path to safety!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
This one is strong...
Keep focus, and your Raiton will strike him down!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Urgh! Have I...failed...?

quest.name: 忍びの務め
journal: Oboro believes the time has come to take your talents to the field.

Impressed with your progress, Oboro has decided that your training will continue in the field...as a full-fledged participant in his mission to assassinate Karasu. Having received word that the imperial espionage unit under Karasu's command means to target Captain Grymuwil of the Bloody Executioners, Oboro intends to ascertain the traitor's whereabouts by interrogating one Wolfstan, the captain's trusted lieutenant. Make for Camp Bronze Lake in upper La Noscea, where Oboro will brief you in detail on the plan of attack.

Oboro imparts to you the technique of Shukuchi, which he explains will afford you an ideal vantage point for your surveillance. When you are ready to proceed with the mission, speak with him once more.
objectives: Speak with Oboro at Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You have trained well since we last met, Forename. I heard not a cry from the door as you entered, nor a creak from the floorboards as you drew near.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: This much is clear: neither waterfalls nor men of wood will serve to hone your senses further. No, a shinobi of your abilities receives his tutelage in the field. Consider this your first lesson in the art of assassination.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I need not remind you who our target is. He is ever the elusive bird, and yet I have come across some information that I believe may avail us.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Rumor has it that Captain Grymuwil of the Bloody Executioners has narrowly evaded several attempts on his life in recent days. This is doubtless the work of Karasu and his men─none other are so bold or skilled as to even consider such an attack.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Nothing short of death will cause a shinobi to forsake his mission. Karasu will strike again─the only questions are where and when.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Answer those questions, and it will be us paying him a surprise visit next time. Fortunately, I know of a man who might be able to give us what we seek.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Captain Grymuwil has a trusted lieutenant by the name of Wolfstan, a man who─if rumors are to be believed─is known to fancy a hot spring bath. I recall reading of a famous bath resort not far from here, but the name escapes me... Have you any idea where it might be?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Where might an Eorzean go to bathe?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Costa del Sol.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Camp Overlook.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Why, yes, that does sound familiar! In upper La Noscea, off to the east, was it? Let us make our way there at once.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That is an ocean resort, is it not? The place of which I read was on higher ground, and known for its healing baths...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Yes! It was Camp─no. That cannot be right. The issue of the Harbor Herald I read earlier spoke of Camp Overlook as a bastion of defense against some unpleasant creatures called kobolds. It sounds like the last place anyone would go for rest and relaxation.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Your presence is ever heartening, Forename. Where we once struggled to adapt to this land, your friendship and your devotion to the way of the shinobi has instilled us with renewed hope.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I had no idea that so many Eorzeans also enjoyed public bathing. I would say it is a comforting sight, but in truth it makes me all the more nostalgic for the pleasures of my homeland.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That said, seeing all these people milling about gives me cause for concern. Even with these disguises, it is only a matter of time before our foreign mannerisms raise eyebrows among the more observant types.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Yes, best we stay out of sight until our man arrives. Let us keep watch from high above until it is time to act.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The time has come for me to impart to you another technique, which we call Shukuchi. You may think of it as compressing the physical space around you, allowing you to cross great distances in the blink of an eye. Go ahead, Forename, give it a try.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I have long dreamed of visiting one of Eorzea's hot springs! Perhaps, when our mission is complete, we can return to partake in its pleasures...

quest.name: 隠密行動
journal: Oboro is ready to proceed with the operation.

Oboro would first take up position high on the rooftops, out of sight. He explains that while a shinobi can cover great distances with Shukuchi, the technique only works effectively on level ground. Tsubame has taken up position at an ideal starting point. Follow her lead to reach the rooftop where Oboro awaits, and keep lookout with your fellow shinobi for Wolfstan's arrival.

A man Oboro quickly identifies as Wolfstan has arrived in Camp Bronze Lake. Finding Oboro's proposed method less than convincing, Tsubame proposes an alternative plan for extracting the desired information from your target. Descend from the rooftops and rendezvous in secret with the kunoichi.

You meet with Tsubame, who has given new meaning to “hiding in plain sight” with the help of a very revealing disguise. She hands you a bottle of liquor, instructing you to bring it to her once she has succeeded in addling Wolfstan's wits sufficiently.

The operation proves a rousing success─Wolfstan is no match for Tsubame's feminine wiles, and you have emerged with information vital to predicting Karasu's movements. Reunite with Oboro and plot your next course of action.

Oboro rejoices at the operation's success, while swallowing his pride at being unable to contribute in a more meaningful capacity. With Grymuwil's destination─and in turn, that of Karasu─ascertained, you and your fellow shinobi agree to hasten to Aleport, that you might get the first strike on your enemy.

You successfully make your way past Karasu's defenses, but your assassination attempt ends with a familiar result─your ever-evasive prey slipping through your fingers. Tasting his most bitter defeat yet, however, has left Oboro more resolute than ever. Regroup at the dock storehouse and inquire as to your next course of action.

Though frustrated at this latest failure, Oboro is convinced that with your growing skills, it will not be long before the three of you can stand against Karasu in earnest. You resolve to take your experiences to heart and train as you have never trained before.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Keep lookout from the rooftop.
Speak with Tsubame.
Serve the bottle of mulled wine to Wolfstan.
Report to Oboro.
Keep watch in Aleport.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I trust that Shukuchi is now second nature to you? Very well. I shall await you on the rooftop, but be warned: while the technique will allow you to cover great distances in the blink of an eye, it does not allow you to soar at will through the sky.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The ledge on which Tsubame now stands is at a level with the roof, and should prove a suitable starting point. That said, a shinobi is ever resourceful─if you would make your way to the rooftop by other means, that will serve just as well.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: The roof may seem quite far away, but use your Shukuchi technique from the edge, and you should be able to reach it with ease.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Quite impressive, Forename─only a true shinobi could stand where you now stand. Anyhow, this should prove a suitable vantage point. Let us keep watch until Wolfstan arrives.

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Nothin' like a steamin' bath, a bottle o' fine wine, and a couple o' buxom wenches to ease what ails ye, aye? As far as I'm concerned, Cap'n Grymuwil can take 'is bloody time!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Wolfstan.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Very well. Now, we need only employ these bamboo breathing pipes, descend underwater, and...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: O-Oboro. I do not question that such methods have served us well in Doma, but might bamboo not arouse suspicion in these environs?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Do you truly believe so? B-But underwater surveillance was always my area of expertise...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I have an idea that I believe is well suited both to our target and the customs of the land. It will require just a simple change of garb and a bottle or two of fine spirits...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I will require your assistance, Forename. As I see it, there's no way the man would refuse a drink from an alluring maidena strapping gentleman like yourself.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Intriguing! And what, pray tell, will be my role in all of this?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Er, I was thinking that, ah, your talents might best be put to use overseeing the operation. Yes, ah, from up here. To ensure that nothing goes amiss, of course.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I must prepare now, Forename. Meet me down below, out of sight, and I shall furnish you with the item that will serve to deliver the final blow, as it were.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Fear not, Forename! I will be standing watch here, ready to leap to your defense should either you or Tsubame come to harm!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Am I wearing this properly, Forename? I am not accustomed to garb that is so...revealing.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Regardless, I will entrust this to you. Though it may appear to be a simple bottle of wine, I have made a few enhancements to the recipe.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Off duty or no, a salty sea dog like Wolfstan is certain to be on his guard. I'll start him off with an untainted vintage. Once he's in sufficiently good spirits, that's your cue to step in with the stronger stuff.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I suspect that once his mind is sufficiently addled, he will gladly take a swig with a minimum of fuss. Now, let us begin!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oh, just look, Wolfie, my darling! This fine lassstrong lad 'as a treat, just for you!

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Fine wine and fine wenches! Now this is what I had in mind when I took up the piratin' life!

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: What's this? Come to battle yer friend here for Wolfie's affections? Don't mind if I do!Think ye can outguzzle Wolfstan Seven-Stomachs? Yer either a legend or a fool! Har har─someone fetch me cup!

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Aye, that'sh the─hic!─good shtuff, if a bit shtronger than I─hic!─recall it. Maybe I should─hic!─take a resht...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oh, you mustn't be so modest! Why, I 'eard that Wolfstan Seven-Stomachs once drank a whale under the table!

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Har har har! Ye bet yer─hic!─shkivvies 'e could, lash! Me bleedin'─hic!─dutiesh 'ave kept me from the bottle for too long. I'm out o' practishe, ish all.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Your duties? Why, that sounds so important and exciting! I'd do anything to hear more!

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Did ye shay─hic!─anythin'? Har har har! Well, maybe ye've 'eard o' the Bloody Executioners? The nastiest, bloodiest band o' piratesh whatever─hic!─shailed the bleedin' sheash!?

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: I reckon our Cap'n Grymuwil's shunk more Garlean vesshels than every other pirate─hic!─combined. And just who do ye reckon keeps the cap'n shafe from all the enemies 'e's made? Why that'd be none other'n hish dear mate─hic!─Wolfshtan.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: The Navigator have mercy! Should you not return immediately to your captain? Surely, he is not safe without his most loyal, capable man at his side!

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Under normal circumshtanches, ye'd be─hic!─right, lass. But there's one plashe even I can't follow 'im─Aleport! Aye, the man is bloody particular about 'is─hic!─grog. Shays he can't─hic!─conshentrate unlesh 'e'sh on 'ish own...

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Not that I'm─hic!─complainin'. It'sh the only time we get a day'sh resht. But don't worry yer little 'eart none, lasshie. Nobody knowsh the cap'n's whereaboutsh but─hic!─me, and I sure as bloody 'ellsh ain't talkin'! Har har!

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: ...Lasshie? Are ye lishtenin'?

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: That'sh─hic!─curioush. She wash jusht─hic!─there a moment─hic! Hic! Hic! Urrrkkk...

dialogue.name: WOLFSTAN
dialogue.text: Which way did she─hic! Urrrrrrk...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Well, I must say that went even better than I expected. Let us share our findings with Oboro. My costume? I have stowed it away...forever, with any luck! Do Eorzean women have no sense of shame?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Well? Were you able to loosen our man's lips?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I see. Captain Grymuwil is en route to Aleport─and alone, at that.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: If I know Karasu, this knowledge has not escaped him. Doubtless he and his shadows already lie in wait.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We haven't much time. Let us hurry to Aleport and ambush the ambushers!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu and his shadows are lurking here somewhere... I can sense it.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The sun sets, and the port is cloaked in shadow. If there were a perfect time to strike...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Speak of the devil. Look at how those men walk─those are no ordinary deckhands.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Those are imperial shinobi, waiting to pounce upon and slit the throat of any who would stand between them and their prey.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu is too proud to entrust such a vital mission to his lackeys. He is here somewhere─of this I am certain.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename, you move forward and search the docks. I will approach from the opposite direction. Tsubame, you secure the escape route─he will not elude us this time.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Take care to stay well hidden, Forename─hidden from the eyes of Karasu's shadows. And yet, I fear your task will be more complicated still...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: For it is not just men that serve Karasu, but creatures of the night. Creatures that see not with their eyes, but with every fiber of their being. Give them a wide berth, or all shall be for naught.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That should be all. Time is short. We must move swiftly!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Wh-What's this!? No, no, NO! This isn't how the story goes! I'm supposed to be the one that surprises you!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The tables have turned today, Karasu! Now face your death like the man you once were!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I must say, popularity really does have its downsides. Fine! If you're so eager to dig your own graves, here's your bloody shovel!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Gah! The slippery bastard!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We have come too close to abandon hope. Come, Tsubame, Forename. Let us return to the safety of the storehouse and take stock of our options.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: (-???-)Grymuwil lives. Failure of this sort...does not become you, Karasu.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: F-Forgive me, Master. I had an unexpected reunion with some friends. Seems they had a mind to kill me. And just when I thought we were getting on so well...

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: (-???-)Your job is to give me answers, Karasu, not excuses. We can ill afford to let a few stray rats foil our plans. Should they return, kill them.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: (-???-)This is your final warning. The next time you fail me will be your last.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: <gulp> Does he have to say it like that? Fine, fine... Let it never be said that I'm not a loyal soldier!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Again, Karasu eludes our grasp. Will the day never come that we can return to our village in triumph?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Bah! Once more, the bloody crow has managed to foil our best-laid plans.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It is as if his skills burgeon with each encounter. But how could this be? Has he perfected some new training regimen since coming to Eorzea?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But there is no time to dwell on past mistakes. Since the times of my ancestors, failure in one's duty is unacceptable for a shinobi. My mission will end in success─Karasu's death─or failure...my own.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But all is not lost. Karasu is not the only one who has honed his skills. Fighting beside you back there, at times it felt as if we had trained together since childhood.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You have shown remarkable focus and aptitude for our art, but you must grow stronger still if we are to have any hope of triumph. Devote yourself to your training with the entirety of your body and mind, and Tsubame and I will do the same. I await your return, Forename.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Use Hide to make your way past the guards and locate Karasu!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Karasu!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Dispatch all foes!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to run─truly, I am─but there's someone very important I need to be killing.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: There will be no escape for you this time, you traitorous dog!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I know you love me, little swallow, but sometimes you just have to let go!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I will let my blade go into your chest. Say your prayers, demon!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Well, looky here! Too bad you didn't realize that there's more than one...way...out!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Curses! We had him just where we wanted him!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I was too...careless...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Oboro... I have...failed...

quest.name: 奇妙な襲撃
journal: Oboro would bequeath to you that which you have earned.

Oboro believes that you have proven yourself worthy of inheriting his people's traditional garb, and has thusly ordered a full set to be delivered from his village. As such a shipment would arouse suspicion at the docks, he has arranged for the goods to be delivered to the De Nevelle Checkpoint in middle La Noscea.

That which awaited you at the checkpoint was not the delivery you sought, but a surprise attack at the hands of a suspicious porter, who you subsequently dispatched. Speak with the shadowy porter cowering beside his compatriot's limp body in hopes of finding out just what manner of skullduggery is going on here.

Your questioning of the shadowy porter reaches an abrupt end when none other than Karasu appears to silence the tongues of his own men. Karasu claims that the measures he has taken are for your own benefit, as he would see you truly consummate your training before you inherit the garb of the shinobi. To this end, he has entrusted the various pieces to four of his “shadows” that he has deemed expendable. You are to traverse the land and defeat each in single combat to earn what you would claim as yours. Your first challenge awaits at the Red Rooster Stead.
You dispatch a minion of Karasu's disguised as a milkmaid. Open the crate beside her to claim the piece of ninja garb she had been guarding.
You lay claim to your first piece of ninja garb. Travel on to Costa del Sol, where your next challenge awaits.
You dispatch another minion of Karasu's. Open the crate beside her to claim the piece of ninja garb she had been guarding.
You claim your second piece of ninja garb. Continue on to Jijiroon's Trading Post, where yet another challenge awaits.
You have dispatched yet another minion of Karasu's, this time disguised as a fisherman. Open the crate beside him to claim the piece of ninja garb he had been guarding.
You have claimed a third piece of ninja garb. Proceed on to Camp Overlook, where your fourth and final challenge awaits!
You defeat the last of Karasu's underlings, this one disguised as a trader. Open the crate to collect yet one more piece of ninja garb.

You obtain the fourth piece of ninja garb, which leaves but one piece remaining to complete the set. Return to the De Nevelle Checkpoint, where Karasu has promised to give you a little something extra.

It was not Karasu, but Oboro who greeted you back at the checkpoint, along with a letter stating that the promised surprise will be delivered straight to your doorstep. Oboro fears that this is little more than a thinly veiled threat. Hurry back to the docks and deliver Tsubame from danger!
objectives: Speak with the suspicious-looking porter at the De Nevelle Checkpoint.
Speak with the shadowy porter.
Seek out and eliminate any of Karasu's minions at the Red Rooster Stead.
Examine the weathered crate.
Seek out and eliminate any of Karasu's minions at Costa del Sol.
Examine the weathered crate.
Seek out and eliminate any of Karasu's minions at Jijiroon's Trading Post.
Examine the weathered crate.
Seek out and eliminate any of Karasu's minions at Camp Overlook.
Examine the weathered crate.
Return to the De Nevelle Checkpoint and look for Karasu.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename. I look into your eyes today, and see a mind unclouded by worldly cares. The time has come─I would pass on to you the ancestral garb of the shinobi.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Knowing that this day was close at hand, I have already made the necessary arrangements. With Karasu watching our every move, I cannot act freely, so I asked your friends at the Rogues' Guild to send word to my village and arrange for the delivery of a set.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Needless to say, this location must remain a secret. I have arranged for the goods to be delivered in secret to the De Nevelle Checkpoint. A porter there will be expecting you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tsubame and I must express our thanks to your Captain Jacke. Be mindful in your travels, Forename. We eagerly await your return.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro may beg to differ, but I find myself enjoying life here more and more with each passing day. Of course, I still look back fondly on my days in Doma, but I have come to consider Eorzea a second home.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That mate o' yers─O'borro, was it?─came by here not long ago to pay his respects. Seems like an upright type, a real bene cull, and that dimber mort's right easy on the eyes. Almost made me feel bad for doubtin' 'em─but doubtin's what we do, aye?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: 'Twasn't easy, mind ye, sending a little gods-know-how-many thousands o' malms across the sea. But he said it was for you, and I couldn't right refuse, eh?

dialogue.name: PORTER00232
dialogue.text: Expectin' a shipment of goods, ye say?

dialogue.name: PORTER00232
dialogue.text: Now that strikes me as right curious, on account of how a scraggly fellow came by not long ago to claim them.

dialogue.name: PORTER00232
dialogue.text: They were actually yours, ye say? Well, ain't that a bloody coincidence!

dialogue.name: PORTER00232
dialogue.text: See, the fellow I talked to said that someone was like to come by sayin' just that... And that if shehe did, he'd pay good coin for me to gut herhim good an' proper.

dialogue.name: PORTERB00232
dialogue.text: <gulp> ...Y-Yes?

dialogue.name: BALOON
dialogue.text: It's just business, eh?

dialogue.name: PORTERB00232
dialogue.text: H-Have mercy! If I knew you were this strong, I never would have taken his money!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: And if I knew you were this incompetent, I would have put you out of your misery long ago.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't my favorite chirping little horsebird. Oh, come now, I'm not that scary...am I?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I heard from a little bird in Doma of a shipment en route to Eorzea in secret. I surmised─I'm quite good at that, you see─that it might have something to do with you and your friends, and I just had to know what was inside.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Lo and behold, what did I find but a shiny set of shinobi garb! Why did you not tell me it was your nameday, little chick? I would have bought you something far more fitting─like a sack of gysahl greens! Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: No, I fear Brother Dim and Sister Swallow are mistaken─you are not quite ready for such an honor. But this is no fault of your own─after all, the student is only as good as herhis teacher.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: But today is your lucky day, little chick, for a true master has come to take you under his wing.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Four crates, scattered to the winds, each containing one of the items you seek. Four of my shadows, guarding each piece with their lives. A test, one where failure will mean your death.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Red Rooster Stead. Costa del Sol. Jijiroon's Trading Post. Camp Overlook. Claim that which you seek by your own hand, or die in the act─it is of little matter to me. If by some chance you survive, return here. You just might find a very special present awaits you. Now shoo, shoo, I say!

dialogue.name: BATTLEA00232
dialogue.text: Pardon me, miladymilord. Have you seen my aldgoats anywhere?

dialogue.name: BATTLEA00232
dialogue.text: ...Oh, it's you. Don't worry, this won't hurt...much.

dialogue.name: BATTLEA00232
dialogue.text: (-Suspicious-looking Milkmaid-)Oh, there's nothing in there but aldgoat milk. Rich and creamy aldgoat milk, to be sure, but aldgoat milk just the same.

dialogue.name: BALOON
dialogue.text: Die, scum!

dialogue.name: BATTLEB00232
dialogue.text: Oh, dear heavens! I must have fallen asleep while sunbathing. How can I ever thank you for rousing me from slumber?

dialogue.name: BATTLEB00232
dialogue.text: What say I slit your throat and we call it even, eh?

dialogue.name: BATTLEB00232
dialogue.text: (-Suspicious Midwife-)Didn't your mother teach you not to touch a lady's personal belongings?

dialogue.name: BALOON
dialogue.text: For Karasu!

dialogue.name: BATTLEC00232
dialogue.text: What's with the dour face, lasslad? Fish just not bitin' today?

dialogue.name: BATTLEC00232
dialogue.text: Maybe they know you're already a dead womanman...?

dialogue.name: BATTLEC00232
dialogue.text: I ain't runnin' a charity here, lasslad. Get your own rod and lure!

dialogue.name: BALOON
dialogue.text: This'll be over quick!

dialogue.name: BATTLED00232
dialogue.text: Whatever possessed me to set up shop in this ungodly place!? I'm like to drop dead from the fumes before I see a single gil in profit!

dialogue.name: BATTLED00232
dialogue.text: ...'Course, if I bring yer head back to Karasu, I'll be set for life!

dialogue.name: BATTLED00232
dialogue.text: (-Suspicious-looking Trader-)Whoa there, now! Are you familiar with the concept of trade? It's quite simple, really: it involves you giving me coin before you put your grubby little paws on my goods.

dialogue.name: BALOON
dialogue.text: Die!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Forename. I am relieved to see you safe. When you did not return, I feared the worst.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu did what!? Forgive me... I never suspected he would target you on your own. It is clear now that his treachery knows no bounds.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And yet, it is curious. Again, he chose to test you rather than dispatch you by his own hand. His intentions remain as inscrutable as ever... Hm. What's this?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Karasu!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: “Welcome back, Forename! And hullo to you as well, Oboro. I left the present I promised you on your doorstep. Such a shame that you weren't at home...”

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Th-The docks! Tsubame... Byakubu... Yomei... We must hurry!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename, I realize it is far too early in your training for this, but the situation is grim. Our only hope of surviving the battle ahead is for you to learn the mudra Jin.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: This is the mudra that will allow you to harness the energies of your fellow man. It is also the final mudra that I can teach you.

quest.name: 心の形
journal: Oboro would teach you what he can in what little time you have.

Oboro teaches you four new mudra combinations that you can form with your newfound knowledge, but sadly lacks the time to explain, let alone demonstrate the precise nature of their effects and how they will serve you in battle. The task at hand is to see to Tsubame's safety. Return to the dock storehouse where Oboro awaits!

You return to the docks to see signs that a battle was fought in your absence. Tsubame is missing, but Oboro suspects she is close by. Find her and attend to her wounds if she is injured as Oboro fears.

As suspected, you find Tsubame in the clutches of Karasu, who while flogging her to near death, has seemingly seen fit to spare her life. Oboro utterly loses control of his emotions, turning against his foe in a blind, frenzied rage, which seems to please Karasu all the more. Suggesting that this is what he had hoped to see in his rival, the traitor agrees to a battle to the death─a battle in which Oboro and you prove victorious. Oboro is about to claim Karasu's life when your flamboyant foe spins a curious tale that suggests the true traitor of Doma was none other than the trusted teacher of the two shinobi, Master Gekkai. Oboro scoffs, dismissing Karasu's words as pathetic lies, but his expression betrays a heart in turmoil. Karasu cryptically reveals the name of a single location─Candlekeep Quay─before taking to the air and self-immolating in a burst of glory as his rival stands there nonplussed. Speak with Oboro and see how he has handled this unexpected turn of events.
Understandably rattled by all that has transpired, a stupefied Oboro can only haltingly suggest that the two of you return to the storehouse with Tsubame.

While Oboro is reluctant to accept Karasu's words as truth, it appears that his rival's words have planted a seed of doubt in his mind. Give your teacher time to work through his crisis of confidence as you hone your ninjutsu skills to new heights.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.
Find Tsubame.
Speak with Oboro.
Speak with Oboro at the storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You have now learned Jin, the final mudra that I can impart to you. Combine it with the mudra you have already mastered, and you will find four new ninjutsu techniques available to you. Time is short, so listen well.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The first is Hyoton, ice release. Form Ten–Jin or Chi–Jin. The energies you summon will be channeled into a glacial floe.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Second is Huton, wind release. Form Jin–Chi–Ten or Chi–Jin–Ten. The winds will gather and swirl around you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Third is Doton, earth release. Form Ten–Jin–Chi or Jin–Ten–Chi. The earth itself will move at your will.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Finally, there is Suiton, release of water. Form Ten–Chi–Jin, or Chi–Ten–Jin. Water will course and flow through you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: As for how each technique will avail you, I trust you will learn on the field of battle.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Now, let us hurry! Tsubame is in danger!

dialogue.name: BYAKUBU
dialogue.text: Ahhh... <cough> Ahhhhhhhhh...!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Shuriken... A battle was fought here. I hear no sounds from within. Tsubame must be here, somewhere!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Byakubu has lost his words from the shock. He can tell us nothing. Come, we must find Tsubame, and quickly!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tsu-Tsubame!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: It is...but a flesh...wound... <cough> O-Oboro... Look out!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-???-)Come now, little swallow. Say that it hurts...that you were scared... Tell the dim one how I took great pains to see that you were fully awake for every moment of agony and terror!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu! This time, you go too far!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! Those are the eyes I wanted to see! Let the anger, the hatred burn away any spot of doubt that remains in your heart!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The fire in your eyes─resolve born from the all-consuming flames of rage and passion! The look in your eyes that day, when you looked on as your friends, your countrymen were massacred, powerless to end the slaughter!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Gaaahhh!!! Be silent, be silent, BE SILENT, BE SILENT!!!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tsubame, stand back. I shall slice this crow's tongue, then tear him limb from limb with my bare hands!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Such pure, unadulterated malice! Finally, you are an adversary worthy of my blade!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The true shinobi─ever calm, dutiful to his master... Presence of mind... Yes, the first few times we met, you fought with all the passion of a mokujin. Today you stand before me as a man!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: You wanted a battle, and today you shall have one─no retreat, no reprieve. The defeated shall die like a dog, and the victor? The victor's tale will continue for another day...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Karasu Redbeak. In the name of our elders, I take your life as divine retribution for your crimes. Your bloodstained beak will feast on the innocent no more.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: ...Ahaha! Ahahahaha! Does he truly believe those words!? Ahaha! Aheahehaheaheaeha!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oh, yes, this beak is stained with blood...this I do not deny. But I am not the leader of this murderous flock.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I tire of your riddles, Redbeak! Give me one reason why I should not separate your head from your shoulders!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oh, dear! What a pickle I find myself in! Now how can I put this in terms even the dim one can understand? I am not the traitor you seek. He is not I, and I am not he.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: You believe I was the only one who fled Doma. Are you sure? Absolutely certain? Did you see the bodies─the faces─of all your brothers who fell that day?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Think, think, think! I know it is not a strength of yours, but surely you remember! One body, maimed so badly that only the possessions could identify the man. And the face─could it even be called a face? Naught but shattered bone and shredded flesh remained where once had been the proud features of...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You LIE!!! One more word... One more twisted, deceitful word, Redbeak, and I will... I will...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Oh, Oboro─poor, sweet, stupid Oboro. How long will you continue to deceive yourself?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You lie, Redbeak, as you always have. Did betraying our homeland not sate your thirst for treachery? That now you must drag our master's name through the mud!? Answer me this, then: if you were not the traitor, then why did you flee the village that day?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: ...How often have I asked myself the same! Oh, how simpler things would have been had I been as naive as you! But the circumstances of Master Gekkai's death did not sit well with me. I left the village looking for answers, and found something far more interesting─our master himself, alive and well.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: In an instant, his hand was at my mouth and his blade at my neck. A simple choice he gave me: follow him and live, refuse and die.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I would like to say I weighed my decision heavily, but the answer really was quite clear. Death is so final, after all, while life─even a life spent as an imperial spy─holds so many opportunities.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: What's the matter, dim one? Do you still find my tale hard to swallow? Oh, believe as you will─redemption means little to a dead man.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: You are going to kill me, yes? That is your mission, after all. Sworn in the sight of the elders, tradition and custom, and so on and so forth?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: ...Candlekeep Quay. When the time is right, he will come, and all will be revealed. ...I just thought I'd tell the one who's shown herselfhimself capable of listening to reason.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The lights grow dim! The stars turn blacksun turns black in the sky! Our hero fought─fought bravely, even─but his chapter in this grand mummery has come to a close... Summoning his last breaths, our hero...speaks...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Just promise me this, Oboro. Whatever your mission, should you fail, just don't go off dying. I know how fond you are of tradition, but this is a new era, and we are not our ancestors. Besides, such an end just wouldn't become a solemn youth like yourself.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: So live, and leave the dying to those who can do it in style. Yes, I may not have been the hero I thought I was, nor the villain you would have me be, but from beginning to end, I was me, and there is nothing I would rather be. Farewell, cruel world, and good bloody riddance!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Wait... Karasu!!!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What can this all mean...?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu is dead, our mission complete. Yet you will forgive me if I am unsure how to feel about this turn of events...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: In any event, there is nothing more to be done here. Tsubame is wounded. Let us bring her home.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming to my rescue, Forename. I owe you and Oboro my life. Worry not for me─with rest, I will be fine...

dialogue.name: BYAKUBU
dialogue.text: When last we met I was not myself. Pray forgive me. Master Oboro awaits inside.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The mission that brought me to Eorzea is complete. Once Tsubame's wounds heal, we have no reason to sojourn further in these lands.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And yet, if Karasu spoke true... No... It simply cannot be...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Karasu and his minions!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This trembling... My heart will know no peace until you are gone from this world!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You look angry, dear Oboro. Is it because I clipped your pretty swallow's wing?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Come, my pets─it is feeding time!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: A mudra of summoning!? ...This bodes ill. Forename, that magicked circle must be destroyed!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Gah! Your mind is nothing but noise, Oboro! Purge your heart of all anger, all hatred, all compassion, all regret! Only in emptiness will you find the strength to defeat me!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Again!? I don't want to see what's coming... Destroy that circle quickly, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: It cannot end... Not like this!

quest.name: 雲晴れる夜に
journal: After much soul-searching, Oboro has reached a resolution.
