Oboro politely expresses his gratitude for the assistance you offered in his mission before abruptly informing you that he and his fellow Domans will be journeying on from Eorzea. As a final favor, he has asked you to watch over the recovering Tsubame while he pays one last visit to the place in Eorzea most special to him.

Tsubame's wounds have healed impressively, leading her to surmise that Karasu manipulated his attack on her primarily for visual effect. She is more concerned for Oboro, who she feels is hiding his true feelings from her. Seek him out at his favorite Eorzean haunt, Fool Falls in upper La Noscea.

Initially taken aback at your presence, Oboro soon confesses his true feelings to you. His battle with Karasu has left the shinobi a changed man. No longer willing or able to repress his true self, he has chosen to forsake obligation in favor of following his own heart's desire, which urges him to seek out the truth behind the traitor he hunted for so long. Prepared to face the answer he fears the most, he has resolved to undertake this final mission alone, insisting that Tsubame and you have sacrificed enough on his behalf. No sooner does he leave than Tsubame steps out from the shadows, looking very concerned at his words.

Oboro's words confirm Tsubame's worst fear: that he means to seek out and confront Master Gekkai alone, even if it means sacrificing his life. She explains that she, too, has come to a resolution─to fight at Oboro's side─and has no intention of being denied. Recalling the dying Karasu's last words, Tsubame suggests that you make for Candlekeep Quay and question the guards about any happenings of note in the area.

According to Zahrmerl, everything is quiet on the quay, save for talk of a small private vessel scheduled to arrive in port at the break of dawn. Though it appears that Oboro is already in the area, Tsubame deems it too dangerous to search for him and attempt to make contact at this time, preferring to observe the area from a safe distance until Master Gekkai shows himself. Take up position on the promontory above the quay and keep lookout for any suspicious movements.

Karasu's tale─Oboro's worst fears─is confirmed as true when the Garlean espionage unit commander who sailed into Candlekeep Quay is indeed revealed to be none other than Master Gekkai. Confronted by his former pupil, Gekkai shows no remorse, coolly explaining how he made a simple decision to seek out a stronger master, while at the same time guaranteeing the safety of his village over that of countless Doman commonfolk that were of no import to him. Incensed by his one-time master's callous disdain for the nation he called home, Oboro draws his blade and swears vengeance, and together you, he, and Tsubame defeat the shinobi master. After the battle, Karasu returns from his self-staged death to bequeath to you the final piece of your ninja garb, and to Oboro the soul crystal that will allow him to go home to a hero's welcome, before walking off to parts unknown. His long mission finally at an end, Oboro returns to the dock storehouse. Meet him there to say your farewells.

Upon returning to the storehouse, Oboro imparts to you a final ninjutsu technique, Kassatsu. While the two shinobi initially intended to return home together, Oboro has decided to remain behind to continue his study of Eorzean culture, in hopes of bringing new schools of thought back to his home. From your experiences traveling with Oboro and Tsubame and fighting at their side, it would seem that the future of the village is in good hands.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Speak with Tsubame.
Search for Oboro at Fool Falls.
Speak with Tsubame.
Speak with Zahrmerl at Candlekeep Quay.
Keep watch from the lookout point.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Your return pleases me. I feared I might miss the chance to bid you a proper farewell.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Yes, we will be taking our leave from your realm. My mission is complete, and Tsubame's wounds have all but healed. Tradition dictates that we return to our elders to deliver tidings of our success.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Redbeak's last words? I will not lie─at first, they weighed heavily on my mind. But in the end, I am a shinobi─I came to this land to perform a role, not out of curiosity or spite.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Mayhap Master Gekkai still lives, mayhap not─it is no longer my concern. Karasu is dead, and with his passing, it is time to close the curtain on this chapter of our lives.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Before I leave, I would ask one favor of you. There is a place I would visit before we depart your realm. I would go alone to gather my thoughts.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Could you pray look after Tsubame while I am away? Her condition has much improved, but I would not take any chances. Thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro has not been himself since the two of you returned from your battle with Karasu. He seems strangely...distant. Please speak to him─perhaps your words will reach him where mine have failed.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Your concern is most touching, but I am quite fine, Forename. In fact, it would seem that the injuries I suffered were not nearly as grave as they appeared on first glance. It would appear that Karasu meant more to fan the flames of Oboro's ire than to cause true harm.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Speaking of Oboro, have you seen him about? It is not like him to disappear in the midst of our preparations for departure.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Alone with his thoughts, you say? Where do you suppose he might have gone?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Where might Oboro have traveled?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Fool Falls.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Truly? Perhaps Eorzeans feel most at peace in a bustling city–state, but that doesn't sound like Oboro at all.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: The place where the two of you practiced, yes? He always has had a fondness for waterfalls. Yes, that is it! It must be!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Forename, Oboro is not himself of late. Perhaps I worry overmuch, but I could never forgive myself if something ill were to befall him. You will go look after him for me, will you?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I seek not to change his heart, if his heart is truly made up. I wish only to know his true feelings, that I might support him in whatever humble way I can.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Bronze Lake? Oboro does enjoy a bath, but the hustle and bustle of that place was not to his liking. Knowing him as I do, I cannot help but feel he would seek out more peaceful environs...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I seek not to change Oboro's heart, if his heart is truly made up. I wish only to know his true feelings, that I might support him in whatever humble way I can.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What are you doing here, Forename? I took you for a womanman of your word...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Tsubame sent you, didn't she? It looks like I was the fool for thinking I could fool two who know me so well.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ever since that day, this is the only place in the world where I can find a moment's respite from the turmoil that rages within me. And yet, the instant the sound of the crashing waters fade from earshot, it all comes flooding back...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You have proven yourself a true friend to us, and a worthy shinobi in your own right. Answer this for me, Forename: for what, for whom do you wield your blade?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: For whom or what do you fight?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: For myself.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: For power.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: For those around me.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: For reasons I alone shall know.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: A clear, unwavering answer worthy of you, Forename. Yes─why fight, if not for that which you believe is unquestionably right?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Puissant words from a puissant womanman, Forename. Yes, without true power, how can one hope to stand up for that which you truly believe?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Yes. I knew you a womanman after my own heart, Forename. Standing here just now, that is the answer that I arrived at as well.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename─it was a fool question. Well do I know that true conviction must come from within. And yet...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I speak in earnest to you, Forename. Our battle with Karasu, his dying words... They left me a changed man, and I can no longer deny what I have become.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: For so many years, I questioned nothing. Tradition, custom, my mission... I was a shinobi─a blade─and a blade does not think. I shut off the doubts, the emotions that threatened to rise to the surface, and told myself this was true presence of mind.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I lie to myself no longer. In confronting Karasu, I confronted myself. Looking upon Tsubame, lying battered and beaten like my countrymen so many years ago, I felt a single, all-consuming desire─to visit retribution upon those who wronged us, and to do so by my own hand.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I have made my decision. I shall go and face the truth, for it is only in doing so that my heart will ever know true peace. I will go alone, and I will hear no more of it. You and Tsubame have sacrificed and suffered more than enough─the battle that awaits is mine and mine alone.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: If it is Master Gekkai I find at the end of my journey, so be it. One or both of us will die─it matters not. Either way, my mind will be at rest. You have been a true friend and ally, Forename. Farewell.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: (-Tsubame-)Oboro...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. It was as if my legs moved of their own accord.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: It is just as I imagined. Oboro means to confront Master Gekkai, even if it costs him his life.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: He has made his decision, and I will not stand in his way. But neither will he stand in the way of mine. Wheresoever Oboro fights, I will fight beside him.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: If it is not too much to ask, pray lend your strength to us this one final time, Forename. You have proven yourself a true shinobi, and your blade, unfettered by tradition or convention, may just be what turns the tide of battle in our favor.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro did not say where he was headed, but we already know, don't we? Karasu's last words: Candlekeep Quay. Let us see what the guards there might tell us.

dialogue.name: ZAHRMERL
dialogue.text: Any unusual happenings of late? Not as such, save for a small private vessel scheduled to dock tomorrow at the crack of dawn. Other than that, it's all pretty quiet around these parts, as it's wont to be.

dialogue.name: ZAHRMERL
dialogue.text: Funny thing, though. You're not the first one to ask that question. A milkmaid─a fairly comely one at that─came by not minutes ago asking the very same question.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: ...Is that so? The milkmaid is one of Oboro's favorite costumes. As we might suspect, he's one step ahead of us.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: If we could rendezvous with him somehow, it would give us the advantage in numbers. And yet, the risk of exposing ourselves to our foe is too great. We should observe from the shadows until Master Gekkai reveals himself.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I will take up position on the western shoreline. You take to the high ground and keep watch from the promontory over there. Between the two of us, that should cover the entire quay.

dialogue.name: ZAHRMERL
dialogue.text: Any unusual happenings of late? Not as such, save for a small private vessel scheduled to dock tomorrow at the crack of dawn. Other than that, it's all pretty quiet around these parts, as it's wont to be.

dialogue.name: STRANGE00234
dialogue.text: Who goes there!? Show yourself!

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: (-???-)I know a rat when I smell one.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I trust that I am speaking with the Garlean Empire's chief of espionage and covert operations.

dialogue.name: HATENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)...None other.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: But you can call me “Master” if you like, young one. For old times' sake...

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: You're full of surprises these days, young one. The Oboro I knew would have been on the first ship back to Doma once Karasu cawed his last caw.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: You look sturdier than I remember, if a bit gaunt in the cheeks. Are you getting enough rest? You always worked just a bit too hard for your own good.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: All these years...it was you... You, who taught me the way of the shinobi... You, who I loved as a father! Why, Master... Why!?

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Why else...? For our village, of course. I simply made the choice that any true shinobi would make.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Don't tell me you require a history lesson, young one. Since the time of our ancestors, the shinobi have served many masters.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: For many years, I served Doma. Then, when the time was right, I chose a more powerful master. Fortunately for me─and for our village─my services were in high demand.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Have you never wondered why, Oboro? Why, when the Doman rebellion was crushed by the Empire, was our village alone spared Garlemald's wrath? It was because of my actions. I protected us where the entire nation of Doma could not.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Protected!? You betrayed us all! The people of Doma trusted us!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Do you know how many Domans died that day!? We swore our lives to protect them, and you sold them into slaughter! Do you feel nothing!? Not even a twinge of remorse at the massacre you brought upon your countrymen?

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Countrymen? What is Doma to me when weighed against the ancient and glorious history of my fellow shinobi? History is littered with the husks of fragile men who gave their worthless lives to bring glory to their betters.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I hoped against hope that Karasu was wrong. That his story was naught but the twisted lies of a sad fool. But no...I was the fool. Master─no, Gekkai, for you are no master of mine... In the name of the souls of the untold thousands whose blood is on your hands, I declare your life forfeit.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Hahaha... Revenge, is it? Revenge for foot soldiers and peasants? Is that what this is all about? That's why you lingered here like a festering boil after your allotted mission was complete?

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Forsaking your role for some selfish flight of fancy will not earn you many friends back home, Oboro. Nor here...

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: The more time I spend in Garlemald, the more I realize that the Empire quite suits me. There is something to be said for a culture that values merciless strength above all. I've won over quite a few loyal subordinates...

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Poor little one... All your lofty words, and here you stand alone. You are alone because you are weak...

dialogue.name: HATENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)He has no subordinates, this is true. This isn't an army, after all.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: But Oboro has something you will never have: comrades who believe in him and the ideals for which he fights!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tsubame! How did you...!?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Not just me, Oboro. Forename, too, has come to fight at your side.

dialogue.name: GEKKAI
dialogue.text: Comrades!? You would choose the company of a glorified sellsword over that of the master who made you what you are? Oh, how far my pupils have fallen!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: You are the one who has fallen, Gekkai. Forename fights with a sense of honor and purpose that you have long forgotten.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename... I cannot begin to express my gratitude.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My friends, my comrades─I am honored to fight at your side. Let us show this false master what true strength is!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tsubame, Forename...thank you. It is through your belief in me that I was finally able to believe in myself...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And Karasu... You had a hand in bringing this chapter to a close. You may be gone, but you are not forgotten...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-???-)Awww, that almost sounds like a eulogy! It almost makes me wish I were actually dead...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: K-Karasu! You still live!? But...but how!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Well, when it comes to playing dead, I did learn from one of the best, you know!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I see. But why vanish, only to return?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oh, just an undelivered present.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: This is...the fifth and final piece of Forename's traditional garb!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Let it never be said that I don't complete my missions. Even if it's just playing delivery boy...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Wait, Karasu! The elders who named you traitor to our village. They were simply blind to the truth, as was I...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: If I explain, they will surely see reason. Please, let us return home...together.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Wh-What's this now!? Now that wasn't in the script! How soon we forget, Oboro... I was not the traitor, no, but I did follow him. That makes me just as much a traitor, at least in their eyes.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Perhaps so. At the same time, you risked your life for what you believed in. We are not so different, you and I.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The sentiment is most touching, but my answer remains no. The village was always a bit too cramped for me. I prefer to spread my wings on a grander stage.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The honorable deeds of my present do not erase the terrible crimes of my past. I was a spy and assassin─quite a good one, I might add─and for all the blood Gekkai has on his hands, mine are nearly as red.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: In the elders' minds, you had one mission, Oboro. Why complicate the matter?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Bring this back, and tell the others what they want to hear─the traitor Karasu Redbeak is no more, slain at your hand. You will be welcomed as a hero, while my fate will be even grander. I will at long last be free!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: If that is how you would have it, Karasu, then so it shall be. But this I promise you: slowly but surely, our village will change. I will take what I have learned and build a village that honors all of our fallen. A village you could be proud to call home.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Just don't get too cocky, now, or I'll have to come back to put you and your whole village in its place.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I look forward to that day. Let us meet again on the battlefield, and pit our ideals against each other as we did that day.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: The flood of emotions I felt when you leaped to our rescue, Forename...I have no words to describe it. So I will only say again: thank you for being a friend.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It is strange, Forename... All this time, I believed I was instructing you in the way of the shinobi, and yet now that all is done, I feel that I should be the one to call you teacher.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, I finally achieved true clarity and presence of mind. My blade is stronger for it, and more important still, I now understand what I am truly fighting for.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Body or mind─by any measure, you are every bit my equal as a shinobi. Save for one final technique which I will now impart to you: Kassatsu.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Use it to rearrange the energies channeled into your body, and unleash powerful ninjutsu techniques one after the next. But be warned. In our tongue, it means quite literally “life and death.” Which one it means for you will depend entirely on your presence of mind.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And with this, I believe we have both satisfied the respective sides of our initial agreement. We will return to our village...which means I must bid you farewell.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Though perhaps not this day. I would see my home change for the better, and introduce new ways of thinking to complement the old. But before I can, there is much I still must learn about this land.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: And so I will go on ahead. I will report to our elders the success of Oboro's mission, and inform them that he will return as soon as he recuperates from the wounds he sustained in battle.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: With the soul crystal that Karasu gave us, no one will doubt the success of our mission. It is a flawless plan, if I do say so myself!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Yes, how fortunate we were that I thought of it. Never change, Oboro─promise me that.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: And with that, Forename, it seems that it is I who will bid you farewell. You've been a true friend, and my heart awaits the day when we shall meet again.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: ...But you will return to give Oboro lessons from time to time, yes? I'm not convinced that his bows are as masterful as he seems to think...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the ninja quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next ninja quest will be available from Oboro.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Gekkai!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Oboro and I will thin the ranks! Make Gekkai feel your blade!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Gekkai's ninjutsu is like nothing I've ever seen... But you can evade them!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: True talent is wasted on peons like you...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: How amusing! Now, why don't we try this?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I tire of these games. Behold...true...power!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This technique... It cannot be...!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The lost fourth mudra!? But it was said to be pure myth!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Forename! Please...fight on!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I can fight...no further... I put my trust...in you...

quest.name: 東方からの来訪者
journal: Oboro has been pondering how you might grow as a shinobi.

Oboro is convinced the path to mastery yet lies ahead of you, but is unsure where you should begin. He remembers that taking on missions in service of Doma honed his own skills, and wonders if perhaps you, too, are wanting for duty. Luckily, Jacke has recently asked for Oboro's presence in some urgent matter. Accompany your erstwhile mentor to the Rogues' Guild.

According to Jacke, there is a bandit in Far Eastern garb going about robbing people, and, even more concerning, using ninjutsu in the process. After checking a slightly disgruntled Oboro, the guildmaster asks that you both aid him in tracking the thief. Follow him to Summerford Farms, and there interview the victim, Mulfa Kelfa.

The distraught merchant tells you his sad tale of how two thieves stole his one rare and oh-so-expensive Far Eastern orb. Learning that the criminals headed northwest, Jacke proposes that you immediately give chase, that you might track them down before they have a chance to escape with their ill-gotten goods. Begin by traveling to where they were last seen, just outside Summerford Farms.
You find a trail of footprints leading northwest. Follow them on the path across the bridge, towards the Descent.
The footprints continue to the northwest. Climb down the wooden stairs, and see again where they lead.
You see the faint outlines of two figures near the entrance of Woad Whisper Canyon to the northeast. Head in that direction, and be ready for anything.

You corner a strange girl along the cliffs, who answers Jacke's questions by silently drawing her blades. Before you come to blows, however, Mulfa Kelfa arrives. He thanks you for your service, and then asks his bodyguard to kill you. Apparently, it would not do for you to learn how he acquired the orb. Unfortunately for him, you, Jacke, and Oboro make short work of his hired blade. The strange girl grudgingly thanks you for your aid. Oboro marks her for a person from the Far East, at which point her retainer, Akagi, introduces her as Princess Yuki Yatsurugi. She left her lands in search of treasures stolen from her clan. Oboro presumptuously offers her your aid, but she refuses, calling all shinobi traitors. Akagi, however, is more accommodating to Oboro's proposal, and promises to contact you should Yuki ever be found in danger. Return now to the dock storehouse, and hear Oboro's thoughts on the matter.

Oboro tells you that the princess's skills are famed in the Far East, and that she may have little need of your help. However, you have now promised your blade to her, and so must train both it and your mind so that you can protect her, no matter what may come.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Jacke at the Rogues' Guild.
Speak with Mulfa Kelfa at Summerford Farms.
Search the area west of Summerford Farms.
Search the area leading toward the Descent.
Search around the base of the Descent.
Speak with the peculiar suspect.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename, you are well come. I can tell your devotion to our art has been absolute, and I sense that greater power awaits you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But I have no new ninjutsu to teach. You alone can awaken to the power inside you. But if you do, our art will be in the very beating of your heart.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I learned much and more whilst I was a shinobi of Doma. Mayhap you would find your own way if your blade served a master...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Such thoughts will have to wait, however. Not minutes before you came through those doors, I received this missive from Jacke. He bid me come to Limsa proper with all due haste.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Join me, Forename. Your path here began at the Rogues' Guild, and mayhap returning will spark something new within you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I wonder if Jacke will have any advice for you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Captain Jacke, it has been too long. I never did thank you properly for obtaining the ancestral garb of the shinobi.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ho there, I was wonderin' when ye'd show up. An' ye brought Forename! How are ye keepin', lasslad?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Bene, bene. Now, I need a whid with Oboro. There's a thief on the loose in La Noscea who's fast─too fast to be a regular old rook.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Hm. You have my sympathies for your problem, of course, but why summon me?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, as I was told it, the one doin' the cloyin' ain't from Eorzea. Came from the Far East, judgin' by the garb.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: How very strange... The journey is too long to be undertaken lightly. I wonder what drove them here?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Who knows, who knows? But here's the rum thing: this cove's a ninja, by all accounts.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: A ninja? Ahaha! It is uncanny how much your thief sounds like me, Jacke! Why, if I did not know better, I would say I was your culprit!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye... So get yer daddles where I can see them!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ahahahahaha! Couldn't help a bit of amusin' there. 'Course I don't actually suspect you. Truthfully, I just wanted to see if ye knew anythin' what could help me with the case.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That I would be taken in by so obvious a ruse... <sigh> Well, if the thief is a shinobi of Doman origin, then I might know him. Would you allow me and Forename to aid your investigation?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: With pleasure! Things'll go a good bit smoother with a couple dimber dambers like you on board. Why don't we go and see what the victim's got to say about our rook, eh?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Mulfa Kelfa's the cove we want, an' we'll find him over at Summerford Farms. Hah, been a goodly while since our last job together, Forename, an' I'm lookin' forward to havin' ye along!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Me an' my favorite mortcull, back on the job! Ye ready to go an' whiddle what's happened to this Mulfa Kelfa cove?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Lend that cove yonder yer wattles, lasslad.

dialogue.name: MULFAKELFA
dialogue.text: And who, pray tell, are you? Yes, you...and the gloomy-looking fellow there. Are these your people, Jacke? Can they handle this matter with the guild's customary sensitivity?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: (-Jacke-)Aye, I reckon so. Forename here is one o' the guild's newer lasseslads. An' yer gloomy-lookin' cove is, er...a colt─just joined up, so to speak.

dialogue.name: MULFAKELFA
dialogue.text: In that case...bring back my orb! It's one of a kind, and they stole it from me─two nasty thieves with a Far Eastern look to them! And after I spent a bloody fortune on it!

dialogue.name: MULFAKELFA
dialogue.text: The nerve of those two, falling upon me just as I was on my way here. The fiends ran to the northwest, thrice as fast as my men could! I want them found and clapped in irons, damn it!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: (-Jacke-)Well, we best get after 'em, then. If they are foreigners, they won't know the lay o' the land. Might be as we can use that against 'em an' catch up afore they hop the twig.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: (-Jacke-)No need to be shy if it comes to bladework, but don't mill them, either. We need to find out why the rooks're cloyin' from honest folk.

dialogue.name: MULFAKELFA
dialogue.text: Get me my orb back! I don't care how!

dialogue.name: GILPIN
dialogue.text: Move along. Ain't nothin' to see here.

dialogue.name: SYSETM
dialogue.text: You find a set of footsteps heading to the northwest.

dialogue.name: SYSETM
dialogue.text: You can just make out two figures ahead in Woad Whisper Canyon.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: He is not dead. I believe he simply knocked himself unconscious. The girl silently staring at us is of more immediate concern. From her looks, she is not to be taken lightly.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, well, yer a dimber mort, make no mistake! So why's it ye've taken to cloyin'?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: <sigh> Never a tender whid for Jacke, is there? No, it's always a stabber...

dialogue.name: MULFAKELFA
dialogue.text: Yes! That's her! The thief! Hah, I knew taking this to the guild was the right choice!

dialogue.name: MULFAKELFA
dialogue.text: Sadly, this means our relationship is at an end. It would be...inconvenient if you were to learn of how I came by the orb. Sellsword? Your skills are required.

dialogue.name: GILPIN
dialogue.text: Har har har, it'd be me pleasure! Jacke's one to be reckoned with, but not when he's got two fledglin's at his side! Me trusty trident'll do fer 'em all!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, them's choice whids from a double-crossin' bastard. Neither o' ye mind bein' called fledglin's?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Not in the least. It will be all the sweeter to make him eat those words. And he is a more fitting foe than some silent maiden.

dialogue.name: GILPIN
dialogue.text: Har har, bluster an' rage all ye want─you won't be goin' gently into the night! Har har har!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, we did ye wrong, my dimber mort. Seems we owe ye an apology.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: (-Peculiar Suspect-)You have my thanks. But I didn't need your aid for such brutes as these.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Your bow... Then it is true. You are from the Far East. Have we met, by any chance? You seem...familiar.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: (-Peculiar Suspect-)Hmph. Your accent marks you a shinobi. Akagi─explain the situation.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text:
Ngh... Oh, you were the lot who were chasin' us? Scary, bein' chased.
...But, uh, er... Right. Why we're here.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Ahem... This is Yatsurugi no Yuki! If I understand your customs, you'd call her Princess Yuki of the Yatsurugi clan. She's left her lands to search for her family's treasures. They were stolen by bandits, you see.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The Yatsurugi clan!? You are very far from your domain, Princess! Tell me, why make the journey?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: (-Yuki-)...I have no time to talk, not while the identity of the bandits still eludes me. You need only know that I have taken back three of the stolen treasures, and I will leave when the other two are mine.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Very well. Your reasons are yours to keep. But I cannot leave you without a sworn dagger, Princess.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And I know just the person to do it. Forename, will you not aid in Princess Yuki's mission as her shinobi?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: As you know, we are blades, and missions are as whetstones to us. Through duty and service, we sharpen our skills and our minds. This is the next step on your path.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The princess is a stranger here. She can trust no one, save you. Your mission is to guard her with your life, and return her safely to her people. What say you?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: (-Yuki-)Tch, you think me naive enough to trust shinobi!? When Doma fell, we all saw your daggers in its back! Come, Akagi─leave the traitors!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: ...Been like that ever since we got here. Why, she'll barely let me pack her bloody clothes!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: I understand why she refuses my help when it comes to fightin', I suppose. I'm no warrior. But she does have her limits. Everyone does, pauper or princess. So, I'd appreciate it if you'd lend me a hand keepin' her...well, alive.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Of course, my friend. If her life is in danger, send word here. Forename and I will answer.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: I'm much obliged. You've no ide─ Ah, but, I'd best go. She'll have my head if she catches me chattin'. I'll be in touch!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Bitin' back Far Eastern baubles what was bitten, eh?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: We'll need to whiddle more from that dastardly duo, I expect. The guild'll tip a daddle to track down the bandits that cloyed the treasures.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Jacke. When you have something, you know where to find us. Shall we, Forename?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I had heard of Yuki Yatsurugi before. The pride of her clan, puissant princess of the Far East...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: If even a tenth of the rumors are true, she has reason to deny our aid. But somehow, you must earn her trust. Someday, her life may depend upon it.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The path ahead of you is long. Your resolve cannot falter. I will help where I can, but from this day forth, you must devote your entire being to protecting Princess Yuki.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 戦技を凌ぐ荒技
journal: Curious Gorge looks eager to expand his combat repertoire.

Curious Gorge tells you of his brother, Broken Mountain, who is still recovering from his wounds at Camp Bronze Lake. The siblings remain steadfast in their resolve to spread the teachings of their people across Eorzea, although Broken Mountain seems reluctant to take up the axe once more. Instead, he now pursues more scholarly studies─during which he has stumbled upon information regarding ancient martial techniques. If you would know more of such things, make your way to Camp Bronze Lake and speak with Broken Mountain.

Broken Mountain tells you of a legendary hero named Mythril Heart whose combat prowess is detailed at length in accounts he has discovered. Skeptical of their veracity, he sees no point in studying them further. However, Curious Gorge strongly believes otherwise, and even his old comrade-in-arms Wheiskaet seems to think there may be truth in them as well. Yielding to pressure, Broken Mountain states that he will reconsider his stance if you uncover proof that Mythril Heart was real. Recalling that the hero's final journey took him to Silvertear Falls, Curious Gorge suggests that you speak with the Sons of Saint Coinach, who conduct their research in Mor Dhona.

Though none of the researchers know of Mythril Heart, it becomes clear that artifacts not of Allagan origin are often left untouched. Scour the shores of Silvertear Falls and see if you can find proof that the Hellsguard hero once walked these lands.

As if by fate, you come upon an axe that is quite unremarkable outside of the crudely engraved letters “MH” on its haft. Could it be the weapon once wielded by the legendary Mythril Heart? Present it to Broken Mountain and see if it serves as proof that the stories were not mere faerie tales.

Broken Mountain declares the weapon to be that of the legendary Mythril Heart, proving that the stories he discovered were true. Convinced of the hero's existence, he agrees to resume his studies of the ancient tomes in order to unlock the secrets of Mythril Heart's techniques─though he also acknowledges that the techniques are like to rouse the inner beast like none before.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Broken Mountain at Camp Bronze Lake.
Question the scholars of Saint Coinach's Find.
Search for proof along the shores of Silvertear Falls.
Present the axe to Broken Mountain.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, I scarce recognized you! The flames of battle have tempered you like fine steel.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Since last we spoke, I've resolved to start upon the path of the warrior anew. I swore that I would not succumb to the beast within again, as I did when I faced my brother in Wineport.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, Broken Mountain has regained much of his strength...though when I speak to him of taking up the axe once more, he changes the subject and returns to his studies of arcanima and other scholarly pursuits.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, his desire to spread the teachings of our ancestors to every corner of Eorzea remains unchanged.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: And you couldn't have come at a better time! I've just received a letter from Broken Mountain stating that he's uncovered information regarding ancient martial techniques!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: If you're interested─and I'm sure you are─why not accompany me to Camp Bronze Lake so that we might hear what he has to say together?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I knew my brother would uncover something of value before long. He awaits at Camp Bronze Lake. Let us not keep him idle for long.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, I knew a true warrior like you would never pass up an opportunity like this.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Well do I remember you, Forename─the sole warrior to tame herhis inner beast. I shudder to think what might have happened had you not been there to save us from ourselves.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: You know the precipitous nature of the forces we wield─as well as the consequences of losing control for even a moment. The beast does not scruple to discriminate between friend or foe, and if given free rein, will lash out at both.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I have pored over countless tomes in search of knowledge of how to tame the beast within, as you did, but my efforts have thus far proven fruitless. All I have found are ridiculous tales of techniques that─if the author could be believed─would make Rhalgr Himself cower in fear.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The elders often told tales of legendary warriors to inspire the youths. Are you sure there is no truth in yours?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Quite. There are descriptions of the techniques used by the hero Mythril Heart, but the details are difficult to swallow. No warrior─alive or dead─can rip off a behemoth's arm with his bare hands.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The tales are filled with similar outrageous accounts, Brother. It would be a waste of time to investigate their veracity when we know so little of how to tame the inner beast. Besides, you know as well as I that Mythril Heart is naught more than a faerie-tale hero.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What if I could prove that Mythril Heart was flesh and blood!? Would you be willing to continue your studies, then?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...Never did he stray from the path of the warrior, even as the years took their toll. Axe in hand, to Silvertear Falls he would go, never to return...which means that if he truly lived, then there may be something there which proves it!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Keep your axe sheathed, Gorge. You'd be better served by time spent swinging your axe at a practice dummy than searching for ghosts!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename. My thanks for ensuring that my old friend here lived to learn from his mistakes, although it seems the lesson didn't stick for long.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Wheiskaet here has been kind enough to keep my brother busy with work and assist me during my recovery.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Anything to keep a former comrade out of trouble. As for these stories─far-fetched as they may seem, I wouldn't be so quick to dismiss them. Lest we forget, Forename has more than a few legendary accomplishments to herhis name.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Well...if by chance shehe found proof of Mythril Heart's existence, I would reconsider. But leave my brother out of it.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I may not be ready to accompany you, but I can give you advice on where to start. Seek out the Sons of Saint Coinach. I'm certain they know something of Mythril Heart's final journey.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I know he was real, Forename, and I'm counting on you to prove it!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Bring me evidence of Mythril Heart's existence and I will reconsider my stance on the stories' veracity.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: If there is truth to the tales, then I pray you find proof. Nothing would please me more than to see techniques once lost rediscovered.

dialogue.name: CLIFTON
dialogue.text: Relics belonging to an ancient Hellsguard warrior? While we are up to our necks in Allagan artifacts, I cannot say that I have come across any that could be what you seek.

dialogue.name: CLIFTON
dialogue.text: The other researchers may have information that could be of use to you. Artifacts spanning all eras come up in our digs from time to time.

dialogue.name: SYELE
dialogue.text: Hmm... Well, when the waters of Silvertear Falls receded fifteen years ago, they revealed a treasure trove of artifacts spanning eras, many of which have yet to be recovered.

dialogue.name: SYELE
dialogue.text: I do not know if any of those artifacts have any relation to this Mythril Heart, but it might serve you well to begin your search in those previously submerged areas.

dialogue.name: SYELE
dialogue.text: We have been meaning to examine the artifacts in that area for some time, but our present work keeps us busy.

dialogue.name: SYELE
dialogue.text: Added to the fact that most of the uncovered artifacts don't seem to be of Allagan origin, it may be some time before that area is given a more thorough excavation.

dialogue.name: KLYNTHOTA
dialogue.text: We focus our research on artifacts from the Allagan Empire. As such, there may be more recent discoveries which were ignored by a single-minded researcher.

dialogue.name: KLYNTHOTA
dialogue.text: As interesting as artifacts from other eras might be, distractions would only impede the progress of our research into the Allagan Empire.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: After a cursory search, you find nothing of interest.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Is that the axe of Mythril Heart!? By the Twelve, the tales were true! Quickly now, you must show it to my brother!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: If anyone can prove the existence of Mythril Heart, you can.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Well? Have you uncovered any proof of Mythril Heart's existence?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: This axe... The engraving and the curvature of the blade are exactly as described. To think of the beasts who tasted this steel...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Surely this proves that Mythril Heart is more than a mere campfire story! With a steel heart and his legendary techniques, we'll have the strength to slay even the strongest of beasts by the dozen!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If Mythril Heart's feats are indeed possible, then the knowledge of how he performed them would prove invaluable in restoring the warriors' reputation...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: You could show the people of Eorzea the true potential of the warrior. Surely, no small number of them would feel compelled to take up the axe.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Indeed, it could prove a great boon for our cause. Very well. I will return to my tomes and scour them for any passages relating to Mythril Heart.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Mind you, ancient techniques may rouse the inner beast like none before...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Of that I have no doubt, which is why you must not take your training lightly. When I uncover more information, you must needs be ready.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: 暴かれし戦士の秘
journal: Broken Mountain seems to have reservations about digging deeper into this newfound knowledge.

Before he will share his latest findings regarding Mythril Heart with you, Broken Mountain asks you to accompany Curious Gorge to the Coerthas central highlands and slay a fearsome beast. Though it appears to be unrelated to his research, Broken Mountain assures you that this request is of the utmost importance. Rendezvous with him at the Weeping Saint and see the deed done.

While defending his brother from the beast's sudden attack, Curious Gorge succumbs to his inner beast, and you have no choice but to subdue him. As you land your final blow, your own inner beast rouses from its slumber with such ferocity that you lose consciousness momentarily. Afterwards, Broken Mountain forbids his brother from assisting you further in your quest, for fear of him losing control again. Though clearly distressed, Curious Gorge accepts his brother's judgment. Rest and visit Broken Mountain in Camp Bronze Lake when you are ready to continue your conversation.

Merely recalling your duel with Curious Gorge causes your inner beast to stir─a revelation which leads Broken Mountain to remember a passage he came across in his research: “Only the flames of animosity may temper a warrior's soul.” He interprets this to mean that the inner beast stirs when a warrior faces an opponent who pushes him to surpass his physical and mental limits, and that only in that moment can he attain mastery of new techniques. Believing this to be the means by which the heroes of eld achieved their legendary feats, he implores you to challenge yourself as they did.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Broken Mountain at the Weeping Saint.
Speak with Broken Mountain.
Defeat Curious Gorge!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I can tell you have not neglected your training, Forename, which is good. I have continued my research into the tales of Mythril Heart and his legendary feats, and I believe I've come across a passage which may guide your next step.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Before I share my findings with you, however, there is...another matter of pressing importance that must be resolved before we continue...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: A ferocious beast has been sighted near the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands, and I would have you, me, and my brother go and slay it, as it poses a threat to any who venture nearby. I realize that this may seem like a trivial matter, but I assure you that it is of the utmost importance.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What is he thinking, asking us to deal with such a trivial matter at a time like this?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I can't...resist...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Thank the Twelve you made it! The beast caught us unawares. My brother leapt to my defense and slew it, but in that moment...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: He was overcome by his inner beast, as before in Wineport!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I knew it was folly to bring him here. I beg of you, stop him before he hurts himself!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The beast...it's...uuugahhh!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: He has almost succumbed to the beast within! Stop him before he is forever lost!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Graaaghhh!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Each attack only serves to goad the beast!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Fleas...insignificant whelps!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: What has he become!?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename! Speak to me!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Thank the gods you're awake. When your final blow landed, you and my brother both collapsed. What happened, Forename? Do you remember anything?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Your inner beast lashed out as if trying to escape!?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I see... The lingering numbness is likely your body recovering from the shock. Otherwise, you appear to be unharmed and in full control of your faculties.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I owe you an apology, Forename. Once again I lost control...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I have already tended to my brother's wounds. You needn't worry.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Alas, as I suspected, my brother yet lacks the strength to control his inner beast. As you may have guessed, I called you both here to see if my fears were unfounded.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I did not wish to give you cause to worry, Brother, but...when the beast stirs, my mind grows clouded, and my will falters...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Or perhaps I remained silent to avoid facing the bitter truth: who would trust a protector that could turn on them at any moment?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It pains me to do this, but I cannot allow you to accompany Forename any longer. The risk is far too great to you both.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Mayhap it is best we continue this conversation in the safety of Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Godsdammit! Forename, you've...you've grown so much stronger...while I've hardly grown at all.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Show Eorzea what it means to be a true warrior. I know...I know you can.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Go on without me, Forename. I will burden you no longer.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: So, my brother has been in a dour mood ever since we returned from the Weeping Saint? Well, that is only natural given his lack of progress─and it may be for the best.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The teachings of our people are too dangerous for those who lack control. That is why I chose to focus my studies on how to tame the inner beast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: For the sake of my brother, I wanted naught more than to solve this dilemma...but then fate intervened, and I stumbled upon the tales of Mythril Heart.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: But mayhap we need not forsake one pursuit for the other, though. In seeking the techniques of eld, we may discover the reason why you can hold the beast in check so easily while my brother and I fumble about like children.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: However, I am still concerned about what you told me before─about your inner beast lashing out during your duel with my brother. Can you tell me of that once more?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Simply recalling the duel rouses your inner beast from its slumber!? Wait─it all makes sense.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: “Only the flames of animosity may temper a warrior's soul.” I came across these words in a passage, and I did not understand their meaning until now.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The inner beast stirs when we face an opponent who pushes us to surpass our physical and mental limits. Only in that moment can we attain mastery of new techniques.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: This must be how the heroes of eld like Mythril Heart became such legends! They traveled the realm, testing their mettle against the fiercest foes they could find. Your path is clear, then, Forename: you must challenge yourself as they did. You must grow stronger and hone your skills to new heights!

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン
ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: 古の英雄を追って
journal: Broken Mountain has some concerns about his brother.

Broken Mountain gives news of Curious Gorge, who has joined the Maelstrom's defensive operations against the kobolds in hopes of training against live enemies. Even though he wants nothing more than to improve, it seems his fear of losing control once again is keeping him from fighting with all his strength. In order to serve as an example to Curious Gorge, and future warriors, Broken Mountain tells you to follow in Mythril Heart's footsteps by hunting the fearsome grizzly bears inhabiting Abalathia's Spine. Go to Tailfeather in the Dravanian forelands and ask the hunters there for any information that might help you track down these colossal creatures.

The hunters at Tailfeather share stories of the massive grizzlies, none of them encouraging. One hunter begrudgingly informs you that some have been known to lure the bears out with Whilom salmon, which can be found at the northwestern part of the Whilom River. Go to the riverbanks and gather any fish you can find.

The hunter's advice was sound, and you have found enough fish to draw one of the beasts out from hiding. Go to the Hundred Throes and use the Whilom salmon to draw a grizzly out, then slay one of them in its watering hole.

You have defeated a fearsome Whilom grizzly, as Mythril Heart before you, and the pitched battle awakens your inner beast from its slumber. Return to Camp Bronze Lake and inform Broken Mountain of your deeds.

Upon returning to Camp Bronze Lake, Curious Gorge enthusiastically informs you of the Maelstrom's successful defense against the kobold attacks, and returns to train for his next mission. However, Wheiskaet has a different story. Although the operation succeeded, it seems Curious Gorge remains frightened of losing control in battle. With the beast tribes growing bolder by the day, there is little hope for the Maelstrom to take warriors seriously if Curious Gorge continues to underperform. Broken Mountain will continue to do research into how to tame the inner beast and encourages you to continue your training in preparation for the next step.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with the hunters at Tailfeather.
Obtain Whilom salmon from the designated location.
Use the salmon at the designated location and slay the bear.
Report to Broken Mountain at Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename. It seems your trials have prepared you for the next step down your long path.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: However, while your progress is truly remarkable, I'm afraid my brother still fears the fury of his inner beast. Even in the training yard, he swings his axe with hesitation.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Seeking to test himself against live foes, he has joined the Maelstrom's efforts to repel a recent spate of kobold attacks. However, Wheiskaet has sent word that his ferocity on the field of battle is not what it once was.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: My brother has long admired your will. Test your axe against ever stronger adversaries and master the techniques of eld, and by doing so serve to inspire him and all who aspire to walk the path of the warrior.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Remember the words set forth in the ancient tomes, and seek foes that test the very limits of your mind and body. The heat of battle will awaken the beast within, bestowing upon you the knowledge of our ancestors.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Luckily, the path you walk has been tread on before, and you need not wander the land aimlessly. According to the tomes, Mythril Heart once spent a season hunting the hulking grizzly bears that stalk Abalathia's Spine, the largest of which are said to rival even a behemoth in size.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Make your way to Tailfeather, home to many seasoned hunters that know the lay of the land and of the creatures inhabiting it. Find the beasts of Mythril Heart's hunt and test yourself against their razor claws as he did.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The techniques of eld are within your grasp, but only if you can transcend the limits of your mind and body.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Each meeting with you, I'm humbled anew. I'll continue my own training, so that one day we may meet as peers.

dialogue.name: REMACLON
dialogue.text: Ask any hunter 'round here about the grizzlies of Abalathia's Spine and they're like to tell you the same thing: if you see one, run.

dialogue.name: REMACLON
dialogue.text: Plenty o' green adventurers come 'round here asking about the beasts of Abalathia's Spine. Few come back from their hunt.

dialogue.name: LOUISONET
dialogue.text: Aye, I can hardly forget the size of the beast I saw that day. I was tracking a chocobo 'round the Hundred Throes, when I spotted a bear near big as a house, drinkin' its fill from the waters. I didn't dare get any closer, and went home from that day's hunt empty-handed.

dialogue.name: LOUISONET
dialogue.text: You can't convince me to go back to the Hundred Throes again, even if there was a whole herd of chocobos over there.

dialogue.name: PRIORFAIX
dialogue.text: You're a right fool if you're thinkin' of goin' after one of those massive beasts alone─best bring about a dozen friends along if you wanna come back in one piece.

dialogue.name: PRIORFAIX
dialogue.text: If you've got the men, then I've heard of huntin' parties usin' Whilom salmon to draw 'em out. If you head up the Whilom River, you're like to find a few what died durin' the salmon run.

dialogue.name: PRIORFAIX
dialogue.text: Some of the huntin' parties comin' through here have used Whilom salmon to lure out the beasts.

dialogue.name: PRIORFAIX
dialogue.text: 'Course, once you lure one out, then you've gotta kill it. Can't give you much advice on that part.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Broken Mountain told me of the daring hunt you set out upon. I'd like to hear about it─sounds like it's the type of story that'll get our blood flowing!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Wheiskaet and I have just returned from our duties in La Noscea. The cowardly kobolds never stood a chance! A dip in the hot springs seems a just reward for our bravery.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, welcome back. My brother and Wheiskaet were just telling me of the Maelstrom's successes in La Noscea.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Aye, the kobolds scattered as frightened mice before our wrath. I daresay they'll think twice before setting foot on Lominsan soil again!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, as eager as I am to hear of your journey to Abalathia's Spine, I can't afford to waste any more time away from my training. The kobolds may be licking their wounds for now, but they'll be back, and in greater numbers. Till next we meet.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: <sigh> Curious Gorge has acted in high spirits since our return from Limsa Lominsa, but his bravado scarcely hides the truth.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: What he said was true─our operations against the kobolds were a resounding success. However, troops that fought alongside him say that Curious Gorge was noticeably shaken during the battle, as if afraid the tide would turn at a moment's notice.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: But it was not fear of the kobolds that caused his axe to waver. He still fears his own inner beast. As long as this fear has hold of him in battle, then there is little hope that he will grow as a warrior...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The kobolds become bolder with each passing day, and the Maelstrom's forces are spread too thin. Maelstrom Command is desperately seeking ways to supplement its flagging troops.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: They're considering bolstering fighting strength by training troops in warrior techniques, so Curious Gorge's capabilities have come under special scrutiny. However, if fear continues to hold him back, I doubt he'll manage to impress anyone.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Once again, we are left wanting for a means to tame the inner beast...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: ...Forename, was there naught learned from your journey to the Dravanian forelands that could be of aid?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: ...Ah, and in the same manner as before, the memories of battle have roused the inner beast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: So my theory was correct: the key to mastery lies in the heat of conflict. Just as the ancient tomes say, only victory against a worthy opponent can temper the inner beast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, your growth as a warrior has given us valuable insight into the true nature of the inner beast. However, there is still much that remains shrouded in mystery.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: And there's still the question of what exactly sets Forename apart from your brother.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Indeed. The tools to tame the beast within are hidden somewhere─I just have yet to find them. Forename, continue with your training while I return to the tomes. A solution will present itself soon enough!

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: 不測なる共振
journal: Broken Mountain knows someone in need of a legendary adventurer.

Wheiskaet informs you that pirates in thrall to the Sahagin have started brazen attacks along the La Noscean coasts, further straining the already-limited resources of the Maelstrom. He has requested that you aid him in the defense of Limsa Lominsa, and promises fierce battles that will test even your battle-worn axe. Report to Aleport and speak with the storm captain for details of your mission.

The storm captain begins the mission briefing, informing you that the Serpent Reavers plan to mount an offensive from the sea, using the Isles of Umbra as a foothold. Determining that the best course of action is to scatter the pirates before they have a chance to carry out their attack, he instructs you to make haste to the isles. Speak with the captain once you have landed ashore the Isles of Umbra.
The captain's assault against the Serpent Reavers on the Isles of Umbra has begun. Speak to the storm captain to join in the fray.
The troops are making steady progress into the pirate foothold. Speak with the storm captain to find out where to proceed to next.

Although several allies have fallen to the Reavers' blades, you manage to cut through their next line of defense. The storm captain's face has a look of desperate determination─speak with him to find out where the next step of pirate killing begins.

The remnants of the Maelstrom outfit have suffered through several waves of relentless Serpent Reavers, but the pirate encampment is finally in sight. Speak with the storm captain once more before proceeding.
The Serpent Reaver captain is in sight, with his ferocious beast in tow. Save the storm captain from the pirate's barrage and steel yourself for the final battle.
The Reaver captain and his pet monster are no match for a warrior who follows in the path of Mythril Heart. Rescue the storm captain and scatter the last remnants of the Serpent Reavers.

You've rescued the storm captain, who expresses his gratitude for your help in repelling the Serpent Reavers. However, he is hesitant to remain on the Isles of Umbra for a second longer than he has to, and bids the party meet up again at Aleport. Speak with the storm captain again once everyone is safely out of those haunted isles.

The morale and strength the troops gained from your presence was key to your victory, and despite the relative weakness of the Serpent Reavers, the souls of the warriors' ancestors bestow upon you a new technique, indicating that the resolve to defend your allies is just as effective as resolving to kill your enemies. After you have recovered from your ordeal, speak with the captain again.
objectives: Speak with the storm captain at Aleport.
Speak with the storm captain at the Isles of Umbra.
Speak with the storm captain and defeat the pirates.
Speak with the storm captain.
Speak with the storm captain and defeat more pirates.
Speak with the storm captain.
Speak with the Serpent Reaver captain and defeat him if he attacks.
Rescue the storm captain.
Speak with the storm captain.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, you couldn't have come at a better time. Wheiskaet has just arrived and looks eager to speak with you.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, just the warrior I wanted to see! The nation of Limsa Lominsa is in dire need of your aid. The Maelstrom is shorthanded and the beast tribes' attacks only grow more ferocious. I'm here searching for skilled fighters─and there aren't many more skilled than you!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: As you know, my brother has already answered the call, helping the Maelstrom defend from the relentless kobold assaults.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Kobolds aren't the only thorn in our sides. Pirates serving the Sahagin have been pillaging along the coasts of La Noscea.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: That's why we need your axe, Forename. They may be mere pirates, but their blades cut as deep as any I've seen. Limsa Lominsa will be grateful to have your prowess on their side.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Once you've made your preparations, hurry to Aleport and speak with the storm captain on duty for the details of the mission.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You're joining the Maelstrom's defense against the beast tribes? Now neither the kobolds nor Sahagin will escape the warrior's fury!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: This mission entails more than just your journey on the warrior's path. Use your burgeoning strength in the aid of Limsa Lominsa, and your inner beast may be tempered even further.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Limsa Lominsa is grateful for your aid.

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: You're the warrior here at Wheiskaet's behest? He has a high opinion of you─let's see if you live up to it!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Adventurer, the Maelstrom thanks you for your aid. A band of pirates flying the flag of the Serpent Reavers has landed ashore the Isles of Umbra, and all reports indicate they plan to use that as a foothold to attack Aleport.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Our walls only defend from inland assaults. I shudder to think of what might happen were the pirates to bombard us with cannons from the sea. Our course of action has been decided: we will take the fight to them, before they have a chance to mount an offensive.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Our rendezvous point is at the Isles of Umbra. The pirates shall not weather the wrath of the Maelstrom!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: So you're the one Wheiskaet sent? He's said much of your prowess. I look forward to seeing you in the fray!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Good, now that our troops are gathered, we shall move out at once. Our objective is to slay the pirate captain. Without a head to lead them, the Serpent Reavers will scuttle back to their moldy ships.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: However, the task ahead of us should not be taken lightly. Reports tell of a fearsome beast under the captain's thrall. Take care not to let your guard down, lest you become the beast's next meal!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: This place is not meant for the living...

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Fight back before we're overwhelmed!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: These're no ordinary pirates!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: The pirates attacked as if possessed... Thank the Twelve your axe cut them down! We shall press forward. For Aleport!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: I've never seen such ferocity. Wheiskaet's praise was not unfounded!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: The main camp will soon be within our sights! I'll protect the wounded─Forename, give the pirates a taste of your steel!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: Godsdammit... The main camp is just ahead... Our strength must not falter...

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: The pirates think they have strength in numbers, but a storm captain is worth a dozen of them! We shall leave the wounded to recover here─Forename, to me!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: We've come this far, but our strength dwindles. I will not...die here...

dialogue.name: SENCHO00596
dialogue.text: Stop the Serpent Reavers!? Har har har! Well, if yer hells-bent on tryin', it's been a long time since me pup had fresh corpses to feast on!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Don't let his bloody beast catch you off guard!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: Forge ahead... We won't be far behind!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: I could not wish for a stronger ally. To think such a beast could be felled so easily...

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Such fine axemanship I've never seen! However, now is not the time to dally about in awe─this place fills me with foreboding. Let us meet again at Aleport!

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: I could not wish for a stronger ally. To think such a beast could be felled so easily...

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Forename, now that we are safely out of those cursed isles, I would like to thank you for your aid once again. Without the courage your fighting spirit bestowed upon us, we would have been overwhelmed. The Maelstrom is honored to count you amongst our allies.

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: The captain speaks for us all. Your ferocity inspired us to carry on in the face of the pirate onslaught. What drove you to fight with such fury?

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: ...And here I thought that axe was just for killing! But instead, you wielded it in our defense, and your will to protect us gave you the strength to surpass the limits of your mind and body... Seven hells, I've been fighting all wrong!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: I've seen nary a battle so fierce, or a protector more stalwart. Forename, I would like to hear more of our skirmish from your eyes. After you have recovered from the fight, pray speak to me again.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: かち割れぬ暗雲
journal: Broken Mountain has something urgent to discuss with you.

Broken Mountain, impressed with your progress, gives word that the Maelstrom is once again in need of extra bodies to aid in another operation against the beast tribes. Wheiskaet and Curious Gorge have visited Camp Bronze Lake seeking volunteers, and have asked for you by name. Speak with Curious Gorge to hear what it is Limsa Lominsa requires.

Wheiskaet informs you that Maelstrom scouts have reported that kobolds of the 179th Order are tirelessly producing bombs in preparation for an all-out assault on Camp Bronze Lake. Maelstrom troops hope to intercept the bombs at Zelma's Run before they can do any damage, and Wheiskaet asks the aid of the two fiercest warriors he knows. Once again, Curious Gorge is afraid of his inner beast taking hold, especially in such a confined area, but Broken Mountain insists that this will be the ideal situation for Gorge to establish his dominance over the beast within. Curious Gorge asks to be alone and leaves, while Wheiskaet gives you the details of the Maelstrom operation. Speak with the despondent Curious Gorge once more before heading off to Zelma's Run and see if he can be convinced to join in on the fight.

You find Curious Gorge looking crestfallen in one of the camp's hot springs. He admits that his brother is right, and that the correct path is plain, but can't seem to shake his fear of being overcome by the inner beast. He comes up with a last, desperate strategy: you must /slap him with all the strength you can muster, hopefully driving the cowardice from him for good.

Your slap rouses Curious Gorge out of his slump, and he stands straight as if a warrior reborn. Determined to show the kobolds no quarter, he rushes to meet the storm captain at Zelma's Run. Follow him and rendezvous with the rest of the troops. Speak with the storm captain when you are ready to start the Maelstrom's next operation.

You arrive at the entrance to Zelma's Run to see the same storm captain from your operation against the Serpent Reavers along with two other Maelstrom troops and Curious Gorge, who is dressed proudly in his warrior's garb. You have been assigned to intercept the 179th Order kobolds on the east side of the valley. Ready your axe and speak with the Maelstrom troop at your assigned area, but be on the lookout for any signs of kobolds.

In his haste, the storm private assigned as your partner falls victim to a kobold ambush. When you run to his aid, the kobolds attempt to swarm you and the storm private, but your axe cuts them down one after the other. With the kobolds of the 179th Order slain or scattered, check on the storm private to see that his wounds are not severe.

The storm private's wounds are but light, and there are no remaining kobolds in sight. The defense of the eastern side of Zelma's Run is a success. Check with Curious Gorge to the west for news of their progress.

It seems Curious Gorge and the other Maelstrom troops had no trouble in intercepting and dispatching the kobolds on the western side of Zelma's Run. The storm captain gives particular credit to Curious Gorge's ferocity in battle, and promises to give high praise in his report to Maelstrom Command. After the others return home, Curious Gorge tells you he was finally able to fight with abandon without succumbing to his inner beast. Nevertheless, he still doubts his own ability to maintain control in a more pitched battle. Curious Gorge returns to Camp Bronze Lake to rest, and asks you to give word of your victory to Broken Mountain upon your return.

Broken Mountain is pleased that his brother was able to fight to his fullest, but disheartened by the news of his brother's continuing self-doubt. There is little time to consider the matter, however, as Wheiskaet brings news that Storm Marshal Slafyrsyn is seeking the aid of capable warriors to help defend Limsa Lominsa from the Sahagin menace. Broken Mountain suggests that if you were to succeed in this operation, it might lift the reputation of the warriors out of obscurity and into Eorzean history books. Continue your training in preparation for what promises to be the most critical test of your strength yet.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with Curious Gorge.
Speak with Curious Gorge again.
Rouse Curious Gorge's courage with a /slap.
Speak with the storm captain at Zelma's Run.
Speak with the storm private and slay any kobolds that appear.
Rescue the storm private.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Report to Broken Mountain at Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, I can see the power in your stride, and feel the inner beast raging within you. You will need such strength, for your next trial is at hand.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Wheiskaet and my brother are here looking for more fighters to supplement the undermanned Maelstrom troops in a new operation, and they've asked for you by name. Seek them out if you wish to raise your axe once more against the beast tribes.
