dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: My wounds are healed, but I fear I may still be in need of training...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It seems the Maelstrom is in need of aid once again. Ask Wheiskaet and my brother for the details.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I would ask you and Curious Gorge to aid the Maelstrom once again. Go to Camp Bronze Lake for more details.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I need the aid of a couple good axes once again.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename! Brother!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom is once again in need of support, is it not? Pray tell us what it is they require.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Very well, now that everyone is here. Scouts have reported increased activity among the kobolds. The 179th Order seems to be producing explosives day and night in preparation for an all-out assault. From all indications, they aim to attack this very camp.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom's strategy is to intercept the bombs near Zelma's Run. Camp Bronze Lake is a haven for wounded soldiers, and its defense is one of our top priorities. If we had two legendary warriors by our side, our success would be all but assured.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Zelma's Run is barely wide enough for one cart to ride abreast... If I were to lose control, none would be able to escape the beast's wrath...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: On the contrary, Brother, this battle will give you the chance to once again assert your dominance over the beast within.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: This is what you spoke of earlier, is it not? To tame the inner beast by devoting yourself to the defense of your allies...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Brother, if my theory turns out to be true, then control is within your grasp. As long as Forename is at your back, there is naught to fear.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Will you run away again? You know that the path you wish to walk, the path of the warrior, does not lie down that road.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Say no more... Please, leave me to my thoughts.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Well, we've not much time for hesitation. The storm captain awaits near Zelma's Run and will be departing shortly. Forename, if you decide to join the fight, pray tell Curious Gorge─if anyone can rouse him from his slump, it's you.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: My brother is right... It's me who's holding us back...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Please, Forename, as a fellow warrior, give my brother strength.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The storm captain awaits at the entrance to Zelma's Run. Please, try once more to convince Curious Gorge before you depart.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: My apologies for causing worry, Forename. My brother is right...it's up to me to walk the path of might. I know that, but still I cower before the beast within...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But a true warrior faces his fears, axe in hand, right!? Come on, Forename, remind me what it's like to scoff at my enemies' feeble blows! Awaken your inner beast and slap the fear right out of me!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Do it, Forename! I expect no less than a slap that would crumble mountains!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Godsdamn, what a blow! That's the stuff warriors are made of, Forename! Thank you... I'll dominate the beast within, and our axes will stand indomitable against those bloody kobolds!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Our enemies will feel the full force of my fury, and will not step one ilm into this camp! Come, Forename, we mustn't keep the storm captain waiting!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I have not seen my brother in such high spirits since the incident in Wineport. Whatever you said to him seems to have worked.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Fight well, and show those kobolds no quarter!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, one day I hope to fell a beast such as the one you battled at Abalathia's Spine. For that, my axe needs practice. The kobolds shall feel the full force of my fury at last! Hurry, we must report to the storm captain at Zelma's Run!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The kobolds will scurry in fear before the wrath of the warrior! They won't dare to get within a malm of this camp again!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598CG
dialogue.text: With Curious Gorge by our side, victory is all but assured. I daresay the kobolds won't have the courage to face him again!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598PC
dialogue.text: Forename, it is an honor to fight with you again! Let's show those kobolds what for!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Forename, that both you and Curious Gorge will be aiding us brings me comfort. Camp Bronze Lake could not ask for a more stalwart defense.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Our strategy is to intercept the kobolds at two separate locations in Zelma's Run. We'll split into two groups, with one warrior protecting each one.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598PC
dialogue.text: Forename, we'll be dispatched to the eastern side. Nary a single kobold will make it through with your fury alongside us!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598CG
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge, we'll be in charge of the western side's defense. I've seen you crush kobolds under your axe before─today shall be no different!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Once the 179th Order have run home with their tails between their legs, we will rendezvous to the north. May your axes strike true! Dismissed!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells are you doing here!?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598CG
dialogue.text: With Curious Gorge here, there's no need for worry!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: We've managed to beat them back, for now... Forename, support the troops to the east!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598PC
dialogue.text: Godsdammit... I walked right into their ambush...

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598PC
dialogue.text: That was too bloody close... Good thing the kobolds didn't count on you showing up. It looks like the eastern side is clear. Curious Gorge and the others may need our help─hurry, Forename!

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: I am glad you've returned to us hale and whole. The kobolds barely put up a fight.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The kobolds won't dare to cross through Zelma's Run after today. Come, let us inform the others at Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598CG
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge fought like a warrior possessed! I could feel his fury flowing through my axe, as well!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598PC
dialogue.text: If not for your timely arrival, who knows what the kobolds would have done with me? Once again, I owe you my life.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: There are no kobolds in sight of the camp, which means the operation must have been a success. Talk to my brother to see how he fared.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Was the operation a success? Check on Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, my apologies, but it seems the kobolds couldn't wait for you. Camp Bronze Lake has naught to fear from the 179th Order anymore!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER00598CG
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge's axe was like a whirlwind, strewing the kobolds in every which direction! His courage carried us all through battle unharmed.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: Without these two warriors on our side, I have no doubt the kobolds would have overwhelmed us. I will be submitting a detailed report of your heroism to Wheiskaet and Maelstrom Command. You have all fought bravely today─let us return home for well-deserved rest!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...Forename, I can scarce remember the last time I fought as I did today. I swung my axe with abandon, but I was free from the inner beast's grasp.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It was just as my brother said. By pouring my strength into the defense of my allies, the beast within was tamed!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...However, kobolds are hardly a true test of one's prowess. If the fight had been against a more worthy foe, or if the circumstances had been more dire...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Although today's battle was heartening, it's too early to say I've subdued the beast. I'll return to Camp Bronze Lake to rest─Forename, let my brother know of our victory here.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It's too early to say I'm in full control of my inner fury... The beast slumbers within me still, of that I'm certain.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Your victory is great news to us all. Broken Mountain is eager to hear of his brother's performance in the battle.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The storm captain has already sent his report of your impressive feats. Broken Mountain will be eager to hear of his brother's heroism.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It seems your victory was well earned. What of my brother? Was he able to fight without succumbing to his inner fury?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Ah... So even with today's victory, he yet dreads the consequences were he to lose control. Still, it is only through the strength of his own will that he may dispel the fog of self-doubt.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the beast tribes won't wait for Curious Gorge's epiphany. Storm Marshal Slafyrsyn has sent word that he requires a warrior's strength to aid in another Maelstrom defensive.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: As you already know, kobolds aren't the only nuisances we have to contend with.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The Sahagin have taken advantage of the distraction caused by our focus on the kobolds to launch an offensive against the tidegates.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: With the bulk of Maelstrom forces tied up with the kobold threat, we can ill afford to send any men to defend the gate near Camp Skull Valley, leaving us wide open to the Sahagin threat.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, if the strength of a warrior were to see the people of Limsa Lominsa safely through this storm, then mayhap the glory of our ancestors would be restored, and all across Eorzea would know of us as guardians, instead of brutes.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: However, it saddens me to say we cannot depend on my brother to be ready to shoulder such a weight. Forename, when the time comes, you must needs be ready to take on the task alone.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: In the meantime, pray tell me of your battle at Zelma's Run. Recall the ferocity with which you fought, and lose yourself in the memories of your fight.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: As before, your inner beast is roused, and another technique of eld is at your disposal. Your progress is encouraging. Continue on this path, continue to challenge the limits of your mind and body, and victory in the battles to come is assured.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: すべてを護る乱撃
journal: Broken Mountain is steeling himself for the decisive battle.

Broken Mountain informs you that the Sahagin have begun their assault on the tidegates. Although Curious Gorge remains doubtful about his ability to control his inner beast, the defense will require two warriors for it to be successful. Broken Mountain will not let you and his brother shoulder all of the burden, however, and he informs you that he will aid you with what limited healing magicks he has at his disposal. Speak with Curious Gorge for further details of the defensive operation.

The three burly Roegadyn fighters are ready to depart for the decisive battle. Wheiskaet informs you that the Sahagin plan to use massive seabeasts to overrun the tidegate, and that he will be joining you despite the wounds he suffered in his fight with the primal Titan. Curious Gorge, still overcome with self-doubt, asks you to once again dispel the fear from his heart with an inspiring /slap to the face.

Your slap serves to rouse Curious Gorge's inner beast even more so than his fight with the kobolds, restoring his confidence and preparing him for his fight against the Sahagin threat. With a newfound courage, he rushes to Camp Skull Valley─follow him and speak with Storm Commander Falkbryda to receive a briefing on your critical mission.
Your allies are all waiting at the southern gate for the fury of the Sahagin. Speak with Storm Marshal Eynzahr to start the desperate battle.

The Sahagin come in waves, one after the other, only to be cut down like fish to the slaughter. Curious Gorge fights at a fever pitch, eventually falling to the ground in a struggle to control his inner beast. In the last desperate moment, he triumphantly quells the rising fury of his inner beast, at last conquering it for good. Then, in a futile attempt to break through the tidegate's mighty defenders, the Sahagin captain attacks with his massive seabeast, but they fall quickly before the full strength of two unbridled warriors. With the Sahagin threat finally quelled, speak with Curious Gorge to celebrate this tremendous victory together.

Curious Gorge and his brother are ecstatic that the former was able to finally tame his inner beast, but that is not the only good news waiting for them. With the Sahagin threat quelled, Storm Marshal Eynzahr informs them that the Maelstrom will move forward with its plan to train its troops in the way of the warrior, and that Maelstrom Command has requested that the two brothers be the first two to teach the fledgling warriors. Little by little, the dream that they carried down with them from their humble mountain village will come to pass, as more people of Eorzea learn the teachings of their ancestors. Curious Gorge, fueled by his new confidence, swears that he will master the techniques of eld, and promises a fearsome duel once you both reach the peak of your martial prowess. Take care not to neglect your training, lest one day Curious Gorge become the mightiest warrior in Eorzea.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with Curious Gorge.
Rouse Curious Gorge with a /slap.
Speak with Falkbryda at Camp Skull Valley.
Speak with Eynzahr at South Tidegate.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Decimate the Sahagin forces!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, the Sahagin forces have begun marching upon the tidegates. The time has come for the decisive battle, on which the fate of all Lominsans hangs in the balance.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: My brother still wrestles with his tenuous grasp on the inner beast, but this crisis will not wait for him. The successful defense of the tidegates depends on two warriors being present.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I shall not stand idly by, either. I will lend what meager aid I can with my healing magicks. If your heart is steeled for battle, let us meet my brother outside.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I cannot stand by idly during so monumental a battle. Let us go meet Wheiskaet and my brother.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The Sahagin have begun their attack. There is much to discuss at Camp Bronze Lake.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The decisive battle is at hand. Go to Camp Bronze Lake so we can begin planning at once.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Whether we like it or not, the fate of Limsa Lominsa depends on us...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, you're here at last. Is my brother ready to depart?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: My preparations are complete. I am ready to lay down my life in Limsa Lominsa's defense.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: As are we all. The most recent reports tell that the Sahagin plan to use their massive seabeasts to overrun the tidegates.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Us four will be in charge of defending the southern tidegate. With two warriors by our side, we'll beat those slimy fishbacks into the muddy depths from whence they came!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You're fighting too!? But what of your wounds? And you said two warriors...?

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Aye, it's true the injuries from our fight with Titan remain, but I reckon the Sahagin's courage won't last for long. As for the warriors... Well, we've got two right here, don't we?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Worry not, Wheiskaet, the Sahagin will rue the day they stood before our might!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Alright, then, let's head to Camp Skull Valley─the Sahagin won't soon forget this battle!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...The fate of Limsa Lominsa... I desire nothing more than to see everyone safely through this battle, but if the beast within takes me within its clutches again...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, you know what to do! Gather your strength and drive the fear from me with a mighty slap! It's time to put that training to work!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Use your fighting spirit to guide my brother through his fog of doubt.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I'll be at Camp Bronze Lake preparing for the battle against the Sahagin.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Everything depends on the outcome of this battle. Show the realm what warriors are made of!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Don't hold back, Forename! Slap me silly like only a warrior can!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: That's the stuff, Forename! I'll be feeling that in the morning!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Come hells or high water, the tidegates will not fall! We'll show the Sahagin the iron will of the warrior! Forename, let us report to Commander Falkbryda at once!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Your presence makes me proud to call myself a warrior! With us at the front lines, the fishbacks won't make it one yalm past the shore!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The Sahagin won't get one ilm past the tidegates with us standing in their way!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge seems like a warrior reborn. With you two by our side, Limsa Lominsa has nothing to fear.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: My brother's confidence has returned at last, thanks to your splendid example.

dialogue.name: FALKBRYDA
dialogue.text: This operation depends on the successful defense of both tidegates. You four will see to the southern, while another unit attends to the northern. Although you are few in number, 'twould be foolish to expect anything but greatness from such storied fighters.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: All in charge of defending the southern tidegate are here. Let's not waste any more time!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Not so fast, Wheiskaet. You don't think I'd let you take all the glory, do you?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Storm Marshal Eynzahr!? You plan to fight alongside us?

dialogue.name: FALKBRYDA
dialogue.text: There was naught I could say to stop him. Once he has a mind to do something, there is very little that can...

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: My sense of duty will scarce allow you four to bear the weight of Limsa Lominsa's fate on your own. My axe will be the first to greet the Sahagin wave!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: And what's more, I'd like to see the strength of these two warriors with mine own eyes. Something tells me this will be a fight to remember!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Storm Marshal, it will be an honor to fight by your side! Our axes will see the people of Limsa Lominsa safely through this storm!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Brave defenders! This day, the Sahagin mean to descend upon us like a tidal wave! But you will stand strong! You will not allow the fishbacks a single ilm of land, nor will you give them any quarter!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Our fate awaits us at Halfstone! To the tidegate!

dialogue.name: FALKBRYDA
dialogue.text: The fate of Limsa Lominsa is safe in your hands. May you return victorious!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Your strength has served to inspire mine, and now our strength will stand in between Limsa Lominsa and the Sahagin menace. Hurry to Halfstone before they attack!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: We shall show Eorzea a warrior's true mettle. May our axes remain steadfast and true!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: To see the storm marshal in battle... The Maelstrom is sparing no effort in this endeavor. May the Twelve give us luck!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The responsibility we bear is not to be taken lightly. The citizens of Limsa Lominsa shall not regret putting their trust in us!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Valiant protectors of Limsa Lominsa! This day, the Sahagin mean to make an end of us. They will come shrieking like the gale, and descend upon us with the force of a tidal wave! But will we falter? No! We will stand strong, unwavering, until the tide recedes, stained by the blood of their dead!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The beast...has been tamed. Forename, Brother, friends...thank you.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: My axe remains steadfast! Friends, stand at my back─my inner beast shall protect you!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Haha, the fishbacks have brought more pets to be crushed under the warriors' heels!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, Brother! Imbue your axes with your inner fury, and show the world a warrior's true wrath!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Go forward, undaunted warriors! Smash these invaders till naught remains but fodder for the gulls!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defend the tidegate and use the fishbacks' broken corpses as bait!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You call that an axe!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Mwahaha! You're not worthy of tasting my steel!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename, Curious Gorge! Skewer the fishbacks!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Graaagh! Die! Choke on your dead!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: My brother, he's...losing control! The beast threatens to swallow him whole!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Tremble before me...weaklings!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename, I'll take care of the captain! Fell the trifling beast!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: As long as Forename stands with us, none shall break through!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I must...withdraw...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Godsdammit...go on without me...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The Sahagin are too fierce... We must pull back...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Gaaagh... I can't... It's over...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Finish off the Sahagin captain!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The Sahagin have been beaten back! Limsa Lominsa is saved! Let's meet at the southern gate to celebrate our victory!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: To see you and my brother fight unbridled gave me strength I did not know I had. No doubt our victory here is thanks to you.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: If not for you two warriors, the tidegate would surely have fallen. Let's return to the southern tidegate to celebrate our victory.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: The full strength of a warrior is truly a sight to behold. The Sahagin won't soon forget today's battle!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Warrior of Light, the tales do not do you justice. It's been too long since I've swung my axe as I did today.

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Warrior of Light, Curious Gorge! The battle is won, and the Sahagin scurry back to their moldy caverns!

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Today's victory is owed to the might of our two warriors! Without you, we would not be standing here.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge, wear the title of warrior with pride!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I couldn't have made it this far alone. It was only thanks to the bravery of my allies that I was able to dominate the beast within.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The day will soon come when, with proper training and instruction, all the peoples of Eorzea can choose to walk the path of the warrior.

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, with the Sahagin threat dealt with, the Maelstrom can proceed with its plan to train its troops in the way of the warriors. And who better to train them than the two siblings who brought their teachings to Eorzea in the first place?

dialogue.name: EYNZAHRSLAFYRSYN
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge, Broken Mountain, I invite you to instruct the Maelstrom recruits in the ways of your ancestors. Forge our troops into mighty defenders worthy of their title!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Many moons have passed since we came down from our mountain village, and finally we can begin to realize our dream!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I... This is an honor. My brother and I will gladly accept this appointment!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, mayhap now you're the one who needs to start training harder!

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: I daresay you're right─Forename has some proper competition!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: We'll both fight where we're needed, unbound by fear or hesitation, and in doing so master the techniques of eld!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, look forward to the day we both reach the peak of our strengths, for then you'll face an opponent worthy of your axe: me!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the warrior quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン
ファルクブリダ中甲佐
ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: でっかい夢
journal: Axemaster Wyrnzoen needs an adventurer he can trust.

An old comrade of Wyrnzoen's, now in the employ of Master Gegeruju of Costa del Sol, has sent an urgent call for reinforcements, and the axemaster believes you to be the only marauder up to the task. Travel to Costa del Sol and rendezvous with your guildmate Solkwyb.

Solkwyb explains that Costa del Sol has been beset by a fearsome horde of turtles, and that the creatures seem to be originating from the northern shore. Investigate any possible cause of the beasts' burgeoning numbers.

With the assistance of a formidable Roegadyn calling himself Curious Gorge, you have driven back the turtle horde that appeared to have been summoned forth by a suspicious figure. Speak to your guildmate Solkwyb, who appears unnerved by what she has seen.

Solkwyb suspects that Curious Gorge's true identity is that of a gifted young marauder who disappeared when the Company of Heroes was disbanded. Should you wish to train in the lost art of the warrior, seek out Curious Gorge at Hidden Falls.

Duly impressed by your strength, Curious Gorge presents you with the Soul of the Warrior. When your inner beast awakens, he explains, the runes will resonate, granting you such strength as you never thought possible. Hone your skills until such time as Curious Gorge can decipher the chronicles of his ancestors that he carries with him, and thereby continue your training.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Speak with Solkwyb in Costa del Sol.
Investigate the northern shore.
Speak with Solkwyb.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Fend off the crazed archelons!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Just the womanman I was hoping to see. Aye, it's plain as day that you've no equal in our guild, and I've a task that I'd entrust to no ordinary marauder.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: To wit: I just received a message from an old comrade-in-arms of mine who now serves as a guardsman in Costa del Sol. It would seem the fighting's grown fierce in those parts, and he finds himself in dire need of reinforcements.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Mind you, this man is no white-livered whelp. He can wield an axe with the best of them, as evidenced by Master Gegeruju's paying good coin for the services of he and his men. No, any enemy who could fluster that bunch is not one to be trifled with.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: I've sent Solkwyb on ahead to tend to the wounded. Seek her out upon your arrival and she'll apprise you of the situation at hand.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Forename! Ever the sight for sore eyes. A nasty bale of turtles has been preying on this area of late, snapping and gnashing at everything in sight. Why, even the best men that Master Gegeruju could buy find themselves no match for the creatures.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Word has it that the beasts have been sighted swimming in from the lightly guarded northern shore. I would send you there to investigate the cause behind their burgeoning numbers.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Ugh, damn it all! Forename, we must see to these beasts!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Seven hells, there's no end to them! Prepare to fall back!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: (-???-)I'll see to the shellbacks! You whelps just try not to end up as turtle grub!

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: That axe! I've not seen its like in...

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Forename! We must do what we can!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: That should send 'em scuttling back to their nests. You can call me Curious Gorge─one remark about the name and I'll rip yer ugly heads from your shoulders and suck the marrow out of your twitching spines. You two are guards from Costa del Sol, I reckon?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: Not as such. We are of the Marauders' Guild, sent here by Axemaster Wyrnzoen to assist in the defense. I am Solkwyb, and this is my comrade Forename.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: From the guild, you say? Well, blow me down and call me a bogy! Had you told me sooner, I'd have introduced myself with proper respect.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You're Forename, right? We've only just met, but I see in you a strength not found in ordinary womenmen. What say you unleash the beast within and become a warrior with me?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: A warrior, you say!? So it was you I saw, brandishing battle techniques I had thought lost to the sands of time...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Lost? Gahaha! Perhaps in these parts. But where I come from, the way of the warrior is alive and well! My tribe has been handing them down for thousands of years.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Yet our numbers dwindle with every new summer, and this is why I left the mountain where I was raised to come here. What say you, Forename? If you would walk the path of the warrior with me, seek me out at Hidden Falls.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: The warriors of old... We have all heard the tales, but never once did I dream that I would meet one in the flesh.

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: My memory is cloudy, but many years ago, it was said there was a young marauder in the Company of Heroes who would unleash crushing blows theretofore unseen by his comrades. When the Company disbanded, he vanished, never to be seen again─might that be this Curious Gorge?

dialogue.name: SOLKWYB
dialogue.text: I cannot vouch for the man's identity, but there can be no denying the display of strength we saw today, nor that he has taken a liking to you, Forename. This could be an opportunity for the ages. Hidden Falls, was it? Were I in your boots, I would head off there without delay.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I knew you would come, Forename. Let us begin.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Any womanman can take up an axe and call herselfhimself a marauder, but to become a true warrior, shehe must prove shehe can tame the inner beast that guides the blade.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I witnessed your battle with the turtles, and I must say that I was impressed. You have proven yourself far more worthy of this than I could have imagined.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: In your hands lies the Soul of the Warrior─a crystal within which the deeds of a thousand thousand warriors from history are recorded. For countless generations, the Soul has been passed on to those in my tribe who choose the path of the warrior, to guide them and aid them on their journey.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: When your inner beast awakens, the runes will resonate, further empowering your will, and granting you such strength as you never thought possible.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Today, there is cause for celebration, my friend! For through you, I have ensured that my tribe's legacy will endure. Yes, it is for this day, this moment, that I came down from the mountain.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Yet however earnestly I pursue my goal, I cannot deny the fear inside me that my mission will ultimately end in failure. For you see, while I style myself a warrior, the truth is that I left the mountains before my training was complete.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: And while I carry with me the chronicles of my ancestors, detailing the ancient arts of war, I lack the ability to fully decipher the texts.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Yet, there may still be hope, for there is another who fled my village─one who shared my dream of passing on the teachings of the tribe, and can read the tome... My brother.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Without him, I fear there is little more I can teach you at this time. But that will not discourage me from continuing my studies of the chronicles, nor shake my belief that further secrets will soon reveal themselves to me.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Until then, I ask that you use the knowledge I've passed on to you, and continue your training. You must strive to harden your will so that it may endure the strain of future burdens. Good luck, my friend.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
My battle ends here...
Forgive me, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

quest.name: 壁をぶち壊せ
journal: Curious Gorge is struggling to decipher the ancient texts.

Curious Gorge has been unable to glean much wisdom from the ancient tome, but would proceed with your training nonetheless. He has tasked you with the slaying of a giant sandworm rumored to reside in the Sagolii Desert. Stop off at Forgotten Springs and ask the inhabitants there if they have seen the creature.

According to the residents of Forgotten Springs, the sandworm you seek was last seen preying on a band of unfortunate merchants in the Sagolii Desert. Seek out an area that shows vestiges of a massacre and fell the immense beast.
The sandworm is no more. Return to Hidden Falls and inform Curious Gorge that you have completed your trial.

In the course of your battle with the sandworm, your inner beast has awakened further, imparting to you yet another technique of your forebears. Master the newfound skill at your disposal, that you will be prepared to continue your training once your mentor has deciphered the ancient texts.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Speak with residents of Forgotten Springs.
Slay the giant sandworm in the Sagolii Desert.
Report to Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, my friend. I can see that you've not neglected your training. For my part, I fear that deciphering the ancient chronicles of my people is proving to be a much more demanding task than I had imagined.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Mind you, it hasn't helped that I've been somewhat preoccupied of late. A comrade of mine from my days in the Company of Heroes asked me to do a favor, and it's taken me back and forth across the realm like some bloody ferry.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I'm on a hunt for some mysterious feral beast that's been terrorizing smallfolk. People don't know where this monstrosity came from, but witnesses say its thirst for blood is unlike anything they've ever seen.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the time I have spent in pursuit of the beast is time I have not spent studying the chronicles, and I am sorry to say I have made little progress.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: However, while on the road, I was able to decipher one passage that may be of interest to us both. From what I can gather, the chronicles tell of an ancient set of armor forged by my ancestors in the flames of the seven hells, and inscribed with the same arcane incantations that adorn the Soul of the Warrior.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It would seem that this mighty armor was passed down from hero to apprentice for centuries, until one man, driven by rage and vainglory, cast all five pieces from Abalathia's highest peak. Since that day, the armor has remained lost...and with it, the power that it harbors.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: As far as I can make out, the next passage in the chronicles concerns the whereabouts of these missing artifacts...though I have only been able to make sense of the odd word thus far. Still, I must confess to some excitement. Imagine what a warrior clad in such garb could achieve!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, if only my brother were here... We could decipher the text together and spread the teachings of our people to the entire realm!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Alas, he is not. His whereabouts are as hidden to me as those of the ancient armor. I would have liked you to meet him...if only so that you could have looked upon a true warrior.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Well, perhaps you still shall. Eorzea is not as large as most people perceive. Paths cross, fates intertwine. Such is the will of the Spinner. It may be that my brother has chosen a similar path to mine... But I have rambled long enough. You are here to take the next step in your training, and so I shall oblige.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: In the southern reaches of Thanalan is the Sagolii Desert, a godsforsaken wasteland of naught but sand that stretches as far as the eye can see. It is here that the leviathan of the dunes lurks─a sandworm of gargantuan proportions.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: When facing this mammoth creature, you will soon realize that the feeble hacks and slashes of your puny axe are ill-suited to the task of felling such a foe...but do not let this dissuade you. Wake the slumbering beast within and summon forth a strength that transcends the limits of your physical form.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Mind you, first you'll have to find the beast, and that might prove a tall order in itself. The U tribe that inhabits Forgotten Springs is wise to the movements of the denizens of the desert. Should you want for guidance, I'd wager they could set you in the right direction.

dialogue.name: URALKA
dialogue.text: Aye, I've seen the beast. Stands three malms high, he does, and stirs up sandstorms with each writhe and wriggle. Showed up in my hunting fields some years ago, and has been swallowing up my would-be prey in that gaping maw of his ever since.

dialogue.name: UGOROMULI
dialogue.text: The leviathan of the dunes? Saw the fearsome bugger not a week ago, preying on a group of merchants south of Byregot's Strike. The smart ones dropped their wares, turned tail, and ran. The dumb ones, well, at least they can say they died rich.

dialogue.name: UKHUBATIA
dialogue.text: Sandworms are particularly sensitive to vibrations in the earth, such as those made by running. If you're looking to summon one of the beasts, then I suggest you search for their tracks, then run about making as much of a clamor as possible. I would also suggest you seek a cure for your madness.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Your crystal grows ever stronger. In felling the raging sandworm, the beast within you slowly but surely rouses to wakefulness.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: When next you do battle, methinks you will find yourself capable of movements heretofore unfamiliar to you. When you have mastered your new talents, return to me. In the meanwhile, I shall continue my study of the ancient texts.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 原初のマグマ
journal: Curious Gorge would share with you a shocking revelation about his tribe's past.

Curious Gorge has revealed to you his tribe's tragic history. It turns out that his ancestors came to be shunned when the people they would protect came to view the warriors themselves as beasts more savage than the fiends they would slay. Vowing to win back his tribe's good name by his own hand, Curious Gorge asks you to assist him in the defense of the village of Wineport. Travel there and receive a briefing from the militia captain.
Curious Gorge will lead the defense at the west gate, while you have been tasked with defending the east. Keep lookout and let not a single fiend into the village!
The fiends have been driven off and the east gate secured. Report to the militia captain.

Despite his efforts on the village's behalf, Curious Gorge received not a hero's welcome, but a reception worthy of the most terrible of monsters. Might the captain have some insight into the source of the people's fear?

The militia captain expresses his gratitude for your efforts and assures you that he will clear up the villagers' misunderstanding regarding Curious Gorge. Return to Hidden Falls and reunite with your mentor.

Having regained his composure, Curious Gorge theorizes that a misunderstanding like unto that which arose at Wineport might be at the root of his tribe's disgrace. He would ask you to continue training while he continues to scour the ancient words for further insight.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Speak with the militia captain in Wineport.
Defend the eastern gate from attackers.
Report to the militia captain.
Consult with the militia captain.
Speak with Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text:
Hello again, my friend. It is quite obvious that you have been anything but idle in your training since last we met. Your progress is heartening to look upon, truly...but it also serves to remind me that each hour I spend poring over ancient texts is an hour not spent honing my skills.
I fear my worth on the battlefield is diminishing by the day.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Yet I am certain that my studies of the chronicles will yield something of use. In fact, just last night, I discovered how the warriors of my tribe came to be shunned by the outside world.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Upon witnessing my people's prowess with the axe, the armies of the city–states began to incorporate similar techniques into their own training regimens. These are the selfsame techniques I have been instructing you in, Forename─ones which call upon the inner beast.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The consequences, of course, were dire. Yes, their soldiers became nigh on unstoppable, but they also became wholly uncontrollable...and both friend and foe fell prey to the ensuing carnage. Of course, the heads of the city–states laid the blame for these atrocities solely at the feet of my kind, promptly banning the ancient art and imprisoning anyone suspected of teaching it. Or so the chronicles say...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What I find hard to grasp, though, is that never once during my training did my brother hint at this dark history. Nor have I myself ever seen one of my tribe succumb to the rage that the chronicles describe.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Could it be that the tales are mere falsehoods? Stories concocted by some long-forgotten enemy who would poison our heritage and befoul our tribe's name? Who in their right mind would seek to sully something so pure...and why would my ancestors simply bow their heads and suffer such ignominy!?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: That my people should be so weak─so utterly bereft of pride─is inexplicable. I refuse to believe it!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It matters not if these claims are groundless─if they prompted my tribe's art to fade into obscurity, then the damage has already been done. Well, I for one will not turn a blind eye to this injustice! If none of my people will give the lie to the stories that have so tarnished our reputation, it shall have to be me!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, but once again I lose myself in history and forget the present. If you recall, I spoke to you of my former comrade from the Company of Heroes, and the great wooly beast we have been pursuing.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The beast remains on the loose, and to toss a ponze of salt on the wound, fell creatures that appear to be its minions have been wreaking havoc on the innocent residents of Wineport.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Were you and I to succeed in quelling the threat, surely the people would see that warriors are no fearsome beasts, but valuable allies. Together, Forename, we will win back our proud name! Now, let us away to Wineport to meet with the captain of the militia!

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: My friends. Wineport is much obliged for your aid. The fiends come relentlessly, and what few able-bodied men we have find themselves hopelessly overmatched. Indeed, the western gates have been so besieged that they are currently left without any manned defense.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Leave the defense to us, my good man! I will secure the western gate.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, you defend the town from the east. Together, we will form a bulwark that not a single fiend can penetrate!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Once the enemy has been driven back, we return here to back up the captain. Got it, Forename?

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Forename, was it? I will stand guard here. You head north and cut the monsters off at the pass.

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Thank the Twelve you're safe! We have need of your skills yet. I just heard a scream, and I fear that one of the beasts might be loose within the village. Come with me!

dialogue.name: SARRA
dialogue.text: You monster! Get away! Get away!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: M-Monster...? But I... I...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Come no closer, Forename!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I...beg of you...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I... I must return to the Falls.

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Whatever has gotten into Curious Gorge?

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: 'Tis true that he fought like a man possessed, but to mistake him for the very beast he hunts─methinks the child's parents have been feeding her a few too many ghost stories for her own good.

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Worry not, friend. I shall speak to the villagers and clear up this most unfortunate misunderstanding. Do return to the Falls and assure Curious Gorge that Wineport is indebted to him for his aid.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename... Please forgive me for leaving so abruptly earlier.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It was a hasty reaction to a situation for which I was completely unprepared.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: While both you and I know that I was in complete control of my inner beast, I now realize that to the layman's eye, it may have seemed that...well, the opposite was true.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Mayhap it was this very misapprehension that lent weight to the lies which led to my tribe's disgrace. And if that is the case, then perhaps I should return once more to the chronicles, and endeavor to reassess their message in light of this discovery.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Speaking of light... Your soul crystal, Forename...it sparkles.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text:
Does the Soul of the Warrior have aught to reveal to you?
Any whispers of...of import?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: <sigh> If only they hadn't forsaken me, as they did my brother...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ahem! Yes, well, I suppose that is that. I must continue my studies, and you your training. I hope to have something new for both of us very soon. Until then, my friend.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
The warriors of ages past have borne witness to your stone-like tenacity.
They now grant you their undying strength!

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

obj.n: ワインポートの自警団長
ワインポートの自警団長
ワインポートの自警団長

quest.name: 英雄巡礼
journal: Curious Gorge would send you searching for ancient relics.

From his continued study of the ancient texts, Curious Gorge has ascertained the final resting places of three pieces of his ancestors' lost armor. Travel to Boulder Downs in Coerthas, Camp Tranquil in the South Shroud, and Parata's Peace in western Thanalan to unearth the relics.
You have gathered three pieces of the lost armor of Curious Gorge's tribe. Return to Hidden Falls and speak with your mentor.
Curious Gorge would see you don the relics you have obtained. Equip the armor and speak with your mentor once more.

Curious Gorge is most impressed after seeing the armor upon you. He tells you that he also found one of the remaining two pieces, but the warrior is unsure of its legitimacy. While he attempts to reason out what is wrong, you should continue your search for the next relic, which he believes to be sealed away at Red Mantis Falls.
You have indeed found a fourth relic at Red Mantis Falls, just as Curious Gorge surmised. Return to Hidden Falls and inform your mentor.

Having done further research with the ancient texts, Curious Gorge now understands why the relic he found did not respond to him. The events at Wineport drained his soul crystal of its vibrance, causing the armor to deny him its powers, lest his soul in its weakened state be devoured. Your mentor, having feared such a possibility, left the breastplate where it lay. While he has more confidence in your ability to control it, he would make certain you are prepared before seeking it yourself. When you feel you are ready, speak with him again.
objectives: Find the relic armor at Boulder Downs.
Find the relic armor at Camp Tranquil.
Find the relic armor at Parata's Peace.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Equip the warrior's armor and speak with Curious Gorge.
Obtain the relic armor.
Speak with Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Welcome again, my friend. I was wondering when your travels would bring you back this way. It just so happens that I have some exciting news.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I have finally uncovered the clues pertaining to the whereabouts of the lost armor of my ancestors! As it turns out, after the fallen hero cast the five pieces from the mountaintop, five of his pupils set out to recover them, intending to restore their master's name.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What is more, they were actually successful in this search. However, when it came to reuniting the set, the armor's great power began to work upon their minds, and not one could bring himself to relinquish his piece.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text:
Realizing then that their master's fatal pride was born of the artifacts' combined influence, the pupils resolved to keep the pieces separate, and to share between five the power that might otherwise have consumed one. Thus did each of them carve his own place in history.
The chronicles go on to say that years later, prior to death, each of the pupils returned to the scene of his own greatest victory, and buried the artifact in his possession in a final attempt to prevent any one warrior from holding the set. And it is there that the pieces still rest.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You may be interested to know that the armor I wear is itself a replica of the set crafted by my ancestors─identical in all respects save for its lack of the arcane enchantments that adorned the original.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text:
I know what you might be thinking: if we were to bring the five pieces together once more, what would prevent us from being corrupted in the same fashion? Well, I've thought of that! What we need only do is trace the runes we find on the armor onto every piece of warrior gear!
That way, there would be no need to worry about a single proud fool becoming drunk on his all-surpassing power, as every warrior in the realm would be possessed of the selfsame might!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It's quite brilliant, if I do say so myself. So, how about we split up and begin the search straightaway? Three of the locations seem quite self-evident─I would entrust the search there to you while I track down the other two with tome in hand.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: One piece is said to be buried under the great rocks of Boulder Downs in Coerthas, while another slumbers peacefully at Camp Tranquil in the South Shroud. The last of the three rests untouched at Parata's Peace in western Thanalan.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Unearth those three relics, and bring them to me. With any measure of fortune, I'll have tracked down the remaining two by the time of your return.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: How fares your search, Forename? Have you found aught of my tribe's ancient relics? Should you have the three pieces of armor, don them and show them to me.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. That you found the gear is most gratifying, but what I would truly fancy would be to see you in it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Equip yourself with the three pieces of armor before speaking with Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In the event that you have lost one or more of these items, you can return to where you obtained them and acquire them anew.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Wait...stand still for a moment. The armor so becomes you that I could not tell you had it on at first glance. But now I can have no doubt─I sense the power of the runes inscribed on each piece resonating with your soul crystal. This is the long-lost armor of the warrior.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I, too, have found one of the relics, but I have run into an unexpected rub. When I donned the piece, I felt nothing─as if the lost treasure were no different from the unadorned replicas already in my possession.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Whether the power has been lost to it, or must needs be awakened by means yet unknown to me, this I cannot say. The ancient texts still hold many mysteries beyond my ability to decipher...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But before I forget, I should mention to you that I did indeed track down another piece before I was waylaid by this current conundrum. You should find it sealed away at Red Mantis Falls.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I see your search was a fruitful one. I am pleased to say I have also gleaned some insight into why the armor I found seemed devoid of power.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: As I alluded to, the ancient warrior's armor derives its power from a concordance between the incantations engraved on the steel itself, and the inner beast of the wearer.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But my own resonance with the plating was too weak as to allow a proper connection with it...and now I think I know why: my soul crystal. It once burned bright like yours, but since the events at Wineport, it has been reduced to a lifeless husk.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Why this happened, I cannot say. But the tome is quite clear about what would happen were the powers of the armor to be bestowed upon one whose soul is weak. The inner beast would devour the mind of the wearer, who would go on a mindless rampage that would end only with the mercy of death.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Yes, not unlike the crazed fiends we battle.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I believe that the armor sensed my weakened state, foresaw the potential danger, and then knowingly shut off its powers to me... And I daresay we are fortunate that it did.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text:
I feel as though an apology is in order at this juncture─I must tell you I left this final piece of the armor where I found it. The breastplate, as the piece closest to the warrior's heart, has powers far greater and more dangerous than the other pieces.
Uncertain as I was to the reason for my being unable to connect with the plate's mystical energy, I feared to take it would mean imperiling both myself and those around me.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Your soul may burn stronger than mine, yet still I worry for your fate were you to put it on. Look deep within yourself, Forename. When you feel yourself ready─and only then─come speak to me again.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!

obj.n: ファイターガントレット
ファイタージャックブーツ
ファイターバーゴネット

quest.name: 腕くらべ
journal: Curious Gorge would share with you the location of the final piece of relic armor.

Despite his misgivings about your ability to fully control its power, Curious Gorge shares with you the location of the final piece of his ancestors' lost armor. Seek it out in the waters of the Weeping Saint in the central highlands of Coerthas. Curious Gorge, recent experiences still weighing heavily on his heart, will stay behind.

No sooner had you taken the armor into hand than did Curious Gorge appear to claim it from you with nary a word of explanation. What has brought about this change of heart from your mentor? Return to Hidden Falls to seek an explanation.

Curious Gorge offers his apology for his actions, explaining that he cannot trust you, himself, or anyone to wear the armor until the would-be wearer's strength is demonstrated beyond a shadow of a doubt. He bids you to return to your training while he studies the texts to see how such strength might be proven.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Search for the relic armor at the Weeping Saint.
Speak with Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You would truly seek the ultimate relic of my people? The armor that could consume the very soul of the most puissant warrior? Very well, if you are truly convinced of your readiness, I will not be the one to stand in your way.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But I beg of you, Forename─the moment you feel yourself losing control, and your inner beast overcoming you, cast the armor aside. Cast it from the highest mountain or into the depths of the ocean, I care not.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: For once the beast consumes your soul, there is no going back. You will rage on, a monster, leaving naught but carnage in your wake. The realm will bleed, and history will repeat itself. I cannot allow this to happen.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: No, my people have been shunned long enough. I would see the coming of a new age, in which warriors protect the weak and are loved and admired by the people of the realm. My years of battle and sleepless nights spent poring over the ancient texts─all has been for this day!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Brother... I know not where fate has led you. And yet I feel certain that, in spirit, you stand with me today. Together, we will restore the honor of our people.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...You must forgive my sentiment, Forename. As I said, this has been a long time coming. The breastplate you seek is in the highlands of Coerthas, at the spring they call the Weeping Saint. I...will stay behind. The events at Wineport still weigh heavy on my heart.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Hand over the breastplate, Forename. After much wrestling with the thought, I simply cannot entrust such a relic to an outsider who may be overwhelmed by its power.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I return now to Hidden Falls. If you would have words with me, then come. I will not run away.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename, I am sorry. I did not mean for things to happen like this, but I had no choice.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I have wrestled long and hard with the matter, but this is my decision. I cannot trust you with this power when I do not even trust myself.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Aye, that's right: I won't attempt to don the plate again, either─nor will anyone. Not until I have proof that there is one with a will strong enough to withstand the beast's siren call.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Peer deep within your soul, Forename. Peer into the eyes of the beast that stares back at you. Can you truly say that you can engage the monster in battle and emerge victorious?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I shall return to the tome. If there are any answers to be found, they lie within those pages. In the meantime, continue your training, that you might find an answer of your own.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!

quest.name: いちばんの戦士
journal: Curious Gorge has received an urgent distress call.
The village of Wineport is under attack once more, this time by the vicious beast that Curious Gorge had been tracking. Hasten to the village and receive a briefing from the captain of the militia.

After the captain finishes telling you the situation, you immediately begin your defense of the hamlet from the invading fiends. Though you make short work of the crazed beasts, you are given little time to celebrate, as you hear further sounds of trouble within Wineport. Heading in, you are unexpectedly challenged by Curious Gorge, whom you are then forced to defeat. Thankfully, your blows knocked the sense back into him, and he has realized the folly of his ways. With the fighting at an end, speak with the militia captain before taking your leave.

The militia captain expresses his thanks for your aid, and assures you that the people of Wineport bear no ill will against Curious Gorge. Rather, they have a newfound respect for warriors and would ask for his continued protection. Return to your mentor and tell him that all has ended well.

Curious Gorge is deeply repentant for his misdeeds, and resolves to devote himself anew to the way of the warrior. His soul crystal shining once more, he vows to never again allow anger or thirst for power to cause him to lose sight of who he is. Recognizing you as the worthy successor of his ancestors and a truer warrior than he could ever be, he entrusts to you the final piece of his ancestors' armor, urging you to go forth and do his people proud.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Speak with the Wineport militia captain.
Speak with the militia captain.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Defend Wineport from the fiends!
Defeat Curious Gorge!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename! There is much we must discuss, but now is not the time!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You surely recall my mention of the hunt for the bloodthirsty creature terrorizing the smallfolk. I've just received word that selfsame monster has been sighted near Wineport!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What is more, according to those who managed to escape the carnage, the creature appeared more man than beast.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: If this is true, then our quarry could be far more dangerous than any wild animal. We must find a way to stop it... I must find a way.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: This is my chance! To prove to the people of Wineport─nay, the world─that my tribe and my art have been wrongly judged!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Perhaps then my ancestors will deem me worthy! I think even my brother would, too!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: There is no time to lose. We must arrive in the hamlet before any of the villagers fall prey to the beast. Let us leave at once!

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Thank the gods for your presence! Wineport is in your debt once more.

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Fell creatures bear down upon our village in hordes, as if drawn by that great hairy beast. You must stop them!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename! You fend off these creatures!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I will see to the beast. This is my battle to fight.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA
dialogue.text: (-Panicked Villager-)It's the m-monster!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB
dialogue.text: (-Fleeing Villager-)It's the beast! Run for your lives!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Stop! These people are not your enemy! The enemy lies within!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You are stronger than this! Take control of the beast! Do not let it consume you!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Brother!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Look what you are doing! You are destroying all that I worked to restore! The fate of our people rests in our hands, brother! Your weakness would cost us everything!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I cannot let that happen! I will not! Our ancestors have chosen me to lead our people to glory...and no one shall stop me!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: No one... No one... No one...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It was I who unlocked the secrets of the chronicles; I who trained you in their ways; I who uncovered the locations of the legendary artifacts...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text:
...I who defeated my tribe's greatest warrior! I am the master now!
I am the master! Return to me what is rightfully mine!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Give me the armor!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Or I shall tear it from your bloody corpse!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I have failed...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I failed you, I failed my people, I failed my ancestors...and I failed my own kin...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I found out long ago what had become of my brother, but did everything I could to deny it.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I thought that if only I could prove myself stronger than he, the people would see his madness as the product of a weak mind... That they would believe the problem lay in him, not in our tribe.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Yet, all the while, my own soul was growing weaker and weaker... The inner beast had taken hold, and it would not let go. It drove me, as it drove my ancestors, the keeper of the armor, and my brother.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Our tribe had lost sight of who we were. In seeking ever more strength, we allowed ourselves to fall victim to that which we had long scorned in others as weakness. Instead of learning to harden our wills with resolve, we steeled them with anger─and therein lay our folly.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Like a bonfire, anger burns hot and bright, but when the fuel that feeds it is spent, all that remains is ash. By accepting anger as our guide, we left our wills at the mercy of the inner beast.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But not you. Your will is more akin to the lava which courses through the mountains of my homeland. It burns as strong─nay, stronger─than any bonfire, and when it cools, it becomes hard and firm, unbreakable. This quality allowed you to keep your inner beast at bay.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: My people were once as you are now, Forename...and I believe that is why my ancestors chose to speak to you.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: They sensed true strength within you. Such strength as could rightly represent our people and our art.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Had I but realized that myself...none of this need have happened. <sigh> Well, what's done is done. If I am to have any hope of restoring my people's name, I must start over from the beginning...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...And this time, I mustn't try to do it alone.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It may take time, but together, my brother and I will restore our village to its former glory. And when we have, I shall remember Forename, my friend and fellow warrior, and how shehe saved me from myself, that my dream might become reality.

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Wineport is in your debt once more, Forename. And what is more, we have seen the truth with our own eyes.

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Pray tell Curious Gorge as much, and that we will be relying on him for his protection. He is a true warrior, and our humble hamlet would be lost without his strength.

dialogue.name: LAEDER
dialogue.text: Tell Curious Gorge that the people of Wineport have seen the truth, and are indebted to him for his protection. He is a true warrior, and our humble hamlet would be lost without his strength.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Hm? Despite all that transpired, the captain at Wineport would entrust his village's defenses to me? I... I know not what to say.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It has been a long road, but thanks to you, I have rediscovered what I lost so many years ago. I will see to my brother's wounds, and once he is well, we will embark on the path of the warrior again─engraving the lessons we have learned in our souls, never to be forgotten.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Curiously, the moment I did avow this to myself, my soul crystal began to shimmer anew. I see yours, too, grows stronger than ever. It would seem my ancestors have once more bestowed their knowledge upon you.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: This... This power. Why, this is a power that I have only read about in the tomes─nay, a power entirely beyond my comprehension.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: To think that I once doubted your resolve. No, you have truly conquered your inner beast, and become a truer warrior than I could ever hope to be.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Know that you stand before me the equal of my tribe's greatest heroes. Ever steel your resolve, Forename, and go forth into the realm and protect those who need your strength. With you representing us, the redemption of my people─the new era I seek─is surely close at hand.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the warrior quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Urgh! Who heals...the healers?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Wineport... I have failed you...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Your strength is no match for mine, Forename!
I am the true warrior!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Graaaghhh! The beast rages within me!
I can fight it no longer!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Gaaarrrghhh! Forename!
You must...stop me!

obj.n: ワインポートの自警団長
ワインポートの自警団長
ファイターキュイラス
蘇る古の武器（ブラビューラ）

quest.name: 自由騎士の誓約
journal: Lulutsu wishes to share with you some exciting news.

Lulutsu of the Coliseum has given you some interesting news. For the first time in their history, the elite of the Sultansworn are prepared to teach the secret arts of the paladin to outsiders. If you wish to learn these skills, seek out the captain of the Sultansworn elite. His name is Jenlyns, and he can be found near the Royal Promenade, in Ul'dah's Hustings Strip.

You have spoken to Jenlyns, captain of the Sultansworn. He is prepared to teach you the paladin skills, but only after you have proven yourself worthy. To that end, he tells you to travel to the ruins south of Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan, light the brazier within, and face the undead monsters drawn to the flame.
The foul abominations are no more. Feed their hearts to the flame so that you might obtain proof of your triumph.

As you complete the trial, you are approached by a free paladin. He hands you a strange crystal and asks that you give it to Captain Jenlyns. Report back to Jenlyns at his station near the Royal Promenade, in Ul'dah's Hustings Strip.

Jenlyns teaches you the basics of the paladin arts, and bequeaths to you the Soul of the Paladin. However, you observe that it bears a striking resemblance to the crystal given to you by the free paladin at the ruins. Show the crystal to Jenlyns and see what he has to say.

Jenlyns is enraged to learn that the crystal you bore was indeed another Soul of the Paladin. He explains that the free paladin you met is a traitor and a thief, and asks that you assist the Sultansworn in bringing the oathbreaker to justice. Your path now clear, you resolve to hone your skills until the time comes.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Speak with Jenlyns on the Hustings Strip.
Light the brazier and slay the undead drawn to the flame.
Feed the ashkin hearts to the flame.
Present the ashkin remains to Jenlyns.
Give the engraved crystal to Jenlyns.

dialogue.name: LULUTSU
dialogue.text: Oh, there you are, Forename. Perfect timing! I've just heard a juicy bit of gossip that I know you're going to be interested in...

dialogue.name: LULUTSU
dialogue.text: Apparently─and remember, you heard this first from me─the Sultansworn elite are sharing the secret skills and training of paladins! Incredible, I know.

dialogue.name: LULUTSU
dialogue.text: The Sultansworn have an exclusive monopoly on the instruction of paladin skills. Once upon a time, if you weren't one of those officer-track elites, then you had no chance to learn the arts. And competition to get to the top was very fierce indeed, let me tell you.

dialogue.name: LULUTSU
dialogue.text: But anyone who joined had to swear an oath of fealty to the Ul'dahn sultanate. Which meant no more adventuring, no more derring-do, and no more Coliseum─just languishing about in the palace all day polishing plate mail.

dialogue.name: LULUTSU
dialogue.text: That's why this news is so big. Now anyone with a bit of commitment can learn the skills of a paladin, and no memorizing the Fifty-Five Commandments of the Sworn or any other nonsense, either.

dialogue.name: LULUTSU
dialogue.text: This is a golden─no, a platinum opportunity that comes but once in a lucky adventurer's lifetime. Let this slip through your fingers and regret will be your just deserts.

dialogue.name: LULUTSU
dialogue.text: You need to go to the Royal Promenade in the Hustings Strip. Find the captain of the Sultansworn elite─Jenlyns is his name─and tell him how you're just dying to become a paladin.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Yes, I am Jenlyns, member of the Sultansworn elite and servant to the Ul'dahn sultanate. Unless my instincts deceive me, you have come to inquire about training as a paladin. If so, I would have your name, good womansir.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: ...Forename? A fine name. I bid you welcome, and salute your noble resolve. But if you aspire to paladinhood, you should understand what it means.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: A paladin swears allegiance to the sultanate. A paladin shall be the sword and shield of the sultanate. A paladin defends the people of the realm.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Sellswords and gladiators and others of their ilk wield their blades for themselves, but a paladin serves the greater good. Do you understand me?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The battle arts that the paladin learns have been held secret, nurtured, and perfected within the ranks of the Sultansworn elite for nigh on these six hundred years.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Of all those sworn to protect the sultanate─the soldiers, the mounted guards, and the knights─we are the elite of the elite. Our conviction unwavering, our hearts true, our sword skills without peer.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But the glory of the Sultansworn... Well, much of it is buried in the past now. Our brotherhood grows smaller by the year, we are a shadow of what we once were, and the sultana turns to sellswords to defend her palace.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: All this, because of one traitor─no, because of a blot of dishonor left by one who shall not be named... And because of him, we have been forced to seek the help of able-bodied adventurers.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: And here you are. We shall instruct you in the paladin military arts. You will not be inducted into the Sultansworn, but serve as a free paladin.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
