dialogue.text: However, first you will show us that both your sword and heart have mettle, and you are worthy of the honor.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: In the ruins to the south of Little Ala Mhigo, you will find an iron brazier. Light it, and the undead nearby will be drawn to the flame. Slay these monsters and give their hearts to the fire. Return and present to me their ashes as proof of your deed.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Now, would-be paladin, show me the mettle in your heart and steel in your blade!

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: (-???-)If you are in this place, searching for the undead, then you must be a petitioner seeking the secrets of the paladin arts.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: (-???-)But make no mistake. Simply learning paladin swordplay does not make you a paladin─nor does the armor you wear, or the status you claim.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: (-???-)I am just another aging free paladin, but you would do well to heed my counsel. Strike off the shackles that bind your spirit, lift the visor that blinds, and find the true path of the paladin.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: (-???-)Here, you will be returning to the captain, yes? Then give him this crystal.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: (-???-)The way you use that sword reminds me of a man I used to know...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: (-???-)Mine eyes may be old, but they can see the truth well enough. Be a paladin strong and true. Devote yourself to the way and become a beacon of light.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Face the undead monsters who infest the ruins south of Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan. Defeat them and return with proof of your deed.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Yes, that's what I needed. Proof that you have defeated the undead. You have shown that your heart is true and your sword has mettle.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I've no doubt that you will prove to be an attentive pupil. That is well, for there is much to learn. First and foremost is this: you are a paladin now─a custodian of traditions ancient and noble.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: A free paladin has no master. Instead shehe travels all lands, and in every place takes up the cause of the unarmed and defenseless. You swear fealty not to a lord, but to yourself─you are nobility amongst adventurers.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You have taken your first steps on a new path, and you have earned the right to bear this, the Soul of the Paladin. Upon its surface are carved the deeds of paladins of eras past. SheHe who bears it commands the respect of all knights of honor.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Bahamut's fang! You already possess a crystal? And you say it was given to you by an unknown free paladin, who told you to hand it to me?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Where is this crystal of which you speak? I demand you show it to me at once!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Curse him, he has made a mockery of the trial. That crystal you bear is indeed the Soul of the Paladin. But it is disgraced, impure. It was stolen from the Sultansworn.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The man who gave you this soul is the very traitor whom I have been seeking these many moons.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: He is an oathbreaker who bent the knee to the Ul'dahn sultanate and who swore allegiance to the Sultansworn, but then single-handedly sullied our name, and trampled it underfoot until it was lost, perhaps forever. How dare he give counsel on honor, on the paladin way!?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: This soul is polluted, and I must dispose of it. When you come to wield your sword as a paladin, the only soul you may wear is that which is bestowed by a captain of the Sultansworn.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: That traitor is no Sultansworn, still less a captain. By giving you a soul, he insulted not only the brotherhood, but you, too.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Perhaps an adventurer like yourself finds our rules nothing more than a nuisance. But through reigns long and short, our forebears in the Sultansworn have preserved its rituals and traditions, and we are duty-bound to uphold them─even if men and women within our own ranks scorn them as relics.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: It has been my fate to be named captain of the Sultansworn in these troubled times. Though I did not ask for this honor, I have bent my knee to the sultana and sworn fealty, and I will fight to restore our honor and name.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You wield a skilled blade, and more importantly, you have met the traitor face-to-face. Your great task as a paladin will be to help me bring him to justice.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You must ready yourself, marshal your resources, and hone your skills until the time comes when you are able to discharge your duty. The journey will be long, but you are a paladin now, and honor binds you as surely as an oath.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: The moans of the undead grow louder...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

obj.n: 剣術士ギルド受付 ルルツ
スピリッツウィズイン

quest.name: 慕いし背中
journal: Captain Jenlyns wishes to teach you more of the paladin arts.

Jenlyns tells you that the elite of the Sultansworn have lost the respect that their good name once commanded, and the main reason is the theft of the sword Oathkeeper by a traitor. Jenlyns is hoping that your skills in battle will help him recover the sword, which has been passed down through generations of Sultansworn captains. To that end, he pledges to teach you more paladin skills and assigns a new task. You are to journey to outer La Noscea and defeat a host of leaping ringtails in order to further hone your skills.
Guided by the souls of paladins past, you have mastered new battle skills. Return to Ul'dah's Hustings Strip and report to Jenlyns.

Jenlyns declares that you have taken the skills he taught you and made them your own. Though he still has no word of where the traitor free paladin is hiding, he will inform you the moment he does.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Light the brazier and slay the leaping ringtails drawn to the incense.
Report to Jenlyns.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You have earned the right to call yourself a paladin. But how do others treat you? Do they recognize you for what you are?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Remember that fancy swordplay and well-polished armor do not make you a paladin. You must be just in your heart and strive always to be an exemplar of true virtue.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Once, not so long ago, the Sultansworn could walk the streets with their heads held high. When they marched by, the smallfolk would look upon them with reverence and gratitude. And no one was more respected than the captain. My predecessor.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: When I first saw him, I was still a child. My father had promised to take me to a local festival, but somewhere he took a wrong turn. We became lost and stumbled into a secluded back alley. Luck was not with us, because the next moment, we found ourselves in the middle of a riot. Drunken hunters were firing arrows into the crowd, and we were caught between them. There was no way out─it was only a matter of time before we would be struck...

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: That's when the captain saved us from our plight. I'd never seen a sword move so swiftly! It flashed faster than my eyes could follow, and in seconds the hunters were on the ground or fleeing for their lives. The captain was gone down the street, slicing at their heels, before my father had time to thank him. Even today, I can see the captain as he was then, blood on his sword, armor impossibly bright in the sun.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: After that, all I ever wanted to be was a paladin. I would practice endlessly with my sword, dreaming of bandits defeated and monsters slain. Even after I became one of the Sultansworn, the memory of the captain still inspired me─I was always the first to arrive in the training yard, and the last to leave.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: And so the years passed, and before I knew it, I found myself named captain of the Sultansworn. Yet the triumph was hollow, because by then, the honor of the Sultansworn elite, that very thing that had drawn me to the brotherhood, was a mere vestige, like the discarded banner of a defeated foe.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: There were many reasons for the fall, but the loss of Oathkeeper... Yes, that was the mortal blow.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The sword Oathkeeper was bestowed upon the first captain of the Sultansworn by the then sultan of Ul'dah. In time it became our standard, the symbol of the oaths we had sworn, and it was treasured by each new captain for generations. Possession was proof of Sultansworn command.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But then the unthinkable came to pass─Oathkeeper was stolen by the traitor. It shook our brotherhood to the core. How can we be trusted to protect the sultana if we cannot even hold on to the symbol of our fealty? We have been tarnished, in the eyes of ruler and ruled alike.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: If the Sultansworn are to survive, we must find the traitor and recover Oathkeeper. But...the Sultansworn have grown too weak, and we cannot do it ourselves. We've been forced to recruit outsiders to help us in our cause.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I have high hopes for you, my friend. It is a great thing that we ask, and you must learn more of our secrets if you are to succeed.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: In outer La Noscea, near the Hermit's Hovel, is a grove where ringtails congregate. Pitting yourself against a host of the beasts would be a fine way to hone the skills that I will teach you.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: In the grove you will find another brazier, this time filled with a potent incense that will drive the creatures into a frenzy. Defeat your attackers and return to me.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Well done. You have taken the skills I taught you and made them your own.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I still do not have word of where the traitor is hiding, but I will inform you the moment I do. Until then, continue your training.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: A strange odor begins to fill the air...

quest.name: 失望と怒りと責任と
journal: Captain Jenlyns has another lesson to teach you.

You learn from Jenlyns that the traitor who stole the sword Oathkeeper is named Solkzagyl, and that he was the Sultansworn captain for thirty long years. The recovery of the sword will be very difficult, and Jenlyns pledges to teach you more of the paladin arts to prepare you for the fight. For that purpose, he bids you test your might against the lepidotes dwelling within the waters of the Yugr'am River in eastern Thanalan.
Awakened by your victory, the memories of paladins past guide you to ever greater heights. Return to Ul'dah's Hustings Strip and report to Jenlyns.

Though pleased with your progress, Jenlyns reminds you that much work remains to be done before you can face the traitor Solkzagyl. As the net draws tighter, it grows ever more important that the Sultansworn be ready for when Solkzagyl is found.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Light the brazier and slay the lepidotes drawn to the flame.
Report to Jenlyns.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Welcome, paladin. You should know that word of your deeds has reached me. Few are those who follow the true paladin path without misstep, but you are one of them. I am proud to call you sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You have kept the faith, and in return, I must have faith in you. It is time that you knew the truth─though it is hard to share, for it is a shame I would rather keep hidden from outsiders.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Perhaps you remember when I told you of the traitor and the sword Oathkeeper that he stole. His name is Solkzagyl, and he was my predecessor as captain of the Sultansworn elite.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Yes, he was the same man whom I had admired as a child, who inspired me to take up the sword and follow the way of the paladin. He was the paragon of paladins─until, that is, he changed.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Some years ago now, there was a struggle for influence between the sultanate military and a faction within the Syndicate known as the Monetarists. The latter emerged triumphant, and the army's authority was diminished dramatically.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Although Solkzagyl was still captain of the Sultansworn elite, he knew his position was perilous─so he fled, taking Oathkeeper with him. In doing so, he went against the words that he had spoken on bended knee before his royal liege.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Now it falls to me, as captain, to restore the honor and name of the Sultansworn. If that means cutting down my former mentor and master, I would do it gladly, for his misdeed cannot be forgiven.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But his death will not lift the stain that mars our name. He must be put on trial, in a public court, so that everyone knows his crimes. Then, and only then, can we begin to earn the people's trust again.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: He served for over thirty years as captain of the Sultansworn elite, and he is a formidable foe─few can match his skill with the sword. Even together, you and I will find it difficult to take him alive without mortal harm to one side or the other. So you must continue to hone your skills and prepare for the day when we will face him.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: To complete the next stage of your training, you must do this: go to the Yugr'am River in eastern Thanalan and find the brazier we have placed there.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: By lighting it, you will draw the ire of the lepidotes dwelling within the waters. Face the creatures in battle and master your new skills.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The fight will not be easy, but if you take to heart what you have learned and let the crystal be your guide, you will triumph.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Good. You've mastered your new skills and made them your own.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But much work remains to be done before you can face the traitor Solkzagyl. We are close to finding him, and as our net draws tighter, it grows ever more important that we make ready for the moment when the fish must at last be landed.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: The waters around you begin to churn...

quest.name: 交わる毒心
journal: Jenlyns wishes to assign you your most daunting trial yet.

Jenlyns has uncovered archived records that point to a link between Solkzagyl and a faction within the Syndicate known as the Monetarists. While he continues his search for the missing traitor, Jenlyns assigns to you another trial. You must seek out the four pieces of the gallant armor, which have been scattered throughout southern Thanalan. The coffers containing each piece will be guarded by the Sultansworn, whom you must first defeat if you are to claim the armor.
You have crossed blades with the Sultansworn's finest and emerged triumphant. Bear word of your accomplishments back to Jenlyns at Ul'dah's Hustings Strip.

Jenlyns at last declares you ready to face Solkzagyl. While you were gone, he succeeded in making contact with the traitor, and the two of them have agreed to meet. When your preparations are complete, speak with Jenlyns to proceed to the parley.
objectives: Obtain the gallant armor.
Report to Jenlyns.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Well come, friend. I have important news for you. In my search for the traitor, I have been looking through old records─and discovered something chilling.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Around the time the traitor Solkzagyl was named captain, several famed soldiers of the Sultansworn met with untimely deaths. But strangely, our records do not say how they died.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Curious, I begged the favor of an old friend and received permission to inspect medical records kept by Frondale's Phrontistery. I discovered that the soldiers died in various ways─some in combat, some suddenly at night, in the barracks... But in nearly every case, there were signs that poison had played a role in their demise.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Yes, poison. Carefully, invisibly administered. The more I read, the more I saw the dark hand of Death's Embrace at work─assassins in the pay and service of the Monetarists. A society so secretive that few believe it truly exists.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But no matter how skilled and devious the assassins, they should not have been able to kill so many of the Sultansworn elite without being discovered. Not, that is, without help from within our own ranks.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: So I asked myself: who had the most to gain from their deaths? One by one, the former captain, his trusted aides, the most capable of the Sultansworn who might become future commanders─all of them, slain by an invisible hand. And with their deaths, the way was open for Solkzagyl to become the Sultansworn's youngest captain in a century.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The Monetarists were plotting to kill the best and bravest of the Sultansworn, to purge its ranks of greatness, and enervate it so that it could no longer carry out its duty to serve as sword and shield of the sultanate.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Which begs the question: how did Solkzagyl remain captain for thirty long years? How did he avoid the poisoner's kiss, when men better than him had succumbed? There can be only one explanation─he was the Monetarists' cat's-paw, the turncloak in our midst.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Needless to say, I am more determined to track him down than ever before. While I continue my investigation, I have a trial for you. I want you to seek the gallant armor, the legendary raiments worn by generations of the finest soldiers of the Sultansworn.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: In accordance with Sultansworn tradition, the set that would be yours has been scattered across southern Thanalan. Each piece has been locked within a coffer, which will be guarded by two men. You must best the Sultansworn themselves if you are to claim their armor.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Good, the armor is yours. You have learned your lessons well and honed your skills, and now you are ready to face Solkzagyl the traitor.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Yes, the time has come. I have discovered his hiding place, and made contact through emissaries. We are negotiating the return of Oathkeeper.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Secrecy is crucial─as is preparation. We will leave only when you are ready.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: Men in shimmering white armor beckon to you...

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: Your trial is not yet complete!

obj.n: ガラントガントレット

quest.name: 交わらぬ心慮
journal: Jenlyns wishes to know if you are ready to face Solkzagyl.

Through intermediaries, Jenlyns has arranged a parley with Solkzagyl in order to negotiate the return of Oathkeeper. However, the meeting could be a trap, and Jenlyns has asked you to accompany him. The parley will be held south of Forgotten Springs, in the Sagolii Desert.

When you arrive at the parley, Jenlyns suddenly turns his sword against you and accuses you of being in league with Solkzagyl and the Monetarists. You have no time to explain or persuade him otherwise, and are forced to fight Jenlyns and his soldiers. Defiant to the bitter end, Jenlyns refuses to believe your pleas of innocence, until one of his own men attempts to take his life. However, Solkzagyl suddenly appears and saves the captain's life, and the man once believed to be a traitor reveals that he has always been loyal to the crown. Although Jenlyns loses consciousness due to his injuries, Solkzagyl assures you that it is nothing serious, and he pledges to deliver him safely back to Ul'dah. Nevertheless, you should see if Jenlyns is well when next you return to the city.

Jenlyns has accepted that he was an unwitting dupe of the Monetarists. Now that his true enemy has been revealed to him, he will bide his time until the time is ripe to strike.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Rendezvous with Jenlyns.
Speak with Jenlyns in Ul'dah.
Defeat Jenlyns Straightblade!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The recovery of Oathkeeper will be the first step in restoring the honor of the Sultansworn.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I have told Solkzagyl that if he returns the sword, we will give him a fair trial.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Otherwise, he shall be captured and thrown at the feet of the sultana for judgment.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The parley is to take place south of Forgotten Springs in the Sagolii Desert. Give me your map and I will mark the location.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: While I believe he is acting alone, we must be prepared for anything─you may be certain that the Monetarists will not take kindly to his surrender.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: In fact, I believe that should the Monetarists discover Solkzagyl is willing to parley, they will surely try to intervene. Therefore, we must not speak of what we do, not to anyone.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: We should travel separately, so as not to attract attention. We shall meet again at the parley.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: So you dared to come. You are a brazen one, I will grant you that. But did you really think I wouldn't find out?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Come, come, confess. My allies within the Sultansworn have told me the truth. I know you are working in league with the traitor and the Monetarists.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Confess! With your dying breath, you will tell me where I can find Oathkeeper and the traitor who stole it!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Do you dare accuse my own Sultansworn of lying? We are comrades-in-arms, every one of us, bound in brotherhood by our oath. I would trust them with my life. What is your word, when set against theirs? We know the meaning of honor!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You are a naive fool. I suspected you from the beginning, ever since you showed me the Soul of the Paladin that the traitor Solkzagyl gave you.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You were, no matter how briefly, a paladin, and as such, you are bound by a code of honor that is as unforgiving as it is noble.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Traitor! I sentence you to death, and decree that your body shall lie here and feed the crows.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You...you cannot do this. I am the greater swordsman. Your superior...in every way...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You were blinded, Jenlyns─by your own conviction.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Jenlyns, remember your own lesson! A paladin does not exist to defend his position or the honor of his fellow Sultansworn.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Those men were assassins, in service to the Monetarists. The moment you outlived your usefulness, you were to be killed. You and this free paladin of yours.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Liar! You are their agent! You betrayed us for them...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You were always naive, Jenlyns─too willing to trust your fellow man. It's one of your virtues, but you have a deplorable habit of turning your virtues into vices...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Think! The information you uncovered─how did you come by it? Did it fall into your lap, as if―oh, I don't know―someone was feeding it to you for their own purposes? You and the paladins under your command are the Monetarists' lapdogs.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Jenlyns, you've been led a merry dance, and followed their lead at every step.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Then...you were never a traitor? You were innocent? I...I have wronged you...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Easy now. Your wounds aren't mortal, but you still need to rest.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: I'll take care of the captain. He's had worse, and we'll have him back on his feet soon enough.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You've become a fine warrior, and learned all there is to know about the way of the paladin. I think perhaps that you are not aware just how much you've grown. Well! 'Tis time you were made aware─paladin!

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: When the captain's recovered, keep an eye on him for me, will you? He needs someone like you to watch his back.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Paladin, I have done you a great wrong. I allowed myself to be hoodwinked, accused you of treason, and even turned my sword against you. I hope that you can find it in your heart to forgive me.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: As for me, yes, I am recovered from my wounds, at least those that will heal. But far more important than that, Solkzagyl is innocent, after all.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: He was never a traitor, and the dream that I followed in my youth was not a lie.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I remain captain of the elite, although a poor substitute for my predecessor. I am now working on a plan to strike back at the Monetarists and restore the Sultansworn to its former strength.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: No, do not be afraid for me. We've unmasked the foe and he cannot hide behind his deceptions anymore. The assassins won't find it easy to reach me.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: For now, I will bide my time, marshal my strength, and, when the time is ripe, strike hard at our enemies.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Save whatever dignity you have left and accept your fate!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: How dare you use our arts against us!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Confess, damn you, confess!

quest.name: かざすは騎士の聖剣
journal: Jenlyns wishes to bid you farewell.

Although his captaincy is a sham, Jenlyns has decided that he will use what power he has to strike back at the cabal. For the showdown, he has chosen Snowcloak in Coerthas─but before you can offer your assistance, he commands you to stay away and find a safe haven. Jenlyns also mentions that Solkzagyl wishes to speak with you, and the captain directs you to a tunnel in central Thanalan where Solkzagyl will be waiting.

Solkzagyl states plainly that Jenlyns will die if he faces the Monetarists' assassins alone, and he all but declares his intention to follow Jenlyns to Snowcloak before departing. What you do next is up to you and your conscience.

When you arrive at the battleground that Jenlyns has chosen to launch his campaign against the cabal, you find him and Solkzagyl facing off against the minions of the Monetarists. Together, the three of you manage to defeat the assassins and deal the Monetarists a crushing blow. Afterwards, despite the captain's objections, Solkzagyl leaves the Sultansworn in Jenlyns's hands and returns to his paladin's journey. Return to Ul'dah, find Jenlyns at his station near the Royal Promenade in the Hustings Strip, and talk to him once more.

As Solkzagyl continues to search for the fabled Oathkeeper, Jenlyns will continue to serve Ul'dah as one of the Sultansworn. In recognition of your deeds, he bestows upon you the gallant surcoat, sacred armor normally reserved for the most courageous of the Sultansworn. Although this is a violation of long-standing tradition, he believes there is no paladin more deserving of the honor. Wear your new armor with pride, free paladin, and continue to defend the people of Eorzea.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Meet with Solkzagyl.
Follow Jenlyns to Snowcloak.
Speak with Jenlyns in Ul'dah.
Defeat the Death's Embrace assassins!
Locate the Death's Embrace master!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Well come, paladin. I had hoped to see you before I left. You remained a true friend, even after the wrongs I did to you, and I owe you my trust. So I will tell you everything I have learned.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: After our encounter in the hills, I spent some time in the care of Solkzagyl, recovering from my wounds. As I convalesced, he gave me the true account of what happened these last few years in his solitary war against the Monetarists.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: After he went into hiding, he tried to get word to me about what was happening, but I was surrounded by agents in the pay of the Monetarists who kept me isolated and ignorant.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: They planted the lie that Solkzagyl was a traitor, and tricked me into tracking him down. I was their puppet, twitching obediently at the end of the strings they pulled.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But when I discovered that Death's Embrace had been behind the demise of my brothers and sisters, they panicked―especially when they found out I had shared the information with you. They set a trap for us, and baited it with the promise of a “parley” with Solkzagyl.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Solkzagyl was no traitor, as I should well have known. But I allowed myself to be deceived by the whispers of mummers and flatterers, and... No. That was not the way of it. It was not their lies that made me blind, but my desire─nay, obsession─to restore our honor.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: For the Sultansworn, and all paladins who have bent the knee to a higher cause, honor is a means to an end, not the end itself. I lost sight of that, and in so doing, lost sight of my true duty.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Solkzagyl understood what was happening, and that is why he gave you the Soul of the Paladin.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: It was a remonstration, a message. Look how adventurers live, he was telling me. Where does their honor, their authority come from?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I owe my position to the machinations of the Monetarists. They calculated that a young captain, eager to prove his loyalty, bound by unquestioning fealty, would be all the easier to control. They were right.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I am a sham and a fake. But the world does not know that, and even the illusion of power is a power of sorts. I can use it to fight back.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I will tell my subordinates that I'm fleeing to Snowcloak in Coerthas. When the Monetarists hear of this, as they surely will, they will send assassins after me again.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But when they show their hand, I will stand my ground and fight back.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I realize you may wish to offer your assistance. However, I cannot in good conscience put you in harm's way anymore. You, too, have become a target of the cabal's assassins.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The odds will be against me, that much is certain. But Solkzagyl has taught me much, and if I am brave and vigilant, I know I can triumph.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I am sorry you have been caught up in our own political struggles. But now, as a paladin, it is time you traveled your own path.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Ah, yes─Solkzagyl wished to have a word with you as well. You will find him in central Thanalan─allow me to mark the location on your map.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Forename. We haven't much time, so I will be blunt. Jenlyns will die if he faces Death's Embrace alone.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: I know what I must do─and I suspect you do as well. If you are the womanman I believe you to be, then we shall meet again soon.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You as well? I told you to go to ground―this isn't your fight!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: First Solkzagyl, now you. Are you both so eager to die?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You forget that we are paladins! Wheresoever our duty leads us, we go─and do so of our own free will.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: To abide by one's own sense of justice is to embrace the paladin's creed.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Sworn or unsworn, we are paladins true, and the only true oath we swear is the one we swear to ourselves.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Now, come! Let us stand shoulder to shoulder and show the blackhearts the mettle of our souls, and the steel of our swords!

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You've done well. You never flinched from your duty, you followed the path you knew you had to take, and you showed us what it means to be a paladin.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: And you even managed to prise the scales from Jenlyns's eyes while you were at it. It's been an honor to know you, and to watch you grow.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: In any case, today's battle should blunt the Monetarists' dagger, at least for a while. They'll think twice before sending assassins after the Sultansworn again.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: I trust you will see to this mess, Jenlyns?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Yes, sir! I mean, Captain! Please, sir, return to the capital...take up your command again. The burden─it is too much for the likes of me...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: The Monetarists may have stolen Oathkeeper, but oaths are not forged in steel―they are sworn in the heart.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You never betrayed your oaths, Jenlyns. And as for your leadership, well, ask this paladin if shehe learned anything from you.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: No matter what the circumstances, once a man has left the Sultansworn, he cannot return. No, I followed my own path, and on it I will stay.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: ...I have followed you since the day I vowed to join the ranks of the Sultansworn. Has the time come for me to stop following, and begin to lead...?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming. Once again, you have placed me in your debt. See me in the city when you return―I will have something for you.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Well come, paladin. These have been troubled times for the Sultansworn, and you have served us loyally.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You did what was just, followed the paladin way, and defended the weak and needy. You are a true oathkeeper.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Honor and right were yours from the very beginning, and that is what made you strong. Strong enough to defeat me.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The sword Oathkeeper has yet to be found, but I have come to realize that I do not need it─nay, not to lead the Sultansworn nor to restore our good name. The oaths we keep are in our hearts, not in hallowed blades.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Solkzagyl has left to wander the nations of Eorzea. He is a man of honor, and unless I am very much mistaken, he will continue to look for the sword that was gifted by our ruler centuries ago.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I shall continue to serve Ul'dah as one of the Sultansworn. You shall defend the people of Eorzea as a free paladin.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Our paths diverge now, but we shall forever be bound by the oaths we keep in our hearts...

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Ah, but listen to me! Noble words aren't much good to an adventurer who has to face monsters and menaces out in the real world. Fortunately, I have something that will serve you rather better...

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: This sacred armor has been kept within the Sultansworn for many generations. It was given only to those Sultansworn who had, through feats of arms and deeds of great courage, earned the privilege to wear it.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But something tells me that, for the first time since it left the armorer's forge, this armor should go to someone who is not of the Sultansworn. If I allowed myself to be a slave to tradition, the paladin who deserves it the most would never wear it!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Now wouldn't that be a waste of fine plate?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Just one thing―if anyone asks where you got it, you mustn't say it was me!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the paladin quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I suspected they would send minions, but voidsent!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hah! Hardly a challenge for a trio of paladins!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Surely the Monetarists would go to greater lengths than this...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Those voidsent were called forth by a mage─a mage who I suspect is observing as we speak.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Spread out and search for anything unusual. But tread lightly─this could very well be a trap.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: What sorcery is this!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Likely the work of our mage.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: It pulses with a queer light...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Up above, it's the mage! The grimoire─it's a trap!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh, damn you! Solkzagyl, Forename─are you injured!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: How disappointing. I had hoped to finish this quickly.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Not that I expect you will live much longer!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Cut down the assassins quickly, but ware that mage!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: His magicks are not to be trifled with!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Where did that monstrosity come from!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Over there, look! That grimoire is the source!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I will hold the beasts at bay! Jenlyns, Forename─destroy the grimoire!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Captain...for...give...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: <cough> <wheeze> So...so be it...

obj.n: 蘇る古の武器（コルタナ）

quest.name: 亡国からの雷動
journal: Gagaruna has work for a willing pugilist.
You have been charged with seeing to the safety of one of Eorzea's most prominent military historians. Visit the Goldsmiths' Guild, and there speak with Professor Erik─the body you will be guarding.

Professor Erik tells you that in the midst of his studies, his previously assigned bodyguard left his side and has not returned. Without protection, the professor cannot continue his research, which is why you must aid in carrying out the crucial fieldwork. Travel ahead of him to the Sil'dih excavation site in central Thanalan and set up the aetherometer he has placed in your care.

The aether flowing through the field of battle has opened one of the chakra within you. Upon witnessing this, a senior monk named Widargelt gifts you with a soul crystal─the mark of a member of the monkhood. He explains that with it, you will come to learn the skills of those monks who bore it before you, but only after your chakra have opened further. For now, retrieve the aetherometer.
Having secured the forgotten aetherometer, return to the Goldsmiths' Guild and deliver it to Professor Erik.

Professor Erik warns that you require further preparation before undertaking the next task that he has for you.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Speak with Erik at the Goldsmiths' Guild.
Place the aetherometer at the Sil'dih excavation site.
Retrieve the aetherometer.
Deliver the aetherometer to Erik.
Defeat the imps!

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: Tell me, do you know of Professor Erik? He is a scholar of Eorzean military history whose genius is second to none! And he is among our most valued clients.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: Some find him to be...verbose. Tedious. Haughty. But never mind all that! The man spends more gil on a moon's research than most people see in a lifetime! Hence our amicable relations!

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: His latest work has him visiting the sites of ancient battlefields. He insists on surveying lands plagued by savage beasts.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: According to him, the beasts keep man away, and less intrusion by man means greater preservation.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: Whatever his reasons, should the professor meet an untimely fate, we will be unable to collect the gil he has borrowed, much less the interest! Oh, and it would be a terrible loss for the academic community and so on and so forth, yes, yes.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: The point is the man must needs be guarded. To that end, I sent a monk of Ala Mhigo to see to his safety, but it turns out the bloody oaf has no work ethic about him─just like an Ala Mhigan.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: The professor cannot focus on his work if he feels endangered, and so has demanded we assign him a new bodyguard.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: That's why I'm so glad to see you, Forename. The professor is awaiting his new escort as we speak, and I'd like for it to be you.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: You are yet a mere pugilist. Perhaps this task would provide some insight into what it is the monkhood does around here.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: Make for the Goldsmiths' Guild, and there seek out our good Professor Erik.

dialogue.name: GAGARUNA
dialogue.text: The professor claims he will pay his debt and the fees for his protection once his research is complete. See to it our investment doesn't end up under the paw or in the maw of some nasty beast.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, my punch-prone maidservantmanservant, I presume? You may and shall call me Erik. You are to guard my life, even at the cost of your own, and aid in my revolutionary research whenever and however asked.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Know that my primary endeavor is to reconstruct the military histories of old through the aetherial analysis of ancient battlegrounds.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I assume the words conjure in your simple mind romantic images of vast plains and open valleys, with armies charging blindly at one another. False!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I seek to know where the armies of old were deployed. Where they made camp and marched. No doubt you think such lands to be those sung of in the songs of bards. False! They are here, beneath our very feet! And to find them and determine precisely how events unfolded upon them is my purpose.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: No doubt you jumped at the chance to aid in my work. Tell me, which of my treatises have you read? All of th─none!? Gods, I knew you adventurers had a reputation for being unlettered. I didn't know you actually made efforts to remain so. <sigh> It matters not.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I require only that you work with diligence─unlike that Widargelt buffoon. The man proved to be sloth itself. Alas, he is a monk of Ala Mhigo. I suppose the fool was too busy opening his chakra or whatever it is those barbarians do all day.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I admit, he seemed keenly interested in my research, but now he's gone off to Twelve know where and has yet to return. Do you understand the sheer magnitude of this inconvenience?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Good, good. You show that much promise, at least. But let us speak more of my work. Our first destination is the Sil'dih excavation site in central Thanalan. I believe events of great import to the history of Sil'dih transpired there.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Hm? Surely if you have ears you have heard of Sil'dih? Or are you deaf as well as dull? <sigh> Very well. I see you require some instruction. It would be remiss of me as an academic to allow you to wallow in such ignorance.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Sil'dih was plunged into chaos in the wake of King Lalawefu's demise─or the King of Springs, as he was known. Despite the success of economic reforms...<babble>...fomented unrest among the people...<babble>...resulting in violent outbreaks throughout the kingdom.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Sil'dih was...<babble>...sultan at the time...<babble>...distant descendant...<babble>...attack was ordered... <babble>

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And so...<babble>...irony of ironies...<babble>...hadn't been for that horse... <babble>

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Fascinating, is it not? It is enough to convince one things could not have happened any other way, no? False! One among my colleagues disagreed with this interpretation of events. He claimed to have evidence suggesting otherwise, but all trace of it disappeared before it was published.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Mine own research shall unearth any such evidence should it truly exist! I shall know the truth! Granted, you are not the brightest coal in the brazier, but surely such a prospect entices even you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And so, we make for the Sil'dih excavation site in central Thanalan. Travel the way before me to see that it is safe, and once there set up this aetherometer.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And, should you ever care to know more of the Eorzean military history, do come and see me. It is a personal crusade of mine to guide the dullards of this realm towards some modicum of enlightenment.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Well done! Now, we need only wait for the aetherometer to gauge the─ Hm?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: There are fiends about, Forename. They are often drawn to the lingering scents of blood and death. Well, this is what you're here for. Have at it.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Widargelt! So good of you to drag yourself all this way, you purblind sluggard! Ah, and Forename. You have far exceeded what admittedly low expectations I had of you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I suppose introductions are in order. Far be it from me to deny the realm's unread the comfort of one another's company. Widargelt, Forename. Forename, Widargelt─the monk I spoke of sent to me by Gagaruna.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I tried to make a pupil of Widargelt as well, but he has little mind for history. His primitive beliefs in the witchcraft of chakra and spiritual energies have a tenacious hold on him.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Oh? Truly!? This is the area where there have been sightings of walking dead!? I have heard the tales. Some claim they've seen an apparition wearing the garb of an ancient commander!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Careful. There are still dangers about.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: His work is dear to him. That is good. He thirsts for knowledge. For truth. Discovery awakens him. You too have awoken, friend. Can you not feel it?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Do not be frightened. Here was a battle. Long ago. Much energy remains. It has found you. It flows through you. Your chakra has been opened. This was the light that shone from you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is as Erik said. Widargelt is my name. I am a brother of the monkhood. My order is the Fist of Rhalgr. Our way is to train the body and mind.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The fist is our weapon. With it, we put down our enemies. The energy within us moves the fist. The chakra is the seat of that energy. It is a sacred place. It can be opened, and the life force within controlled.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Chakra exist in all that lives─in all beings. Yet not all beings can open them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Much training is needed. And great discipline. With these, the life force be commanded.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There are those who require no training. Their inner strength is such that it forces the chakra open. I have heard of this happening. But never have I seen it─until now.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I see in you great conviction. You mean to walk the monk's path. And so I will give you this─a soul crystal. The mark of my order.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: None but a monk may hold it. And only then with the order's leave. But your chakra is awakened. That is clear. And so you are worthy.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Many bore that crystal before you. It remembers them. Their breath and their movement. They will one day be yours. But your chakra must open further. Only then can the crystal's memories enter you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: This is no more than the beginning. Now you must train. Learn to control the life force within you. With time, you will master it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We stand on an ancient battleground. A great war was waged here. The spirit of the fight lingers. The aether reaches for the chakra. It aids in their opening. That is why we monks seek such lands.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Erik seeks these lands for reasons of his own. The fates favor you in this. Follow him. Your chakra will grow ever more.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Hm? Professor Erik is leaving. Fear not. I will see to his safety. Please, sisterbrother, the aetherometer. Gather it and bring it to the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Well, look who has decided to grace us with herhis presence. Did you enjoy the saunter back? I was just about to begin my analysis, so if you've matters you wish to speak on, I'd ask that you save it for─

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You've brought the aetherometer! Excellent. I had a feeling you might not be entirely useless. Now, let us see what discoveries await.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Hm? Widargelt passed along a soul crystal to you? Moved to join the monkhood by the bone-headed clod, were you? <sigh> Well, I suppose it is for the best that my pupils get along.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But I do believe I will see to it you are sent to separate locations for the next round of measurements. And I daresay the land to which I intend to send you is fraught with dangers. You had best tread the monk's path quickly if you mean to defend yourself─and me, besides!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next monk quest will be available from Erik upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Beat the bloody hells out of the blasted things! There are measurements to be taken!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, that's it! The data is flowing now!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ahhh, here comes a true foe!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Most fascinating! This data will prove invaluable!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

obj.n: 格闘士ギルド受付 ガガルナ

quest.name: 青き古戦場
journal: Professor Erik seeks to measure the aether of more ancient battlefields.

Professor Erik has skillfully manipulated you and Widargelt into conducting even more research on his behalf. Travel to Bloodshore in eastern La Noscea and place the aetherometer he has given you at an appropriate location.
You have measured the aetherial currents at Bloodshore. Retrieve the aetherometer.
Deliver the aetherometer and the invaluable data it contains to Professor Erik at the Goldsmiths' Guild in Ul'dah.

It seems that the aetherometer in your keeping suffered some damage on your latest outing. Professor Erik asks that you visit him again later after he has time to see to its repairs and determine where next to send you in search of aetherial data.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Place the aetherometer at Bloodshore.
Retrieve the aetherometer.
Deliver the aetherometer to Erik at the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, just the pupil I was hoping to see. I was a hair's breadth from setting out on my own. Hmmm, to look at you... Yes, I daresay you appear to have been growing in brawn at the expense of brain.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Right, well, let us measure some aether, shall we? And by we I mean you. Oh, and the monk simpleton, of course. Though, contrary to his nature, he has already set out for the destination I assigned him.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Thinking perhaps that you are far too stupid to take, much less understand, aetheric readings? It is true─you are stupid. But the aetherometer shall do all the work for you, and transmit the data back to me.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: As souls more, ahem, suited to action, the monk simpleton and yourself need only carry the device on your person and set about beating on things as you always do. It shall capture data as you trudge about hither and yon.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Aether is not only the source of all magicks, but also the fount of all life. Yet despite its ubiquity, it remains imperceptible. When a living thing dies, the aether comprising its life is released. When this discharge takes place, a portion of that aether remains, lingering in the physical world.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: No doubt you have...<babble>...aetherial crystallizations...<babble>...physical manifestations...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: ...Apparitions of the deceased...<babble>...luminescent glow...<babble>...known as the aetherial threshold!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: In short: the more violent and dramatic the loss of life, the greater the amount of aether left behind, either in its imperceptible form or in crystallizations. And where are the most lives lost in this manner?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Cemeteries!? No, false, you idiot! Battlefields! Do you not see? With aetheric readings of those locations, we can discern the scale and more of the battles that took place there!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: As for those fool beliefs the monkhood keeps─chakra and spiritual energies and whatnot─if I were to allow that they truly exist, I would be inclined to say they are one and the same as aether itself.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The aether churning around these ancient battle sites comes to naturally settle in the surrounding life─both plant and animal, though more so in the latter. It accumulates within them. Felling these beasts then releases that aether, causing a surge that resonates with the aether within you, causing it to expand─the so-called opening of the chakra. By this, the very power of life itself within you grows.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: A watered-down explanation, but adequate for one of your mental prowess, I believe. Mine own wife never had the patience for such things either, nor my passion. She cursed me and my work, took our children, and returned to Ala Mhigo...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: <sigh> But now is not the time for that tale.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The area I am placing in your charge is Bloodshore in eastern La Noscea. Place this aetherometer in an appropriate location, and after a spell, retrieve it and bring it to me.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I obtain the data I require, and you and the monk simpleton are afforded the chance to indulge your─how shall I put it?─charming little backward fantasies. All are happy.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ideally, I would prefer you have a knowledgeable understanding of Bloodshore's history, but I fear we lack the time for me to educate you. I need hardly tell you that my research takes precedence over your schooling.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Have you brought the aetherometer?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Hmmm... It seems the device has suffered some damage. I suppose such things are unavoidable in this line of work. I must see to its repairs at once. That is, after all, why I put up here at the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: My aetherometer is no ordinary device. I came up with the elaborate design myself, had the finest engineers at Garlond Ironworks draft the schematics, and then commissioned the most talented goldsmiths to fabricate it.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Widargelt delivered the results of his outing not long ago. I must insist that you take your leave of me now. There is a wealth of data for me to analyze, and I fear that simply having you nearby will somehow affect the processing power of my brain.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Repairing the aetherometer and determining which locations to next investigate will require some time. Why don't you go and train those muscles of yours or whatever it is you do in my absence?

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 不和から至る旋律
journal: Professor Erik seeks further aid in his aetherial research.

Professor Erik has entrusted you with two tasks, the first of which is to collect the aetherometer in the possession of Widargelt. Travel to Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan and there speak with the monk.

Widargelt urges you to set about your second task, assuring you that he will bring you his aetherometer when it has finished collecting data. Travel to Snakemolt in the South Shroud and make use of your aetherometer at the designated location.
You have collected the data Professor Erik requested. Retrieve the aetherometer.

Widargelt confesses that his sole purpose is to learn the locations of ancient battlefields from Professor Erik, so that he may travel to them in order to further open his chakra. In doing so, he hopes to serve the Ala Mhigan Resistance to the utmost of his ability. Return to the Goldsmiths' Guild and deliver both your and Widargelt's aetherometers to the professor.

Upon a cursory examination of the aetherometers, Professor Erik is excited by the prospective results they might yield. Continue in your monk's training as he sees about analyzing the latest haul of data.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt in Little Ala Mhigo.
Place the aetherometer at Snakemolt.
Retrieve the aetherometer.
Deliver both aetherometers to Erik at the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, dear Forename, so good of you to trouble yourself to come. Normally I might be cross, but my spirits are far too high just now. And it is you I have to thank!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I speak of the data you procured! It is simply marvelous! You have a true gift for grunt work, my friend. I wish I had a hundred more assistants just like you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I have been in this field for a very long time, and I have been alone. Ever since that unfortunate mulled tea fungus culture incident sparked my passion for research. I regret nothing, Forename.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Save perhaps having to share so wondrous a world with souls as unlearned as yourself. Still, your performance has not left me completely bereft of joy. It is rewarding to think that my instruction has guided you to such success.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: There, how was that? Shall we dispense with any further pleasantries? Very good, then.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I made yet another career-defining discovery while pondering which battleground to measure next. Eorzea is home to numerous locations where the aether is in an intensely chaotic state, yet which never played host to any war.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: My hypothesis was that such flux in the aether was indicative of a past battle, and all my research was predicated upon this.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But turn the theory on its head, Forename, if your mind is able─what if the people of the past chose areas of roiling aether to hold their battles!?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I have already sent the simpleton monk to take measurements at the Finesand Banks. As you are doubtless unaware, this lies on the border between Ala Mhigo and Gridania, and was the stage of the Autumn War.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I ask that you find our monk friend and collect his aetherometer. Manual and tedious, yes, but he has an early make of the device that is unable to transmit data. I gather the numskull is in Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan by this time.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You think I ask much of you? False! I ask more. Your other task is to travel to Snakemolt in the South Shroud, and there take measurements with your own aetherometer.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I will continue with my research here in your absence. Mind you, if you care to know aught at all of the Autumn War and the Finesand Banks upon which it was fought, I will gladly enlighten you. You need only ask.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You have come far. It is good to see you, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You come for my aetherometer? It is not ready to give. My work is not finished.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I came as soon as I was told. But the readings require more time. Do not worry. They will be ready soon.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You make for Snakemolt in the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Erik believes the aether strong there. Yet that land hosted no great battles. He told me as much this morn.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Leave me to my task here. Make for Snakemolt. Take your readings. My work will soon be done. I will bring the device to you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have troubled you to come here. I will not trouble you to wait. Go. We will meet again at Snakemolt, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Well done, sisterbrother. I feel your chakra. It has grown.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I hoped to arrive before you. But I see I am late. This land's power has gone to you. There is nothing left for me here.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is as I told you. We monks travel where aether flows strong. There we train. The power of the land enters us. Thus our chakra expand.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: This bonding causes great unrest. The land's energy becomes unstable. It will enter no other until it calms.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I feel nothing here. As you would feel nothing at Finesand Banks. That land bonded to my chakra. And its aether is now at unrest.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The teacher's work means nothing. I took no readings. I meant to hasten here. But I was delayed. There was a gathering of the monkhood. I was summoned to Little Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The teacher's chidings? Worry not. I will use my device here. Any result will suffice. The man has already reached his conclusion. He will twist the data to fit.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is a sad existence. To sacrifice all for truth. Yet be unable to truly know when one sees it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Speak not of this to him, sisterbrother. You see both our aims. You know mine to be more worthy.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I tell this to you. You and you alone. I am of the Ala Mhigan Resistance. I fight for freedom from Garlemald.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I escaped the occupation. I have come here to fight. To gather allies and weapons.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But these lands sadden me. The people have forgotten. Ala Mhigo is a distant memory.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The Resistance here is small. They aid where they can. But it is not enough. This war demands great power. That power lies in the chakra.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The teacher is not an evil man. But he thinks only of his work. Not the suffering of innocents.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: His knowledge can be used for good. The battlefields. They can turn the tide. The chakra of many must be opened.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If this way is lost to me... No. No, I will have this power. I must!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: An end to oppression. An end to starvation. Ala Mhigo will be made free. I will see it done!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forgive my speech. It is a matter close to my heart.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will give you my device. But I ask you say nothing of this to Erik. I beg you, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The aether of the land opens your chakra!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I trust you have returned with both of my aetherometers? Please tell me you fumbling dolts haven't managed to damage either of them this time.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: All looks to be in order here. Hmmm... These readings from your device...they look promising. Very promising, indeed. I daresay this data may yield revolutionary results!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Hm? Your chakra opened a bit more, did it? Yes, well, aether is a most mysterious and wonderful thing. I am glad this meaningful research could serve your nonsensical ends as well.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Now, leave me to my work. Surely you can find some simple way to pass the time. Fighting, say? Or...I don't know─scratching?

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: チャクラの波紋
journal: Professor Erik would have you do his bidding yet again.

Professor Erik is ill pleased to discover that you and Widargelt gave him aetheric readings from the same location in your last outing. However, he has decided that this one error should not prevent you both from continuing in your capacity as his assistants. Once again, take the aetherometer given to you and travel to Larkscall in the East Shroud to record more field data.
You have dispatched the aetherbound kerns summoned forth by the presence of the aetherometer and finished taking the desired readings. Retrieve the professor's device.
You have gathered up the aetherometer. Head back to the Goldsmiths' Guild to deliver the latest batch of data to Professor Erik.

The professor can scarcely contain himself at the prospect of analyzing the results you have returned to him. However, he still seems to be harboring concerns over Widargelt. Speak with him again to learn more.
objectives: Set the aetherometer at Larkscall.
Retrieve the aetherometer.
Deliver the aetherometer to Erik at the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You two played me for a fool. The data the simpleton monk brought me was absolutely astounding. Groundbreaking. Revolutionary. Yet I remained objective in my analysis, as a scholar must.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Poring over the data, I finally arrived at a disheartening conclusion: the two of you took measurements of the same area! The values were near identical─equivalences mocking me as I struggled to reconcile them.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I could neither sleep nor eat lest I waste time not drawing nearer the truth. And for what? Tell me. What is it you two were doing in the field?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Bah, not this bloody chakra nonsense again! How many times must I tell you? It is naught but imperceptible aether. Call it what it is!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And to think I had a mind to put your names under mine when my hypothesis was published!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: This life force, this spiritual energy, this godsforsaken eternal soul essence─I care not what primitive nomenclature those backward monks wish to assign it. It is aether, plain and simple!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: They claim they are able to manipulate and amplify it through discipline and the opening of the so-called chakra. False! This is nothing more than the aetherial regulation of organisms─a basic and natural concept. In an attempt to explain that which science does not yet fully understand, the monks have erected an institution of control.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Their preachings are unassailable by design─for none can disprove the existence of the unknowable. They promise power in return for abjection and servitude. Control and power, indeed! Only that of man! It is the very essence of a religion, and should be treated with contempt, as all religion should.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Aether resides in all living things, as do natural mechanisms with the capacity to regulate it. This is simply life─not some mystical, supernatural endowment.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I concede, of course, that the heightened mental faculties of man allow for the potential to gain conscious control over those mechanisms. Indeed, it would appear that you and the simpleton monk have already achieved that end.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: <sigh> The indiscretion and impertinence of youth... I suppose it can be forgiven─once. In my own youth, I was not the model of perfection you see before you. I too have made what some might call mistakes. Not myself, but some.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: In our talks together, the simpleton monk often spoke of the seventh chakra. Its awakening is thought to be the highest achievement among the monkhood. Aye, I make it a habit to know the tenets of my intellectual enemies.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: It was the flow of the aether within the two of you which betrayed your falsehood. The whispering of your chakra, as I'm sure the monks would rush to call it.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But serendipity most often visits the industrious! Just so, it is precisely these aetherial whispers that proved to be most intriguing. The waves of these sounds resonated perfectly with the aether of the battleground!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I can see by your vapid expression that you are missing my point. Allow me to spell it out─it follows that if one were to visit a battlefield with a certain aetherial wave amplitude and frequency, it would resonate with one's own aether!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: This is the phenomenon responsible for the initial opening of your own chakra. <sigh> I cannot believe I am being reduced to speaking in these terms.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: It stands to reason that for any aetherial wave, there may be a location that will resonate with it. Think of the implications, Forename!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: If the seventh chakra the monks speak of truly exists, then so, too, must an ultimate battleground to bond with it. The concentration of aether in such a place would be unlike anything ever recorded!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I forgive your past treachery, guide me as it did to this great discovery. That, and I need you to do more work for me. Here, take this new aetherometer.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Make for Larkscall in the East Shroud. My research indicates it is a very promising tract indeed.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Set up the aetherometer as you have others in the past, and then kill whatever you must to obtain a strong reading.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Slaying beasts there will release the aether of the land they are steeped in, and it may then resonate with your own. I suppose in the primitive terms of the monkhood, that would translate to the expansion of your chakra.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Oh, and you'll not be crossing paths with the simpleton monk this time. I will be sending him to take readings at East End. I've no intentions of allowing you two to conspire to impede my research again.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: If you care to know more about the events that have transpired at Larkscall, I suggest you pay a visit to your local library. East End, on the other hand, is a fascinating subject of which I never tire speaking. Ask me about it any time if your curiosity ever gets the better of you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I very much look forward to the readings of both your and Widargelt's aetherometers. What's this? You've already finished!? Then what are you standing there talking for? Come, come, give me the aetherometer!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Amazing... Simply amazing! And your soul crystal... It's glowing more vibrantly than ever before, is it not?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I will begin my analysis of the data with all haste! You've come to be quite the model pupil, Forename. Would that I could say the same of the monk simpleton. <sigh>

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I can see the feeble gears turning in your mind. Come, there is no need to feel shame at your ignorance. If you wish to know what has transpired, you need only ask. I promise to use small words.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 無明の内地
journal: Professor Erik wishes to speak with you about Widargelt.
Widargelt has asked that you come see him. He awaits you at Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan.

Widargelt explains to you how the war garb of a monk can strengthen the inner energy of the wearer and aid in opening the chakra. Though they are normally awarded only to those monks who pass prescribed trials, there is a set that was recently stolen. Widargelt is willing to gift these relics to you should you retrieve them. Two have been tracked to southern Thanalan, at the Sepulchre and the Circle of the Tempered, and the third to northern Thanalan, at the abandoned Amajina mythril mine.
You have obtained the three stolen relics. Return to Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan and speak with Widargelt.
Widargelt tells you that the Fist of Rhalgr has tracked down the fourth stolen monk's relic. Travel to the Gods' Grip in lower La Noscea and track down the Qiqirn black market trader who has it.
You have defeated the thugs summoned to put an end to your prying. Interrogate the Qiqirn trader to learn what he knows.
You have gathered the fourth monk's relic. Return to Little Ala Mhigo and speak with Widargelt once more.

Professor Erik has made a revolutionary discovery based on the aetherial data he has collected. Widargelt anticipates that his work will mark the emancipation of Ala Mhigo from Garlean rule. Return to the Goldsmiths' Guild in Ul'dah and speak with Erik about this new development.

Erik intends to present his thesis to a conference of his academic peers upon its completion. Continue to travel the path of the monk until that day comes.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt at Little Ala Mhigo.
Retrieve the monk's relic from the Sepulchre.
Retrieve the monk's relic from the Circle of the Tempered.
Retrieve the monk's relic from the abandoned Amajina mythril mine.
Speak with Widargelt.
Speak with the Qiqirn trader at the Gods' Grip.
Speak with the Qiqirn trader.
Speak with Widargelt.
Speak with Erik at the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The simpleton monk asked that I send you his way should I see you. He waits for you at Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Surely you see Widargelt for the danger he is. His is the most dangerous type of mind─one blinded by revolution and revenge.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I do wish you'd tell him yourself that people should live for the future rather than the past.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You thought I did not know he was of the Ala Mhigan Resistance? How saddening it is that on the rare occasions you do trouble yourself to think, you are wrong. Of course I know. What manner of imbecile do you take me for?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: No doubt Widargelt thinks me the idiot. False! These two eyes see far more than you know. I, too, am an Ala Mhigan, and love my homeland every bit as much as he.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Go now, hurry to Little Ala Mhigo. I will keep you no longer. No doubt Widargelt is already awaiting your arrival.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You spoke to Erik. Do not lie to me, sisterbrother. You told him who I am─what I seek to do.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am not angered. He tried to sway me from my path. He believes resistance will only leave more dead. I expected as much from him.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I feigned understanding. He asked much of me. Of the monkhood and the Fist. He asked of the seventh chakra.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My answers excited him. He said they would advance his studies. I too learned from him. I am nearer the seventh chakra now.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Soon the Resistance will rise. You too will see. Very soon.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Others do not understand. Ala Mhigo tried to protect them. We were the shield of the realm. We bled to fend off Garlemald.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: None here know our suffering! None here can imagine it. The lives we led after the fall. After the shield was sundered.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have traveled far and wide. I have met many souls. But none are as you. You have a gift.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Yours is a great strength. Unite it to ours, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Help us reclaim our home. Your efforts will be rewarded.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
