dialogue.text: Look upon my garments. This is the war garb of the monkhood. It attunes to the wearer's chakra. Enables it to realize its fullest expression.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The cloth is imbued with the power of Rhalgr. Only monks of His Fist may don it. Only those who overcome many trials.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will tell you how it can be yours. Fear not. I require you to speak no vows.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I ask only that you fight with us. Give yourself to our cause.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You long for adventure. I understand. But such longings can wait. This cannot. See Ala Mhigo freed. Then enjoy your own freedoms. What say you, sisterbrother?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Give yourself to Widargelt's cause?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Your decision saddens me. But know that my offer stands. I pray you change your mind.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You have the heart of a true monk. You are different from the others in this realm.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Hear this. A set of our war garb was stolen. The Fist has tracked the bandits. We know now where three of the relics are.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Here in southern Thanalan, the Sepulchre and the Circle of the Tempered. And in northern Thanalan, the abandoned Amajina mythril mine.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Your soul crystal will react to the relics. Draw near them, and they will glow. By this power, you can find them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The Fist's honor has been trampled upon. Make the heretics you find pay for their sins.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Erik has sold his soul to this land. But he is a knowledgeable man. He knows more than I of the monkhood. And of the Fist.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Speak with him if you would know more of our way. The man revels in hearing himself speak.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I await the day we fight side by side, sisterbrother. Go now, and go well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Travel to the Sepulchre and the Circle of the Tempered here in southern Thanalan. And to the abandoned Amajina mythril mine in northern Thanalan. There will you find the relics you seek.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You have returned. The first three relics are yours. And now, the Fist has located the fourth.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There is a Qiqirn merchant who deals in contraband. The fourth relic is among his wares. Hurry to lower La Noscea. Find this Qiqirn. Take back that which is now yours by right.

dialogue.name: KIKIOROON
dialogue.text: Stinky [Race]! Come to stop Kikiroon's business. Come to take shinies! Kill herhim! Kill the stinky!

dialogue.name: KIKIOROON
dialogue.text: Don't kill Kikiroon. P-Please don't kill! Take back monk circle. Take and spare!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The fourth relic is now yours. You have done well, sisterbrother. But know this. There is another relic. A fifth and final piece.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It will be yours. A gift, from brother to sisterbrother. Given on the day Ala Mhigo stands free once more. That day is near.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Erik sent word not long ago. He claims his revolution has begun, as well. He has made a grand discovery. And is now setting it to paper.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I look forward to his work. With it, we will know all we must. The day he finishes will be the day Ala Mhigo is reborn.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Return to him now, sisterbrother. Ask for yourself when that day will be. May Rhalgr watch over you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I'm afraid I haven't time for you now, Forename. I am penning my thesis based on the aetherial data you and the simpleton collected. There have been significant developments since last we spoke. Or, rather, since last I spoke and you stood before me with that ever vapid expression.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Soon, I will complete my work and present it at a conference of my peers. Surely you can pass the time until then punching and kicking and pursuing other monkly interests, yes? Go do that, then.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

obj.n: テンプルサークレット

quest.name: 廃王の帰還
journal: Professor Erik looks overjoyed.

Widargelt disappeared immediately after hearing Professor Erik reveal his revolutionary discovery. The professor suspects he may have made for Silvertear Falls in Mor Dhona─the location he believes capable of unlocking the seventh chakra. Find Widargelt and try to speak some sense to him.

As a result of the epic struggle to deny Widargelt his seventh chakra, it is yours that has fully opened. Speak with the defeated and devastated Widargelt, and see if the veil of vengeance which blinded him has at last been lifted.

Widargelt gifts you the fifth and final relic, completing your monk's war garb. He has realized the error of his ways, and learned the most important lesson of all from Professor Erik: the true responsibility of the monk is to fight for life, not revenge. Take to heart Erik's words as Widargelt did, and wield your arts so that the realm might one day know peace.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Find Widargelt south of Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Widargelt.
Defeat Widargelt!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Muahahahaha! My theory was correct! Correct, I tell you!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: This will be the greatest academic breakthrough of my lifetime! Perhaps of all lifetimes!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I shall spare you the details of my experiment─as you are not like to comprehend their significance anyway─and proceed directly to the all-important conclusion!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The announcement of my theory before a council of my peers was met with thunderous applause!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And to think I owe it all to a vacant-eyed adventurer and a simpleton monk! Both you and the Pugilists' Guild that sent you are due a debt of gratitude.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Speaking of the monk, where in Eorzea has the semiliterate oaf wandered off to? I took note of his attendance among the spectators at the conference, but he has yet to present himself and offer his congratulations.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: ...Aaahhh!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: What have I done!? Forename, I fear the words I offered may have driven Widargelt to attempt the insane.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I analyzed the aetherial waves of your bodies, second by second. I was able to isolate and identify those of the final aetherial regulation mechanism─the so-called seventh chakra! From that, I was able to find the land which was most likely to resonate with those waves.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Silvertear Falls! I went to the site myself to investigate, and it was there that I made my great discovery─the discovery of the century!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: <sigh> It occurs to me that you shall never accomplish such a feat of the mind, Forename, and I find myself pitying you. But I digress.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Do you not see what I have done, Forename! I told him precisely where he must go to unlock the seventh chakra!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: He has given his life to the fight to reclaim Ala Mhigo from the Empire. More than anything, he desires the power needed to achieve that end─the power to combat the might of all Garlemald.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Any fool can see that─ Ahem, almost any fool can see that he imagines the seventh chakra to be that power!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Yet battling the Empire on such terms will only result in another tragedy like that which befell Ala Mhigo. I pray you do not mean to follow him in this fool's crusade.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: He has gone to Silvertear Falls in Mor Dhona. I am certain of it! You must go, Forename! You must stop him!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: My words will not sway him─just as they could not sway my son. Perhaps yours will.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You claim the power of Garlemald? Fools. Power outside your own cannot be trusted. You had no hope of defeating me.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The seventh chakra swells within me. Soon it will open. When it does, the Empire will burn.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The power of magitek... The power of Garlemald...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They are nothing.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ala Mhigo fell to these!?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ah, sisterbrother. You are late.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But perhaps that is best. I have just attended our Garlean guests.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I wanted us to be alone.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Erik was right. This is the place. You have come. Our chakra beat as drums...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Do you not feel it, sisterbrother?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Living in constant fear of death. Struggling to stay warm enough to sleep. Eating crumbs to fight hunger.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Garlemald took everything from Ala Mhigo! They left us nothing! Not even our pride. Look to the craven teacher. He is proof of the truth I speak.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will reclaim it. All of it. But I need great power to do so. That power rests in the seventh chakra.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I made you a promise. I have not forgotten. The fifth and final piece. It is yours to claim. But only if you defeat me.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I told you when we first met. We monks seek sacred ground. There we train. That is how the chakra are opened.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The teacher told me himself. This is where the seventh chakra opens. This is my sacred battleground. The ground of battle between you and me. Your strength has peaked. Through it, mine will grow.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Do not despair. Your death will have purpose. It will be for Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Rejoice, sisterbrother...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You shall die a martyr!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So close... Why? Why will you not yield your power? For the greater good...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Stay back! This power...is mine!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The others of Eorzea ignore our suffering. Why should I care for their lives? Why should I care for yours?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I must have that power. I must protect my people.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename... That power...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: That light! Never have I seen any like it. Is this the opening of the seventh chakra? Fascinating! Simply fascinating!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You have no mind for study, but your gift for fieldwork is extraordinary indeed.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Wh-Why!?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Why did you strike me?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Silence, you bloody fool! You oaf! You idiot!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I would strike you a thousand times more if it did not pain my hand so. Next time, I shall bring a stick!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Bugger opening your infernal chakra, and open your bloody ears for once! Cid Garlond of the Ironworks that bear his name once wrote that these Silvertear Falls lie at the center of our world.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Our world is round, and we live on its surface. Even you should see, then, that he did not speak of a center in the physical sense.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I am no astrologian, nor a biologist, but I have studied enough of the various sciences to say this:

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The vital energy of Hydaelyn, that which is called aether, is one and the same as the life force in which you monks believe. As the center of our world, these Silvertear Falls are connected to what you call chakra in an inexplicably profound way.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: We all share in the same existence. We are neither separate nor distinct from the world. Our energy and its energy are one.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: At times, that energy may wreak havoc and destruction, but it plays a far grander and more significant role.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: To bring forth life! As part of this world, you must endeavor to do the same.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You sought only to gain power by force. In that, you are no different than the very Garleans you seek to destroy. Is this what you truly wish to be?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You speak pretty words. But would you speak them to our people? To every soul who has suffered?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To children with empty bellies? To wives made widows?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I would.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: To every last soul among them.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Even if they failed to grasp their meaning, as you do now. I would, and will, speak those words until they are understood.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Long have I studied the history of this realm's wars. If there is aught I have learned, it is that there is no future for Eorzea should her people struggle and vie for power without considering the consequences of their doing so.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: With great power comes great responsibility. To seize the former and deny the latter is to beget despair.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The duty we owe to one another, and to this world as part of it, is to use what power we possess to deliver a future full of life─not death. Can you truly not see the right in this?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You have done the realm, indeed the world, a great service, Forename.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: As a scholar, as a teacher, as an Ala Mhigan, as a man─I offer you my deepest thanks.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Widargelt is stubborn, as most monks are. I do not know if it will be possible for him to change his mind. But I pray he does. For his own sake, and for the world's.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: He calls you his sisterbrother. Go now. Speak to him as one.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Not long ago, I spoke with a man. An Ala Mhigan. He too was of the Resistance. He asked me a simple question. Why do I fight?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I did not hesitate. I did not think. The word came of its own will─revenge.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: He said revenge is in all our hearts. That it is the most common of reasons. The easiest. And the most dangerous.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I did not think on it then. Perhaps now I should.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I thought of nothing else. But you thought of me, sisterbrother. You and the teacher. For that I thank you both.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I made a promise. I will keep it. The fifth piece is yours. It is meant for you. For one whose seventh chakra is open.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ala Mhigo fought to protect itself. To protect all Eorzea from the Empire.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And yet we are despised. Ignored. Worse, we are forgotten.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Even so, the teacher preached peace. For a long time, I did not understand. I hated him for it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ala Mhigans are a proud people. This pride is strong in me. And in the teacher. As it was in his son.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: He fought in the Resistance. Yet it cost him his life. He, too, cursed his father for being a coward.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I wish I could speak to him. I wish to tell him this is not so.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Farewell, sisterbrother. May Rhalgr watch over you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the monk quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next monk quest will be available from Erik.

dialogue.name: TALK
dialogue.text: コンプリート

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The seventh chakra must be opened. And only your death will serve. Ala Mhigo thanks you, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The seventh chakra... Yours has begun to open.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: But only one can─and it will be mine. The future of Ala Mhigo depends on it!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The energy wells within me. Come. Let us end this now!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hahaha! Such power! Nothing can stop me!

obj.n: 蘇る古の武器（スファライ）

quest.name: 竜の眼
journal: Ywain seeks your aid in assisting an old friend.
An Ishgardian friend of Ywain's requires aid, and the guildmaster would have you provide it. Make your way to the Observatorium and seek out the man, a knight by the name of Ser Alberic.

Ser Alberic has enlisted your aid in tracking down the Eye, a priceless Ishgardian relic that has been spirited away by a rogue dragoon named Estinien. Consult with Logedanrel for insight as to where the fugitive may have traveled.
Logedanrel suggests that you speak to the sentry Idristan at Florentel's Spire and inquire as to whether he has seen a man matching Estinien's description.
Idristan of Florentel's Spire insists that no dragoon in black armor has crossed the border. Return to Logedanrel and inform him that your trip was unfruitful.
Logedanrel suspects that the fugitive might still be in hiding within Ishgardian borders. Search the cavern east of the Observatorium for signs of a visitor.
Upon searching the campfire, you were ambushed by a dragoon clad in black steel. Return to Ser Alberic and tell him of your encounter.

Upon hearing of your encounter, Ser Alberic confesses to you the truth. The dragoon you encountered was indeed Estinien, who is no ordinary thief, but rather the Azure Dragoon─the chosen one─and a former pupil of Ser Alberic's. Convinced that you have been chosen by the Eye, Ser Alberic tasks you with retrieving the relic from Estinien.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Speak with Ser Alberic at the Observatorium.
Speak with Logedanrel.
Speak with Idristan at Florentel's Spire.
Speak with Logedanrel at the Observatorium.
Examine the campfire.
Report to Alberic.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, I daresay you might just be the right womanman for the job. The guild has urgent need of a capable lancer for a mission beyond our nation's borders. Hear me out, if you will.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: I've received word from an Ishgardian friend to the effect that he requires our aid. I would have you go and provide that aid.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: As you may already know, due to her ongoing conflict with the dragons, Ishgard has kept her gates closed to outsiders for some time. The occasional dragoon on patrol duty is about all folk see these days.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: In spite of her self-imposed isolation, however, the Holy See has never failed to honor her obligations to her allies.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: It is only fitting that we answer the call and lend what assistance we can. To this end, we offered to dispatch a contingent of Wood Wailers with all haste─but were politely informed that they would not be welcome, much to our initial confusion.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: It was later explained that we are dealing with a matter of some sensitivity, best handled by individuals who are capable and trustworthy, yet unbound by allegiance─and who fits that description save adventurers?

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Secrecy being paramount, I can provide no details as to the nature of the task. All you need to know will be revealed at the rendezvous point.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Should you accept the mission, take yourself to the Observatorium. A knight by the name of Ser Alberic will receive you upon arrival.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be the adventurer of whom Ywain sent word. Greetings and well met.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I am Ser Alberic Bale, knight of Ishgard. The Holy See is much obliged to you for your aid.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Time being of the essence, I shall proceed straight to the heart of the matter. The Eye, an Ishgardian relic of immeasurable worth, has been stolen, and we have reason to believe the culprit has come this way. So it is that we ask your assistance in its recovery.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The thief has been identified as a man named Estinien, a dragoon sworn to the service of the Holy See. Aye, you heard true: the crime was perpetrated by one of our own; an individual in a position of trust and no little honor... You may be assured that a fate worse than death awaits him upon capture.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: My duties to the See afford me little opportunity to travel far beyond the walls of Ishgard. I must confess to a grave ignorance of recent Gridanian affairs.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I was told that a sentry by the name of Logedanrel might have knowledge of routes oft taken by Ishgardian fugitives. I would prefer to keep my identity a secret, and thus would have you gather what information you can from the man.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: We must act quickly. For you see, Estinien is...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: ...But I have already said too much. What matters is that we find our thief and the Eye with all haste. When last sighted, Estinien was clad in black armor. Now go, and speak not a word of what I have told you to anyone.

dialogue.name: LOGEDANREL
dialogue.text: Routes favored by Ishgardian fugitives? Now that's a question I don't hear every day. You aren't plotting some unsavory act yourself, are you?

dialogue.name: LOGEDANREL
dialogue.text: Even if you were, I doubt you'd make it far. Anyroad, we've caught a few fleeing to the North Shroud. What with Gridania being home to nearly as many Elezen as Ishgard, it is no easy task to identify outsiders.

dialogue.name: LOGEDANREL
dialogue.text: If you're on the hunt for someone, you could do worse than to visit Florentel's Spire in the North Shroud and speak with a man named Idristan. If any suspicious persons have crossed the border in recent days, he'd be the first to know.

dialogue.name: IDRISTAN
dialogue.text: Hail, adventurer. Yes, I am the one tasked with monitoring those who would enter our lands by way of Coerthas. Hm? An Ishgardian knight clad in black armor?

dialogue.name: IDRISTAN
dialogue.text: No, I recall nothing of the sort─and such a striking visitor would be difficult to forget. My apologies, friend. I can only suggest that you return to Logedanrel and see if he has any other theories.

dialogue.name: LOGEDANREL
dialogue.text: No luck, you say? Most curious. Why, it is nigh impossible that a fugitive could make it this far without being espied from Florentel's Spire.

dialogue.name: LOGEDANREL
dialogue.text: Which leaves the possibility that your man is still in Ishgard. It runs counter to good sense─would the fugitive not want to put a distance of grounds between him and his pursuers?─but by the process of deduction, it is a possibility.

dialogue.name: LOGEDANREL
dialogue.text: The climes of Ishgard are not kind to drifters and vagabonds. That said, there has been talk of curious smoke wafting from a cave east of here, at night. Were I you, I might begin my search there.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: That Ishgard would resort to sending coin-starved adventurers after me... I know not whether to laugh or feel insulted.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Th-The Eye! It rouses...for another!?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Preposterous...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Our paths shall cross again. You can be sure of it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: A dragoon clad in black, you say!? Tell me all that transpired!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: By the Fury... That the Eye would choose another...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I had not thought it possible. In light of recent events, it would seem an explanation is in order.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The Eye is no ordinary relic. It harbors the power of the dragon, which it bestows upon a single chosen soul─the strongest and wisest dragoon.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: He who is chosen is possessed of the power to fight our mortal foes, the dragons of Dravania, on equal footing, soaring the firmament as if it were an extension of the land. That man is known as the Azure Dragoon.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The Azure Dragoon is the light of hope for all Ishgardians, and the paragon of all dragoons.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: ...For this reason, you may imagine how it pains me to have to confess that the man you encountered, the thief, is none other than the Azure Dragoon...and that I was once his teacher.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Needless to say, I acknowledge myself accountable for Estinien's misdeeds, and mean to do all in my power to find him and recover the Eye. But I cannot do this alone.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I require your help, Forename─you, who have received the power of the dragon.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You may labor to believe it, but there can be no mistake. The Soul of the Dragoon I bear glows in your presence─irrefutable proof that you are chosen. What I can ill explain, however, is the why of it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Never before in Ishgard's long history has the Eye roused to more than one individual in a single generation. But it avails us naught to cudgel our brains about it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The fact of the matter is that you are now a vessel for the power of the dragon. That dragon lies yet in slumber, however, and you must needs possess the means to wake it: the Soul of the Dragoon. I would entrust you with mine, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Like Estinien, I once ruled the skies as the Azure Dragoon, although that power has since become lost to me. It was simply by force of habit that I have hitherto kept the soul upon my person.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I have no inkling as to why the Eye has seen fit to choose a second, and an outsider at that.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Yet one thing is clear: none can challenge the Azure Dragoon and conceivably prevail save another Azure Dragoon.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You are our only hope of bringing Estinien to justice and reclaiming the Eye. Of course, I do not ask that you do this unaided. I may be a dragoon no more, but what knowledge I have, I shall gladly impart to you.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: For indeed, when the time comes that you must face the Azure Dragoon, naught less than complete mastery over the power of the dragon will avail you.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: That a perilous road lies ahead of you, I shall not deny. Knowing this, if you would still lend me your lance, I will teach you to harness the power that has chosen you.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Go forth, my young dragoon, and rouse the dragon within. I look forward to your return.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

quest.name: 戦神の槍
journal: Ser Alberic would have you undertake a trial.

The fugitive Estinien is known to be one of the most formidable dragoons in Ishgardian history. To fully prepare you for the pursuit of such a dangerous opponent, Ser Alberic would have you undergo further training. Make your way to Witchdrop in the central highlands of Coerthas, and seek out the knight Ser Brucemont.
You have successfully passed the surprise trial set on you by Ser Brucemont. Speak with the knight once more to see what he has to say.
Your passing the trial has earned you Ser Brucemont's grudging respect. Return to the Observatorium and inform Ser Alberic of what has transpired.

Ser Alberic observes that the soul of the dragon grows ever stronger within you. Continue to hone your skills, that one day you may face Estinien as his equal.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Speak with Brucemont.
Report to Alberic.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: It is pleasing to see how readily the dragon stirs within you. You show great potential, Forename─a potential that may well prove the difference between victory and defeat.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Estinien is no ordinary dragoon. Even when set against the legendary Azures of ages past, the man is considered second to none. Such is his prowess, in fact, that the day he was chosen by the Eye, it was proclaimed that Haldrath the Dragonseye had been reborn.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I mean not to disparage your skills, Forename, but to pursue Estinien in your current state would be tantamount to suicide. As promised, I shall train you in the way of the dragoon, that you might face Estinien as an equal.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Before we commence, however, it is only fitting that you are edified regarding our origins. It all began a millennium past, when our forebears resided in the southern plains in humble circumstances.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The Fury, impressed by the spirit of our ancestors, decided it was meet that She make them Her own. So did She appear before Haldrath's sire, a man of courage and integrity named Thordan, and bade him lead Her people to the Promised Land─to what would become the great nation of Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Their journey brought them to a wide chasm, whereupon Thordan and his people set to building a bridge. It was then that a dark shadow descended upon them─the great wyrm Nidhogg. Heedless of his own safety, Thordan fearlessly charged at the colossal beast. Alas, he was pushed into the chasm by one of his own, a man seduced by the wyrm, and fell to his death.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Taking up his slain sire's lance, Haldrath hurled himself at Nidhogg, even as tears streamed down his face. The confrontation ended when the young man, his hand guided by Halone, landed a mighty thrust that prised out Nidhogg's eye. With a terrible roar of pain, the great wyrm took wing and fled, while jubilation reigned below.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ishgard's priceless relic is none other than the eye taken from Nidhogg that day. It is a veritable wellspring of dragon power─even so removed from its owner, it can exert control over the hearts of men.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Haldrath himself felt its malign influence, but his love of justice brooked no corruption, and he prevailed over the power, claiming it for his own. And so it was that the first Azure Dragoon was born.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Being derived from our foe, the power of the dragon is a thing to be loathed.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But as Haldrath proved to us all, so long as our hearts burn with justice, we need not fear being taken in its thrall.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, but what is justice, precisely? Justice assumes many shapes and forms, Forename, and none can say that one is greater than another. So long as you hold fast to your beliefs and stay true to yourself, you leave no room for the power of the dragon to master you.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But enough of history─let us return our attention to the present. A knight by the name of Ser Brucemont will see to the next stage of your training. Seek him out at Witchdrop.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: So the adventurer seeks to become a dragoon. Hah! Ser Alberic speaks of legends and chosen ones, but I would see you prove yourself in a more practical fashion─with your lance. Defend yourself!

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: You have some skill─I will give you that. And the glow of your soul crystal...perhaps Ser Alberic was not wrong about you, after all. Now return to him─your training here is complete.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The soul of the dragon grows ever stronger within you, Forename. Clearly, your trial was a rousing success─I need only observe your crystal to know as much.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Yes. Though you have only just begun to walk the path of the dragoon, it is clear you possess the talent to become Estinien's equal. Go forth and make the powers you have obtained your own. When the time is right, we shall proceed with your training.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 消えぬ爪痕
journal: Ser Alberic would send you on your next trial.
After further enlightening you on the history of Ishgard and the dragoons, Ser Alberic sends you off to undertake your next trial. Travel once again to Witchdrop and seek out Ser Heustienne.

After meeting with Ser Heustienne of Ishgard, you are set upon by a bevy of banemites. The beasts have proven no match for your skill with the lance, however, and they have been put down. Speak again with the knight.
Ser Heustienne is impressed with your abilities, which remind her of Estinien himself. Return and inform Ser Alberic that you have passed your trial.

Ser Alberic is pleased to see you pass your most challenging trial yet. He encourages you to continue your training in earnest, assuring you that the day when you may stand before Estinien as his equal is not far off.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Speak with Heustienne.
Report to Alberic.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You grow ever stronger, and I speak of more than just the flesh. Aye, you are slowly but surely realizing your potential as an Azure Dragoon. It is heartening to look upon...though I must confess that my presiding feeling is one of relief. You must understand, the mere thought that the Eye would choose an outsider─one who ill comprehends the threat posed by the dragons─filled me with the gravest of misgivings. Yet you have... Ah, but I shall say no more, lest flattery impede your improvement!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now, during our last lesson, I enlightened you regarding the origins of dragoons. You will recall how Haldrath heroically triumphed over the great wyrm Nidhogg, and Ishgard came into possession of the Eye.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Tell me, Forename─do you believe that these events truly transpired? Or are you inclined to think them faerie tales? I ask you this because few folk have seen dragons in the flesh besides we Ishgardians, and most would as soon dismiss them as products of the imagination.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Alas, dragons are no less real than you and I, with Nidhogg perhaps the most real of all. In the course of its history, Ishgard has suffered the creature's wrath on eight separate occasions. Each time the great wyrm rouses, the blood of countless Ishgardians is spilled.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Let us revisit the past once more, Forename. The time is twenty summers past, and the place Dravania.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: After a century in slumber, Nidhogg awakened once more to resume his reign of terror. Entire villages were razed to the ground, their inhabitants reduced to smoldering ash.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Sensing the great wyrm's unbridled rage, others of his kind began to rouse, and in such numbers as to blot out the sun with their wings. A deep, foreboding darkness swept over Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text:
Raging infernos painting the belly of the sky an angry red... The agonized screams of innocents fading into deathly silence...
In my station as the Azure Dragoon, I was there through it all─bore witness to all the horrors.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But there was no time to offer even a silent prayer. Nidhogg lingered in one place only long enough to lay it to waste, and when he took wing, so too did I pursue him, a man possessed. This game of cat and mouse continued for what seemed an eternity before I found myself face-to-face with the great wyrm.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text:
The battle unfolded in a tiny settlement on the edge of Coerthas, raging on for three days and three nights with neither side able to gain a decisive advantage. Remaining on my feet by sheer force of will, I realized that it must end now else it shouldn't end well.
Marshaling my last onze of strength, I wagered all on a single thrust.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: My lance struck home, burying deep in the ruin of my opponent's empty eye socket. Yet before I could withdraw my weapon, the wyrm lashed out wildly in its agony, dealing a blow that left me sprawled upon the scorched earth, nigh insensate.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: In that instant, I thought myself surely doomed...but Halone was not finished with me. Having lost the taste for battle, Nidhogg let loose a bloodcurdling roar before fleeing to the sky. The battle was over.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: While I did not perish from my injuries, they rendered my body unfit to bear the power of the dragon, and I was Azure Dragoon no more. Lying bedridden, my thoughts wandered to all the innocent lives that had been lost─the people I had failed to protect.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: That last conflict with the dragons of Dravania left countless orphans in its wake. Estinien is one of them, the sole survivor of Ferndale, the final village to suffer Nidhogg's wrath.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: With none left to care for him, I did the only thing I could: I took Estinien as mine own son, instructing him in the way of the dragoon when he was of an age to learn. Yet I would not have you think me noble. My actions were born not of compassion but of guilt. My guilt at having failed him.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But alas, I have also failed him as a father. For what manner of man did I bring him up to be? A thief who would endanger the life of every one of his countrymen.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Aye, you heard me right─all of Ishgard may suffer for his crime. Though we know little and less of the minds of dragons, it is conceivable that the disturbance surrounding his stolen eye will rouse Nidhogg to awaken once more. That his kin have already stirred from their slumber serves as fair warning of that.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Time is not on our side. Fortunately, it would seem you are more than ready to embark on your next trial.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Make your way to Witchdrop, where the knight Heustienne awaits your arrival. My nation is depending on you, Forename.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: You are the one who would aspire to be Azure Dragoon? Why, you are not even of Ishgard! If you truly possess the power that Ser Alberic sees in you, then prove it to me with your lance. En garde!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: That strength... I have not seen its like since Estinien himself stood before me. Mayhap Ser Alberic has the right of it, after all. Return and show your crystal to him─I have no doubt he will be pleased.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You have passed yet another trial with flying colors, Forename. The day when you may stand before Estinien as an equal is not far off.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: And when that day comes, the Eye will choose you over the traitor─I have no doubt of this. But we must be patient still. For now, you must continue your training. When you can do no more on your own, seek me out once more.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 双竜の邂逅
journal: Ser Alberic has been eagerly awaiting your arrival.

Much to Ser Alberic's surprise, the fugitive Estinien has initiated contact, saying that he has an important matter to discuss with the two of you. Travel to Boulder Downs and await his arrival at the designated rendezvous point.

Estinien explains that he did not steal the Eye out of treachery, but rather to spare Ishgard from Nidhogg's wrath when the great wyrm returns. Upon realizing that you have been chosen as a second Azure Dragoon, he proposes that the two of you slay the ancient dragon together. Return to the Observatorium and speak with Ser Alberic for instructions on how to procure the armor necessary for the task.
Ser Alberic explains that you must earn your drachen armor as the Azure Dragoons before you did─by trial. Travel to the Ogre's Belly and seek out Ser Brucemont.
You have passed the first trial. Speak with Ser Brucemont and obtain your reward.
The trials continue. Advance to the next chamber and speak with Ser Heustienne.
You have passed the second trial. Speak with Ser Heustienne and obtain your reward.
Yet another challenge awaits you. Advance further within the cavern and speak with Ser Brucemont.
You have triumphed over the third trial set to you. Speak again with Ser Brucemont.
You have obtained the third piece of the set of drachen armor. Return to the Observatorium and tell Ser Alberic of your success.
Ser Alberic informs you that one final trial awaits you. Travel to the graveyard northwest of the Steel Vigil, blow a single note with the flute provided to you, and see to the visitor that arrives.
You have slain a mighty dragon of the Dravanian Horde and claimed its skull. Present it to Ser Alberic as proof of your victory.

Upon receiving the skull, Ser Alberic offers congratulations and presents you with the fourth piece of drachen armor. Though the fifth piece remains beyond your grasp, the old dragoon assures you of your readiness to complete your training. However, he would ask you to reaffirm your commitment before proceeding. If you are truly prepared to embark with Estinien to do battle with the great wyrm Nidhogg, speak with Ser Alberic once more.
objectives: Wait for Estinien at the rendezvous point.
Speak with Alberic.
Speak with Brucemont and complete the trial.
Obtain drachen armor from Brucemont.
Speak with Heustienne and complete the trial.
Obtain drachen armor from Heustienne.
Speak with Brucemont and complete the trial.
Obtain drachen armor from Brucemont.
Speak with Alberic.
Play the flute and complete the final trial.
Deliver the draconian flute and Horde skull to Alberic.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Impeccable timing, Forename. A message arrived from Estinien but moments ago, much to my astonishment. He would trade words with us, and bids us meet him at Boulder Downs.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: As to his true intentions, I cannot say. It may well be a trap, but we must go nonetheless. I trust I can count upon your company.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Greetings, Master. It has been too long.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Estinien, end this folly at once! You must know that each second the Eye passes outside Ishgard's walls brings us closer to a repeat of the tragedy of twenty summers past. Surrender yourself and the Eye, and return with me to Ishgard before it is too late.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Ah, but it is already too late, Master. For you see, Nidhogg has already awakened.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hear me, Master: you have mistaken the cause of the dragons' return─the Eye is not to blame.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: A premonition came to me by virtue of the dragon within, warning me that the great wyrm would soon rouse.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Even as he slumbered, Nidhogg seethed with irrepressible rancor for that wound of twenty years ago. That rancor will send him flying as a speeding arrow to Ishgard, whereupon death and devastation will ensue.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But there is a possible solution: were the Eye taken to a remote land, far from the Holy See─then, and only then, could destruction be averted and the lives of innocent Ishgardians be spared.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text:
Y-You mean to make a bait of yourself!?
...Nay, there is more to this than you let on. You seek vengeance for Ferndale.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: To me, the two are one and the same. You know my past better than any else. It was for no other reason than to avenge my family that I became a dragoon.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Dragons long outlive men and do not soon forget the wrongs done them. What grudge they harbor burns as a fire in their hearts, over time swelling into an unquenchable inferno. You need only look back on history to see that Nidhogg grows stronger with each awakening.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: When last he darkened our skies, the great wyrm came within a hair's breadth of laying waste to Ishgard. Naught short of death will prevent him from completing his mission when next he wakes. Nidhogg took everything from me─now I shall take everything from him, even if it means my life.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The Eye works in ways men can ill comprehend, but this much is plain: in choosing two Azure Dragoons in one generation, it means for us to join together in common cause.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Adventurer. You have heard my resolution. Now I ask that you lend me your power─aye, the power of the dragon.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: In the long and proud history of Ishgard, never before have two Azure Dragoons arisen in the same era to fight as one. This is our best─nay, our only─chance to send the great wyrm to eternal slumber.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Behold my armor. This is the drachen mail, forged in the lifeblood of dragons. As blood calls to blood, so too does the armor call to the dragon within, redoubling the wearer's strength thereby. If you would realize your potential as an Azure Dragoon, you must needs clad yourself in the same.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Clad so, you will inherit the technique passed from Azure Dragoon to Azure Dragoon down through the generations. Then─and only then─will your training be complete.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But first, you must win the drachen mail as I and Ser Alberic did before you, by proving yourself worthy in the ultimate trial of the Azure─a series of battles so harrowing as to send the unworthy to an early demise.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Master. Once the adventurer acquires the armor, pray see to it that shehe learns to harness the power of the dragon in full.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Estinien, wait!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Save your worries. I do not mean to make myself easy prey for dragons.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I take my leave of you.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Estinien...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: F-Forgive me. I was deep in thought. Now then, as to acquiring the armor of which Estinien spoke...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: At first, it was my intention to bequeath mine own armor to you. I am an Azure Dragoon no longer, and its powers are wasted on me. It would be simple enough to hand it over to you and complete your training right here and now.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But it is as Estinien said: the drachen armor is no ordinary set of mail. Its strength derives from the dragon blood whence it came, the blood's power resonating with the soul of the wearer.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Though I can no longer draw upon mine own armor's power, its bond to me was forged years ago. Were I to bestow it on you now, I fear it would offer but a scintilla of the protection it afforded me in those bygone days.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Aye, Estinien has the right of it: you must claim your armor as he and I did before you. You must complete the trials of the Azure, that the powers of dragon blood be yours and yours alone.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The Ogre's Belly will be where your final test begins. I shall dispatch Ser Brucemont there. Seek him out upon your arrival.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: You have grown strong since we last met, adventurer, but you pale in comparison with your Azure forebears. If you would prove me wrong, let your lance do the talking.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: Once again, adventurer, you prove yourself worthy beyond my expectations. Take this, but know that your trial has only just begun.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: Your next challenge lies in the chamber beyond. Ser Heustienne awaits you there.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: You, a foreigner, would don the drachen armor? Then prove to us that you will not do it dishonor!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Ser Alberic said the Eye had chosen you, and it would appear he speaks true. The armor is yours─wear it with pride and honor.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Your trial is nigh complete, but be forewarned: many before you have made it this far, only to fall at the final challenge. Do not let overconfidence be your downfall.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: So you have made it this far. Very well. Prove yourself worthy of the Azure, or die in the effort!

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: You have demonstrated your powers to me beyond a doubt─aye, there is not an Ishgardian who would gainsay your right to don the armor of dragons.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: I shall send word ahead to Ser Alberic that you have passed your trials here. It is he who will present you with the fourth piece of armor, and consummate your training. Go now, my fellow dragoon, and deliver this land from the great wyrm's wrath.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I hear from Ser Brucemont that you performed most impressively. Yes, I stand more convinced than ever that you will be the one to save our land. Yet be warned, Forename: one last trial awaits you.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You will face this trial in the presence not of knights, but of ghosts. Make your way toward the Steel Vigil, and seek out a gravestone north and west of the structure.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Take with you this flute, and when you reach your destination, blow a single strong note. A visitor shall soon arrive. Entertain your guest, and should he leave behind a present, return it here to me.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Your presence before me indicates you've seen to the visitor. Have you aught to show for your deeds?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, the skull of Greywine, old warrior of the Dravanian Horde. It's said that in ages past, he could bring down a castle with a single breath. His strength has dwindled since those days, but a dragon past his prime is a formidable foe nonetheless. In slaying him, you have proven yourself worthy of this.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You now possess four pieces of the armor that Estinien, myself, and our forebears did wear. While you doubtless wonder about the fifth, I can tell you only that it is not mine to give. Fear not, however─your triumphs in the trials and against a dragon of the Horde give evidence that drachen blood now resonates with yours. Yes, you stand before me as prepared for your ultimate challenge as any could be.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: And yet, before we proceed, I would hear it from your own lips. The great wyrm's power is the stuff of legends. Have you truly resolved to fight this battle? To risk your own life to deliver a foreign land from the clutches of its ancient foe? When you are certain that your mind is settled, return and speak to me.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

obj.n: ドラケンガントレット

quest.name: 邪竜の声
journal: Ser Alberic would ask you to reaffirm your commitment to do battle with the great wyrm.

After telling you the tale of how he came to abandon the power of the dragon and warning you against being consumed by the same, Ser Alberic sends you off to further your skill with the lance. Play the flute at the specified location and slay the dragon that it summons forth.
You have slain the winged terror Archaeoaevis in a battle you will not soon forget. Return the flute to Ser Alberic and recount to him every last detail.

The soul of the dragon having fully awakened within you, you now stand as a full-fledged Azure Dragoon. Make your newfound powers your own, that you may be fully prepared to join Estinien in battle with the great wyrm.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Use the flute to summon a dragon and slay it.
Return the flute to Alberic.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: So you would join your strength to Estinien's, that Ishgard might be free from the rage of the great wyrm forevermore?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Then I shall honor my promise. You shall have full use of your powers by the time we are done.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Before we begin, there is something I must needs confess. You will recall the tale of my battle with Nidhogg twenty years past, and how the power of the dragon left me on account of the injuries I sustained.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: What I said was an untruth. The power did not abandon me, Forename. It was I who abandoned it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Being derived from our mortal enemies, the power of the Azure Dragoon is a double-edged sword. Even as it lends us the strength we need to smite dragons, it heightens our communion with the creatures, rendering our minds more susceptible to their seduction than ordinary men.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Even as I buried my lance in Nidhogg's flesh, our gazes locked, and mine eyes met then with a look that would fair impale a man. In that instant, I found myself assailed by a torrent of emotions not mine own...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Sorrow... Rancor... Pity... They threatened to drown the man in me and leave behind a dragon.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Fearing that I might turn traitor, I chose to purge myself of the power that the Eye had bestowed upon me.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Thus regaining lucidity, I was able to rout the grievously wounded Nidhogg.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Alas, countless of his brethren yet remained. As if to mock me, they fell upon Ferndale with a vengeance. Bereft of my power, it was all I could do to save but one child.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Nary a soul knows of this. Nay, not even Estinien...but I can keep him in the dark no longer.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: At our last meeting, Estinien said that protecting Ishgard and exacting revenge upon Nidhogg are as one to him.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: That frame of mind, I fear, may well lead to his demise. The desire to protect and the desire to avenge are opposing forces that can ill be reconciled. Worse, the latter serves only to cloud his sense of self.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: When next Estinien and I meet, I intend to confess all, though it mean the loss of his good opinion. The outcome of the coming battle─and his very life─may well depend upon his readiness to relinquish his powers.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Never allow yourself to forget the origin of your strength. Ever does the dragon lurk behind your eyes, biding its time, ready to claim you for its own.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Aught less than complete conviction, and you will find yourself in its vicelike clutches. So forewarned, let us return to our present endeavor.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: My promise to Estinien was that I would impart unto you the technique that will mark you as a true Azure Dragoon. If you would know the truth, however, this knowledge is not within my power to bestow.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: No, you must claim the technique much as you claimed the fourth piece of the armor you bear─by proving yourself in battle with the dragons whose power you would unite with your own.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I entrust you with this flute once more. Take it to the southwest of Providence Point and blow a single note. By locking wills with your adversary and prevailing, you will prove yourself worthy to champion the cause to which your lance is sworn. The dragon within you shall then awaken.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: It is good to see you safely returned. I take from your bearing that the engagement went favorably?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You left this place as a womanman, Forename, but you return as a dragon. There is no more for me to teach you. From here, your battle is yours and yours alone.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now, you might recall me saying that the fifth and final piece of the drachen armor was not mine to give... However, that is not wholly true. Aye, I could guide you in the direction of that which you seek.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: That said, I yet have reservations. The sheer power of the dragon housed within is such that a great many of your Azure forebears─myself among them─have proven hopelessly incapable of wielding it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But I do not doubt what I see. Aye, within you has awakened a strength that forever eluded the likes of me. If you are not worthy of wearing the armor, then I know none who are.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Remember my warning to you, Forename, and heed it well. Nidhogg is a lord among his kind. Aught less than complete conviction, and you will surely fall under his thrall.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Before you can master your foe, you must needs master yourself. Hone your lance arm till it can bear no further honing, and then present yourself to me. When the time is come, I will tell you what you need to know.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I look forward to our next meeting, my young dragoon.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 蒼の竜騎士
journal: Ser Alberic wears a solemn expression on his face.

Ser Alberic has received a message from Estinien, who intends to strike against Nidhogg straightaway. Travel with Ser Alberic to the Steel Vigil, that you might share the truth of Ferndale with the young dragoon before the battle is joined.

You and Ser Alberic locate Estinien, but the fugitive dragoon has already learned the truth of the past on his own. Enraged at what he perceives to be Ser Alberic's failure to defend his home, Estinien turns upon you. Your virtuous spirit and mastery of the lance, however, prove more than a match for your adversary, and the being of darkness vanishes from sight, taking the fallen dragoon with it. Return to the Observatorium to hear Ser Alberic's thoughts on the matter.

Shaken but no worse for the wear, Ser Alberic welcomes you back. Nidhogg's aura now subsided, his scalekin will return to slumber for the time being. Though concerned for Estinien's fate, Ser Alberic is heartened by your accomplishments, which give him newfound hope for the future. Until such time as the great wyrm wakes again, go forth as the Azure Dragoon and use your newfound strength in the name of justice.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Rendezvous with Estinien.
Speak with Alberic.
Defeat Estinien!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! An urgent message arrived from Estinien in your absence. He bids you come at once to the Steel Vigil. It would seem Nidhogg is on the move─and rather sooner than we had anticipated.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: It appears you have not yet fully become master of the dragon within you, and yet we are racing against time. I fear we have no choice but to do battle to the best of your current abilities, and without the drachen mail I promised.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now let us away. Estinien must know the truth of Ferndale, lest he fall for the great wyrm's seduction.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Alberic. I have waited long for this day.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You, who fancy yourself an Azure Dragoon. The man whose cause you have taken for your own is a coward. He relinquished the power of the dragon of his own volition and watched as Ferndale burned.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Do you not think it ironic that I was chosen Azure Dragoon? I, an orphan who has naught of value to protect in Ishgard?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I suppose I must give thanks, for it was the Eye that revealed to me the truth─a truth so damning as to undo a lifetime of trust. I loved you as a father...but I can ill forgive you for Ferndale.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: As I understand it, you've kept even the archbishop in the dark regarding the missing Eye. Do you mean to take your shame to your grave?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: But I waste my breath. Prepare yourself, old man, for I shall lay to waste all the things you hold dear. And once I'm finished with you, I shall do what no Azure Dragoon has succeeded in doing─I shall claim Nidhogg's head!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, Estinien!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Your rage renders you vulnerable to the dragon's influence!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Forename...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: In you, I thought I had found kindred, someone beside whom I could fight the great wyrm.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It is with a heavy heart that I relinquish that dream. Your affection for this coward has rendered you deaf to your own destiny.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Very well. That we would one day cross lances was inevitable from the moment of our first meeting─as we shall now find out who is the Eye's true chosen. There can be only one!

dialogue.name: DRAGON
dialogue.text: (-Voice from Within-)Feeble creature... Dost thou desire power?

dialogue.name: DRAGON
dialogue.text: (-Voice from Within-)Look to thine anger and to thy hatred... It is there that thou shalt find it...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: O mighty Nidhogg! Lord of Dragons!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Grant unto me thy blood, that I might be granted the claws and fangs wherewith to rend thine enemies!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: ...Forename!? Th-This is impossible! It cannot be!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Estinien... I have failed you once again...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I am fine, Forename. Somewhat shaken, but otherwise whole of body. Suffice it to say I have much to reflect upon. Let us return to the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: When the being of darkness closed upon us, you appeared to me the spitting image of Haldrath the Dragonseye, just as he is depicted in the holy scriptures.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I thought that mayhap the years had taken their toll on my mind, but behold─the Soul of the Dragoon shines as it never did in all the years I bore it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: It would seem you have achieved that which was thought impossible: you have awakened to the ability that none but the first Azure Dragoon possessed.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Truly, a momentous achievement. I can still scarce believe that you were able to summon the selfsame drachen mail worn by Haldrath! To think that it had been sealed within the soul crystal all this time...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I have borne witness to many and more wonders over the years, yet none compares to you, my young dragoon. Could it be that you are...?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ahem. Mark not my mutterings. I am certain that it was your indomitable sense of justice that resonated with the spirit of the first Azure Dragoon, prompting him to bestow the armor upon you. Yes, that is doubtless what happened.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: As the being of darkness faded, so too did Nidhogg's aura subside. And now his kind have ceased their stirring. Whether this was compelled by your awakening, I cannot say. I suspect we will learn the truth of it eventually.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Estinien, my dear boy... Whatever becomes of him, he will ever be as a son to me.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I pray that he is somewhere out there still...and that he has not wholly forgotten the great man he once was.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: When that darkness brushed against me, the selfsame torrent of emotions swept over me as those I experienced twenty summers past.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But there was something else besides. There was a voice, and it lamented the rift that divides dragons and men.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You will come to comprehend what I speak in due time. Till then, Forename, I pray that you will ever use your newfound strength in the name of justice.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the dragoon quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I am the Eye's true chosen...
And you shall know it when I bury my lance in your chest!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Estinien, stop this madness!
You and Forename were meant to be allies, not enemies!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Ah, yes...the power of the Eye.
But it cannot compare to mine own!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You have awakened the dragon, Forename!
Now my flames shall consume you whole!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Power! I must have more power!
O, Lord of Dragons, grant me strength to raze thine enemies!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Estinien! Surrender not to the beast within!
Have you forgotten the vows you swore!?

obj.n: 蘇る古の武器（ゲイボルグ）

quest.name: 声を聞きし者
journal: Yayake has need of a talented thaumaturge.

Yayake of Arrzaneth Ossuary has asked you to ascertain the truth of a prophecy being spoken by one Ququruka, a prisoner who claims to hear the voice of Nald'thal. To do this, proceed to Highbridge in eastern Thanalan and investigate the planar fissure that is said to be there. Once looked into, fell any fiends that emerge, and secure a vial of their blood.
You have obtained a vial of fresh blood. Pour it into the planar fissure that remains.

After pouring the voidsent blood into the planar fissure, an Amalj'aa named Kazagg Chah appears and presents you with the Gem of Shatotto. Take the gem and word of your feat back to Yayake at the Thaumaturges' Guild.

Yayake is surprised to see that the so-called “prophecy” carried with it some legitimacy, but is even more surprised when the prophecy maker himself, Ququruka, makes an appearance in the guild. After hurling a few well-timed insults in Yayake's general direction, the self-proclaimed black mage bids you proceed to Milvaneth Sacrarium. Once there, speak with his companion, Lalai.

Upon arriving at the Sacrarium, you learn that Ququruka is preoccupied with his meditations, and has entrusted Lalai with guiding you along the path of the black mage. Continue your study into the black arts, and return when you feel the arcane might within you has grown.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Investigate the planar fissure at Highbridge and procure the blood of any fiends that emerge.
Pour the voidsent blood into the planar fissure.
Speak with Yayake at the Thaumaturges' Guild.
Report to Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Forename. I've been waiting for you─in a way. Please, let me explain. Do you know of the Marasaja Pit? It is a prison, here in Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: In prison, a man will do most anything to keep his mind occupied. Of late, one inmate claims to hear the voice of Nald'thal. No doubt he has lost his mind after serving one hundred years of a life sentence.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: But, he knew of you by name, Forename, and maintains the Traders demand you win the Gem of Shatotto and exchange it for his release.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: A farce, no doubt. I make it for nothing more than the maniacal ravings of a cell–crazed, sweaty–toothed madman. But I fear the only way to be sure is to free him of the Pit.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: The prisoner's name is Ququruka Tataruka, and as if his story were not proof enough of his lunacy, he also styles himself a black mage.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: But such magic was lost to Eorzea centuries ago. Who does this senile charlatan think he will fool with such rubbish?

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: <sigh> Nevertheless, he has invoked the name of Nald'thal, and so the Order feels it unwise to ignore his words. Though I am still no believer, you have come, as he said you would.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: So let us get to the bottom of this, shall we? It may be that you are an agent of fate, or perhaps you are merely a crooked old man's accomplice.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: In either case, I ask that you travel to Highbridge in eastern Thanalan. Seek out the planar fissure─a rift between this world and the next. Fell whatever beasts might lurk there, and water the earth with their blood.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: According to our gaoled mummer, doing so will give rise to the Gem of Shatotto.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: The gem is no more than a pretty stone oft mentioned in bedtime stories and the tales of faeries. We shall see if it truly exists.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: I shall await your findings here. Return to me when the deed is done.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: (-???-)[Job], hear me.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Put up your weapon, friend. Kazagg Chah means you no harm.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: So you are the one of whom Ququruka's prophecy speaks.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: By your hand was the blood of these creatures spilt upon this earthen vein, was it not?

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Then you have earned this Gem of Shatotto. Take it. You will know what to do with it when the time comes.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: With this, my part is done. Farewell, for now.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Well, you certainly smell as though you've been off spilling blood. But it will take more than a waft of foulness to convince me you are an agent of divine will. I take it yours was an eventful journey?

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: <gasp> I-It is exactly as described in the tales! Could it truly be...? The Gem of Shatotto?

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Twelve be good, I can feel the magic pulsing within it!

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: The tales tell that only souls blessed by the grace of Nald'thal are entrusted with the keeping of the gem.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: This is beyond mere coincidence. I must investigate further.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: And you must assist me, Forename. This now involves you as much as any other.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Still, I cannot shake my inner skeptic. If Ququruka somehow made contact with the outside world, he may be manipulating adventurers such as yourself for ends yet unknown to us.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: I will call an emergency council of the Order. Please, wait here.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: (-???-)That will not be necessary.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Ququruka!? What are you doing here? How have you escaped the Pit?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Watch your tongue, you insolent fool! Master has passed a century in meditation communing with Nald'thal. You will address him with the proper respect!

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: The gaolers of the Marasaja Pit are very different from the heretics of your Order. Suffice it to say they had wisdom enough to listen.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Must I remind you again? The will I speak is that of Nald'thal Himself. The true criminal is he who ignores the words of a god.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Beware, Ququruka. The Twelve seldom spare those who claim Their voice. This mummer's farce will bring disaster to us all.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: The cause of the disaster to come will be no words of mine─of that be sure.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Nald'thal spoke unto me. By His own declaration, the seal on the voidgate will be broken.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Once thrown open, it can be closed once more by none but shehe who bears the Gem of Shatotto.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: I speak of you, Forename Surname.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: The gem you hold is the mark of a mage of the black. With it in hand, you must now set forth to gather the keys needed to seal the voidgate.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Wait! You can't─ I mean, you don't have the right to─ I...I can't just let this happen!

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Silence, you hollow-pated prig! Those who do not listen shall not be heard!

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: You take for yourself the title of thaumaturge, and so I will not suffer you to claim ignorance. You know as well as any of the existence of a netherworld rife with shadow and monstrosity─the void.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: As the power of the void waxes, the barrier between it and our own world wanes. Eventually, that barrier will falter, and the voidgate will open.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Once it has, only the black magic of eld can reseal it.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: This... This is sacrilege!

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: As one who now commands the forces of destruction, I bid you go forth, black mage.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: The Gem of Shatotto is our sigil─the mark of the magi devoted to the true dark art. In it, you already possess the first key required to see the voidgate sealed.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: You have taken the black, but time is needed before the black takes you─before it permeates mind and body, and colors every fiber of your being dark as pitch.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Visit Milvaneth Sacrarium, and there hear the words of Lalai.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Do not fear the power to destroy. Master it, and with it destroy that which would destroy you.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Master is meditating in his chambers. For Nald'thal always speaks, and Master must listen. He has entrusted me with guiding you on your path─but you must walk alone yet. Come again when the black has grown stronger within you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

obj.n: 呪術士ギルド受付 ヤヤケ

quest.name: 時を告げし血
journal: Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium has guidance for those seeking the black.

You learn from Lalai that when a new light shines from the black mage's testimony you carry, you are to obtain the key to reseal the voidgate. To fulfill this prophecy, you must travel to the Sagolii Desert in southern Thanalan, and slay the fiends that emerge from the planar fissure. After having done so, collect their blood to use it as a sacrifice.
You have obtained yet another vial of voidsent blood. Pour it into the planar fissure that yet remains.
You have poured the sacrificial voidsent blood into the planar fissure. Take word of your feat back to Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

Lalai explains that your skill in the dark arts must be tempered further before the next task can be laid before you. Continue your training so that you will be prepared when the next challenge comes.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Investigate the planar fissure in the Sagolii Desert and procure the blood of any fiends that emerge.
Pour the voidsent blood into the planar fissure.
Report to Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I sense the black magic within you has grown stronger, Forename. You have earned the right of my audience.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I am pleased to see that you do not fear your newfound powers. But then, you adventurers were ever wont to embrace the new.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: You are now ready to set forth on your journey─to find the keys required to seal the voidgate. Hear me well, for mine are Master's own words, and his those of Nald'thal Himself.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “The next key requires the blood of sacrifice.

dialogue.name: LALAI
