dialogue.text: “Travel to the Sagolii Desert in southern Thanalan. Slay what fiends emerge from the planar fissure there, and slake the land's thirst with their lifeblood.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “Once drunk, its essence shall be borne away upon the aetherial veins of the earth, and thence serve to notify our friends in the wastelands that the time has come.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “Complete the task before you, and the black mage testimony you carry will shine full with a new light. Light to envelop and absorb evil. Light to show you destruction and guide you to righteousness. This light is the key. Take it into you, where it will forever burn bright.”

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...That is all. Do you understand and accept what you must do?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It is done, then. But the blackness you have awoken has yet to settle within you. Time is needed, Forename. Pray be patient.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Continue to practice your mastery of the arcane, and come to me once more when the dark art is as much you as you it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 40.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 異郷なる友
journal: Lalai has another task to strengthen your connection to the black.

Lalai has handed down yet another prophecy from her Master. You are to travel to eastern Thanalan, and once there, enter a cave located behind Burgundy Falls. In its depths, locate and speak with Kazagg Chah, the Amalj'aa who first gifted you with the Gem of Shatotto.

Kazagg Chah believes that you are the [Race] of prophecy, but would have you face death once again so as to prove your readiness to serve your final purpose. When you are fully prepared, journey to the Silent King in western Thanalan and speak with Dozol Meloc.
The Ixal Dozol Meloc has commanded you to close the nearby planar fissure. As before, investigate the fissure and obtain the blood of whatever fiends might emerge from it.
You have slain the dread ahriman which spawned from the fissure. Pour the blood obtained from the voidsent into the remaining planar fissure.
You have closed the planar fissure. Speak again with Dozol Meloc.
The Ixal seems impressed at your skill with the dark magicks. For the next stage of your trial, Dozol Meloc bids you seek out 269th Order Mendicant Da Za north of the Silent King.
It would seem yet another planar fissure exists which must be sealed. Do for Da Za what you did for Dozol Meloc: investigate the fissure and slay any fiends that emerge.
Once again, you have slain the ahriman that came forth from the void and taken a measure of its blood. Pour the liquid into the remaining planar fissure.
You have sealed yet another of the dark voids. Speak with Da Za to hear his thoughts.
Da Za seems to share Dozol Meloc's high opinion of your arcane skills. Report your successes to Kazagg Chah, who has been overseeing the trial.
Kazagg Chah expresses his approval of your showing in the latest trial. He bids you return to Burgundy Falls in eastern Thanalan so that you and he might speak further of the challenges to come.

Having borne witness to both your ability and resolve, Kazagg Chah confides in you the prophetic words of his forebears, and vows to aid however he might in the fulfillment of your purpose.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Kazagg Chah upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Speak with Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls.
Speak with Dozol Meloc at the Silent King.
Investigate the planar fissure and procure the blood of any fiends that emerge.
Pour the voidsent blood into the planar fissure.
Speak with Dozol Meloc.
Speak with 269th Order Mendicant Da Za.
Investigate the planar fissure and procure the blood of any fiends that emerge.
Pour the voidsent blood into the planar fissure.
Speak with 269th Order Mendicant Da Za.
Speak with Kazagg Chah.
Report to Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, I see in your eyes the look of a womanman prepared to take on the daunting responsibilities of the black mage.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: There are few who know of our existence, even among those versed in the ways of magic. You will not even find mention of us in all but the most esoteric of texts.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Yet the secrets of our dark art lie encrypted here, within the forbidden library of this Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Master himself deciphered and read the texts, some hundred years past. It is said the first of our kind were the favored of Nald'thal, and it was He who entrusted them with the duty of sealing the voidgate.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But as you well know, the power of black magic lies in its great potential for destruction. The slightest errancy in its use may give rise to the most tragic of disasters.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Of the disappearance of the black mages from Eorzea, Master says only, “We must not repeat the errors of the past.”

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, Master has made known to me what it is you must next do. Listen to his words now, with all your being...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “The land has drunk deep of the blood you spilled, and by this act, three souls of three races to Thanalan have come.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “The fires of our Order once burned black and full. Yet long ago they were left to wane and very nearly die. These three souls are the keepers of the embers that remain─of all that we now are.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “In the hands of one who will usher our return, the Gem of Shatotto, testimony of our creed, will shine with new light. And by that light, the three keepers will be made your allies.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “An Amalj'aa by the name of Kazagg Chah awaits at Burgundy Falls in the east of Thanalan. Go to him.”

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...That is all. Dwell not on the fact that the Amalj'aa are the sworn enemies of Ul'dah. It is not your place to question Master's will─for it is the will of Nald'thal Himself.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Go forth, black mage, and see the voidgate sealed.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Well come, [Race], chosen of Ququruka and bearer of the Gem of Shatotto.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: By the gem's power do our paths cross once more. At last the time spoken of in the prophecy has come, and yet I know nothing of shehe who would guide us. Come, tell me your name.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Forename Surname. I am Kazagg Chah, a sorcerer of the Amalj'aa, as were my forebears. I am the fourth of my line to walk this path, which brings me now to this land.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: As you well know, my kind bear the scorn of the Ul'dahns. It is for that reason that I must remain here, far from the city walls.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Great power, this one has. But enough, is it? Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Kazagg Chah is terrifying to behold. Yes, yes, but he is both wise and kind─good, warm, kind.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: These are my brethren in the black, Forename, and now they are yours, as well. Before you stand the Ixal, Dozol Meloc, and the 269th Order mendicant of the kobolds, Da Za.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: You have fed the aetherial currents with the blood of fiends. That the Gem of Shatotto radiates as it does in your presence is proof of your deeds, and a sign of what must yet be done. It falls to me to bear witness to your awakening, and to pass on to you the knowledge entrusted to me.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Know that you must face death before your purpose can be fulfilled.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: It is to the Silent King in western Thanalan that you must next journey. There, too, lies a planar fissure, and there, too, must you slake the land's thirst with the blood of the fiends which surge forth from it.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Fear not, each of us shall journey to the Silent King, and there convene once more. Seek out first the Ixal Dozol Meloc, for your path is destined to first cross with his.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: When the deed before you is done, the Gem of Shatotto shall shine with new brilliance.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: To close planar fissure, strong black magic you need. You close, then come to Dozol Meloc once more. Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! Kazagg Chah spoke true! Black is strong in Forename. You go now. Go see Da Za.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Here lies the planar fissure─rift, tear, fissure. Use the power within you to seal it.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: It is as Kazagg Chah foretold. You are chosen, Forename. You must return to him now. Yes, yes, return and tell Kazagg Chah the deed is done─ended, over, done.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Fell whatever fiends emerge from the planar fissures, and let the land drink deep of their blood.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: When the deed before you is done, the Gem of Shatotto shall shine with new brilliance.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: You have done well, Forename─as I knew you would. Come, it is time now to return to Burgundy Falls.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Forename Surname of the black, you return to me victorious.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The Gem of Shatotto burns bright. You are indeed the heiressheir to a dark and ancient power, as Ququruka foretold. I am reminded of a prophecy my great-grandfather uttered long ago:

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text:
“When four magi meet in a barren land,
Black powers of eld woven by their hand,
Shall see the fate of wickedness made stark,
And the path to light shall be lit by dark.”

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The black powers of eld require no explanation. And know that wickedness refers to the evil birthed by the void.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: That the seal holding the voidgate shut will falter and fail is beyond doubt. Yet your deeds speak of determination and ability, and in them I spy hope. I have learned all of you that I must.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I bestow upon you the knowledge kept by my line. Here and now, I speak an oath to discard old grudges. By our power combined, the voidgate will be sealed anew.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: You have brought this old Amalj'aa much happiness. Few believed the words of my great-grandfather. He was mocked and ridiculed, and worse, ignored. Yet your coming has fulfilled the prophecy he spoke.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Forename, the dark magic coursing through you shares a deep bond with the voidgate. Should that portal be cast open, you will come to great peril.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Temper yourself, in both mind and body. When you are ready, return to this land and seek me out once more. Then, and only then, will I speak to you of your next task.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: A fiend emerges from the planar fissure!

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ

quest.name: いざないの霧
journal: Kazagg Chah would see you undertake another challenge to strengthen your dark powers.

According to Dozol Meloc, the Gloom emanating from the voidgate is reacting to the power that has awoken within you. The ancient black magic that will aid you lies hidden in the South Shroud, sealed within a pillar by mages of old. Seek out this now-mossy pillar in Urth's Gift and see what secrets it holds.

Investigating the pillar sparks the appearance of a rash of planar fissures, which you and Mendicant Da Za subsequently dispatch with your usual flair. Speak with the mendicant to see how he is holding up after the battle.
Seemingly none the worse for wear, Da Za instructs you to return to Burgundy Falls to inform Dozol Meloc of your success.
Dozol Meloc is thrilled that the mysterious Gloom has been eliminated. Now speak with Kazagg Chah, who awaits you in his usual location behind Burgundy Falls.
Kazagg Chah is relieved that the Gloom has been scattered, and is greatly pleased by the power of darkness that has grown within you.
objectives: Investigate the mossy pillar in Urth's Gift.
Speak with 269th Order Mendicant Da Za.
Speak with Dozol Meloc at Burgundy Falls.
Speak with Kazagg Chah.
Repel the Gloom's advance!

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Forename. It is well you are here. My colleagues Dozol Meloc and Da Za would have words with you. Wait here while I fetch them.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: To close voidgate, strong black magic you need. Ready for test, are you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Are you ready?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Very good. Squaaawk! You have sharp sense, like Dozol. Noticed, have you? Your aura. Strangeness, it has.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Fool! Squaaawk! But no matter. Sharp sense, Dozol has. Your aura. Strangeness, it has.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Now, the voidgate. Gloom, it makes. Like black breath. Gloom drawn to black magic. Drawn to you. Like moth to flame. Black magic, it seeks, to corrupt and make own.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Losing strength, seal is. Black magic and voidgate share bond. Very deep. But must not leave be too long. Else other side maybe take you! Squaw-aw-awk.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: No fear yet! Still weak, Gloom is. Time, you have. Strong Forename find next key!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Teach you, Dozol will, what must do.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Many black mages, there were. Long ago. One more powerful than rest. Very powerful. Epic, even. Epic black mage.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Black magic too powerful. Too dangerous. Wrong hands must not have. Know this, he did. Ciphered spells. Hid secrets. Dark way passed to few. Very few.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Teaching, writing, spread over realm. Lost to time, they were. Forgotten. One carved in stone. Stone of mossy pillar. Pillar in South Shroud. Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Chosen Forename is chosen! Unleash power of this black magic, you can. Key, it is! Key to end of Gloom!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Knowledge of my line, this is. Passed to Dozol from mother. From mother of mother. From mother of mother of mother. Four hatchings past. Strong mage, she was. Epic, even. Epic mage!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Great love for dark art. More than anything. Joined with lizardmen to learn all. Named betrayer, she was. Chased from village. Squaaawk! Her words, Dozol keeps. Teach to strong Forename now.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text:
“Four magi meet, in barren land,
Old black powers have they, in hand.
Fate of all wicked, be made stark.
Path to light then lit by squaaawk!”
That her squawk. Not Dozol squawk. Should be dark, Dozol thinks.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Good words. Deep words. Bring Dozol here, they did. To pass on. Not Dozol alone. Others come too. Other mages.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Birdman. Lizardman. No matter. All wait for strong Forename. Strong mind, you have, and heart. Help you, Dozol will.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Go to Gridania, you must. To Urth's Gift. Near pillar lurking beasts, there are. Slay them, you must. No need fear beast. Strong Forename is strong!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Da Za! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I, too, am here to lend you my aid─help, hand, aid.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Wood danger for Dozol. For Ixal, Wailers wait. Wait with sharp spears. Go in place of Dozol, Da Za will.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Decided, it is. Go now, you will! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A stone pillar covered in moss rises here.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Gem of Shatotto shines bright, revealing an inscription in the stone. As you approach it, you hear a voice ring out...

dialogue.name: SEKIHI
dialogue.text: (-???-)By the gem thou bearest shall the great and dark power of eld be bestowed upon thee. But those who seek this power must first prove their worth. Behold, the Gloom that would be thine undoing cometh!

dialogue.name: SEKIHI
dialogue.text: (-???-)Stay the Gloom's encroach by thy hand. Only then shall the umbral wisdom of the ages be gifted unto thee.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: That voice spoke true. Look! The Gloom gathers, Forename. I sense there are fiends of evil about─nearby, close, about.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Well fought! The Gloom is scattered! Scattered is the Gloom!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Let us return to Burgundy Falls. Yes, yes, Dozol Meloc awaits us─you, me, us.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Gone from you, Gloom is. Worry for nothing, Dozol did!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! Now go see Kazagg Chah, you must. Awaiting you, he is.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The gods are good to return you unharmed. The Gloom which threatened to taint this world does so no more. And I sense the darkness within you is reborn with a new power.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Wield it well, Forename of the black, and make of it a tool for our ends. Do that, and as the prophecy speaks, the way to light shall be lit by dark before you.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The Gloom will change into great horrors if left unchecked. You must stop it with your black magic─spells, sorcery, magic.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The Gloom has birthed fiends, Forename. Be careful─cautious, wary, careful.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: More fiends come! Worry not, the tide will turn─shift, change, turn.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Do not falter, Forename. We must endure─rally, persevere, endure!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. My powers are gone─spent, exhausted, gone.

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ

quest.name: 道を求むる旅
journal: Kazagg Chah wishes to guide you further along the path of the black mage.

Da Za tells you that he set out from his kobold homeland of O'Ghomoro to pursue the same legend recounted by Kazagg Chah and Dozol Meloc. He holds a stone tablet passed down to him from his ancestor Da Gu. Upon showing it to you, the light from your Gem of Shatotto reveals writing carved into its surface indicating that closing the voidgate requires certain garb. To locate three of the pieces, pour the blood of Kazagg Chah into the planar fissure at the Zanr'ak encampment in southern Thanalan, the blood of Dozol Meloc into the planar fissure at the Ixali logging grounds in the North Shroud, and the blood of Da Za into the planar fissure at O'Ghomoro in outer La Noscea.
Your blood-pouring activities have netted you three pieces of wizard's garb. Return to Burgundy Falls and show Kazagg Chah your new duds.

During your absence, Kazagg Chah and his companions have tracked down the location of the fourth garment mentioned in the tablet. Travel to Thal's Respite in eastern Thanalan, investigate the planar fissure that has opened there, and procure the blood of any fiends that emerge from it.
You have obtained the voidsent's blood. Pour it into the planar fissure that yet remains.
You have obtained the fourth piece of wizard's garb. Take word of your accomplishment to Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls in eastern Thanalan.

You learn from Kazagg Chah that a fifth piece of wizard's garb yet remains, and that its location is a mystery. The only clue the ancient tablet gives is that the body armor rests in the Solace of the Gods. The Amalj'aa black mage tells you he will continue researching the matter. In the meantime, carry on with your studies, and make preparations to seal the voidgate once and for all.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Kazagg Chah upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Pour Kazagg Chah's blood into the planar fissure at the Zanr'ak encampment.
Pour Dozol Meloc's blood into the planar fissure at the Ixali logging grounds.
Pour Da Za's blood into the planar fissure at O'Ghomoro.
Speak with Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls.
Investigate the planar fissure at Thal's Respite and obtain the blood of any fiends that emerge.
Pour the fiend's blood into the planar fissure and obtain the black mage relic armor.
Speak with Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Forename of the black, our brother Da Za has words for you. Pray wait a moment for him to arrive.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: You have reclaimed the key from the depths of the Shroud─wood, forest, Shroud. Yes, you have done well. Very, very well. You are truly the black mage foretold by legend─oracle, prophecy, legend.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: It was such a legend of my people that brought me to this Thanalan. Such is what legends do.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text:
“When four magi meet in a barren land,
Black powers of eld woven by their hand,
Shall see the fate of wickedness made stark,
And the path to light shall be lit by dark.” Black, shadow, dark.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: You have heard these words before. Yes, yes, here I found Kazagg Chah and Dozol Meloc. The words that brought us to Thanalan are the same─equal, identical, same.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: It was one hundred years ago that a kobold first deciphered the legend─decrypted, decoded, deciphered. The great mage who did it was my own ancestor, 1st Order Patriarch Da Gu. Yes, yes, my very own.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: But he broke kobold law. The first patriarch must never leave O'Ghomoro. No, no, never. But leave he did. He set out from La Noscea to pursue this legend. And for that he was named traitor─betrayer, turncloak, traitor.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: None were drawn to the words of Da Gu. No, no, not a single kobold soul. They ignored his words. But when first I heard them, I felt strange─peculiar, odd, strange.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I felt I must do something. I could not simply be idle. I, too, left La Noscea, just as Da Gu before me. Yes, and I have come here to Thanalan.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Now I see the legend is real. Yes, the words kept by Kazagg Chah, Dozol Meloc, and myself are true. You have appeared. That is no coincidence. No, no, none at all.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I am a kobold. Yes, yes, I am, and we kobolds are good at finding things─treasures, trinkets, things. I will help you where I can.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Da Gu left behind many things when he left. Yes, many, many things. I was given a stone tablet. The others in my family thought it rubbish─dross, refuse, rubbish. Its surface has many scratches, you see. Yes, many, many. But I sense in it a great power.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Here, it may give some─ Your gem! The light! It is illuminating the tablet. The scratches are...growing!? Mighty Titan, those are no scratches! No, no, not scratches at all. They are carvings! Words!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text:
“Know thee, brave keeper of Shatotto's light,
As these very words wax plain to thy sight,
The seal what was cast doth shudder and sigh,
And the voidgate's dread sundering draws nigh.”

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text:
“To ward against the creeping of the Gloom,
Thou needest great garb to stay any doom,
To this sacred wear thy thoughts must now tend,
Unto thy black command darkness shall bend.”

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: This tablet was more important than I ever imagined. Yes, yes, much more. It seems to say one who would close the voidgate must first find this sacred garb─gear, armor, garb!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: And the names of places are written here as well. Yes, yes, these four places I know. You would do well to set out and gather the first three relics.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Legend speaks of this. It holds that an offering of blood must be given to the planar fissures─the blood of those who have lived life steeped in the black. Only then can the relics be won. Here, take with you an offering of my blood, Forename.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Need Dozol's blood too, you do. Take. Take quick! Squaaawk! Before change mind.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: And here is mine─my, me, mine. I would entrust it to no other.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: But be warned─one does not simply walk into these places. There are great dangers waiting. Do be careful. Yes, yes, very, very careful.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I had no doubt you would return triumphant. Yes, yes, no doubt at all.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Braved the logging grounds, you did. Great, great strength, you have. Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I have awaited your return, Forename. I have learned where it is that the fourth relic of our forebears rests─the land known as Thal's Respite.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: There, too, lies a planar fissure into which the blood of the fiends it births must be poured.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The first four relics are now in your keeping. Yet the final piece remains, and our efforts to learn where it rests have been to no avail.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The dark which empowers at times obscures─such is its nature. Da Za claims his tablet names the Solace of the Gods as the location we seek, but none among us have ever heard tell of such a name.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text:
“When a power worthy to relics claim,
Takes root in one of righteous end and name,
The Solace of the Gods will be made known,
And the last seed of the black mage be sown.”

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Da Za insists his reading is correct, and both Dozol Meloc and I trust in his ability. We will endeavor to decode these words, that you might see your quest to its end. The day of the void's opening shall come. Until then, Forename, I ask only that you continue to walk the path of the black.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: Fiends emerge from the planar fissure!

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ

quest.name: 黒魔法の導き手
journal: Kazagg Chah awaits you with news.

Unable to learn the location of the Solace of the Gods and the final relic, Kazagg Chah directs you to call upon Ququruka once more. Perhaps Lalai will be able to assist you in gaining an audience with him. Seek her outside Milvaneth Sacrarium in Ul'dah.

Lalai has discovered that Ququruka is no prophet at all, but merely the vile criminal he was convicted of being one hundred years ago. He means to use the black magic at his command to open the voidgate and summon forth Barbatos─a monster capable of destroying all Eorzea. Follow Ququruka to Nald's Reflection in southern Thanalan and put an end to his maniacal scheme before it is too late.

You have vanquished Barbatos and heard from Ququruka the truth of all that has transpired these hundred years. The souls of Ququruka and his black mage brethren have finally been put to rest. Speak to Kazagg Chah, Dozol Meloc, and Da Za once more for closure.

You have spoken to the three black mage beastmen. All have forgiven Ququruka his sins, and pray their ancestors have done the same. Return to Burgundy Falls in eastern Thanalan and speak to Kazagg Chah once more.

Kazagg Chah is happy that you have chosen to walk the path of the black mage, and to have walked it with you. He vows to forever count you among both his friends and brethren.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Speak with Lalai in Ul'dah.
Follow Ququruka to Nald's Reflection.
Speak with Kazagg Chah.
Speak with Dozol Meloc.
Speak with Da Za.
Report to Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls.
Defeat Barbatos.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: You have gathered the first four artifacts, Forename. That is no small feat.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Yet I fear little time remains. If the tablet of Da Za's great ancestor is to be believed, there is yet one more. Attempting to seal the voidgate before you have found them all would be the height of folly.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Our search for the Solace of the Gods continues. I have gone through all the records left by my great-grandfather, yet have discovered little.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The only seemingly relevant passage I found was his last. He put it to paper some one hundred years ago, just before bidding farewell to his home. “The true power of destruction will be awoken in that most sacred of places.”

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The power of destruction is black magic, of course. But as to what is meant by this “awakening”... I fear I am at a loss.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Hm? You believe that Da Za's and Dozol Meloc's ancestors might know more? To be sure, they were witness to the same events. And it is true that they, too, left their homes one hundred years ago and were damned for traitors.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: It could be mere coincidence... But, no, I do not think that likely.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I fear this foreshadows our doom. Should you find aught else, I beseech you to tell me at once. I will also continue the search for answers.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The tablet seems to suggest that the way to the Solace of the Gods and the final relic will be made known in time. Yet we can scarce afford to wait idly by.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Both Dozol Meloc and Da Za understand this urgency, and have already returned to their respective homelands to delve into the matter.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: And now, to your next task. You must return to he who first bound our four fates together─the prophet, Ququruka. Perhaps his words can guide us once more.

dialogue.name: MAMANE
dialogue.text: Solace of the Gods? There is no such place within the walls of Arrzaneth Ossuary. But the name... I recall having heard it before.

dialogue.name: MAMANE
dialogue.text: Yes, there was a mage with Lalai who I overheard mention it. A Lalafell dressed all in black who... When he spoke there was...a darkness about his words.

dialogue.name: COCOBYGO
dialogue.text: This place you seek... It has something to do with black mages? I know nothing of it, and the same goes for most folk around here, I'd wager. <shudder>

dialogue.name: COCOBYGO
dialogue.text: That said, Lalai is always with that criminal who escaped the Pit. The dark arts are her trade. She might have the answers you seek.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Solace of the Gods? Black mage? voidgate? Gods, womanman, you sound like a bloody cultist!

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: What madness has that criminal filled your mind with? Follow him down this path and you'll wind up no better than Lalai.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Ququruka's grip on that foolish lass is far too strong. For her, truth lost the battle to his lies long ago.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Please, you must help me. Ququruka has disappeared!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: That man is no messenger of Nald'thal. He is a miscreant and a charlatan─one guilty of the most heinous of crimes.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: None had seen him for days. I became worried and entered his chambers to see that he was well, though he prohibited me from doing so. Within I found only evidence of his deception!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The records he had hidden were damning. I now know why he was condemned as the greatest criminal of his day.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: One hundred years past, he conspired with magi from the beast tribes to summon a creature known as Barbatos─a monstrosity that was meant to destroy all of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Their plot was discovered by the Order of Nald'thal, and the voidgate was sealed before Barbatos could emerge.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ququruka was cast into the Marasaja Pit for his crime, where he was to rot until his last breath.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The Order was loath to let word of this spread, fearing others might someday seek to succeed where Ququruka failed. And so they left no record of the plot, save a few inscrutable documents─parchments intelligible only to those to whom the secret was known.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: These were the last words I found among the scribblings.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “Four is the answer. Four spells of black. Four artifacts of eld. The blood of four races. By four alone shall the true power of destruction be woken from the voidgate.”

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename... Black magic is not the key to sealing the voidgate. It is the key to opening it! Ququruka used us to revive this dark art, and now means to finish what he began a century ago.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: What fools we were to believe his lies...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Please, Forename, you must stop him before it is too late! Hurry to Nald's Reflection in southern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: MINOTAURMALM
dialogue.text: I have been ordered to let none pass.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: You! Deceived us all, you have! Squaaawk! Pay, you will!

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: You. You are one of Hetali Meloc's get, are you not?

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Mother of mother of mother! Her name, you know!?

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: And you, Amalj'aa... Yesss, you are of the line of Kazibb Chah. I can see it.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: And, kobold, through your veins courses the blood of Da Gu, does it not?

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: And last but not least─the black mage Forename. Splendidly done. Few could have vanquished Barbatos as you have.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: No doubt you are all eager to hear what truly transpired one hundred years ago. Being a kindly soul, I shall tell you.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: I was an ambitious mage in my youth─insatiable in my thirst for knowledge of the arcane. In the course of my studies, I discovered ancient writings which told of a black magic. A magic capable of destroying as only the gods can.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: It was innocent at first. Until it wasn't. But then questions began to arise in my mind that demanded answers. Where had all the black mages of old gone? Why had the existence of the art been hidden?

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: And so I probed. Endlessly. Tirelessly. The more I uncovered, the more it drew me in. There was such...power to be had.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: I was not merely ambitious. I was also vainglorious. I desired recognition. Deference. By accomplishing that which no other could, I sought to make my legacy an eternal one.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Yet the pursuit of black magic was...trying. I would pass days, weeks, months at a time, unsure of how to proceed. And what little progress did come, came but slowly. It was then that I met your ancestors.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: The Gem of Shatotto, the power to sense magic, the relics─all of these things I owe to them. With their vast knowledge, the slow crawl of my studies turned to leaps and bounds.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: I daresay your ancestors sought the same recognition as I.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Kazibb Chah, ridiculed by the Amalj'aa for his ingenious analyses of worldly phenomena. Hetali Meloc, named a pariah for not sharing in the small-minded prejudices of the Ixal. Da Gu, a victim of his kind's idiocy, bound never to leave the land of the kobolds.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: We toiled together, learning what we could. And learn we did. Much and more. Imagining we had gleaned all that was to be known, we prepared to hold a dark rite─one we believed would restore black magic to its fullest expression.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text:
I do not know what came over me. I...
Blinded by my own lust for power, I altered one of the incantations. It was...arrogant. Foolish.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Our command over the ancient powers we summoned was lost. I watched as the chaotic aether washed over my friends, ripping them apart, only to fuse them together into an...abomination.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: No... You couldn't mean... That thing we just saw...

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Yes. When I saw what my hubris had created, I mustered all of my strength to see Barbatos sealed behind the voidgate. Sealed─yet not defeated.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Yet I felt myself corrupted by the aether, and was unsure whether I could hold my powers in check.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Fearful, I returned to Ul'dah where I manipulated the minds of a few thaumaturges of the Order into believing I had committed some terrible crime. Only with me confined to the depths of the Marasaja Pit could the realm be safe.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: And there I remained─waiting. Waiting for the coming of one with the power to purify the aether of those three friends with whom I once shared a dream.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: I do not expect your forgiveness, but I am truly sorry.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: No words, Dozol has. Squaaawk! Only squaaawk!

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: I am not long for this world. Here, take this relic while I still have strength enough to offer it.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: The fifth artifact? Yes, yes, the fifth!

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Welcome to the Solace of the Gods. Perhaps you know it better as Nald's Reflection, as most do.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: Truly remarkable, Forename. You have succeeded...where many great mages...have failed. Mastered...what we sought...to master.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: I can now rest...knowing that this power...is safe with you. It is for you...to set the hatreds of the past...aright.

dialogue.name: QUQURUKA
dialogue.text: My time to join Thal...has come. May He greet me...as a friend.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: To think, Ququruka carried that anguish one hundred long years.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: His crime was born of the hubris of youth, yet his atonement came from the wisdom of old age.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: His soul has found peace, and it is not our place to linger and disturb it. Come, let us return to Burgundy Falls.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Century-old plan, this was? Fulfilled his purpose, Ququruka did?

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Mother of mother of mother! Forgiven Ququruka, she has? Squaaawk! Think so, Dozol does.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Finished, this story is.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Had much fun, Dozol did. Like mother of mother of mother! Grand fun she had, too, Dozol hopes.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Farewell, Forename. We meet again someday, Dozol hopes. Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Then it is over─finished, ended, over. We did all we could, and the souls of Ququruka and the others have been saved.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: The legends carried by my forebears have had their final chapter written this day. I confess, there is a sadness in that.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I am proud to call you friend, Forename─brethren, sisterbrother, friend. Now and always, no matter how divergent our paths from here.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, you are a true mage of the black now. Pray grace we kobolds in La Noscea with your presence someday.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Things have come to an end, it would seem. Both the threads which bound us all, and this tragic tapestry they wove.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Most mysterious things, these lives we lead. Do you recall when the words of so many legends and prophecies first brought you to me? It was here, at these same Burgundy Falls. We have spoken much here since then, yet I never imagined this day would come.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I stand before you now with no regrets. I am grateful to the gods for letting our paths cross. Dozol Meloc, Da Za, and you, Forename Surname─I count you all as my brethren in black.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Together, we have seen the souls of our ancestors given peace, and I, too, now feel a happiness I have never known.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: You have become a true black mage, my friend. And more than that, a true friend, black mage.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Let the dark art we share be a symbol of our bond, and that undying─in shadow or light, by day or night.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the black mage quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next black mage quest will be available from Lalai.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Let us see how far your powers have come, black mage!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No... The voidgate has opened too far. Other fiends have emerged!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Mage of the black, the voidgate looms before you! You must seal it!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Yes... Yes, you are nearly there. Finish it, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. I have nothing left to give.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Fallen, Dozol has. Squaaa─

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I am beaten, Forename. Carry on the fight!

obj.n: 呪術士ギルド受付 ヤヤケ
メンディカント269 ダ・ザ
蘇る古の武器（星屑のロッド）

quest.name: 偉人の後継者
journal: E–Sumi–Yan has a task for a skilled adventurer.

Raya–O–Senna and A–Ruhn–Senna, siblings of the Elder Seedseer, are en route to Everschade, where they would perform a ritual to quell the fury of the great elemental that dwells within the Guardian Tree. Brother E–Sumi–Yan fears for their safety, and tasks you with their protection.
Joining up with the two Seedseers, you assist them in their battle with hostile forest creatures. Raya–O–Senna bids you seek her out at Camp Tranquil, where she would speak with you further.

Convinced that your arrival has been ordained by the legendary mage A–Towa–Cant, Raya–O–Senna would have you join her and her brother in performing the Quieting and restoring peace to the Twelveswood. Hone your skills, that you might be capable of the task before long.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Seek out Raya-O-Senna in Everschade.
Speak with Raya-O-Senna at Camp Tranquil.
Defeat the enraged creatures!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Forename, I am glad you have come. I have a task of a most urgent and confidential nature, and I can think of none other to whom I can entrust it.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: You are doubtless familiar with the Seedseers, yes? Kan–E–Senna─Elder Seedseer, leader of the Order of the Twin Adder, and guardian of our fair nation─clearly needs no introduction, but know you also of her siblings?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: The two young Padjals, Sister Raya–O–Senna and Brother A–Ruhn–Senna, make for Everschade as we speak, where they will perform a ritual of great import. Verily, such import that it would be no overstatement to say that the very fate of Gridania hangs in the balance.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: As you well know, we dwell in this forest by the good graces of the elementals, eternal guardians of the Twelveswood, and most of all the great one who dwells within the Guardian Tree. Yet our ceaseless warring and ill treatment of the trees that shelter us have aroused the great one's ire, and it is only by the Quieting─the ritual of which I spoke─that he may be placated.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Thus did the two Seedseers set out for Everschade, with nary a guard to accompany them. Therein lies the rub, and the nature of the favor I ask of you.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: By no means would I question the powers of the Seedseers, but with the great one's anger mounting, the Twelveswood becomes a threatening domain for even the most puissant of conjurers.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Pray hasten to Everschade and see that no harm befalls the two.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Curses! How can we hope to make it to the Guardian Tree with these ghastly creatures bursting forth like rampant weeds?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: If I'd known what we were in for, I'd have brought along a Wood Wailer or two. In fact, I daresay we should return and do exactly that!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Oh, do not be such a coward, Sister. We are Seedseers─these overgrown vermin are no match for us.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Bold words, Brother. But were they true words, we would have dispatched our enemies and arrived safely at our destination bells ago.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Hm? A conjurer, are you...? Brother E–Sumi, ever the worrier. For once, however, his solicitude is most welcome. Might you help us dispose of these fell creatures?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Have you no pride, Sister!? A Seedseer does not beg the aid of some common adventurer!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Enough, Brother! We have a duty to perform─a duty that takes precedence over your silly notions of pride. Now, enough talk! Let us see to these pests.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: That crystal! Do my eyes deceive me, or does this adventurer inherit the legacy of A–Towa–Cant?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: It was none other than A–Towa himself who last performed the Quieting. No, I do not believe this adventurer's arrival is mere coincidence.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Bearer of the soul crystal, inheritor of arcane knowledge long since forbidden to those not of our kind... I know not why it is you he chose, but I believe our great forefather has led you to us today.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Ancient tradition dictates that the Quieting be performed by three Padjals─ah, but I misspeak. The ritual is to be performed by three white mages. If Master A–Towa truly has chosen this adventurer as his successor...

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Y-You speak madness, Sister! Surely, you have not forgotten that Padjali tradition strictly forbids sharing the teachings with those not of our kind. The power of white magic is far too great to risk it falling into the wrong hands!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And so you would uphold tradition merely for tradition's sake? Even at the risk of incurring the great one's wrath and bringing disaster upon our forest home?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Have you so little faith in your own abilities, Sister? We are Seedseers─more than capable of slaying any beasts in our way and carrying out the ritual on our own.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: <sigh> This petty bickering is getting us nowhere...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Adventurer! I am sorry to trouble you with our silly sibling squabbles... If you've the time, I would speak with you further. But not here. Come to Camp Tranquil, and come quickly; time is of the essence.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, adventurer. Forgive my brother's rudeness─he cannot help that he was born with a head of solid stone. Anywise, I do not believe we have been properly introduced. I am Raya–O–Senna, a Padjal─as you can see─and sister of the Elder Seedseer.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: You are Forename, yes? Brother E–Sumi has spoken of you─and most highly, at that.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As you no doubt have heard, my brother, A–Ruhn, and I were en route to the Guardian Tree. There, the great one, by whose graces we dwell here, resides.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The gentlest of guardians when at peace, a destructive force that knows no bounds when angered─as the great one goes, so goes our fate. The creatures you helped us dispatch─doubtless they, too, were roused to hostility by the great one in his anger.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: You need only look around you to see. The forest grows more and more threatening with each passing hour. So it is that we traveled here to quell the great one's fury─to perform the Quieting.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: In days of old, the ritual was, without fail, performed by three white mages. With our elder sister occupied with her many duties, my brother and I thought to attempt it on our own. A–Ruhn was quite confident, but I had my doubts...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: It was then that you arrived, and shortly thereafter became one of the chosen few to be gifted with a white mage's soul crystal. 'Tis no small honor; that gem marks you as an inheritor of the magic of our ancestors.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: My brother's pride may blind him, but the signs are clear as day to me. You are not Padjali, but A–Towa–Cant meant for you to be here today, to perform the ritual with us.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Towa–Cant is known to all as one of the greatest mages in our history, but even more so, he was known for being something of an eccentric. In defiance of tradition, he bid farewell to his forest home, wandering the realm and healing the wounds of the land and its people wheresoever he went.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A most admirable cause, yes? But alas, A–Towa was never to return. He perished in a far–off land, and having taken no apprentices, his legendary powers were lost to us for eternity. Or so I believed...until I met you.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And yet, for all his stubbornness, there is some truth to my brother's words. Ancient laws forbid us from sharing the teachings of white magic outside of our own kind. There are reasons for this, which I would share with you when the time is right.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: There are many who would not approve of this arrangement. Still, I am convinced that it is A–Towa's will that we bring you into the fold. And so I welcome you, Forename of the white.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I can feel the great one's fury welling up even now. Time is short, and yet, while you may have been chosen by A–Towa, I fear your journey as a white mage has just begun. Return to me when you have further honed your skills, and we shall proceed with your training.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The great one does not approve of our presence here...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'll thank you to stay out of my way, adventurer.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Bring down as many of the creatures as you can!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We never should have tried to fight this battle alone... Brother, forgive me...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I am A-Ruhn-Senna! I will not...fall...to these...urghhh...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

quest.name: 森の嘆き
journal: Raya–O–Senna would teach you to commune with the elementals.

The process of pacifying ireful trees involves communing with the elementals that dwell within, such that a state of harmony might be restored. As the next stage of your training as a white mage, Raya–O–Senna would have you pacify a small tree in the northwest area of Sorrel Haven.
You have attuned yourself with the elementals and soothed the tree's anger. Inform Raya–O–Senna of your success.

According to Raya–O–Senna, the unrest that has come to the Twelveswood is a manifestation of the elementals' fury. Soothing their anger and restoring harmony to the forest is the duty of the white mage─a duty she feels transcends race or nation. She would ask that you continue to hone your skills while she thinks of a way to persuade her brother, A–Ruhn–Senna, that you are the right womanman for the job.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Quell the anger of a tree in Sorrel Haven.
Report to Raya–O–Senna.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Looking ever more the white mage, I see. And yet, I fear you are as ready to perform the Quieting as a chocobo chick is to carry a Wood Wailer clad in full plate.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: But take heart, for we all must begin somewhere. Today, I would teach you the art of communing with the elementals. This is, by any measure, the very foundation of our art, the means by which we preserve harmony between the forest and our people.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Not far from Sorrel Haven you shall find a tree─a mere sapling in the shadow of the Guardian Tree, but one that has likewise been consumed by anger and fear.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I would ask you to placate this tree. The process is quite simple: stand before the tree and raise your hands. Commune with the elementals that reside within, and attune yourself to them, until your feelings are in absolute harmony.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Be forewarned, however: an angry elemental can be as stubborn as my dear brother. Do not be surprised if you find your honest plea rebuffed, and foul creatures sent to drive you from the forest.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: No matter what happens, you must remain calm. Dispatch the creatures, settle your heart, and speak to the tree once more. If your heart is true, your voice will reach the elemental ere long.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Remember this, Forename: under no circumstances must you allow your anger and fear to overcome you. As practitioners of white magic─the magic of succor and solace─such emotions are anathema to our very existence.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A short while ago, I sensed a great anger abate. The forest is quieter, more welcoming now. It would seem you have passed your first test, Forename.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The trees are the elementals, the elementals are the trees─the lush verdure of the wood is inseparable from the spirits that dwell within it. But you do not need to hear this from me. Doubtless you felt it for yourself, when you healed that tree.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Above all else, the elementals prize harmony. When they sense a threat to harmony, they summon forth all the powers at their disposal to expulse it.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: For so long have we lived in peace with the elementals. Why, now, do they turn against us? I can offer no answers, only theories. But one thing is certain─we must quell the great one's fury, and do it soon, lest Gridania bear the full brunt of the forest's wrath.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: To soothe the forest's wounds, and restore harmony─that is our duty as mages of the white, and it is a responsibility that transcends race or nation.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I sensed your success in soothing the ailing tree, and am more certain of this than ever. Sadly, many cannot see past established practice and tradition─my dear brother among them.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: One would hope for a bit more open-mindedness given his youth, but alas, his pride as a Padjal will not permit it.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: For my part, I am not entirely unsympathetic to his concerns. And yet, the task before us is too great. We must bring him around to see reason...but how?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. I would be alone with my thoughts for a while. Worry not─I will find a way to deal with A–Ruhn.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!

quest.name: 角尊の誇り
journal: Raya–O–Senna would ask a favor of you.

A–Ruhn–Senna, unconvinced by his sister's words, has run off to the Bramble Patch on his own to prove that your powers are not needed. Raya–O–Senna, fearing for her brother's safety, asks you to go look for him.
Despite suffering injury in his foolhardy quest to placate the forest single-handedly, A–Ruhn–Senna remains as stubborn as ever. Placate the tree in his stead.
By communing with an elemental before A–Ruhn–Senna's eyes, you have grudgingly won the trust of the proud young Padjal. Return to Camp Tranquil and speak with Raya–O–Senna.

Raya–O–Senna informs you that her brother, despite his misgivings, has finally come to accept your participation in the Quieting. To commune with the great one, however, no ordinary powers will suffice. Continue to hone your skills, that you might join the two Seedseers in healing the forest.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Speak with A–Ruhn–Senna in the Bramble Patch.
Placate the tree.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename... I owe you an apology.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: When last we spoke, I promised that I would find a way to convince my brother to accept you, but I fear he intently refuses to heed my words.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Why, the more I try to reason with him, the more he shuts his ears to me. All pride and no common sense, that one─I can scarce believe we are kin!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: So intent is he to prove that you are unneeded that he dashed out into the forest all alone, boasting that he would placate every last elemental and save the forest all by himself!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Needless to say, such a task is far beyond his powers. There is a part of me that would like nothing more than to see the foolish boy learn his lesson, and yet...as his sister, I fear for him.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Would you go look after him, Forename? Seedseer or no, he is in many ways still a child, and the forest grows ever more unsafe these days.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I thought to go myself, but...if you were to save my brother from his own recklessness, perhaps he might finally see how fatuous he has been.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: When last I spoke with him, he announced his intentions to begin his efforts in the Bramble Patch─with any luck, you may still find him there. Now please go in haste, before some ill fate befalls him...

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Hmph! If it isn't my sister's favorite adventurer. Come to show me up, have you?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Well, you can march right back and tell Sister that I am doing just fine. I am only...ungh...resting.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: <cough> Even if I were hurt and unable to placate this tree...what could a run–of–the–mill adventurer like you do about it?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Hmph! Beginner's luck.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: If you think healing a sapling or two is going to convince me that you are a worthy inheritor to the teachings of Master A–Towa...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn, you yourself do not believe those words!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Sister! What are you doing here!?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Seeing to my pigheaded brother's safety─what do you think I am doing? For better or worse, it would appear you suffer only from bruises to your leg and your pride.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn. For all your obstinacy, I know that deep down you are no fool.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: No, you are wise beyond your years. You realize as well as I the dire fate that will befall Gridania if we do not quell the great one's fury and restore peace to the wood.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The adventurer is not Padjali─this is true. But what of it? Would you blindly trumpet tradition as the very forest turns against us and brings ruin to our home? We have a greater calling to answer─you know this!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: I... I do, Sister.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Oh, my dear A–Ruhn... What are sisters for, if not to forgive their little brothers' fits of folly?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Now, Forename, I believe the most important task of all still awaits us. Let us return to Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename, thank you. I knew it was only a matter of time before A–Ruhn came around to reason. And yet, his hesitance to accept you was not entirely unfounded.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: When we first met, I promised that one day I would share with you the tale of how white magic came to be regarded as a forbidden art. Well, I suppose this is as good a day as any for the telling.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The tale begins some three millennia ago, in the Fifth Astral Era. It was the time of the Endless Frost, when a barren wasteland of snow and rime stretched as far as the eye could see.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Food was scarce, and warmth scarcer. The histories hold many a grim tale of those who died in their beds, starving and benumbed. So did our ancestors discover magic, born out of the most fundamental instinct─survival.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: In time, the winter thawed, and magic was no longer essential for survival. But once awakened to its conveniences, there was no returning to how things once were. Ere long, the people discovered all the myriad ways in which magic could be employed, and civilization flourished.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: But prosperity breeds contempt, and nations warred for power and riches. So did the people seek greater and greater power, to rain destruction down upon their enemies. So was born black magic, the most devastating form of sorcery the world had seen.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: At the same time, another form of magic emerged, brought forth by those who would keep this immense destructive power in check. That is white magic─our magic. Does this surprise you? Just as there can be no dawn without the night, the white and black are but two sides of the same coin.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: War raged on, and magic was used and abused with little concern for the consequences. And consequences there were─unchecked use of magic soon dried the flow of aether, threatening to bring blight to the land.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The magic of healing? It made little difference. If used with no concern for the aether, our magic could prove as ruinous to the land as the most devastating black magic spell. And so it was that the practicing of white magic was forbidden...with one exception.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: ...The Padjal. Our kind were entrusted as sole shepherds of the now-forbidden art, to serve as healers and bringers of peace while ensuring that this great power would never again be misused.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Though he is still young, A–Ruhn feels this profound sense of responsibility as strongly as any of us, thus his hesitance to accept you. But having seen your abilities─and the sincerity of your intentions─you can rest assured his doubts have been dispelled.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: With the three of us united in place and purpose, and your skills ever growing, the day that we may perform the Quieting draws near. To our fortune, the great one has not yet been entirely consumed by fury, but our time remains short.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: To commune with the great one, and restore the Twelveswood to its former state of harmony, we must truly be one of heart, one of mind.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: It is to this end that A–Towa–Cant has guided you to us. Further your mastery of our art, Forename, and let us mend the wounds of the wood together.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!

quest.name: 偉人の足跡
journal: Raya–O–Senna would send you on a pilgrimage.

Raya–O–Senna explains that in order to withstand the fury of the great one while performing the Quieting, you must clad yourself in garb imbued with the powers of your forebear. Take the items of clothing she has given you and /pray before three of A–Towa–Cant's resting places─in the Serpent's Tongue, the Tangle, and Raubahn's Push─that you might obtain the great mage's blessing.
Your prayers have been answered, and you have received the blessing of A–Towa–Cant for the three pieces of garb entrusted to you. Return to Camp Tranquil and speak with Raya–O–Senna.

Pleased by your success, Raya–O–Senna goes on to tell you of a fourth location where an urn of A–Towa-Cant's ashes has been laid to rest. Take the fresh set of white mage's robes you've been given, and pay your respects to the grave near Proud Creek in the North Shroud.
The grave by Proud Creek has been defiled and A–Towa–Cant's remains stolen, leaving you unable to obtain the great mage's blessing. Return the unenchanted robe to Raya–O–Senna.

Incensed upon hearing that A–Towa–Cant's grave has been robbed, Raya–O–Senna nevertheless sends you on the last leg of your pilgrimage. Travel to the Kobold Dig in outer La Noscea, where the great mage is said to have perished.

After bowing your head in solemn prayer one last time, you have received another of the great Padjal's blessings, making the healer's circlet yours. Head back to Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil and inform her of your progress.

Raya–O–Senna explains her reasons for sending you on the pilgrimage. It was not merely for the purpose of enchanting your ritual garb, but also because she wished for you to see with your own eyes the beauty and suffering of the realm, as A–Towa–Cant once did. Angered by the defilement of the great mage's resting place, she has vowed to find the culprit.
objectives: /pray before the grave of A–Towa–Cant in the Serpent's Tongue.
/pray before the grave of A–Towa–Cant in the Tangle.
/pray before the grave of A–Towa–Cant in Raubahn's Push.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.
Examine the grave of A–Towa–Cant near Proud Creek.
Return the unenchanted robe to Raya–O–Senna.
/pray before the grave of A–Towa–Cant near the Kobold Dig.
Report to Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Your command of white magic has advanced considerably, Forename. Yes, the time draws near─let us begin our preparations for the Quieting.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: At its roots, the ritual is no different from the acts of pacifying that you have already performed. The difference lies only in the difficulty of the effort─the great one possesses a power unfathomably more immense than the elementals you have communed with thus far.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Power so immense that a mage might be easily overwhelmed by the sheer force of its will. To prevent such a catastrophic fate, our tradition decrees that especial garb must be donned before performing the ritual.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I have prepared for you these pieces, but I fear they will not avail you in their current state. So it is that I would send you on a journey.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I trust you know the story of A–Towa–Cant. Rare among the Padjal, he left the forest behind to travel the realm, healing the land and its people. As tribute to his wanderlust, after he passed, his ashes were divided among several urns, which were in turn carried to the far reaches of the realm.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And it was there, in the distant lands that the great mage so loved, that his ashes were buried, and monuments erected in his honor. You are to go on a pilgrimage to these sites, and receive the blessings of your forebear. Only then will the garb I've gifted you be imbued with his divine powers.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Mind you, you will find that these places are not as welcoming as they might have been in Master A–Towa's time. The first site is on the shores of western La Noscea, in a place now feared as the Serpent's Tongue, home to a band of vile pirates.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The next is to be found in Mor Dhona, in that overgrown labyrinth of roots and vines so affectionately known as the Tangle. I do hope that Master A–Towa's ashes have survived those most oppressive environs.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The third site I would have you visit is perhaps the most treacherous location of the lot─Raubahn's Push in northern Thanalan, a stone's throw from an imperial stronghold. I urge you to exercise extreme caution.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The gravestone is inscribed with an epitaph paying tribute to the life and deeds of the great mage, A–Towa–Cant.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Your safe return heartens me, Forename. I can feel newfound power emanating from the garb I gave you. I trust that this stage of your pilgrimage was a success.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Now that you have traveled the realm and seen the land as Master A–Towa did, I would share with you the rest of his tale. The histories claim that A–Towa–Cant disappeared in the mountains of O'Ghomoro, the kobold motherland. This is not untrue, but there is more to the story.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: When the great mage did not return from his journey, one of his most devoted students went in search of him. As the legends have it, the young mage single-handedly fought off veritable legions of kobolds while scouring the mountains for any sign of his master.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Sadly, it was as all had feared. Though the young mage eventually found his master, the great A–Towa–Cant lived no more.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As if the death of the man were not enough, Thyrus─A–Towa–Cant's great staff, a mighty relic passed down by his ancestors─was lost to the shadows.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Undeterred, the young mage fought off the kobold hordes to carry his master's remains back to the surface. A ceremony was held to honor Master A–Towa's life and deeds, and urns housing his ashes were carried off to the far-reaching frontiers of which he was so fond in his living years.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text:
All the urns, that is, except for one. Yes, though the precise location is known to only a few, Master A–Towa also rests closer to home. Here in the Twelveswood, not far from Proud Creek, you will find yet another monument to the great mage.
Take with you this habit, and pay your respects as before. If you keep pure intentions in your heart and in your mind, then the healer's robe shall be your reward.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The grave has been defiled, and its contents appear to have been stolen.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The power of A–Towa–Cant has been lost here. Return to Camp Tranquil and seek counsel from Raya–O–Senna.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The urn holding Master A–Towa's ashes was stolen!? This cannot be!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Grave robbery is a damnable enough crime in itself, but what manner of scoundrel would dare defile the resting place of a Padjal?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Rest assured that I will investigate this heinous crime immediately. In the meantime, your pilgrimage demands you travel to one last destination.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: This final leg of your journey will take you to the very place that Master A–Towa drew his last breath: O'Ghomoro, the homeland of the kobolds in outer La Noscea. It is there, in plain sight of the Kobold Dig, that the student of whom I spoke did erect a monument to his fallen master.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. The journey was not an easy one, I trust, and yet I knew that Master A–Towa would guide you safely back to me.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: In your travels, you have received the blessings of our great ancestor. And yet, this was not the sole reason I sent you on this pilgrimage. Perhaps you sensed something of my intentions during your trip.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Yes, Forename. As shehe who would inherit Master A–Towa's legacy, I wanted you to truly walk in his footsteps.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: To see the realm─in both its beauty and its suffering─with your own eyes, as the great mage did so long ago.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And yet it is strange, no? A pirate's lair, a rampant jungle, mountains of fire─of all the hostile environs to which you journeyed, the single grave despoiled was that which rests right here in our forest home.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I suspect this was the handiwork of no witless grave robber, but rather someone who knew all too well the value of that which was buried within.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: We must uncover the truth behind this crime and return Master A–Towa's ashes to their rightful resting place, and quickly. You are with me, yes?

obj.n: ヒーラーサークレット

quest.name: 不埒者への報い
journal: Raya–O–Senna would have you recover the stolen ashes of A–Towa–Cant.
Distressed at the theft of A–Towa–Cant's ashes, Raya–O–Senna sent her best moogleservant in search of the thieves. Having now returned, speak with Kupcha Kupa and see if his search has borne fruit.

Kupcha Kupa informs you that one of his kind caught sight of an urn being carted away by a band of Redbelly Wasps. Venture to the bandits' den northwest of Quarrymill in the South Shroud, and speak with the moogle eyewitness, Pukno Poki.

Pukno Poki tells you that he saw the bandits haul the urn off toward Redbelly Hive on a wain carelessly overloaded with stolen loot. Carefully navigate your way around the skulking Redbelly Wasps and recover the stolen remains.
After tracking down the overloaded wain and dispatching a trio of Redbellies, you have successfully recovered the remains of A–Towa–Cant. Return them to Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.

Though relieved at the return of the great mage's remains, Raya–O–Senna has unfortunate news for you. Uprooted from their resting place, the ashes have been drained of their powers, rendering them unsuitable for enchanting your garb. She asks you to continue your training while she consults her brother as to the best course of action.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Speak with Kupcha Kupa.
Speak with Pukno Poki.
Search the overloaded wain.
Deliver the urn to Raya–O–Senna.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Grave robbery is a loathsome enough crime in its own right, but to defile the final resting place of a Padjal! Such an act could only be performed by the lowliest of bandit scum.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Though I would like to think that the elementals have already delivered due justice to the villain, we must take no chances in allowing an escape.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Whilst you were away, I put my best moogle on the hunt, searching for any sign of the culprit or the stolen remains. I daresay he should have a clue or two for us by now.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: ...At least, he better, if he values that little ball on his head. Suffice it to say, though many forestborn think of the moogles as blessed, my own personal experience has found them to be more touched than anything else.

dialogue.name: KUPCHAKUPA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Oh, Mistress. You shouldn't say such hurtful things. It's most unbecoming of a Seedseer, kupo... But fine, don't listen to me.

dialogue.name: KUPCHAKUPA
dialogue.text: Why, I told her just the other day that this is why she remains, shall we say, unspoken for. She might not react to that phrasing at present, but her ire was indeed fierce, kupo...

dialogue.name: KUPCHAKUPA
dialogue.text: Of course, you have not come to discuss my mistress's temper, but the grave robbery. A most unforgivable act of villainy, if I do say so myself─which I believe I just did, kupo!

dialogue.name: KUPCHAKUPA
dialogue.text: I am pleased to say─and you will be pleased to hear─that the culprit did not escape moogle eyes, kupo!

dialogue.name: KUPCHAKUPA
dialogue.text: Well, my eyes, he did escape. My associate Pukno Poki, however, claims to have seen a band of ruffians skulking off in the direction of Redbelly Hive with various and sundry stolen goods in tow─among them, a rather conspicuously elaborate urn, kupo.

dialogue.name: KUPCHAKUPA
dialogue.text: I do not know what the Redbellies are up to, but surely it can be nothing good. Please, Forename, go quickly! If the urn is lost, I...I fear Raya–O's ire will be the least of my worries, kupo.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Those thieving crooks! Those crooked thieves! Defiling the resting place of a Padjal? Why, no amount of thrashings, lashings, and bashings would suffice!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Kupopo? Why, if it isn't the lovelydashing white mage Kupcha Kupa spoke of. And not a moment too soon!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Why, I was just about to swoop in and give them their comeuppance myself! Now that you're here, however, I believe I'll just sit back and enjoy the show, kupo.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Those vile Redbellies tossed the urn onto some ramshackle wagon─a most ignoble fate for a Padjali legend, I do declare─and carted it northwise toward their hive. You will retrieve it safe and sound, won't you, kupo?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. The remains of our exalted forebear hauled away by brigands like a sack of loot... Is that what our land has come to?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
