dialogue.text: There can be no doubt. It is the great one's fury that brings such chaos to the Twelveswood. The situation is grave indeed.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I shall have our Wood Wailers deal with the Redbellies. We have more important matters before us.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And yet, I fear we have hit another snag. Though the urn has been safely recovered, the harsh treatment it suffered at the hands of the bandits has taken its toll. Uprooted from its proper resting place, the power of A–Towa–Cant once housed within has grown dim.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I shall return the urn to its rightful home. Perhaps, over time, it will return to its former state.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And yet I fear time is a luxury we do not have. We must explore other means to enchant the ritual garb.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I will consult with my brother to see what knowledge he might have to offer. In the meantime, I would ask that you master your newfound skills as best you can. There is no telling when the great one's fury might grow too strong to contain─we must ever be prepared.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

dialogue.name: ACCESS
dialogue.text: The enemy is still about!

quest.name: 鎮撫の儀
journal: Raya–O–Senna is wearing a concerned expression.

With time running out, and yet lacking the means to complete the enchantment of your ritual garb, the Seedseer siblings have come to the decision that the three of you must attempt the Quieting nonetheless. Make for Everschade and quell the fury of the Guardian Tree.

As you begin the ritual, the great one's wrath descends upon you in the form of a bevy of enraged forest creatures. However, before all hope is lost, A–Towa–Cant himself appears from out of the aether to fight alongside you. After a grueling battle, the great mage is again forced back into his aetherial slumber, but not before entrusting the future of the Twelveswood to you and the Seedseers. With peace returned at last, return to Camp Tranquil and speak with Raya–O–Senna.

Raya–O–Senna expresses her profound gratitude for your assistance in the ritual. In recognition of your accomplishments as a white mage, she bestows upon you the last piece of your garb─now imbued with the power of the departed A–Towa–Cant─and imparts unto you the most powerful incantation she knows. Expressing her confidence that you will bring succor to the realm and do her people proud, she wishes you well in your journeys.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Quell the fury of the Guardian Tree in Everschade.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.
Quell the great one's fury and heal the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. Brother and I have considered every possibility, and attempted every incantation at our disposal, but I fear the task of completing the enchantment has proven beyond our abilities.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: No living Padjal─not even our sister─possesses such power. Without the blessing of A–Towa–Cant, there is nothing we can do.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: With the ashes returned to their rightful resting place, A–Towa–Cant's spirit will return. Surely, it is only a matter of time!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Look around you, Sister. Open your eyes and ears. Time is one thing we do not have.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The fury of the great one mounts with each passing moment─it will not be contained much longer. No, the time for waiting is long past. Now is the time for action.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: But...Forename's garb! The enchanting is not yet complete!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The situation is far from ideal. Yet we have no choice─we must trust in Forename's powers and do what we can.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Do I hear you right, A–Ruhn? Why, it was not long ago that you objected to Forename's very presence at the ritual!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: I may be stubborn, Sister, but I am no fool. I have witnessed Forename's abilities with my own eyes. There can be no doubting that shehe is a mage of the white, one as worthy as you and I.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn...if you would place your trust in Forename so, I see no reason why I should not. Very well, let us hasten for Everschade!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Is something the matter, Forename? This is no time to lose faith in your abilities! Hurry and take your place by the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename... I speak to you now as my peer. The fate of Gridania lies in the balance─we can ill afford to fail.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The great one's rage is too strong! I cannot reach him!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Stay focused, A–Ruhn! If we fall, who will rise to take our place!?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: But, Sister...the forest itself turns against us!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: If we can only reach the great one, his minions will relent. Cast away your worries, and focus your mind on the ritual!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: No! Forename!

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Stand strong, Forename! Are you going to let some overgrown shrub ruffle your feathers?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: (-???-)And the two of you! Don't you have a ritual to perform?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: D-Do... Do my eyes deceive me!?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: This is no time for chitchat! Raya–O, A–Ruhn, Forename─focus your energies on the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: We must quell the great one's fury! Dispatch its minions and resume the Quieting!

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Now! Focus your powers on the Guardian Tree!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Is it...over?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: The great one's anger abates. You have done well, my children.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Master A–Towa. Do you truly...live?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Live...? Not as you would define the word. Mayhap in the heart of Forename here, whose strength I borrowed to join you.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: It's...a miracle.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Aye, it may very well be. Or perhaps the Mothercrystal heard this old soul's wish...

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: I lived a long and fruitful life. But when I drew my last breath in O'Ghomoro that day, I did so with one profound regret─that I would pass from this realm without finding a worthy inheritor to bequeath my knowledge in full.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: My spirit left my lifeless body to abide in this soul crystal, with the hope that one day it would find its way into the hands of my successor.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: For years, my consciousness slumbered in the darkness...until I met Forename.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: From the moment you took my crystal in hand, I knew. Padjal or no, I had at long last found one to whom I could truly pass on my knowledge.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Yes, Forename, I knew... Urrrgh!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Master A–Towa!?

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: The power of the crystal grows faint... It would seem my all–too–brief sojourn here has come to an end.

dialogue.name: ATOWACANT
dialogue.text: Farewell, Forename of the white. Farewell, my children. I leave my forest home in your capable hands...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Master A–Towa... He has left us.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: And yet by his power─and that of his successor, Forename─the great one's fury is quelled, and the Twelveswood is safe.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Though Master A–Towa traveled the world, no doubt his heart always remained here. In the forest home he loved, he waited for us...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Why, Brother...for once, you almost sound wise beyond your years.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Strange, is it not? Perhaps I have finally learned something from you, dear sister.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As I could learn something from you, A–Ruhn. Your pride as a Padjal, your deep respect for our past─these are traits to be admired. The same can be said for Master A–Towa's liberality. Yes, I believe there is a place for both beliefs among our kind.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The road was a long and winding one, but at long last our work is done. Let us return to Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: To meet Master A–Towa in the flesh! Well, not flesh, perhaps... I am still shaking from the experience...and from the pure joy of seeing peace return to my forest home at last.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I will be forever grateful to you, Forename. I am honored that we were able to heal the wood together.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I speak not only for myself; my brother has expressed the same sentiments. Were Master A–Towa here, I am sure he would say the same.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Though...perhaps he is still here in some form. Behold! The final piece of your garb now pulses with his ancient power.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Yes, there can be no doubt that Master A–Towa intended this as his parting gift to you.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Take it, and wear it with pride...Forename of the white.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Before we part, I would bestow unto you a present of my own.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: By the ancient powers vested in me as a Seedseer, I bestow upon you the greatest incantation known to our kind. May you ever heed the will of the elementals, and use it in wisdom and compassion.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Phew! I'm not given to formalities. I swear, I do not know how my sister manages...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: In the short time I have known you, Forename, you have grown into a fine white mage. I am honored to call you my peer. Use your powers in moderation, and let compassion be your guide, and I have no doubt that you will bring succor and solace wherever your journey takes you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the white mage quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The great one is consumed by grief and anger.
Our words will not reach him in this state.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Fear not, my children─I will protect you.
Focus your energies on the Quieting!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Out of my way, foul creature!
I cannot concentrate on the ritual!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
That's the spirit, my children!
I feel the great one responding...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No! It can't...end like this...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Sister... Forgive me...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
My strength grows dim, my children...
I must...return...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
We must quell the great one's fury!
Focus on the Guardian Tree!

obj.n: 蘇る古の武器（タイラス）

quest.name: 響きあうふたつの音色
journal: Guildmaster Luciane wishes to speak to you about learning new skills.

Luciane informs you that the legendary archer-turned-bard, Jehantel the Godsbow, has recently returned to the Twelveswood. Aspiring to transcendent mastery of the bow, several members of the Gods' Quiver have presented themselves as pupils to the legend. Alas, all have returned disappointed, as Jehantel offers only to teach poetry and verse. If you would learn from the man nonetheless, make your way west of Quarrymill in the South Shroud, where he is said to have made his camp.

Having exchanged pleasantries with Jehantel, you astonish the kindly old bard by taking him up on his offer to teach you poetry and verse. He excitedly instructs you to present yourself to a moogle named Pukno Poki, who can often be found in an area situated east of Quarrymill.
Speaking with Pukno Poki, the moogle prevails upon you to recover a stolen charm that was meant for Jehantel. The thief was last seen fleeing to the east of Quarrymill towards Takers' Rot.
You have succeeded in reclaiming the stolen charm. Return it to Pukno Poki, who is likely in the last place you saw him, to the south of Takers' Rot.
You show the charm to Pukno Poki. Impressed by your resourcefulness, the moogle requests that you deliver the strangely shaped crystal to Jehantel in his camp to the west of Quarrymill.

You deliver both Pukno Poki's message and the charm to Jehantel. The legendary archer explains to you that the item you recovered is known as the Soul of the Bard. Jehantel bids you embrace your new calling, and become a bard who exceeds even Pukno Poki's wildest expectations.

※The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Speak with Jehantel to the west of Quarrymill.
Speak with Pukno Poki.
Search for the charm.
Show the charm to Pukno Poki.
Deliver Pukno Poki's charm to Jehantel.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename. Would that we had the time for banter, but we're all up in arms here. Yet another Ixali dirigible has been spotted over the Twelveswood, you see.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Their reappearance calls to my mind the Battle of Griffin Crossing. Well, I say “Battle”─most are agreed that “Massacre” would be rather more apt. Aye, the Ixal dealt us a crushing defeat that day. Right around this time of year, it was, more than two decades past.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: A humiliating episode in our history, to be sure, but heavens forbid that we ever forget it. Failure is the finest─if not the kindest─of teachers, and few things drive a womanman better than its sting.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Ah, but do let's speak of cheerier matters. Mayhap you've already heard, but a renowned archer has recently returned to the Twelveswood─the one they call the “Godsbow.”

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: That's just a title, of course. His birth name is Jehantel, and he was once of the Gods' Quiver. The man was a legend even then, and there was no honor greater than being taken under his tutelage.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: But that's not all there is to him, mind you. Jehantel was also a skilled bard, one of the rare few capable of inspiring others to great feats through song.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Upon learning that the Godsbow had returned, dozens of us flocked to him in hopes of training under a legend, yours truly included.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Alas, the meetings haven't unfolded quite as we had hoped. Jehantel has refused to teach each and every suitor that has approached him thus far.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Though, it should be mentioned that the topics he is reluctant to instruct us in do not include poetry and song. He seems exceedingly keen to teach us all about them. Some few of us were tempted to take him up on the offer...save that we have a nation to defend.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Far be it from my intent to belittle all those bards out there, but I like my chances rather better charging into battle with a quiver than a harp. <sigh> And here we were hoping that transcendent mastery of the bow might be ours...

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Hm? By the sparkle in your eyes, I'd wager you have an interest in that selfsame poetry and song. Come now, there is no call for shyness, and there is more to life than battle. If you would present yourself as a pupil to Jehantel, I happen to know his whereabouts.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I'm given to understand that he has made his camp somewhere west of Quarrymill in the South Shroud. Jehantel is an agreeable sort of fellow, and should be willing enough to meet with you.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I'm still holding on to hope. If you could find a way into Jehantel's confidence, mayhap he can yet be persuaded to train us.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: I wish you the best of luck, friend.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, another guest. You are kind to pay me visit, young one.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Naught gives us elderly folk more pleasure than the company of the young. Add to that a steaming pot of tea and the beauty of the Twelveswood, and we could want for little more!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah. But the curl of your lip tells me that tea and scenery are not what you desire. You seek knowledge of archery, I take it? In which case, I'm afraid I must disappoint you...Forename, was it?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, I am Jehantel, the one they called the Godsbow─but that was in another life. I have long cast aside my bow, taking instead a harp to my breast. For years, I have lived as a bard, going wherever the wind blows, exulting in the beauty of creation through song.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: To be sure, I still have the eyes to recognize a promising archer when I see one. And you, young one, have promise. Keep your nose to the grindstone, and one day you may count yourself a virtuoso of the bow.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Yet know that virtuosity is worthless without virtue. Aye, the words of the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool tell us this much.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: ...You truly wish to remain and learn poetry and verse? Well, well, well...I must admit to being rather taken aback.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In uncertain days such as these, there are few indeed who would devote their time to song as opposed to more “tangible” endeavors.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: You intrigue me, young one. I find myself growing curious as to how the melodies of old might find expression through you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I do believe a certain friend of mine would be of the selfsame opinion. Aye, that would be as good a place as any for us to begin.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Listen well, Forename. There is a moogle named Pukno Poki, who can oft be found wandering an area situated east of here. I would have you present yourself to him.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Pukno Poki is possessed of a discerning eye for talent. If he sees potential in you, I should be well satisfied that you indeed have the makings of a bard.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Heed me, O Puissant Althyk! Turn Thee over the hourglass of time, that we might gaze upon the battles of yore!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Kupoarrrgh! How could this have happened? It's just so...embarrassing! A blunder for the ages, kupo!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Hm? You understand what I'm saying, don't you?

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: That's a rare talent, I'll allow, but you've caught me at a bad time, kupo. Now, be a good adventurer and show yourself out─

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Jehantel sent you!? You should have said so sooner, kupo!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: You do know that Jehantel is no ordinary bard, yes? His songs can salve your heart and strengthen your resolve. They can banish your fears and fill you with hope...and that's not even scratching the surface!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Why, to hear him perform is like bathing in sunbeams, kupo!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: I've asked, begged, and pled more times than I care to count for Jehantel to stay and sing in the forest. Only now has he deigned to set foot here again...but he's refusing to sing for us. That's a blatant breach of promise, kupo!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: ...But what's this? Why, your being resonates with a chord similar to Jehantel's! Perhaps even identical, kupo!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: By the Twelve, this means that things may yet turn out as planned! Why, you might even have it in you to surpass the man, and that's saying a lot, kupo!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Egads! Your coming had so excited me, my predicament nigh escaped my mind!

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: There's a charm that I had meant to give to Jehantel, you see, but it was stolen as I napped, kupo! I roused just in time to espy the thief and attempted to give chase. Alas, drowsiness robbed me of my balance and I was...delayed by this tree.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Last I saw of that overbold brigand, he─or possibly she─was scurrying towards Takers' Rot, kupo. Now, I realize we've only just met, but would you mind recovering the charm and delivering it to Jehantel in my stead?

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Last I saw of that overbold brigand, he─or possibly she─was scurrying towards Takers' Rot, kupo. Now, I realize we've only just met, but would you mind recovering the charm and delivering it to Jehantel in my stead?

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Have you recovered the charm?

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text:
You did it, kupo! Please, you must now deliver it to Jehantel. Tell him that Pukno Poki thinks him a cunning rogue, but is excited nonetheless! So excited, in fact, that he cannot help but sing!
Kupololololo～♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Hm? You have a charm and a message for me from Pukno Poki, you say?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: A cunning rogue, am I? Hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I suppose I must explain. Pukno Poki and I go back a long way, to when first I took up the harp. I made a promise to him then, one that I have yet to make good on.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Pukno Poki has long desired that I remain in the Twelveswood to sing for the rest of my days. Regrettably, I have been ill able to oblige him.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Duty called, you see─I had battlefields to stand upon and comrades to protect. Moreover, an event came to pass that rendered my being in the Twelveswood...problematic.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I thought that by taking eager souls such as you under my wing, mayhap it would suffice to appease Pukno Poki.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Of course, he saw straight through my little ruse. What the moogles lack in grace, they amply make up for in wit.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The creatures are great lovers of song. That you return with this charm is proof positive of his high regard for your potential as bard and archer both.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The charm is a crystal known as the Soul of the Bard. Pukno Poki asked that you bring it to me, aye, but he meant for you to have it. It is a gift from the moogles, bestowed upon those they deem worthy of walking the path of the true bard.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The Soul of the Bard harbors memories of the past─verses and refrains sung by the bards of old.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: As you gain in worldly experience, more of these memories will find expression through your being, imbuing your song with powers untold.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Now, it may surprise you to hear that bowmen and bards are as next of kin. By the same token, mastery of song is dependent upon one's prowess as an archer.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The sense in this will be lost upon you at first, but in time the realization will dawn that bow and harp are but stringed instruments played by the same hand.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Go now, Forename, and let your body and soul drink deep of the melodies of old.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: When next we meet, I hope to see a fully fledged bard standing before me...one who exceeds even Pukno Poki's wildest expectations.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The quest to learn the action “Perform” is now available from Simpkin at Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre in Old Gridania.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

obj.n: 心のままに「楽器演奏」を

quest.name: 弓兵の戦歌
journal: Jehantel wishes to teach you how to learn a new song.

You have learned from Jehantel a method for acquiring a new melody. Travel to Raincatcher Gully in eastern La Noscea, and wait at the specified destination. Defeat the spirits that appear to release them from their suffering.
You have defeated the spirits and, in so doing, sensed something of their undying regret. Return to the South Shroud and report to Jehantel at his camp west of Quarrymill.

After reporting your success to Jehantel, the bard appears satisfied with the changes the defeat of the spirits has wrought in your soul. Return to your training and perfect your performance of the new melody you have earned.

※The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Defeat the spirits of Raincatcher Gully.
Report to Jehantel at his camp west of Quarrymill.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, that glint of determination in your eyes is a testament to your newfound strength. You put me in mind of my salad days, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Hm? You would know why I truly abandoned the battlefield and became a bard?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: That I took an arrow in the knee is what most folk believe...but it is quite clear you are not “most folk.” Very well. I shan't insult your intelligence with an untruth.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: For now, allow me to answer by saying that everything in creation is given to change, and man most of all. I was drawn to the power of song─the power to touch the very souls of men─and decided that I must pursue it.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Sadly, that power has been all but forgotten in this age of cynicism. Such songs as those performed by tavern bards serve no purpose beyond the amusement of drunkards.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: But that was not always the way of it. There was a time when song could shape the outcome of conflict.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ever since nations first quarreled, armies have fielded archers wherewith they rained death upon the enemy from afar. As the battle unfolded, however, the distinction between the lines of friend and foe would grow hazy. Yet the archer's part did not end there.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: He had to stay ever alert, with arrow nocked and eyes trained upon the struggle.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Even as his comrades fell, turning the earth red with their blood, the archer could ill afford to avert his gaze, lest that moment cost another his life.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: One need not have a vivid imagination to appreciate the torrent of emotions that raged within him in that moment.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Nerves near to fraying, his breast fit to burst, the archer did the only thing he could: he sang. His bow became a makeshift instrument, plucked as an accompaniment.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: At first, the archer sang only to still the roiling within. But his voice chanced to carry to his comrades. It inspirited those engaged in combat, lending strength to their sword arms. And to those who lay upon the precipice of death, it granted a measure of peace.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Realizing the tactical potential of song, yet loath to set aside skilled archers for that purpose, armies began raising dedicated regiments of minstrels.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: But the members of such units were no warriors, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Fair of voice and nimble of finger, these career minstrels could find a place in the hall of any lord.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Yet they knew naught of the burden borne by those who charge into battle─whose lot is to dance with death and sup on pain. And so their songs rang hollow, holding no power over the hearts of men.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In eastern La Noscea, spirits are said to haunt the trees of Raincatcher Gully. I would ask you to travel there and await the emergence of these specters.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Through force of arms you are to release the spirits from their tormented existence and, in the doing, ease their unfathomable suffering. With such a deed might you draw forth an ancient melody from the Soul of the Bard.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. In your eyes I see a layer of understanding...of regret, and of futility. And in your heart? It now echoes with the strains of an old song, newly discovered.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Embrace this song, and as you play it in battle shall ever more powerful emotions beset and temper your soul. When your stock of tales has grown, pray return and regale me with stories of your adventures.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

obj.n: 響きあうふたつの音色

quest.name: 時神の境地
journal: Jehantel would help you to learn yet another melody of the bard.

You have learned from Jehantel a method for acquiring a new melody. Travel to Wellwick Wood in eastern Thanalan, and wait at the specified destination. Slay the aldgoats that appear and liberate them from their grief.
You have slain the aldgoats and felt the echoes of their sadness resonate within your soul. Return to the South Shroud and report to Jehantel at his camp west of Quarrymill.

You have reported your success to Jehantel. The bard approves of your new understanding of anguish, and declares you almost ready to hear the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool. First, however, you must train your body to match the ever-growing resilience of your heart.

※The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Defeat the aldgoats of Wellwick Wood.
Report to Jehantel at his camp west of Quarrymill.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: 'Tis good to see you return, Forename, and more seasoned still for your time in the world. Call me a spoony bard, but as a man in the winter of his years, it gives me great joy to observe an adventurer in the spring of hershis.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: This is an odd time for recollection, but it was a spring day when a bard first came to my hometown. He played the most sorrowful chords, even as his words tantalized the ear like the breath of one's first love. Many a maiden's heart was stolen during his visit...and doubtless more besides.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Forename. Would you believe that common bards, too, were born of archers? This may seem far-fetched upon first hearing, but it isn't so far a stretch.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ask yourself this: what becomes of soldiers when conflict gives way to peacetime? Some have lives they might return to, aye, but most must needs take up a new trade to make ends meet. Well, it so happened that many who had once bent the bow took to strumming the harp.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: They wandered the realm, singing passionately and earnestly of the war as seen through their own eyes─of sweet victories and bitter defeats, of sacrifice and cowardice. Their songs so captured the imagination of the people, nary a day passed that a bard was not called to perform, be it in a humble tavern or some great lord's hall.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Alas, their popularity proved their downfall. Intoxicated by the attentions of the masses, the bards took to embellishing their songs in a bid to outdo one another.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: And over time, each song was shorn of verity, till the bard's repertoire contained not one shred of truth.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: By now you will know that such songs have no purchase upon men's hearts. Certainly, a bawdy tune may set off fits of laughter in a sailor, and a sorrowful ballad summon tears from the eyes of a soft-hearted maiden. Yet these are but pale shadows of what songs can achieve.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: For a blessing, this decline did not escape the notice of the moogles. As great patrons of the arts, they feared that the true power of song might be lost to mankind.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: So it was that they labored to gather and safeguard those crystals known as Souls of the Bard, that they might be bestowed upon worthy men and women.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Now, well as I know you relish listening to my sermons, I daresay it's past time we moved on to the practical side of the lesson. I know I have mentioned this previously, but tell me, are you perchance familiar with the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Nay? Well, that won't do at all. We must remedy this posthaste.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The song recounts the Massacre of Griffin Crossing, a battle that took place decades past, wherein countless Gridanian lives came to a premature end.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, but do forgive me─I seem to have mistaken the proper order of things. Before I begin, I must be convinced that the point of the tale will not be lost upon you. Elsewise I will have wasted my breath in the telling of it.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Now, heed well these instructions. You must make your way to Wellwick Wood, where resides a mated pair of aldgoats that have but recently lost a kid. The pair has been driven mad with grief, and only death will put an end to the uncontrolled rampages.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Linger in their territory until you encounter the beasts, then let fly your arrows of mercy. As you liberate them from their sorrow, so too shall your soul resonate with the echoes of poignant melody.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I can almost hear the cries of mourning that have seared themselves into your soul. That you remain unbowed by such anguish is a testament to your spirit's fortitude.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Yet even as your heart swells to contain these new experiences, you must not neglect your skills with the bow.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: A resilient heart must needs have a robust body in which to beat. Once you have trained both to equal strength, then shall I perform for you the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: 罪深き愚者
journal: Jehantel assents to sing for you the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool.
After singing the ballad for you, Jehantel asks that you travel to the Gelmorra Ruins in the North Shroud. Once there, you are to lay a bouquet of Nymeia lilies at the resting place of the fallen.
You have laid the flowers at the resting place as instructed by Jehantel. Return to the South Shroud and speak with the bard at his camp west of Quarrymill.

You have returned to Jehantel at his camp. You learn from the tormented bard that the vainglorious fool of the ballad is none other than himself. With the deaths of his companions weighing heavily on his soul, Jehantel could never again summon the will to bend back his bow. He also regrets exposing you to danger, but nevertheless has a further request to make of you. Speak with the bard once more when you have steeled your resolve.
objectives: Lay the bouquet of Nymeia lilies at the resting place of the fallen at the Gelmorra Ruins.
Speak with Jehantel at his camp west of Quarrymill.
Defeat the Ixali sabreur!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. By your tranquil countenance, it is plain that both your body and soul are in readiness for the next stage of your journey.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Very well. The time is ripe that I teach you the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The song tells the tale of an archer of the Gods' Quiver whose peerless skill was surpassed only by his hubris.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Alas, that hubris led to the annihilation of his entire regiment at the battle which has come to be called the Massacre of Griffin Crossing. Ahem!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
Standing guard in dead of night,♪
An archer, wearying of the sight,♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
Drunk on pride and starved of glory,♪
Forsook his post to claim victory.♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
Ten score yalms had the archer crept,♪
When shrieks rang out whence his comrades slept,♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
For he was not there to see the knives,♪
Nor to ring the bell and save friends' lives.♪

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Tell me, Forename, what lessons can be learned from this tale?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, but hold that thought─what your tongue claims to understand interests me not.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: As before, I'd sooner have you demonstrate the fruits of your learning with bow in hand. This time, however, you shall have the pleasure of my company.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I would have you escort me to the Gelmorra Ruins in the North Shroud. It is there that some few fallen from the Massacre of Griffin Crossing have been laid to rest. Pray honor this place of remembrance with a bouquet of lilies.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Heed me, O Puissant Althyk! Cast Thee back the rains to the firmament, that we might gaze upon the battles of yore!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The enemy van!?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: No... I...I cannot...

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Why? Why do I still draw breath?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text:
That a sin of the past would beget another...
Forgive me, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: As you have doubtless noticed, I am no longer capable of wielding a bow─I, whom they call the Godsbow.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I had hoped that the years would take the edge off the memories...but I hoped in vain. Absolution does not come so easily. Heed me well, Forename, for I shall reveal all to you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The man sung of in the Ballad of the Vainglorious Fool, whose hubris doomed an entire regiment─he and I are one and the same.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Being no stranger to the bow, you will know that the archer's role in battle is that of support. His charge is to thin out the enemy line, that his comrades might gain ground in the field of battle.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: By that most basic of criteria, I was unfit to hold a bow from the first.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In my pride and lust for glory, I sent countless souls to a bloody grave─good men and women all, with loved ones and bright futures awaiting them. I lost the will to live that day, becoming an empty husk of a man, tormented in sleep and wakefulness both by the memories of my crime.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: But the gods were not without mercy. They gifted me with song, that I might find a measure of solace in my wretched existence.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: A new melody resounds within you, I see. Though this outing was rather far departed from what I had in mind, that it still bore fruit gives me comfort.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: On that note, let us conclude the lesson. I daresay I have no cause to worry that you will repeat the selfsame mistake as the vainglorious fool.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Forename, I would be alone for a while. Take yourself back to camp─I shall make my own way there presently.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I am glad to see you safely returned. Though I rasp my voice hoarse through the saying of it, I cannot tell you enough times how much I regret dragging you into such danger.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: ...And yet, there is more I would ask of you. If you would do me the kindness of lending your ear, then pray speak now.

quest.name: 浄罪の地を求めて
journal: Jehantel has a request for you.

The bard known as the Godsbow has bid you gather the four parts of the choral attire. Search the sacks at Halfstone in western La Noscea, Urth's Gift in the South Shroud, Raubahn's Push in northern Thanalan, and the Goldleaf Dais in the East Shroud.
You have gathered the four parts of the choral attire. Return to Jehantel's camp west of Quarrymill in the South Shroud.

You have returned to Jehantel bearing the garments he once surrendered to fate. Now fully convinced of your destiny to don the choral attire, it appears that the bard has come to a decision. He asks for time to make certain preparations, and sends you away to focus on your training

※The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Find choral attire at Halfstone.
Find choral attire at Urth's Gift.
Find choral attire at Raubahn's Push.
Find choral attire at the Goldleaf Dais.
Return to Jehantel at his camp west of Quarrymill.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: You will listen to my request though you know me for the vainglorious fool I am? I am humbled.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The boon I ask of you is simple: I would have you sing for me.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you sing for Jehantel?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: A heartfelt performance, masterfully delivered. You have come far in such a short time, my young apprentice.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Hearing your song this day, I am convinced that you are well on your way to surpassing me, as bard and archer both. Soon there will be naught left for me to impart to you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Forename. You have proven yourself worthy of the consecrated garments worn by the true bards of old to honor the Keeper. I speak of the choral attire.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The attire was entrusted to me when Pukno Poki and I first met, deep within the Twelveswood. The moogle and I had traded scarce more than a handful of words when he proffered to me the attire along with the Soul of the Bard.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: At that time, I knew not the true power of song, and so declined the gifts...but Pukno Poki would not be denied. For all his good humor, the moogle can be as unmoving as a rock. “The attire chooses the wearer, not the other way 'round,” he insisted, and I found myself yielding to his will.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In mastering the verses of war, I won acclaim beyond my wildest dreams upon the field of battle, and for a time I was well pleased.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Alas, my lust for glory knew no bounds, the consequence of which you are already aware. It was in the wake of the Massacre of Griffin Crossing. Stricken with guilt, I wanted naught more than the earth to open up to swallow me whole. I had lost the will to live, aye, but I was too craven to end it myself.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: And so I took to wandering aimlessly, in search of a place to die, far away from the judging eyes of men.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Disillusioned with the power of song, I committed an act of folly: I scattered the choral attire across the realm. “If truly the attire chooses its wearer,” I challenged, “then let it find its way back to me.”

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Determined that I would not be proven wrong, I went to great pains to ensure that the attire would never again see the light of day, and the pieces now rest in places of peril. Being the proud fool that I was, it never crossed my mind that mayhap another was meant to don it.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I would entrust the choral attire to you, Forename. But as you can see, you must needs brave the dangers to claim it. I shall mark its whereabouts on your map, but I can afford you no further aid beyond that.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I am deeply sorry that my folly of years past has entailed this burden upon you. But Althyk works in mysterious ways─in His wisdom, it may be that He has sent this trial to test your spirit.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I mean not for my sentiments to encumber you, but I am convinced that you are the one chosen by the choral attire.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: But pray do not take that as license for complacency. Trials wouldn't be called such if they failed to tax one's ability. Stay ever on your toes, Forename. I would have you return whole of body, and bearing the four parts of my surrendered raiment.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Heed me, O Puissant Althyk! Reverse Thee the seasons' turning, that we might gaze upon the battles of yore!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: So, you have returned─sound of body and mind, I trust? And you bear the four parts of the choral attire!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I knew you for the true owner of these garments ere I heard your song. Since the day we met, your determination has reminded me of much that I have lost...and would have again.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I have at last settled my heart on a matter that has plagued me for some decades. When my preparations are complete, you shall know of my decision. Until then, may your song lift the spirits of your allies, and your arrows seek the hearts of your foes.

quest.name: 命の賛歌
journal: Jehantel wishes to bestow upon you the final garment of the choral attire.

Jehantel has asked of you one final request. You are to meet him at the site of his regiment's demise to the west of the Observatorium in the Coerthas central highlands. Once you arrive, lay a bouquet of Nymeia lilies at the specified location.
You have honored the fallen with a bouquet of lilies. Speak with Jehantel and learn how the old bard fares.

Faced with the prospect of losing another dear companion, Jehantel finds himself once more able to draw back his bow. And after long years of regret and crushing guilt, the bard is finally able to sing a requiem for his fallen comrades. Thanks to your inspiring presence, Jehantel has decided to lend what aid he may to the Gods' Quiver, and live fully the years that remain to him.

※The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Lay the bouquet of Nymeia lilies at the specified location in the Coerthas central highlands.
Speak with Jehantel.
Defeat the Ixal and their wolves!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: You have done well, my young apprentice. In returning with the choral attire, you have reaffirmed my faith in you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I see no further reason to withhold from you the existence of the final piece in the set...the piece that has brought us together.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Listen well, Forename. When I put down my bow, I vowed never again to set foot in the Twelveswood. That I now forsake my oath is for no other reason than to impart my knowledge to one who would succeed me.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder why I should deem that so important, permit me to relate to you an event which brought about a great change in me.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: My most recent journey had taken me to Ul'dah, where I found myself ambling through the marketplace early one morn.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Browsing the wares on display, mine eyes were met with a relic from my past: a piece from the choral attire that I had discarded decades before, countless malms away.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I felt at once that it was not mere chance that had reunited me with it, and put forth the coin with nary a pause. Holding the garment in my hands, I resolved to find a worthy heir to my legacy.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Alas, no sooner had I arrived in the Twelveswood than I found myself mobbed by archers seeking to hone their skills. Amongst those who came, not a one showed the least interest in poetry and verse.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Sorely discouraged and regretting my decision, I made to strike camp and leave the Twelveswood once more, never to return.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It was then that you appeared, young one.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: When you expressed your desire to learn song, I could scarce contain my joy.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Looking back, I am fully convinced that our meeting had been preordained.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Your coming has instilled me with the courage to attend that matter of which I spoke earlier. I am ready─ready to make a pilgrimage to the scene of my regiment's demise.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ever since that fateful day, I have been haunted by visions of my fallen comrades, torment graven upon their bloodied faces.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Lost to hope but too craven to end my own life, I wandered the land aimlessly, seeking a place to die. But the heavens denied me even that.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Yet just when it seemed that despair would draw me wholly into its black abyss, never to emerge again, a melody resounded within me.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It was then that I awakened to the power of song and found new purpose in life.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I embarked upon a journey to master such verses as would bestow peace upon the fallen, that I might lay the tortured souls of my comrades to rest.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It has taken long years, but now I believe I can offer a requiem worthy of my comrades. To do so, however, I require one last favor of you, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I would have you escort me to the west of the Observatorium, in the Coerthas central highlands.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It is there that we shall find the scene of my regiment's demise.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Your presence kindles within me a courage I had thought lost. I would have none other by my side as I undertake this pilgrimage─now, as I enter the most daunting stage of my life.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Once you arrive, I ask that you pay your respects with another bouquet of Nymeia lilies. When my requiem is sung, you shall have the final piece of the choral attire.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Heed me, O Puissant Althyk! Reverse Thee the dance of the stars athwart the night sky, that we might ease the suffering of souls long departed!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: We are surrounded! And our foes seem disinclined to listen to parley.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: You must survive this, Forename! My soul is overburdened with the deaths of too many dear companions.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Forename. Without you, I would not be standing here this day. I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Forgive me, my friends. I have kept you waiting overlong.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The Keeper be praised... I...I can wield a bow once more...

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It was you, young one, who helped me to remember how.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I had known this for some time, but your presence is as a salve for the wounds of my soul. Your coming has delivered me from the nightmares of my past.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: My worthy successor. To you I entrust the final piece of the choral attire. Don it, and go forth to fill the hearts of men with courage and purpose.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Though the seasons may turn, bending a man's back and dimming his eye, so long as there is life, there is reason to hope. Thank you, Forename, for showing me the truth of this.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: With the blood of my comrades upon my hands, to simply draw breath racked me with such guilt as I could not bear. But the time for mourning is past.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I shall take up the bow once more and lend what aid I can to the Gods' Quiver. In fighting for those who yet live, I do my fallen comrades the greatest honor.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Yet another melody resounds within you, I see. Then there is naught more I can impart to you. As equals, let us together give praise to life and all the joy that it brings!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Heed me, O Puissant Althyk! Turn Thee over the hourglass of time, that we might exult in the glory of all creation!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In Thine exalted name we sing, that the living may savor life and the departed know true peace!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I thank you again, Forename. You have blessed this old fool with the gentle touch of salvation.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Eorzea awaits! Go forth now, and inspire endless hope and courage with the beauty of your songs. May we one day meet again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the bard quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next bard quest will be available from Jehantel.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: My bow... I cannot...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Does cruel fate seek to stain my hands once more?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Have I not drank deep enough of bitter regret?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I shall aid you as best I can.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename! To my side!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
No more lives will be lost to my folly!
May my songs envelop and protect you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Forename! You must not fall!
Hear my song, and be invigorated!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Mayhap in the sleep of death I shall know peace...

obj.n: 蘇る古の武器（アルテミスの弓）

quest.name: 業火の召喚獣
journal: Acting Guildmaster Thubyrgeim has news of a task which might interest you.

Thubyrgeim has told you of a request made to the guild that asks for an arcanist of uncommon experience. If you would answer this request, you are to travel to Apkallu Falls in Gridania and speak with Y'mhitra.

Y'mhitra, a member of the scholarly Sons of Saint Coinach, explains the recent discovery that led to her requesting your cooperation. Seek out the researcher in the west of Byregot's Strike, and follow her instructions for conducting the Austerities of Flame.
You have successfully tamed the egi spawned by the summoning ritual. Speak with Y'mhitra once more to learn what must next be done.
After praising your performance during the battle to subdue the egi, Y'mhitra bids you meet with her back at Apkallu Falls in Gridania.

You return to where you first met Y'mhitra, and she explains to you the nature of the entity you now command. The next stage of her research will culminate in the Austerities of Earth─a ritual that demands the summoner to have once toppled the primal Titan. Even with such experience, however, you will first need to accustom yourself to your newfound abilities.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon the successful defeat of the primal Titan, and upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Speak with Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.
Speak with Y'mhitra west of Byregot's Strike.
Speak with Y'mhitra.
Return to Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.
Defeat Ifrit-Egi!

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. You might be interested to know that the guild has received an intriguing request. The task, however, specifically requires an arcanist that has faced and defeated the primal Ifrit.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: If you would consider undertaking this duty, then you must first travel to Ul'dah and participate in an expedition to slay the Lord of the Inferno.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The first summoner quest will become available from Thubyrgeim upon the successful defeat of the primal Ifrit.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. It is well you have come, for we have an intriguing matter to discuss.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: A request has come to our guild from the Sons of Saint Coinach─an organization of some of the finest minds in Eorzea─and they have asked for you by name.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: It appears that the research the Sons are currently conducting would benefit from the assistance of an arcanist─specifically one who has had the tempering experience of defeating the primal Ifrit.

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: Though I must admit to some curiosity as to how these scholars knew the extent of your heroic exploits, I suppose the source of their knowledge is of little relevance...

dialogue.name: THUBYRGEIM
dialogue.text: If you would answer this request, then you will find your contact, a researcher by the name of Y'mhitra, at Apkallu Falls in the nation of Gridania.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You are Forename Surname, I assume? Well met, and thank you for coming. My name, as you have obviously surmised, is Y'mhitra.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I am a member of the Sons of Saint Coinach. Ours is a Sharlayan order that seeks the lost knowledge of the Allagan Empire.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And in that regard, we have recently made a singularly important discovery at our dig site in Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We salvaged from the ruins a set of ancient texts describing the existence of a sect of Allagan mages known as “summoners.” These were arcane practitioners said to have the ability to siphon the essences of the primals and manifest this stolen energy as a biddable ally known as an “egi.”

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Should we succeed in resurrecting such arts, then we might well hold in our hands the power to bring this age of conflict to an end. There is, however, as there always must be, one monumental obstacle to realizing this reality.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: In order to manifest these obedient incarnations of the beastmen's savage deities, one must first defeat a primal and capture its aetheric essence.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Thus, only one who can boast such a daunting achievement under herhis belt may even begin on the path to becoming a summoner. Do you understand now why I called upon you?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: If you wish to contribute to my research, then come to me in the west of Byregot's Strike, in southern Thanalan. There shall we conduct a ritual of summoning: the Austerities of Flame.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Greetings to you once more, Forename. I had a feeling this unique opportunity would be nigh impossible for you to ignore. Let us proceed directly to the ritual, shall we?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: According to the records we recovered, the summoners of old would perform these rites in a land in which the naturally dominant element matched the aspect of the avatar they wished to call forth. Only in such a place might one sufficiently shift one's aetheric balance in the desired direction.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The element of fire is especially strong here in the Sagolii Desert─I can think of no land more fitting in which to summon an incarnation of the Lord of the Inferno.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Before we begin, I must insist that you accept this gem. It may appear of little worth, but within its faceted depths dwell the memories of long-deceased summoners.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Now, you must focus. Visualize the aether flowing through you, a vibrant current of energy transforming into living fire. Hold this image in your mind, and the raging heat of your life force shall spawn an egi wreathed in flames!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Be aware, however, that this nascent entity will appear before you unbound and hostile. It is your charge to overpower the avatar, and establish yourself as its master. The path of the summoner is naught if not fraught with peril!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Most impressive, Forename! The fire-born egi has submitted to your will!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You have mastered the Austerities of Flame, and that is no small feat. Pray let us return to Apkallu Falls that we might further discuss your achievement!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: This is truly a momentous occasion! You have rescued the lost art of summoning from the grasping mire of forgotten history.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: But you must know more of the avatar you have bound. In the ancient tongue of the Allagan Empire, it would be known as “Ifrit-Egi,” where “egi” translates approximately to “pure” or “the essence of.”

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: In short, you have tamed a willful manifestation of Ifrit's raging fires.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: As you might expect from an entity born of the Lord of the Inferno, this avatar and its capacity for destruction should serve you well in your battles to come.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: With such an ally at your command, it is not too soon to take upon yourself the title of “summoner.” You have proven yourself more than worthy of the soul crystal you now possess.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Yet be that as it may, the road before you is long and arduous. If you would triumph in this age of conflict, you must needs master more than just the egi of fire. I suggest you next fix your gaze upon claiming a servant of unyielding stone.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You once seized victory against the primal Titan, did you not? Though I admit I am eager to progress directly to the Austerities of Earth, we must be careful not to overtax your reserves of strength.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Rest well, and spend some time to grow accustomed to your newfound abilities. Once you feel prepared to continue with our historic research, you will find me here awaiting your arrival with barely constrained impatience!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: This will, of course, necessitate you joining an expedition to defeat the primal known as Titan. This beloved divinity of the kobolds poses the greatest threat to Limsa Lominsa, and it is there that you shall find allies in your cause.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The risks are great, but so, too, are the rewards! Topple the Lord of Crags, and we may progress to the next stage of our historic research! Fair fortune to you, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The heat is almost intolerable.
Pray defeat this entity swiftly, Forename.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Ifrit-Egi has summoned sprites to do its bidding!
Have a care they do not surround you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You must shatter the crimson nails!
They amplify the egi's powers!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The crimson nails are destroyed!
Now is the time to press your attack!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: My apologies, I... Combat is not my forte...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

obj.n: 巴術最大級命題の証明

quest.name: 大地の召喚獣
journal: Y'mhitra, the researcher at Apkallu Falls, wishes you to proceed with the next summoning ritual.
You have chosen to perform the Austerities of Earth. Speak with Y'mhitra southwest of Alder Springs in the North Shroud to begin the ritual, and attempt to bind a new egi to your will.

After following Y'mhitra's instructions, you summon and defeat the entity known as Titan-Egi. However, before you are able to celebrate, you find yourself under assault by a man who also appears to be a summoner. Though you manage to force the stranger to retreat, you are left bewildered by the unprovoked attack. Speak with Y'mhitra to see how she is faring in the aftermath.
You have spoken to Y'mhitra and confirmed that she is sound of body. Return with her to Apkallu Falls in Gridania to discuss the encounter further.

Y'mhitra, still somewhat shaken, wonders what could have motivated the haughty stranger's sudden attack. The researcher suggests that you spend some time exploring the capabilities of your new egi ally while she makes use of the Sons' resources to investigate the identity of the murderous summoner.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Speak with Y'mhitra to the southwest of Alder Springs.
Speak with Y'mhitra.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.
Defeat Titan-Egi!
Defeat the dark summoner!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: By all accounts, the primal Titan is a dire threat to the people of Limsa Lominsa. If you would face the Lord of Crags and continue with our historic research, then you must travel to the maritime nation and join a primal-hunting expedition.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: There is little point in beginning the Austerities of Earth until you have bathed in the aether released upon Titan's defeat.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon the successful defeat of the primal Titan.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Titan's essence infuses your aura, Forename. I foresee no further obstacles preventing us from attempting the next ritual.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Shall we proceed with the Austerities of Earth? I have every confidence that you will succeed in binding Titan-Egi to your will.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: According to my research, the most suitable location for the ritual is a place found to the southwest of Alder Springs in the North Shroud. A heretofore buried layer of ancient rock exposed by the violent upheavals of the Calamity has lent the surrounding area an overwhelming earthen aspect.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The conditions will be perfect. I will await you at our destination, Forename.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The ritual you are about to perform is, essentially, no different from the Austerities of Flame.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Instead of fire, however, you will be concentrating on shifting your aetheric balance towards the spectrum of earth. Once you have achieved the required state of earthen affinity, the primal's captured essence will tumble forth and coalesce into the stony form of Titan-Egi.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: As before, you must demonstrate unflinching authority if you would convince the newborn avatar to heed your commands. Let us begin!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Oh, well done, Forename!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)I come in search of Allagan relics, and what do I find but a pair of incompetent dabblers. By what jest of fate did you chance across such undeserved power?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And who might you be, sir, to so boldly question our accomplishments?

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)If you have, indeed, unlocked the secrets of summoning, then you must be in possession of the very treasure I seek.

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)How terribly convenient. I need only slay you both and take what I need from your bloody corpses.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Gods below! A summoner!? But how!?

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-Dark Summoner-)Cease your infantile prattle! The continuation of my divine work far outweighs the worth of your pitiful lives!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-Dark Summoner-)Why do you struggle so?

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-Dark Summoner-)Your unwillingness to accept oblivion but delays the inevitable!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-Dark Summoner-)Heed me, avatar of infernal flame! Incinerate these fools in all-consuming hellfire!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-Dark Summoner-)What!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Feel nature's fury, you vile blackguard!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: (-Dark Summoner-)<grunt> I tire of this childish game. Thank your gods for granting you another day of miserable existence!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: He's gone... What a decidedly unpleasant fellow.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well, I suggest we return to Apkallu Falls─I have no desire to linger here and chance another encounter with...whomever that deranged mage was.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I must say, I did not expect to meet another practitioner of the summoning arts.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And I also did not expect to be suddenly fighting for my life. What precious treasure do we carry that this callous stranger was so willing to kill us to possess it?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Such mysteries aside, I am most glad you were able to secure Titan-Egi before the summoner decided to unleash his fiery avatar. Without its protection, I doubt we would have survived that conflagration.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The egi of earth─as was so aptly demonstrated─is not a force to be trifled with. You should certainly take the time to explore its capabilities, as well as its limitations. Be careful, however, not to neglect other magicks at your disposal.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, I shall confer with my colleagues in the Sons of Saint Coinach, and see what I might learn of that hostile summoner. We shall meet anon.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The mere presence of this egi is suffocating.
It is as if the weight of a mountain presses upon my chest!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The entity has summoned allies of earth!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The aetheric flow...it shakes the very ground.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
How fortunate to die by my hand!
Naught but ash shall remain of your wretchedness!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Defend yourself, Forename!
His words are no empty threat!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You think to stand against me?
Foolish bravado. You will burn nonetheless.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Be on your guard!
His power is building!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: ...How can this be?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The art of summoning was lost...
I should have known if there were others...

quest.name: 黒き召喚士の影
journal: Y'mhitra wishes to share with you the results of her investigation.

As a member of the Sons of Saint Coinach, Y'mhitra has access to records that allowed her to narrow down her search for the mystery assailant. Though she uncovered little more than an outdated military registration and a name─Tristan─the researcher was also able to track down one of the man's old war comrades. Travel to Little Ala Mhigo, and speak with the former Immortal Flame.
You have survived the ambush sprung upon you by the former soldier in Little Ala Mhigo. Return to Apkallu Falls and speak with Y'mhitra.

Though your inquiries in Little Ala Mhigo were met with nothing but misguided hostility, you nevertheless learn that Tristan is aware of your efforts to track him. Y'mhitra apologizes for her mistaken evaluation of the dangerous summoner, and bids you continue to improve in the art of summoning.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Speak with the former Immortal Flame in Little Ala Mhigo.
Return to Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: How fared you with your training, Forename? For my part, I had some success in uncovering the identity of our mystery attacker.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We knew that our assailant was capable of summoning Ifrit-Egi, so I perused the records of past expeditions for those who claimed to have triumphed against the Lord of the Inferno.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Of these victorious primal hunters, there were eight names listed as “present whereabouts unknown.” After eliminating unlikely candidates based on race and gender, I was left with but a single name: Tristan.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Assuming the records are accurate, this Hyur was once registered as a soldier in the Immortal Flames. As to how the man came by his skills as a summoner, or why he sought to kill us, however, I remain woefully ignorant.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, I have witnessed him use the art of summoning for casual brutality, and that I cannot countenance. This power should never be employed for the sake of tyranny or personal gain; it was meant to oppose such evils.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It is our responsibility to bring this Tristan to justice. Should we stand idle, his reprehensible actions could very well stain the good name of future summoners who have yet to answer their calling. The art itself could be outlawed: the very mention of it, taboo.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Now, through my inquiries I was able to determine that a war comrade from Tristan's days in the military resides in Little Ala Mhigo. I ask that you pay a visit to this former soldier, and learn what he knows of our callous villain.

dialogue.name: SENYOU
dialogue.text: Well, well, seems like Tristan wasn't telling tall tales, after all. He said I could expect some primal-addled sod to show up and start asking questions.

dialogue.name: SENYOU
dialogue.text: Why don't you stay here and “play” with some friends of mine─I've a message to deliver. She'sHe's all yours, ladies!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You were set upon!? The fiend is one step ahead of us...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I'd wager ten years of dig site findings that Tristan “warned” his old allies long before you set foot in that settlement. They thought you one of the tempered─a mortal in thrall to a primal's will.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: In addition to being ruthless, it appears that our opponent is highly intelligent...and not quite as deranged as I first assumed.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Such a level of planning hints at the existence of some greater scheme. But that is still all we know. For the moment, we must be content with the knowledge that he perceives us as a threat and is aware of our efforts to track him.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, you did exceedingly well to survive the trap into which I blithely sent you.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I must apologize for my carelessness─I will not underestimate this man again. On a happier note, however, my efforts to decipher the Allagan texts proceed apace. Here, you must read this.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: With your skills already tried and tested against the egi, you should have little difficulty in mastering a secondary summoning technique such as this. Let us put this day's disaster behind us, and focus on the wonders that lie ahead!

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

quest.name: アラグの装束
journal: Y'mhitra wishes to share with you her thoughts on dealing with Tristan.

In order to prepare for the inevitable clash with the dark summoner, Y'mhitra suggests that you enhance your powers with the ancient Allagan garments unearthed in the ruins of Mor Dhona. Travel to Saint Coinach's Find and speak with Rammbroes.

Rammbroes is sympathetic to your plight, but claims that you will have to aid his excavation team before they will consider surrendering their pieces of the evoker's attire. Speak first with the muddled researcher, and defeat the mirrorknight that is distracting the scholar from her tasks.
You have defeated the distracting mirrorknight. Speak with the muddled researcher once more.
The grateful researcher rewards you with a piece of the evoker's attire. Speak next with the unmanned researcher, and defeat the mirrorknight that has him quaking in his boots.
You have defeated the fear-inspiring mirrorknight. Speak with the unmanned researcher once more.
The grateful researcher rewards you with a piece of the evoker's attire. Speak next with the seemingly unmoved researcher, and defeat the mirrorknight that is perturbing him.
You have defeated the bothersome mirrorknight. Speak with the seemingly unmoved researcher once more.
The grateful researcher rewards you with a piece of the evoker's attire. With all the mirrorknights thus defeated, it is time you returned to Rammbroes to report your success.

Praising your efforts to secure the safety of the dig sites, Rammbroes gladly rewards you with the summoner's garment he himself uncovered in the ruins. Thus weighted down with Allagan garb, you are ready to return to Y'mhitra where she awaits you at Apkallu Falls.

Y'mhitra makes note of the fact that your newly obtained equipment bears a strong resemblance to the garments worn by the dark summoner, Tristan. In order to guarantee your supremacy in summoning, the researcher appears eager to conduct the Austerities of Wind─a ritual that requires the captured aetheric essence of the Lady of the Vortex. While Y'mhitra seeks an appropriate place to call forth the wind-aspected egi, she bids you make certain of your own preparations.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon the successful defeat of the primal Garuda.
