objectives: Speak with Rammbroes at Saint Coinach's Find in Mor Dhona.
Speak with the muddled researcher and defeat the mirrorknight.
Speak with the muddled researcher.
Speak with the unmanned researcher and defeat the mirrorknight.
Speak with the unmanned researcher.
Speak with the seemingly unmoved researcher and defeat the mirrorknight.
Speak with the seemingly unmoved researcher.
Report to Rammbroes.
Return to Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. Though it is good to see you, I am afraid I have yet to ascertain Tristan's ultimate objective. I only know that he is cunning and brutal, and will stop at nothing to achieve his purpose.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: As matters stand, we but chase after this man's shadow. Such a straightforward pursuit will, I believe, leave us ever one step behind.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Our sole advantage is the “treasure” we possess that Tristan appears to covet. Eventually, his desire will bring him to us.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Where and when Tristan will strike, I cannot say, but it is unlikely to be on a field of our choosing. Thus, I suggest we prepare for this inevitable conflict as best we may.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: As fortune would have it, the ruins of Mor Dhona may have provided us with a new source of strength: word among the Sons is that a set of evoker's attire has been unearthed.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Made during the reign of the Allagan Empire, these enchanted garments were sewn for the exclusive use of summoners. I can only imagine the degree to which they will enhance your already impressive powers.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The man supervising the excavation efforts at Saint Coinach's Find─Rammbroes─is a dear friend of mine. In light of our circumstances, I am certain that he will consent to a request that you be allowed to don the attire. Shall we pay him a visit?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Ah, Y'mhitra! I suspected you would make an appearance before long. And I presume this fine ladyfine gentleman is the new summoner I've heard so much about?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Yes─hopefully the first of many. Now, pray tell me, Rammbroes, has the discovery of Allagan-made evoker's attire been confirmed?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: It has. Truly an historical find!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Then...I would ask a boon of you, my friend. You recall the predicament of which I spoke? Our chances of survival would be greatly improved if you would consider allowing Forename to wear the Allagan garments.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Hmmm. Well, shehe is a summoner, after all. And I must confess to no small degree of scholarly curiosity as to the effect the attire will have on one with the appropriate training.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: These finds are, however, the result of much sweat and even a few tears on the part of our excavation team. 'Tis a frustrating task at times, and I fear they will be loath to part with the garments without some measure of recompense for their efforts.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Allow me, though, to offer a solution. Metallic monstrosities of Allagan construction known as “mirrorknights” have risen from the dig sites scattered across Mor Dhona. Needless to say, they pose a dangerous threat to our excavators.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: I suggest you speak with my three field researchers, and dispose of any such nasty hindrances to their work. I daresay they will then gladly surrender the pieces of the attire they hold.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Once I have confirmed our dig sites suitably empty of armored horrors, I will see you rewarded with the garment that I myself recovered from the ruins.

dialogue.name: SEEKER450A
dialogue.text: A mirrorknight lurks just over yonder. I can scarce think straight with that thing wandering about! Oh gods... It approaches!

dialogue.name: SEEKER450A
dialogue.text: Phew! You have my thanks. Now I might finally be able to concentrate on my tasks.

dialogue.name: SEEKER450A
dialogue.text: ...If I'm not mistaken, you were in search of the evoker's attire? I have one of its wondrous pieces right here─you are most welcome to it!

dialogue.name: SEEKER450B
dialogue.text: P-Praise the g-gods! R-Rammbroes said an adventurer w–would be along. P–Please! Y–You must destroy that h-horrid construction!

dialogue.name: SEEKER450B
dialogue.text: Thank you for eliminating the source of my recent nightmares. I do not ordinarily stutter so, you see, but abject terror has that effect on folk.

dialogue.name: SEEKER450B
dialogue.text: Now, I hear from Y'mhitra that you have need of this Allagan garment. I should be glad to see it put to practical use, rather than shut away in some dusty vault.

dialogue.name: SEEKER450C
dialogue.text: Mirrorknights? Yes, they have become quite bothersome. I would be most appreciative were you to eliminate the creaking pest that has been plaguing me of late.

dialogue.name: SEEKER450C
dialogue.text: Fascinating. I never thought I would be fortunate enough to observe a conflict against an Allagan construction at such close quarters.

dialogue.name: SEEKER450C
dialogue.text: This has been a deeply enriching experience. If the price is to be my piece of the evoker's attire, then so be it.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Ah, the champion of my researchers returns!

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: With the ruins now free of mirrorknights, the excavations can proceed at a far more satisfying pace. Trembling in fear for one's life makes it astonishingly difficult to handle ancient artifacts that have a tendency to crumble into dust.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: You have performed a valuable duty for us, Forename. As promised, you shall have the summoner's garment uncovered by my own hand as your reward.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Ah, yes. Y'mhitra mentioned she would await you at Apkallu Falls. It seems there was no doubt in her mind that you would succeed here.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: So, this was how the summoners of old were clad. Well, more or less. It is unfortunate that the ruins have yet to surrender the final piece to the Sons.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: These garments... Aside from the coloring, they are identical to the garb Tristan wore.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: He will find no edge against you through his equipment. When next you face that murderous cad, victory will be decided purely by who is the more talented summoner.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: To that end, it is time you drew on your experience of defeating the primal Garuda. Yes, her aura of fickle violence is palpable upon you.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It is daunting to imagine an egi born of the Lady of the Vortex... Such unpredictable ferocity should serve you well!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I will search for a suitably...airy...location in which to perform the Austerities of Wind. You, my dear summoner, must needs prepare yourself body and mind for the trials ahead. I shall be waiting.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: To that end, I would soon proceed with the Austerities of Wind to secure you another potent ally. Though...it seems that you do not yet count the Lady of the Vortex amongst your triumphs.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The primal Garuda is as a glowering stormfront, ever poised to unleash her merciless gales upon Gridania. If you would capture her aetheric essence, then you must find yourself an expedition to join.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: You sense a hostile presence!

obj.n: エボカーウェストクラウト

quest.name: 烈風の召喚獣
journal: Y'mhitra wishes you to attempt the next summoning ritual.
You are ready to perform the Austerities of Wind. Travel to the Floating City of Nym in outer La Noscea and speak with Y'mhitra to begin the ritual.
You have succeeded in controlling the storm that is Garuda-Egi. Speak with Y'mhitra and celebrate your victory.
After praising your skills as a summoner and showing her gratitude for your contribution to her research, Y'mhitra suggests a return to Apkallu Falls.

Y'mhitra explains to you the nature of the ally you have gained. While the researcher continues to investigate the mysterious Tristan, she bids you experiment with your egi, and master their abilities in preparation for the coming confrontation.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Speak with Y'mhitra in the Floating City of Nym.
Speak with Y'mhitra.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.
Defeat Garuda-Egi!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You should have little trouble finding an expedition here in Gridania that seeks to challenge the keening winds of the Lady of the Vortex.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Remember: we can only proceed with the next summoning ritual once you have grounded Garuda and captured her aetheric essence.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon the successful defeat of the primal Garuda.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I sense Garuda's restless essence railing within the confines of your aetheric channels. It is time we granted it release with the Austerities of Wind.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Thankfully, I already have in mind a location that well suits our elemental purposes.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You are familiar with the Floating City of Nym in outer La Noscea? As you might imagine, the aspect of wind is entirely dominant in the area of those suspended isles.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Pray make your way there as soon as you feel prepared─I am quite excited to see this new egi!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Shall we begin? I assume that as this is your third such experience, you have by now grown familiar with the steps of the ritual.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Thus, as before, I would have you concentrate on shifting your aetheric balance. Imagine the energy within you howling through your veins─an incessant gale of screeching wrath.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Garuda's essence will be only too eager to harness those raging currents, and shape them into a worldly avatar. Once Garuda-Egi has appeared, it falls to you to tame its fury.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Masterfully done, Forename! Garuda-Egi's power is now yours to wield!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Your aptitude for the art of summoning has exceeded my highest expectations. I honestly could not have found a more valuable partner for my research!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Let us return to Apkallu Falls. I am sure you must be exhausted after this ordeal.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: With the addition of Garuda-Egi, you now command three powerful avatars.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: As you have no doubt realized, however, each of these entities has a particular role in which it excels.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: For Garuda-Egi, that role is unleashing magic to strike down distant foes. I must admit to feeling equal parts joy and apprehension at how faithfully the summoned being displays the original primal's volatile disposition.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Experiment with your egi allies, and the most effective use of their individual abilities will soon become clear. With such mastery of the art at your disposal, I shall almost pity Tristan when next he chooses to confront you.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Before that time comes, however, I will endeavor to pierce the mystery of his motivations. May your discoveries bring you new confidence, Forename.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Such powerful winds!
There can be no doubt we face Garuda's spawn!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Beware the avatar's feathers!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Do my eyes deceive me!?
I am certain you summoned but one egi!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I feel so battered and bruised...
It is past time we calmed this storm!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I thought...I thought myself ready...

quest.name: 邪道と正道
journal: Y'mhitra has some terrible news to tell you.

Shocked and dismayed, Y'mhitra tells you of the sudden attack that took the lives of several researchers at Saint Coinach's Find. Speak with a survivor at the dig site, and confirm your suspicions that Tristan was behind the brutal murders.

You have spoken with a survivor of the attack, and learned that Tristan struck down the excavation team and took an Allagan soul crystal into his possession. Confer with Y'mhitra, and plan your next move.

After hearing Y'mhitra's thoughts on Tristan's bloody motivations, you resolve to chase down the cold-blooded summoner and wring some answers from the man himself. Search the Singing Shards for Tristan, and confront him with his crimes.
You locate the power-hungry murderer, and best him in a climactic battle in which Tristan brings to bear the might of an elder primal. Speak with Y'mhitra, and discuss the aftermath of the conflict.

The weary researcher laments the path that drove Tristan to madness, and wonders if, had he chosen differently, he would have proven a potential ally. Y'mhitra warns you to remain wary of power's corrupting influence, and suggests you both return to Apkallu Falls to recover from the ordeal.

Though the dark summoner that wreaked such havoc is no more, Y'mhitra bids you to maintain vigilance against the shadowy Ascians' destructive machinations. As a symbol of gratitude from the researchers of Saint Coinach's Find, you receive the final piece of the evoker's attire. And to further prepare you for the inevitable conflict with the Paragons, Y'mhitra opens your mind to the powerful technique known as Enkindle─an ability that allows you to unlock the true might of your egi.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Speak with the surviving researcher at Saint Coinach's Find.
Speak with Y'mhitra.
Confront Tristan.
Speak with Y'mhitra.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.
Defeat Tristan!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename, there has been a terrible incident!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: My poor colleagues at Saint Coinach's Find...murdered. The reports are confused, but they all mention the same black-robed attacker.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You know as well as I do that Tristan is behind this massacre. He has indeed grown bold─or desperate─to commit such a brazen act.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We should set off to Mor Dhona at once and speak with any survivors.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It may be that we can glean some idea of what that cold-hearted monster was after, or where he might strike next. We must stop him, Forename!

dialogue.name: SEEKER500
dialogue.text: Yes. Yes, I am absolutely certain. It was the same dark summoner whom Y'mhitra described to us.

dialogue.name: SEEKER500
dialogue.text: We were celebrating a recent find─the soul crystal of an Allagan summoner─when a man in black robes suddenly appeared and demanded we surrender the gem.

dialogue.name: SEEKER500
dialogue.text: Naturally, we objected to this arrogant imposition, but he simply sneered at our refusal. The next moment the world exploded into flame. Through a haze of agony, I saw him snatch up the soul crystal from a smoldering body and stride off towards the Singing Shards.

dialogue.name: SEEKER500
dialogue.text: That bastard slaughtered my friends! There was no warning...no negotiation... If the gods grant you the chance to exact vengeance, then I pray you show him the same mercy he afforded us...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Though the necessity pains me, we must ask this man what he remembers of the attack. Tristan cannot be allowed to escape the consequences of his unrepentant savagery.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Another soul crystal... Yes, it makes sense that he would shift his attention to a more easily obtainable gem. After all your progress, you would now make for a most formidable opponent.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, I must apologize for not sharing my theory earlier─I suspected that Tristan might desire the soul crystal you carry, but did not wish to draw any premature conclusions without sufficient evidence.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I am at a loss, however, to explain why he seeks to collect more of these Allagan relics.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We shall just have to ask the villain himself after we corner him in the Singing Shards. Let us be on our way!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: I have brought you the soul crystals, as promised.

dialogue.name: ASCIANS
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Yes, these appear to be authentic Allagan artifacts.

dialogue.name: ASCIANS
dialogue.text: Very well. I shall honor our bargain. From within these gems I will draw forth the memories of the ancient summoners...and the slumbering essence of an elder primal. All the attendant knowledge and power shall be yours.

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: Aaargh!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> <pant> Oh gods, the pain... Hm hm hm... Mwahahaha!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: Ah, the bumbling summoner and herhis incompetent lackey make an appearance at last. You think to capture me? Fools. I have orchestrated your every move.

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: You have grown much in the art, it is true. But through the wisdom of the Paragons, I now command the power of an elder primal.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You made a deal with the Paragons!? And you call us fools! The Ascians will never relinquish their hold on you!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: A small price to pay. If you could but feel the strength that fills my entire being! It is indescribable!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: I will use this power to annihilate the beast tribes, and put an end to their insufferable rituals once and for all! The primals will rise no more!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: Hear me, Demon King of Devouring Flame! Feed on my ever-burning anguish and be reborn!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: The culmination of my sacred duty is at hand!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: But first... There is one more soul crystal that must be mine. I will tolerate its wasted potential no longer!

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: By all the memories of summoners past... I should have been unstoppable...

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: I will sear the disease of beastmen from the face of the land! Deprived of worshipers, the primal that tempered my weak-willed sibling will wither into oblivion!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: So, I see my order's records were accurate.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Though it was buried deep in the archives, I but recently uncovered a report that described how you slew your own brother. He was corrupted during your ill-fated encounter with Ifrit, was he not? I imagine your superiors in the Immortal Flames thought it a mercy to conceal that inglorious detail.

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: Once the soft-headed fool had been tempered, there was no saving him... And thus I took it upon myself to expunge the stain of embarrassment.

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: But my work is left undone! The primal─ No, all primals must suffer for that insult! After I killed my brother, I found myself liberated, my vision clear. No deed was too vile if it promised to add to the power I required.

dialogue.name: TRISTAN
dialogue.text: How can you not see!? I am the sword of vengeance! And I shall wrest that soul crystal from your blasted corpse!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I wonder which struck the first blow to his sanity: the despair at his brother's tempering, or the guilt from slaying his own kin?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It is ironic to think that, discounting the means, our purposes were fundamentally one and the same. A summoner employs the savagery of the primals to conquer the primals themselves.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Had Tristan approached us as an ally, we might have found ourselves aiding his cause. Alas, he chose to walk the path of bloodshed.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Each vicious act must have pushed the man deeper into madness until, eventually, the lust for power and vengeance was all that drove him.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The might of the primals carries with it a burden of responsibility─and a measure of danger.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I hope never to see you corrupted by the potent energies you wield, Forename.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It is time we returned to Apkallu Falls. The dark summoner is no more.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Oh, how I would love to declare our troubles at an end. But I fear the Ascian with whom Tristan made his bargain is yet afoot.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: These so-called Paragons prey upon men and women who are at their weakest, speaking honeyed words to lead them down the road to destruction. In this manner, they seek to plunge the realm of Eorzea into chaos.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It is reassuring to know that heroes like you exist to foil their never-ending schemes and foul plots.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: An outright war against the Ascians looms closer day by day. Thus, would I have you armor yourself with this last piece of the evoker's attire.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It was discovered at the same dig site whence Tristan seized the soul crystal, and the Saint Coinach's Find researchers, grateful for your actions in bringing the murderous summoner to justice, insisted that you complete your set.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: One can never be over-prepared when heading into battle against a Paragon. Wear it proudly, Forename.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Speaking of preparations... Were you aware of the deeper layer of power hidden within your avatars?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: A technique exists that allows you to tap into the full potential of your egi. You must have seen Tristan employing this ability.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: During the final battle with the dark summoner, you would have heard a whisper emanating from the soul crystal.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Still your mind now, Forename, and you will hear the voices of the ancient summoners instructing you in their greatest achievement. The true power of the egi will be yours!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the summoner quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Behold the might of Belias!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I have never before sensed such power...
All the more reason to defeat this madman!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
No...it is not enough!
Belias! I must have it all!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Aaah!
The tendrils of Darkness...I feel them!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: None can withstand this tenebrous aether!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I didn't think it possible...
He's absorbed the egi's power!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Hehe... Bwahahaha!
The power! I am a god amongst men!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
My dear colleagues...I have failed you.
Forgive me, Forename...

obj.n: 蘇る古の武器（ウイユヴェール）

quest.name: 学問ノススメ
journal: Murie has knowledge of an intriguing opportunity.

Though marauders are not known for their academic pursuits, one such marauder named Alka Zolka seeks an arcanist to assist him with his archaeological research. Should curiosity overwhelm you, he can be found at the Coral Tower in Limsa Lominsa.

Alka Zolka's interest in history is a practical one, as he seeks to research the military tactics of Nym, an ancient civilization said to have repulsed would-be invaders time and time again. He had hoped that an arcanist might help analyze any text pertaining to magical arts─that is, if he were in possession of any texts to translate. Alas, the Nymian tablets he purchased were stolen en route to Limsa Lominsa. Journey to the Raincatcher Gully docks in eastern La Noscea, where he suspects the thieves may be found, and help him recover his stolen relics.

As predicted, the thieves and the relics were both found at the docks. However, Alka Zolka had not anticipated the appearance of an otherworldly creature, one which seemingly burst forth from a crystal you found with the tablets. Hastily translating one of the tablets, Alka Zolka explains that the creature is a faerie, one which once served as the companion of a Nymian scholar. Ask the shocked marauder what he would like to do next.
Eager to discover what other secrets the tablets contain, Alka Zolka quickly departs for Limsa Lominsa. Perhaps by the time you return to the Coral Tower, he will have learned something new.

Alka Zolka explains that the crystal you found was the Soul of the Scholar, and that with it, you can call upon the faerie at will. Reasoning that an experienced arcanist would be in a better position to preserve the lost arts, he decides to entrust the crystal to you. Do your utmost to gain mastery over your newfound powers as the marauder continues to decipher the ancient tablets.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 35.
objectives: Speak with Alka Zolka at the Marauders' Guild.
Speak with Alka Zolka in eastern La Noscea.
Speak with Alka Zolka.
Speak with Alka Zolka at the Marauders' Guild.
Defeat the bandits and reclaim the stolen relics!

dialogue.name: MURIE
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Forename, have you any interest in history? If so, I would share with you an opportunity to study the ways of the ancients.

dialogue.name: MURIE
dialogue.text: A curiously refined and well-read marauder visited the guild the other day in the hopes he might meet an arcanist of exceptional skill.

dialogue.name: MURIE
dialogue.text: He claims that the assistance of one such individual would be invaluable for the success of his archaeological research. I say “claims,” because despite his eloquence, the thought of a marauder with academic ambitions still strikes me as odd...

dialogue.name: MURIE
dialogue.text: You are, of course, free to formulate your own opinions. His name is Alka Zolka, and he can be found at the Marauders' Guild should curiosity overwhelm you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Thank you for setting aside your preconceptions, Forename. I am acutely aware how unusual it is for a marauder to “conduct research,” as it were.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: However, you shall soon understand that I am not at all like my more muscular brethren. Rather than rush blindly into the enemy's maw, I formulate and execute stratagems to great effect.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: My archaeological pursuits are but an extension of this practice, for at present I am researching the military tactics of ancient Nym.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: 'Twould not surprise me if you were unfamiliar with Nym. The civilization flourished some fifteen-odd centuries ago, during the Fifth Astral Era.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The Nymians lived during an age of wonders, when the magical arts flourished. But magicks can be wielded for weal or for woe, and this period of peace eventually gave way to the great War of the Magi.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The nations of that bygone era brought earth-shattering magicks to bear against one another. Yet Nym, with only a handful of mages to support its army of mariners, repulsed would-be invaders time and time again.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Precisely how a military force of this composition could defy its stronger neighbors is a mystery which has long puzzled military historians. By translating extant Nymian tablets which I have recently purchased, I mean to solve the riddle at long last.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As my knowledge of arcanima is cursory at best, I require an experienced arcanist to assist me with my analysis of any text pertaining to the magical arts. Will you be that arcanist, Forename?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: There is, however, a complication. The Nymian tablets and other assorted relics─for which I paid an exceedingly large amount of money─were stolen en route to Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The information inscribed upon those tablets could be of untold significance! I will not allow thieves to sell it to some rich Ul'dahn collector for a pittance. Pray accompany me to the Raincatcher Gully docks and help me reclaim my relics. I have strong reason to believe the perpetrators can be found there.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We must have those tablets, Forename. Though I did not seek you out for your combat acumen, pray lend me your magicks this once.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As I suspected. They are naught more than broken men who have seized the docks and taken to robbing every passing ship. Come, let us put an end to their banditry and take back what is ours!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Yes, yes! This is it! A treatise on Nymian military tactics, just as I had hoped!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: ...Hello there.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: M-Mayhap the tablet can explain this...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <mumble> <mumble> Scholars...familiars...faeries!?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: “The sunlight of Eos doth soothe and shield.”

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: “The moonlight of Selene doth silence and strengthen.”

dialogue.name: KOKORONIHIBIKUKOE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Forename...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: By the Twelve, have you any idea what this means!? We have rediscovered the long-lost magical arts of Nymian scholars!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Faeries. Honest-to-gods faeries. Well, now I have seen everything!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Anyway, I shall return to the guild and begin translating the tablet. I cannot wait to see what other secrets it contains!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Excellent timing, Forename. I have just finished transcribing a section which will doubtless be of interest to you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: According to the tablet, the crystal from which the faerie sprang forth is called the Soul of the Scholar, and it contains the wisdom of those long-dead Nymian mages.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: With it, you can call upon the faerie as you did before and bind her to your will.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As I said before, I have little knowledge of arcanima, so unless you have some objections, I would like to entrust the crystal to you. Oh, and you needn't recompense me─simply knowing that the lost arts are being preserved is enough.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I shall devote my energies to deciphering the remaining text. Should I discover anything new, I promise that you will be the first to know.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 35.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the Soul of the Scholar equipped, you can summon a faerie to aid you in battle! When called forth, she will assume the form of a healer-type pet.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Moreover, by completing the quest “A Faerie Tale Come True,” you may cast glamours on your faerie familiar, allowing her to take on other appearances.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Have at thee, knaves!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I may have miscalculated...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Do you see any others? No? Excellent!
Now, help me search for the tablets!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have unlocked a new job! You can change to this job at any time by equipping the soul crystal received from this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When changing jobs, gear sets will allow you to register and save your equipment. You may then use them to switch between jobs instantly without the need to manually equip weapons or equipment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A button for the Gear Set interface is located in the upper portion of the Character window.

obj.n: 巴術士ギルド受付 ムリー
巴術最大級命題の証明
失われた記憶を求めて

quest.name: 失われた記憶を求めて
journal: Alka Zolka wishes to share with you his most recent discoveries.

Ever the dedicated academic, Alka Zolka has deciphered a significant portion of the Nymian treatise, much of which pertains to scholars. He notes that the Soul of the Scholar should have imparted to you a far more diverse repertoire of spells, and concludes that the cause may be your faerie's fifteen-hundred-year slumber. Surmising that exposure to familiar sights may kindle lost memories, he suggests that you visit the ruins of ancient Nym in outer La Noscea.
The faerie reacts to a number of locations, seemingly straining to hear inaudible whispers. Perhaps taking in a view of the distant ruins from the western cliff will prove more effective.
Your time spent together in the ruins of Nym seems to have affected the faerie. Return to Limsa Lominsa and share your findings with Alka Zolka.

Based on the reactions of your faerie, Alka Zolka concludes that each is a distinct individual with her own thoughts, feelings, and memories─an exciting discovery, to be sure, but not the sort Alka Zolka set out to make. Determined not to let your accomplishments overshadow his, he redoubles his efforts to unearth new stratagems.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 40.
objectives: Explore the Floating City of Nym.
Observe the distant Nymian ruins.
Speak with Alka Zolka.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I was hoping you might come along. Deciphering the treatise has proven more difficult than I anticipated, but I have nevertheless made progress.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It contains a wealth of military knowledge, much of which details the role of scholars in Nymian units.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Apparently, a single scholar could provide effective support for an entire party of marauders!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: They would employ their magicks to heal the wounds and enhance the abilities of their allies. Moreover, they often served in leadership roles, as they were highly trained tacticians.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: But how swiftly the remembrance of all things is buried in the gulf of eternity...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The treatise indicates that Nymian scholars wielded a far more diverse repertoire of spells than you currently possess. Precisely why you lack these spells, I cannot say.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: However, the fault may lie with your faerie. One could surmise that the knowledge contained within the Soul of the Scholar is essentially hers. Therefore, if she cannot remember the ancient magicks, it would suggest that...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Hm. A thought occurs to me. If it is indeed the case that the faerie, having been sealed for fifteen hundred years, has yet to fully regain her senses, mayhap visiting a familiar location would hasten the process.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: And I can think of no more familiar place than the city of Nym─rather, what remains of it in outer La Noscea...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Why not journey to the Floating City of Nym? Something there might rekindle the memories of your faerie─assuming her memories are incomplete, that is.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Though...does she possess memories, like you and I? Until recently, I had no idea faeries even existed. It may be ages before I gain an understanding of these otherworldly entities...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. I gather the experiment met with success?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Then this strongly suggests that each faerie is a distinct individual with her own thoughts, feelings, and memories...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Well, I must redouble my efforts to translate the remaining text! At this rate, your discoveries threaten to overshadow mine.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Not to bemoan your accomplishments, but I have yet to decipher any equally amazing stratagems. Soon enough, though, soon enough!

quest.name: 怨念の権化
journal: Alka Zolka looks pleased to see you.

The time has come at last to revive the Nymian tradition of marauder and scholar fighting side by side. A tonberry has been sighted in Bronze Lake, and Alka Zolka would have the two of you slay it. To further tempt you into accepting his request, he states that the experience may rekindle the memories of your faerie, as he theorizes that tonberries once plagued the people of Nym. Rendezvous with Alka Zolka outside the Wanderer's Palace so that you might hunt the creature together.

Finding the tonberry was surprisingly easy. Slaying it, however, was not. As Alka Zolka prepared to deliver the final blow, your faerie inexplicably came to the tonberry's defense, providing it with ample time to escape. Do what you can to console the downcast Alka Zolka.

Alka Zolka understands that you are still inexperienced in the ways of a scholar and cannot be expected to control the faerie flawlessly. Nevertheless, you sense that he may still be cross with you. Speak with him again at the Coral Tower when he has had time to calm down.

In retrospect, Alka Zolka declares that your success against the tonberry, as well as the rekindling of your faerie's memories, is cause enough to celebrate. Even so, he politely requests that you strive to gain greater control over your faerie so the incident does not repeat itself.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 45.
objectives: Speak with Alka Zolka in upper La Noscea.
Speak with Alka Zolka.
Speak with Alka Zolka at the Marauders' Guild.
Defeat the tonberry wanderer!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: How curious that you always come at the most opportune time, Forename. 'Tis divine providence, almost.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Doubly so since we have both been blessed with a chance to refine our respective arts.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You see, in your absence, I have been studying a section of the Nymian treatise detailing marauder fighting techniques. The fundamentals do not differ much from modern methods, but there are slight variations in footwork and grip, as well as the distinctions between the various ranges, and the attacks best employed when─

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, I lost sight of the more pertinent point. Nymian scholars and marauders fought side by side, yes? Well, now you and I have an opportunity to do the same. A tonberry has been spotted in Bronze Lake, and the Marauders' Guild has been asked to dispatch it.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Since tonberries dwell within the Wanderer's Palace─an ancient Nymian temple recently discovered in the wake of the Calamity─there is a strong possibility that the creatures have resided there since before the fall of Nym.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Do you follow my reasoning, Forename? These malevolent creatures may have overrun the temple and claimed it for their own at the height of Nymian civilization. They may have posed a major threat to the ancient people, even.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If so, then surely facing one in battle would rekindle the memories of your faerie.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Even if I am mistaken, the tonberry poses a threat to the locals. Moreover, I would very much like to put my newly learned Nymian techniques to the test. So, we will rendezvous outside the Wanderer's Palace, yes?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Facing the tonberry is sure to rekindle the memories of your faerie. And even should my theory prove incorrect, there is value to be had in refining our Nymian arts, do you not think?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename. I had only just arrived myself.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: 'Twas in this vicinity that the tonberry was last sighted. With luck, it will not have gone far.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Look, atop the stairs!

dialogue.name: TONBERI
dialogue.text: My sun! My dear sun! At long last, I... I...

dialogue.name: TONBERI
dialogue.text: The...the rancor... It rises... It rises!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It comes!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Raaargh!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What are you doing!? Move, damn you!

dialogue.name: TONBERI
dialogue.text: My...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Confound it all!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Bah! What happened, Forename!? I thought you could control her!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <sigh> I apologize. I know you have only just begun to work with the faerie. Some...disobedience is to be expected.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Axemaster Wyrnzoen will be disappointed, but there is naught we can do. The tonberry is long gone. Let us return to Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Permit me to apologize a second time. Earlier, I...I was flustered and not myself.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: In the aftermath of the tonberry's escape, I completely overlooked our accomplishments. We confirmed the viability of Nymian tactics, and proved that a scholar and marauder working in tandem is a force to be reckoned with, would you not say?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: And correct me if I am mistaken, but your faerie regained some of her memory, yes?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: With that in mind, I feel comfortable claiming that this was a worthwhile endeavor. However, do try and gain greater mastery over your minion, Forename. I would hate for a repeat of that incident.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I shall draw his ire, Forename! Lend me your support!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Did the tonberry summon those abominations!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename, I can't...

obj.n: 失われた記憶を求めて

quest.name: 匠たちへの頼み
journal: Alka Zolka has news which should be of great interest to you.

Alka Zolka has come into possession of ancient engravings which purport to show the traditional raiments of Nymian scholars. Coupled with information gleaned from other sources, he believes he has deduced the raiments' design. However, he wishes to conclusively verify their historical accuracy by recreating the garments and gauging your faerie's reaction. In order to do so, he will need to enlist the aid of a preeminent Eorzean weaver─namely, Master Redolent Rose of Sunsilk Tapestries. Approaching him now would be premature, though, as you must first gather the leaves of a direwort. These plants, which can be found only in the Fogfens of Mor Dhona, are essential for producing the distinct colors of a Nymian scholar's uniform.

Your initial attempt to gather the direwort leaves is foiled by the sudden appearance of belligerent wildlife, which you are forced to dispatch. Hopefully, your second attempt will not be so rudely interrupted.
To your relief, no rampaging beast attempts to devour you this time. Journey to Ul'dah and speak with Redolent Rose, who should have hopefully been contacted by Alka Zolka by now.

Redolent Rose works feverishly to render the ancient designs into modern creations. Alas, his skill is insufficient to produce more than the culottes; the other pieces will require the skills of a master goldsmith and leatherworker. Realizing that you were not aware of this fact, Redolent Rose offers to contact Mistresses Serendipity and Geva of the Goldsmiths' and Leatherworkers' Guilds on your behalf, so that you need only visit each guild and present the items to receive their help.
The ever-cheerful Serendipity requires but a moment to fashion a mythril tassel for your mortarboard. You can only hope that Geva will work with similar alacrity.

Geva effortlessly crafts a pair of fingerless gloves in accordance with Alka Zolka's designs. However, she has no intention of spoiling you further, and bids you speak with Beli, her subordinate, about the boots.

Beli relishes the opportunity to finish the famed Redolent Rose's work, wasting no time in constructing the leather boots. Now that the set is complete, all that remains is to show Alka Zolka what the craftsmen have wrought.

Alka Zolka is thrilled by the resemblance you bear to the Nymian scholars of eld. He is not alone in his excitement, as your faerie also appears to approve of your new raiments. Wear them with pride as you continue to pursue your studies.
objectives: Search for a direwort shrub in Mor Dhona.
Harvest leaves from the direwort shrub.
Deliver the leaves and thesis to Redolent Rose in Ul'dah.
Ask Serendipity to finish Redolent Rose's work.
Ask Geva in Gridania to finish Redolent Rose's work.
Ask Beli to finish Redolent Rose's work.
Speak with Alka Zolka at the Marauders' Guild.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Good to see you, Forename. I have made yet another discovery which pertains to you and your scholarly arts.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I have come into possession of several ancient engravings, including some which show the traditional raiments of Nymian scholars.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: In fact, the extraordinary detail of these illustrations, coupled with information gleaned from other sources, was sufficient to deduce their design.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: At present, it is impossible to say how historically accurate my designs are. That is why I propose we enlist the aid of Eorzea's preeminent artisans, so that we might recreate these garments. Should they prove sufficiently authentic, I expect your faerie will regain more of her missing memories.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: In the hands of a preeminent weaver─say, Master Redolent Rose of Sunsilk Tapestries─this information should be sufficient.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ah, but you cannot journey to Ul'dah until you have gathered the leaves of a direwort. My texts explicitly mention that the plant's pigments were used to dye Nymian uniforms.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Alas, direwort is much rarer than it was in the days of yore. It can only be found in the Fogfens now.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Lest you think I mean to make you do all the work, worry not. While you scour Mor Dhona for the plant, I will contact Master Rose and convince him to help─though I doubt it will require much effort!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Do not forget to obtain the direwort leaves before journeying to Ul'dah! Without them, it will be impossible to reproduce the distinct colors of a Nymian scholar's uniform.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: ...I suppose you do have a rather scholarly air about you. I've been expecting you, Forename. Have you the leaves and Alka Zolka's designs, then?

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Crafting raiments that have not been seen in fifteen hundred years... This is indeed a daunting challenge.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: But it is one I suspect I will enjoy a great deal, for rare is the day a weaver revives ancient fashion!

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: I shall begin at once. You may observe if you like, but be aware it will be a lengthy process...

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: It...it has been some time since I labored with such...intensity.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: I adhered to Alka Zolka's designs as best I could, though there were certain aspects I felt compelled to change. His lack of familiarity with textiles and weaving led to what I can only assume are errors.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: You will note that I could only complete the culottes. This is because the other garments require skills which I do not possess.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Mistresses Serendipity and Geva of the Goldsmiths' and Leatherworkers' Guilds, respectively, can provide the finishing touches to the remaining pieces.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Ah, but you were unaware that I could not craft the full set by myself, weren't you?

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Very well. I shall send word to them on your behalf, Forename. You will need only visit each guild and present to them my unfinished work.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: You may wear the culottes at your leisure, but the boots, gloves, and mortarboard remain unfinished.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: Only a master goldsmith and leatherworker have the skill to complete the three remaining pieces.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: So, if you wish to finish what you have started, then make haste for the Goldsmiths' and Leatherworkers' Guilds.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: I will see that the two guildmasters know to expect you.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename! Red said you'd be along shortly. So, let's see that mortarboard!

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Hmmm... This shouldn't take long. Wait here a moment.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Here it is, as promised. Amazing what a difference a mythril tassel can make, isn't it?

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Wear it with pride, Forename. Now, off you go! And be sure to enjoy your time in Gridania!

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename─the womanman who would single-handedly revive the scholarly arts. All right, then, show me what you've got.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Master Rose's work is marvelous, as to be expected. This will be a pleasure.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: There you go─one pair of fingerless buffalo leather gloves, perfect for the scholar who prefers that herhis protection does not come at a cost to dexterity.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: Oh, the boots? Beli will see to those. He's an expert cordwainer, so you needn't worry about the quality. Besides, I've already spoiled you by making your gloves for free.

dialogue.name: BELI
dialogue.text: You're the scholar, yes? I've been instructed to assist you. If you would please let me see Master Rose's work...

dialogue.name: BELI
dialogue.text: This craftsmanship is amazing! I cannot wait to get started.

dialogue.name: BELI
dialogue.text: Here you are, madamsir. Made with the finest boar and buffalo leather, in accordance with Alka Zolka's designs─which are very impressive, I must say.

dialogue.name: BELI
dialogue.text: He must be dying to see the completed set. I know I would be, had I gone to such great lengths. You ought to surprise him by wearing the garments when next you meet him.

dialogue.name: REDOLENTROSE
dialogue.text: ...Should a chirurgeon humor the imbecile who sticks his hand in a fire just to see what will happen? You are a fool, and you know it. Fortunately for you, so did I, which is why I prepared another pair of culottes for this eventuality.

dialogue.name: SERENDIPITY
dialogue.text: Wow, you really are as foolish as Red said! He came by earlier and gave me additional mortarboards, saying that you'd probably come back and ask for another.

dialogue.name: GEVA
dialogue.text: I don't know what's more impressive: Master Rose's prescience, or your idiocy. Be thankful I don't skin you for this.

dialogue.name: BELI
dialogue.text: Matron's teats! Why would you go and do a foolish thing like that? I mean, really, that's just...damn. You should count your blessings that Master Rose leaves nothing to chance.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: ...Although I am certain this is not necessary, on the off chance you misplaced any pieces of the set, go back and speak with the artisans. If we are fortunate, they may be able to furnish us with replacements.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename! By your return I take it the raiments are ready? If so, would you consider donning them so I might see if they match the ancient descriptions?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: By the gods, I feel as though I have been transported backwards through time!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You are the very image of the Nymian scholars of eld!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Well, minus the gown, but still! Never in my wildest dreams did I think it would turn out this well.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Hah, I see you approve as well, little one! Suffice it to say, we can consider this a great success.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: A foul stench fills your nostrils...

quest.name: 軍学式の治療法
journal: Alka Zolka wishes to propose another way you might rekindle your faerie's memories.

Much of what Alka Zolka has learned of scholars pertains to their roles in the Nymian military. However, his most recent translations offer insight into their activities during times of peace. Apparently, scholars would use their talents to help the sick and infirm, and they were even instrumental in combating a virulent plague which once threatened to engulf all of Nym. For these reasons, Alka Zolka believes that tending to the patients recuperating at Camp Bronze Lake might rekindle the memories of your faerie. Journey to the Warmwine Sanitorium in upper La Noscea and offer your services to Rukusa Farusa.

Rukusa Farusa is happy to accept your assistance, and tells you of five patients suffering from a variety of lingering conditions. Rather than treat their symptoms with restorative magicks, he implores you to address the underlying cause by leeching the impurities from their bodies.
As instructed, you worked your scholarly magicks on each patient to varying degrees of efficacy. Inform Rukusa Farusa that your work is complete.
Rukusa Farusa's final words of gratitude elicit a reaction from your tiny companion. Return to the Coral Tower and tell Alka Zolka that his idea seems to have worked.

Alka Zolka is pleased to see you and your faerie have made such great strides. Confident that the Nymian tablets contain far more than the secrets of the scholarly arts, he resumes his translations.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 50.
objectives: Speak with Rukusa Farusa in upper La Noscea.
Cast Esuna on the invalids.
Speak with Rukusa Farusa.
Speak with Alka Zolka at the Marauders' Guild.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, I forgot to mention that while I was awaiting your return, I made considerable progress with the deciphering of my Nymian tablets.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Much of what I have learned until now has pertained to the roles of scholars within the military. However, these latest texts offer insight into a scholar's activities during times of peace.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As you can imagine, they were not the sort to let their restorative magicks go to waste.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: One particularly stirring account describes their selfless efforts to combat the spread of a virulent plague which at one point threatened to engulf all of Nym.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Naturally, they did so with the aid of their faeries, which is why I believe that similar acts of charity may serve to further awaken your winged companion.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If you are of a mind to test my theory, why not journey to Camp Bronze Lake? You will find no shortage of the sick and wounded there.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Rukusa Farusa would doubtless welcome your services were you to offer them. He presides over the Warmwine Sanitorium, so be sure to have a word with him if you decide to go.

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: Hello, and welcome to Bronze Lake. If you desire treatment, I─ Pardon, you wish to administer treatment? Are you even qualified to─

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: Wait, you must be Forename, the scholar! We are happy to accept any assistance you can provide.

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: I am told you possess magicks which can cleanse the body of toxins, impurities, and maladies.

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: At the present, we have five patients visiting the springs who would benefit from this care. Pray attend to these individuals and return to me when finished.

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: The five patients I would have you attend to are all suffering from a variety of lingering conditions.

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: Traditional restorative magicks may treat the symptoms, but not the underlying cause. To balance their humours, you must leech the impurities from their bodies.

dialogue.name: KAOIRONOWARUISHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: What's...what's wrong with me? My wounds have closed, but still I feel so weak...

dialogue.name: KAOIRONOWARUISHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: Eh!? What did you do? You took something from me...something bad. I don't know what you did, but I'm glad you did it. Thank you.

dialogue.name: NEMUSOUNASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: Can't sleep, mummer will eat me. Can't sleep, mummer will eat me.

dialogue.name: NEMUSOUNASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: You...you've set me free! I no longer feel his eyes upon me...

dialogue.name: INNKISOUNASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: Me arm ain't been the same since Carteneau. Chirurgeon says the flesh is willing, but the spirit is weak. I say he's a superstitious git.

dialogue.name: INNKISOUNASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: What...what's this warmth? Did you do that? I...I... Thank you, whoever you are.

dialogue.name: TURASOUNASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Are...are you here to help me? I...I don't know what's wrong, I just...can't...

dialogue.name: TURASOUNASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: <gasp> My lungs, I...I can breathe again! Bless you, misssir, bless you!

dialogue.name: YOTTASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: Gahaha─hic─hahaha! Try takin' a wound sometime, lasslad. Sure, it hurts like hells at first, but then ye get to drink away the pain!

dialogue.name: YOTTASHOUBYOUHEI
dialogue.text: Huh? What the... Why'd ye have to go an' do that!? Ah, bugger. Now they'll take me wine away...

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: Incredible, absolutely incredible. What you did for those patients was nothing short of miraculous.

dialogue.name: RUKUSAFARUSA
dialogue.text: Their commanding officers will be pleased to hear that they can return to active duty. You and Alka Zolka have my deepest thanks, Forename.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Rukusa Farusa tells me that your potent magicks exceed all expectation.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Had a good time, did you? Aye, I thought you might.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It warms my heart to see the two of you making such great strides. And it reminds me that I must work harder to see that I am not left behind!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: For the nonce, I will resume deciphering the Nymian tablets. Though they have yielded an immense quantity of information on the scholarly arts, I remain confident that they contain an equally impressive wealth of tactical information.

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: The corruption lingers...

quest.name: 次代の学者
journal: Alka Zolka has an urgent request.

Another knife-wielding denizen of the Wanderer's Palace has emerged to terrorize the people of Vylbrand, and once again it falls to the Marauders' Guild to find and slay it. Determined not to repeat the mistakes of the past, Alka Zolka has enlisted the aid of two other marauders. He would also like you to join as well─but only if you can promise to keep your faerie in check. If you can, rendezvous with him and the others in Bronze Lake, at the same ruins where you fought the first tonberry.

You pursue the tonberry to the Wanderer's Palace, leaving many of its brethren slain in your wake. As the creature grows weaker, Alka Zolka once again raises his axe to deliver the final blow─and once again is prevented from doing so by your faerie. At last understanding her intent, the two of you turn your restorative magicks upon the tonberry. Rejuvenated, it rises to its feet, and reveals that it was once a man named Surito Carito, one of countless Nymians transformed by a mysterious sickness, and imprisoned within the Wanderer's Palace by their own countrymen. Like his fellow Nymians, Surito was driven mad by his fate─until you returned with his dear companion Lily and cleansed him of his rancor. This shocking revelation has doubtless affected the marauders, so it may be wise to see how they are faring.
After exchanging a few words, the three marauders depart for Limsa Lominsa, leaving you alone with Surito Carito, the scholar turned tonberry. Seek the wisdom of your predecessor.

Alas, the sickness which transformed Surito Carito has rendered him incapable of summoning Lily. By what providence you came to possess his Soul of the Scholar he does not know, but he is nevertheless pleased to see his dear companion in good hands. Declaring that only you are fit to wield the magicks now, he bequeaths to you a scholar's gown, as well as knowledge of the spell Sacred Soil. He then bids you farewell, embarking on a quest to rid his countrymen of their rancor. Carry on the traditions of your Nymian colleagues and share your scholarly gifts with the people of Eorzea!

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka once you have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”
objectives: Speak with Alka Zolka in upper La Noscea.
Speak with Alka Zolka.
Speak with the hardened marauder.
Speak with the soft marauder.
Speak with Surito Carito.
Defeat the tonberry wanderer!
Heal the tonberry wanderer!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, you must come with me at once! Another tonberry has emerged from the Wanderer's Palace!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: A traveling peddler caught sight of the fiend and fled to Camp Bronze Lake. Once again, it falls to the Marauders' Guild to find and slay it.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: This time, we will hunt the tonberry in greater numbers, so that we might surround it and cut off all avenues of escape.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I have not forgotten our previous attempt to slay one of the foul creatures.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Nor have you, I trust. I have your assurances that you will keep your faerie in line this time, yes?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Then let us make for Bronze Lake at once. Our comrades have already departed, and I do not wish to fall behind. We will rendezvous with them at the same place we battled the first tonberry.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Go on ahead to Bronze Lake, Forename. I will follow once I have attended to a few pressing matters here.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Thank the gods you have come, Forename! Any later and we might have had to proceed without you!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The tonberry appears to be in some sort of trance and is oblivious to our presence.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Is everyone ready?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Excellent! Remember: we must surround the fiend─it cannot be allowed to flee!

dialogue.name: TONBERI
dialogue.text: My sun, my dear sun... Stay away... I cannot...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Damn it, not again! It seeks sanctuary inside the Wanderer's Palace!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Come! Let us follow and finish this once and for all!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What? Again!? Why do you protect this demon?

dialogue.name: TONBERI
dialogue.text: The rancor...it... I...

dialogue.name: TONBERI
dialogue.text: Lily, my sun! Why are you here? Who has summoned you?

dialogue.name: TONBERI
dialogue.text: Then Nym...Nym is no more? Fifteen hundred years... Can it truly be so?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)I am...I was Surito Carito, before the sickness from the sea transformed me.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)The traders, they were the first. As their ears and noses began to atrophy, their limbs grew shorter, and their skin...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)We scholars tried to halt the spread, tried to find a cure. But in time, we too fell ill.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)Sympathy turned to fear, and fear to anger. Monsters, they called us. Abominations!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Then...then you were once a man!?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)They sealed the sick within the temple with magicks─tried to drown us...tried to forget us...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)Though our bodies had been changed, our minds remained intact.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)But within every man lurks a beast. When those whom you call kin deny you, come to hate you and despise you...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)I too succumbed to the rancor─until you reunited me with Lily, my dearest sun.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)Long has my mind been clouded with hatred. But by the resplendent light of Lily, at long last, I am free...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <sniffle> <sob> I...I nearly killed him! Thank the gods that faerie stopped me.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I wonder...did she know it was Surito from the beginning, or was it only...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: In any case, she has regained a good portion of her memories, if not all of them, I suspect.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Well, if you would excuse me─I need to take some time to put my thoughts in order, and decide how I might explain this to the axemaster...

dialogue.name: MRDA
dialogue.text: So wait a bleedin' moment─that tonberry used to be a scholar like you? So...does that mean you'll turn into one of 'em if you keep slingin' those spells? Or did I misunderstand what he said back there? Ah, the hells with it...

dialogue.name: MRDB
dialogue.text: I came expectin' to fight one tonberry, not a whole bloody mess of 'em. If it wasn't for you an' yer flyin' friend, I reckon we'd not have left there alive.

dialogue.name: MRDB
dialogue.text: Gotta say, you and Alka make a great team. Shame there ain't more of you scholarly types around, 'cause I could use a partner like you. Take care, Forename.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)That the traditions of my people have not been lost to the ages is of great comfort to me.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)I do not know how that soul crystal came into your possession, but I am glad that it did. For the sickness robbed me not only of my body, but of Lily as well.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)The Soul of the Scholar no longer resonates with my aether. I cannot summon her─only you can. Only you are fit to wield the magicks now.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)Here─a gown as befits a scholar of your standing. I bequeath it to you, along with the knowledge of Sacred Soil, my most versatile art.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)I cannot thank you enough for purging the rancor from my heart. But there are still countless others who have yet to see the light. I cannot abandon them to their fate. I will not.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: (-Surito Carito-)And so I bid you farewell, Forename. Carry on our traditions with pride!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the scholar quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: A Realm Reborn. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Before the Dawn.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Do not dally, Forename! We need your magicks!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Have you gone mad!? That thing is a monster! It must be put down!

obj.n: 蘇る古の武器（マダレムジエン）
ブロンズレイクの再会

quest.name: 蘇る古の武器（ブラビューラ）
journal: Gerolt has the air of a man defeated.

Gerolt has reluctantly agreed to lend his expertise to the restoration of a legendary arm of yore. For the first step, the weaponsmith bids you venture within U'Ghamaro Mines in outer La Noscea to retrieve a lost Bravura. Search for a vessel in which the valuable relic might be kept.
You have obtained the timeworn Bravura. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and present the relic to Gerolt.

According to Gerolt, the restoration process involves merging the old with the new─that is, embedding the original relic in a new host weapon. To this end, you must bring him a barbarian's bardiche melded with two grade three battledance materia.

You have delivered the materia-enhanced barbarian's bardiche to Gerolt. The weaponsmith next directs you to go to the Weeping Saint in the Coerthas central highlands, and obtain alumina salts from the dhorme chimera.

※The dhorme chimera can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
※This objective must be completed as a warrior.
You have painstakingly obtained the pinch of alumina salts. Make your way back to Hyrstmill and deliver it to Gerolt.

Using the alumina salts you brought him, Gerolt adds the finishing touches to your relic weapon. Even as he declares his work over, however, the man believes that there is still something incomplete about it. In order to shed light upon the mystery, Gerolt suggests that you seek out literature surrounding the hero associated with the relic. Perhaps the trader Rowena back at Revenant's Toll will be able to assist you in this endeavor.

You have consulted Rowena, who agrees to procure the literature you seek...for a price. For your part of the deal, you must obtain for her an Amdapor glyph. Make your way through Amdapor Keep in the South Shroud, and procure this artifact.

※Amdapor Keep can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a warrior.
You have successfully obtained an Amdapor glyph. Make your way back to Revenant's Toll and deliver it to Rowena.

You give the Amdapor glyph to Rowena, who upholds her promise and furnishes you a copy of The Warrior Within. You now possess literature on the hero who once wielded the relic weapon. Gerolt the weaponsmith will be keen to peruse it.

After a cursory examination of the text, Gerolt declares that he will require some time to make sense of its contents. In the meantime, you are to familiarize yourself with the restored weapon in its current state. Arm yourself with the unfinished Bravura, make your way to U'Ghamaro Mines in outer La Noscea, and there slay eight U'Ghamaro quarrymen, eight U'Ghamaro roundsmen, and eight U'Ghamaro bedesmen.
You have defeated the specified kobolds. Return to Hyrstmill and report your success to Gerolt.

Upon your return, Gerolt deduces that you must face mightier adversaries if you are to experience a revelation pertaining to your relic. To this end, he bids you challenge the hydra within Halatali, the abandoned training grounds situated in eastern Thanalan. Armed with the unfinished Bravura, enter Halatali and defeat the hydra.

※The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination.
You have overcome the hydra. Take word of your accomplishment back to Gerolt at Hyrstmill.
Combining information gleaned from the text with your firsthand experience, Gerolt has ascertained what must be done next. Hand over the unfinished Bravura to the weaponsmith.

Gerolt declares that but one step remains in the restoration. In order to create the raging fire that he needs, the weaponsmith bids you fetch him a white-hot ember, a howling gale, and a chunk of hyperfused ore. The first of these can be obtained by defeating Ifrit within the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

※The Bowl of Embers (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a warrior.

You have extinguished the Lord of the Inferno and obtained a white-hot ember. Next, take on Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard) and defeat her to obtain a howling gale.

※The Howling Eye (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a warrior.

You have silenced the Lady of the Vortex and obtained a howling gale. Next, take on Titan in the Navel (Hard) and defeat him to obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore.

※The Navel (Hard) can be accessed via the Duty Finder.
※This objective must be completed as a warrior.
You have buried the Lord of Crags and obtained a chunk of hyperfused ore. Deliver it along with the white-hot ember and the howling gale to Gerolt.

You have delivered the three items Gerolt requires to create a raging fire. Now he only wants for a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to complete the restoration of your relic. Obtain this item and deliver it to the weaponsmith.

You have delivered the bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt, who promptly sees to the final stage of the restoration process. After no small amount of effort and perseverance, you are now the proud owner of Bravura. May it serve you well in your adventures to come!
objectives: Obtain the timeworn Bravura from a treasure coffer in U'Ghamaro Mines.
Deliver the timeworn Bravura to Gerolt.
Deliver a materia-enhanced barbarian's bardiche to Gerolt.
Examine the destination at the Weeping Saint and, as a warrior, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Chimera.”
Deliver the alumina salts to Gerolt.
Speak with Rowena at Revenant's Toll.
Obtain an Amdapor glyph by completing Amdapor Keep as a warrior.
Deliver the Amdapor glyph to Rowena.
Deliver the copy of The Warrior Within to Gerolt.
Slay U'Ghamaro quarrymen while equipped with the unfinished Bravura.
Slay U'Ghamaro roundsmen while equipped with the unfinished Bravura.
Slay U'Ghamaro bedesmen while equipped with the unfinished Bravura.
Speak with Gerolt.
Examine the destination outside Halatali and, with the unfinished Bravura, use the Duty Finder to complete the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra.”
Speak with Gerolt.
Give the unfinished Bravura to Gerolt.
Obtain a white-hot ember in the Bowl of Embers (Hard) as a warrior.
Obtain a howling gale in the Howling Eye (Hard) as a warrior.
Obtain a chunk of hyperfused ore in the Navel (Hard) as a warrior.
Deliver the requested items to Gerolt.
Deliver a bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil to Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' let me make one thing clear: it might be as I'm repairin' kettles to pay for yesterday's mead, but I still got me pride as a master weaponsmith. Ye'll get no less than the finest out of me forge.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' it might be as ye've got that godsdamned slip of paper, but it'll only get ye so much. Restorin' relics like these calls for some rare ol' materials, an' I ain't got none. So if you want the job done, ye'll have to run along an' fetch 'em for me.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So, what is it ye want restored?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Fancy yerself a dauntless warrior, like they had in the olden days, eh? So the rumors're true, then─the Company of Heroes did have one in their ranks... Bloody hells.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'll tell you what, though─we weaponsmiths like a good axe, and them warriors' axes were better than good. Ain't no weapon more fearsome to look at, I reckon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' of all the kinds out there, there's none I'd take over Bravura. Aye, from the intimidatin' form to the destructive power, 'tis everythin' a warrior could ever want.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There's jus' one snag: the only blacksmith clan what knew how to forge Bravura died out years ago. The last of 'em didn't quite get 'round to trainin' a successor, see, an' the hapless sod took the techniques to his grave.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Might be some warriors out there bear the axe still, but if I was them, I wouldn't willin'ly part with such a prized possession. Nay, not for all the mead in Eorzea...or would I?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, if yer to have any hope of gettin' a Bravura to call yer own, it'd be through the kobolds. The creatures're renowned for their skill at the forge, an' it jus' so happens they also have a penchant for scourin' ancient ruins an' mines for artifacts, precious ores, an' the like.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To find what we need, ye might try venturin' into U'Ghamaro Mines. Mayhap the kobolds have Bravura stowed away in a repository or summat.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We weaponsmiths like a good axe─and them warriors' axes were better than good. Ain't no weapon more fearsome to look at, I reckon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' of all the kinds out there, there's none I'd take over Bravura. Aye, from the intimidatin' form to the destructive power, 'tis everythin' a warrior could ever want.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There's jus' one snag: the only blacksmith clan what knew how to forge Bravura died out years ago. The last of 'em didn't quite get 'round to trainin' a successor, see, an' the hapless sod took the techniques to his grave.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Might be some warriors out there bear the axe still, but if I was them, I wouldn't willin'ly part with such a prized possession. Nay, not for all the mead in Eorzea...or would I?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, if yer to have any hope of gettin' a Bravura to call yer own, it'd be through the kobolds. The creatures're renowned for their skill at the forge, an' it jus' so happens they also have a penchant for scourin' ancient ruins an' mines for artifacts, precious ores, an' the like.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: To find what we need, ye might try venturin' into U'Ghamaro Mines. Mayhap the kobolds have Bravura stowed away in a repository or summat.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, bugger me... Never in me wildest, drunkest dreams did I imagine ye'd actually find the bloody thing... Bah, so I'll have to fire up the forge, after all.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
