dialogue.text: Hm, I reckon I can find what you need. Might take a bit o' time, is all.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: 'Course, this ain't a charity I'm runnin' here. I can get you what you want, but you'll have to do likewise for me.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I'll track down literature on the ninjas o' the Far East.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: For your part, you're to bring me an Amdapor glyph. You'll find this inside Amdapor Keep, a ruined castle situated in the South Shroud.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Clear on the deal? Then run along and fulfill your part of it.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Ah, good on youlad! This is exactly what I was after. You've honored your part of the bargain, and so I'll do the same.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back to pester me so soon? Judgin' from that smirk on yer face, I take it ye've found what ye need?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, this text is about the ninjas o' the Far East, all right. But gods, would it have killed the bugger that wrote it to use normal bloody words!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It'll take me bleedin' moons to get through this lot─time I could be spendin' on kettles! Gah...while I try to make head or tail of it all, why don't ye take this here pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu an' try 'em out?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As I mentioned before, they're still missin' summat, but they're all there shape-wise, meanin' they should serve ye jus' fine as an ordinary weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seein' as yer a ripe ol' ninja, mayhap ye'll be able to feel out exactly what they want for.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's to say, get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as the ninjas o' the Far East must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sapsa Spawning Grounds over in western La Noscea oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some Sapsa shelfspine, shelfclaw, an' shelftooth─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: With the information in the text an' yer firsthand experience, I reckon we'll solve this puzzle yet.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's to say, get out there an' fight some nasty foes, as the ninjas o' the Far East must've done back in the day.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The Sapsa Spawning Grounds over in western La Noscea oughta serve yer needs. Pit yerself against some Sapsa shelfspine, shelfclaw, an' shelftooth─eight of each, say─then come back an' tell me what ye've gleaned.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Back already? By the frown yer wearin', I take it ye've got nothin' to show for yer time with the fishbacks.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmmm, might be as ye want for better sport. An' I know jus' the creature what'll give it to ye─the hydra what reigns over the fiends within Halatali. A nasty piece o' work, that. Try not to piss yer britches when ye see it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The hydra can be confronted via the Duty Finder upon examining the quest destination situated by the entrance to Halatali in eastern Thanalan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that the trial “A Relic Reborn: The Hydra” must be completed while equipped with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu.

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: We Immortal Flames have managed to cull most of the feral denizens of Halatali, but the hydra still remains. Frankly, we're out of our─

dialogue.name: FAFAJONI
dialogue.text: What!? You mean to face the fell creature!? To be sure, we would be grateful if you could rid us of it, but I must warn you of the dangers. Survival is not guaranteed.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to challenge the hydra, you must be equipped with the pair of unfinished Yoshimitsu.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bloody hells, not ye again! Can't a man have a moment's bleedin' rest!? I've barely had time to piss since you gave me that damnable text.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Readin' the thing's given me a fierce bloody headache...which yer makin' worse by houndin' me!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Do me a favor an' make yerself scarce, will ye? Go an' play with yer bloody Yoshimitsu or summat.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer... Yer still alive! Why the hells do you adventurers have to be so godsdamned sturdy!? I was bloody sure ye'd be hydra dung by now... <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But what's done is done...or in this case, not done. Anyroad, let's talk about that text ye brought. It contains an account o' how a Far Eastern ninja named Sasuke brought ninjutsu to Doma.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems ninjutsu was invented in a land far to the east of Othard's shores─same isle as where Sasuke grew up. The bloke was the best ninja about, so he gets secret orders or summat to cross the sea, an' makes his way to Doma.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Life for the Doman commonfolk was shite back then, what with the starvin' an' the poverty. The worst, though, was the bleedin' tyrant what ruled the place! Well, bein' the charitable sort, what's Sasuke to do but teach the smallfolk ninjutsu so they can win back their freedom?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer man trains some ninjas, an' together they boot the ruler's royal arse off the throne, an' put a dagger in his back for good measure. Well, with the dynasty dead, yer ninjas go lookin' for the spoils o' victory. An' what should they find in the palace vaults? Aye, a pair o' Yoshimitsu!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text:
After that, the lot o' them headed to the outlands o' Doma to build a hidden village, so's to live as ninjas away from pryin' eyes. 'Tis there they wrote a bit on the Yoshimitsu, enough that I know now what's wrong. Seems the rhyme about the smitty ain't about his member's thickness:
The daggers themselves are too damned slim!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: See, the vamper's knives make a good host, an' what ye got now will slip 'twixt a man's ribs jus' fine. But Yoshimitsu were made o' folded steel what could pierce armor without shatterin' nor crumplin'. A thick blade─aye, that's what yer weapons are wantin' for.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As ye can see, I've done me research. I trust ye've also been pullin' yer weight, puttin' the relic to use like I said. Well, go on, then─tell me what ye've learned.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Is that so? Aye...I'd wondered about that.

dialogue.name: EPICMOOGLE
dialogue.text: You mustn't lose your relic, kupo! I went to great pains to retrieve it, so promise me you'll take better care of it!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Based on what we've gleaned from the text an' yer firsthand experience, I'll rework the relic so as to improve yer affinity with it. Hand it over for a second, will ye?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: There, the deed's done. That leaves us with one last step.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That is, fully mergin' the old relic, the new host, an' the soul o' the bearer─aye, that's you. Only then can the weapon be restored to its former glory.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But to do this, I need a fire what's hotter than the seventh hell. An' to keep such a fire alive an' ragin', I need a wind what's fiercer than the...than the...er, hangover I had last week. Gah, ye know what I mean!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Jus' get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk o' hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon! Ah, an' I need me a bottle o' Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil as well to cool it off!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In order to restore yer weapon to its former glory, we need to fully merge the relic with the new host. Oh, aye─an' yer soul. Don't worry, though─it might not hurt much.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Get me a white-hot ember, a howlin' gale, an' a chunk o' hyperfused ore, an' I'll finish yer bloody weapon.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The white-hot ember, the howling gale, and the chunk of hyperfused ore can be obtained by defeating Ifrit in the Bowl of Embers (Hard), Garuda in the Howling Eye (Hard), and Titan in the Navel (Hard), respectively.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer back... Never doubted for a second ye'd trounce all three primals an' come back to pester me again.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All right, then, let's see the white-hot ember, the howling gale, an' the hyperfused ore.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, these oughta get me the levels o' heat I need. Which leaves just the Radz–at–Han quenchin' oil for coolin' things off afterwards. Ye've got that, too, I assume?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bottle of Radz–at–Han quenching oil can be obtained by exchanging 15 Allagan Tomestone of Poetics with Auriana, one of Rowena's assistants at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye've done yer part, an' so I'll do mine.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Watch now, an' try not to bat yer eyelids─ain't every day ye get to see a relic reborn!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Muahahaha... MUAHAHAHAHAHA! These gods-given hands've worked yet another miracle! Feast yer eyes on Yoshimitsu, jus' as they were in days o' yore! 'Tis a sight to move a man to tears...ye lucky bastard. Ye'd better bloody well take care o' them!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of Amdapor Keep.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to gain access to Amdapor Keep, you must complete the quest “Ghosts of Amdapor.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Bowl of Embers (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Bowl of Embers (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Howling Eye (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Howling Eye (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to progress further in the quest, you must complete the objectives of the Navel (Hard).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that gaining access to the Navel (Hard) requires that you make sufficient progress in the main scenario.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Gods, I've been dry as a bone for the past six bells. M-Mead... Jus' give me enough mead to wet me lips...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that you can only undertake one “A Relic Reborn” quest at any given time. If you wish to acquire a different relic weapon, you must either complete or abandon the current quest.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the dhorme chimera!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat the hydra!

obj.n: ファファジョニ上等闘兵
ドルムキマイラ討伐戦

quest.name: ブロンズレイクの再会
journal: Alka Zolka's face is the picture of excitement.

Alka Zolka has received a missive from none other than Surito Carito, requesting that you both join him near the Wanderer's Palace. Make your way to upper La Noscea, and learn what the scholar wishes of you.

Surito Carito has terrible news: the sickness, the selfsame plague that deformed his people, has returned. Surito needs time to find a cure, and intends to place the worst ailing among his friends into magical slumber with the sealing enchantments of Nym. However, he needs keystones to do so, and would have you and Alka Zolka scour the nearby shores for one apiece. Travel to the Long Climb in outer La Noscea, and search for one of the outer keystones along the northern edge of Bronze Lake.
Though momentarily distracted by a golem of dubious origin, you have stumbled upon one of the sought-after keystones. Attempt once more to remove it from its resting place.
You have safely taken the keystone. Return with it to Surito near the Wanderer's Palace.

Surito Carito gratefully accepts one of the outer keystones from you, and the other from Alka Zolka. However, he reveals that these are not enough─the sealing enchantment requires yet another keystone. He asks that you continue to study the way of the scholar until he can discern the location of the last one.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Surito Carito near the Wanderer's Palace.
Search for the outer keystone in outer La Noscea.
Pick up the outer keystone.
Deliver the outer keystone to Surito Carito.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You have astonishing timing, Forename. Would you believe that I meant to send for you this very bell?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito has summoned us both by name!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: His missive was unclear as to why he needs us. But when a living scholar calls, we can scarce dismiss him.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Just imagine the sorts of things we might learn from him: the military tactics, the Nymian secrets!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Come, my friend, let us make for the shores of Bronze Lake, where Surito Carito and untold knowledge await!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito awaits us near the Wanderer's Palace, on the shores of Bronze Lake─and we ought not keep him!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming. I hope the journey was not too taxing.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Not at all! Both Forename and I are ready and willing to help. But pray tell, why have you summoned us?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Allow me to start at the beginning. After Lily freed my heart, I returned to my people. For the first time in an age, I was myself.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I brought all my knowledge to bear against the rancor and managed to save some of my comrades. Alas, many and more are yet consumed by hatred...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: And I was not alone for long. Many of my kin regained their sanity once the palace was freed of the tonberry king's malignance.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Though our minds were our own, our forms remained monstrous, and we dared not venture outside. Yet within our halls, we were content with our own company and the quiet life.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: But it did not last. One by one, we began to grow ill again, and then grotesque. The sickness that transformed us into tonberries has returned!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What? Are you certain!?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Beyond all doubt. Fifteen hundred years past, powerful magicks were used to seal us in the palace alongside the sickness. Yet even these could not withstand the Calamity. As we arose from our long slumber, the sickness awoke with us.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: As a scholar, I must see my people restored in mind and body both. But finding a cure will take many moons─perhaps even years─and that is time they do not have.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Yet I presume you will not stand idle while their condition worsens. This is why you summoned us, is it not?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Just so. I plan to seal the worst afflicted within a section of the palace. There, they will slumber once more.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: This itself is no cure. But it will afford me the time I so desperately need to find a permanent solution.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text:
Now, as for the seal itself, an enchantment of this nature is not unlike a net. It is anchored at several points, and if not laid down in perfect balance, the magicks will falter. In order to accomplish this balance, my people created keystones to focus and disperse aether.
It is these keystones that I have need of, but I dare not seek them out myself for fear of being hunted.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text:
Then we will gather them in your stead!
...It is “we,” is it not, Forename?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you both. The original enchantment encircled this lake, and two of the keystones should be somewhere along the banks. If you search the shores, I've no doubt you will find them.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I will take the near bank. If you scour the northern shores in outer La Noscea, I am sure we will find the outer keystones.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: You have my thanks for taking up the search for the keystones, my friend.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: As you reach to pick up the keystone, you hear the crack and rumble of rock upon rock. The hair raised on the nape of your neck, you turn to see a guardian of eld awaken!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Has your search for keystones borne fruit?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Yes...yes, there can be no mistaking these runes...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I have it, I have it! Whew... That was a pitched battle, I tell you. The keystone was in the clutches of an uragnite─and an ill-tempered one at that!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: That explains the...distinctive odor. But the runes leave no doubt. Thank you, Alka Zolka.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It was the least I could do. I trust you can seal away the worst stricken of the Nymians now?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: It is not that simple, I fear. The enchantment will fail without three keystones: two on the outside, and another at the center.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I lack this grand keystone, and the knowledge to locate it. While I search, pray focus on your studies. I have a suspicion that what trials await will try you sorely as a scholar...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 封印の大要石
journal: Surito Carito has been waiting for you.

Surito Carito reveals that he and Alka Zolka have located the grand keystone, the means to again sealing away the afflicted tonberries. In fact, Alka Zolka has already ventured forth to search for it among the ruins to the east. However, ancient guardians watching over Nymian assets may pose a threat to your marauder friend. Go now, and ensure his safety.
Alka Zolka has eagerly awaited your coming. Take the grand keystone from where it lies, and together face whatever rises to defend it.
The guardian destroyed, you now have the grand keystone in hand. Present it to Surito Carito near the Wanderer's Palace.

Surito takes the grand keystone with thanks. Though sealing his ailing friends away will not save them, it will give the scholar enough time to devise a cure.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Alka Zolka in the ruins to the east.
Obtain the grand keystone.
Deliver the grand keystone to Surito Carito.
Defeat the guardian!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: We have divined the location of the grand keystone, my friend. It lies in the ruins to the east.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: The credit for the find truly lies with Alka Zolka. His knowledge of Nym is impressive. It was not long into our discussion of the stone's whereabouts that we were able to piece together where it must be.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: As you can imagine, he could not contain his curiosity. Even now, he is combing through the ruins. Please, see that he comes to no harm.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: We often left guardians to watch our most precious assets. I told Alka Zolka this, but he firmly believes the enchantments have worn thin. I am less sure. Be careful when you take the grand keystone.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Perhaps I fear for nothing, and Alka Zolka has already found the grand keystone.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: But if the magicks that power the guardians remain, he may be in great danger...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename! You have arrived in time─I believe our prize is just yonder. And I trust Surito Carito mentioned the guardians?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I have my doubts they still guard our prize, but better safe than sorry. Should any awaken to our presence, we will reduce them to rubble!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Come, Forename, let us take the grand keystone and be done with it!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Keep your wits about you, Forename...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: A guardian! Well, we have dug up much of Nym's past. Mayhap it's time we put a piece of it to rest!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Haha, what a team we make! No foe can stand against scholar and marauder!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The grand keystone is ours. Surito will no doubt be happy to get his hands on it.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: You are safe, thank the gods. And the grand keystone...?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Well done, you two. With this, I can cast a sealing enchantment over those of my people suffering most.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I am full glad to hear it!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Soon the worst afflicted will be at peace once more, safely segregated from the others.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: But this is only the first step. I will need to learn the cause of the sickness before seeing my people cured.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You are not alone in this, Surito Carito. We three shall see an end to this blight.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Alka Zolka, Forename. I am proud to have you both at my side.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forename, it is time that you learned a new spell for giving succor to your comrades-in-arms: Indomitability. Once, it was the sole province of high-ranking scholars. May it serve you well henceforth.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I shall draw its ire! Pray attend me, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Destroy its soulstone─it cannot move if you do!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Now, while it is paralyzed! Keep attacking!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hah! It is no match for us!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We have it, Forename! We have it!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: M-My carelessness has cost us...

obj.n: ブロンズレイクの再会

quest.name: 魔法都市「マハ」の陰謀
journal: Surito Carito seems to be at wit's end.

The cause of Surito Carito's frustration is a lack of progress─he cannot cure the sickness without learning more of it. He explains the scourge of his people came from the ocean, upon a trader's galley. Sailors lost in a terrible storm drifted to a desert isle in the south seas, where they met a tribe of Lalafells. These natives gave the traders succor, and sent them home with a wondrous gift─an ornate amphora. Upon hearing the tale in full, however, Alka Zolka realizes that this vase may be the sickness's source, for would not these traders otherwise have transformed? To discover the truth of this, and learn more of the illness, Surito Carito entreats you to search for the south seas amphora in what remains of the Floating City of Nym.
Your search for the south seas amphora has availed you naught, but there are yet more places to scour. Continue to look in another area.
You look about for the south seas amphora a second time, but to no avail. Move on to another vantage point and try again.
You look high and low, and spot something protruding from the dirt nearby. Go and attempt to dig it free.
Though voidsent appear as if from nowhere to preempt your discovery, you make short work of them. Now is the time to excavate the earthenware amphora.
You pry the empty amphora from the soil. Return to Surito by the Wanderer's Palace, and ask whether or not this is the south seas amphora you seek.

Though amazed to find it intact, Surito concludes that the vase is the selfsame amphora the traders brought back to Nym. However, he is shocked by what he sees inside: a binding sigil, carved into the bottom to hold a voidsent. Surito reveals that this is the work of Mhach, an ancient nation of magi who drew their might from the void and coveted Nym. Bewildered, he wonders if everything, from the storm to the traders' miraculous return, had been a Mhachi plot to bring low his people. Greatly troubled, he asks for time to think upon the role that void magi played in spreading the sickness.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Search for the south seas amphora in the Floating City of Nym.
Continue searching for the south seas amphora.
Examine the amphora.
Retrieve the amphora.
Deliver the empty amphora to Surito Carito.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I have worked day and night on the cure, yet I have little to show for it. My research is at a standstill for lack of information.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I feared as much. If ever men had knowledge of the sickness, it was lost long before this age. Even after careful study of Nymian tablets, I still know little more than what you have told me: that it came from the sea.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: From traders who returned from the south seas, yes. They had lost their mainmast in a fearsome tempest and drifted, victims of the current, until at last they ran aground on a desert isle.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Half dead, they stumbled ashore, and would have perished but for the Lalafellin tribe that lived there. These natives nursed the traders back to health and helped mend their ship. They even sent our men home with an amphora etched with ornate designs─a gift of friendship.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: In Nym, we had given them the rites due to those lost at sea. When they sailed into port a year after they had left, you can imagine how joyful the mood was.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Yet our joy soon turned to horror. The traders began to grow ill, for the sickness was upon them. They transformed, and the rest, you know.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Hmmm... The story suggests the traders contracted the disease on the isle. The voyage home must have been─

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Hold on... The traders were hale and healthy when they returned to Nym, yes? The sickness became known only after they reached port?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: You mean to suggest that it was not the men who bore the disease? Then who─or what...? Something they carried, perhaps, something...like the islanders' gift!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: That does seem the more likely culprit. But without the amphora, this is all conjecture, and I would be astounded if even a shard remains after fifteen hundred years.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: As would I. <sigh> It was placed on display in the royal halls for all to see. If only I had considered it a possible source...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The royal halls? I know exactly where those used to be! Precious little remains of them, but I will scour the area. And if Forename joins me, mayhap we will be lucky.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: The amphora was kept in the royal halls, which Alka Zolka can pinpoint in the Floating City. Unlikely though it may be, perhaps a piece of it remains...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I hope we have not come on a fool's errand, Forename, but I see nothing to persuade me otherwise. Mayhap if you searched over there...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You see no sign of the south seas amphora...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You see no sign of the south seas amphora...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You spot something half-covered with soil several yalms below you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You dig out an empty amphora from the soil where it lies.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You...you actually found it!? It's a miracle! ...But we must have Surito Carito authenticate it before growing too excited.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I beg your pardon... You found it? Intact!?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Incredible... I remember this as though it were yesterday. This is the selfsame amphora.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Then it truly is an honest-to-gods miracle! Though...it occurs to me now that we should handle it with a bit more care─assuming it can, ahem, turn us into tonberries.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Voidsent? That is what attempted to stop you from taking the amphora?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Voidsent are drawn to the magicks of their own kind, which means a voidsent of some strength was likely sealed herein.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text:
Yes, here, a binding sigil cut into the bottom─
...Dear gods, it cannot be! This is the work of Mhach!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text:
“Mhach, Mhach, beware the dark,
keep away or lose your heart.”
...That Mhach?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: An apt rhyme doubtless inherited from Nym. Mhach was our enemy, rapacious and unwise. Their magi trafficked with the void, grew mighty from shadows and attacked our lands time and again!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Look no further than this─their sigil which sealed a voidsent in this “gift.” The islanders must have been their pawns in a plot to bring us to our knees.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: We were fools. Not once did we consider that everything, from the tempest to our traders' miraculous return, might be a voidmage ploy!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I must return to my tomes. Pray allow me time to research this─and please, tell me if you begin to transform...

quest.name: 海兵魂、海兵魂、海兵魂！
journal: Your time away has not lightened Surito Carito's mood.

Surito Carito reveals his latest theory: the voidsent bound within the amphora unleashed the sickness upon Nym, and fled from its cage after cloaking itself with dark magicks. He says you must track down this invisible voidsent, but that even a scholar of his experience needs time to discover where to start. In the meantime, he asks that you and Alka Zolka focus on training, and introduces Halga Tolga to guide you. Speak with this former officer of the vaunted Nymian Royal Marines near Bronze Lake, and start learning things the hard way.

After dressing you down, Halga Tolga demands you show your commitment to the Royal Marines. Demonstrate your resolve now by entering any expression containing the phrase “come hells or high water” with the chat mode in Say.
Halga Tolga cannot hear you. Show your spirit again by entering any expression containing the phrase “come hells or high water” with the chat mode in Say.

Grudgingly, Halga Tolga admits you have the spirit of a Royal Marine. Now, he bids you prove that you have the courage of one by finding the leader of the Mamool Ja to the east of Bronze Lake. Mock him and his ways with a great big /laugh, and defend yourself if he should take exception to your actions.
You have outraged and defeated a band of Mamool Ja. Report back to Halga Tolga near the Wanderer's Palace for your debriefing.

Though not overly impressed by either Alka Zolka or you, Halga Tolga concedes that you show promise. However, he is abundantly clear that you have a long way to go. Focus on honing your own skills, he orders you, and you may be able to defeat the invisible voidsent. Someday.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Halga Tolga.
With the chat mode in Say, enter “come hells or high water” to show your resolve to Halga Tolga.
With the chat mode in Say, enter “come hells or high water” again to appease Halga Tolga.
Mock the Mamool Ja leader with a /laugh and defend yourself if he attacks.
Report to Halga Tolga.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you for joining me. I gather your noses have not shrunk. And your ears...?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Good, then you are safe. I think the voidsent inside the amphora summoned its kind to distract you while it fled, magically concealed.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Traces of this enchantment remain, but nothing else. There were no signs of toxin or miasma in the amphora. The corpses of the creatures you slew were likewise free of disease.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What? Does this mean our invisible voidsent is indeed what spread the sickness through Nym!?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: That is what I have come to believe. As to why it fled, I can only suppose the long years bound within the vase robbed it of the strength to oppose you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: But surely it can regain that strength! My gods... If it does, the entire realm is at terrible risk!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: It does pose a risk, but this is also an opportunity. If we can track it down and lay it low, its corpse may lead us to a cure!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: There is truth in that... Come, Forename, let us pursue this voidsent forthwith!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: A moment, Alka Zolka. It will require all my skill to track the voidsent, and time besides. Moreover, you cannot afford to be defeated once I have found it. As such, I have requested the aid of an old companion.

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Realm's gone to shite if these sorry specimens're all the Royal Marines've got left. But they'll march like proper soldiers when I'm done, or my name isn't Halga Tolga!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: S-Sergeant Tolga!? Forename, do you understand who this is!? Before us stands the greatest drill instructor of the Nymian military! Come on─we have much and more to learn!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Halga will demand much of you, and subject you to seemingly unreasonable tasks. Know that he does this solely for your benefit.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: No hardship is too great! I will become a marauder worthy of the Nymian military!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Think you've got what it takes to be a Royal Marine? Hah, you make me laugh! Ever worn glasses into battle, boy? Expect your foe to wait while you wipe blood from the lenses, do you!?

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: And the scholar. Had a lot like you in the war. More use dead than alive! Having their corpses piled high around us kept us safer than their damned magicks ever did! You're a bloody joke!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: But I'm here to turn you into Royal Marines, and Royal Marines you will be! First, the creed! “To victory─come hells or high water.” Come on, let me hear you!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any expression that contains the phrase “come hells or high water” to demonstrate your resolve to Halga Tolga.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: come hells or high water

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Are you a mammet or a scholar!? If you can't remember five bloody words, then what good are you!? Say “come hells or high water,” or get out of my sight!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any expression that contains the phrase “come hells or high water” to demonstrate your resolve to Halga Tolga.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: To victory─come hells or high water!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: How do you expect to strike fear into your enemies whispering like that!? Open your gobs, and say it like you mean it!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter any expression that contains the phrase “come hells or high water” to prove yourself to Halga Tolga.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: TO VICTORY─COME HELLS OR HIGH WATER, SIR!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Well, you show spirit, I'll give you that... Now, to your tasks!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: First, the scholar! There's a band of Mamool Ja sellswords that've been eyeing our palace. Walk up to them with a great, stupid grin, and laugh in the leader's face!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: The whoresons'll hurl everything they've got at you for that. Acquit yourself well and you pass. Now go!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Too craven to laugh at a Mamool Ja!? Then you've no place in the Royal Marines! Do it or don't come back!

dialogue.name: MAMOOLJAMERCENARYCAPTAIN
dialogue.text: Wh-Why you laugh? You think Mamool Ja funny!? No! You funny! I laugh, see!? AHAHA...ha... Er... You die now!

dialogue.name: MAMOOLJAMERCENARYCAPTAIN
dialogue.text: What? You talk to Mamool Ja? No? Then who you talk to!?

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Hah! You're both still alive. Not half bad!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: But any real marine could've done it twice as fast! You truly are the sorriest excuse for a unit I have ever seen!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: With all due respect, sir, the tasks you gave us were... I mean, what was I supposed to achieve by massaging that man with...salamander oil?

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: You bloody fool! If you've got to ask, then clearly you learned nothing! And you, scholar─are you going to tell me you don't know why I had you fight without a protector!?

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Chaos reigns on the battlefield! The marines around you are all you've got, and they will die for your failings!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Marines, scholars─everyone has to do whatever it takes to survive! To be all they can be!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Until you understand that, you're not fit to face even the weakest voidsent! That is all for today. Now get back to training─you're dismissed!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Sir, yes, sir! I...I have been a fool, Forename! I will do as he says! To victory─come hells or high water!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Whew... I have done many and more strange things in pursuit of my goals, Forename, but massaging a man with salamander oil is the strangest yet...

quest.name: 消え去りし大妖異
journal: Surito Carito would again ask for your assistance.

Though he has done painstaking research, Surito Carito is stumped. He supposes that the voidsent's invisibility is uniquely suited to subverting Nymian wards. In the current day and age, however, he believes academics may know a way to reveal the unseen foe. Alka Zolka suggests that the Thaumaturges' Guild in Ul'dah may contain the sought-after information, and bids you speak with its receptionist, Yayake. Proceed there in hopes that the library holds a tome or two on the subject.

Upon speaking with Yayake, you learn a book on vanishing voidsent was once in the guild's collection. Now, it is somewhere in Coerthas, carried there by a researcher who has been missing since the Calamity. Yayake directs you to his last known destination: Falcon's Nest. Make your way there, and see if Ser Redwald knows anything.
After hearing your situation, Ser Redwald directs you to Soubinie. Visit the keeper of records and see if she knows anything of the missing researcher.

Soubinie informs you that the researcher left Falcon's Nest via a riverboat, the North Star. However, the vessel ran aground during the Calamity. Though no passengers are thought to have survived, the ship itself remains. She suggests you search the ship on the stretch of water where it froze in the western highlands.

You find the sack of void scholar's effects aboard the North Star, and the book you sought therein. Though the elements have not been kind, it is still legible. Present it to Surito Carito back near the Wanderer's Palace.

Surito Carito thanks you for the sack of void scholar's effects, and vows that he will find a way to trace the invisible voidsent. The day of reckoning draws near, and Surito bids you prepare yourself to face the fiend who spread the sickness.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with Yayake at the Thaumaturges' Guild.
Speak with Redwald at Falcon's Nest.
Speak with Soubinie.
Search the North Star on the Coerthas River.
Deliver the sack of void scholar's effects to Surito Carito.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: How goes the training, friends?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As Forename's comrade-in-arms, it is clear that herhis prowess with the scholarly arts has increased immeasurably thanks to Sergeant Tolga's advice.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Alas, the same cannot be said for me... I had already thought myself a master of Nymian techniques, frankly, based on what I had gleaned from the tablets we uncovered. But the sergeant's training has robbed me of that notion.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I am still a novice. Until Sergeant Tolga says I am worthy, I wish to continue training!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Your ambition does you well, Alka Zolka. Stay true to this path, and you will become as fine a marine as ever marched under our banner.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Well, I suppose I have no choice but to ask you to do the work of two, Forename.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I have tried every method known to me to find our missing voidsent, but without success. It seems Nymian magicks will not suffice.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: That comes as little surprise. This voidsent was in Mhach's thrall, and likely chosen for its ability to circumvent Nymian wards.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Yes, which is why I hope your academics have answers I do not. Have you any writings on voidsent?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I believe the Thaumaturges' Guild in Ul'dah has a collection dating back centuries, including some authored by their Belah'dian forefathers.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Belah'dian, not Mhachi? Hmmm...perhaps they were the heirs to the voidmage legacy. In any case, this Ul'dah seems worth a visit. Will you go in my stead, Forename?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I suggest you seek out Yayake. She is an old friend whose love of ancient tomes rivals mine own.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I wish I could see her in person. But I must continue my training, as well as look after the new recruits.

dialogue.name: MARAUDER01675
dialogue.text: (-Hardened Marauder-)One! Two! Three!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: To victory, Forename─come hells or high water!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: It is good to see Halga active again.

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: When I'm done with you whoresons, you might be worthy of the Royal Marines! Until then, you're no better to me than pudding, and rotten pudding at that!

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Welcome to the Thaumaturges' Guild. It is fate that has guided your steps here, friend.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Is today the day you delve into the one hundred and eight volumes of fundamental thaumaturgical principle? No?

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Ah, our own avatar of devastation. To what do we owe the pleasure?

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Alka? Alka Zolka? That is not a name I expected to hear! But I am glad my fellow booklover is well.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Hmmm... I have indeed read of voidsent able to perfectly conceal their form. There was a tome on the subject─Unseen was the title─penned in the Fifth Astral Era. Unfortunately, it is no longer a part of our collection.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: A member of the guild borrowed it for his research expedition, a project which was to last some few moons. However, that was five years ago, and he has not been heard from since.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: A pity. He proposed the most fascinating theories on voidsent, and traveled to the western highlands of Coerthas to put them to the proof. Alas, that area was rendered inhospitable by the Calamity...

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: There is a chance, of course, that the man is alive, and the book unharmed. We traced his journey as far as Falcon's Nest. Mayhap someone there can point you towards where he ventured next.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: If you are bent on retrieving that book, I suggest you make way for Falcon's Nest. The researcher who borrowed it from our library was last seen there before he vanished.

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: How now, adventurer?

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: On the trail of a researcher who visited five years ago? Hm... That is not much to go on.

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: The garrison was still stationed here in those days. Soubinie is in charge of organizing the records. If any here know of your researcher, it will be her.

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: Soubinie has the records of all that happened here five years ago─or what remains of them.

dialogue.name: SOUBINIE
dialogue.text: Oh. H-Hello... How might I help you...?

dialogue.name: SOUBINIE
dialogue.text: A man researching voidsent? Yes...yes, where was it he was mentioned?

dialogue.name: SOUBINIE
dialogue.text: Ah, that's right. He stayed here for a time before taking the North Star downriver...

dialogue.name: SOUBINIE
dialogue.text: ...Which was one among many sunk by that fearsome primal's rampage during the Calamity. The lucky few who made it to shore were then...eaten by vilekin!?

dialogue.name: SOUBINIE
dialogue.text: Er... Well, the boat ran aground, and hasn't moved since the river froze over. You may wish to search the wreck yourself, though do be careful of the local wildlife.

dialogue.name: REDWALD
dialogue.text: To the Coerthas River, eh? The fastest way there is astride a black chocobo.

dialogue.name: SOUBINIE
dialogue.text: O-Oh! I thought you were going to search the North Star in the Coerthas River.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Have you found anything to aid our cause?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: These things have all seen better days. Ah, but here is the book! And the writing is still legible.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: It will take time and patience, but I am hopeful its secrets will allow us to snare our invisible voidsent!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Do mine ears deceive me, or did you track down a book? Splendid, Forename!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As for me, I would like to think I've improved by leaps and bounds, thanks to Sergeant Tolga. The recruits are coming along nicely as well.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: With a bit more training, every individual in our unit will be able and ready to face our voidsent foe in battle!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Very good. Then let us all attend to our tasks─the day of reckoning will be upon us soon enough.

obj.n: 呪術士ギルド受付 ヤヤケ

quest.name: 次代の「海兵団」
journal: Surito Carito appears resolute.

Surito Carito informs you he has learned how to track the invisible voidsent. His research has revealed that your faerie can perceive where the fiend has feasted, and that you can track it via these aetherial traces. With Alka Zolka and the new Royal Marines at your back, make your way to the Floating City of Nym, and begin the hunt for the fiend.
Your faerie detects the voidsent's aetherial traces─the remains of its prey. She directs you next towards Zelma's Run in upper La Noscea.
Your faerie once again senses the aetherial traces of the voidsent, this time moving towards Camp Bronze Lake. Hurry there and consult with Alka Zolka.

With a burst of blinding light, your faerie dispels the spell concealing the voidsent. The foe now visible, the Royal Marines charge. Alka Zolka and his soldiers deliver punishing blows, whilst your spells defend them. The battle is fierce, but soon the fiend lies dying. With its last breaths, it makes ready to release the sickness─yet before it can, the tonberries come to your aid. The killing blow is theirs. Now, as you stand victorious, congratulate your fellow combatants for putting an end to this specter of Mhach.
You have spoken with your comrades-in-arms. Before you head off into the sunset, it would be best to see what comments Surito Carito has.

Though the cure to the tonberries' plight is still not quite within your grasp, Surito Carito remains gratified by the outcome of the day's events. Seeing both your people and his able to work together toward a common cause is victory enough, at least for now.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Search for traces of the voidsent in the Floating City of Nym.
Search for traces of the voidsent in Zelma's Run.
Speak with Alka Zolka at Camp Bronze Lake.
Speak with your fellow Royal Marines.
Speak with Surito Carito.
Find the voidsent!
Aetherial traces detected
Prevent the Nymian Plague and slay the voidsent!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I have it, Forename─the means to track our invisible voidsent! The time is come to discuss our attack.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Hah hah! I've been waiting for this day! What's the plan, Surito Carito?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: First, we will need to track our quarry. I believe it has been feeding upon the aether of local creatures to regain its strength.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: The way in which it feeds leaves behind unique aetherial traces. As bread crumbs mark the path of a hungry child, this trail will lead us straight to the voidsent.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: How are we to detect these traces?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: With Lily's aid. She can sense where the voidsent has left aether undevoured.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: We will begin our search where you unearthed the amphora, and follow where Lily leads.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Once she senses the voidsent is near, we will force it to show itself. Lily will illuminate the area, and her light will dispel the magicks concealing it. Right, my dear?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: With the voidsent visible, we will attack with all our might. The marines will charge, and kill it before it causes more damage!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: This is it, Forename─our chance to prove the might of our corps!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Little one, the fate of the realm is in your hands. Are you ready?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Then our course is clear. May our plan ensure the sickness never again claims a victim!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: To victory─come hells or high water!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Quickly, my friend, to where you found the amphora!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Through the aetherial traces remaining from devoured prey, your faerie senses the voidsent is moving towards Zelma's Run!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Our future rests upon your success. May good fortune attend you today.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Where could it have gone...?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Through the aetherial traces remaining from devoured prey, your faerie senses the voidsent is moving towards Camp Bronze Lake!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What is it, Forename?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: B-But that way lies Camp Bronze Lake!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What purpose could it have there? The healing waters? No... I suppose it is home to─

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Of course! The wounded Maelstrom soldiers! It means to spread the sickness anew through them!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We must stop it! Quickly, to the camp!

dialogue.name: OLDSAILOR01676
dialogue.text: Godsdammit! This place is bloody crowded! If we don't find the voidsent quickly, there's to be a lot more tonberries!

dialogue.name: SAILOR01676
dialogue.text: But how do we draw it out into the open if we can't see it?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Get the soldiers to evacuate! Forename, find the voidsent with Lily's light!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Only you can track the voidsent.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Wh-What is that queer light!?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Is that it!? Quick, after it!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It will try to infect us! We must avoid that at all costs!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Blech! What is this foul stuff!? Get it off me!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Your people will not face Nym's tragedy─not while I draw breath!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito! Sergeant!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: N-No... Nooooooooo!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Gods above, Forename! No...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Waaah! They're tonberries!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: V-Victory, Forename─come hells o-or...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: At long last...

dialogue.name: WOUNDEDSOLDIER01676
dialogue.text: Waaah! M-M-Monster!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: For Limsa, for the tonberries, and for glory─attack!

dialogue.name: MARINES01676
dialogue.text: (-Marines-)TO VICTORY─COME HELLS OR HIGH WATER!

dialogue.name: ENEMY01676
dialogue.text: Deleted

dialogue.name: OLDSAILOR01676
dialogue.text: Is...is it─

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Get back! It's trying to infect us!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: No!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Now, Forename!

dialogue.name: ENEMY01676
dialogue.text: Deleted

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ahaha! We are victorious!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Yes... When I think on the horror it visited upon my people, I...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: But now, no one else will share our fate. My thanks to you and Alka Zolka both.

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: Aye, you've got my gratitude as well. Good to see proper Royal Marines at it again.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Indeed it is. Today, the torch is passed to you─may the Royal Marines evermore defend the people!

dialogue.name: SAILOR01676
dialogue.text: An honor fighting beside you, madamsir! If you ever have need of us, you need only ask.

dialogue.name: OLDSAILOR01676
dialogue.text: Ain't common feelin' that safe in a battle. I reckon those Nymians knew what they were doin' with them scholars an' faeries. I'll have yer back, too, if ever ye need it.

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: <sniffle> Bloody tonberry eyes, always running with─ Bah, who am I kidding? You did a fine job, a fine job indeed!

dialogue.name: HALGATOLGA
dialogue.text: ...But don't you dare think of easing up on your training on account of one victory! If you sully the name of my beloved marines, I'll flay the skin off your back!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Imagine, Forename, defeating a voidsent over fifteen hundred years old... When we first met, I didn't dare think we'd achieve such things together.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The threat is gone, and the Royal Marines are born anew. Not a bad day's work, I daresay.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: But we are far from finished. I do not know what threats the future holds, but they will not find us unprepared─not as long as I have aught to say about it. To victory, my friend─come hells or high water!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: You have won a great victory today, my friend. Your allies will appreciate it if you tell them so.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I have gathered the voidsent's remains. With careful research, they should yield the secrets I need to heal my people.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I am not so naive as to believe the answers will come quickly. Yet the cure shall be ours one day.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: For now, my people will labor so that we may walk with yours towards a brighter dawn. I would see a future where we are part of the realm, not shunned by it.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend. Lily chose most wisely in you.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Allow me to pass on to you one of Nym's mightiest abilities─Dissipation. It is a secret spell meant for use only by those scholars who have earned the full trust of their faerie companions. Use it with care.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Now, I must return to my people, and you to yours. Fare you well, and may our efforts make tomorrow a brighter day!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the scholar quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka.

quest.name: かそけき光明
journal: The storm captain would hear more of your battle.

Your fighting has inspired the Maelstrom outfit, and each member will take lessons from the battle back with them. With the operation against the Serpent Reavers coming to a successful close, the troops will report to Maelstrom Command. Bring word of your operation at the Isles of Umbra to Broken Mountain at Camp Bronze Lake.

Broken Mountain is reassured at your safe return, and surprised that such weak foes were able to awaken the inner beast so fiercely that you learned a new technique. He informs you that Curious Gorge is recovering from recent injuries suffered during his latest operation against the kobolds. Visit Curious Gorge and exchange battle stories in the relaxing hot springs.

You learn that Curious Gorge was injured in an operation against the kobolds after throwing himself on top of a bomb with more destructive capability than any that have been seen from the kobolds before. Despite the strength of the bomb, Curious Gorge's wounds are relatively light, and he is on the road to make a full recovery. Broken Mountain makes the connection between his brother's story and yours, and surmises that the key to taming the inner beast might lie in the resolve to protect the lives of one's allies.

However, while Broken Mountain is eager to test his theory by having his brother challenge a powerful adversary as you did, Curious Gorge remains fearful that the beast within will overcome him. The troubled warrior asks you let him think on this dilemma in peace. It seems Broken Mountain has some words he would like to share with you before you depart. Visit him to get his read on the situation.

Broken Mountain's theory is that the inner beast is roused in the heat of battle, and tamed when a warrior resolves to protect the lives of his allies. If he is correct, then his brother will no longer have to fear losing control, so long as he fights to protect those he holds dear. However, if Curious Gorge does lose control again, someone must have the strength to bring him back from the brink of bloodlust. Continue your training so that Curious Gorge can swing his axe without hesitation during his next battle.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Broken Mountain.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Speak with Broken Mountain.

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: To be unbound from the limits of your mind and body, and to use that strength in our defense... Truly we could not have asked for more valiant an ally.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: It would seem our battle with the Serpent Reavers bestowed upon you yet another technique of eld. My comrades and I, as well, will not soon forget the ferocity with which you protected our lives this day.

dialogue.name: CAPTAIN00596
dialogue.text: I shall return to Maelstrom Command and inform them of our success. I look forward to the day we fight side by side once more.

dialogue.name: YOUHEI00596
dialogue.text: The lessons learned from your example will serve to aid me in countless battles to come. No doubt Wheiskaet and the others are eager to hear back from you. Give that old marauder my regards!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, I knew the Serpent Reavers would fall swiftly before your axe. Did you learn aught from the skirmish that might be of aid?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Hmmm...I did not expect such feeble opponents to wake the beast from its slumber, but it seems your conviction to safeguard your comrades had much the same effect as pitting yourself against the bears of Abalathia's Spine.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, this information may prove to be invaluable. Within your story likely lies the key to overcoming my brother's struggle...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, my brother suffered injuries in a clash with the kobolds, and has come here to nurse his wounds as I did. It would please him to see an old friend such as you. Pray speak with him, for an exchange of battle stories may serve to lift his spirits.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: My brother nurses his wounds in the camp's healing springs. He will be eager to hear of your operation on the Isles of Umbra.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: A former junior officer of mine sent word of your deeds. Fighting by your side is bound to give him even greater courage.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: From my old comrade's account, his operation with you won't be one he'll soon forget.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I suffered injury during my fight with the kobolds, and was told to rest at Camp Bronze Lake. I'll be departing shortly.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, I'm joyed to see you came through your battle with the pirates unscathed. If only I could say the same. I've been ordered to rest here until the wounds I suffered in our fight against the kobolds heal.

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: According to the unit's report, the kobolds unleashed a new type of explosive on the Maelstrom troops. Gorge valiantly threw himself upon it before detonation, shielding his allies from the worst of the blast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The new bomb had a destructive force unseen in the kobolds' primitive explosives. That my brother is still standing before us is no small miracle.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Truth be told, my wounds are barely severe enough to warrant sending me here... The moment I saw the bomb, I knew I couldn't let my comrades come to harm, and leapt upon it as if by instinct. I remember nothing after that...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Forename has a similar story to tell...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The Serpent Reavers almost overwhelmed the Maelstrom troops, but shehe remained undaunted in their defense, awakening the inner beast with a ferocity unseen before.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: You both poured your energy not into defeating your foes, but protecting your allies... Could this be the secret to taming the throes of the beast within?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If so, that means... Brother, you have finally brought your inner beast to heel!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What!? But I didn't feel the beast taking hold...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: This theory must needs be tested. Brother, once your wounds have healed, it would serve you best to let go of the worry keeping you from unleashing your full strength. Swing your axe unbridled by fear!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...But, what if I succumb to the beast's call again? My training has only made me stronger. If I lose control, it could be worse than in Wineport...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Now is not the time for doubt. Your allies─nay, your friends─will be by your side. They will ensure none are harmed should the worst come to pass.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: ...I know your theory demands that I fight without hesitation, but... Please, I must think on this...

dialogue.name: WHEISKAET
dialogue.text: Aye, we should let Curious Gorge's wounds heal before we demand anything more from him. Rest well, my friend. We'll return before long.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, there is more I would speak with you about. Pray visit me when you are ready.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Please, let me rest... There is much to think about...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: To rouse the inner beast with fierce battle, and tame it by resolving to fiercely defend your allies... This theory could serve us better than aimlessly scouring the ancient tomes, but my brother still fears the consequences should he lose control...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If indeed his fears should come to pass, you must be ready to stop him, as you have before. Forename, prepare your axe for our next battle.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: 破壊の力を求めて
journal: Lalai would entrust you with powerful spells left by Master Ququruka.

Lalai has stumbled upon an enciphered parchment among Ququruka's effects which reveals the whereabouts of tomes of magic thought to have been long lost─the Books of Nald'thal. As the womanman who has inherited Ququruka's legacy, Lalai believes that these tomes and the secrets they hold rightly belong to you. She bids you meet her at Nald's Reflection in southern Thanalan, there to search for the Book of Nald.
You have successfully retrieved the Book of Nald. Proceed now to Thal's Respite in eastern Thanalan and look for its twin, the Book of Thal.

You arrive at Thal's Respite only to find that the Book of Thal is no longer there. Lalai is determined to recover the tome before the secrets it holds can be used to cause great harm. Return to Milvaneth Sacrarium and speak with Lalai to deliberate on a course of action.

Evidence at the crime scene indicates that the Book of Thal was removed from its hiding spot but recently. As the tome is protected by an enchantment as its twin is, Lalai believes that there is still time to avert disaster. She expresses her intent to make discreet inquiries as to the location of the missing tome, and asks your permission to hold on to the Book of Nald for a thorough examination.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Lalai at Nald's Reflection.
Speak with Lalai at Thal's Respite.
Speak with Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. You come at a good time. I have made a remarkable discovery, which I would share with you.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: After Master Ququruka passed away, I went to his cell in the Marasaja Pit─the cell in which he spent a hundred years locked away.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I doubted my master, and the guilt of it gnaws at my conscience. In order to atone, I decided to preserve the fruits of his research for future generations.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Well, as I went about sorting through his personal effects, I found a most peculiar slip of parchment bearing a jumble of glyphs and sigils, which I instantly recognized to be a cipher.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: When I removed the cipher to reveal the hidden words, I could scarce believe my eyes! They described the whereabouts of two ancient tomes─the Books of Nald'thal.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The tomes are said to contain the secrets of forbidden spells, and their existence has been hidden from even the Thaumaturges' Guild. Master Ququruka entrusted you with his legacy, Forename─he would want the tomes to be in your keeping.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The first tome is said to be at Nald's Reflection, in southern Thanalan. Come, let us make haste and retrieve it!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The first tome is said to be at Nald's Reflection, in southern Thanalan. Come, let us make haste and retrieve it!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I have found the first tome, Forename─the Book of Nald! It lay not a fulm from where the parchment said it would be.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But gods...I cannot stop trembling... My blood runs cold simply imagining the havoc that could be wreaked with the knowledge within...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Such power must be safeguarded lest it fall into the wrong hands. Let us make haste and retrieve its twin─the Book of Thal. It should be at Thal's Respite.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, the unthinkable has happened!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The chest is empty! The Book of Thal is gone!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Who could have taken it? Who else could have known?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Gods, if the tome's secrets were to be used for evil... This is an absolute disaster!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: And my worries do not end there. Should the Thaumaturges' Guild somehow learn of the tomes' existence, they will stop at nothing to seal them away. That cannot be borne.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Master Ququruka spent his lifetime restoring the knowledge of black magic to the world. We cannot suffer any part of it to be lost.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: At any rate, there is nothing more to be done here. Let us return to the Sacrarium and reassess the situation.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: (-Robed Figure-)There is nothing left for me here.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I am sorry you had to see me lose my composure earlier, Forename.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: As I made my way back, I pondered the situation. When I found the chest, it was covered in a century's worth of dust. Some of that dust had been knocked loose by prying hands, and nothing had settled in its place.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: From this, it can be inferred that the tome was taken recently.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Now, the tome we were able to retrieve─the Book of Nald─is enciphered by an enchantment. I think it is safe to assume that its twin benefits from like protection.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Such a protection will not be easily circumvented. It will take the thief time─time enough, I hope, for us to track him down, retrieve the tome, and avert disaster.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But enough talk. I shall make some discreet inquiries into the missing tome. Oh, and if you do not mind, I would like to hold on to the Book of Nald for examination. In the meantime, I suggest you continue your training in the dark arts. We may have need of your skills again ere long.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 破壊を憎む者
journal: Lalai has acquired new information regarding the missing Book of Thal.

Evidence suggests that whoever stole the Book of Thal means to avail himself of the secrets within, leading Lalai to conclude that the thief is a black mage. She speculates that the individual may have attempted to make contact with other black mages, namely your three beastman friends. Proceed to Burgundy Falls in eastern Thanalan and ask Kazagg Chah whether he has had any unusual guests of late.

Kazagg Chah tells you that he was very recently attacked by a robed man who wielded black magic. Could this be the individual you seek? According to the Amalj'aa, the attacker will not have gotten far. Search for him in the surrounding area.
You have found a robed man, but he vehemently denies being the one who attacked Kazagg Chah. He suggests that you both pay the Amalj'aa a visit in order to clear up the matter.

A glance is enough for Kazagg Chah to confirm that the robed man is not his assailant. Introducing himself as Zhai'a Nelhah, a Hearer of Gridania, he informs you that the Seedseer Council has sent him to find a certain black mage. Upon hearing of the Book of Thal, Zhai'a Nelhah believes that he may learn something useful from Lalai, and decides to pay her a visit. Return to Milvaneth Sacrarium in Ul'dah and be present for the meeting.

In fretful tones, Zhai'a Nelhah explains that the man he is hunting, Waldeve, leads a cult of nefarious black mages. Waldeve was once a conjurer of Stillglade Fane, but he forsook the art of healing in order to sate his hunger for power. It seems clear that he is the thief who stole the Book of Thal, and with it seeks to unleash unspeakable destruction. Though their ideologies are completely at odds, in order to avert disaster, Zhai'a Nelhah and Lalai resign themselves to working with one another. After the Hearer takes his leave, Lalai teaches you a new spell─Ley Lines─which she deciphered from the Book of Nald. She bids you apply yourself to mastering the spell, and promises to let you know if there are any developments.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls.
Find the robed man.
Speak with Kazagg Chah.
Speak with Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you come at a most opportune time. There is a task I would have you perform.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: In my search for the Book of Thal, I have drawn upon all my resources in the trading spheres. The tome has not appeared on the black market, nor has it found its way to a private collection.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: This tells us that the thief has made no effort to sell it. If we consider, then, the fact that he was able to open a magically sealed chest, we may safely assume that the suspect is a mage, and his interest in the tome is personal.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: However this individual came to know the existence of black magic, it seems plain he seeks to unlock the tome's secrets. To what end, it is too early to say, but at the very least we now have a lead.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: There are scarce few who share our knowledge of black magic: your three beastman friends who were present when Master Ququruka rendered up his last breath. It may be that the thief's identity is known to one of them.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Begin your inquiries at Burgundy Falls, Forename. Find out if Kazagg Chah has had any suspicious visitors of late.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It may be that one of your three beastman friends knows something of the thief. Begin your inquiries at Burgundy Falls, Forename. Find out if Kazagg Chah has had any suspicious visitors of late.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Forename. I am glad to see you again, my friend. What brings you here this day?

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: That such tomes should exist... But to answer your question, aye, I have been visited by a suspicious man, and very recently. Though “visited” fails to capture the nature of our meeting.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Not a bell ago, a robed man appeared before me. “Join me,” he said, “and together we shall master the dark arts!” A dubious offer, which I naturally declined. But no sooner had the words left my mouth than he unleashed a barrage of spells at me!

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Though I could scarce believe it, I would swear that the spells he wielded were black magic.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I warded off his attacks and countered with spells of my own, and he swiftly turned tail. All this happened but a short while ago. He cannot have gone far since then.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: If you mean to confront him, you would do well to exercise caution. Though he alone approached me, I felt the presence of others.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The robed man who attacked me is like to be nearby still. If you mean to confront him, you would do well to exercise caution. He is not alone.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Hm? What do you want? ...Wait. This aura.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Yes, there is no mistake! You are a black mage, and you will lead me to him! Now, speak...or I will make you wish you had!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How will you respond?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: But aren't you a black mage?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I have no idea who you're talking about.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Me? A black mage? How utterly ridiculous! Hmmm, perhaps you're not one of them, after all...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Hmmm, your confusion seems genuine. Perhaps you truly do not know...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I fear there has been a misunderstanding. I am not the villain who attacked the Amalj'aa, nor does it appear you are in league with him.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I see you are disinclined to believe me. Well, the truth of my words is easily verified. Let us go to Burgundy Falls and see your friend together. I wished to have words with him at any rate.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Let us go to Burgundy Falls and see your friend together. He will be able to attest the truth of my words.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
