dialogue.text: There is a misunderstanding that I wish to clear up. We meet for the first time, and that fact alone should suffice to settle the matter, but for the sake of formality, pray answer this question: am I the man who attacked you?

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: No, you are not. You bear scant resemblance to the villain.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Now that the matter is behind us, allow me to introduce myself. I am Hearer Zhai'a Nelhah, of the Conjurers' Guild in Gridania.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The Seedseer Council has sent me to find a man who wields black magic, the forbidden art of destruction.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: His trail led me to this area, where I chanced to witness him attacking your Amalj'aa friend. Alas, the villain beat a hasty retreat, and I lost sight of him in the confusion. You approached me shortly thereafter.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You may not be connected to the man I seek, but you are a practitioner of the dark arts nonetheless. The aura is telltale, so don't even think to deny it. You must also answer to justice.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The Books of Nald'thal? Matron preserve... I was not aware that such terrible tomes existed...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: This woman, Lalai─she may well know something useful. I will pay her a visit...and I expect you to be there as well.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I take it you intend to continue searching for the mystery black mage. Though I doubt that his skill is a match for yours, he has proven himself unpredictable and dangerous both. Be sure to keep your wits about you.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I shall go to Da Za and Dozol Meloc and apprise them of the situation. For now, you would do well to return to Lalai.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I will apprise Da Za and Dozol Meloc of the situation. Pray return to Lalai.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: By the gods... It's as if she has no ears to listen...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Thank Thal you have returned! This man, whom I have never seen before, charged up here and started berating me for meddling with forbidden arts! He had the nerve to call me a fool─thrice!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Aye, and I will say it again: you are a fool! But the worst fool of all was your master Ququruka!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: It is because of him that these miscreants are running rampant!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: <sigh> Let me start again. I know about the Book of Thal...and I know the people who took it. They call themselves the “Defiant,” and their sole objective is to master the art of destruction.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The man I have been tasked with finding is their leader. Waldeve is his name...and he used to be a conjurer of Stillglade Fane.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The man harbored a deep hunger for power─the power over those he had sworn to protect. In order to satisfy this craving, he began dabbling in the dark arts.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Before long, however, his doings were made known to the guild, who summarily banished him. But as he left, he declared that, one day, he will show the world the true power of black magic.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: For years, we heard naught of Waldeve. Some of us dared to hope that his words were but wind. Alas, he has returned, and this could only mean one thing: he is ready to make good on his promise.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Gods preserve... A-Are you certain of this? That it is Waldeve who has taken the tome?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I am afraid so. It is no coincidence that the tome went missing at the same juncture the man reappeared. Even now, he continues instructing his minions in black magic, and every day that passes sees the cult grow into a bigger threat. If we are to move against them, we must do so now.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I had assumed that we were dealing with a lone mage. But if it is an entire cult as you say, I will need to reconsider my plans.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, while you went about your investigation, I succeeded in deciphering a new spell in the Book of Nald. It should prove useful in the battles to come. I shall teach it to you forthwith!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: What!? You mean to fight destruction with more destruction!? This can only end in tragedy, I tell you!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Listen to me, Hearer! Waldeve and his cult may be a menace to the realm, but Forename is nothing like them. Master Ququruka himself entrusted herhim with his legacy. SheHe will not misuse herhis power and cause carnage─on that you have my word.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I cannot believe what I am hearing... Were the situation not so dire, I would bring you to justice without a moment's hesitation!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Fortunately for you, a greater threat looms over us all, and we must cooperate if disaster is to be averted. Your connections have proven useful before, and they may do so again. If you learn aught through them, I will thank you to send me word, but know that I'll not tolerate any interference in my investigation!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Gods! What an irksome, ignorant, insufferable idiot! To think that we must cooperate with him!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Heed not the mutterings of that stuck-up lout. We shall prepare for the gathering storm in our own way.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Now, where were we? Ah, yes, the new spell. Ley Lines, it is called, and it will be a potent addition to your arsenal. While you go about mastering it, I will make further inquiries on the situation at hand. If there are any developments, you will be the first to know.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 54.

quest.name: もたらされる破壊
journal: Lalai has received an unexpected letter.

Lalai has received a letter from 269th Order Mendicant Da Za. Though somewhat scarce of detail, the letter requests that you meet him at Bronze Lake. The timing of this unsolicited correspondence strongly suggests that Waldeve may be involved. Travel to Bronze Lake and ask Da Za what prompted this sudden communication while Lalai reluctantly informs Zhai'a Nelhah of this development.

You find Da Za at Bronze Lake. He explains that he was indeed approached by Waldeve. The man spoke of the Defiant and asked Da Za to share his knowledge of black magic. The wily kobold asked for time to reconsider, arranging another meeting and an opportunity to ambush the dangerous man with your assistance. Travel to the meeting point at the northeast of Bronze Lake and lie in hiding nearby while Da Za waits for Waldeve.

Before long, the leader of the Defiant, Waldeve, arrives. He seems to have recently come into ownership of an ancient tome left by Ququruka─no doubt the Book of Thal. Unfortunately, Da Za's cunning plan for capturing the renegade black mage failed to account for the possibility of the man simply walking away. Waldeve may be gone, but his cultists remain. They know of the secrets passed down to Da Za from his ancestor, and Ququruka's friend, Da Gu, and they plan to extract these secrets from him...by any means necessary. Intervene before the outnumbered kobold is overpowered.
The battle with the Defiant mages is vicious and short. There are no survivors. Assist Da Za and confirm that he is unharmed.

Da Za thanks you for your help, expressing his awe at the raw destructive power you brought to bear on his assailants. Zhai'a Nelhah, having heard of Da Za's letter from Lalai, arrives in time to witness only the aftermath of your fight. He is utterly incensed that you have left not a single cultist alive. Furious that this promising opportunity to question Waldeve's men has been squandered, he storms away to speak with Lalai. Return to Milvaneth Sacrarium and attempt to spare her from the Miqo'te's fury.

Zhai'a Nelhah confronts Lalai with the chilling parallels between your battle with the Defiant and the War of the Magi so many years ago. Though Lalai sympathizes with his concerns, she points out that it was not just black magic that brought about the Sixth Umbral Calamity─white magic, too, was involved. In any case, she doubts Zhai'a's claims that you were not in full control of your powers, and proves as much by entrusting you with even more powerful magicks that she gleaned from the Book of Nald in your absence.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with 269th Order Mendicant Da Za.
Lie in wait at the specified location.
Slay the Defiant mages.
Aid Da Za.
Report to Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, I have received a letter from 269th Order Mendicant Da Za!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The moogles' reach extends further than I had realized. But that Da Za would contact us suggests that something is very much amiss.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “I wait at Bronze Lake,” it says, and no more than that. Though perhaps somewhat cryptic, the letter's brevity suggests a sense of urgency.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Please hurry to Bronze Lake and investigate the situation! I shall inform Zhai'a Nelhah of this development. Though I doubt the fool can render much assistance, I gave my word that we would cooperate.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Please hurry to Bronze Lake and meet with Da Za. I shall inform Zhai'a Nelhah of the letter.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Forename! I am glad to see you─pleased, happy, glad.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Kazagg Chah has told me what happened. This is grim news. Yes, yes, grim news indeed.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: The man Kazagg Chah spoke of approached me, too. Spoke of the Defiant. Said he wanted my knowledge─wisdom, insight, knowledge.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I told him I needed time to think─consider, ponder, think. I told him to return later. When he returns, we shall ambush him! Yes, yes, a sound plan, I think.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I told him to meet me northeast of Bronze Lake. I shall approach as normal─as bait. Forename, you lie in wait─ambush, hiding, wait.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: You! Are you the leader of the Defiant?

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: My name is Waldeve. And you─you are descended from 1st Order Patriarch Da Gu, yes?

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Da Gu was my ancestor─progenitor, forebear, ancestor... You know him?

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: I've had opportunity to peruse a fascinating tome left by Ququruka. In it, Da Gu is mentioned as a confidant who assisted the master in his studies of the dark arts.

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: It also states that Ququruka intended to entrust the secrets of his research to those same confidants. I fully expect you to tell me all about these secrets.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Then you are wrong─mistaken, incorrect, wrong! I shall reveal nothing to the likes of you!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: Hmph. I'm a busy man, Da Za. If you refuse to cooperate, I simply don't have time for you.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Wait! Where are you going!?

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: You might have made a powerful ally...but as an enemy, you cannot be suffered to live.

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: Find out everything he knows. Then kill him.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename! Those Defiant didn't stand a chance! No, no, no chance at all!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: But Waldeve got away─fled, escaped, got away.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Forename! Lalai relayed to me what happened.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: These men... Were they Defiant mages?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You fool! You've killed every last one of them! How do you intend for us to question them now!?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I knew this would happen. You black mages are quick to wield your destructive powers, but rarely do you consider the consequences.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: We must return to Lalai. Do not think that I'll forget about what you have done here.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Were you not in full control of your powers? Did your magicks run wild─amok, untamed, wild?

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Whatever the case, I do know that you saved me─rescued, protected, saved.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. I owe you my life.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: You should hurry to Ul'dah. Much as you protected me from the Defiant, I suspect Lalai may benefit from protection from that Miqo'te. Yes, yes, hurry to Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Hurry back to Ul'dah, Forename. Stop Lalai and the Miqo'te from fighting─quarreling, bickering, fighting.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Hmph. You're finally here.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, Zhai'a Nelhah has been standing there, silently fuming, for quite some time now. What has transpired?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: So it was indeed Waldeve that stole the Book of Thal. And he has been studying the magicks inscribed within.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But did truly not a single Defiant survive? I somehow doubt that you are fully responsible for─

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I care not for your doubts! I explicitly told you not to interfere in my investigation!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: If nothing else, this shows the bloody outcome of a battle between opposing black mages.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Fighting destructive power with more destructive power... It's such thinking that led to the War of the Magi. I'm sure I needn't remind you of the outcome of that war.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I strongly recommend you give some thought to just how terrible a force you toy with.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The War of the Magi... I suppose I cannot blame him for seeing the parallels. A war between forces commanding unimaginably destructive magical power. But black magic is not purely to blame. It was the violent confluence of black and white magic that ultimately led to disaster.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It brought about the Sixth Umbral Calamity. It is only natural that the risk of a reoccurrence of those terrible events would instill great fear.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I know you would never be so reckless as to allow something like that to happen.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The problem lies not with black magic, but with the Defiant. I am disinclined to pay heed to Zhai'a Nelhah's words when they run counter to those of Da Za, who witnessed the battle firsthand.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I find it hard to believe that you would lose control of your powers. There must be some other explanation for the deaths of those mages...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It also seems that Waldeve is gathering something of a following. To better oppose this growing menace, I shall teach you a new spell I recently deciphered from the Book of Nald.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Remember, Forename, black magic is not a thing to be feared. As a true black mage, you have the power to control it. I believe in you.

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ
メンディカント269 ダ・ザ

quest.name: 強き破壊が生む惨劇
journal: Lalai has received another letter.

Lalai tells you of a letter she received from Dozol Meloc. He is hiding from someone at Alder Springs, and asks urgently for your assistance. It is clear that, as was the case with Da Za, this is the work of the Defiant. Travel to Alder Springs and stop them before anything happens to Dozol Meloc. Lalai will inform Zhai'a Nelhah of the letter.
You find Dozol Meloc surrounded by Defiant mages ready to attack. You intervene and they soon fall to your dark magicks. Assist the Ixali mage and confirm that he is unharmed.

You have successfully defended Dozol Meloc from the Defiant mages. As he is thanking you for your help, Zhai'a Nelhah arrives. He once again berates you for slaying every last attacker─again leaving not one alive to be questioned─before realizing that they appear to have been burned alive from the inside. Dozol Meloc suggests that, without the Gem of Shatotto to control their dark magicks, the very aether within their bodies ignited when they resorted to their most powerful spells. Zhai'a Nelhah offers his apologies for blaming you for the previous deaths before leaving. Dozol Meloc is safe and the Defiant mages have been defeated. Return to Ul'dah and report to Lalai.

You tell Lalai what happened. She points out that the Defiant's inability to utilize their powers without dying horrible, fiery deaths probably hinders their ability to recruit new members. This explains the desperation with which they approached your beastman allies. Although you have no information to assist in locating Waldeve and his cult, they are in no position to stay in hiding. Frantic for answers, they will soon be forced to reveal themselves. You need simply wait for that moment.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Search Alder Springs for Dozol Meloc.
Aid Dozol Meloc.
Report to Lalai.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename! I've received another letter!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text:
“Danjer! Pleez Help! Me Hide In Alder Springs
Tell Forename!

─ DOZOL”

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: That's all it says... The handwriting is barely legible.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It doubtless goes without saying, but Dozol Meloc is in need of our help.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I shall have to tell Zhai'a Nelhah about this. Do not dwell on his previous outburst. I know you have full control of your powers.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Use this opportunity to show that man the true cunning and finesse that a black mage can bring to the fight!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Enough talk. Hurry to Alder Springs and save Dozol Meloc!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, why are you still here!? Dozol Meloc is clearly in danger! Hurry to Alder Springs and save him!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename! Save Dozol's life, you have! Kazagg Chah tried to warn Dozol. Dozol panicked, tried to flee. But get caught, Dozol did! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Somehow knew that Dozol was exiled from tribe, these mages did. So into the forest, they chased Dozol! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Finally, they surrounded Dozol. Offered friendship at first...but rejected, Dozol did. They said if Dozol is not friend, then Dozol enemy... But save Dozol, you did. Many thanks.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Gods! I was too late again! You've already cut your swath of reckless destruction.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: What did you plan to achieve? How many more lives must you end before you realize how fruitless this is?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Wait... These wounds...they're unlike anything I've ever seen. It looks like they were incinerated from the inside.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Forename, was this perhaps not your doing, after all?

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Of what does this man speak? Pursued Dozol for a long time, these men did. Tried to kill Dozol! Squaaawk! Explain! Who are they? What did they want!?

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Dozol understands now! Squaaawk! Read the Book of Thal, they did. Learned of mother of mother of mother of Dozol, learned of her secrets─Dozol's secrets. Made clear, their pursuit is!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: But these wounds... Perhaps Dozol has an explanation. These men did not have the Gem of Shatotto! Squaaawk! Dozol thinks that is why they died.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Gem of Shatotto? Whatever are you talking about?

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Gem is proof that Forename is true black mage.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Gem brims with magical power. Without the Gem of Shatotto, impossible to control, the most powerful black magic is! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Lost control, these mages did. Aether within their own bodies ignited! Burned alive from the inside. Painful way to die, it is.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: So these Defiant mages fell victim to their own arrogance─using dark magicks that far outstripped their ability to control them. So Forename isn't at fault...

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: The answers you seek, Dozol hopes you find. But Dozol cannot stay here. Dozol must leave. Thank you, Forename. Dozol owes you debt of life. Squaaawk! One day, Dozol will repay!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: So these men were slain not by your hand, but by their own use of powers they couldn't control.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: But please understand that the fact that you can control your powers does nothing to resolve the issue at hand.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You should return to Lalai and explain to her what happened here. Please accept my apologies for my earlier accusations.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename! Was Dozol Meloc unharmed?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Hmmm, I see... Well, if nothing else, it seems that Zhai'a Nelhah no longer doubts your innocence.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But...the Defiant were immolated from within? If Dozol Meloc's conjecture is accurate, the cult's situation becomes quite clear! But I hardly need to explain that to you, do I?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How will you answer?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ah, so you have noticed, too.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: But if you were to explain it to me...?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But I still cannot condone Zhai'a Nelhah's attitude. I have struggled ceaselessly through my studies of the dark arts myself with what little power I have. Perhaps none can understand the Defiant's motivations better than I...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I suppose for one to whom these powers come as second nature, some things are not so easily noticed.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The Defiant's numbers cannot continue to grow indefinitely. They will have difficulty swelling their ranks when they cannot use their powers without the risk of a horrifying death by immolation.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Thus they strive for control over the dark arts, while showing themselves only to our beastman friends in the hope that they might reveal the secrets to controlling these magicks.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Fortunately, we have prevented them from learning anything. With these avenues now lost to him, Waldeve must realize that he is running out of options.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Though we may lack leads from which to track down the Defiant, their position becomes weaker the longer they wait. They will soon be forced to take action.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: There is no need to rush─we need simply wait the enemy out.

quest.name: 正義のために破壊を
journal: Lalai has received an unexpected request.
Zhai'a Nelhah has contacted Lalai, requesting your assistance in the investigation into the Defiant. Speak with him at the Quicksand for further details.

The Conjurers' Guild had contacted the many cities of Eorzea, requesting any information that might lead to the apprehension of Waldeve and his dangerous cult. A response has finally come from the Temple Knights of Ishgard. The Defiant have been witnessed at the Holy See. Zhai'a Nelhah knows nothing of this nation and requests your assistance in following up on this sighting. Travel to the Arc of the Worthy in Ishgard and speak with the Temple Knights for more details concerning Waldeve's whereabouts.

You soon find a Temple Knight, who explains that the Defiant were recently proselytizing in the Holy See. When the Temple Knights moved to stop them, the cultists fled the city. However, the trail has not been lost. Reports now reach the capital that the Defiant have been seen at the Convictory, in the Coerthas western highlands. However, the Convictors do not share the Temple Knights' resolute steadfastness. Travel to the Convictory and stop the Defiant before they can rally these impressionable young soldiers to their cause.
There is no sign of the Defiant at the Convictory. Try asking some of the troops if they have seen any suspicious mages recently.

You question the Convictors and learn that, as best you can tell, none of them were fooled by the Defiant's promises of easy power. You also hear that the cultists have set up camp near the Swiftrun River, southeast of the Convictory. Unfortunately, it seems that Zhai'a Nelhah has heard this, too, and has headed off to confront them without you. Find him before he gets himself killed.

You find Zhai'a Nelhah in time to assist him in fending off an attack by the Defiant. He apologizes for his hypocrisy in attempting to engage the cultists alone. However, he goes on to explain that he feared the Defiant mages would lose control of their powers if forced to defend themselves against a black mage of your skill. With, once again, no Defiant survivors to question, you are left with no leads. Return to Lalai and pass on Zhai'a Nelhah's apologies.

Though you were unable to apprehend Waldeve, Lalai sees this latest development as encouraging. The fact that the Defiant were forced to travel all the way to the frozen wastelands of western Coerthas would seem to confirm that they are growing increasingly desperate. If things continue in this vein, it will not be much longer before these renegade black mages are brought to justice. And when they are, the dangerous tome of dark magicks they have stolen─the Book of Thal─can be safely secured.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with Zhai'a Nelhah at the Quicksand.
Speak with the Temple Knight near the Arc of the Worthy.
Speak with Zhai'a Nelhah at the Convictory.
Gather information about the Defiant.
Search for Zhai'a Nelhah southeast of the Convictory.
Report to Lalai.
Defeat the Defiant!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename! I just received word from Zhai'a Nelhah─he wants to speak with us!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Apparently, he has secured lodging at the Hourglass, and is awaiting us at the Quicksand. We should head there now. I wonder what he could want...?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text:
Zhai'a Nelhah is waiting for us at the Quicksand. I suppose we shouldn't keep him.
...At least, not too long...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming so quickly. Forename, I have something to ask of you.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Some time ago, the Conjurers' Guild contacted the various cities of the realm, entreating assistance in the search for─and capture of─Waldeve. It seems that this finally paid off. They just received a missive from the Temple Knights of Ishgard. The Defiant have been sighted at the Holy See!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The cult has been trying to garner popular support there. They've been offering what they claim is “the power to defeat the Dravanians” to anyone who will listen.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I hear that you have made something of a name for yourself among the High Houses of Ishgard. I, however, know next to nothing about their lands.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Now that Ishgard has opened its borders, it is no longer difficult to travel to the Holy See. However, I still know next to nothing about their lands.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Please, Forename, would you lend me your assistance in tracking down this evil cult and bringing them to justice?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Zhai'a, you have made no effort to conceal your disapproval of we black mages and our ways. Are we to understand that you have now come to accept us?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text:
...That I have.
The Temple Knights who provided us with this intelligence are stationed at the Arc of the Worthy, within the city of Ishgard. They will be waiting for us there.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Much though I would like to believe that he has had a change of heart, men are not wont to change so simply. One does not live one's whole life hating black magic, only to change one's mind over the exoneration of a single mage.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I know not what this man is plotting, but I suggest you keep a close eye on him.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You won't get away this time, Waldeve!

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01682
dialogue.text: You must be the investigators from Gridania. It's about time! Someone needs to do something about that blasphemous cult.

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01682
dialogue.text: They were ranting on and on to anyone who would listen, offering the power to defeat the Dravanians. We Ishgardians have our own way of fighting─we told them as much quite plainly. But it made no difference; they continued their proselytizing.

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01682
dialogue.text: Obviously such blasphemy could not be allowed to stand. We Temple Knights made our move, but they managed to get away. It hardly mattered to us at the time─they were no longer spreading their lies here─but they recently reappeared, this time at the Convictory in the western highlands.

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01682
dialogue.text: Most Convictors would do anything to earn honor and glory through the slaying of a powerful dragon. They are young and full of spirit...and naive. I fear that some among them may be deceived, seduced by promises of easy power.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Hmph. Gullible fools... Well, our destination is clear. To the Convictory!

dialogue.name: TEMPLEKNIGHT01682
dialogue.text: The cultists you seek have been sighted at the Convictory, in the Coerthas western highlands.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Hmmm. There is no obvious sign of the Defiant here... We should split up and question the soldiers.

dialogue.name: DRGONHUNTERA01682
dialogue.text: Those crazy mages? I've spent years studying the art of dragonslaying─I don't need some magical help from weird outsiders. I made sure to tell them as much.

dialogue.name: DRGONHUNTERB01682
dialogue.text: I think I know who you're talking about. I told them I wasn't interested. Ancient spells are no match for a good spear at your side!

dialogue.name: DRGONHUNTERC01682
dialogue.text: You're goin' on about the Defiant, too? Well, they spent a while shoutin' about how they'd share ultimate power with any who'd join 'em... Then they left.

dialogue.name: DRGONHUNTERC01682
dialogue.text: Apparently, they've set up camp o'er near the Swiftrun River. What's the story with that lot anyway? Some Miqo'te chap was askin' the same thing a few minutes ago. I told him what I told you an' he ran off in a right hurry!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Ungh... I know what you must be thinking... I entreated your help only to run off on my own.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: But you know what happens when you get involved. You saw it happen just now. They've no choice but to fight back with all their strength. And when they do so, they lose control of their power, and they...they burn.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Nobody deserves to die like that. So I went to confront them alone.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I am a fool! My healing magic is no match for the destructive power they wield.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We can work together.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It was foolish to go alone.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You're right. What did I expect to achieve, challenging them without any help at all?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Had we fought together, things would have turned out differently. You, taking down the mages in a flash of black magic; me, nullifying their every attack with my healing spells...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I truly was a fool to assume all black magic was evil. I should have seen that such power can be harnessed safely─just as it is by you.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I apologize. We have lost our only lead, and this time it is clearly my fault.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Please pass on my apologies to Lalai. My actions were unbefitting of a representative of the Seedseer Council. I shall take my leave. I need to reflect on my actions.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah! You're back from Ishgard already! But where is Zhai'a Nelhah?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I see. If nothing else, you have stopped more poor souls from joining that accursed cult. I can only hope that Zhai'a Nelhah can see it that way.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The fact that the Defiant would travel so far as Ishgard in an attempt to recruit new members speaks volumes to how desperate they grow...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah! Forename! I almost forgot. I was able to decipher the final remaining spell from the Book of Nald. Though you might not welcome an ice magick after the frigid wind of Coerthas, I'm certain you'll find this a frighteningly powerful addition to your repertoire.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I doubt the Defiant can hold out much longer. They will be forced to use everything they have in the next fight─they cannot risk being drawn into a protracted war of attrition. Should we defeat them, we can finally recover the Book of Thal─and uncover the magicks within!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 60.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We can't let them get away! Forename, stop them!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Watch out! There's more of them!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: They're attempting to summon something! Seal the planar fissures!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: There's yet more of them! Beware the voidsent!

obj.n: 聖フィネア連隊の弓兵
聖フィネア連隊の騎兵
聖フィネア連隊の槍兵

quest.name: 破壊と癒し
journal: Lalai has learned the location of the Defiant's hidden base.

Lalai was recently approached by Zhai'a Nelhah, who announced that he had discovered the Defiant's base of operations before departing in a rush. It seems that the cultists lurk at the Burning Wall in eastern Thanalan. Hurry there with Lalai and meet with Zhai'a Nelhah before he attempts to confront them himself.

You rendezvous with Lalai, but see no sign of Zhai'a Nelhah. Lalai fears that he attacked the Defiant alone. It makes no difference. You have no choice but to descend the Burning Wall and search for Waldeve.

In the deepest depths of the Burning Wall, you encounter Waldeve. In defiance and desperation, he calls forth a great horror from the beyond. Knowing that his powers alone are insufficient─and despite Lalai's warnings of the inherent danger─he plans to control this monstrous voidsent such that all will fall in worship of him. Before he can enact his ghastly plot, Zhai'a Nelhah appears...and with reinforcements! Kazagg Chah, Dozol Meloc, and 269th Order Mendicant Da Za arrive to lend their strength, wisdom, and support. Waldeve's plan fails when, as predicted by Lalai, the voidsent turns on him, defeating him in an instant. This unspeakable, dangerous beast cannot be allowed to escape the Burning Wall. Slay it.

With the threat of the voidsent resolved, Zhai'a Nelhah steps forward to heal the grievous and brutal wounds that it inflicted upon Waldeve. The criminal is taken away into custody by Zhai'a Nelhah, who asks you to wait for him at Milvaneth Sacrarium, where he intends to thank you formally for your assistance in his investigation. Confer with Lalai.

Lalai decides to return to Ul'dah immediately. She suggests you do the same, but not before you speak with Kazagg Chah, Dozol Meloc, and 269th Order Mendicant Da Za, who assisted you in the battle. This is a valuable opportunity to renew your friendship with these powerful allies.
You thank the beastmen for their support. The bond you share with these noble magi will not be easily broken. Lalai still waits for you at Milvaneth Sacrarium. Return there and speak with her.

With Waldeve under arrest and awaiting sentencing by the Padjals, Zhai'a Nelhah returns to Milvaneth Sacrarium to give you his thanks for your assistance and the Book of Thal, which he recovered from Waldeve. Your actions in the recent battles with the Defiant have shown Zhai'a Nelhah the value of black magic when wielded with wisdom and prudence, and in aid of a noble goal. He hopes that, by entrusting the tome to Lalai's care, he can one day see an age of cooperation between healing and destructive magic.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with Lalai at the Burning Wall.
Speak with Lalai.
Speak with Kazagg Chah.
Speak with Dozol Meloc.
Speak with 269th Order Mendicant Da Za.
Report to Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename, your timing is impeccable! Just moments ago, Zhai'a Nelhah approached me.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: He ran up to me, all fuss and flurry, and told me he had found the Defiant's base of operations! He then departed before I could respond!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It seems that he is headed to that base himself. Though the Defiant's forces may well be weakened, it's utterly reckless to approach them alone. It's as though he has learned naught from the incident at Ishgard!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: We should waste no time in traveling to the Defiant's den. Before he left, Zhai'a Nelhah mentioned that it was at the Burning Wall. I shall meet you there.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Zhai'a Nelhah is in great danger. We must travel to the Burning Wall immediately!

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: No, I have seen no sign of Zhai'a Nelhah... But to think that the Defiant lurked so close! I shall prepare for battle and join you posthaste.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Zhai'a Nelhah is nowhere to be seen. I fear he may have already fallen victim to the Defiant's destructive magicks.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: We have no choice but to press on. If Zhai'a Nelhah's intelligence was accurate, then Waldeve must be further down this road. Are you ready?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Waldeve! Give yourself up! Your followers lay defeated. You have nowhere left to run!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: Hmph. There is no need for me to run.

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: Mwahahaha! The summoning ritual is complete! All shall congregate in worship of my might!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: I may not be powerful enough to rule this world alone, but with this voidsent under my control, followers will flock from across the realm to kneel before me!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: That voidgate... It's colossal! Whatever could he mean to summon!?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Waldeve, stop! Whatever comes through that portal, you'll never be able to control it!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: Barghest! I summon thee! Present thyself and be bound to my will!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: MwahahahaHAHAHAHAHA! Perhaps it's now you who should run. Do you really think that the two of you can defeat me alone!?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: (-???-)They are not alone!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Your evil plans end here, Waldeve!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Zhai'a! Where were you!?

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Fool of a mage! You are lost to reason and shall be shown no mercy!

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Prepare yourself! Squaaawk! Here, we are! And at an end, your schemes are! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Forename! We are here to help─aid, assist, help!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Forename! Lalai! Forgive my late arrival! I hope I am not too late to make a difference!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: No. You are inconsequential.

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: Barghest! Don't just stand there─destroy them!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: No! NO! Not me! Them! Noooooo...!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: A sorry end... Defeated by the very creature he summoned.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It ought come as no surprise. He was playing with forces far beyond his reckoning.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: We can discuss it later. First let's deal with this voidsent!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: You could not have arrived at a better time. We thought you were lost to us!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Hmph. Did you think I had rushed in alone? What manner of a fool do you take me for, to think that I would repeat so grave an error?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: For a moment there, I thought he might strike him!

dialogue.name: WALDEVE
dialogue.text: But...but why?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You are responsible for a great many deaths, and I have been tasked with bringing you to justice. I need you alive so that you may atone for your sins.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Forename, Lalai. I owe you my thanks.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: First, I must see to Waldeve's incarceration. But once that is done, I shall return to Milvaneth Sacrarium and thank you properly.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: We, too, should return to Milvaneth Sacrarium. I'd hate to miss something as rare as a “thank you” from Zhai'a Nelhah!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But first, you should speak with our beastman companions. This is a valuable opportunity to rekindle our relations with them─it would be folly to waste it.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The battle was well fought, Forename, well fought. But where do you rush to? Did Lalai not have more to say at the wall?

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: It is well the man was brought to justice. I harbor no regrets.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Forename, my friend. Though we may be of different lands, the bond we share cannot be broken. I hope we can all meet again.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! All killed, the evil black mages are! Done here, Dozol is. Dozol's debt is now repaid.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: To all fight together again... It was a hard fight, but fun─enjoyable, satisfying, fun! Until we meet again, Forename!

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: There is no sorrow in this parting. Instead, consider it a vow to one day meet again. For now, it is best you return to Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I'm sorry to have kept you waiting. Waldeve has been placed under arrest, and is awaiting sentencing by the Padjals.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Forename, thank you for all your help.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The Book of Thal was amongst his belongings. Lalai, I entrust it to your care.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Are you sure? You've made your views on black magic very clear...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Our recent battles have shown me that black magic itself is not evil. It need only be used in the right way, in pursuit of the right goals.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You have shown yourselves to be noble magi with pure intentions. I trust you to use the knowledge within this book wisely.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: That being said, I am a conjurer. Were I to witness black magic used with ill intent, I would not hesitate to take action. Even if it were you, Lalai, I would hunt you down without mercy.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Come now, Zhai'a! Can't we have any fun?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Haha... You'd do well to not forget that my order still considers your black magic forbidden.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: But if there were more magi like you... I hope this might become the first step towards a world in which both healing and destructive magicks can meet on the battlefield, not as enemies, but as allies.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the black mage quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next black mage quest will be available from Lalai.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Make your way down the Burning Wall!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Slay the barghest!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The Defiant are lying in ambush. Proceed with caution!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I shall see to healing! Unleash your destructive magicks upon the barghest!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Voidsent are emerging from the voidgate! Destroy it quickly before more arrive!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: What!? It's grown a new head! Be careful!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Another head!? Destroy it, quickly!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No! How!? Forename, finish this...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Alas! I am defeated...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Sorry...Forename...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No! Squaaawk! No!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I am beaten... Forename...the voidsent...

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ

quest.name: 3つの家宝
journal: Oboro has received a missive from Akagi.

Akagi's letter is a call to action: Princess Yuki is attempting to breach a Salthound base, and may have need of your help. Find out how you might be able to from the retainer, who is waiting near Memeroon's Trading Post in upper La Noscea.

Unsurprisingly, the princess is displeased to see you, and has little to say about your offer of assistance. Akagi, meanwhile, all too gladly explains that the Salthounds are in possession of a trading record that is passing through the black markets. Somewhere within this log, he says, there should be information on the Yatsurugi clan's stolen treasures. After this explanation, the retainer then turns to ask Yuki to use you shinobi, only to find that she has already left to infiltrate the base. Oboro quickly outlines a plan to aid her entry: use smoke bombs to distract the guards. Make your way to the designated areas, and defeat any guards attracted by your diversion.
Your role in diverting the guards' attention has succeeded. Rendezvous with Oboro and Akagi near Poor Maid's Mill to see how they have fared.

After a brief moment of panic, you turn to see that the puissant princess has already successfully infiltrated the base and returned with the prize. For better or worse, she did not notice the part you played from the shadows. Return to the dock storehouse, and consult with Oboro.

Though you failed to win over the princess, Oboro nevertheless thinks the day a success. He asks that you now devote yourself to quiet meditation, wherein you might realize new skills and strategies based upon your experiences.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Akagi at Memeroon's Trading Post.
Throw smoke bombs at the designated spots and dispatch foes.
Speak with Oboro near Poor Maid's Mill.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Akagi has summoned us, Forename. Princess Yuki is attempting to infiltrate a Salthound stronghold. He would have us “save her,” to use his words.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: He has managed to delay her near Memeroon's Trading Post. I trust you know the place. Let us away with all haste.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Your mission awaits, Forename.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: ...Yes?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I think it best that you approach Akagi.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Finally! It's not easy keepin' the princess in one place, you know!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Incredible. This is why you had me wait, Akagi? I had thought myself clear: I neither need nor want their help. Go home, shinobi.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Princess, now that we are here, surely there is no harm in telling us your plan.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Oh, we'd be happy to. It's a long story, too. Rumors have been swirlin' about your black markets, about things that sound much like our clan's stolen treasures.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: It's hard to pin down rumors like that. But we've also gotten word that some group of pirates─the hounds of salt, or some such─keep records of the black markets. I don't need to tell you how valuable those could be.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: 'Course, a certain someone is all set on slippin' in to their camp by herself. But I can't see to lettin' that─

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Ahhh! Not again! Always sneakin' off on her own like that...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Seeing as she is already gone, we cannot stop her. However, we still might lend her aid by clearing obstacles from her path.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Here, Forename─smoke bombs. You will catch the attention of the nearby watchmen if you set these off near the camp. Incapacitate them, and the princess may pass unnoticed.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Ah, a fake attack? My axe is for show, mainly, but I'll help where I can.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Very well. Akagi, go east. I will go north. We will rendezvous to the southeast of Poor Maid's Mill when done.

dialogue.name: MONSTERA01684
dialogue.text: Who goes there?

dialogue.name: MONSTERB01684
dialogue.text: Wh-What's that sound!?

dialogue.name: MONSTERC01684
dialogue.text: Intruder! We've got an intruder!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Whew... Only a diversion, you said, but it was bloody frightenin'!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: All we can do, we have done. Princess Yuki should have made it inside by now.

dialogue.name: MONSTER01684
dialogue.text: Heh...hehe... P–Put paid to the watch, but n–not the watchdogs... Wh–When they get their teeth into you lot... Ehehehe! <gurgle>

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What!? Quickly, Forename, inside the camp!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: (-Yuki-)Save yourselves the effort. The black market records are mine.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Our jade jewel is mentioned in here. The Midare Kanemitsu dagger, as well.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: It seems the former was sold, but finding the buyer should not be difficult. And the blade will be up for auction shortly.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Princess! You are safe! Did you not meet with any resistance?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Resistance? Oh, them?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You did that, Princess?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: She's not the pride of our clan for nothin'! The princess's a skilled fighter. She's tried her hand at your ninjutsu, too. Not even her instructors can keep up with her these days.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I trust you see now why I have no need of your help. I will reclaim my clan's property myself!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: <sigh> I just wish she understood what she means to our clan... Well, thank you for today. I'll have need of your help again soon─but let's keep it on the sly, eh?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Come, let us return to our haunt. You must meditate on what you have seen here, to focus your thoughts into weapons anew.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Well, the princess's trust is not yet yours, but she is safe. Were this a trial, you would have passed.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But your mind is full. Still your thoughts. Listen to what your heart says in the silence. In so doing, you will grow as a shinobi.

quest.name: 奇妙な刺客
journal: A new request from Akagi has arrived.

Akagi's missive is a tersely worded summons, asking you to come as quickly as you are able to Oschon's Embrace. Make your way there now, and learn what trouble Princess Yuki has gotten herself into this time.

Having found where her clan's jade jewel was being kept, Princess Yuki has slipped in amongst a host of enemies to retrieve it. While the daring plan seems to have paid off, she now lacks for an exit strategy. Akagi begs you to distract the guards, and Oboro fleshes out the plan by proposing that you use the noise of Raiton to draw the foes away. Strike the path leading away from Oschon's Embrace multiple times, and so secure Yuki's escape.
The foes have heard your thunder, and you hear them as they make their way toward you. Move further away from Oschon's Embrace and strike with Raiton again.
Once again, the guards hear as your thunder echoes through the hills. Make for the Salt Strand, and unleash Raiton again on the way there.
You have drawn your pursuers far from their camp, and away from Princess Yuki. Now, make your way to the Salt Strand proper, and await Oboro.

You arrive on the Salt Strand and are greeted by a man with seemingly sinister intent. From his babbling, you ascertain that he had anticipated Princess Yuki. Yet his familiarity with shinobi─Gekkai and Karasu in particular─leaves you uneasy. The man attacks, revealing that he, too, has a command of ninjutsu. You slay his underlings, and eventually force him to flee after Oboro comes to your aid. Speak now with your shinobi friend and see what he knows of your mysterious combatant.

After a moment's thought, Oboro theorizes that the man was once an imperial spy, trained in ninjutsu by Gekkai and Karasu. What he desired with the princess, however, remains a mystery. In any case, now is not the time to wonder why, but rather to see if Princess Yuki is safe. Travel to the Tempest Gate in lower La Noscea and speak with her.

Princess Yuki has escaped the clutches of her pursuers, her clan's stolen jade jewel now safely in hand. She is aware that you aided her, but seems completely ungrateful. After she takes her leave, however, Akagi says she is secretly thankful. Oboro bids you return with him to the dock storehouse.

As you might have suspected given your recent missions, Oboro once again tells you to meditate upon your experiences, that you might draw new power from within. He also leaves you with a somber warning, and bids you practice vigilance whilst a mysterious foe may lie waiting in the shadows.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with Akagi at Oschon's Embrace.
Use Raiton on the target.
Use Raiton on the next target.
Wait at the rendezvous point.
Speak with Oboro on the Salt Strand.
Speak with Yuki.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.
Defeat Redway!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Akagi has called us again, this time to Oschon's Embrace.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: His note was brief and hastily written. I do not know what the princess has done, but it is clear she needs our aid─urgently.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We must away to Her Highness's side, Forename.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I would not keep Akagi waiting. He looks to crumple from worry...

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: You! Where were you!? Here I am, worried half to death because the princess is in danger, an' I can't do a thing about it! An' you just saunter up, like...like...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, and start at the beginning. Where is the princess?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: C-Calm!? Er, right, calm. Her Highness learned who bought the clan's jewel. She's run off to take it back, an' left me behind.

dialogue.name: TOUZOKU01685
dialogue.text: Where is she!? She can't've gotten far, even with her bleedin' witchcraft or...or whatever! Come on, lads, fan out and find her!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Well, that's it in a nutshell. The guards won't rest till they catch her. An' she's stuck up there!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That she would find the jade jewel is just like her. But she clearly has no way to escape.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Well, Forename? It's your mission. What takes the greatest priority?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What takes priority?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Helping the princess.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Completing the mission.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: An answer that befits the true shinobi!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Exactly, and your mission is the princess. As a shinobi, you must now aid her.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You wish to let your actions speak for you? Very well. Our only recourse is to aid the princess.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The guards think the princess's ninjutsu is magic. We can use this ignorance to our benefit.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Let fly Raiton. They will mistake the thunder for Princess Yuki's ninjutsu.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Draw the enemy southwest─away from the princess. We will rendezvous on the Salt Strand.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Unleash the thunder of Raiton to attract the guards' attention.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The sound of footsteps echoes in the distance.

dialogue.name: TOUZOKU01685
dialogue.text: (-Enemy Guard-)That sound... It's the girl! After her!

dialogue.name: TOUZOKU01685
dialogue.text: (-Enemy Guard-)Come on! Wh-What do you mean no!? Cowards! Do you want to be the one to tell the master someone took the jewel!? Then come on!

dialogue.name: TOUZOKU01685
dialogue.text: (-Enemy Guard-)Don't let her get away! That jewel's more valuable than our lives!

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text:
(-???-)Hello, hello, Princess!
...Oh. You are unexpected. Yes, most unexpected.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)So the thunder wasn't her doing, but a shinobi's? Huh. Most curious. Where did she find coin to pay you? Or does she command your loyalty with her regal blood?

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)What I could do if royalty flowed in my veins... No matter. I'm buying a bright future with my actions today.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)The mission comes first, as they used to say. I was only paid to oversee the delivery. But what is my employer's goodwill worth, I wonder.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)...Why do you look at me like that? Your eyes are like Karasu's or Gekkai's, judging me unworthy.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)You must be from the Far East, a real shinobi with real ninjutsu─like Gekkai. You think yourself my better because of it?

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: (-???-)Don't lie to me! I can see it in your damn eyes! I will make you spit out what you know about Yuki─or I'll cut it from your corpse's stomach!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: A different breed than the other guards, that one. He knew of Karasu, of Gekkai─there should be no shinobi in this land with such knowledge.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Unless he was one of Gekkai's shadows. The imperial shinobi lost their place in Garlemald when the unit was disbanded after the man's death.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That would be cause for them to sell their blades. I imagine the demand for mercenaries with ninjutsu would be great among people with money enough to trade in Far Eastern treasures...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Pardon me, Forename, this can wait. Princess Yuki's safety is paramount. Let us join her near the Tempest Gate.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: You really saved the princess's skin! She's safe, thanks to you!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Well, she seems unruffled for her ordeal.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Yes, Akagi told me. And no, your aid was not needed. I could have escaped perfectly well without you.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: But I suppose the important thing is that the jade jewel is once again mine. All I've left to find is the Midare Kanemitsu dagger.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Don't interfere! This...this is my problem to solve, all right?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: (-Akagi-)Never know it by what she said, but she's secretly grateful. An' if she does anythin', I know where to find her brave protectors.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That you do. Shall we return, Forename?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I have made Akagi aware of that strange sellsword we met on the Salt Strand. He will be vigilant, as should you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: As for your mission, I believe the princess is warming to you─though it is difficult to tell. But at the very least, no harm has befallen her on your watch.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Now, I will leave you to your meditations. Allow them to further sharpen your mind, so you will be the blade when the time comes again to strike.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I can't lose! Your head will bring me a fine reward.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Pawns, pawns, useless pawns─the match is won when the king comes!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. I was waylaid.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Two? How unexpected. I'll just have to use what he taught me─however disagreeable the cost!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I know your face! It's the face of Gekkai's foe! You are Oboro! And that makes you Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You'd forbid my mudra of summoning, too!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I know when the tide has turned! He who fights and runs away─yes, yes!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Why do they always run? He spoke of Gekkai and Karasu, but who was he?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: For now, this victory is enough.

quest.name: 凍てついた心
journal: You notice a letter bearing Jacke's name in Oboro's hand.

Through Jacke's network of eyes and ears, he has found information on the one Yatsurugi treasure still unaccounted for: the dagger. While Oboro waits for Princess Yuki and Akagi to join him in the dock storehouse, visit the Rogues' Guild and harvest Jacke's intelligence.

Jacke has discovered that the Yatsurugi clan's dagger is to go up for auction. The sellers are a group known as the Truehounds─a band of Salthounds who never left the brine. Ostensibly, they liberated the Far Eastern treasures from an imperial vessel's hold, and, with Princess Yuki's word being the only proof otherwise, Jacke regretfully informs you the guild cannot get involved. However, he directs you to a black marketeer newly come to the guild's attention. To learn more of the Truehounds, seek out this shadowy character at the House of Sticks in lower La Noscea.
You defeat the trio of Qiqirn that appears. Now, present the sack of gil to the black marketeer.

Though a cowl covers his face, the black marketeer's voice sounds oddly familiar. However, he does away with any introductions, and jumps immediately to the heart of the matter─the Truehounds. Captained by one Rosalinde, these cutthroats have made their name and fortune on the Far Eastern seas. What they lack in numbers, they make up for by imbibing pluto before boarding their victims' vessels. Moreover, they have recently hired a mercenary known as Redway─a man trained in ninjutsu by Gekkai. The entire crew has dropped anchor in Costa del Sol. Travel there now, and spy on the fiends.

You crouch in the shadows as Captain Rosalinde and Redway converse. The so-called shinobi has gathered information on you and your allies just as you have on him and his. You also overhear the leader of the Truehounds as she lays out her plan to capture Princess Yuki by using the clan treasure as bait, and the auction as the trap. Return now to Oboro in the dock storehouse, and inform him of these dire developments.

Princess Yuki and Akagi have been waiting for you at the storehouse. Upon learning of the Truehounds' involvement, Yuki reveals that it was not only the treasures they stole from her clan, but the lives of her people as well. Though the princess had wished to fight back, her vassals forbade it, and laid down their lives in her defense. When she left her lands, she vowed that never again would she allow someone to die for her. Akagi seizes this opportunity to force her hand, and, finally, Yuki accepts your and Oboro's aid. However, she has a condition─you may not sacrifice your own life for hers. Having reached an agreement, Oboro asks that everyone wait for further news of the black market auction.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Jacke at the Rogues' Guild.
Track down the black marketeer in lower La Noscea.
Deliver the sack of gil to the black marketeer.
Spy on the Truehounds from the designated location in Costa del Sol.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename, Jacke's network has caught wind of who has been selling the Yatsurugi clan's stolen treasures. This is information that may lead us straight to the dagger.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: He has summoned us both to the guild, but could I ask you to go by yourself?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I cannot leave just now. Akagi and Princess Yuki are on their way here.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I sent a missive telling them we might have information on the bandits who robbed her. The princess desires to learn more of them, and so she has seen fit to join us.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I believe Jacke will give you a thread. Follow it, and return once you have unraveled the truth.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Jacke's network of spies is most impressive. Presently stationed in Eorzea as we are, perhaps it would not be amiss for us to set up our own...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Forename! Gods know it ain't simple to make black marketeers talk, but we tickled Mulfa Kelfa's neck with a stabber, an' he coughed up a load of information.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: The remainin' bauble─a dagger, by all accounts─is to be sold at auction, an' attendance is invitation only. The hosts are a band what go by the name o' the Truehounds.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Now, in the eyes o' the law, they're sellin' loot cloyed from imperials on an expedition to the Far East. But Garlemald don't control where yer dimber mort's from.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: It's a bene mummery, turnin' a profit under the guise of a proper company. The buyers won't ask too many questions, either─grabbled or no, treasure is treasure.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: But it's just yer princess's whid against the Truehounds'. The guild can't act on that. Not officially, anyway.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I've left the investigatin' to a...well, let's call him a black marketeer. He's a strange one─only came to the guild's attention recently. But I've never met a cove who could get information so quickly.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: The Veil was lifted by a southerly this morn─that'll put the man at the House o' Sticks. Here's a sack o' blunt. Bene luck to ye, lasslad.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Haven't forgotten, have ye? That's not yer style, lasslad. Ye'll want to be headin' to the House o' Sticks.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: You want information? Then come, render unto me what is mine.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Hm, hmmm... Yes... Yes, this seems to be everything I was promised. The back alleys are awfully profitable, eh? Now, about these Truehounds.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Most of the Salthounds crawled back to land after the Calamity. But a few refused to leave the seas, and took up again as the Truehounds. They sail under the black flag of one Captain Rosalinde.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: They boast the strength of a crew twice their size, mostly because of the pluto they take. With their muscles bolstered by the substance─and a healthy dose of natural viciousness─they have brought themselves fortune and infamy on the eastern seas.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Now, however, they've hidden their ship away on Hullbreaker Isle and made their way to Costa del Sol. Seems they fancied a cup of ale and a peek at the dancing girls.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: They won't be hard to spot if you wanted a look, but do so at your own peril. Drunken pirates might not frighten you. But Redway, their new sellsword, should.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: They say he is an ex-member of Garlean covert operations, one who has thrown himself into the study of ninjutsu.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: His pursuit has paid off handsomely...albeit at the cost of his humility. Stay vigilant, or you'll find his blade pricking your back.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Anyhow, that's all from me! Give my best to the dim one...little chick! Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: Redway, Redway, Redway. I lost me plunder. That's coin I may never get back. But you convinced me to give ye time. Make yer report worth me while, or I'll have yer head.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: There were two thieves, Captain─the Iron Orchid herself, and some servant. The latter looks to be more brawny than brave, but the princess is dangerous.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: She has two shinobi in her employ. One is a Doman jonin, Oboro. He, too, is a force to be reckoned with.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: The other is a Hyuran Elezena Lalafella Miqo'tea Roegadynan Au Raa Hrothgara Viera─Forename, if I'm not wrong. SheHe is famous in herhis own right, and dangerous.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Their involvement makes me think the princess has more coin than she lets on. These two are responsible for my master's death─their services cannot be cheap.

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: Yer master's murderers, eh? Ye wouldn't be dreamin' of avengin' Gekkai on my time now, would ye?

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Vengeance, Captain? Why? Gekkai treated me like scum, he and Karasu both. Because I wasn't from their precious little village.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: But Oboro? If I triumph over Gekkai's favorite, I triumph over the lot of them! That is my heart's desire, yes.

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: I could give a gnat's arse what ye do with the ninjas. But it's not them I want─it's the princess. Alive.

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: The way I see it, the auction's the perfect trap─baited, as it is, with the Yatsurugi dagger.

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: The Iron Orchid can't resist. Catchin' her then'll be easy an' fast─savvy, Redway?

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Of course, of course. The princess won't stand a chance with the guard doubled. No she won't.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: This better not be some ploy to worm your way into my good graces.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Clean, tidy, cozy─a bloke could get used to livin' in a place like this.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Success, Forename?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Hmmm. This Rosalinde is a clever one, spying upon us through Redway...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Princess, the foe will be watching for our tricks now. Reclaiming the last treasure will be that much harder. So I beg you─leave it to us shinobi.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I know there's sense in what you say, Oboro. But this is my problem. I alone must solve it.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I...I will not allow more people to die in my name!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: ...The Truehounds didn't just steal the treasures. My people stood in their way. And many died. Too many.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I wanted to fight. But my vassals wouldn't allow it. And as they were cut down, they called for me. Screamed my name. You can't imagine how that feels.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: My lands are so close to destruction. My people are on the brink of starvation. If I do not do something, all of their sacrifices will mean nothing.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: When I came here, I vowed that I would bring prosperity to my country by finding and selling my treasures. Alone. No one would ever die protecting me again. Not my smallfolk, nor my vassals, nor you.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: You don't want anyone to die protectin' you, Princess? What about those of us who would give our lives willingly to defend you!?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: If...if you won't trust in the shinobi, then...then I...I'll slice open my belly!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: I'm bound to you, Princess, but they're not! We've given them no coin, no gratitude, an' yet they're still helpin' us! You can trust them, you have to─or there's no takin' back the treasure!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Trust the shinobi. Or lose me, an' add one more to those who died tryin' to protect you. That'll get you to stop. Right? P-Princess!?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: ...Heh...hehehe! Akagi, you have the strangest way of... Clearly, the shinobi have left a great impression upon you.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Oboro, Forename─consider this my formal request. Help me retake our last treasure.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: But I have one condition. No matter what happens, you will not lay down your lives for mine. Call it...a duty to stay alive, if you wish.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: To stay alive, hm? An interesting notion. Shinobi are trained to put duty ahead of all else, including our lives.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That said, Forename, this is the mission that has been given you. You are duty-bound to see it through. And come what may, I know that completing it will aid in your growth as a shinobi.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Now, we wait, and watch for signs of the auction. I will approach Jacke. With the eyes and ears in his service, we will spread a web, and so catch word of the Yatsurugi clan's dagger.

quest.name: 月夜の叢雲
journal: Oboro's tense jaw indicates something is up.

The Truehounds' auction has come and gone, and the Yatsurugi clan's blade has been sold to an Ishgardian collector who paid extra to have the dagger taken directly to his home. Princess Yuki plans to attack the transit directly in order to reclaim the dagger. To make matters easier, Oboro then suggests that you swap the pirates' pluto for lavender incense, that you might use their dependence against them and send them to sleep. He proposes that the four of you split up. He and Akagi will find where the Truehounds are keeping their stores in Limsa Lominsa, while you and the princess will purchase the incense from Kyokyoroon in Hawkers' Alley. Yuki, as usual, takes off in a huff, leaving you to follow behind her with the sack of gil to pay the merchant.

Shortly after purchasing a sack of lavender incense from Kyokyoroon, Yuki receives an unpleasant surprise─a pair of her vassals from the Far East has come in search of her. The princess deftly avoids their gaze, and vanishes with Akagi. A bemused Oboro instructs you to leave the princess to him, and asks that you make your way to Fisherman's Bottom. Once there, switch the pluto for the lavender incense.
The Truehounds will now fall into a deep slumber instead of receiving their usual stimulation. Now, wait near the docks and watch to make certain the guards do not detect your ruse.

You wait and listen as two Truehounds discuss their planned route─sail to Dravania, and go on foot from there to Ishgard. As the journey is long, and their crates heavy, they plan to stop once in the Smoldering Wastes and there take their “pluto.” With all parties in agreement that this would be the ideal place to strike, make your way to the Dravanian forelands and rendezvous with Princess Yuki and Oboro.

You arrive to find that Oboro's plan worked perfectly, with several Truehounds already snoring nearby and Yuki searching through their crates. However, as she has not yet found the Midare Kanemitsu dagger, and there are yet more Truehounds in the area, she bids you join Akagi and Oboro in their own patrols. Proceed to keep a lookout to the southwest, and dispatch any enemies that may come your way.
You have made short work of the Truehound patrol. Return to where Yuki was looking and see if Oboro and Akagi have anything to report from their own search.

You find Oboro none the worse for wear after his patrol. However, Akagi was not exaggerating his lack of martial prowess, and has sustained a serious injury. The princess joins you, triumphantly announcing that the last of her clan's treasures is again hers. However, both you and Oboro feel the hair on the back of your necks stand up. You turn to see Redway standing but a few yalms away. Instead of attacking, however, the man offers an ultimatum: the princess comes with him, or her vassals who recently came to Eorzea die. Unable to refuse, the princess walks away, leaving you with a single command: tend to Akagi. Beaten, Oboro orders you all to return to the dock storehouse.

Though you have lost this battle, Oboro is intent that you not lose the war; Princess Yuki did not forbid you from mounting a rescue. Await the day when Akagi is healed, as is your duty as a shinobi, and then save the princess from Redway and Rosalinde's clutches.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Deliver the sack of gil to Kyokyoroon in Hawkers' Alley.
Switch the pluto for the sack of lavender incense near Fisherman's Bottom.
Lie in wait at the designated location.
Speak with Yuki in the Smoldering Wastes.
Keep watch at the specified location.
Speak with Oboro.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I must retake the last treasure...

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: It's a great feelin', havin' a roof over my head again!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It seems the Truehounds have already held their auction, Forename.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Some collector bought the Yatsurugi clan's dagger. However, the princess's reputation has kept him trembling at home, and he paid a small fortune to have the blade brought directly to Ishgard.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: So, we strike while it is on the move. I look forward to taking it back from the Truehounds─though there is still the question of their guard.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename, you mentioned the pirates regularly use pluto, yes? Should someone exchange this for a powerful sleep draught, such as lavender incense...

dialogue.name: YUKI
