dialogue.text: Couldn't we just face them out in the open? Or is there something in the shinobi code that forbids straightforward solutions?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Nothing so formal, Princess, but a stealthy approach best allows us to carry out your orders: stay alive, and retake the treasure.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The Truehounds base their operations in La Noscea. They will supply themselves in Limsa for the journey north─a weakness we can exploit by dividing into two groups.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Akagi and I will search for the Truehounds' supplies. Princess, you and Forename will visit Kyokyoroon in Hawkers' Alley.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I have been informed the shopkeep has lavender incense in stock.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Is this a jest? I'm perfectly capable of going shopping without Forename's help!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: <sigh> Here, Forename─the funds to purchase the incense. Good luck.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: <sigh> Never asks for anybody's help, does she?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I fear the princess will find shopping to be more of a challenge than she thinks without sufficient funding...

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Forename! You, ah... I seem to...er...

dialogue.name: KYOKYOROON
dialogue.text: Kyokyoroon puzzled by puzzling customer. She makes demanding demands, but has no shinies.

dialogue.name: KYOKYOROON
dialogue.text: Trade for incense? Kyokyoroon promise─good for good night's rest. Breathe deeply for deep, deep sleep!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Look, I just forgot my coinpurse. That's all! Anyway, you have the incense now─does it matter who paid? And where are Akagi and Oboro?

dialogue.name: KASHINA01687
dialogue.text: (-???-)What was she thinking coming all this way!? Her mother would've died of shock had she lived to read that note!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Th-That voice... N-No...! They can't... Not here!

dialogue.name: KASHINA01687
dialogue.text: How the princess doesn't realize she is our land's sole ray of light is quite beyond me. If we don't bring her home, I shudder to think what will happen!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Gods, why would they come here? I told them I'd be back. Just...after I found the treasures.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Princess! Princess Yuki! Did you─

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Shut up, you oversized oaf! We're leaving now!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Princess, what'd I do? Princess!?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I suspect I am better off not knowing. In any case, the Truehounds are storing their supplies near Fisherman's Bottom. I will follow the princess. You go and make the switch before the guards return.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Quickly, Forename, you must switch the pluto for the sleeping draught before the guards come back.

dialogue.name: ZOKUA01687
dialogue.text: Well, that's the last of it. How's it we're gettin' to Ishgard?

dialogue.name: ZOKUB01687
dialogue.text: Captain won't go within twenty yalms o' the Shroud, mate. We sail to the Dravanian hinterlands, an' hook back around west from there.

dialogue.name: ZOKUA01687
dialogue.text: <whistle> Fair bit of land between there an' the Holy See. What if we stopped off in the Smoldering Wastes? A dose of our medicine'll carry us the rest of the way, eh?

dialogue.name: ZOKUB01687
dialogue.text: Don't bleat that to the whole harbor! I've heard the thief's after this haul. That's why we're takin' twice the guards. Heh, I'd like to see her try an' take it now!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: They'll take the sleepin' draught and be out like babes! Come on, let's hurry to... Er, where was it, again?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The Smoldering Wastes. Forename, what manner of place is it? I have never visited Dravania myself.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah, thank you. The princess and I are both experienced travelers, and we will meet you there.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Forename! Oboro's plan worked!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: But not all the patrols have reported in for their pluto. They could be back at any moment.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Stand guard while I search these crates. The Midare Kanemitsu's got to be in one of them.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Take the south─Akagi's to the north, Oboro's to the east. When you've finished your own patrol, return here. They should both be back by then, as well.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: But as I said, no matter what happens, do not lay down your life for mine.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Where in the hells is it!?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: <groan>

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: I told you I'm no good in a real fight!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename, Akagi is wounded. We must tend to him once we are out of danger's path.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I found it! Haha, everyone back home will be so happy! It's over, my friends─I can finally bring prosperity to my lands. It...it will all be all right!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text:
Splendid! Then let us─
...Wait. Do you sense it, too, Forename?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The foe is near.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: You played a clever trick, Oboro, but not clever enough! No liquor or pluto ever passes these lips, and now I've found you.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: What to do, what to do? Three able and one lame could make for an interesting fight, yes. But I hold all the cards─why risk it?

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: I've come to offer the princess an invitation. Your countrymen miss you so terribly. They've called for you, cried your name ever since we caught them. Surely, you'll want to join them, yes?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What!? Princess, no!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Put up your blades. Fate played us for fools.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Redway...I'll go.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Look at me now, Gekkai! I won! I've beaten your proper Doman shinobi!

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Oh, but you'll try to rescue her, won't you? If I see anything out of the ordinary, Oboro, I will slit their throats. Yes, yes, starting with Yuki's!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: ...See to Akagi, shinobi. Farewell.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Don't just let them get away! After her, Oboro! Dammit, man, move, or I'll...argh!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Wait. Forename, you can pursue her if you wish, but you must see to Akagi's wounds. That was the princess's order.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I know we could have fought. But I understand why she chose not to. Had Redway escaped, his hostages' lives would have been forfeit─more dead in her defense.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: <sigh> The decision was hers to make. It is not our place to question it.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We can do nothing more for now. Let us return to La Noscea, and tend to Akagi there.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Akagi is distraught, but alive. I will tend to his wounds in your place.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But the moment he is better, we will mount a rescue! The princess did not forbid us from trying, and I would hate to see Redway win.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: For the moment, train your mind, practice your blade. You will need all of your skill in our next battle.

quest.name: 融雪の雨に
journal: Oboro stands deathly still, as if listening for something.

In a voice barely above a whisper, Oboro tells you the storehouse is surrounded. The blades in the shadows are no doubt loyal to Redway, waiting to attack you when you are most vulnerable. Oboro bids you give them a target, by patrolling and pretending to /doze, then striking back.
The unwanted visitors are no more. Tell Oboro as much.

Though Oboro had come up with a plan to sneak across to Hullbreaker Isle, the recent attack on the storehouse has changed his mind. If Redway has seen fit to send assassins to your hideout, no doubt unfriendly eyes watch the docks, as well. Oboro reasons the wisest course of action now is to see what opposition awaits you, and asks that you join him at the Moraby Drydocks.

Crouched on a battlement, you and Oboro look out over the harbor in dismay. There are too many guards to fight. However, your friend is not without a plan. He supposes that since it is you who is bound by duty to save Princess Yuki, he is therefore free to put himself at risk and draw Redway's attention. This will allow you to sneak across the channel in the boat Jacke has provided. Retreat to Oschon's Torch and wait for your moment.

Redway has gleefully captured Oboro, and left with his men. After pacifying an agitated Akagi, the two of you resolve to infiltrate the Truehounds' camp on Hullbreaker Isle. Speak with him at the Moraby Drydocks.
You have spoken with Akagi. Approach him again when you are ready to board the boat to Hullbreaker Isle.

Rosalinde promised the captive vassals' freedom in exchange for the treasures of the Yatsurugi clan. However, the captain goes back on her word when Princess Yuki brings them, and orders her bound and stowed with the other prisoners. Just as all hope seems lost, you appear with Akagi. Princess Yuki finally commands you to rescue her. You draw your daggers, slash Oboro's bonds, and take the fight to Redway. When the sellsword realizes he is losing, he makes to run─only to meet a gory end on Rosalinde's axe blade. After the battle continues, you finally put an end to the cutthroat captain's reaving for good. Their leader dead, the remaining Truehounds run, leaving behind all the treasures of the Yatsurugi clan. Princess Yuki offers her heartfelt thanks, and then turns excitedly to her freed vassals. With the profits from these treasures, her lands can be rebuilt. Oboro indicates it is time to take your leave. Speak with him in the dock storehouse.

Oboro congratulates you for the successful completion of your first mission. Truly, few other shinobi could have earned their master's trust as you earned Princess Yuki's. Now, he bids you meditate upon your experiences, and continue upon the path towards mastery of the art of ninjutsu.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: /doze at the designated spots and slay the intruders.
Speak with Oboro.
Speak with Oboro at the Moraby Drydocks.
Lie in wait near Oschon's Torch.
Speak with Akagi.
Speak with Akagi again.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.
Defeat the Truehounds and save Princess Yuki!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: P-Princess, I...I failed you...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Do not raise your voice, Forename. The woods are filled with hostile ears...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I have no doubt the shadows that surround us are Redway's. How he found us, I cannot say.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But why? His hostages already shield him. Does his fear so consume him that he would slit our throats while we are helpless? This is cowardice...or madness.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: His men will try to catch us unawares. I say we let them.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Go and patrol the outside. Pretend to doze off at some point. Our foes will strike. Once they do, make sure they do not live to report to Redway.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Do not worry about me, Forename. If any shadows enter here, I will ensure they do not leave.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Defeat the enemies that appear when you pretend to doze on patrol.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thank you. I sense we are free of unwanted visitors.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Akagi is on the mend. We have seen our duty through. Now, the princess awaits our rescue!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I spoke with Jacke, and he has commandeered a boat for us. The plan had been to slip across to Hullbreaker Isle from the Moraby Drydocks and find the princess...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: However, if Redway sent his cutthroats here, he will not have neglected the docks. The place is likely swarming with guards. It would be unwise to continue without reconnaissance.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: I...I'd only slow you down if I went, wouldn't I?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You have only just healed, Akagi. Princess Yuki wants to keep you safe, and you would serve her best by remaining here.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Er...all right. Forename, I'm entrustin' her life to you. Please, please bring her back safe.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What are you waiting for, Forename?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: No, really, you don't have to check up on me. I'm fine stayin' here. Too much of a coward to be of much use, anyway. Ahaha...ha...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: This is even worse than I'd imagined. There are Truehounds everywhere. We cannot risk open battle. Princess Yuki will die if even one escapes our blades...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I have a plan. But you will not like it. Tell me, Forename─do you recall what the princess ordered you to do?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What was Princess Yuki's order?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Stay alive.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Exactly.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: She ordered you to stay alive. I hope your silence is stoic, and not because you had forgotten.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You are bound to her, Forename Surname. I am not. I am an ally, and my death means nothing in the eyes of duty. But if you die without delivering the princess from danger, then as a shinobi, you have failed your mission.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You must live to save her. So...I must be the pawn, and I must be sacrificed.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Redway's eyes are on me. If I surrender, he will lower his guard, giving you the chance to sneak over to the isle.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I did say you would not like it. But it is the only way. I hope you are ready. Ahem...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I trusted you, Forename! And now, you show your true colors! Craven, I call you! You are no shinobi─you are a mistake! I should never have taught you the ways of my village! Get out of my sight!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Whew. Forgive me, Forename. I had to give them a reason to believe we parted. No matter what happens to me, you cannot interfere.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Now, the princess has only one shinobi. Watch for your chance to save her. Her fate─our fates─are in your hands.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: You slew all the sellswords I sent to find you? Perhaps I should have spent more on them and less on buying the location of your little shack. Well, a good lesson for the future.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: But really, Oboro, how could you be so stupid? You could have fled with Forename! But did you? No. You scurried back, like a child who hasn't learned to fear his father's fist!

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: I told you I'd slit the princess's throat if you came after her. I still may, if you don't comply. So, come along, or she'll die. Screaming, yes.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Bastard! Have you no honor!? Don't hide behind your hostages─fight me!

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Why should I? You and your honor have lost. Your way─the traditional way─is out. In with the new!

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Change requires sacrifice, Oboro. Your village, for example. I'll lure your elders into the open with you and lay waste to your houses. Then, I'll build the shinobi anew in my image. Simple, yes?

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Ahhh, if only that were today... Maybe I'll keep you alive to see it. Now, heel, Oboro. Your princess awaits.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Forename! Why're you skulkin' back here when your friends are in danger!?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: T-Traitor! You... Damn you, shinobi! The princess was right─I should never've trusted you! Go! Come on, get! I'll save her my own bloody self!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: What? Just a mummery!? Oboro...Oboro's put his life in danger for the princess?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Ahhh...haha! I knew that! Never doubted you, not for one second!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: I've bound my leg proper. I can run on it, an' fight on it, too! I won't win renown back home if I just let the shinobi do it all, eh? Let's take the battle to them!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend. You won't regret it! Now, to the Moraby Drydocks!

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Not a guard left. I suppose Redway's got them all keepin' watch over Oboro.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Well, Forename, it's now or never─let's get across to that island. Oboro said somethin' about a boat...

dialogue.name: KASHIN01688
dialogue.text: Princess, forgive us! We never meant to cost you the treasures!

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: Aye, that's the lot. Good to have the plunder back.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: You have what you came for, Rosalinde! Now release my people!

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: Lads, I remember seein' an empty pair o' shackles in the brig. Stow the princess belowdecks along with the others!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: What!? No! You gave me your word! You said─

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: Ye believed I'd actually barter treasures fer hostages!? Ahahaha! Ain't a reason in the realm fer me to keep that promise, child!

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Captain, I caught him! Allow me to present Oboro─the last of the princess's would-be rescuers.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: O-Oboro!? Why, why did you follow me!?

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Oboro's disciple ran away, Captain. Yes. Fled with herhis tail between herhis legs. These so-called shinobi were never a match for me.

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: And the new order will follow me, fight for my attention, and beg for my teachings! Yes, yes, yes!

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: See, Princess? I paid for Redway with cold, hard coin. And you got yerself two rat-eared ninjas...with what? Promises? Hah! Ye get what ye pay for!

dialogue.name: ROSALINDE
dialogue.text: What's this? Is the Iron Orchid wiltin'? Ye lost yer baubles, ye lost yer bodyguards, an' failed yer people! How's it feel, eh?

dialogue.name: MOB01688
dialogue.text: AAAAAAAAARGH!

dialogue.name: REDWAY
dialogue.text: Y-You! No...no, no! You're not supposed to be here! Get away! Leave!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Forename? Akagi!?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tell me, Princess─how does it feel, knowing you are not alone?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You need not despair, Princess. Here are two who still serve in your name! Please, trust to them!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: ...Save me. Forename, I order you to defeat these dogs!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You have your duty, Forename!

dialogue.name: KASHIN01688
dialogue.text: Princess! Thank the heavens you're safe!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: And what about you? Are you hurt? We can seek treatment upon returning to town.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Forename... I was lucky to have a shinobi like you in my service. For all my skill, I couldn't have done this alone. Thank you, from the bottom of my heart.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: The treasures of the Yatsurugi clan are mine. Their sale will buy tools for farming and storehouses for our grain. With hard work, our lands will prosper!

dialogue.name: KASHIN01688
dialogue.text: You have our thanks as well, shinobi. The princess is the standard we rally to, the beacon that will lead us to restoring our nation. There are not words to express our gratitude for defending her.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Well, I hope now our lands will be free of winter. May the snows melt in the spring sun and deliver us from our cold, parched lives. Come, my friends─let's go home, and rebuild!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You completed your mission, Forename, and saved a country and her people. Remember this moment, to look back upon with pride in your heart.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Well, I think we must away. The storehouse awaits, as do long meditations on today's events.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That was a promising first mission, Forename. Only one most skilled in our art could have earned Princess Yuki's trust as you did. But for now, the time for excitement has passed, and I am looking forward to quiet meditation.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Oboro! Oboro! So this is where you vanished to!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Princess? Had you not started homewards?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I had something to tell you before I left. I plan to send a formal note of thanks for the duties you performed in my name, from the Yatsurugi clan to your village.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Your people and mine both must rebuild. I thought a letter might spark a friendship. But I'm unsure of your customs─should I just address it to your village elders?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Yes, that would be perfect. The village would welcome your friendship, Princess. Thank you fo─ Wait, to the village elders?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: All right, it shall be done! Thank you, Oboro. I look forward to meeting again, Forename!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: N-No! The elders think I have stayed in Eorzea to treat to my wounds. If they find out I am running about on new missions...!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I have to catch her! Curses, why does she have to be so fast!? Princess, wait!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the ninja quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next ninja quest will be available from Oboro.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Y-You must finish this...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: P-Princess, I'm s-sorry...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename, you must win!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename, I'll take Redway. You've got to free Oboro!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Redway, I ain't payin' you to stand about! Kill them!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Unexpected, yes, but not impossible. The princess's cowardly dogs are no match for me!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You...you've forced my hand. Let it be on your head!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: His mudra of summoning! Forename, you know what needs to be done!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: N-No! I'll make you regret this! Yes! YES!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Wh-Who's the conjurer!?
Forename, stop him, quickly!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No...no, this is not worth it! My reward is not worth my life! No!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: WHAT!? Mutiny, is it!? I'll have yer head, Redway─YER HEAD!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Wha─ Arrrggghhh! AAAAAAHHH!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The lot of ye are wastes o' skin! I'll do it meself!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Why? Gods, he...he was your ally!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: May you find peace, Redway...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Rosalinde, your own shinobi... Why!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
A hired sword that can't do his job don't
deserve to be hired no more, does he?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
But you should've trusted his blade... To hells with you!
Forename, show her what true shinobi can do!

quest.name: 限界を超える跳躍
journal: Ser Alberic is mustering reinforcements for a battle.

Ser Alberic informs you that a host of dragons has been wreaking havoc within Ishgardian territory. Though the Holy See's best dragoons have been dispatched to deal with the threat, they are sorely outnumbered and are struggling to gain the upper hand. Even now, a unit is locked in a fierce struggle northwest of Whitebrim Front, and is in dire need of reinforcements. Ser Alberic means to answer the call, and bids you join him. Make haste to the location of the battle.

With your aid, the Ishgardians succeed in putting the enemy to rout. Shortly thereafter, Ser Alberic arrives in the company of another dragoon, who introduces herself as Heustienne, one of your instructors during your trials. Impressed by your distinct fighting style, she asks to be taken on as your pupil. Consider her request, and convey your decision to Ser Alberic at the Observatorium.

You have agreed to accept Heustienne as your pupil. “As we teach, so too do we learn”─with these words in mind, go forth and strive to reach new heights as a dragoon.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with the wounded dragoon northwest of Whitebrim Front.
Speak with Alberic.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Forename! You...you have not succumbed to the Eye's influence? The Fury be praised... Word had reached me of Estinien's fate, and I could not help but fear for you. I am relieved to see that my fears were unfounded.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Forename. I am pleased to see that you are in control of the dragon within. Nonetheless, I must remind you to remain vigilant at all times. It takes but a moment of weakness for the Eye to make you its thrall.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now, forgive me this abrupt change in subject, but we have urgent need of your lance. Some days ago, a horde of dragons began wreaking bloody havoc within Ishgardian territory.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: An elite regiment of dragoons has been dispatched to deal with this threat. Alas, though they fight bravely, they are sorely outnumbered, and are struggling to gain the upper hand.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Indeed, but moments before you arrived, we received a request for reinforcements from a unit engaged in battle north and west of Whitebrim.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: A fellow dragoon and I will go to their aid, and we should be grateful for your presence. Pray go on ahead─we shall follow anon.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The battle rages to the north and west of Whitebrim. Pray go on ahead─we shall follow anon.

dialogue.name: KISHI01689
dialogue.text: I owe you my life. That beast would have torn me limb from limb.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Our lances were not needed, 'twould seem. Such is the might of the Azure Dragoon.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: (-Mystery Dragoon-)You have not pledged allegiance to Ishgard, yet you came to our aid nonetheless. For that, we are grateful. Their deaths thus avenged, our comrades may go to their rest in peace.

dialogue.name: KISHI01689
dialogue.text: My lady, I shall attend to the fallen.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: (-Mystery Dragoon-)'Tis an honor to see you again, my friend. Though it appears I am not remembered? I suspect the armor is to blame...

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Permit me to introduce myself anew. I am Heustienne of the Order of the Knights Dragoon, and I had the pleasure of assisting in your training.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: As we approached, Ser Alberic and I bore witness to the final moments of the battle. I could not help but notice that, though you have been instructed in our ways, there was something distinct about the manner in which you fought.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I believe I know the reason why. As an adventurer, you have done battle with foes the realm over. Through these many encounters, your techniques have evolved to produce a style that sets you apart from we who fight dragons exclusively.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Such insights you must possess... If I may speak frankly, I wish to train under you. Will you accept me as your pupil?

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: You see, a fearsome dragon has been terrorizing Coerthas of late. Graoully is its name, and I have been charged with leading a mission to slay it.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Though I have stepped up to lead the Order in the interim, I am not confident of my chances against the creature. Such is its ferocity and cunning.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Though I am second-in-command in the Order, I am not confident of my chances against the creature. Such is its ferocity and cunning.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: If I am to triumph over Graoully, I must needs grow stronger. And I believe I can...under your tutelage. What say you? Will you consent to training me?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: As we teach, so too do we learn. This I know from experience. I wholeheartedly urge you to accept Heustienne as your pupil.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: You need not give me an answer right this moment. Think on it, and let Ser Alberic know your decision. Till next we meet.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Have you made your decision, then? Will you agree to teach Heustienne?

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I am grateful. I swear I will not disappoint you. With your guidance, I shall put an end to Graoully's reign of terror!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Now, I should like nothing more than to begin my training at once, but duty calls. For the time being, I shall endeavor to emulate the deadly lancework I witnessed you employing earlier.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Heustienne is among our very best in recent generations. If you are to train one of her caliber, you yourself must rise to new heights of mastery.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Resume your own training, and return hither when you are satisfied with your progress.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 対峙する竜騎士
journal: Heustienne is ready for her first lesson, and Ser Alberic would direct your steps to her.

Ser Alberic informs you that Heustienne is ready for her first lesson. Having offered you some words of advice, he bids you go to the western highlands of Coerthas. You will find your pupil near the Pike, testing her lancework against dragons.
You arrive to find Heustienne overwhelmed by dragons. Having dispatched the creatures and secured the area, return your attention to your pupil.

Heustienne thanks you for your timely arrival, and explains that her predicament was the result of an unsuccessful attempt to mimic your unique style. In order to avoid a recurrence, do as your pupil bids and give her a formal demonstration of your abilities. Follow her to the area west of the Black Iron Bridge, and lie in wait for dragons. When the creatures appear, strike them down with your sublime lancework.
You have demonstrated your transcendent abilities to Heustienne, who appears at once impressed and perplexed. Ask her what she thinks of your display.

Heustienne struggles to see how your lancework differs from her own. Though you are unable to answer her questions, in your earnest attempt to do so, you experience an epiphany which inspires you to create a new technique.

※The next dragoon quest is available from Heustienne to the northwest of the Black Iron Bridge.
objectives: Speak with Heustienne near the Pike.
Speak with Heustienne.
Lie in wait at the specified location and defeat any enemies that appear.
Speak with Heustienne.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. You look very much a teacher today. That is well, for Heustienne is eager for her first lesson.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now, though you agreed to accept her as your pupil, I suspect that you are not without reservation. You worry whether you will be equal to the task. Well, worry not─I have every confidence that you will make a fine mentor.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Were I to offer you advice, however, it would be to have patience. Though Heustienne is a master of her art, it is all she has ever known. As such, it may prove a challenge for her to adapt. And like all of us, she is not without pride, and there will be times when tact is required.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text:
I must also mention that Heustienne is zealous to a fault. I worry that she will overexert herself in her pursuit of strength.
...But I am keeping you from your lesson. Heustienne left word that she would be in the western highlands, testing her lance against dragon spawn. Seek her out near the Pike.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Heustienne has gone to the western highlands of Coerthas. Seek her out near the Pike.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: <pant> There are too many... L-Look out!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I owe you a debt of gratitude. <sigh> Our lessons have not even begun, and already you have seen me on my knees... I had been trying to match what lancework of yours I'd seen, but without success. That was how the dragons managed to overwhelm me.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Had I but fallen back on my tried and trusted techniques, I would have made short work of their ilk. But what would I have learned, then? Nay, what I know is no longer enough.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: The war exacts a heavy toll on us all, but none more so than we dragoons. If we are to survive, we must grow stronger─I must grow stronger!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Forename, will you demonstrate your techniques to me? I would study your movements up close.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: ...Aye, I suppose you have the right of it. There is no substitute for live foes. Come with me, then─there is a suitable place west of the Black Iron Bridge.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: This is the spot. Lie in wait long enough, and dragons will surely appear.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Hmmm... The techniques you employ differ not from mine, yet you overcome the enemy with such ease...

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: What is it that separates us so? What is it that you are doing that I am not?

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: ...Did I hear you rightly?

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: You see no difference between our lancework, but in the course of considering this, you conceived a new technique!?

quest.name: 仰がれる竜騎士
journal: Heustienne wants to hear more of the marvelous technique you have conceived.

In hearing of your new technique, Heustienne realizes that she must cast aside her preconceptions if she is to transcend her limits. Though she would continue her lesson, the hour is late and her duties call. Before she leaves, Heustienne extends to you an invitation to visit the home of the dragoons. Make your way back to Ishgard and meet your pupil before the entrance of the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly.

You arrive at the Congregation's entrance to find Heustienne with her father, Montorgains, a retired dragoon. After her father takes his leave, Heustienne opens up to you about her past. You learn that she is a war orphan, and became a dragoon that she might honor her adoptive father. The tale concludes with Heustienne remembering that Ser Alberic wished a word with you. Take yourself to the Observatorium at your earliest convenience.

You learn more of Heustienne's past from Ser Alberic. Possessed of tremendous potential, she had once vied to become the Azure Dragoon. Alas, the Eye chose her rival, Estinien, and she has since taken to training with a fervor bordering on self-punishment. Ser Alberic bids you keep watch over her, lest she lose sight of her conviction and render herself vulnerable to the enemy's wiles.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Heustienne at the Congregation.
Speak with Alberic at the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: ...A way to draw out your comrades' strength? Such an approach had never occurred to me.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: And small wonder, perhaps, for we dragoons are taught to be relentless in offense. In order to bring down dragons, we strive to jump higher and strike harder.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: But in my single-minded pursuit of what I believed to be perfection, 'twould seem I ended up fighting only with my lance. So focused was I upon delivering that next blow, I rendered myself blind to other possibilities.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: You have opened my eyes, Forename. If I am to transcend my limits, 'tis plain I must cast aside my preconceptions.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Ah, but the hour grows late. I must needs return to the Congregation. Would you care to accompany me? It may interest you to see how your fellow dragoons live.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Have confidence, my friend. I have no doubt that you will make a fine mentor for Heustienne.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Welcome to the home of the dragoons. I had a mind to show you the premises, but my father has paid me a sudden visit.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: This is my father, Montorgains. Father, allow me to present to you my mentor, the Azure Dragoon Forename.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: 'Tis an honor and a pleasure both to make your acquaintance. I hope you will forgive me for inconveniencing your plans, but what is a father to do? Dedicated to her duties as she is, my daughter scarcely comes home, and so I must go to her.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Father, please, we have spoken about this. I but strive to be a dragoon worthy of the name, as you yourself were. All that I do, I do to honor you.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: My child, you would honor me best by taking care of yourself. Well, I shan't overstay my welcome─seeing you hale and hearty is enough. Till next time.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: He is so kind to me, even though I share not his blood... Like so many others, I was orphaned by the war. I would have died long ago, cold and alone, had he not found me and taken me in. All that I have, I owe to him.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: 'Twas for no other reason than to honor my father that I followed in his footsteps and became a dragoon. But if I am to live up to his legacy─if I am to protect Ishgard as he once did─I must needs grow stronger.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: And I will, under your sage guidance. I look forward to our lessons to come.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Ah, it nigh slipped my mind: Ser Alberic wished a word with you. Pray seek him out at the Observatorium at your earliest convenience, perhaps after you have had a wander inside the Congregation.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: My thanks for coming, Forename. 'Tis no urgent matter─I was but wondering about Heustienne's progress. Tell me, how fares her training?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: So you have met her father. In his day, Montorgains was a dragoon of no small renown. He served Ishgard with valor until he took a grievous wound and was forced to hang up his lance.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: As Heustienne herself told you, she follows in her father's footsteps. From the first, she exhibited tremendous potential. In all ways, she was Estinien's equal, and the rivalry they shared raised both of them higher.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Alas, the Eye chose Estinien, and not her. Since then, she has taken to training with a fervor which borders on self-punishment.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: It is well to strive for greater heights, but a dragoon must never lose sight of his conviction. It is the only thing that shields us from the dragons' wiles.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: So I beg you, keep watch over Heustienne. By your shining example, see to it she never forgets what it means to be a dragoon.

quest.name: 飛槍ペレグリン
journal: Ser Alberic has just received word of an impending Dravanian offensive.

Ser Alberic informs you that the dragon Graoully and his horde are advancing on Ishgard, and Heustienne is preparing to meet them in the field. Alas, with the majority of her fellow dragoons absent, she can muster only a token force of defenders, and so Ser Alberic bids you lend your lance to the mission. Make haste to the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly and join Heustienne ahead of her departure.

Your offer of aid is received by Heustienne with thanks, and by her father with relief. After his daughter leaves, Montorgains asks that you watch over her, lest her desire to distinguish herself in battle cloud her judgment. Having given him your assurance, make now for the western highlands of Coerthas and rejoin your fellow dragoons.

You arrive to find the battle already raging, with the dragoons incurring heavy losses. Together with Heustienne, you succeed in repelling the remaining enemy forces, but their leader, Graoully, is conspicuous in his absence. Just when it seems the dragon will not appear, his menacing shadow falls over you. Heustienne impulsively leaps at Graoully, piercing his hide with her lance, and you and Brucemont can only look on helplessly as she is borne away. Speak with Brucemont and see if aught can be done.

Brucemont does not mince words: he is not hopeful of Heustienne's survival. He entrusts to you a fragment of her armor, broken off in battle, and bids you see it to her father's hands at the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly.

You deliver the fragment of armor to Montorgains in lieu of the tragic news, but he refuses to believe that Heustienne is gone. Upon hearing your account of events, he dares to hope that his daughter is still alive. Ser Alberic swears to do all in his power to find her, and bids you meet him at the Observatorium to deliberate a course of action.

Alberic fears that Heustienne may have been taken deep into Dravanian territory, but he is determined to rescue her. While he tracks Graoully's movements to ascertain Heustienne's location, dedicate yourself to honing your lance arm, that you may be ready for the trials to come.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with Heustienne at the Congregation.
Speak with Heustienne near the Pike.
Speak with Brucemont.
Deliver the armor fragment to Montorgains at the Congregation.
Speak with Alberic at the Observatorium.
Defeat Graoully's horde!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Thank the Fury you're here! But moments ago, we received word that Graoully's horde is advancing on Ishgard!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Even as we speak, Heustienne prepares to go and meet them in the field. Alas, with most of the dragoons absent on another mission, I fear she sorely wants for lances.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I would have you lend her yours, Forename. Pray make haste to the Congregation and join her!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Heustienne sorely wants for lances in her mission, and I would have you lend her yours. Pray make haste to the Congregation and join her!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Forename! You've come to aid us? This improves our chances tenfold!

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Allow me to thank you as well, MistressMaster Forename. I am but a worried father, and it gives me heart to know that the Azure Dragoon shall fight beside my daughter.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Though my training is far from over, the situation will brook no delay. We must head off Graoully and his horde before they reach a populated area.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: It shall be my honor to fight shoulder to shoulder with you. The experience alone will teach me much, of that I have little doubt.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Promise me you will be careful, Heustienne. Take no unnecessary risks. Do you understand me?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Remember, the dead cannot serve their nation. And what Ishgard needs above all are brave souls like you to protect her.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Worry not, Father. I swear I will return to you.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: See that you do, my child. Now, before you go, there is something I wish you to have.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: The lance Peregrine. It is yours now.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Wh-Why, this lance was bestowed upon your forebear by the archbishop himself! I am no true child of yours, yet you would entrust me with the family treasure...

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I will not betray your faith in me, Father! With this lance, I shall strike down Graoully and protect Ishgard!

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: Heustienne. It is time.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: It has been a while, my friend. I had the honor of overseeing your training when you were but a fledgling dragoon, and I shall be honored to fight beside you.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Comrades! At last report, Graoully and his horde had gained the western highlands. We shall lie in wait for them at the Pike. With me!

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Forename. May I have a moment?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Each time I see my daughter off on a mission, we dance the selfsame dance. I tell her to be careful, and she promises to do so. But I know her all too well.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Heustienne burns to distinguish herself in battle, that she might repay me and my lady wife a perceived debt. I fear that, one day, that desire will cloud her judgment, and she will not come home. And so I beg you, pray watch over my daughter.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: <pant> We were able to repel the first wave, but it cost us dearly... I am afraid the rest is up to you and Heustienne...

dialogue.name: THIERREMONT
dialogue.text: Our forces are in a bad way.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Forename! Already, we've suffered heavy losses, and that was but the first wave!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: They come! Brace yourself!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: FOR ISHGARD!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Stay sharp! That was but a taste!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Halone grant me strength!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Strike down the runners first!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Something big is coming!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Beware! 'Tis one of Graoully's champions!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Hold them, Forename... I must retreat...

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: That was the last of them...yet Graoully is nowhere to be seen. Were the reports mistaken?

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Such a price we have paid, only for our quarry to elude us!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: So you finally show yourself!

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: What is she─!? Heustienne! Nooo!

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: By the Fury, this is a disaster! I...I know not how to say this, but Heustienne... Strong as she is, she cannot have survived that...

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: ...Here, I discovered this in the aftermath. 'Tis a fragment of her armor. It must have broken off during the battle.

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: Pray see it to her father's hands. Knowing him, he will be at the Congregation, awaiting his daughter's return...

dialogue.name: BRUCEMONT
dialogue.text: I must rest a while. Pray bear word back to Ishgard.

dialogue.name: THIERREMONT
dialogue.text: By the Fury... So many lives lost...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I have heard the news. Pray go on ahead to Ishgard. I shall follow anon.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Forename. What has happened? Where is my daughter?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: This scrap... A piece of her armor? But why bring it to me? No... No!

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: I refuse to believe that Heustienne is gone. It is too early to know for certain. Tell me everything that happened. Everything.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: So she leapt upon the dragon, piercing its hide, after which the creature carried her westward...

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: If none saw her fall, it means she may have managed to safely dismount! There is hope still!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: If Heustienne is out there, I shall not rest until I find her. Forename, I trust I can rely upon your aid. Let us speak further at the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Without further ado, let us consider a course of action.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: As Montorgains dares to hope, if Heustienne was not shaken off Graoully's back, there is a chance that she yet lives.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: She will have ridden the dragon until such time as she saw an opportunity to dismount. The question is where.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The worst possible outcome is that she has been taken deep into dragon-ruled lands, far away from her allies. While I pray that this is not so, we must be prepared for anything.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Heustienne is one of our very best, and Ishgard can ill afford to lose her. For the nation's sake, and that of her father, let us find her and bring her home.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I will track Graoully's movements in order to ascertain Heustienne's location. Like as not, the search will take us into the heart of enemy territory. Pray keep your lance arm honed, for we shall soon have need of it.

quest.name: 槍が繋ぐ命
journal: Ser Alberic has acquired a lead pointing to the missing Heustienne's whereabouts.

Ser Alberic has received a report that Heustienne's lance, Peregrine, was recently seen in the hands of a heretic. Though it is unclear how the villains came to possess the weapon, they are all but certain to know of Heustienne's fate, and Ser Alberic is determined to track them down. A regiment of Temple Knights is presently on the trail of the selfsame heretics you seek. Make your way to the area west of Camp Riversmeet in the western highlands of Coerthas, and join the hunt.

West of Camp Riversmeet, you meet a Temple Knight who informs you that the heretics have retreated south, in the direction of the Swiftrun River. Join the knights in their hunt, and scour the area for Heustienne.

You find Heustienne and liberate her from her heretic captors, but she refuses to return to Ishgard and will not explain why. She bids you alert the Temple Knights to an impending heretic offensive, and further requests that you lie about her survival to her father and comrades. Return to the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly in Ishgard, and deliver Heustienne's message to Handeloup.
Handeloup receives Heustienne's death with disbelief. Next, make your way to the Observatorium and relay the tragic news to Montorgains.

In spite of your promise, you cannot help but reveal the truth to Montorgains, and the search for Heustienne continues. Though her inexplicable disappearance may be seen by some as desertion, all present are convinced that she would not forsake her nation and her vows. Ser Alberic speculates that Heustienne means to go after Graoully and recover Peregrine. While he tracks down the leader of the heretics, he bids you continue dedicating yourself to your lancework, that you might be better prepared for the coming trials.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with the Temple Knight west of Camp Riversmeet.
Search for Heustienne.
Speak with Handeloup at the Congregation.
Speak with Montorgains at the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: It seems your training proceeds apace, Forename. Would that I could say the same of our search for Heustienne...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: With heretic activity on the rise of late, our forces are stretched thin; the Temple Knights have not the men to spare for the search effort. Be that as it may, we are not without leads.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: A short while ago, a peculiar report arrived from the front lines. In a recent skirmish between our knights and a band of heretics, one of the enemy was wielding a lance bearing a striking resemblance to Peregrine.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The lance is a treasure belonging to Heustienne's family. If the reports are true, these heretics now have it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: However the villains came to possess Peregrine, 'tis more than likely that they know something of Heustienne's fate. If we can find them, we may yet find her.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: West of Camp Riversmeet, in the western highlands, a regiment of knights hunts the selfsame band of heretics we seek. I would have you join them, Forename─it is our best hope for a clue.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I pray that this information will lead us to Heustienne...

dialogue.name: KISHI01693
dialogue.text: Ser Alberic sent word that you would come. The heretics retreated through yonder pass, the man with the lance Peregrine among them.

dialogue.name: KISHI01693
dialogue.text: Our forces are giving chase even as we speak. Needless to say, we should be grateful for the Azure Dragoon's aid.

dialogue.name: KISHI01693
dialogue.text: The heretics retreated through yonder pass, the man with the lance Peregrine among them. Our forces are presently giving chase even as we speak. We should be grateful for your aid.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I find myself thanking you often of late, Forename... When I leapt upon Graoully and pierced his hide, the creature responded by soaring and attempting to shake me off. 'Twas all I could do to hold on to the shaft of my lance.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: High as we had climbed, I could not safely dismount. And so I bided my time, waiting for the right moment to jump clear of my unwilling mount.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Alas, the beast had other ideas. It bore me straight into the heretics' midst, and I was swiftly overwhelmed and divested of my weapon.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: What? It was the sighting of Peregrine that led you here? 'Twould seem my forefathers watch over me.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Hear me, Forename. The man who took my lance is the leader of this band of heretics.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I overheard the guards say that he has departed to meet with the leader of yet another group. In all likelihood, they are plotting a large-scale assault on the Holy See.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: The Temple Knights must be warned. You must bear word to the Congregation, that we might bolster our defenses.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: No. I cannot return with you. There is a task I must needs attend to.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Should someone ask whence this information came, tell them that you wrung it out of a heretic. And tell them that I...that I fell in battle.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I know full well I ask much of you, and it pains me to deceive my father, but I have no other choice. Whatever you might think of my request, believe me when I say that I remain firm in my purpose.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Unnngh... 'Tis nothing. I but took a glancing blow to the chest.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I must go now, as must you. When you return to the Congregation, deliver my message to Ser Handeloup. Please take care of my comrades...and my father.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Heustienne...slain? I cannot believe it... To lose one of our best while Graoully's shadow looms over us still...

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: But we must deal with each threat as it comes. First, we prepare for the heretics. I thank you for alerting us to their plan.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Now, loath though I am to place this burden upon you, Montorgains must needs be informed of his daughter's passing. He has gone to meet Ser Alberic at the Observatorium. Pray bear the news to him.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Loath though I am to place this burden upon you, Montorgains must needs be informed of his daughter's passing. He has gone to meet Ser Alberic at the Observatorium. Pray bear the news to him.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Ah, MistressMaster Forename. Have you learned aught of my daughter's whereabouts?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: What? S-Slain? No... It cannot be...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I am sorry, my friend...

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Heustienne is one of Ishgard's finest dragoons! She would not fall to common heretics! This must be some kind of mistake! Y-Yes, a terrible mistake!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Tell Montorgains the truth.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Remain silent.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Why do you not speak!? Are you hiding something from me!?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: ...You are, aren't you? 'Tis writ plain upon your face.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Please, I must know what became of my daughter! You may think to spare me pain, but I must know the truth!

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: What? Heustienne chose not to return?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: I know not what compelled her to act as she did, but it is enough for me that she lives still. Thank you for giving me this hope, at least.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: To those who do not know her, it may well appear as though Heustienne has deserted. But I believe I speak for us all when I say that she would not forsake her vows, let alone her people.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Indeed you do, Ser Alberic. However inexplicable my daughter's actions may seem, I will not cease to believe in her. No matter what it takes, I will find her and bring her home.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Montorgains puts on a brave front, but I fear the weight of worry may prove too much for him to bear─yet another reason to find Heustienne with all haste.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now, it seems plain she means to go after Graoully and to recover Peregrine. And while these objectives alone do not explain her decision to leave, they reveal to us where she is like to be.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I shall track down the leader of the heretics, the man who has Peregrine. You, meanwhile, must continue dedicating yourself to your lancework.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The trials of recent days have made you stronger, but I sense that the greatest tests are yet to come. See to it that you are full ready to face them.

obj.n: 血塗られた使命と宿命

quest.name: 血塗られた使命と宿命
journal: Ser Alberic has acquired information on the heretics you seek.

Ser Alberic has learned the heretics' identity. Calling themselves the Bloodbearers, they have entered into a pact with Graoully, through which they have abundant access to dragon blood, making them exceedingly dangerous foes. According to Ser Alberic's source, the Bloodbearers have most recently been sighted in the Chocobo Forest. If his instincts serve, and Heustienne means to reclaim her lance Peregrine, she will surely go after them, presenting a chance for you to be reunited with her. Make your way to the Dravanian forelands and join Ser Alberic at Tailfeather.

According to the locals, strange merchants have been frequenting Tailfeather and buying up prodigious quantities of goods. Ser Alberic is convinced that they are the Bloodbearers, here to replenish their stores. He bids you help him search the area for these so-called merchants. If you notice any suspicious individuals, confront them and gauge their reaction.

The merchant you approach reveals himself to be a heretic, and you are forced to defend yourself. A search of the man's body turns up a strange sliver of parchment. Return to Ser Alberic and have him examine it.

The sliver of parchment bears a message ciphered in a manner favored by heretics, but for a blessing Ser Alberic is able to make sense of it. It appears there is to be a meeting of some description in an area of the forest south of Tailfeather. Make your way there and be present for whatever may come to pass.

You arrive at the scene of the meeting to find Heustienne on her knees but alive, the dead bodies of several heretics strewn about her. As Ser Alberic predicted, she has come to recover her lance. Yet, though she has accomplished this task, she refuses to return with you to Ishgard. At Ser Alberic's insistence, she finally reveals the reason for her actions: when she was a prisoner of the heretics, she was made to drink dragon blood, and had already once turned into a dragon. Resigned to being judged a heretic by the inquisition, she declares her intent to go after Graoully, and Ser Alberic can find no words to change her mind. For now, rejoin Ser Alberic at the Observatorium.

Ser Alberic believes that Heustienne has a fighting chance against Graoully, if she can but master the dragon power that threatens to consume her. He bids you resume your training, all the while keeping your purpose close to your heart, that you may be ready to stand with Heustienne in her ultimate test.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with Alberic at Tailfeather.
Speak with the shady merchant at Tailfeather.
Show the sliver of parchment to Alberic.
Scout the designated meeting point south of Tailfeather.
Speak with Alberic at the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You come at a good time, my friend. I have tidings to share regarding the heretics we pursue.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: They call themselves the Bloodbearers, and their leader is a man named Matheonien. He and his minions are all capable of assuming the form of dragons.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Such a transformation is possible by partaking of dragon blood─I daresay you have borne witness to it─and it grants the individual unholy strength.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Though the sanguine substance is precious, the Bloodbearers have access to an abundant supply owing to their pact with Graoully. That is why they have been able to offer our forces such fierce resistance.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now, my sources tell me that the Bloodbearers have been sighted in the Chocobo Forest. If Heustienne means to reclaim Peregrine, as I believe, that is where she will go─and so must we.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Pray meet me at Tailfeather. We shall begin by making inquiries around the settlement.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I pray that we will be able to bring Heustienne home...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I took the liberty of speaking with some of the locals before you arrived.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: They say that strange merchants have been acquiring goods in prodigious quantities. It seems to me the Bloodbearers are replenishing their stores.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Let us split up and scour the area for these so-called merchants. Should someone strike you as suspicious, confront him and gauge his reaction.

dialogue.name: ITANSHA01694
dialogue.text: ...One o' the See's dogs!? Ye ain't takin' me alive!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The one suspicious fellow I approached was an honest chocobo breeder. How fared your search?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Attacked by a false merchant! And you say you found this sliver of parchment upon the man... Hmmm, it bears a message ciphered in a manner favored by heretics. Thankfully, I am versed in it.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: There is to be a meeting a short way south of here. Let us go there at once.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Thank the Fury, we were not too late.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Forename... Why are you here? Why is Ser Alberic here?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text:
Rest assured your secret is safe with us. Your father is the only other soul that knows; Forename could not bear to see him suffer so.
...What ails you?

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I am fine... It will pass... Now, I suspect it was Matheonien that led you here. As you can see, he and his Bloodbearers shall trouble the Holy See no more.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Even in self-imposed exile, you think of duty... But now that you have reclaimed Peregrine, there is no need for further deception. Come with us back to Ishgard─your family and your comrades have need of you.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I am sorry, but I cannot. I cannot return to Ishgard ever again.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Why!? What has happened to you!? The Heustienne I know would never forsake her people! She would never turn her back on her nation!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Please understand! I wish with all my heart to return home, but I have no choice!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I have partaken of dragon blood! When the heretics held me captive, they forced the vile substance down my throat!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Halone have mercy... Th-Then you...

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Aye... I have already turned... Were I to set foot in Ishgard, I would be charged with heresy of the worst order.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: If I alone must suffer, then so be it. But you know as well as I how the inquisition works. Should I be declared a heretic, suspicion is like to fall upon my parents as well. I will not allow that to happen.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Full well do I understand your plight, but what do you intend to do? You cannot mean to throw your life away!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Perish the thought! I owe my life to my father! If I must die, it shall not be in vain!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: As Forename has shown us, a dragoon needs no banners to do what is right. And I know full well what I must do.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Upon my lance, I swear to hunt down Graoully and end his reign of terror!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. For showing me the path I must walk. For helping me to accept my fate.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I asked this of you once before, but I shall ask it again: please take care of my comrades and my father.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: No matter how I searched, I could find no words to stop her... For now, let us return to the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: As I made my way back, I recalled words Heustienne once said to me.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: “My worth is measured by the dragons I slay.”

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: To be changed into the very thing she has sworn to fight... I can only imagine the storm of turmoil that must rage within her.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Yet cruel though her fate is, we must make the best of the hand we have been dealt. And I believe I spy an opportunity.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: In partaking of dragon blood, Heustienne has come to harbor the power of dragons. If she can but master this power, she may well have a fighting chance against Graoully.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: It is not so different from harnessing the power of the Eye, I believe. Alas, the danger of corruption is far greater.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: As you yourself have witnessed, dragon blood alters the flesh. And once the flesh is altered, the mind must soon follow.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Will Heustienne be able to conquer the dragon that has roused within her? I know not. But we must believe in her and lend her our strength, else she will surely be lost to us.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Pray resume your training once more, Forename, and keep your purpose ever close to your heart. For when next we meet, it will be to confront the dragon Graoully!

quest.name: 槍に誓う使命
journal: Ser Alberic's jaw is set in anticipation of a confrontation.

Graoully is on the move once more. According to the Observatorium, the creature will soon pass near the Dreaming Dragon in the western highlands of Coerthas. Ser Alberic believes that Heustienne will seek to confront her nemesis, and bids you aid her in the battle. First, make your way to the western highlands of Coerthas and join Ser Alberic at the Convictory.

Ser Alberic informs you that a woman fitting Heustienne's description has been sighted near the Convictory. She was last seen heading north towards the Dreaming Dragon, leaving dead heretics in her wake. Follow this trail of carnage to Heustienne.
You arrive at the scene of a battle, a solitary set of footsteps threading through it. Follow the footsteps north.
You arrive at yet another scene of battle, the selfsame set of footsteps threading through it. Follow the footsteps west.

At the end of the trail of carnage, you find Heustienne staring down Graoully. With your lances joined, you succeed in vanquishing the dragon that for so long had tormented the people of Ishgard. Turn your attention now to your comrade, who continues to wage a battle within herself.

You bear witness to a touching reunion between Heustienne and her father, Montorgains. Bolstered by his words, she vows to conquer the lure of dragon blood, that she might one day return to Ishgard. Till that day, she will roam the land and fight dragons with their own power. And till next you meet her, continue serving the realm as the best Azure Dragoon you can be.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with Alberic at the Convictory.
Follow the trail of carnage.
Search for Heustienne.
Speak with Heustienne.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Forename! The hour of reckoning is at hand─Graoully is on the move once more!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: According to our astrologians, the creature shall soon pass near the Dreaming Dragon in the western highlands. Heustienne, too, will be aware of this, and she will seek to confront her nemesis. We must go to her aid.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Now, 'twould not do if she were to be seen by her comrades at this juncture. As such, I will assure the Congregation that you have the situation in hand.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: By the same token, however, this means we will receive no support from the dragoons. We fight this battle alone.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But without further ado, let us be on our way. Pray see to your preparations and then meet me at the Convictory.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The hour of reckoning is at hand. Let us aid Heustienne and put an end to Graoully.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Forgive me, but I insisted that I must join you. Though I am long retired, I will not hesitate to take up my lance again for my daughter.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I have spoken with the people here. A woman fitting Heustienne's description has been sighted nearby.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: She was headed north, they say, a lance in her hand and a trail of dead heretics in her wake─remnants of the Bloodbearers, 'twould seem.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Ser Alberic has told me all. It matters not what my daughter has become─I am resolved to bring her home. I beg of you, please help her through the coming trial.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Let us split up, the quicker to find Heustienne. Lord Montorgains shall come with me.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: MistressMaster Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A fierce battle took place here recently. A solitary set of footsteps leads to the north.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A fierce battle took place here recently. A solitary set of footsteps leads to the west.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: So you have come... Behold, then, the malign face of my torment─Graoully!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: It gives me heart to know that the Azure Dragoon stands with me against my nemesis!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Ungh... The craving grows stronger by the day...but I shall not succumb to it! Nay, I shall be no dragon's thrall!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I failed in my duty before─I shan't fail again!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Today, I shall claim Graoully's head!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Defeat Graoully!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Father... I am unworthy...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Come and meet your doom, dragon!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: At last, my duty is fulfilled...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: He takes wing! Keep your eyes above!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Your time is at an end!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We almost have him! Let us press our advantage!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: <pant> I did it... I resisted the dragon within and fulfilled my duty... I could not have done it without you, Forename.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Verily, you are the paragon towards which I aspire. If I am to be like you, I must learn to harness greater power without being consumed by it.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: With this battle won, I have a new purpose. I shall conquer the lure of dragon blood and purge every last drop of it from the land!

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Heustienne! Thank the Fury you are safe!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Father!? Wh-Why are you here!?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: I have come to bring you home. Your mother and I cannot bear to lose you again.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Would that I could return, Father, but I cannot. I have partaken of dragon blood and...and turned. In the eyes of the inquisition, I am no better than a heretic. I cannot allow you to be associated with me.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: You needn't worry. This shall remain a secret between the four of us.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: No, the risk is too great! Even now, 'tis all I can do to suppress my thirst for dragon blood!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Since the day I said my vows, I strove to become the Azure Dragoon. Failing that, I strove to be as near to it as I could. Finally, I have the power I longed for, but it renders me an enemy to mine own kind!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Accursed dragons... How many of ours have you claimed with your foul blood?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Hear me, Heustienne. Not once have you yielded to fate, and you mustn't yield to it now. The road ahead will be fraught with hardships, this I do not doubt, but I have faith that you will overcome them all and return to us.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Father. Your faith in me lends me strength. However long it takes, I shall conquer the lure of dragon blood to stand before you once more. Till that day, I shall roam the land and smite our foes with their own power.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: This I swear upon my forefathers' lance!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the dragoon quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic.

obj.n: ドラゴンランサーチェスト【ILv210】
血塗られた使命と宿命

quest.name: 戦歌求め西方へ
journal: Jehantel would help you rise to greater heights in your art.

Jehantel tells you of his recent endeavors, namely training the members of the Gods' Quiver. By taking an interest in the development of the younger generation, he feels that his songs have gained in power, and believes that yours could, too. If you have a mind to rise to new heights as a bard, accept Jehantel's invitation and go to Quiver's Hold, where you will be introduced to his acquaintance.

Arriving at Quiver's Hold, you are introduced to a man named Sanson, a captain of the Order of the Twin Adder. Though he is a lancer by training, Sanson believes in the power of song, and is seeking to establish a new unit which incorporates bards. To his frustration, however, thus far the leaders of the Gods' Quiver have not been amenable to his requests for cooperation. Presently, he will meet with them again, and hopes to sway them with the existence of a legendary song said to hold the power to bring battles to a decisive end: the Ballad of Oblivion. Make your way to the Seat of the First Bow and be present for the meeting.

The meeting does not proceed as well as Sanson had hoped. The Gods' Quiver are still unwilling to lend their cooperation, though Lewin allows that he is intrigued by the Ballad of Oblivion. Sanson declares his intent to go on a journey to find this song, but even this endeavor is met with opposition. The leader of the Gold Bull unit─a man who does not think highly of bards─assigns Sanson a trial to test his fitness to embark on his proposed expedition: culling enraged treants in the East Shroud. In this manner, the meeting comes to an end. Speak with Jehantel to hear his thoughts on the trial.

Dubious as to whether the Gods' Quiver actually mean to dispatch a bard, Jehantel bids you aid Sanson in the trial. Make your way to the East Shroud and join the serpent captain at Amarissaix's Spire.
You arrive to find Sanson on his knees and surrounded by enraged treants. Vanquish the creatures and assist your companion.

You defeat the treants and help Sanson to his feet. At that moment, you are almost taken unaware by yet another creature, but before it can do you harm, a mysterious archer appears and puts it down with a barrage of arrows. Introducing himself as Guydelot, the cocksure fellow is revealed to be the bard assigned to your expedition and one of Jehantel's students. Yet in spite of Guydelot's ability, Sanson is unconvinced of his suitability, and makes his displeasure towards the man abundantly clear. Speak with Jehantel to learn what he thinks of this rocky introduction.
