Jehantel does not mince words: watching over the conflict between Sanson and Guydelot will be a burden upon you. By the same token, however, he believes that the experience will help you to grow as a bard. Make your way back to Quiver's Hold and join Sanson as he reports the success of his trial.

With the trial's success, Sanson receives official permission to proceed with the expedition. So it is that your journey to find the Ballad of Oblivion begins. For the first leg, make your way to Ishgard, and rejoin your companions at the aetheryte plaza.

Upon arriving in Ishgard, Sanson declares that he will begin by making inquiries. He bids you rest and recover your strength, for it will most certainly be called upon as the journey unfolds.

※The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Jehantel at Quiver's Hold.
Speak with Jehantel at the Seat of the First Bow.
Speak with Jehantel.
Speak with Sanson at Amarissaix's Spire.
Assist Sanson.
Speak with Jehantel at Amarissaix's Spire.
Speak with Sanson at Quiver's Hold.
Speak with Sanson in Ishgard.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, my dear Forename. Precisely the womanman I wished to see.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: You will know that I have been training the members of the Gods' Quiver. Well, the experience has proven most insightful. By taking a keen interest in the development of the younger generation, I feel that my songs have gained in power. And yours could, too, my friend.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: If you have a mind to rise to new heights within our art, I invite you to come to Quiver's Hold. There is an individual to whom I would introduce you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: If you have a mind to rise to new heights within our art, I invite you to come to Quiver's Hold. There is an individual to whom I would introduce you.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: By the Matron, you're Forename Surname! I have heard of all your exploits!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce you to Sanson, a captain of the Order of the Twin Adder. He is a skilled lancer and a fervent believer in the power of song. As a matter of fact, he now seeks to establish a new unit which incorporates bards.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: 'Tis an honor to finally meet you, Forename. Jehantel often speaks of you, and highly.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And as you have heard, I seek to establish a new unit. 'Tis my belief that bards would give our forces a tactical advantage. To that end, I went to the Gods' Quiver to request their cooperation.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Alas, they were not receptive to my proposal. Many yet remain skeptical of the power of song, and would sooner spend their time bending the bow than plucking the harp. But I was not deterred.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I scoured ancient tomes and reached out to the moogles to find decisive proof of a bard's worth in battle. And I am pleased to say that my efforts have finally yielded fruit: there exists a legendary song that is said to bring a battle to an immediate conclusion!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The Ballad of Oblivion, 'tis called. And on the condition that I find it, I shall convince the leaders of the Gods' Quiver that mine is a worthwhile cause.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, the meeting is about to begin. I take my leave of you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: He left without giving us the chance to bring up our own business...

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Actually, why don't we join Sanson in the meeting? As it pertains to bards, I doubt our presence would be taken amiss. Come, let us go to the Seat of the First Bow.

dialogue.name: SUBLEADER01713
dialogue.text: Another bard, are you?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You would lend your voice to my cause? I am in your debt!

dialogue.name: LEWIN
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't Forename! I did not expect to see you here!

dialogue.name: DOORMANSINYU
dialogue.text: Jehantel said that you would come. You may enter.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Seat of the First Bow?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The meeting isn't faring well, I'm afraid. The Gods' Quiver are disinclined to cooperate.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: ...Once you bear witness to the ballad's power, you will change your mind! I am certain of it!

dialogue.name: LEWIN
dialogue.text: I must allow, such a decisive way to end a battle does pique my interest...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: My investigation has revealed that the song originates from the western reaches of Coerthas. It is my intent to journey there and find it.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, I have already submitted papers to the Gods' Quiver requesting a bard to accompany me on this expedition.

dialogue.name: SUBLEADER01713
dialogue.text: Rest assured we have already handpicked one for you. Not that there were many to choose from, mind you. Jehantel has scarcely commenced his lessons, after all.

dialogue.name: SUBLEADER01713
dialogue.text: Now, with times as they are, every man of us is precious. Therefore, before we commit one of ours to your cause, I would test your fitness to undertake this expedition.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: What would you have me do?

dialogue.name: SUBLEADER01713
dialogue.text: Demonstrate your martial prowess─simple as that. Enraged treants have been plaguing travelers in the Twelveswood. I would have you and your companion–to–be deal with them.

dialogue.name: SUBLEADER01713
dialogue.text: Lest you worry, we've assigned you someone capable. I shall have him join you presently at Amarissaix's Spire, near to where said treants lurk. Good fortune to you, Captain.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: This comes as no surprise. He is among those who doubt the worth of a bard.

dialogue.name: LEWIN
dialogue.text: Though a trial is a mite contrived, that we have no hands to waste was no lie. I shall pray for your success.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: With that, we are come to your part in this, Forename. 'Tis my desire that you accompany Sanson on his expedition.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I request this of you because I know no finer bard. Furthermore, I believe that you will gain something from this experience.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: But first, there is the matter of the trial. I find myself dubious as to whether the Gods' Quiver actually mean to lend Sanson a bard. Pray aid him in dispatching the treants, Forename.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The creatures are fearsome foes. I would be heartened for your assistance.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I shall go on ahead to Amarissaix's Spire. Pray join me there at your earliest convenience.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I was caught unawares... B-Be careful!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: (-???-)The famous Forename Surname, I take it?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: (-Assertive Archer-)You're not half bad, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: “Not half bad”!? Forename is a prodigy, I'll have you know! That's why I gave herhim the charm, kupo!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Guydelot! What is the meaning of this interference? They were in the midst of a trial, for gods' sake!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: (-Guydelot-)Don't have a fit, old man. It isn't good for your heart. Besides, I wouldn't call it interference, seeing as I'm part of this merry band.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: It's true, kupo! I was present when he received his orders. And I was also present when he said, “What a bloody bother! I hope they botch the trial!”

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: (-Guydelot-)Aye, well, I did say those words, I'll not deny it. But seeing Forename in action has changed my mind.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I'm Guydelot, of the Gold Bulls. I don't care for fame and fortune, and I couldn't give two farts about this Dirge of Deathlike Doomness you're after.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I do, however, have an interest in song. I can't pass over the chance to travel with an exceptional bard like yourself. And I promise you won't be poorer for my fine company.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Well, things have certainly taken an interesting turn. Know that Guydelot is among my most promising students. I can vouch for his ability.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Ability, aye, but naught else.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I know about you, Guydelot the Spent. Your reputation as a troublemaker precedes you. You treat authority with contempt, shirk duty at every turn, and make a general nuisance of yourself.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: That they sent the likes of you means that they want me to fail! My hopes of finding the Ballad of Oblivion... All up in smoke...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Grrr, say it straight to my face, will you? Jehantel, do we really have to travel with this pompous prat? Forename and I alone will do just fine! We don't need anyone else!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Without me, you say? Who do you think is the driving force behind the expedition!?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: <sigh> I suppose beggars can't be choosers. Forename, I must return to Quiver's Hold with word of the trial's success. Please join me there.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: I'm glad to see you again, Forename! You must sing for me again, and soon, kupo!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Guydelot may have his failings, but he is not a bad fellow. Truth be told, I had intended to introduce him to you as well.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: To that end, I asked Pukno Poki to seek him out, only to have him appear as our Quiverman. Fate works in strange ways, does it not?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: A pity he and Sanson do not see eye to eye. Their personalities are simply too far apart, and the gulf will not be easily bridged.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Though it will be a burden upon you, in watching over these two disparate souls, doubt not but that you will grow as a bard.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: But come, let us hurry back to Gridania. 'Tis too early still to leave those two unchaperoned.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: The air is taut as a tightly wound harp, kupo...

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: They may have gotten off on the wrong foot, but these two have proven their readiness for the expedition.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: That Sanson hasn't shut up since he got here. Seriously, sisterbrother, we'd be well rid of him.

dialogue.name: SUBLEADER01713
dialogue.text: You are returned. Well, well...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We have done as bade and culled the enraged treants. I trust you have no objections to the expedition.

dialogue.name: SUBLEADER01713
dialogue.text: None whatsoever. Nor do I have any doubt that Guydelot shall be of great help to you. I shall look forward to good tidings in the days to come.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Of great help indeed...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: At any rate, 'tis now official─we may proceed with the expedition. Let us depart for the Holy See at once. Lest you wonder, I have already secured us passage into Ishgardian territory.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: At any rate, 'tis now official─we may proceed with the expedition. Let us depart for the Holy See at once.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And remember: we have a golden chance to raise the standing of bards within our nation. Let us succeed in our mission and find the Ballad of Oblivion!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Any stiffer, and he's like to snap in half.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: It'll be a grueling journey, but so long as you work together, you're bound to succeed, kupo!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: So it is to Ishgard, then. Safe travels, my friend. I shall await your return, all the while looking forward to hearing such songs as are born of your experience.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: It'll be a grueling journey, but so long as you work together, you're bound to succeed, kupo!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: So it is to Ishgard, then. Safe travels, my friend. I shall await your return, all the while looking forward to hearing such songs as are born of your experience.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Ack, snow and ice everywhere you look, and it hurts like a bastard to breathe. For all this open sky, it feels gloomier than the closeness of the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: First, I shall make inquiries here in Ishgard. As for you, Forename, pray rest and recover your strength. We will likely have need of it on the road.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Godsdammit, man! Here we are in a new place, one that hasn't been open to visitors for over a decade, and you've got your nose buried in a bloody book!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Take a moment to get a feel for the city, I say! And to that end, I'm off to a tavern to get a feel for the locals─the young and female sort. Heh heh heh!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 放蕩と堅物
journal: Irritation is writ plain on Sanson's face.

In annoyed tones, Sanson informs you that Guydelot is about to bring scandal upon your fellowship. Apparently, a local maiden ruffled his bard's pride when she told him that her sweetheart is fairer of voice than he is, and he has impulsively left the city in order to settle matters with the man─a knight of Ishgard. Sanson bids you come with him to Falcon's Nest, that you might stop Guydelot from doing something regrettable.

The knight in question is currently on patrol. Upon learning this, Guydelot struck out into the wilderness of the western highlands in order to find him. Sanson suggests that the two of you split up and track down the unpredictable bard. Focus your search on the area of Twinpools.

Contrary to expectation, you find Guydelot not confronting the knight, but helping him and his fellows fend off ferocious fiends. Assuring you that the situation is under control, he bids you tend to another horde of fiends beyond the rocky outcropping to the north.
You have defeated the fiends. Make your way back to Guydelot's location.

It is revealed that Guydelot's purpose in seeking the knight was not to challenge him, but rather, to deliver a nameday present and message from his sweetheart. Deeply grateful, the knight, Ser Alamenain, offers to assist in your search for the Ballad of Oblivion. He tells you of a woman who is said to send souls unto the heavens with a song, and believes that this song may be what you seek. With matters now settled after a fashion, make your way back to Falcon's Nest and rejoin Sanson.

Sanson takes Guydelot to task for his willful ways, but the bard does not seem especially repentant. While your two traveling companions continue inquiring after the Ballad of Oblivion, you must maintain your strength for the journey to come.

※The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Sanson at Falcon's Nest.
Search for Guydelot.
Lie in wait at the specified location and defeat any enemies that appear.
Speak with Guydelot.
Speak with Sanson at Falcon's Nest.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Gah, that Guydelot is worse than useless! Instead of helping with our inquiries, he spends all his time drinking and wenching, and now his indiscretion is about to get him─and us─into trouble! The gods see fit to bless him with a gift for song, but what does he do but use it to satisfy his base urges!?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: <sigh> Pray forgive me my outburst. 'Tis towards Guydelot, and not you, that I should be giving vent to my annoyance. Allow me to explain the situation.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Apparently, a maiden told Guydelot that her sweetheart is fairer of voice than he. That was enough to throw him into a fit of jealousy, and he rushed out of the city seeking to settle matters with this sweetheart, who happens to be a knight.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I am sure you can appreciate how swiftly this could descend into disaster. We must stop Guydelot before he does something stupid and gets us banished from Ishgard. Please come with me to Falcon's Nest and talk some sense into the fool!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01714
dialogue.text: Aye, a bard did come through a while ago. The fellow walked with a swagger, as you say.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The knight in question is currently on patrol. Upon learning of this, Guydelot continued north into the wilderness to find him.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I must add that the knight and his unit are late to return. It may be simply a coincidence...or it may be our witless friend has done something we'll live to regret.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Whichever it is, we had best go and see for certain.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I shall look for Guydelot around Gorgagne Mills. Pray focus your search on Twinpools, to the north and west.

dialogue.name: ALAMENAIN
dialogue.text: Stay back! Leave these fiends to us!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't Forename! Come to join the revelry, I shouldn't doubt.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The situation here's under control, but there's plenty more fiends to go around. Why don't you try checking beyond the rock to the north?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: There's plenty more fiends to go around. Why don't you try checking beyond the rock to the north?

dialogue.name: ALAMENAIN
dialogue.text: That was a close call. We wouldn't have fared nearly as well had your friend not arrived.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Your sense of timing's superb, sisterbrother. Late enough to be stylish, but not too late to be useless.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Forename! What has happened!?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: ...Guydelot did what!? Why would he do such a dangerous thing!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Ser Alamenain, I presume. I've got something here for you─a nameday present from your sweetheart.

dialogue.name: ALAMENAIN
dialogue.text: From Abby? Hm, there's a message attached to it...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: 'Tis well and good to do your duty, but you mustn't forget who you're fighting for. After all, you're about to have an extra mouth to feed.

dialogue.name: ALAMENAIN
dialogue.text: My Abby...is with child? Oh, Halone be praised! I'm to be a father! From this moment on, I must live not only for duty, but for my family!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Rushing out of the city, joining the battle against fiends... It was all for the sake of delivering the present and message?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Aye, something like that. At the tavern, I heard tell of a knight who's versed in traditional songs. I went to his sweetheart to ask about him, but the poor lass was damn near inconsolable. The way she was pining for her dearest Alamenain, what was I to do but go and find the bloke?

dialogue.name: ALAMENAIN
dialogue.text: Not only did you bring me the gladdest tidings of my life, in coming to our aid, you most certainly saved it besides. I can never repay this debt, but it shall not be for want of effort. Whatever it is you wish to know, I should be glad to assist you.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We are searching for a legendary song said to hold the power to bring battles to an end. The Ballad of Oblivion, it is called. Are you perchance familiar with it?

dialogue.name: ALAMENAIN
dialogue.text: I have heard rumors of a woman who sends souls unto the heavens with a song. Perhaps this is the song you seek? I shall look into it and send word should I learn something.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot! Just because this ended well doesn't mean you're excused! You can't simply do whatever you please!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: ...Whatever I please? I was adapting to the situation─that happens to be sought after in a bard. An opportunity presented itself, and I grabbed it with both hands.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Insufferable man... Brazen though it was, his action did save lives, so I shall overlook his lapse in judgment this once. Let us return to Falcon's Nest.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I swear, there's another lance up his arse that keeps him propped up.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Lest you forget, we are a fellowship! Members of a fellowship work together! Do we have an understanding?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
Fight not the flow of life's river,♪
For you'll never arrive at the shoals.♪
Give your body and soul to the waters,♪
And Sanson the Stiff has no soul.♪

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Stop that! I am trying to have a serious conversation!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You know nothing, Sanson the Stiff. A bard must compose when inspiration takes him. I was trying to capture the virtue of tranquility, and you rudely interrupted me.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: What about you, my friend? Have recent happenings kindled a verse within your heart?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You see? Forename, too, was moved to compose a lovely little ditty!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, that was very beautiful...but I was talking about what it means to be a fellowship! We have much work to do, and I expect you to do your part, starting with our inquiries!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: (-Guydelot-)I'm inquiring, aren't I? As I've already proven, there's plenty to be learned from the commonfolk. I'll leave you to deal with your own kind─the stuffy, highborn sort.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We haven't yet heard from Ser Alamenain. Until such time as we do, I shall continue my own search for information. As before, pray keep up your strength for the journey ahead.

obj.n: デュランデル家の騎兵

quest.name: 氷墓に捧ぐ歌
journal: Sanson has acquired information on the Ballad of Oblivion.

Sanson informs you that he has received information from Ser Alamenain on the Ballad of Oblivion. Specifically, the woman who is said to sing the song is a soldier stationed at the Convictory. Sanson declares that the three of you will go there to seek her out. Make your way to the Ishgardian encampment and join your companions.

You have tracked down the soldier, Celaine. However, though she admits to singing the song, she stubbornly refuses to teach it to you. Presently, Guydelot is attempting to coax it out of her; ask him how his efforts fare.

No amount of words will sway Celaine to teach you the song, and Guydelot is loath to press her further. But Sanson, determined to accomplish his duty, proposes a deal: the three of you will assist the Ishgardians in a dragon-culling operation in exchange for being near in case Celaine employs the song in battle. Make your way to Twinpools and present yourself to the Convictor knight to receive instructions.
The Convictor knight bids you help by thinning out the dragons. Lie in wait at the location he has marked on your map, and defeat the creatures that appear.
You have dispatched a sufficient number of dragons. Rejoin Sanson and the others.

Though the culling operation is a success, the Convictors have incurred heavy losses. Stricken with sadness, Celaine begins singing a requiem for her fallen comrades, which Guydelot recognizes as the song to send souls unto the heavens. Follow Sanson's lead and pay your respects with a /salute.

Appreciative of your gesture, Celaine opens up to you. At Guydelot's encouragement, she resolves to savor the time she has with her comrades, rather than keep them at arm's length to spare herself the pain of loss. In her turn, she counsels Guydelot and Sanson to appreciate each other's company. Finally, she speaks of the requiem, which she says was taught to her by a scholar of Ishgardian history named Sylviel, who is based in the settlement of Tailfeather. Speak with Sanson to learn what your next step will be.
It is decided that you will go to Tailfeather to seek out Sylviel. Make your way to the settlement in the Dravanian forelands and rejoin your companions.

Sylviel has apparently left Tailfeather on one of his many surveys, and you must await his return. With the mission taking you into ever more perilous territory, see to it that you are fully prepared for whatever lies ahead.

※The next bard quest will be available upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with Sanson.
Speak with Guydelot.
Speak with the Convictor knight.
Lie in wait at the specified location and defeat any dragons that appear.
Speak with Sanson.
/salute Celaine.
Speak with Sanson.
Speak with Sanson at Tailfeather.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
To be a bard means to let your heart guide you as much as your head.
...That's what I think, at least.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Good tidings, Forename! We've received information from Ser Alamenain regarding the Ballad of Oblivion!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You will recall the woman he mentioned─the one who sends souls unto the heavens with a song. She is apparently a soldier stationed at the Convictory. Let us go there at once!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot, you are coming with us!

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, but the answer is no.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Well, if you're not up to it, I won't press you. A song isn't something you can force out of someone.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We have found the soldier, Forename─Celaine is her name. Alas, though she admits to singing the song, she refuses to teach it to us.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot is doing his best to coax it out of her. For once, his way with women may serve an honorable cause.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot is doing his best to persuade Celaine to teach us her song. For once, his way with women may serve an honorable cause.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You won't sing for us; I don't have a problem with that. But could you at least tell us why? It'd help to ease our disappointment.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: I'm no bard─just a simple soldier. And it isn't a song I would willingly sing.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The lady has spoken. Seems to me there's nothing else we can do.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You would give up, just like that? We have a duty to accomplish!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Begging your pardons, but your comrade gave me to understand that an operation is due to be conducted presently.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Aye, dragon numbers are on the rise, and we go to cull them.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: If you are not averse, we would lend you our aid. The operation would be better for the extra hands, and should you have occasion to employ the song in battle, we would be able to hear it.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: ...Very well. You may join us, but on one condition: you are to provide our forces with support only.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: All right, we have work to do. The operation will take place at Twinpools, to the north and west. Let us present ourselves to the commander and offer him our aid.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And he throws a hissy fit when I do something spontaneous. Hmph.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Well, let's make ourselves useful, the only way a bard can.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: This is rather sudden, I know full well, but it is for the sake of our mission.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Remember, you are to provide support only.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Rest assured I don't plan on charging into the fray. No, sir, I'm content to stand back and strum out a song or three.

dialogue.name: CAVALRY01715
dialogue.text: You would join us in the cull? The Holy See thanks you!

dialogue.name: CAVALRY01715
dialogue.text: Seeing as you are skilled in the bow, you may help us by thinning out the beasts. I shall mark a spot on your map; pray focus your efforts upon this area.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I shall remain close by, in case you have occasion to employ the song.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Do as you will. Just see that you do not overreach yourself.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Go to our assigned positions, do what we always do─seems straightforward enough!

dialogue.name: CAVALRY01715
dialogue.text: Seeing as you are skilled in the bow, you may help us by thinning out the dragons. Please focus your efforts upon the area I marked on your map.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I'll not stray a fulm from Celaine's side!

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Stay back! Don't make me say it again!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Shouldn't you be elsewhere, Forename? Leave this spot to us, and run along to your own.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Again, so many lives lost...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The cull's finally over. I had no idea dragons were so bloody tough. And those were the lesser ones.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Not once did Celaine perform the song...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And though the operation itself was a success, her people suffered heavy losses.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Farewell, my friends. Your sacrifice will not be forgotten.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text:
Rest now, O valiant souls,♪
Lay down your weary heads.♪
Go unto the bosom of the Fury,♪
In Whose exalted name you bled.♪

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: A requiem?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The song to send souls unto the heavens... This is what it was.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I was trying to make you sing a song of mourning? Gods strike me down for a callous fool...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: For once, Sanson has it right. Let's show our respects to Celaine's fallen comrades.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Gods strike me down for a callous fool...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: For once, Sanson has it right. Let's show our respects to Celaine's fallen comrades.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Pay your respects by saluting Celaine.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: You need not feel bad. The fault is mine for not offering a proper explanation.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Men fall far too often in this war we wage. Wishing to spare myself the pain of loss, I've kept my comrades at a distance. Yet I always find myself racked with regret that I didn't reach out to them before they were taken.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Aye, far better to taste pain than to live with regret. There's no need to deprive yourself of the joy of friendship.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: I won't. Not anymore. I shall learn to savor the time I have with my comrades...as should you.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: The two of you bicker like an old couple, but life is too short to waste squabbling with your own. So cast aside your differences, and have joy of each other's company while you still can.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: As for the requiem I sang...it was taught to me by a scholar of Ishgardian history. If there is a man alive who knows the song you seek, it will be he.

dialogue.name: CELAINE
dialogue.text: Sylviel is his name, and you will find him at Tailfeather. I suggest you pay him a visit. I take my leave of you.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Celaine's song was simple, but she sang with all her heart. Therein lies the power of a bard.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Let us go to Tailfeather, as Celaine recommends. This Sylviel may know the song, and failing that, he may at least be able to direct us to it.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: It's the fervent desire to aid our comrades that bestows our songs with power.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: It makes me wonder, what sort of desire is needed for a song that destroys all?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I'm playing around with chords to accompany Celaine's melody.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: It appears Sylviel is presently afield on one of his surveys. We must await his return.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Tell me, Forename, what thoughts have you on Celaine's inner struggles?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: ...That's some deep stuff, sisterbrother. Truly insightful. A pity that's all lost on Sanson─the bastard's got eyes for naught but his bloody tome.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Our mission takes us into ever more perilous territory. Pray see to it you are fully prepared for the trials ahead.

obj.n: 聖フィネア連隊の騎兵

quest.name: 己の信ずるもの
journal: Sanson is wearing an expectant look.

No sooner does Sanson inform you that Sylviel will soon return to Tailfeather than the scholar's hired sword rushes in bearing dire tidings: his master has been captured by the Gnath. With the denizens of Tailfeather unwilling to help, it falls to you to mount a rescue. First, Sanson suggests that you scout out the entrance to the stronghold of Loth ast Gnath.

You arrive at Loth ast Gnath to find that Sylviel's assistant has managed to flee to safety. Alas, his master is still being held by the beastmen. Together with your friends, you sally forth into the stronghold and succeed in freeing Sylviel from the clutches of the Gnath. Speak with Sanson north of Loth ast Gnath.
All members of Sylviel's survey party have been accounted for. Make your way back to Tailfeather and speak with Sanson.

According to Sylviel, Coerthan legend speaks of a saint of song in the heavens─an individual with transcendent mastery over poetry and verse─who can bring a battle to its conclusion with a song. As a gesture of gratitude, the scholar promises to investigate the legend further. And though Sanson is hopeful that this will lead you to the Ballad of Oblivion, Guydelot is not wholly convinced. The two exchange heated words, and Guydelot subsequently storms out of the settlement. Sanson believes that the bard will eventually come around, and asks for your patience in the meantime.

※The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Sanson outside Loth ast Gnath.
Speak with Sanson.
Rescue Sylviel!
Defeat the Gnath that bar your retreat!
Defeat the Gnath!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Life's too short to waste squabbling, eh? I'd argue it's also too short to waste on pompous prats.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You come at a good time, Forename! Sylviel and his expedition are due to return any moment now.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01716
dialogue.text: (-???-)Help! For gods' sakes!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01716
dialogue.text: Hear my tale, I beg you! A group of us were surveying ancient ruins when we stumbled into Gnath territory. The creatures took us captive─I was the only one who managed to flee.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Tell me, is the leader of your party a man named Sylviel?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01716
dialogue.text: H-How did you know? But yes, I'm his hired sword. I ran back to Tailfeather as swiftly as my legs could carry me, but no one here is willing to help us.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And why the hells not?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER01716
dialogue.text: Going into Gnath territory is tantamount to suicide. They warned us, but we ignored them, thinking we could manage. How wrong we were...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: There're people in need, Forename. Are we going to ignore their plight? Or are we going to lend them our aid?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Rescue the survey team?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We can't abandon them.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: But of course!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Heh, that was just a rhetorical question, but thanks for humoring me all the same! Aye, we'll go and rescue these people, and I'm sure you'd be no less enthused even if Sylviel weren't among them!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: As for you, friend─while we're off saving your employer's arse, I want you to tell the craven bastards here they're a bunch of craven bloody bastards!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Needless to say, I am coming as well. Let us begin by scouting the entrance to Loth ast Gnath.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: So that's the Gnath, eh? Is it just me, or does it look like they're all wearing hats?

dialogue.name: ASSUSTANT01716
dialogue.text: <pant> Please... They still have Master Sylviel...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: This man is Sylviel's assistant. He managed to win free, but Sylviel is still being held within. Let us go and extricate him!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Nothing to it!

dialogue.name: ASSUSTANT01716
dialogue.text: Thank you ever so much!

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: I did not think I would escape with my life.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Are you all right, Master Sylviel?

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: Aye. A little shaken, perhaps, but otherwise whole of body─a statement I am able to make thanks to your timely arrival. May I ask the names of my saviors?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I am Sanson, of the Order of the Twin Adder, and my companions are the bards Forename and Guydelot. We three are on a journey to find a legendary song. The Ballad of Oblivion, 'tis called, and we were given to understand that you may have knowledge of it.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But this is not an ideal place for conversation. Let us first return to Tailfeather.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: So, what's the next legendary feat on the agenda? A performance with moogles, perhaps?

dialogue.name: ASSUSTANT01716
dialogue.text: I shudder to think what may have happened had you not come to our rescue.

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: I harbor no ill feelings towards the people of Tailfeather for forsaking us. We are outsiders, after all, and they owe us nothing.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOHUNTERS01716
dialogue.text: So you're the heroes what went to the rescue, eh?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: This hunter here wishes a word with us.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOHUNTERS01716
dialogue.text: I won't keep you long─just wanted to say thanks for wakin' us up, is all. Tailfeather's made up o' folk who come here seekin' their fortune, you see, an' such folk tend to put themselves first.

dialogue.name: CHOCOBOHUNTERS01716
dialogue.text: But most of us are ashamed we didn't lift a finger to help them as were in need, an' we're determined to do better from now on. To be sure, gettin' called “craven bloody bastards” stung at first, but after the grumblin' died down, none could deny that it was the truth. An' that's all I wanted to say.

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: You certainly have a knack for moving people, my friends, though I suppose it is only to be expected of bards! But come, let us speak of the song you seek─the Ballad of Oblivion.

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: Coerthan legend speaks of a saint of song in the heavens. This saint is an individual with transcendent mastery over poetry and verse, and 'tis said that he can bring a battle to its conclusion with a song.

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: As for being in the heavens, I suspect it is a figurative expression, but I cannot say for certain at this juncture. I shall investigate the legend further─a small gesture of gratitude for having saved our lives.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: While we wait to hear from Master Sylviel, let us conduct our own investigation. Coerthan literature may yield us some clues.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: If you ask me, it sounds like naught but a faerie tale. I'd wager that “heavens” is just a metaphor for a natural phenomenon. We've hit a dead end─I say we return to Gridania for now and look for other avenues.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And if you ask me, I think it far too early to draw conclusions. I, for one, mean to continue searching until I find a definite answer. If you wish to abandon our mission, I'll not stop you.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But know that you would be judged a deserter. You would lose your place in the Gods' Quiver...and that would be precisely what your superiors had intended.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Look, Guydelot. You of all people must know the true reason they chose you for this mission. They wanted you out of the way! Your skills had naught to do with it!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text:
And it isn't so different for me! I was a thorn in their side, demanding cooperation when they were loath to give it! They were pleased to be rid of me as well, yet naught would please them more than for us to come back empty-handed!
That is why we must succeed! That is why we must find the Ballad of Oblivion!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: If you want to find the song so badly, you can bloody well find it yourself. I've had a gutful.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You're no bard─I doubt you even understand what gives a song its power. Yet here you are gallivanting about searching for one.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: To you, the Ballad of Oblivion is just a means to curry favor with the brass hats. Well, that's an insult to honest–to–gods bards like me and Forename.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Oh, gods, what have I done? I did not mean to be antagonizing...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Though my pride won't let me tell him this, I know that Guydelot is a truly exceptional bard. With his skills married to my unit composition, I had hoped that we might prove our detractors wrong. Alas, my words failed to convey that intent.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Given time, I believe that Guydelot will come around. I shall wait for him here. Meanwhile, I ask that you have patience with us.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Guydelot and I will draw them away! Please tend to Master Sylviel!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Y-You are...?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No time for chitchat! Hurry on out of here─we'll keep the Gnath occupied!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You have my thanks!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: <click> <click> Intruders! To arms, to arms!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Keep them away from Master Sylviel!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Thank you. I shall be fine from here.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Let's finish off this lot and quit this place!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Master Sylviel! Are you hurt?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No more than a few scratches, thanks to you.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You must...fight on...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Bugger... The rest is up to you...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No... I am not...ready...

obj.n: テイルフェザーの猟師

quest.name: 道は詩聖へと続く
journal: Sanson is holding out for Guydelot's return.

As promised, Sylviel has looked into the Coerthan legend pertaining to a saint of song in the heavens. Alas, the information he provided is not as promising as Sanson had hoped, with “the heavens” most likely referring to a natural phenomenon, as Guydelot had suspected. Just when Sanson resigns himself to accepting that the legend is a dead end, you reveal to him the existence of a tribe of moogles in the Churning Mists. The revelation spurs him to continue his mission, and he begs you to show him to Moghome. Before striking out, he bids you leave a message with Sylviel for Guydelot, in the hopes that the wayward bard will rejoin you later.

To your surprise, you find Sylviel conversing with Guydelot, who apparently has been watching you and Sanson from afar. Upon hearing of the moogles of Moghome, Sylviel concedes that the legend may in fact be referring to the creatures, and urges Guydelot to settle his differences with Sanson and accompany him to the Churning Mists. For now, however, a promise to think on it is the best the bard can offer. Your message thus delivered, make your way to Anyx Trine and rejoin Sanson.
Sanson is eager to continue on to the Churning Mists. Lead the way to the summit of Sohm Al, and speak with your companion when you arrive.

Shortly after arriving at Moghome, Sanson declares his intent to seek an audience with the moogle chieftain. As he walks away, you catch a glimpse of what appears to be Guydelot, hiding behind a rock. Set aside that sighting in your mind for the time being, and join Sanson for his meeting with Moglin.

Moglin informs you that the Ballad of Oblivion is exceedingly dangerous, and hence is forbidden among mooglekind. In spite of his ominous words, however, he goes to great lengths to point you in the direction of a moogle bard named Mogta, who has also shown an interest in the song. Sanson bids you meet him outside Moghome to discuss the chieftain's curious behavior.
Whatever Moglin's intention may be, Sanson believes that there is no harm in seeking out Mogta. Search for the moogle bard at the specified location in Eil Tohm.
Mogta does not appear to be in the area. Take your search to another part of Eil Tohm.
Mogta does not appear to be in the area. Take your search to yet another part of Eil Tohm.
Mogta does not appear to be in the area. Take your search towards the Landlord Colony.

Just as you are about to give up searching for Mogta, the moogle stumbles into you. You quickly establish your shared interest in the Ballad of Oblivion, and he becomes a member of your expedition. Return to Moghome and receive Moglin's blessing to search for the forbidden song.

Moglin declares that your company is still missing a little something, and so withholds his permission for you to seek the Ballad of Oblivion. Sanson discerns that something to be Guydelot, at which time you finally reveal to him your earlier sighting of the bard near Moghome. Mogta is convinced that he likes Guydelot, and reassures Sanson that you will yet find him and together continue your mission.

※The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with Sylviel.
Speak with Sanson at Anyx Trine.
Speak with Sanson outside Moghome.
Speak with Moglin at Moghome.
Speak with Sanson.
Search for Mogta.
Speak with Moglin.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Mountaintop Diplomacy.”

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Ah, it's you, Forename. If you are wondering about Guydelot, I'm afraid I've not seen him since he stormed out.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But I have spoken with Master Sylviel. As promised, he looked into the Coerthan legend─the saint of song in the heavens─and he came to share his findings.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Apparently, “the heavens” is a reference to a voice from the sky. It is most likely some form of natural phenomena, such as thunder and lightning.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Which means that Guydelot was right. After all, what else could a voice from the sky be? It isn't as though there are people who dwell in the clouds, and love to sing besides.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: ...What!? A tribe of moogles in the Churning Mists!? Why didn't you say so earlier!?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: If these moogles are patrons of music like their forest-dwelling counterparts, they may well know of the Ballad of Oblivion. Please, you must show me to their village!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: As for Guydelot... 'Twould seem he still requires time alone. But I daresay he will come after us once he hears we are on the right track.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Might I trouble you to leave a message with Master Sylviel, informing Guydelot of our destination? I shall await you at Anyx Trine.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Forename!?

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: Hah, 'twas but a matter of time before you found him. Lest you wonder, Guydelot has been watching you and Sanson from afar. Several times did he come to ask what I had been discussing with his friend.

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: ...Moogles at the summit of Sohm Al? I was not aware of this. And I certainly wouldn't discount the possibility that the legend may in fact refer to the creatures.

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: Guydelot, you should settle your differences with Sanson and go to the Churning Mists with your friends. Being stubborn is wearisome business, you know.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Damn it... I want to, but...ugh... Forename, you always seem to know what's best. Tell me, what should I do?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say to Guydelot?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Come with us.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You reckon I should go as well, eh? I'll...I'll think on it.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You want me to think for myself, is that it? Well, then, I'll do just that.

dialogue.name: SYLVIEL
dialogue.text: I wasn't aware that moogles also dwell in the Churning Mists. And I certainly wouldn't discount the possibility that the legend may in fact refer to the creatures.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Such an imposing structure... Were Guydelot here, he would doubtless be inspired to compose a song.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: From here on, I must rely upon you to lead the way. Let us ascend to the Churning Mists!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Such a magnificent view... I have no gift for verse. I must commit this scene to memory, that I might convey it all to Guydelot when next we meet.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Now then, 'tis only meet that we first present ourselves to the chieftain of Moghome. Let us seek him out.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Th-This is the chieftain? He has such...presence.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: The Ballad of Oblivion... I had not expected to hear the name from you, kupo.

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: It is a terrible, terrible song. Hence it is forbidden among mooglekind. Why, just earlier, I gave one of our bards a dressing-down simply for asking about it!

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: Ah, young Mogta... He was ever the inquisitive one. I hope he understands that I mean well. Lest you wonder, after being scolded, he flew off sulking and headed north of Moghome. That's Mogta, and to the north, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Forename, would you mind meeting up with me outside the village?

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: After his scolding, Mogta flew off sulking and headed north of Moghome. That's Mogta, and to the north, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Despite making much of the song's forbidden nature, it's clear that Chieftain Moglin wanted us to meet the moogle who shares our interest in it.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: What his motives are, I cannot say, but I see no harm in seeking out the bard of which he spoke. Twelve forbid you have forgotten this, but his name is Mogta, and he should be north of Moghome.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: No luck so far...

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Boneheaded...<mumble>...layabout...<grumble>...kupo.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I cannot seem to find the little creature. And I was so certain that the chieftain had intended for us to seek him out...

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: (-Skittish Moogle-)Kupopo!? P-Please don't eat me! I'm not nearly as sweet and succulent as I look!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Have no fear, little one. I promise we won't hurt you. Might you be Mogta, by any chance?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: You...you know my name? Who are you?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: ...You seek the Ballad of Oblivion? Why, I do believe we're looking for the same thing, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Recently, I learned about the existence of a potent song. Legend says it resounds through the heavens and destroys all. Curious to know more, I went to ask the chieftain about it, but he told me off...

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: It's beyond a single moogle to seek, he said. I need friends with me whom I trust, otherwise it'd be far too dangerous. Unfortunately, I have no friends, kupo...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Though we have only met, we share a common objective. Might we not seek the Ballad of Oblivion together─as friends?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: You...you would search with me?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Oh, joy of joys! I have friends!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Let's return to Moghome at once and have the chieftain tell us all about the song, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: I'm not alone, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I dare to hope that we will actually find the Ballad of Oblivion. Which just leaves the question of Guydelot...

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: Hmmm... That your hearts beat as one in this endeavor is plain to see. You are fit to look for the Ballad of Oblivion...

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: ...Is what I would say, except you are still missing a little something─a small but vital piece. I can't quite put a paw on it, but your fellowship is incomplete without it, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot─he is our missing piece. I believed that he would come back, but it seems I was wrong...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Is this true!? You caught sight of Guydelot here in the Churning Mists!?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: This Guydelot fellow─does he love music, kupo?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Aye, that he does. Like you, he is a bard, and he loves music with all his heart.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Then it's settled! Once Guydelot joins us, we'll embark upon our journey! Our band will be all the merrier for his company!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: If he's nearby, we're bound to find him. So please cheer up, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGLIN
dialogue.text: Until such time as your fellowship is whole, you may remain here as our guest, kupo.

quest.name: 終焉の戦歌
journal: Sanson has given up hope of Guydelot returning.

Together with Mogta, Sanson has searched high and low for Guydelot, but the bard is nowhere to be found; it would seem you must continue the mission without him. Mogta informs you that the Ballad of Oblivion is said to originate from the skies to the east, and you take this to mean the Sea of Clouds. Sanson declares that he will secure an airship to carry you there, and bids you meet him at the airship landing in Gridania. After the serpent captain takes his leave, Mogta reveals to you a secret: he has met with Guydelot, but could not convince the bard to return with him. The moogle believes that you may fare better than he did, and entrusts you with Sanson's journal in case it may be of use. Make your way to the peak of Sohm Al, where Guydelot is lingering, and show the journal to the bard.

In spite of the journal and your earnest pleading, Guydelot refuses to rejoin the fellowship, so ashamed is he of having accused Sanson of using song as a tool. You can only stand and watch as Guydelot leaves to do his soul-searching. Follow your two other companions back to Gridania, and join them at the airship landing.
Sanson has secured the use of an airship, and together you fly to the island of Mok Oogl, at the fringe of the Sea of Clouds. Speak with Sanson for further instructions.
Something upon the island has Mogta deeply unsettled, and Sanson believes it to be the Ballad of Oblivion. Do your part to scour the island, and report to Sanson.

You find Sanson staring longingly at a stone bearing strange markings. Mogta remembers that it is a stone of sealing, used to imprison baleful beings, but his warning comes a breath too late, and Sanson unleashes the siren that had been held within. The Ballad of Oblivion is revealed to be the fiend's soul-rending voice, which she used to annihilate the tribe of moogles that once dwelled upon Mok Oogl. Sanson is resolved to face the siren alone, and bids you and Mogta flee. At that moment, Guydelot makes his return, his words instilling Sanson with newfound courage. Together with your companions, you succeed in returning the siren to her stony prison. Though the Ballad of Oblivion never truly existed, Sanson believes that such abilities as you have mastered in the course of the mission will suffice to satisfy his superiors. Follow your friends back to the airship and let Sanson know when you are ready to return to Gridania.

Sanson expresses his heartfelt thanks for your invaluable contributions to the mission. While he makes his report to the Order of the Twin Adder and the Gods' Quiver, he bids you pay a visit to Jehantel west of Quarrymill, that you might regale the old bard with an account of your journey.

Jehantel thanks you for having watched over Sanson and Guydelot, and observes that your experiences have raised you higher as a bard. He bids you continue being a paragon of your art, enriching the hearts of men with song.

※The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Deliver Sanson's journal to Guydelot.
Speak with Sanson at the Gridania airship landing.
Speak with Sanson.
Speak with Jehantel west of Quarrymill.
Defeat Ligeia!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Guydelot sounds like a nice fellow! I can't wait to meet him, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: In spite of our best efforts, I'm afraid we weren't able to find Guydelot.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: If he had any intention to return, he would have done so by now. It seems plain we cannot depend upon him anymore.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But with or without him, we must continue our mission.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: I was so hoping to meet Guydelot, but I suppose the show must go on. Now, the legend says that the Ballad of Oblivion can be found in the skies to the east. Is there another place like the Churning Mists in that direction, kupo?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Is there a place like the Churning Mists?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes, it's called the Sea of Clouds.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes, the Ishgardians have an outpost there.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Truly? Then that is where we must go!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We will need to make a brief visit to Gridania, to secure the use of an airship to bear us there. Pray come to the landing when you arrive in the city.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: This is just between you and me, but I've actually spoken with Guydelot, kupo.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, he refused to come back, saying that he couldn't bear to face Sanson. I couldn't convince him to join us, but maybe you can, Forename. Here, take this with you.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: It's Sanson's journal, the one he's always writing in. I, uh...borrowed it. I thought that it might help if you were to show it to Guydelot. You'll find him at the summit of Sohm Al, kupo.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Please see if you can convince Guydelot to join us. Show him Sanson's journal if you think it'll help. You'll find him at the summit of Sohm Al, kupo.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Bah, that Mogta blabbed, didn't he!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Sanson's journal, is it? It's nigh filled cover to cover with writings on song. Huh... To see this, you'd think him a bard.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: <sigh> I've done a lot of thinking since we last spoke.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Though he's no bard, Sanson's bent on finding the song. Hells, he's keener on it than any one of us, and I couldn't understand why. But now I do.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Sanson truly believes in song─it's as simple as that. But in the heat of the moment, I accused him of using song as a tool.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: That was ill done, and I'm ashamed of myself. I can't bear to be in Sanson's company.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: ...You're off to the Sea of Clouds? Then I wish you luck. I can't go with you─I don't have the right.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I need to be alone right now and take a long, hard look at myself. You'd do best not to expect anything of me.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: I've made myself invisible with moogle magicks. You mustn't talk to me, or people will suspect, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I'm pleased to say I was able to secure the Order's cooperation. We have permission to take an airship to the Sea of Clouds!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Oh, joy of joys! I'm so excited, I can hear music from the general direction of the airship!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Let's not tarry─the Ballad of Oblivion awaits, kupo!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Travel to the Sea of Clouds?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Travel to the Gridania airship landing?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We've been granted permission to take an airship to the Sea of Clouds. Let us depart at once!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Something about this place makes my fur stand on end, kupo...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Mogta senses that an eldritch power rests here, and it fills him with dread. It can only be the Ballad of Oblivion.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Though this place is abandoned, such structures as remain are reminiscent of Moghome. If moogles once lived here, then we are surely on the right track. Let us scour the entire isle!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: This stone... It calls to me...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The Ballad of Oblivion is here! I've never felt so certain of anything in my life!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Where have I seen such markings before, kupo...?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: <gasp> I remember now! This is a sealing stone, used to seal away baleful beings! Y-You mustn't touch─

dialogue.name: LIGEIA
dialogue.text:
The long cold night is ended, banished by the hand of a fool.♪
Your dreams are mine to see, and your heart is mine to rule.♪

dialogue.name: LIGEIA
dialogue.text:
I sing a song of love, and such love I bear for you,♪
With all my heart I give it, and know my heart is true.♪
As I once loved the creatures who upon this land did dwell,♪
But they cast aside my love, so I sent them all to hell.♪

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Unnngh... M-My head─nay, my very soul is like to split... What...what is this voice?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Resounds through the heavens and destroys all... Oh, gods, this is the Ballad of Oblivion!?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: And this fiend used it to lay waste to an entire tribe of moogles! This isn't a song...this is an outrage, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: All this time, the thing I sought didn't even exist...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: 'Twas I who released this menace into the world. I will vanquish it, even if it costs me my life. Flee this place, the both of you!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Who do you think you're trying to impress?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Forename and Mogta aren't running anywhere, and neither am I. We're in this together─to the bitter end!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: G-Guydelot!? Why are you here!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: <sigh> I'm here because you know nothing, Sanson the Stiff. I can't well leave you to your own devices.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Prick up your ears, because I'm not going to say this again: it's the fervent desire to aid our comrades that bestows our songs with power.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And no songs have more power than those you compose yourself! If there's no Ballad of Oblivion to be had, we'll just have to create it!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Yes... Yes, you have the right of it. Let ours be the song of triumph over a legendary fiend!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Hah, I like the sound of that! Now then, there're four of us to battle the siren. This makes the song a quartet, eh!?

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Whew... The sealing stone is back to the way it was, kupo.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: ...You were with us aboard the airship!? But there's scarcely any room to─ Ack, never mind that now! Wherever it was you were hiding, you made us all worried sick! Do you know that!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: If I didn't know before, I certainly do now. I also know how hard you've been working, thanks to this.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: M-My journal! Where did you─!? Give that back this instant! I need it to write my report!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Balls you do! We composed our own Ballad of Oblivion─that's all you need to write!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Hmmm... Now that I think about it, my superiors will demand more tangible results...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Ah, but of course! Such abilities that Forename mastered during the journey─they shall serve admirably!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Bah, make up your bloody mind!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: When I return to Moghome, I'm going to tell everyone that we created our very own Ballad of Oblivion, kupo!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Speaking of returning, I'd best get back to being a Quiverman. And who knows? I might even try to behave myself from now on. But whatever I might get up to, know that I won't rest until I surpass both Jehantel and Forename!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I look forward to the day that you do. Remember, my plan can't succeed without you.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Please send me word when the unit is formed! I'll come and pay everyone a visit, kupo!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You shall be the first to know, my friend.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And on that note, let's go home!

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Please send me word when Sanson and Guydelot form their unit! I'll come and pay everyone a visit, kupo!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Let's be on our way, eh?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Upon returning to Gridania, I must report to both the Order of the Twin Adder and the Gods' Quiver. While I attend to business, might I trouble you to pay Jehantel a visit? He will doubtless desire to hear an account of our journey.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename─for everything. I know not when it will be, but I look forward to the day we meet again.

dialogue.name: MOGTA
dialogue.text: Guydelot and Sanson have returned to their duties, and I suppose you have things to get back to as well. I do believe I'll take this opportunity to see the sights and sounds of the Twelveswood. Do send Jehantel my regards, kupo!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: ...A rousing tale of friendship in the face of adversity. I thank you for watching over Sanson and Guydelot. When Sanson's plan begins taking shape, he may count on me to aid him in whatever way I am able.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: As for you, my friend, 'tis plain that your experiences have raised you higher as a bard, as I had expected they would. I pray that you shall ever be a paragon of our art, enriching the hearts of men with song.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the bard quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next bard quest will be available from Jehantel.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Hush now, my dearest, close your weary eyes.♪
Bask in the warmth of my tender lullaby.♪

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No, fiend! You're the one who will be sleeping!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You call that a song!? Don't make me laugh!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Why deny your feelings, why keep your love from me?♪
Give your heart to my song, and it shall set you free.♪

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Be careful, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I've got a bad feeling about this!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
My love unrequited, I hunger for your kiss,♪
I taste only tears, will I ne'er know true bliss?♪

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Keep your guard up!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Your music is bad and you should feel bad!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Lost to your affection, I languish in the night.♪
My salvation lies in your love's precious light.♪

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Just a little further, kupo!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Our own Ballad of Oblivion...for your consideration, fiend!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Confound it...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ungh... You must finish...our song...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: And I'm spent, kupo...

quest.name: 不浄なるもの
journal: Raya-O-Senna has a task of great import for you.
Trouble is afoot in the Twelveswood once more, and Raya–O has dire need of your aid. Do as she bids and meet her before the Guardian Tree in the Central Shroud.

At the Guardian Tree, Raya–O and A–Ruhn inform you of the unsettling change that has come over the great one. The elemental has taken to repeating the same warning that the taint shall flood the Twelveswood, but offers scant details. In order to learn about this threat, the Seedseers bid you seek out a former student of the legendary A–Towa–Cant. Make your way to Fallgourd Float, where the man is said to reside, and ask the locals to point you in his direction.

According to the denizens of Fallgourd Float, A–Towa–Cant's student passed away some years ago, and his granddaughter now tends his master's tomb in his stead. Make your way to Proud Creek, where the tomb is located, and find the granddaughter, a woman named Eschiva.
You arrive at the tomb to find Eschiva under attack from fiends, and you jump to her rescue. Having secured the area, turn your attention now to Eschiva.

Eschiva reads the Seedseers' missive, and is shocked to learn that the taint threatens the Twelveswood once more. The taint, she explains, is befouled aether, and it must be purged at the source. Make your way back to the Guardian Tree and be present for her meeting with the Seedseers.

The two Padjals are dismayed to learn that they must leave the Twelveswood if they are to defeat the taint. With their duties binding them to the forest, it falls to you to undertake the journey of purification, as the great A–Towa–Cant once did. Wishing to emulate her grandfather's deeds, Eschiva begs to join you on your journey. Speak with her again to reaffirm her intent.
Eschiva would make plans for the journey ahead, and invites you to meet her at Fallgourd Float.

At Fallgourd Float, Eschiva openly expresses her displeasure at the two Seedseers for their unwillingness to act. Having given vent to her irritation, she promises to scour her grandfather's records for clues, and bids you see to your own preparations ahead of the grueling journey.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Eschiva upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Raya-O-Senna at the Guardian Tree.
Gather information at Fallgourd Float.
Search for Eschiva.
Deliver the Seedseers' missive to Eschiva.
Speak with Raya-O-Senna at the Guardian Tree.
Speak with Eschiva.
Speak with Eschiva at Fallgourd Float.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename, you could not have come at a better time! We have dire need of your aid!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: There isn't time to explain. Know but that trouble is afoot, and I would ask you to meet me at the Guardian Tree.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Pray make haste to the Guardian Tree. I shall explain the situation when you arrive.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming on such short notice. We knew not who else we might turn to.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: How fares the great one?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Unchanged from before, I'm afraid. He repeats the same words, over and over.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Then it falls to us to glean their meaning. Very well.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename. You will recall the time we performed the Quieting and quelled the great one's rage. Since that day, we have continued communing with him to ensure that all is well. And it was, until recently.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I am afraid to say that an unsettling change came over the great one some days ago. He has taken to repeating the same words to us: “The taint floodeth the forest, its beating heart to befoul.”

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: After some inquiries and research, we were able to learn that the great one has spoken these words before, during the time of A–Towa–Cant.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Immediately, we were made to wonder: when Master A–Towa embarked upon his journey of healing, could his purpose have been to protect the forest from the taint of which the great one now warns?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: We sought to delve further into this, but no accounts of Master A–Towa's journey are to be found at Stillglade Fane. Such records as exist are in the keeping of his foremost student, the mage who recovered his remains from O'Ghomoro.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: If he is still alive, he may be able to assist us. We have prepared a missive, and we would ask that you deliver it into his hands.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: After interring his beloved master, the man is said to have taken up residence at Fallgourd Float, that he might ever be near to tend the tomb. If he is there still, the locals should be able to point you in his direction.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: While you see to this task, my brother and I shall remain here and continue observing the great one. My thanks in advance, Forename.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Whatever the taint is, it seems plain we must eliminate it.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: It is deeply unsettling to see the great one behave so.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The people of Fallgourd Float should know where Master A–Towa's student might be found. I suggest you speak with them first.

dialogue.name: THIERRAND
dialogue.text: You seek Master A–Towa's former student? I am afraid he has departed for the realm yonder. His granddaughter now tends the tomb at Proud Creek in his stead.

dialogue.name: THIERRAND
dialogue.text: If truth be told, I am worried about her. The area is thick with fiends, and even experienced Wood Wailers avoid venturing there unaccompanied.

dialogue.name: SOMERHILD
dialogue.text: A–Towa–Cant's old student? Hm, I'd heard that someone's tending the tomb, but it's a young maid as I recall.

dialogue.name: AELUUIN
dialogue.text: That old fellow? I'm afraid he passed away some years ago. I remember him well, though. He took care of his master's tomb to the very end.

dialogue.name: THIERRAND
dialogue.text: His granddaughter Eschiva tends the place now, and she's been especially attentive since those accursed bandits came and defiled it.

dialogue.name: THIERRAND
dialogue.text: Though Master A–Towa's student is no longer with us, his granddaughter tends the tomb at Proud Creek in his stead. If truth be told, I am worried about her. The area is thick with fiends, and even experienced Wood Wailers avoid venturing there unaccompanied.

dialogue.name: SOMERHILD
dialogue.text: A–Towa–Cant's old student? Hm, I'd heard that someone's tending the tomb, but it's a young maid as I recall.

dialogue.name: THIERRAND
dialogue.text: The old fellow they say was A–Towa–Cant's student passed away some years ago. His granddaughter Eschiva tends the tomb now, and she's been especially attentive since bandits defiled it.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: <pant> Th-Thank you so much... So focused was I on tending the tomb, I failed to notice the fiends approaching me...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: What? You're searching for the granddaughter of Master A–Towa's former student?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Then you need search no more. I am Eschiva.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Know that I have taken on my grandfather's responsibilities. If it is within my power to help the Seedseers, then I should be glad to do so.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The taint threatens the Twelveswood? Nophica have mercy...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: As the Seedseers have surmised, 'twas to purge the taint that Master A–Towa journeyed the length and breadth of the realm.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Simply put, the taint is aether that has been befouled. If we are to be rid of it, we must find the source of the corruption and cleanse it.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The question is, are the Seedseers prepared to do as Master A–Towa once did?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: At any rate, it is best that I speak with them directly. I shall make my way to the Guardian Tree at once.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: A journey...outside the forest?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The Seedseers know what they must do. But are they willing to do it?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: My thanks for finding Eschiva, Forename. She has told us all.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: If we are to protect the Twelveswood from the taint, we must needs deal with the corruption at its source. Is that the way of it?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: It is. That was why Master A–Towa embarked upon his journey, heedless of his Padjali heritage.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And yet Master A–Towa was no ordinary Padjal... We are duty-bound to remain in the forest─we cannot simply leave it.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename. I am loath to ask this of you, after all you have already done for us, but the preservation of the Twelveswood is at stake.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: You are not Padjali, and hence are not bound by the laws which bind us. Will you embark upon this quest in our stead?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
