dialogue.text: With all due respect, I cannot believe what I'm hearing! You would entrust the fate of the forest to an adventurer!?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, and know that Forename is no ordinary adventurer. Nay, shehe is a white mage true, chosen by Master A–Towa himself to be his successor. SheHe bears his soul crystal and his legacy both.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I have every confidence that you will be able to purge the taint. As such, I would join my voice to my brother's request.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Master A–Towa's successor? That such an individual existed...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I wish to make a request of my own. In his youth, my grandfather served Master A–Towa proudly, accompanying him wheresoever he went and assisting in purification rituals.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: It has ever been my desire to emulate my grandfather's deeds. If Forename is to undertake this quest to eliminate the taint, I would likewise accompany and assist herhim.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The journey will be fraught with peril. Are you willing to risk life and limb solely for the sake of emulating your grandfather?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I am, my lady, but that is not the whole of it. I cannot sit idly by while a threat encroaches upon the Twelveswood. It is our home, and we each of us must do our part to protect it.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Our part...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I see that your heart is true. Very well. Assuming that Forename consents─and I see no reason why shehe would not─you have our blessing to accompany herhim.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The fate of the Twelveswood is in your hands. We shall pray for your success.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: 'Tis no simple matter for a Padjal to leave the Twelveswood. Once again, we must rely upon you, my friend.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The fate of the Twelveswood is in your hands. We shall pray for your success.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: We will need to make plans for the journey. Please come and see me at Fallgourd Float.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Hmph! And they call themselves Padjals!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You wonder at my irritation, I shouldn't doubt. I suppose I ought to explain. You see, I was brought up on the tales of Master A–Towa's journeys─the sufferings he endured for the sake of the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Young though I was, I was deeply touched by his courage and sacrifice, and to this day his deeds remain close to my heart. That is why it irks me that the Seedseers will not lift a finger to help the forest!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: But thankfully, we have you. As Master A–Towa's chosen, you are far more dependable than any Padjal alive.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Now then, let us speak of our journey. Grandfather left his records of Master A–Towa's journeys in my keeping. I shall scour them for clues as to where we must go.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: While I do this, pray attend to your own preparations. I shall be here when you are ready to strike out.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next white mage quest will be available from Eschiva upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 浄化の旅へ
journal: Eschiva has uncovered a clue for your quest to purge the taint.

The taint was once borne to the Twelveswood via subterranean water veins, and Eschiva has reason to believe that it comes again in like manner. She bids you meet her at Camp Dragonhead in the central highlands of Coerthas, that you might investigate water veins in the area.

Eschiva has learned that a water vein passes beneath an area to the south. The fiends that lurk there have grown unnaturally aggressive of late, and Eschiva attributes this change to the taint's influence. A regiment of knights is currently on a mission to cull the frenzied creatures, and Eschiva suggests that you join them. Meet her at the specified spot south of Camp Dragonhead.
With your aid, the knights succeed in eliminating the frenzied creatures. The area thus secured, you may now purify the manifestation of the taint.

Immediately after you purify the taint, your soul crystal takes on a new radiance─a bestowal of power from A–Towa–Cant, if Eschiva is to be believed. Your companion goes on to posit that the act of purifying serves to empower the white mage. Return to Camp Dragonhead to discuss the next step of your mission with Eschiva.

Eschiva informs you that the headwater of the vein you just visited is situated further west, and through the city of Ishgard. While she conducts research on your next destination, take the time to accustom yourself with your newfound power, that you might be prepared for the challenges ahead.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Eschiva upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Eschiva at Camp Dragonhead.
Speak with Eschiva.
Purify the taint.
Speak with Eschiva.
Defeat the enemy!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You come at a good time, Forename. I believe I have found a clue in my grandfather's records.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: There is a passage which tells of the time when the taint reached the forest via a subterranean water vein. Master A–Towa traced it back to its source at Abalathia's Spine, and there he purged the corruption.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder, 'tis the mention of the water vein that interests me. Allow me to explain.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Though the danger to the Twelveswood has become so dire as to elicit emphatic warnings from the great one, none of the Padjals or Hearers were aware of it.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: If we then consider the great one's warning that the taint shall “flood” the forest, I am inclined to conclude that befouled aether is being conveyed via water veins.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Years have passed since Master A–Towa purged the taint. A new source of corruption may well have manifested in the intervening time.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: First, I suggest we take our investigation to the central highlands of Coerthas, which form the southern edge of Abalathia's Spine. Pray meet me at Camp Dragonhead.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Everything is frozen over... I had read about the snow–swept mountains of Coerthas, but no amount of reading can substitute for seeing...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I have a confession to make: this is my very first time setting foot outside the Twelveswood. The experience is proving to be at once fascinating and frightening. But I digress...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: While I awaited your arrival, I spoke with some of the knights about water veins. They say that one passes beneath the area just south of here.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The area happens to be thick with fiends. And these fiends happen to have grown unnaturally aggressive of late.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I would wager that the taint is to blame for this change.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: A short while ago, a band of knights departed for the area in question on a mission to cull the unruly creatures. Shall we go and join them?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: My suspicions were correct─the taint has driven the fiends into a frenzy! Let us aid the knights, then see to the cleansing!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: There it is, Forename─the taint. I trust you know what to do.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: This energy, soothing and pure... 'Tis precisely as my grandfather wrote...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: And your soul crystal─I believe it has taken on a new radiance!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: In all likelihood, the spirit of Master A–Towa within has bestowed upon you greater power.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I wonder... Could it be that the act of purifying serves to empower the white mage?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: If this is true, it makes the Padjals' refusal to leave the forest even more incomprehensible.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: <sigh> How long will they allow their laws to dictate their actions to the detriment of reason?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: At any rate, there is naught more to do here. Let us return to Camp Dragonhead.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Let us review what we've learned. As we had suspected, the taint is being borne along subterranean water veins.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: According to my grandfather's records, the headwater of the vein we just visited is situated further to the west.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, it lies beyond the Holy See of Ishgard. As foreigners, we will require special permission to pass through the city.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I shall contact Stillglade Fane and request to have the Elder Seedseer issue us with the necessary papers.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Of course, were one of the Seedseers here, we would not have to go through all this hassle.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: We must pass through Ishgard proper to get there. Fortunately, travel restrictions have been eased since the Holy See was restored to the Alliance.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, we will be venturing into the unknown. Master A–Towa's journeys did not take him there, and there is no telling what awaits us. We must tread warily and be no less than fully prepared.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Had the Seedseers been willing to come, with your powers combined, we would have been able to go boldly forward. But there is no point in dwelling upon that now.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I shall survey the lay of the land in order to ascertain our next destination.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, I suggest you take the time to accustom yourself to your newfound power. I shall be here when you are ready to resume our mission.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I'll attend the fiends! Pray focus on mending our hurts!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Curses! Fiends are being drawn to the taint!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Is there no end to them!?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The sprite! We must strike it down first!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: We're almost done!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I was...unready...

quest.name: 竜を見つめる女
journal: Eschiva is ready to resume the mission to purge the taint.

Eschiva has completed the necessary preparations for the next leg of your mission, which will take you to the western highlands of Coerthas. She suggests that you first make a stop in the hamlet of Falcon's Nest, that you might gather information from the locals.
You rejoin Eschiva at Falcon's Nest. Having mused about her grandfather's journeys, she bids you speak with the locals and ask whether they know anything of the taint.

Much to your chagrin, the locals know nothing of the taint. However, they tell you that a foreign woman reeking of death has come through Falcon's Nest recently. Make your way to the northern entrance of Falcon's Nest and report your findings to Eschiva.

It appears your investigation will take you in the same direction as the foreign woman. Setting aside the question of coincidence in your mind, make your way to the northwestern corner of the western highlands, to the area south of the Slate Mountains, and rejoin Eschiva.

You and Eschiva find the foreign woman crouching over the remains of a dragon. At the end of an awkward conversation, the woman warns you to leave her alone. Who is this Alaqa, and what is her purpose? Though such questions plague you, for now you must focus on your mission. Eschiva believes that the taint has manifested nearby; find it and purify it.
You have succeeded in purifying the second manifestation of the taint. Rejoin Eschiva west of Banepool and relay the good tidings to her.
Eschiva is pleased to hear that the taint corrupts the area no more. Rather than stand out in the cold, she suggests you first return to Falcon's Nest to discuss recent events.

Though shaken by her meeting with the mysterious Alaqa, Eschiva is determined to continue the mission to rid the realm of the taint. While she resumes her investigation of water veins, continue honing your powers of purification, for they will be called upon again before long.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Eschiva upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with Eschiva at Falcon's Nest.
Gather information at Falcon's Nest.
Speak with Eschiva.
Speak with Eschiva south of the Slate Mountains.
Find the taint and purify it.
Report to Eschiva.
Speak with Eschiva.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I am terribly sorry for the wait, Forename.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: It has taken a while, but our request to pass through Ishgard has been granted. We may now continue on to the western highlands.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: It has taken a while, but I believe we are now armed with sufficient knowledge of our destination. Let us continue on to the western highlands.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: First, I suggest we make a brief stop in Falcon's Nest. If there has been an anomaly in the area, the locals may be able to tell us something.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: So this is Falcon's Nest... To think that architectural styles can differ so even within the same nation...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Going to new places is a veritable feast for the senses. Such wonders Grandfather must have beheld in his journeys with Master A–Towa...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Ah, but such musings must wait─we have a task to do. Let us begin by speaking with the people here.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: When you have finished, pray come and meet me at the hamlet's northern entrance.

dialogue.name: FORCHETAIX
dialogue.text: ...The taint? Never heard of it. We've had a strange visitor, however─a foreign woman with the stench of death about her.

dialogue.name: FORCHETAIX
dialogue.text:
Suspicious as she was, I decided to steal a peek at her belongings, and─
Unnngh... Forgive me, but the mere recollection of it is like to bring up my lunchsupperbreakfast...

dialogue.name: FORCHETAIX
dialogue.text: Anyway, after that, some few of us confronted her and demanded to know her purpose, but she refused to say a word. Nay, she looked straight through us with empty eyes and left the hamlet. As I recall, she was headed to the north and west. Wherever it is she has gone, we are well rid of her.

dialogue.name: TOURCENET
dialogue.text: I am unfamiliar with this taint of which you speak. We do consider dragons unclean, however.

dialogue.name: TOURCENET
dialogue.text: Speaking of the beasts, lately, there have been reports of a strange woman skulking about their remains. We are on the lookout for her, lest she prove to be a heretic.

dialogue.name: FORCHETAIX
dialogue.text: The foreign woman who reeked of death? After we confronted her, she left the hamlet and struck out to the north and west. We are well rid of her, I tell you.

dialogue.name: TOURCENET
dialogue.text: A strange woman has been skulking about dragon remains. Should you catch sight of her, we would thank you to inform us.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The rumors of this strange woman are on everyone's lips. This is likely but a coincidence, but it appears we are headed in the same direction as her.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: There are water sources in the northwestern corner of the region─frozen lakes, to be precise─and I would take our investigation there.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I mislike the sound of this woman, and I'd sooner not cross paths with her, but we have a mission to fulfill. Let us keep moving.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Good gods! The stench is overpowering, even in this frigid clime!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Um, forgive me for interrupting, but what are you doing?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: (-Malodorous Maiden-)Searching.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: (-Malodorous Maiden-)Hmph... Rather more damaged than I would have liked, but it will serve. After all, the experiment proceeds apace.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Experiment? What in the heavens are you doing?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: (-Malodorous Maiden-)Why must I justify myself to you?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: W-Well, I suppose you have no obligation to do so. It's just not every day that I see someone, er, rummaging through a dragon's corpse.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: (-Malodorous Maiden-)So I frighten you, then. You find me repulsive, like the rest of them.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: N-No, you misunderstand! I didn't mean to give offense!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Whatever you do is your business, to be sure, but it isn't safe to be alone out here.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: (-Malodorous Maiden-)What would you suggest, then? That I find a stout protector like your friend? As if anyone would be willing to help me...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: (-Malodorous Maiden-)Hm? This aura you emanate... They sent you to hound me, haven't they? To remind that witch Alaqa that she has no place in the world!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: ...Alaqa?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I am warning you: leave me alone.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Well, that was certainly queer... I know not what compelled me to speak with that woman─Alaqa, I believed she called herself─but I must confess to being morbidly curious about her experiment. But I mustn't let myself be distracted─we have work to do.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Unless I am mistaken, the taint has manifested in this area. Let us split up and search for it.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Nothing so far. Keep searching, Forename.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You found the taint and purified it? Well done!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Though, I cannot help but wonder: is it truly a coincidence that the taint chanced to have manifested where we met Alaqa?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Brrr... Being frozen to the bone isn't conducive to conversation. Let us return to Falcon's Nest and warm ourselves before we discuss matters in earnest.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: With your most recent effort, I sense that your powers continue to grow. Suffice it to say this is a boon to our cause.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The mission proceeds smoothly thus far. If we continue following the water vein, it should lead us to the source of the taint.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: As for the stranger, Alaqa─never have I felt so unsettled in someone's presence.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The thought that she might be connected to the taint also bothers me, but until we know for certain, it avails us naught to dwell upon it.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: For now, I shall resume my investigation of water veins and try to deduce other locations where the taint might appear.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Leave the investigative aspect of the mission to me, and pray continue honing your powers of purification. After all, no one else can purge the taint but you.

quest.name: 蠢動する穢れ
journal: Eschiva has terrible news regarding the taint.

A troubled Eschiva informs you that the taint you earlier cleansed in the western highlands has reappeared. Consequently, the creatures nearby were driven into a frenzy once more, and they reportedly attacked a knight on patrol. Though the man managed to flee to the Convictory, he has suffered grievous wounds. And to compound matters, all of the camp's chirurgeons are afield and cannot readily return. Eschiva believes that you are his only chance for survival; do as she bids and make haste to the Convictory.
You arrive at the Convictory to find the wounded knight upon the ground, writhing in pain. Cast the Cure II spell on him and free him from his hurts.
Thanks to you, the knight will live. While Eschiva continues caring for him, make your way back to the taint that has reappeared west of Banepool, and purify it with extreme prejudice.

You succeed in purifying the taint a second time, shortly after which Eschiva arrives with information from the knight you saved. Before he was attacked, the man claims to have witnessed a woman fitting Alaqa's description heading west towards the Dravanian forelands. Convinced that Alaqa is somehow connected to the taint, Eschiva declares her intent to track her down. Make your own way to the Dravanian forelands and join her at the settlement of Tailfeather.

Eschiva informs you that a strange woman has been seen coming and going from Tailfeather. While Eschiva continues gathering information, dedicate yourself to honing your powers, that you might be prepared for the inevitable confrontation with Alaqa.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Eschiva upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Eschiva.
Cast Cure II on the wounded knight.
Purify the taint.
Speak with Eschiva at Tailfeather.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Terrible news, Forename! The manifestation of the taint you purged here has reappeared!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The fiends nearby were driven into a frenzy all over again, and they reportedly attacked a knight on patrol.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Though the man managed to flee to the Convictory, his wounds are grievous. And to compound matters, the camp's chirurgeons are all afield and cannot readily return.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You are his only chance, Forename. You must go to the Convictory and save him.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: He is in a bad way. Please hurry and tend to his hurts.

dialogue.name: NOBLE01722
dialogue.text: I can't die... <gasp> What will become...of my family?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: He is in a bad way. Please hurry and tend to his hurts.

dialogue.name: NOBLE01722
dialogue.text: Th-The pain fades... I...I owe you a debt of gratitude...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Thanks to you, the danger is past. However, he will still require constant care for a time.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I shall remain on hand to help provide it. Meanwhile, you must go and purify the taint that has reappeared west of Banepool.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Only you have the power to do so, Forename. Please hurry before it can cause any more harm!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You must go and purify the taint that has reappeared west of Banepool. Please hurry before it can cause any more harm!

dialogue.name: NOBLE01722
dialogue.text: You saved my life... Thank you...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I'm pleased to say that the knight will make a full recovery. Had you not come to his aid, his comrades believe he would have died.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I see you have already purified the taint. Good work, Forename.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I must say, though, that its reappearance baffles me. It should have taken far longer for befouled aether to accumulate.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I am disinclined to believe that this came about by itself. Nay, I sense that someone had a hand in this.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I spoke with the knight after he had sufficiently recovered. Shortly before he was attacked, he caught sight of the foreign woman who reeks of death─Alaqa.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Wherever she appears, so too does the taint... I wasn't certain before, but now I'm convinced that it is no mere coincidence.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Could it be that she is creating the taint? If so, to what end? Why would she do such a thing?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I know not her designs, but her actions cannot be borne.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Should the taint continue to manifest, both Coerthas and the Twelveswood would suffer unimaginable damage.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Stillglade Fane must know of this threat. I shall send word to them.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Though I shan't raise my hopes that the Seedseers will bestir themselves. Best to assume that we are on our own.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Now then, our priority now is to track down Alaqa. The knight said that she was headed west to the Dravanian forelands.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Let us take our search to the main settlement there─Tailfeather, I believe it's called.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I have spoken with a handful of locals. A strange woman has been witnessed coming and going, and with some regularity.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I'm reasonably confident that it is Alaqa, but I shall try to gather more information for good measure.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Something occurs to me, Forename. If Alaqa is indeed responsible for creating the taint, she'll not take kindly to our purifying it. It may well come to a confrontation.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Pray use this time to further hone your powers, for we shall have need of them ere long.

quest.name: 私を否定するもの
journal: Eschiva is eager to share new information on Alaqa.

Eschiva informs you that Alaqa was recently seen heading west into dragon territory, most likely to continue her experiment. Make your own way west and join Eschiva at Avalonia Fallen, where you will attempt to pick up Alaqa's trail.

In the interests of expedience, Eschiva suggests that the two of you split up and look for Alaqa. Focus your search in the area north of Avalonia Fallen, and purify any manifestations of the taint you come upon.
You come upon a manifestation of the taint and purify it, but Alaqa does not appear to be in the area. Make your way to the west of Avalonia Fallen and rejoin Eschiva.

You arrive to find Eschiva on her knees, Alaqa standing before her. A heated exchange ensues between the two women, during which Alaqa admits to creating the taint for her experiment. Eschiva bids you stop her, but you are interrupted by fiends drawn to befouled aether. Defeat them, and purify the taint that has manifested.
You have defeated the fiends and purified the taint. Turn your attention to Eschiva and offer her your assistance.

You show Eschiva the peculiar hunk of flesh you found in the aftermath of battle─in all likelihood something from Alaqa's twisted experiment. At your urging, Eschiva agrees to take this discovery to the Seedseers and petition their aid.
objectives: Speak with Eschiva.
Find the taint and purify it.
Rejoin Eschiva.
Purify the taint.
Assist Eschiva.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Good tidings, Forename! I have acquired definite information on Alaqa!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: As before, the stench of death gave her away─a hunter she chanced to walk near couldn't help but notice the smell. When she realized that she was being observed, she quickly turned her steps west, towards dragon territory.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The hunter shouted a warning, but she continued on heedless. In light of her...inclinations, I daresay she has business there.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: There is an area called Avalonia Fallen to the west. Let us head in that direction and try to pick up Alaqa's trail.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Hm, no signs of Alaqa... And the area beyond is fraught with danger─not even hunters dare venture in.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I would sooner not wander these parts without some guarantee that Alaqa is near, but we cannot afford to delay lest she elude us completely.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Let us split up and search. If you would focus on the area to the north, I shall follow the highroad west.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Oh, and do keep an eye out for the taint. If Alaqa is here, it is like to have manifested.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Nothing here thus far. Please focus your search on the area to the north.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Alaqa is not here. Rejoin Eschiva on the westbound highroad.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: You should not have startled me.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: You...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I see. You are the one who undid my work.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Why do you interfere with my experiment?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: So it was you who created the taint!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: ...The taint, you say? An insult born of ignorance. What you so callously destroyed is a wellspring of life-giving aether.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: (-Eschiva-)What are you saying? The taint is befouled aether! It destroys life!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: So you choose to cling to your ignorance, like all the others. But it matters not what you think. When my experiment is complete, all the fools who tormented me and mine shall get their comeuppance.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: No! We won't let you continue your twisted experiment! Forename, stop her!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I believe you have more pressing concerns.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Drawn to the aether, I shouldn't doubt─or the taint, as you insist on calling it. But such details are immaterial. By whatever name it is known, I shall fill the world with it and have my revenge!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Do not interfere. Consider this your final warning.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM000
dialogue.text: You find a peculiar hunk of flesh on the ground.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. Again, you have saved me, and again, I am reminded of my own weakness...

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Hm? What do you have there?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Ugh, 'tis well I skipped my last meal... I'd wager this is part of Alaqa's experiment.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The Seedseers may be able to glean something from it...and yet I find myself loath to seek them out.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: They haven't lifted so much as a finger to help us. What can we expect of them now?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We should consult them anyway.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Now is not the time to be stubborn.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You have the right of it, Forename. There is more at stake than a difference of opinion.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: If we are to save the Twelveswood, we must needs turn to the Seedseers for aid. It's settled, then─we return to the Twelveswood.

quest.name: 角尊は惑う
journal: Eschiva is ready to return to the Twelveswood to petition the Seedseers' aid.
Eschiva has given the hunk of tainted flesh over to your keeping. Make your way to Camp Tranquil in the South Shroud, and present it to Raya–O–Senna.

Having dared to hope that the Seedseers will bestir themselves, Eschiva is furious when it becomes evident that they mean to have you bear the burden of dealing with Alaqa. She storms off, and the two Seedseers are left to ponder her words. Though the law binds them to the forest, they concede that it will all count for naught if the people lose faith in them. For the time being, sit tight while A–Ruhn examines the piece of tainted flesh for clues.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Deliver the tainted flesh to Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Please hold on to the hunk of flesh. It is, er...safer in your keeping.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Now then, let us return to Camp Tranquil and explain the situation to the Seedseers.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The great one's warnings have not abated. On the contrary, they have become more fervent.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The situation grows ever more dire, but will it be enough to spur the Seedseers to action?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text:
Ah, you are returned! How fares the effort to purge the taint?
...Hm? You wish to show us something?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: What does it tell us, Brother?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: The elementals are in trepidation of the flesh. It is infused with befouled aether, of this there can be no doubt.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: And with the great one's warnings growing ever more fervent, it seems plain that this Alaqa continues to sow the taint.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Whatever it is she seeks to do, we must put a stop to it!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn and I shall take a closer look at the flesh. In the meantime, you must resume your journey of purification.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: What!? With all due respect─ Oh, to hells with respect! I can't believe what I'm hearing! You would send us back into the midst of danger, and with nary a word of counsel!?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I know full well that we ask much of you, but there is none other upon whom we can depend.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Depend, you say? Instead of depending upon others, why don't you do something for a change!? We all know that you both have the power to do so!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Do you realize how much Forename has been through in your names?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Oh, but of course you don't, because while shehe bled for you, you were hiding here with your heads in the treetops!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: If Master A–Towa were to see this, he would be turning in his grave!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Heads in the treetops? What is the matter with her?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: To think that our own people see us in such a light...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: It cannot be helped, Brother─we are bound to remain in the forest. Things are not as they were during Master A–Towa's time.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, were the people to lose faith in us, for whom shall we convey the will of the elementals?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename, but I would be alone. Rest assured I will take a closer look at the tainted flesh.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A-Ruhn has the right of it. It is our duty to facilitate harmony between man and elemental. All the laws of the forest count for naught if we fail in this.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: At any rate, we must needs stop Alaqa's dark designs. And fear not, Forename. Henceforth, we will not leave you to bear the burden alone. Pray allow us the time to consider our next step.

quest.name: 世界の癒し手
journal: Raya–O would call a meeting to discuss measures against the taint.
Raya–O informs you that she and A–Ruhn have conceived a plan to deal with the taint. Go and fetch Eschiva from Fallgourd Float, that they might share the particulars with everyone.
Eschiva is surprised that the Seedseers still wish to see her in spite of her earlier display. Deciding that she may have been too quick to judge them, she agrees to come with you to Camp Tranquil.

Much to Eschiva's relief, her words have reached Raya–O and A–Ruhn; the two Seedseers have resolved to leave the Twelveswood in order to help you purge the taint. With their heightened sensitivity to aether, they believe they can ascertain the site of Alaqa's experiment. Make your way to the Dravanian forelands, where you last saw Alaqa, and join Eschiva and the Seedseers at Tailfeather.

Shortly after arriving at Tailfeather, A–Ruhn senses an anomaly in the aether emanating from the northwest. A cavern called Mourn lies in that direction, along with a water vein, and the party decides to investigate it. Brave the dragon-infested area and search for Alaqa.

Deep within the cavern of Mourn, you find Alaqa just as she completes her experiment─an undead dragon whose existence is sustained by the taint. Upon confronting her, the Au Ra justifies her actions as self-preservation: her tribesmen have suffered much at the hands of the ignorant, and she desires but to protect them. Having said her piece, she unleashes her pet upon you, but you succeed in overcoming it and purifying the taint which gave it life. With her dreams of vengeance thus shattered, all of the fight goes out of Alaqa.

Though Alaqa must answer for her crimes, Raya–O offers her words of hope for the future. Watching on from a distance, A–Ruhn resolves to do as A–Towa–Cant once did and go wheresoever his powers are needed, be it to the ends of the world. With gratitude, he accepts Eschiva's offer to accompany him as he embarks upon his journeys.

The two Seedseers shall see the misguided Au Ra given over to the Wood Wailers. Afterwards, Raya–O bids you and Eschiva come to see her and A–Ruhn at Camp Tranquil, that they might properly thank you for your services to the Twelveswood.

You bid Eschiva farewell as she departs with A–Ruhn. Together with her siblings, Raya–O vows to continue preserving the harmony of the forest, protecting it from threats both within and without. With your newfound powers, go forth and shine the light of succor and solace across all the realm.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna once you completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with Eschiva at Fallgourd Float.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna.
Speak with Eschiva at Tailfeather.
Search for Alaqa in Mourn.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna in Mourn.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna.
Speak with Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.
Defeat the zombie dragon!
Heal the stagnant aether to defeat the zombie dragon!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename! We have conceived a plan to deal with the taint!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: We would share the particulars with everyone; might I trouble you to fetch Eschiva?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: She will have returned to Fallgourd Float, I believe.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Pray return here after you have notified her. A–Ruhn and I shall be waiting.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: We have conceived a plan to deal with the taint. Pray fetch Eschiva from Fallgourd Float, that we might share the particulars with everyone.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Oh, it's you, Forename. I must apologize for my earlier display.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The Seedseers wish to see me despite the disrespect I showed them? Though their ways baffle me, it cannot be denied that they care for the forest. Perhaps they deserve more credit than I give them.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I will go, of course. Let us strike out at once.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: We each of us must do our part to protect the forest.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Worry not─I shall keep my tongue in check.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Our thanks for coming. Without further ado, let us begin.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: After our last meeting, I went to the Guardian Tree and presented the tainted flesh to the great one.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: His reaction was telling─the befouled aether it bears is identical to the taint which now threatens the Twelveswood. Unless we stop Alaqa, the forest will be reduced to a wasteland of death.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Forename gave me to understand that you have conceived a plan to deal with the taint. What is this plan?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Simply put, A–Ruhn and I shall accompany you to the Dravanian forelands.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As you are doubtless aware, we Padjals are chosen by the elementals to convey their will. Should that will go unheard or be misinterpreted, harmony would be lost and tragedy inevitably befall.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: In order to prevent this, we strive to hone our sensitivity to the elementals far beyond the limits of ordinary men. And this sensitivity allows us to perceive even the slightest fluctuations in the aether.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: With our faculty for sensing aether, A–Ruhn and I shall ascertain the site of Alaqa's experiment. And once we find it, we will join our powers to Forename's and purge the taint once and for all!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You would leave the forest? But what of the will of the elementals?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Rest assured we have obtained the Elder Seedseer's permission. Our sister shall see to it that the elementals do not go unheard during our absence.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: But above all, your words struck home. We will not leave the two of you to bear the burden alone. We shall do all we can to aid you, as Padjals and white mages both.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You truly mean to leave the forest and help us?

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: In the heat of the moment, I forgot myself and spoke out of turn. I pray you can forgive me.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: There is naught to forgive. On the contrary, we are grateful to you for opening our eyes. Now, I trust we can rely upon you to guide the way?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Listen, Forename. This will be our first time outside the forest, and we will most certainly make fools of ourselves. I would thank you not to enjoy yourself overmuch!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I shall escort the Seedseers to Tailfeather. Pray meet us there.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: With our powers combined, there is no taint that we cannot purge. Let us make for the Dravanian forelands at once!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Pray leave the escorting of the Seedseers to me. I shall see you at Tailfeather.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I-I am doing just fine, thank you for asking! There is nothing to it!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: That everything should be so different...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: So here we are at Tailfeather. Why, the journey here wasn't nearly as daunting as I expected. I daresay we could have made it without Eschiva!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Bold words coming from someone who fairly hugged our guide during the entire journey.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Ahem! S-Seeing as we are here, we ought to get to work! Do you sense anything, Brother?

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: I do─an anomaly in the aether that wrenches the stomach... It emanates from the north and west.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: A cavern lies in that direction─Mourn, 'tis called. And if memory serves, so too does a water vein. It seems to me that is where we must go.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I must warn you all, though, that the area is thick with dragons. We must proceed with caution.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: D-Dragons, you say? Well, I for one would welcome the excitement! The journey thus far has been rather dull for my tastes!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Dull suits us just fine, Sister. Remember, our priority is to purge the taint.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As if I would forget! The fate of the Twelveswood is at stake! Let us make haste to Mourn and confront Alaqa!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: The cavern of Mourn lies to the north and west. The area is home to dragons, so let us proceed with caution.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: So, you are still alive.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Most intriguing─horns such as I have, yet you are not Au Ra... Well, whatever you are, you are no different from the others. You have come to interfere with my experiment. But know this: it is your ignorance that has led us down this path.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: We Xaela are nomads who roam and live off the land. My tribe was no different. Yet though we did no harm to those whose lands we traversed, they treated us as vermin. In their ignorance, they feared us, and that fear manifested as spite and violence.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: My loved ones and I were cursed at, spat upon, beaten, and worse. It was out of the desire to protect them that I began my research. Such pain we have suffered, I swore that I would visit upon the ignorant masses a hundredfold!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: And soon I shall fulfill my goal, for my experiment has finally borne fruit!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: To be sure, there is still work to be done; such robust flesh cannot be sustained by ordinary aether. Nay, it must needs be fed something far more potent─the taint.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: My pet can go only where the taint exists, and so I shall fill the whole world with it!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: S-Sister! I sense naught but befouled aether from that dragon!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: This is without a doubt the source of the taint. We must needs purify it whole!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: You would get in the way of my vengeance? Then you shall be the first to feel my wrath!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: We all of us can accomplish far more than we dare imagine.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: With the taint eliminated at the source, the Twelveswood is safe again.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: No...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: My dreams... All gone to dust...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I am powerless─powerless to protect my people, powerless to change anything...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: We are cowards, all of us. That which we do not understand instills fear within us, and so we lash out. In return, you sought to strike back at those who hurt you.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: You have done terrible things, and must be held to account for your crimes.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: But know that it is not too late to make amends. You still have a chance to atone.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Your knowledge may yet be used for good. You need but find a new purpose, and I should be glad to help you look for it.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: With Alaqa apprehended, it seems safe to say that danger to the Twelveswood is past. And we owe it all to the two of you.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: This experience has taught me much and more, not least of all how powerless I was in the face of an external threat.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: If I am to protect the forest, I must needs spend less time with my head in the treetops and more with my feet on the ground. To that end, I shall strive to be a Padjal as Master A–Towa was, standing ready to journey to the ends of the world if needs be.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Were it not for your shining example, I never would have found the courage to come to this decision. I cannot thank you enough.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Master A–Ruhn. When the time comes for you to embark upon your journey, pray allow me to accompany you.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: It isn't safe to travel alone, you know this to be true. Besides, you need someone to keep a record of all your deeds, that they might be passed on to future generations.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: For all my bold words, I am still but a green sapling. Nevertheless, I would serve you faithfully as my grandfather once served Master A–Towa.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: I should be heartened to have your company, Eschiva. I shall endeavor to be a Padjal worthy of your respect.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Master A–Ruhn! I swear you'll not be disappointed in me!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: A new purpose...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn and I shall escort Alaqa and place her in the Wood Wailers' care. Pray come and see us afterwards at Camp Tranquil─we would thank you properly.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: A–Ruhn and I shall escort Alaqa and place her in the Wood Wailers' care. Pray come and see us afterwards at Camp Tranquil─we would thank you properly.

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: You have given me the courage to make a change. I cannot thank you enough.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I shall soon depart with Master A–Ruhn. I'm glad for this opportunity to see you again.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: During the entire way back, Alaqa did not so much as favor us with a glance, but neither did she attempt to flee.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I believe there is hope for her yet. Till such time as she finds a new purpose, I shall visit her cell as often as my duties allow.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: With the source of the taint banished, the great one's warnings have ceased. We may rest easy for a time.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Disaster has been averted thanks to you and Eschiva. We are eternally in your debt.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: You are kind for saying so, my lady, but I have done scarcely anything. All your gratitude should be reserved for Forename.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Allow me to thank you as well, Forename. Had you not sought me out that day, I may never have found my true calling.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Beginning today, I shall accompany Master A–Ruhn as he works to maintain peace and harmony within the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: I know not where our journeys will take us, but when next we meet, I shall stand before you a stronger woman!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: We had best be on our way. Fare you well on your own journeys, Forename. I look forward to seeing you again, within the Twelveswood and without!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Well, they pretty much exhausted everything I had intended to say...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: So I shall say but this: I mean to do my part as well. Together with my siblings, I shall work to preserve the harmony of the forest, protecting it from threats both within and without.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As for you, Forename of the white─with your newfound powers, pray continue employing our art for the betterment of the realm!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: May the light of succor and solace shine wheresoever you may go!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the white mage quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Kill them all, my lovely!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: It ends here, Alaqa!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: You'll not harm so much as another leaf!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Vengeance is not the way!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: What? The befouled aether refuses to disperse!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: What is dead can never die!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: The power of healing, Forename! Use it to purify the stagnant aether!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Souls of the damned! Render your essence unto my creation!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: This bodes ill! Strike down the undead first!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: It...it rises! All that healing, and it still wasn't enough!?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: It is no use! My pet cannot be slain!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: No! We won't give up!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: If it rises again, we have but to strike it down!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: Matron have mercy... It's coming back!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: We must focus on purifying it!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Your feeble powers shan't avail you!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: We mustn't give up! Keep purifying!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Confound it! The befouled aether still remains!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: How many times must I tell you? You struggle in vain!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Hmph! We'll see about that!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Hah! 'Twas but a matter of time!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Nooo! You will not get in the way of my vengeance!

dialogue.name: ESCHIVA
dialogue.text: It...it still returns!

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: Ah, but the befouled aether is gone! We nearly have it!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Souls of the damned! Come to our aid!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: More undead! Stay sharp!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: You know my suffering, yet you insist on standing in my way! Why!?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Wake up, Alaqa! There is more to this than your own suffering!

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: No... I cannot fall now...

dialogue.name: ARUHNSENNA
dialogue.text: I was not...strong enough...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: F-Forgive me...

quest.name: 新たなチャクラ
journal: Professor Erik is concerned for a mutual friend, though he would be the last to admit it.

You learn from Professor Erik that your friend and fellow monk, Widargelt, has cast aside his all-consuming desire for vengeance, and now seeks to rebuild the Fist of Rhalgr. To that end, he has begun taking on pupils, whom he trains at Revenant's Toll. The good professor bids you pay Widargelt a visit, that you might cease worrying about your friend.

Widargelt introduces you to two of his most promising pupils, D'zentsa and O'tchakha, orphans who one day appeared before him. As their senior and his foremost pupil, Widargelt now asks you to assist in their training. Join Widargelt to the southeast of Revenant's Toll.
First, Widargelt asks you to demonstrate your prowess to D'zentsa. Seek her out to the northeast, and defeat any enemies that appear.
You fell your fearsome foe with ease. Turn your attention back to D'zentsa.
You have won D'zentsa's respect and admiration. O'tchakha is next in line to be treated to a display of your sublime skills. Seek her out to the south, and defeat any enemies that appear.
You fell more fearsome foes with ease. Turn your attention back to O'tchakha.

You have won O'tchakha's respect and admiration as well. But as the two friends speak excitedly of training under you, a yell rings out. It appears Widargelt is in danger. Make haste to the place you left him.

You arrive to find Widargelt alone and on his knees, his assailants having since fled. He explains that he was attacked by strange men who fought in the style of monks. During the encounter, a new chakra appears to have opened within Widargelt, though the sensation was unlike anything he has experienced before. For now, return to the safety of Revenant's Toll and rejoin your fellow monks.

Widargelt recounts his encounter with the strange men in detail. As he defended himself, his body was racked by a sudden pain as though something had pierced it. While he is certain that a chakra has opened within him, he does not believe it to be the seventh. For lack of an explanation, he declares that he will seek Professor Erik's advice. Should this phenomenon prove to be a new source of power, Widargelt promises to share its secrets with you.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Widargelt southeast of Revenant's Toll.
Speak with D'zentsa and defeat any enemies that appear.
Speak with D'zentsa.
Speak with O'tchakha and defeat any enemies that appear.
Speak with O'tchakha.
Speak with Widargelt.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Your sense of timing is impeccable as ever! A pity your mind was never quite so reliable.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But worry not, for the task I would have you perform shan't tax your limited intellect. It pertains to your monk friend, Widargelt.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: This scarce comes as any surprise, but my words of wisdom have struck a chord with the oaf. Having been made to realize that there is more to life than vengeance, he now expends his energies on more constructive pursuits. Namely, rebuilding his order, the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Indeed, he has been taking on pupils, and rumor has it he teaches with both charisma and zeal. Plainly, mine own brilliance as a tutor has rubbed off on him.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And what is this task that I would have you do? Take more readings with my aetherometer, you are doubtless thinking. False! You of all people should know that I am finished with that research. And such a triumph it was!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: To be sure, I may have need of your talent for fieldwork again in the future. For now, however, I simply wish for you to go and see how Widargelt fares. And lest you think that I worry about the fool─perish the thought!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: As a sisterbrother of the path, you will be worried about him, though it may not have occurred to you yet. And so I am taking the liberty of telling you what you must do to alleviate that worry.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Widargelt trains his pupils at Revenant's Toll. With that, you have all the information you need. Off you go, then!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Widargelt trains his pupils at Revenant's Toll. Take yourself there and see how your friend is faring.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename. It has been a while, sisterbrother. What brings you here?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So the professor sends you. But it matters not why you came. I am glad for your visit.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Indeed, I have begun teaching. I desire to preserve our way. To impart our art to a new generation. Though I myself still have much to learn.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have but few pupils now. But slowly their numbers grow.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will introduce some to you. Two girls who show great promise. Perhaps you can assist in their training?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: What is it, Master Widargelt? Has someone new joined?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: No, not a new pupil. An old one. My first and foremost. SheHe has long surpassed me.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename is herhis name. Today you will train under herhis supervision. An excellent opportunity. Go to the usual place and make ready.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Heh, I've always wanted to have a senior! See you in a bit, Forename!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa, wait! <sigh> Please excuse Zentsa. She forgets herself sometimes, but she has a good heart. We shall be honored for your watchful gaze, Forename.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Those two were abandoned by their parents. One day, they came and begged me to teach them. They are very dedicated. Very quickly do they learn. Every day is fulfilling.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But come, let us go to the training ground. Meet me southeast of Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We have no dedicated place for training. No halls of our own. My pupils train wherever they can.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: First, I would have you demonstrate your abilities to D'zentsa. She awaits you to the northeast.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa awaits you to the northeast. Demonstrate your abilities to her.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: I've been waiting for you! Master thinks very highly of you, so you'd better not disappoint!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Whoa, you really are strong... And there I was feeling good about myself. The world's a big old place, isn't it?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: So, you're going to demonstrate for Tchakha next? Heh, she's going to be so impressed!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We've been together all our lives, in case you're wondering. We can read each other's thoughts as though they were our own!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Come on, I'll take you to her! She should be over to the south!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Hurry and show Tchakha your skills!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I have eagerly awaited your coming, MistressMaster Forename. Zentsa tells me that I'm in for a treat─that I mustn't so much as bat an eyelid.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: My heart races in anticipation of your demonstration! Please begin whenever you are ready!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Whoa, that's even better than what you showed me!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You're every bit as amazing as Zentsa claimed you would be! Even though Master said so himself, I didn't believe that anyone could be stronger than him!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: See? You impressed the britches off her, just like I said you would!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Oh, Zentsa! I have never been so excited! I wish to learn everything MistressMaster Forename knows! Everything!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Me too, Tchakha! With herhis help, we're bound to become stronger than we'd ever dared hope!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Growing up on our own, Zentsa and I suffered much because we were weak and couldn't protect ourselves.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: And so we swore to one another that we would become strong. If we could be as strong as you, there would be naught we need fear!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: So! I've been wondering about the applications of Four-point Fury...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: (-Widargelt-)Who are you!? What do you want!?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That was Master Widargelt!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Master! Are you alright!?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You...you have not come to harm?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We're fine, Master─it's you we're worried about! What happened!?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Strangers came. They attacked without warning. The techniques they used were the same as ours.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Same as ours? You mean to say they were monks? But I thought there were no others besides ourselves...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text:
I alone survived the massacre at the temple. There should be no─
Ugh... This sensation...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A new power swells within me. As though a new chakra has opened. Yet it is unlike aught I have felt before.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Tchakha, this area was the site of some famous battle, wasn't it?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Yes, it was─the Battle of Silvertear Skies. Which means that one's chakra can be opened here. Judging by Master's condition, however, I'm inclined to think that something else was the cause.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Let us return to Revenant's Toll. I must rest.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am feeling better. The pain has subsided.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They came shortly after you left. Masked men who fight as we do. They were monks. Of this I am certain.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They outnumbered me. I held them off. But a sudden pain racked my body. As though I was pierced through. I fell to my knees.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: When next I was aware, my assailants were gone. Most likely fled when they heard your coming.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The sensation I felt. It is not unlike a chakra opening. But neither is it the seventh chakra.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: If it isn't the seventh chakra, then what could it possibly be?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I know not. I must ask someone more learned than me. Professor Erik. He is versed in the history of our order. Perhaps he can find more information.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha. Return to your training.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename. This may be a new source of power. If so, I would share its secrets with you. If I learn something, I will let you know.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: ふたつの流派
journal: Widargelt is wearing an apologetic expression.

Widargelt informs you that he has consulted Professor Erik regarding his newly opened chakra. Alas, the good professor has yet to provide an answer, and so he has no tidings to share at present. Setting that concern aside for the time being, Widargelt invites you to oversee his pupils' training once more. Join him to the west of Revenant's Toll, where training is currently in progress.

You arrive at the training ground to find one of Widargelt's pupils badly beaten. The fellow explains that he was set upon by monks, and Widargelt is convinced that they are the selfsame men who attacked him. Join your brother monk as he gives chase, and make your way to Camp Revenant's Toll.
Widargelt has chased down some of the enemy monks. Tend to them while he continues pursuing those who are still at large.
You have dispatched the monks. Follow Widargelt west of Camp Revenant's Toll.
Widargelt has chased down another group of enemy monks. Once again, tend to them while Widargelt continues giving chase.
You have dispatched the second group of monks. Follow Widargelt to the area northeast of the Tangle.
Widargelt has chased down yet another group of enemy monks. And yet again, you must tend to them while Widargelt continues giving chase.
You have dispatched what you hope is the final group of monks. Follow Widargelt to the area north of the Tangle.

You arrive to find Widargelt locked in a gaze with his leading pupils, D'zentsa and O'tchakha. Explaining that they have no choice, they fall upon you. In the midst of the encounter, you and Widargelt experience the sensation of a new chakra opening. Upon seeing this, D'zentsa and O'tchakha take their leave, but not before revealing the existence of two sects─one of light and one of shadow, the latter to which they belong. Return to Revenant's Toll and speak with Widargelt about these revelations.

Wounded by his pupils' betrayal, Widargelt is all the more determined to uncover the truth behind this mysterious sect of shadow and its objective. In the meantime, he bids you focus on mastering your newfound power, which has been unleashed with the opening of your chakra.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt.
Follow Widargelt.
Defeat enemy monks.
Follow Widargelt.
Defeat enemy monks.
Follow Widargelt.
Defeat enemy monks.
Follow Widargelt.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Greetings, sisterbrother. It is good of you to come again.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: After your last visit, I told Professor Erik of my experience. I have not heard from him since. I wonder if he has forgotten. He is a busy man.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But never mind that for now. You are here. Perhaps you can help my pupils train again?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa and O'tchakha were impressed by you. They spoke of your prowess to their peers. Now they all want you to teach them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My pupils are training to the west. Let us go there.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: He is one of mine. He has been badly beaten. Who did this?

dialogue.name: DESHI02027
dialogue.text: (-Injured Pupil-)Ungh... They were monks...like us...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The same villains who attacked me? This is an outrage! They must be made to pay! With me, sisterbrother! They cannot be far!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They are the ones, sisterbrother!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But there are more at large. I saw them scurry away. See to this lot. I will continue giving chase.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They are yours, sisterbrother!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We almost have them all!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Mind stepping away?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Beware, Forename. Those two are not what they seem.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We had stayed too long. Any longer, and we wouldn't have a place to return to.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: We seek no forgiveness for what we do. For it is the only life we know.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: And if we don't return to it now, there'd be nothing left for us.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Please understand. We have no other choice. And now...prepare yourselves!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Damn it!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Th-This power surging within... Another chakra? But why? How?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That's it for today. We're sparing you, but know that it isn't out of pity. We need you, that's all.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Wh-What do you mean?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Yours is the sect of light, and ours shadow. We are two sides of the same coin.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That said, you disciples of light are naught but fodder to us. You exist solely to nourish shadow.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: W-Wait!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A new chakra has opened within me. As it did before. It is the same for you, yes?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The two girls. The way they harness energy differs from us. It must be the way of their sect.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I had great hopes for them. Their betrayal saddens me. But there is no time for lamentation.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: This sect of shadow. I knew not of its existence. It is a great surprise. We must learn all we can of them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A new chakra has opened within us. How it happened, I know not. But you have newfound power. And you must master it.

quest.name: ゼンツァとチャクハ
journal: Widargelt has urgent tidings for you.

Widargelt informs you that he has received a letter from his former students, D'zentsa and O'tchakha, who bid the two of you come to Dalamud's Talons. Though their agenda is a mystery, Widargelt has questions of his own that he would ask them. Make your way to northern Thanalan and participate in the meeting.

At the meeting, D'zentsa and O'tchakha explain that there exist two aspects of chakra, one each for the sect of light and the sect of shadow; in order to open a chakra of an aspect not his own, a monk must fight a disciple of the opposing sect. To that end, the two Miqo'te attack you and Widargelt, the battle ending with all four combatants experiencing their chakra opening. Having thus accomplished their task, D'zentsa and O'tchakha take their leave, but not before begging you to give up being a monk. Speak with Widargelt to learn his mind on these revelations.

Unsurprisingly, Widargelt has no intention of relinquishing his dreams of rebuilding the Fist of Rhalgr. However, if you are to deal with the threat posed by the sect of shadow, you must learn more about the two aspects of chakra. Professor Erik will soon be arriving at Revenant's Toll to share with you his insights on the subject. Make your way back to the settlement and be present for what will surely prove to be a most enlightening experience.

Professor Erik supplements your knowledge of the history of the Fist of Rhalgr. The order was once formed of two distinct yet united sects─one of light and one of shadow. Alas, the members of the latter were expelled in the wake of a bitter feud over the order's alliance with the royal house of Ala Mhigo. The professor then appends that members of the two sects once faced one another in single combat to open all fourteen chakra. Widargelt cannot understand why the sect of shadow insists on fighting rather than cooperating. In order to find the answer, he declares his intent to confront D'zentsa and O'tchakha once more. In the meantime, focus on mastering the new power that has been unleashed inside you.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt south of Dalamud's Talons.
Speak with Widargelt.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.
Defeat D'zentsa and O'tchakha!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename! A letter has arrived. It comes from D'zentsa and O'tchakha.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They would speak with us. They bid us come to Dalamud's Talons.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: What their agenda is, I know not. But I would ask them questions of my own.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Professor Erik also sends word. He has learned of the sect of shadow. Soon, he will come to share his knowledge. But before I see him, I would see my former pupils.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I wish to believe in them. They are good at heart. Of this I am certain. Come, sisterbrother. We go to Dalamud's Talons.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It has been a while. You two look well.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Thanks for coming. For what it's worth, we're sorry that we deceived you.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Know that it is for the benefit of both our sects that we fight.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: The other day, when you fended off our fellow disciples of shadow, a new chakra opened within you, did it not? Yet the sensation was unlike aught you had felt before.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: It's because you opened a chakra belonging to our aspect─the aspect of shadow. The opposite also applies, of course. Fighting a disciple of your sect allows us to open chakra belonging to the aspect of light.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Aspects of light and shadow? If this is the way of it, then why must we fight? Why can we not cooperate?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Our master forbids it, I'm afraid. Our true master, that is.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: If truth be told, we shouldn't even be speaking with you. We are not permitted to exchange words─only blows.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They leave us no choice. Come, sisterbrother! We will give them the exchange they desire!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: <gasp> Ahhh, my chakra has opened... <pant> 'Tis precisely as Master described...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: <pant> Yesss, I feel the power surging through me... But if we're to become stronger─if we're to open any more chakra─we must throw ourselves into far fiercer struggles.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: The kind where lives are on the line.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: So long as you are disciples of light, we will continue to come for you, over and over. It cannot end until one side falls, never to rise again.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: And that's the reason we called you here.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We don't want to hurt you.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: So please, give up being a monk. Give up any notion of rebuilding the Fist of Rhalgr. And go somewhere far, far away!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Wait!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: They would have me stop being a monk. Same as telling me to stop breathing.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Many revelations have there been this day. The existence of opposing aspects of chakra. This not the least of all. We must learn more of it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The professor will soon arrive at Revenant's Toll. Perhaps he can enlighten us.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Strong backs and feeble minds as far as the eye can see... Yes, this is indeed the frontier.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Professor. The information I requested. Were you able to find it?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: (-Erik-)Of course I was, you incurable dolt! Elsewise I wouldn't have bothered to come all the way to this backwater! Now then, I have many demands on my time, so I shall convey my findings to you at once, and in the most concise manner possible. Ahem!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Now, it is common knowledge that the Fist of Rhalgr rose to the zenith of its power by virtue of royal endorsement. Lesser known is the dispute which broke out over this arrangement between two factions within the Fist─the sect of light and the sect of shadow.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The head priest of the sect of light believed that an alliance with the royal house of Ala Mhigo was the key to prosperity. However, his counterpart in the sect of shadow disagreed, warning that it would lead to their undoing. History has proven them both right. But I digress.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Unsurprisingly, the disciples of each sect rallied to their respective leader's side, and the two factions clashed with words and fists both. In the end, the sect of light prevailed, the alliance with the royal house was sealed, and all members of the sect of shadow were banished from the order.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text:
So, in the past, the two sects both belonged to the Fist of Rhalgr, and their disciples trained beside one another as comrades. And yet, though the techniques they employed were identical, the manner in which they harnessed energy was opposed in nature.
It was this difference which gave rise to two aspects of chakra.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: There is a tradition wherein monks from the two schools would meet each other in single combat. In attacking you, I posit that the disciples of shadow are seeking to recreate this tradition.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: This clashing of light and shadow quickened the aether within, causing a chakra of the opposing aspect to open within them. In simple terms for your simple minds, disciples of light fought to open shadow chakra, and disciples of shadow fought to open light chakra.

dialogue.name: ERIK
