dialogue.text: And the implications of this? There are not seven, but fourteen chakra all told. Yes, yes, two sides of the same coin; where there is light, there is shadow, and all that poetic tripe.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: One thing I do not understand, Professor. Why can our sects not cooperate? Why must the disciples of shadow attack like common brigands?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: A feud caused the rift between the two sects─who's to say there isn't a feud still? I suspect only a member of the sect of shadow can tell you the truth. But now I must be off. I shall inquire further into the matter in my spare time. If there is aught else, you know where to find me.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We must speak with D'zentsa and O'tchakha again. I will try to track them down. Meanwhile, please continue honing your skills.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Why? Why must we fight?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Enough talk. We have no use for your words.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We're just limbering up!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Try this on for size!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Steel yourselves for more!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: There's more where that came from!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Our own technique!? Stand clear, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: N-No... We aren't supposed to lose...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Bugger me... They're too strong...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh... Forgive me, sisterbrother...

quest.name: 第七のチャクラ
journal: Widargelt has acquired information on O'tchakha's whereabouts, and would share it with you.

O'tchakha has been sighted near Eugenia's Spire. Widargelt means to confront her, that he might learn what drives the sect of shadow. Make haste to the North Shroud and join Widargelt near Eugenia's Spire.

You and Widargelt find O'tchakha in a bad way. She explains that her master, a man named H'raha Tia, forced her and D'zentsa to fight one another to the death. Though O'tchakha once saw the man as a father figure, this incident has opened her eyes to his true nature. O'tchakha now fears for D'zentsa, who is still at their master's mercy. She declares her intent to rescue her, and Widargelt pledges his aid. While the two of them make for the safety of the Hedgetree, Widargelt bids you lie in wait near Eugenia's Spire and intercept any pursuers.
You have dispatched the minions H'raha Tia had sent to verify O'tchakha's death. Make your way to the Hedgetree and rejoin your companions.

O'tchakha reveals the truth of the sect of shadow and the ruthless man who now leads it. Though Widargelt harbors hopes that he and H'raha Tia may yet come to an understanding, O'tchakha is not confident that her master will be amenable to discussion. More than likely, it will come to blows, and against a powerful foe who has opened all fourteen chakra─seven each of light and shadow. For now, return to Revenant's Toll and discuss a course of action with Widargelt.

When O'tchakha has recovered, training will resume to open more chakra. In the meantime, Widargelt bids you dedicate yourself to your training, that you might together go forward─as proud disciples of light.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt near Eugenia's Spire.
Lie in wait at the specified location and defeat your pursuers.
Speak with Widargelt.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename. Finally, I have information on O'tchakha. She is near Eugenia's Spire in the North Shroud.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I mean to confront her. To demand the truth from her.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: She and D'zentsa do not act of their own free will. Of this I am certain. Nay, something has a hold over them. We will find out what it is.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Come, sisterbrother. We go to the North Shroud. Quickly, while the trail is still fresh.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Unnngh...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I found her like this! What has happened!?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Widargelt...and Forename?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Rest assured my injuries are not serious. Zentsa held back.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: But gods, I feel like such a fool... No matter what he asked of us, we always did it without question. In so doing, we thought we could survive. But in the end he commanded us to fight each other to the death to open our chakra.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Fight to the death? Who commanded this!? Who!?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Who else but our master? H'raha Tia is his name, and he leads the sect of shadow. But more than that, he was a father figure to Zentsa and me.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: After our own parents abandoned us, Master H'raha Tia took us in and raised us. We always strove to please him lest we lose our place.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: But today he made our worth to him abundantly clear. We are not his friends, let alone his family. Nay, we are naught but tools to be used and discarded.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: When we fought, Zentsa thrust me off the cliff. She made it appear an accident, that I alone might flee.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: But I cannot flee while Zentsa is still at our master's mercy. I must rescue her, before he decides that she is no longer useful.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: And if you know what's good for you, you will put many malms between yourselves and this place. Master will doubtless send people to verify my death.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: O'tchakha, wait! Let us help you!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You would help us, after all the wrongs we have committed against you? Why?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I once lusted for power. I stopped at nothing to obtain it. I used Forename. I betrayed herhim. Worse, I tried to kill herhim.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I repented. I started anew. Now, someone is making the same mistake as me. I cannot ignore it. Nor can I ignore those who suffer from it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But above all, my pupils are in trouble. I would help them. It is what a master should do.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Oh, Widargelt...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will go with O'tchakha to the Hedgetree. See that no one follows. Join us when the area is safe.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will go with O'tchakha to the Hedgetree. See that no one follows. Join us when the area is safe.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Oh, Widargelt...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You have my thanks.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is safe here. We may speak freely. There is much I do not know. Please tell me everything.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: In the beginning, members of the Fist of Rhalgr strove to open all fourteen chakra─seven of light and seven of shadow.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Those who had opened all seven of their native chakra were permitted to duel those who had achieved the same in the opposing aspect.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: For generations, such duels were held in great secrecy.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: But that ended with the massacre at the Temple of the Fist, when the sect of light was extinguished. And though the sect of shadow survived by virtue of its obscurity, its disciples lost the means to open light chakra.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: That is, until Master H'raha Tia learned of the sole survivor of the massacre─you, Widargelt. And that was how Zentsa and I came to you.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Our master taught us that the disciples of light were but a means to an end─a resource to be used. He ingrained in us the belief that our two sects must ever be at odds. And we took him at his word, fools that we were.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I understand now how things were in the past. How they are in the present. Most importantly, I know that light and shadow were formerly as one. And it may yet be so again.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will speak with Master H'raha Tia. Convince him that our schools need not fight. Together, we can rebuild our proud order.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I am afraid he will not be easily swayed. And should it come to blows─as I fear it will─know that his strength far surpasses ours. He is the only person alive who has opened all fourteen chakra.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Recently, I have focused on opening light chakra. Of my own aspect, I have succeeded in opening but six. I am no match for Master H'raha Tia.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You are our best hope, Forename. Even so, you are still one chakra short of fourteen─a small yet decisive difference.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: If you are to have a fighting chance, you must open the final chakra that eludes you─the seventh chakra of shadow. Alas, this presents a dilemma: there is no way to do so outside of mortal combat.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There will be another way. There always is. All our chakra may not be open. But we have each other. Together, we may yet rescue D'zentsa.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Widargelt. I swear to do my utmost to aid you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: That is well. But first, O'tchakha must recover. We return to Revenant's Toll. There is much planning to do.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A healer tends O'tchakha. When she is well enough, we will work to open our chakra.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We both saw how O'tchakha fears her master. It is not normal. As she warned, words may not avail us. We must be prepared for anything.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Continue your training, Forename. And together let us go forward─as proud disciples of light!

quest.name: 鳥籠の中
journal: Widargelt has a theory for opening a chakra of the opposing aspect, and is eager to put it to the test.

With help from Professor Erik, Widargelt and O'tchakha have conceived a potential method for opening a chakra of the opposing aspect without bloodshed between fellow monks. Join your comrades near Dragonspit in the western highlands of Coerthas, where the theory will be put to the test.

O'tchakha puts forth the theory: instead of each other, what if it sufficed for monks to fight other foes within close proximity? To that end, Widargelt and O'tchakha will seek out fell fiends to do battle against in the nearby area. Seek out fell fiends of your own by lying in wait at the specified location.
You have defeated a horde of fell fiends. Unfortunately, it did not seem to open a new chakra within you. Return to Dragonspit and rejoin your comrades.

You arrive to find O'tchakha and Widargelt on their knees, with H'raha Tia, leader of the sect of shadow, gloating over them. The man explains that he is here to silence O'tchakha, but offers to set her and D'zentsa free in exchange for Widargelt's life and your servitude. The villain leaves, and you are left to ponder his words. Turn your attention now to O'tchakha and provide her with assistance.
The unexpected encounter with her former master has left O'tchakha despairing over rescuing D'zentsa. Do as Widargelt bids and /rally her spirits.

Your words of encouragement have done wonders for O'tchakha's spirits, who is more determined than ever to defeat H'raha Tia. She declares that she will not submit to her former master's demands, and neither must you. For the time being, Widargelt suggests that you return to Revenant's Toll to prepare for the battle to come.

Professor Erik has loaned you his tomes, which O'tchakha is poring over for information on opening your final chakra. Meanwhile, Widargelt bids you focus on honing your mind and body both, that you might be ready to confront H'raha Tia─with or without all fourteen chakra.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with O'tchakha near Dragonspit.
Lie in wait at the specified location and defeat any monsters that appear.
Speak with Widargelt.
Assist O'tchakha.
/rally O'tchakha's spirits.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Good tidings, sisterbrother. O'tchakha has recovered.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Together, we spoke with Professor Erik. With his help, we sought ways to open chakra of the opposing aspect. Ways that require no dueling.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Now, we have a theory. We will test it in the western highlands of Coerthas. Near a place called Dragonspit.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: O'tchakha has already left. Let us join her.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Listen to O'tchakha. She will explain the theory.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename. My thanks for coming.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: This site hosted a fierce battle. So says Professor Erik. Much blood was spilled between knights and dragons. This makes it an ideal place for our test.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: As you know, in order to open the chakra of the opposing aspect, one ordinarily has to fight an individual trained in that aspect. However, it does not suit us to duel one another to the death.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: And so we theorized: instead of each other, what if disciples from each sect were to fight independently within close proximity?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Influenced by their presence, the aether that pervades a battleground may be tricked into opening an opposing chakra within each combatant.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Without further ado, let us put this theory to the proof. Please seek out likely opponents nearby─as formidable as you can manage─and fight them with all your might. Widargelt and I shall do the same.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I advise you not to interfere.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: H-How did he know?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Be on your guard, Forename!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: He is H'raha Tia. Leader of the sect of shadow. He comes to take back O'tchakha.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: ...Take back? What an idiotic notion. She is a traitor to our sect, and I am here to silence her.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We will not allow it! You must defeat us first!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: You... You are a disciple of the sect of light, and one who surpasses Widargelt besides. Aye, that you have opened your seventh chakra is plain to my senses.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: An idea occurs to me─a peaceful way to end this meeting. We need not fight one another, you and I.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Tchakha, you are to slay Widargelt and open your seventh chakra.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Once you have accomplished this, return to me, and Zentsa shall come to no harm.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: As for you, adventurer─if you will then swear to serve me, I shall release Zentsa and Tchakha both. A fair trade, is it not?

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: You need not answer right this moment. If you agree to these terms, come to the ruins south of Little Ala Mhigo. I shall await you there.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Think on it, but not overlong, or I cannot guarantee that there will be much of Zentsa left to retrieve.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Damn him!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I tried to fight him. But he was too strong. Far stronger than I had imagined.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Such is the might of he who has opened all fourteen chakra. None alive can fight him on equal footing─not even Forename.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: One thing bothers me. The sect of light was destroyed. Yet H'raha Tia has opened all fourteen chakra. How did he do this?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: He was present for the massacre at the temple. He attacked and slew a priest of your sect, and in so doing opened the seventh chakra of light.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: As we are, we cannot hope to defeat him. Alas, our test was a failure.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: My chakra did not open, and neither did yours. Am I correct?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: What am I to do? Oh, Zentsa... I want to save you, but I cannot kill Widargelt...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: O'tchakha needs comfort. Will you rally her spirits?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I feel so powerless...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Please forgive me my pitiful display. You are right, Forename─I mustn't despair.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa and I used to be as birds in a cage. Serving H'raha Tia was the only life we knew. But all that changed when we met the two of you.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You opened our eyes to a world of infinite possibilities. So much more is possible than I had ever dreamed. And so I won't give up hope.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: There is a way to defeat H'raha Tia, and we need but find it! We will rescue Zentsa! Without my raising a hand against Widargelt, without your offering yourself as H'raha Tia's thrall!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There is time still. Let us return to Revenant's Toll. There, we shall make a plan.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Professor Erik has loaned us his tomes. O'tchakha scours them for ways to open your final chakra.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Perhaps she will find something. Perhaps not. Meanwhile, we must do what we can. Hone our minds and our bodies for the battle to come.

obj.n: 力を統べる者、力を担う者

quest.name: 力を統べる者、力を担う者
journal: Time is running out to rescue D'zentsa, and Widargelt is uncharacteristically unsettled.

Though you have not found a way to open your final chakra, you must confront H'raha Tia now, or D'zentsa's life will be forfeit. Widargelt bids you join him and O'tchakha near Little Ala Mhigo in southern Thanalan ahead of the rescue mission.

Desperate to save her friend, O'tchakha bids you fight her, that you might open your final chakra. However, Widargelt will not hear of it. He harbors the hope that, in joining hands, you may yet defeat H'raha Tia. Prepare yourself for the confrontation, and tell Widargelt when you are ready to proceed to the southern ruins, where D'zentsa has been taken.

At the ruins, Widargelt attempts to convince H'raha Tia that fighting one another is not the way. Alas, the master of the sect of shadow will not be swayed from his beliefs, and he sets upon you with fists and feet flying. In the midst of battle, your final chakra opens, allowing you to do battle with H'raha Tia on even footing. And with D'zentsa's belated help, you succeed in overcoming him and his pupils. As the dust settles, speak with Widargelt south of Little Ala Mhigo to know his mind on the battle's outcome.

The pursuit of power was once thought to be the sole route to greatness among the disciples of the Fist of Rhalgr. But by your shining example, this old preconception has been shattered, giving way to alternate paths. Together with D'zentsa and O'tchakha, Widargelt will strive to rebuild the order as it once was, reuniting the sects of light and shadow. As the paragon for a new generation of monks, see to it that you ever exercise your powers for the good of the realm.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with O'tchakha near Little Ala Mhigo.
Speak with Widargelt.
Hold off H'raha Tia until D'zentsa is free!
Defeat H'raha Tia!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Time is running out. D'zentsa's life will soon be forfeit. We must act now.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Alas, we did not find it. A way to open the seventh chakra. But we must act nonetheless.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: O'tchakha has gone to Little Ala Mhigo. She fears for her friend. Let us join her.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We must rescue D'zentsa. But how...?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa is still alive, but I fear she'll not remain so much longer. But moments ago, she was taken to the ruins to the south.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You will have already heard, but I couldn't find a bloodless way to open chakra of an opposing aspect.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Thus far, you have opened thirteen chakra─the most of us three. But one more, and you could face H'raha Tia as an equal...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Fight me, Forename, and make the final chakra yours!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How will you respond?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Very well. Let's get this over with.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No, this isn't the way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: No, sisterbrother! If O'tchakha dies, victory would have no meaning!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We need power. This is true. But at what cost? You must remember what is truly important. Or you will commit a grave mistake. As I once did.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Listen to Forename. SheHe speaks the truth. It is not the way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We need power. This is true. But at what cost? If you die, D'zentsa would grieve. Victory would have no meaning.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Remember my words. All our chakra may not be open. But we have each other. Together, we can defeat H'raha Tia. We can rescue D'zentsa.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The disciples of our sects once fought side by side. Let us do so again. As we did in the days of old.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Widargelt. I shall stand with you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: First, I will try to persuade H'raha Tia. Convince him to see reason. But if my words fail, be ready to fight.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa was taken to the ruins to the south. We must hurry before it's too late!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We go to confront H'raha Tia. Are you ready, sisterbrother?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Hear me, H'raha Tia! We come, but not to accept your demands!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Nay, we would remind you of the past! Of the true nature of our order!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our two sects once fought beside each other. Not against. Together, we can achieve much. Let us join hands, brother. And rebuild the Fist of Rhalgr!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Hmph, cowards like you bring shame upon our order. Plainly, it is you who needs to be reminded of our true nature.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The arduous training to hone mind and body, the blood we spill and shed─all of it is for no other purpose but to honor the Destroyer.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: We pay Him great tribute by dueling to the death. And in return, He grants us great power: the power of all fourteen chakra.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: By consorting with the royal house, the disciples of light lost sight of their true nature. For this, Rhalgr visited destruction upon them.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But in His wisdom, you were spared, that your existence─feeble though it is─might serve to raise us higher. Upon your battered bodies, the Fist of Rhalgr shall be restored to its former glory!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are wrong. The sect of light was undone, but not as you say. We misused our power. We turned it upon our own people. For this, we were cast down.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Now you misuse your power. You turn it upon your own comrades. It is the same. It will end the same. You will destroy yourselves as we did.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Do not make the same mistake, brother. If we are to survive, we must find another way. A way to prosper together. Or we shall perish in vain. All of us.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Those who have power must choose. You must choose. With it, will you pave the way for life? Or will you destroy it? Surely, the choice is clear.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I grow weary of your blathering. You have already declared your unwillingness to meet my demands. There is naught more to discuss.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Take the adventurer alive─shehe will yet prove useful to us. Kill the rest!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa! Are you all right!?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: You came... Thank you...

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: So you have turned against me, the both of you. Have you forgotten who it was that saved you all those years ago?

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: But I pride myself on being a forgiving man. In lieu of an apology, I shall accept your life force.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Your power is mine! Be glad, my wayward pupils, that you were useful to me at the end!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Magnificent! My body is as a raging furnace! It shall be as child's play to unleash my ultimate technique!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It ends here!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Can it be? Your final chakra has opened?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That's the only explanation! Which means that Forename's now an equal with H'raha Tia!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: If we fight together, we may yet triumph!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Triumph, you say? I do not recall having raised such a foolish child.

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Forename is as a suckling babe with herhis new chakra, while my entire being is fairly ablaze with the life energy of three monks!

dialogue.name: HRAHATIA
dialogue.text: It matters not how many of you there are! You cannot hope to defeat me!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Tchakha has told me everything. Thank you, Forename.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: To be reunited with Zentsa... Words cannot well express my relief.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is over. Zentsa is safe. Together, we achieved the impossible.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Yet my heart is heavy. I failed to convince H'raha Tia.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Every step I take, blood is spilled. With my power, I know only destruction.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That's not true, Widargelt. A monk's power can also be used to save, like you saved us.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: We have a favor to ask of you. If you are still intent on rebuilding the Fist of Rhalgr, we would lend you our aid.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We'd bring whoever's left of our sect. Together, we can restore the order to the way it used to be, with disciples of light and shadow side by side.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: And together, we can think about what power means to us. Thinking about it alone, your mind's liable to take you to a dark place. Better to have comrades around who share your cause, I reckon.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: With H'raha Tia gone, Forename is the only soul left who has opened all fourteen chakra. And a soul of gentleness shehe is.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: SheHe did not seek power for its own sake, yet shehe has reached the zenith of our art. In so doing, shehe has shattered our old preconceptions and shown us another path.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: And in opening herhis final chakra by stopping Master's technique, shehe has given us hope that there is a way to open all chakra without bloodshed.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Thank you, D'zentsa, O'tchakha. Together, we will create a new path. And lay a new foundation for our order!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename. It is to your shining example that we turn.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are as a star. We look up to it. We strive to reach its heights.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The way may be dark. And it may be filled with hardship. But come what may, we will forge on. Towards your light.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Promise me this, sisterbrother. Ever use your powers for good. And for the realm!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the monk quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next monk quest will be available from Erik.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I was not strong enough...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ungh... Please take care of Zentsa...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Tchakha...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hold off H'raha Tia, Forename! We will unbind D'zentsa!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hold on, Zentsa!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Tchakha!? And you two as well!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You think you can defeat me? Fools!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Impressive. Mayhap a different approach is in order.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Beware, Forename! I sense a torrent of energy!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: It seems your awakening is at hand. How curious.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Their ranks have thinned out! Now's our chance!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Such power! My body can scarcely contain it!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Fear not, sisterbrother! You are now his equal!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Focus on Master, Forename! We'll keep the rest occupied!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Past time I made myself useful!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Play time is over! Prepare yourselves!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Something comes! Be careful!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Master, please! We need not fight any longer! There is another way!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forename opened herhis final chakra, and shehe did it without hurting you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This changes nothing. Mine is the one true path. It is to exalt Rhalgr that we fight.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: So it ends here...

quest.name: 聖剣を追って
journal: Jenlyns would look to a renowned free paladin for aid.

In these troubled times, the Sultansworn must ever be ready to serve as the sword and shield of the sultanate. Fortunately, it would seem that your shining example has inspired many young men and women to join their ranks. Several such recruits are currently training at Camp Bluefog, and Jenlyns believes they would benefit from your words of encouragement.

At Camp Bluefog, you meet with Owyne, one of the Sultansworn charged with overseeing the recruits' trainingthe Sultansworn you helped to recover the royal crown, who also happens to have been charged with overseeing the recruits' training. He states that they are currently participating in drills at the east watchtower and invites you to follow him there.

Recognizing that you are a womanman of few words, Owyne asks that you favor the recruits with a display of swordsmanship. Basilisk bait has already been laid out, so you need only wait for the beasts to come to you.
You dispatch the lone basilisk that was foolish enough to try its luck against you. See if Owyne is satisfied.
Owyne thanks you for the rousing performance and bids you convey his gratitude to Captain Jenlyns. Return to Ul'dah and inform the captain that you have finished.

Though Jenlyns wishes he could repay you, he admits that there is nothing left he can teach you. He bids you go forth and continue to defend the people of Eorzea, and so you do─only to be stopped momentarily by Papashan, former brother of the Sultansworn. Though he has an urgent matter to discuss, he seems loath to do so within earshot of Jenlyns. Journey to the Ul'dah Dispatch Yard and speak with the stationmaster there.

Solkzagyl, Jenlyns's predecessor, has kept in contact with Papashan for many years, sharing with the stationmaster his discoveries in his quest to reclaim Oathkeeper, the legendary blade stolen from the Sultansworn by the minions of the Monetarists long ago. The former captain's most recent missive contained a startling claim: he has finally found the sword, it would seem. However, Papashan has not heard from him since, and is growing increasingly concerned. The stationmaster does not wish to involve Jenlyns until he has learned more of the situation, and so he begs your assistance, which you readily offer. Once Papashan determines the precise location from which Solkzagyl's last missive was sent, you can begin your search in earnest.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Papashan upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Owyne at Camp Bluefog.
Speak with Owyne at the east watchtower.
Slay a fog basilisk.
Speak with Owyne.
Speak with Jenlyns in Ul'dah.
Speak with Papashan at the Ul'dah Dispatch Yard.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: We live in troubling times, Forename, as you well know.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: That is why it is more important than ever that the Sultansworn stand ready to serve as the sword and shield of the sultanate.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: For a time, I feared that our order was doomed, but then you helped us to restore our good name.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Your shining example inspired many young men and women to seek us out. Even as we speak, they train to hone their skills.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: A few words of encouragement from the famed free paladin herselfhimself would do much to motivate them further, I should think. Perhaps you would consider paying them a visit at Camp Bluefog?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Our younger paladins would surely benefit from a few words of encouragement from you. Forgive me the imposition, but would you call on them at Camp Bluefog?

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: A pleasure to meet you, Forename. My name is Owyne.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Well met, Forename! It's been ages since last we spoke! Certainly not since you helped us to recover the crown.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: At the moment, Phillice and I are conducting drills with the new recruits at the east watchtower.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: They'll be thrilled to see you, I'm sure!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Since we all know you're a womanman of few words, I thought we might forgo the speech and instead ask you to favor us with a display of swordsmanship. We've laid out bait for the basilisks already, in fact. You need only wait for them to come.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Truly a rousing performance, Forename! Thank you!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: It's one thing to talk about proper technique, but an altogether different thing to see it firsthand.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: I think it safe to say that the recruits will long remember this day─as will I!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Thank you again for the demonstration, Forename. Pray convey my gratitude to Captain Jenlyns as well.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Well come, Forename. I gather the recruits took your lesson to heart.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Would that I had some way to repay you─some knowledge or technique to bequeath to you. I am humbled to admit that there is nothing I can teach you.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: All I can offer you is my heartfelt thanks. Pray go forth, my friend, and continue to defend the people of Ul'dah and Eorzea at large.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Begging your pardons, Forename.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)Begging your pardons, Forename.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: We need to talk, but not here. At the Dispatch Yard, outside the city.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Was that Master Papashan just now? Well, if he would have words, then do not let me keep you.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming, Forename. You must be wondering why I called you here...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: It concerns Solkzagyl, Jenlyns's predecessor.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: As you may recall, he continues to search for Oathkeeper, the sword stolen from us by the Monetarists' minions. From time to time, he sends me missives, sharing with me his latest discoveries.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: His most recent one contained a startling claim. He wrote that he had found the sword, at long last...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: But that was some time ago, and he has not contacted me since.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: I would not trouble Jenlyns with this news─not until I learn what has become of Solkzagyl, at the very least. Will you help me find him?

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: I knew I could count on you, Forename.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: For now, all I know is that his last missive came to me by way of Ishgard. Once I learn more, we can begin the search in earnest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next paladin quest will be available from Papashan upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 雪原の若き騎士
journal: Papashan is relieved to see you.

Papashan has determined that Solkzagyl's last missive was sent from Falcon's Nest in the Coerthas western highlands. Journey to the hamlet and see what you can learn of the missing paladin's whereabouts.

Though you hear mention of a rather large man being attacked by bandits the other night, it remains unclear if it was Solkzagyl. The only other viable lead appears to be Hundred Eyes, a Roegadyn craftsman who has worked with many migrant laborers since the reconstruction of Falcon's Nest began.

To your dismay, you learn from Hundred Eyes that Solkzagyl was indeed the man ambushed in the wastes the other night. The craftsman buried him the next day, in a yard on the ridge by Camp Riversmeet. Journey to the paladin's grave and pay your respects.

You arrive in time to rescue a young boy from a group of bandits curiously intent on ending his life. Afterwards, he explains that he was a friend of Solkzagyl's, and that the men who killed him are the same ones whom you just defeated: Death's Embrace, the assassins who stole Oathkeeper years ago at the behest of the Monetarists. As you watch the boy go, Papashan contacts you via linkpearl, and you inform him of Solkzagyl's death. Aghast and confused, he bids you go after the boy and see what else you can learn of Solkzagyl's final days.

The boy introduces himself as Constaint, friend and former pupil of Solkzagyl. After the former captain saved him from a pack of ravenous wolves, Constaint begged the captain to teach him the ways of the paladin. For a time, Solkzagyl refused, but eventually he relented and accepted the boy as his student. However, he never shared his latest discoveries with Constaint, choosing instead to challenge Death's Embrace when the boy was absent. Though he lacks a master, Constaint is still resolved to become a paladin and reclaim Oathkeeper in Solkzagyl's stead. With your help, he may yet succeed.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Constaint upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Question the people of Falcon's Nest.
Speak with Hundred Eyes.
Search Camp Riversmeet for Solkzagyl's grave.
Speak with Constaint in Falcon's Nest.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Ah, just the womanman I was hoping to see!

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: I now know from where Solkzagyl sent his last missive to me. Falcon's Nest, a hamlet in the Coerthas western highlands. It is there I would have you begin your search.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Reclaiming Oathkeeper would do much to restore the honor of the Sultansworn. But we must not get ahead of ourselves. First, we must find our missing man.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: I want nothing more than to join you in the search. However, Jenlyns would take note of my absence, and I do not wish to involve him just yet.

dialogue.name: EMERISSEL
dialogue.text: A Roegadyn “paladin”? Well...I do recall a traveler who spent several days here, at least...

dialogue.name: JOSSELOUX
dialogue.text: There was a pitched battle the other night, out in the wastes. Involved a rather large man and a party of his fellow heretics, to hear the scouts tell it. Naturally, we chose not to intervene. If they wish to kill each other, by all means.

dialogue.name: FORCHETAIX
dialogue.text: ...Solkzagyl? Never heard of him. Was he one of the new craftsmen working with Hundred Eyes?

dialogue.name: FORCHETAIX
dialogue.text: Sorry, we see an awful lot of new faces around here. Most don't leave an impression─other than the heretics and bandits, that is.

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: Heard you was askin' after a Roegadyn, and in a fashion that might give a man cause to worry.

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: Aye, I know Solkzagyl─knew, I should say. Older fellow, spent some time chattin' with the youngblood. He came through, like the rest of us before him, lookin' for the same thing we all do...

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: ...Bandits ambushed him in the night, out in the wastes. Buried him with my own two hands the next day, out near Camp Riversmeet. Constaint took it especially hard, close as he was to him.

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: I laid him to rest in the yard up on the ridge by Camp Riversmeet, if you've a mind to pay your respects.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Halone's blessings be upon you, misssir. I say, that was a rather frightful experience.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Were you a friend of Solkzagyl's, too? Ah, good... Er, that is to say, my condolences.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I knew there had to be others who would want to know...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: 'Twas the work of Death's Embrace, I'd wager. Those fiends you slew just now were sent by them as well.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: My kinsmen think them but another band of sellswords or heretics. If only they knew what they were truly capable of...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I can only hope that they will heed my warnings this time. If you would excuse me...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: (-Papashan-)Forename, this is Papashan. Have you found Solkzagyl?

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: (-Papashan-)Gods almighty, slain by Death's Embrace!? I heard some of those bastards were still skulking about, but I never thought they would try to...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: (-Papashan-)Wait─could it be that they were the ones who held Oathkeeper? And that they killed Solkzagyl when he tried to take it back?

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: (-Papashan-)Damn it all, we've still no answers. Though there is still the boy... Hm. Get after him and find out what he knows.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: ...I appreciate you coming all this way to see me, Forename, but I think we would be better served by you finding out what else the boy knows about Solkzagyl.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: A pleasure to see you again, misssir. Was there something you wished to discuss?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Oh, so you're that free paladin Solkzagyl told me all about! It is an honor to meet you at last, Forename. That is, for the second time. My name is Constaint. Truly honored, misssir. Truly, truly honored.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Sorry if I'm a bit out of sorts. It's just...I've been thinking about him a lot. About the day we first met, when he saved me. How his sword gleamed as he danced among the wolves...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I begged him to teach me the ways of the paladin, so I could save others like he had saved me. He must have turned me down a dozen times before he finally relented─probably because he caught me asking around about Oathkeeper.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: But I suppose he didn't think I was strong enough to help him reclaim the sword. Why else would he sneak off to challenge Death's Embrace while I was away?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I should've been there, Forename. I should've been there!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...I've decided I'm going to take it back. Oathkeeper, I mean.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: He said I wasn't ready to wield this soul, but what choice do I have now that he's gone?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: You want to find it too, don't you? Then help me, Forename─please!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: You will!? Halone be praised! You won't regret this!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Oh, if Solkzagyl could see us now! Two paladins united in purpose! Well, er, I suppose it's rather premature for me to claim the title, isn't it...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: One veteran paladin and one aspiring paladin, then! United in purpose! We shall recover Oathkeeper and bring Solkzagyl's murderers to justice! As...as soon as I uncover new information, that is!

obj.n: ハンドレッド・アイズ

quest.name: 己の聖剣
journal: Constaint has made an exciting new discovery.

Hidden amongst Solkzagyl's belongings was a journal, the final entry of which contains what appears to be a map of the Gorgagne Holding. Constaint declares that you should sally forth to investigate─though he acknowledges with some shame that you are far better equipped than he to do so.

Though he is lacking in all other equipment, Constaint has managed to resize Solkzagyl's sollerets, which he now proudly wears. Referring to the map, he directs you across the river to the west. Search the area for anything unusual.
In the snowy wastes you come across a gallant coronet, as well as a worrying trail of blood. Return to Constaint and see what he makes of it.
Constaint instantly recognizes the coronet as the one which Solkzagyl once wore. Intrigued by your mention of a blood trail, he suggests that you follow it and see where it leads.
You find another large patch of blood further in the direction of the Dusk Vigil. The trail continues...
Yet again, you and Constaint discover a large patch of blood. Eager to carry on the search, the boy rushes off towards the west.

Constaint's eagerness nearly costs him his life, as you find him surrounded by assassins of Death's Embrace. After fending off your attackers, you help Constaint to his feet, who observes sudden movement to the west and, without regard for his safety, once more gives chase.

You and Constaint come face-to-face with more assassins of Death's Embrace, preparing to make a final stand. Though they do not seem to be carrying Oathkeeper, Constaint is nevertheless eager to bring them to justice. With sword in hand and Solkzagyl's coronet atop his brow, the boy charges, and you follow. After a pitched battle, the villains are no more.
Constaint is somewhat surprised by how well that went. Return to Falcon's Nest for a well-earned rest.

Solkzagyl's is not the only death for which Constaint sought justice. The boy's mother was also a victim of Death's Embrace, murdered when her caravan was attacked on the road to Tailfeather. The former assassins had turned to banditry to survive, taking care to pick targets which would not provoke a response from the authorities. Yet even the least among us deserve a champion, Constaint believes. Though it may not lead him to Oathkeeper, he firmly believes that it is his duty as a paladin to stop Death's Embrace before they strike again.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Constaint upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Rendezvous with Constaint southwest of Gorgagne Mills.
Search for anything of interest.
Present the coronet to Constaint.
Follow the trail of blood.
Follow Constaint.
Speak with Constaint.
Speak with Constaint at Falcon's Nest.
Defeat the Death's Embrace assassins!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I have tidings, Forename! Hidden amongst Solkzagyl's belongings was a journal, the final entry of which contains what appears to be a map of the Gorgagne Holding.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: He marked a spot near the river, though he did not write why. Yet considering how devoted he was to recovering Oathkeeper, surely it has some relation?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I say we sally forth and investigate! We may encounter wild beasts or worse, of course, but we are well equipped to face them! Well...that is to say, you are...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Impressive, eh? It took some doing, but I managed to resize Solkzagyl's sollerets! They should afford me excellent protection against, er...thigh-high threats.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Anyway, let's see where this map leads... Somewhere over yonder, perhaps?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: If I'm reading this map correctly, the spot Solkzagyl marked is...on the other side of the river?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A trail of frozen blood leads west...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A light catches your eye, and on closer inspection, you find a gallant coronet buried beneath the snow...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Or was it further to the─ Oh, Forename! Find anything?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Solkzagyl's coronet? Then he did come here!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: There was a trail of blood as well, you said? Let's follow it and see where it leads.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: What...what is this? Blood?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: It seems to lead towards the Dusk Vigil...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Hope this is not Solkzagyl's blood...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I think it's taking us westward...

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Get the other one!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Careful! This one looks like shehe can fight!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Of course! Death's Embrace! They must have made camp here, and Solkzagyl learned of it!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Wait, was that movement just now!? To the west! We cannot let them escape!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: End of the road...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Hm. They don't seem to be carrying Oathkeeper... Well, if nothing else, we can at least bring them to justice for their countless other crimes and ensure that they harm no more innocents!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: To arms, Forename! For justice! For Solkzagyl!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...Hm. I thought the coronet would help, but that speech still felt rather uninspired...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Did we win? I mean, er...by the Fury, we won! That villainous scum will prey on the weak no longer!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Pity they didn't have Oathkeeper. Well, all in a day's work for a pair of paladins, eh? Back to Falcon's Nest for a well-earned rest.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: The wheels of justice are slow to turn, as we know all too well. Even Ser Aymeric, who they say cares deeply for the welfare of every Ishgardian─even he is bound by bureaucracy.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: It all comes back to the war, in the end. If it's not heretics or dragons, well...you know how it is.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: And the forelands, well, if you head that far west without enough hired help, you've no one to blame but yourself for what happens.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: So when my mother's caravan was raided on the road to Tailfeather, I was resigned to never knowing who to blame...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...Until Solkzagyl told me all about Death's Embrace, and I realized they were the ones responsible─for that and many other attacks.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: They chose their targets with care, preying on those who wouldn't be missed...save by their equally powerless friends and family.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: But everyone deserves a champion! Even the least among us are worth saving!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I don't know if the remaining members of Death's Embrace have Oathkeeper, but even if they don't, it is our duty as paladins to stop them!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...That's what Solkzagyl would say were he here, right?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Your chicanery ends here! ...Wait, is “chicanery” the word I want?

dialogue.name: ENEMYLEADER
dialogue.text: Royalist dogs! My voidsent will feast on your souls!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Voidsent!? I, er...I'll focus on the mage. Take care of that th–thing, will you?

dialogue.name: ENEMYLEADER
dialogue.text: Oh, you'll pay! Don't think that you won't pay!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: This...this is rather...

quest.name: ソウルクリスタル
journal: Constaint wishes to share with you a rather unusual development.

For whatever reason, it would seem that a missive penned by Solkzagyl and addressed to Constaint was sent to Tailfeather in the Dravanian forelands. An acquaintance of Constaint's, Grimold, informed him of this fact, and also insisted that he come to Tailfeather to collect the missive.

The missive is rather unusual, in that it appears to have been written weeks ago and sent with a shipment of supplies instead of by more efficient methods. Perhaps most puzzling of all are its words: “I left you a gift near the Hundred Throes. Take it, and become the man you were destined to be.” Though he knows not what to make of it, Constaint heads north to search for whatever it is the deceased paladin hid there for him.
Constaint tells you that you are in the right area, though he cannot say for certain. Search the vicinity for anything unusual.

Beneath a tree, you find a pair of gallant cuisses, as well as a faded soul crystal. Pondering the items, Constaint begins to question if he is being manipulated somehow, though he does not expound upon his suspicions in detail. He departs for Camp Riversmeet, out of a desire to speak with the one man who could explain─if only he were still alive...

As Constaint contemplates what Solkzagyl intended for him, Jenlyns suddenly arrives, having learned of his predecessor's death from Papashan. As he grieves for Solkzagyl, his soul crystal inexplicably begins to glow, as does yours, and a mysterious burst of aether flows from his crystal into yours. However, before you all can discuss what you have witnessed, you become aware of a cloaked man staring at Constaint and the soul crystal in his outstretched hand. The man disappears before you can discover his identity, but Jenlyns concludes that it was another minion of Death's Embrace, spying on Solkzagyl's pupil to see if he will continue to seek Oathkeeper. Jenlyns is, of course, still determined to reclaim the sword, but as you observe Constaint, staring at the cliff where the man once stood, you cannot help but wonder if he is equally resolved.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Constaint upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Grimold in Tailfeather.
Speak with Constaint.
Search the surrounding area.
Speak with Constaint at Camp Riversmeet.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Curious tidings, Forename. Not long ago, I received word from an acquaintance of mine, Grimold, who claims to have in his possession a missive written by Solkzagyl and addressed to me.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: He insisted that I come collect it from him in person in Tailfeather, and since we haven't any leads in our search for Oathkeeper, I see no reason to deny him. Let us be off, then!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Forename, Grimold. Grimold, Forename.

dialogue.name: GRIMOLD
dialogue.text: I appreciate you coming all this way, Constaint. I know it must seem a little odd...

dialogue.name: GRIMOLD
dialogue.text: Frankly, it's been strange from the start. Who sends a missive with provisions when we've got moogles running about who can do it far faster?

dialogue.name: GRIMOLD
dialogue.text: Not to mention the fact that bandits have been raiding caravans to Tailfeather for weeks. If it weren't for them moving on, this latest shipment would've likely never arrived. Anyroad...

dialogue.name: GRIMOLD
dialogue.text: From what I can tell, it was languishing in someone's storeroom for a while. Better late than never, though, eh?

dialogue.name: GRIMOLD
dialogue.text: It was your friend's wish that you come all this way. Read it for yourself and you'll see.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: “I left you a gift near the Hundred Throes. Take it, and become the man you were destined to be.”

dialogue.name: GRIMOLD
dialogue.text: Curious fellow, this Solkzagyl. Anyroad, if I were you, I'd head north and find whatever it is before someone else does.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: My thanks, friend. I shall do just that.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Let's head towards the Throes and see what we find, Forename.

dialogue.name: GRIMOLD
dialogue.text: If that missive is any indication, whatever your friend left behind has been there for weeks. Wouldn't be surprised if a hunter stumbled across it by now...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: It should be around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Hmm, I don't see anything out of the ordinary... Forename, why don't you try looking over there?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Is that...is that a soul you've found!?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: By the Fury, it is... And look! A pair of gallant cuisses! But why?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...Why do I feel like I'm being led by the nose?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: First the journal, now this missive?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: There's so much I want to ask─so much I should have asked when he was still alive...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: To be honest, I never really understood why you accepted me as your pupil...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: What made you change your mind? What did you see in me? And what...what would you have me do now that you're gone?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: (-???-)So it is true, then.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Papashan could not conceal the truth from me forever. He told me of Solkzagyl's claims and your search.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I could not believe it. I would not believe it. Yet now...

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Wh-What sorcery is this!?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: He was watching you, boy. You and the soul you bear.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Could he have been a minion of Death's Embrace, spying on Solkzagyl's pupil?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Perhaps they hoped Solkzagyl's quest would end with his death─that none would attempt to reclaim Oathkeeper in his stead.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: They thought us broken when our brothers betrayed us─when they robbed us of the sword and delivered it into their keeping...

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But we did not give in to despair. Nor will we do so now. Oathkeeper will be ours again, I swear it!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I must return to Ul'dah for now. The way our souls resonated was unlike anything I have ever seen before, and I would know what it portends. Pray continue to look after the boy, Forename.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: What do you want from me...?

obj.n: ディヴァインヴェール

quest.name: 堕ちた蠍
journal: Constaint has decided on a new course of action.

Rather than attempting to retrace Solkzagyl's steps, Constaint has decided that it would be better to simply pursue Death's Embrace, as they are the ones in possession of Oathkeeper. Before he embarks upon this venture, however, there is one matter he would like to discuss with Hundred Eyes, the man who buried his master...

Constaint begins to question Hundred Eyes about his master's death, but the craftsman brusquely refuses to answer, stating simply that he buried him, and that he needs not know anything else. The boy apologizes for asking and leaves to seek out someone who might know the whereabouts of Death's Embrace.

According to Emerissel, the assassins-turned-bandits have not been seen in western Coerthas for quite some time. Upon learning that the men you seek are Ul'dahn, the Ishgardian is inspired to regale you with a tale of southron idiocy, namely a gang of Ul'dahns who managed to sneak aboard the airships which travel regularly to Camp Cloudtop. The Ul'dahns then attempted to seize the Protector, despite the fact that the airship is not fit for travel. Suspecting this to be a serendipitous coincidence─and having no other leads whatsoever─Constaint suggests that you go and investigate the incident at Camp Cloudtop.
House Haillenarte is preparing to hunt down the bandits responsible for the attack, and your assistance with the operation is more than welcome. Join the assembled knights at the Rosehouse.
Having learned of House Haillenarte's plans, the Ul'dahns have fled to the east. The commanding officer bids everyone advance with caution, as these are dangerous men desperate to survive.
Though the knights manage some success against the former assassins, you must nevertheless come to their aid. One search party is no longer in danger, but the other is nowhere to be seen...

Constaint and his search party are able to defeat most of the remaining enemies, but they are unable to subdue the bandits' leader. You, however, have no such trouble. Afterwards, you are surprised to discover a pair of gallant gauntlets amongst the man's possessions...

The House Haillenarte knight thanks you for your contribution and leaves to inform Lady Laniaitte of your success. Constaint is beaming with pride, yet how will he react when you show him the gauntlets you found?
Constaint is at a loss. There is no possible explanation for how the gauntlets came to be in the assassin's possession. That they were cannot be denied, however...so what could it possibly mean?

Given the manner in which they have been struggling to survive, Constaint is forced to conclude that Death's Embrace no longer has Oathkeeper. Surely they would have sold it rather than resort to banditry, he considers. Yet even more disconcerting are the gallant gauntlets, which fit Constaint perfectly─as he suspected they would...

※The next paladin quest will be available from Constaint upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with Constaint.
Speak with Emerissel.
Speak with the House Haillenarte squire at Camp Cloudtop.
Speak with the House Haillenarte knight at the Rosehouse.
Search for the Death's Embrace assassins in the Wisent Herd.
Speak with the House Haillenarte knight.
Present the gallant gauntlets to Constaint.
Speak with Constaint in Falcon's Nest.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I'm beginning to think I've been going about this the wrong way, Forename.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I've been trying to determine the whereabouts of Oathkeeper by retracing Solkzagyl's steps, but honestly, how he came to pursue and die at the hands of Death's Embrace isn't nearly as important as the simple fact that he did.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Death's Embrace has the sword. It's the only logical conclusion. So if we find them, we find Oathkeeper.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: And even if I'm mistaken, we'd be doing the world a favor by bringing them to justice.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I wouldn't presume to speak for Solkzagyl, but I'd like to think that he'd agree. Don't you?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Yes, well...I suppose if we're going to find them, we had best start asking around.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Though there is one thing which still troubles me. I think I need to speak with Hundred Eyes...

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: Whatever it is, it can wait. I've work to do and no time to do it.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: A moment of your time, if it please...

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: For you, Constaint? Sure, sure.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: It's about Solkzagyl. He... You never told me, but...how exactly did he die?

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: You want me to paint you a bloody picture? He was murdered. I found him, and I buried him. That's all you need to know.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: It's just that, the other day, I could have sworn that I...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...Forgive me. I don't know what I was thinking. Don't let me keep you from your labors.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Let us resume our hunt for Death's Embrace.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Maybe Emerissel can tell us something of value?

dialogue.name: EMERISSEL
dialogue.text: Death's Embrace? Those bandits who used to raid caravans bound for Tailfeather? No one's seen neither hide nor hair of them recently. Why do you ask?

dialogue.name: EMERISSEL
dialogue.text: Ul'dahns, eh? Maybe they ran back to warmer climes!

dialogue.name: EMERISSEL
dialogue.text: Never understood southrons myself. Queer folk, prone to inexplicable and irrational behavior. Like those buffoons who attempted to seize the Protector, of all things!

dialogue.name: EMERISSEL
dialogue.text: Apparently they snuck aboard some of the airships ferrying supplies to Camp Cloudtop. Of course, the knights drove them off. Last I heard, they had fled into the wilds screaming “Thal's balls” this and “swivin' whoresons” that.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...Are you thinking what I'm thinking, Forename?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Admittedly, we've no reason to believe these men are the ones we seek, but we've been blessed with serendipity before. There's no harm in investigating, at least.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: This fellow looks rather well-informed. Let's see what he knows.

dialogue.name: EMERISSEL
dialogue.text: You don't suppose those Ul'dahns who tried to seize the Protector are the selfsame ones you seek, do you? Be awfully convenient if that were the case, but stranger things have been known to happen.

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTA
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Squire-)The Ul'dahns who tried to seize the Protector? Aye, I remember them. Baffling, really.

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTA
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Squire-)Signed their own death warrants with their ill-conceived attack. You can be sure that House Haillenarte won't allow them to leave these isles alive.

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTA
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Squire-)Death's Embrace, eh? I suppose it's possible they're the bandits you seek. You're welcome to help us hunt them down, if you like.

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTA
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Squire-)The boy too, yes? He can join my unit. Given your reputation, I think you better suited to the van.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I won't let you down!

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTA
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Squire-)We gather at the Rosehouse. Come─let us delay no further!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I'll see you there!

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTA
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Squire-)I'll look after him, MistressMaster Surname.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: How exciting!

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTB
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Knight-)Glad to have you with us, MistressMaster Surname. Would that we could speak at length, but the Ul'dahns are aware of our plans and have already fled to the east.

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTB
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Knight-)Remember that these are desperate, dangerous men! Advance with caution and wait for reinforcements if necessary. With me!

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTA
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Squire-)Forgive me, MistressMaster Surname, but we can go no further!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Not here! Not like this!

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTB
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Knight-)We...we have them trapped!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Be careful, Forename! He's bound a voidsent to his will!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: We did what we could, but we simply haven't the strength...

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTB
dialogue.text: (-House Haillenarte Knight-)Well fought, MistressMaster Surname! Their leader was surely the toughest of the lot.

dialogue.name: HAILLENARTEKNIGHTB
dialogue.text: Lady Laniaitte will be pleased to learn of our success. I shall inform her at once!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: That was amazing, Forename!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Hm? What have you got there?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Gallant gauntlets!? Why would a member of Death's Embrace be carrying these?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...There's no way he could have possibly planned this. It's too elaborate─nay, impossible! But what other explanation could there be?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: We should return to Falcon's Nest...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Before we cornered the leader, we came across their camp.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: It was plain to see that they had fallen on hard times, hence why they resorted to common banditry to survive.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: But isn't it strange when you think about it? I mean, if they had Oathkeeper, why not simply sell it? Surely someone would have been willing to pay for it.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I'm beginning to wonder if Solkzagyl succeeded in reclaiming the sword─or if Death's Embrace ever had it at all...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: And by the Fury, what to make of these pieces of armor...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Just as I suspected─it fits perfectly.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Whatever remnants of Death's Embrace there may be will stay in hiding for some time, I should think. But should they dare to reveal themselves, we will finish what we started...as Solkzagyl intended.

obj.n: ハンドレッド・アイズ
アインハルト家の騎兵
アインハルト家の騎兵
アインハルト家の騎士
アインハルト家の騎兵
アインハルト家の騎士

quest.name: 志すは真の騎士
journal: Constaint looks as though he has suffered a tremendous shock.

Hundred Eyes, friend to both Solkzagyl and Constaint, was attacked by a pack of wolves and gravely injured. Constaint went to see him earlier, only to be sent away and told to fetch you, of all people. Attend the injured man and see what he desires.

Resigned to his death, Hundred Eyes asks you to dig up Solkzagyl's grave and give what you find to Constaint. As you look down on the dying man, racked with pain and guilt, you briefly consider pressing him for an explanation, but decide against it for now.

Deep beneath the cold, hard earth, you find not a coffin, but a small chest containing a gallant surcoat. A cry of rage causes you to whirl about, bringing you face-to-face with Constaint, who followed you at a distance. You quickly explain yourself, further confusing the boy. After a moment, he declares that he will have answers from Hundred Eyes and makes for Falcon's Nest.

Alas, whatever Hundred Eyes's reasons were, they will remain forever unknown. The craftsman succumbed to his injuries in your absence, leaving you and Constaint with no one else to press for answers─save for Papashan, who came to Falcon's Nest out of growing concern for your well-being. Stating simply that he must have words with Constaint, he asks that you meet with him at Lancegate, far to the north, and leaves.

You find yourself rather unsurprised by the revelation that Solkzagyl lives, as the former captain reveals himself to be the cloaked man who observed you from atop the cliff at Camp Riversmeet. His was a complex and impenetrable plot to push Constaint towards becoming a paladin and seeking Oathkeeper of his own volition. It is not enough to reclaim Oathkeeper, he states. The sword must be won by a worthy paladin, whose soul is so pure and powerful that all others are driven to yield. However, when two souls cannot reconcile─when one cannot establish dominance, there is but one recourse: a duel. A duel to establish who is truly worthy of Oathkeeper. Though a part of him believes it to be utter nonsense, Constaint is unwilling to renounce his oaths after having come so far─and neither are you.

Though he fights bravely and with conviction, Constaint is clearly no match for you. Yet the true test is yet to come. Jenlyns arrives and accuses Solkzagyl of having already recovered Oathkeeper, and the former captain at last reveals the full extent of his plans: to restore the light of the soul crystal once wielded by the first captain of the Sultansworn. In so doing, Solkzagyl hopes to infuse Oathkeeper with the resplendent light with which it once shone. Donning his armor, he demands that you face him in battle. And so you defeat him as well, establishing dominance over his and Constaint's souls.

For thirty years, as captain of the Sultansworn, Solkzagyl strove to live up to the example set by the order's founder. For thirty years, he tried to make Oathkeeper shine, as it did for the legendary captains of eld. It did, one day, but only for a fleeting moment─before it was taken from him and he forswore his oaths to reclaim it. Though you are not a true member of the order, he believes that the sword will shine for you. Gingerly taking the sword from his hands, you hold it aloft, and for a moment, the world is bathed in light. In witnessing its resplendence once more, Solkzagyl seems to find a measure of peace.

The light fades as you hand the sword to Jenlyns, but the captain does not seem to be disappointed. He invites Solkzagyl to return to Ul'dah, and the former captain agrees─though only as a friend and ally, for to leave the order is to leave it forever.

Constaint struggles to say good-bye to Solkzagyl, but the paladin corrects him, stating that his business in Falcon's Nest is hardly finished, and they will meet again soon. Jenlyns, Papashan, and Solkzagyl set out for Ul'dah, and you and Constaint head back towards Falcon's Nest.

Though he has yet to reconcile his feelings towards Solkzagyl, Constaint still intends to be the best free paladin he can be. He bids you farewell, but not before warning you that, should you cross blades again, he means to win.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with the House Durendaire leech.
Dig up Solkzagyl's grave.
Speak with Constaint.
Speak with Papashan.
Speak with Solkzagyl.
Speak with Constaint.
Speak with Constaint in Falcon's Nest.
Defeat Constaint!
Defeat Solkzagyl!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Terrible news, Forename! Hundred Eyes has been gravely wounded! There were wolves, and...and he fought them off as best as he could, but by the time the sentries came to his aid...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I went to see him earlier, but he turned me away and bid me fetch you. For the life of me, I cannot imagine why...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I've no idea what he wishes to discuss with you, but please hurry, for his sake!

dialogue.name: DURENDAIREKNIGHT
dialogue.text: ...I will do what I can to ease his suffering.

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: (-Hundred Eyes-)<cough> <wheeze> Wolves. Swivin' wolves...

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: (-Hundred Eyes-)Reckon I've earned it. <cough> <cough> So. Time to settle one last account.

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: (-Hundred Eyes-)Go to Solkzagyl's grave. Dig it up. Take what you find and give it to the boy.

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: (-Hundred Eyes-)Won't make up for what I did to my sworn brothers, but perhaps...it'll go a ways towards redressin' the balance.

dialogue.name: HUNDREDEYES
dialogue.text: (-Hundred Eyes-)<cough> <wheeze> 'Course, what we've done to the boy ain't hardly defensible, no matter what he says...

dialogue.name: DURENDAIREKNIGHT
dialogue.text: Please, he needs rest...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Several fulms beneath the cold, hard earth, you find not a coffin, but a small chest containing a gallant surcoat...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: What have you done!?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: But...but how can this be!? Why would Hundred Eyes lie to us!?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: That bastard! I will have answers from him! From them both!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Come! We're going back to Falcon's Nest!

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Rest in peace, brother...

dialogue.name: DURENDAIREKNIGHT
dialogue.text: He's gone...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: We're too late...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Jenlyns and I had grown worried. That it has come to this...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. There was nothing more to be done.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Gods...godsdammit all!

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: ...We must have words, Constaint. I go to Lancegate. Look for me there.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: What was it all for...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Here we are...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: My comrade wishes to explain himself.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Why the lies, Solkzagyl!? Was this all just some game to you!?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: I had my reasons, as you will soon learn─

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: That's a rather odd way of apologizing, Solkzagyl. I suggest you try again.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: ...I am sorry for deceiving you, Constaint.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Faking your death, constructing an elaborate scenario for me to find your armor...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: To be honest, I'm as astonished as I am offended. How could you have possibly orchestrated everything so perfectly?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: It doesn't matter how I did it. What matters is why I did it.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Oathkeeper is but a sword, Constaint. True oaths are not forged in steel─they are sworn in the heart.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: To merely reclaim the sword will not suffice. It must be won by a worthy paladin. Only then will it─and our order─be restored to its former glory.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
