dialogue.text: I don't understand. Why not simply teach me the ways, as you said you would?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: A sultan may move a man. A master may instruct his pupil. But only when that pupil moves himself can he become a paladin.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: ...That said, I did not account for Forename's intervention.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Master Papashan, as we discussed.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: ...Very well.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: The souls we paladins wield are embodiments of our will.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: In keeping to our oaths, they grow stronger, more dominant.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: In the presence of a particularly pure soul, others may be compelled to yield...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: But when two souls cannot reconcile─when one cannot establish dominance─it can spell disaster.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...That seems awfully inconvenient.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Oh, you have no idea. As the discordance between two souls grows, the aether builds, and the souls grow unstable.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Aye, their souls looked as though they were fit to burst with aether.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Wait. You don't mean to say that their souls will be destroyed, do you?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: By the Fury! How do we stop it!?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You fight. Your souls demand it.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You two cannot coexist as you are. One must rise above.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...That's the stupidest thing I've ever heard.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: We are paladins! Defenders of the weak and needy! What madness is this that we must face each other in battle!?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: But...if there is truly no other way...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I will not renounce my oaths! I will become the paladin I was destined to be! And if that means that we must fight, then so be it!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I...I am ready.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Well, I suppose we must take Solkzagyl's word for it.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Come, sisterbrother!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Am I truly so weak...?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: No, Constaint. Nothing could be further from the truth. You fought with honor and purpose. Do not be ashamed.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Solkzagyl...

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Impressive. Truly impressive. Intrigue and deception that would put Lord Lolorito to shame.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Tell them the truth, Solkzagyl. The whole truth.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Figured it out, have you?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Do you still have the soul I left for you at the Hundred Throes?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: What? Oh, yes. Here.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: This soul once belonged to the first captain of the Sultansworn─the first paladin who wielded Oathkeeper.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Once, it shone with a resplendent light, as did Oathkeeper. But now, both have lost their luster...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Aye, I have the sword! And everything I have done─that I have made you all do─has been for the sole purpose of making it shine once more!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text:
Of course. It's so simple!
...Wait, no, it's not. It's needlessly complicated.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: What of your soul─the one you gave to Forename when first you met? I yet have it, Solkzagyl. Take it, and restore Oathkeeper's light with your own!

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: ...Once a man has left the Sultansworn, he cannot return. My soul will no longer suffice.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: All I can do is show another the way, and ask that shehe do the same for herhis brothers and sisters.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: But shehe does not yet stand above all others...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Not until shehe has bested me. Draw your sword, Forename. The time has come.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: At long last...a paladin...who can make it shine again...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Behold Oathkeeper. Bestowed upon the first captain of the Sultansworn. Stolen under my watch by the minions of the Monetarists.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: For years, I sought to reclaim it─to redeem myself for my failure...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text:
“A paladin swears allegiance to the sultanate.”
“A paladin shall be the sword and shield of the sultanate.”
“A paladin defends the people of the realm.”

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Thirty years I aspired to those ideals. Thirty years I tried to live up to the example set by our founder, so revered that his very soul crystal would be set in Oathkeeper's pommel.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: For those legendary captains of eld, the sword would shimmer with such brilliance that night would be as day...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Yet for the thirty years I wore it, it shined for me but once.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: That was before it was taken from me. Before I forswore my oaths so I could reclaim it.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Forename. Through all your trials and tribulations, you have remained true to yourself and to Eorzea.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: You continue to be an inspiration to us all.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Come, take up Oathkeeper. Raise it aloft and let it shine forth as a beacon unto all!

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: ...You were always my first choice, Forename.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Constaint was incentive. Motivation. Though, in the end, he proved himself to be so much more.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: ...You're a right bastard, you know that? Doing all this just to make a bloody sword shine.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Praise Halone that I found a proper mentor in Forename.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Well, I may not be the chosen one, but I'm still a free paladin...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: That is the path I have chosen for myself, and on it I will stay.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Well said. It would not do for you to be so easily discouraged.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Jenlyns, I leave matters here in your capable hands.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You've done it again, Forename.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Oathkeeper may not shine for me as it did for you, but perhaps, in time, it will.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But even should it not, I will not lose heart, for a paladin's virtue is not in the radiance of his blade, but in the righteousness of his actions.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: By what we decide to do every day, we will be good men. Or not.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Solkzagyl. Oathkeeper is returned to the Sultansworn. Will you not return to us as well?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: ...As a friend and ally perhaps, but not as a brother.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Some bonds, once broken, cannot be mended.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: I thank you, Forename, for all you have done.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Heh, how strange that we must turn to a free paladin, rather than one of our own, to show us the way.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Yet I suppose it is not the first time, is it...

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: ...If you still mean to ask how I planned it all, don't. You wouldn't believe me anyway.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: It would seem that some questions weren't meant to be answered, and we must simply deal with it.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: I've got to say, I've given it some thought, and I cannot see how it was possible for him to... Oh, never mind.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: So that's it, then? You're leaving?

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: Ul'dah beckons, and besides, I've nothing left to teach you.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Then I wish you well on your journey, and pray that you find happiness there.

dialogue.name: SOLKZAGYL
dialogue.text: I'm coming back, you know. There's an awful lot of work to be done in Falcon's Nest, and I did make a promise to Hundred Eyes...

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Oh! Then I shall see you when you return!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: We should head back, too, Forename.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I'm still not quite sure what it was all for, but it seems to have ended well enough.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: I suppose you ought to get back to your grand adventures, and me to my paladin-ing, or whatever it is you call it.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Right, then. It's been a pleasure, Forename!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Oh, but I warn you: the next time we cross blades, I mean to win! Fare thee well!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the paladin quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: There can be only one, Forename! Face me!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Of...of course. I knew it wouldn't be easy...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No, no! I will not yield!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: A paladin must be...without fear in the face...in the face of...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Come, paladin! Show me the mettle in your heart and steel in your blade!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Yes, fight and struggle! Hold nothing back!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Good, good! But it will not be enough!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Have you the strength to overcome this!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: A performance worthy of the Warrior of Light!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Not yet, Forename! We are not yet finished!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Yeeesss! YEEESSS!

obj.n: デュランデル家の治療師

quest.name: アラグの遺物より
journal: Y'mhitra has glad tidings she would share with you.

Y'mhitra has presented her findings on the art of summoning to her peers, and tells you of the overwhelmingly positive reaction. In addition to a flood of offers to assist with her research, she has also been promised a contribution of several rare Allagan tomestones. Join Y'mhitra on her journey to Saint Coinach's Find, and speak with Rammbroes about the newly unearthed relics.

You call on Rammbroes at the scholars' camp in Mor Dhona, and he gladly surrenders several Allagan tomestones to Y'mhitra. After mentioning your role in defeating Leviathan, Ramuh, and Shiva, the anthropogeographer subsequently theorizes that you should now be capable of summoning forth new egi. Y'mhitra, jumping excitedly at this realization, presses her colleague for suggestions of suitable locations at which to attempt the rituals. Head to the Singing Shards, and join the researcher in the north of the area.
Your attempt to summon Ramuh-Egi in the Singing Shards has ended in failure. Return to Apkallu Falls, and discuss this unexpected development with Y'mhitra.

Even after examining her previous findings, Y'mhitra has been unable to ascertain the reason behind the failed ritual. She then promises to begin her study of the Allagan tomestones she received from Rammbroes, and asks that you prepare yourself, body and spirit, for the unknown challenges that lie ahead.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 52.
objectives: Speak with Rammbroes at Saint Coinach's Find.
Speak with Y'mhitra.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename! You visit me at a most opportune moment─I have tidings that you of all people should hear.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: After our last encounter, I presented our findings on the art of summoning to my fellow scholars. Suffice it to say that the response has been enthusiastic─in addition to a flood of offers to assist with my research, I have also been promised a contribution of several rare Allagan tomestones.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I imagine that any summoning knowledge hidden within those relics would prove of great benefit to us both. Shall we journey out to Mor Dhona now, and pay a visit to Rammbroes?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem that I am to be the recipient of several Allagan tomestones. I suggest we call on Rammbroes at Saint Coinach's Find, and take possession of these valuable relics.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: There are so many aspects of summoning that we are yet to fully understand. I wonder what incredible secrets might lurk within these newly unearthed relics...

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Forename! How do you fare, my friend? As ever, we here at Saint Coinach's Find remain firmly entrenched in our efforts to excavate the secrets of the Allagan Empire. The members of NOAH must be armed with knowledge if they are truly to pave the way to the future...

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Well met! Without your invaluable cooperation, our research in the region would have ground to a highly unsatisfying halt.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Ah, I see you are here with the intrepid Y'mhitra. Might I assume you have come to collect your promised tomestones?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, I am most eager to sink my scholar's teeth into something new...

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Then allow me to feed your fervor. We have uncovered a number of relics which, on cursory inspection, appear to contain detailed methodology for several summoner incantations. Who better than you to decipher their mysteries?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Leviathan, Ramuh, Shiva... With every new primal that appears, the importance of a thorough study of summoning magicks becomes ever more apparent.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Speaking of those particular deities, Forename, I am given to understand that you had a hand in defeating every one of them. Your name features quite prominently in the reports we receive from the Scions of the Seventh Dawn.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: And as you were present at each of their downfalls, it then follows that your aura was infused with the essences of those primals. Could it be possible that you now have the potential to call forth new egi?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: By the Twelve, of course! The most trying of the requisite conditions has already been met... All that remains is to perform the summoning rituals at locations charged with the appropriate elemental energies!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Master Rammbroes! Can you suggest any places in which the aetheric balance tips heavily towards either water, lightning, or ice?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: The Singing Shards should adequately serve your needs for lightning─the area is alive with the constant discharge of crackling energy.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The Singing Shards it is, then! Let us perform the Austerities of Lightning, and attempt to bring Ramuh-Egi into this world!

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: If you wish to begin with Ramuh-Egi, then the nearby Singing Shards should serve your needs most admirably.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I missed you at the Singing Shards, Forename. Shall we return there now, and perform the Austerities of Lightning?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Let us then begin the Austerities of Lightning. Concentrate on shifting your aetheric energies towards the desired element...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Hm? I sense...nothing.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I do not understand─all of the conditions have been fulfilled.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: This summoning ritual has never failed us before! Whatever could we be missing...?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...Well, there is little point in us remaining here if Ramuh-Egi will not answer your call. Shall we return to Gridania?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Hello, Forename. I scoured my research notes for a hint as to why the summoning failed, but there were no revelations to be found.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I am forced to conclude that the cause must lie outside our current understanding of the art. Thus shall I begin studying the tomestones we received from Rammbroes, and hope they contain some heretofore unknown wisdom.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Mayhap these new egi require a different manner of catalyst...? While I delve into this mystery, I suggest you continue practicing your art─we enter an uncharted realm of summoning and you must be prepared, body and spirit.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 52.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 事実の究明
journal: Y'mhitra has new knowledge to share with you.

Y'mhitra confesses that her studies have yet to reveal the reason behind the failure of the Austerities of Lightning, but is otherwise pleased to announce the discovery of several new summoner incantations. Her attempt to instruct you, however, is suddenly interrupted by the arrival of Captain Dancing Wolf─an Immortal Flames officer who claims to be in pursuit of the dark summoner, Tristan. Though Tristan was apparently consumed by fire at the culmination of your battle, Captain Wolf has witness accounts that place him at the scene of a merchant caravan attack. Unwilling to dismiss the possibility that the dangerous madman yet lives, Y'mhitra requests that you both be allowed to assist in the ongoing investigation. Travel to Camp Drybone in eastern Thanalan, and speak with Dancing Wolf.

You join Captain Wolf in Camp Drybone, and the officer sets you the task of searching for more witnesses to the incident. Make your way around the settlement, and gather more information from the merchants.
You speak with several Camp Drybone inhabitants, and learn that a survivor of the attack has recently left town. Return to Dancing Wolf, and report your findings.

Upon learning that the merchant who survived the attack has but recently left Camp Drybone, Captain Wolf immediately sets off in pursuit. Search the road heading east towards Highbridge, and find the assaulted importer.

You come across the unfortunate trader under attack by an Amalj'aa raiding party. After saving him from the beastmen's spears, the merchant gratefully provides you with a description of the man responsible for the caravan attack. The silvery-haired villain appears to have been in command of Ifrit-Egi, further deepening your suspicions that Tristan is indeed still alive. Head to Ul'dah, and discuss these developments with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.

You meet Captain Wolf at the Immortal Flames headquarters, and once more hear the tragic story of how Tristan was compelled to slay his own brother. As the dark summoner was once a soldier under his command, Dancing Wolf feels bound by duty to expunge the evil Tristan has become. Accept Y'mhitra's instruction in the damaging magicks recovered from the tomestones, and prepare for the day when you may once more face the madman's flames.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Dancing Wolf upon reaching level 54.
objectives: Speak with Dancing Wolf at Camp Drybone.
Question the merchants of Camp Drybone.
Report to Dancing Wolf.
Search for the assaulted importer.
Speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. Since we last met, the arduous task of deciphering those tomestones has occupied my every waking moment. I have made significant progress, but the cause of the ritual's failure yet eludes me...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
I am somewhat heartened, however, by my discovery of a number of new incantations. In fact, there is one spell which I believe you could soon master with a minimum of instruct─
...Hm?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Pray forgive my interruption. You are the leaders of the research effort on summoning magicks, yes?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I am Captain Dancing Wolf, of the Immortal Flames. It is fortunate that I find you together, as I have questions for you both...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And what would the Immortal Flames want with us, Captain Wolf? Does Ul'dah's military have some vested interest in the activities of summoners?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Just one summoner in particular, madam. We seek a man by the name of Tristan.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...Then you do know him. I've read reports that you had been in pursuit of our former soldier, but I always like to have confirmation on our intelligence.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: The Immortal Flames has its own reasons for wanting Tristan found. If you have any idea of his whereabouts, then I must know what you know!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: So, Tristan matched his summoning magicks against yours, and was ultimately consumed in fire. ...And you are certain he perished?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...Have we given you reason to suspect otherwise?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I do not doubt the veracity of your tale, but...there has been an incident. A merchant caravan was recently attacked by a man who, by the description given, closely resembles Tristan in appearance.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Should we allow the crime of a former Immortal Flame to go unanswered, then the integrity of the entire organization would be called into question. I will find him, and see that justice is served.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We looked on as Tristan was engulfed in flames. Naught remained─not even a charred corpse─and we believed him utterly consumed. Could he have somehow survived that inferno?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: If he is alive, then we have unwittingly permitted the escape of a known pawn of the Paragons. Captain Wolf, you must allow us to accompany you on your investigation.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Your combined expertise in the summoning arts is most welcome, Lady Y'mhitra. The attack occurred on one of the roads out of Camp Drybone─join me at the settlement proper, and we can continue the search for witnesses.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We cannot allow a madman like Tristan to roam unchecked. Let us hasten to Camp Drybone and assist Captain Wolf with his investigations.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Assuming Tristan truly was behind this recent violence, whatever could he stand to gain from attacking a simple caravan...?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra. Forename. As we are now cooperating on this investigation, I see no reason not to trust you with some of its duties. Let's split up, and find out what these merchants know.

dialogue.name: TUTUSI
dialogue.text: ...Aye, now that you mention it, they did just cart in the body of a merchant. Such things are hardly noteworthy around here, though. As such, I failed to take notes.

dialogue.name: ADELSTAN
dialogue.text: ...The attack out on the road? I hear the man who did it was swathed in a robe that was black as midnight─one of Ifrit's tempered, I should think.

dialogue.name: ERMEGARDE
dialogue.text: A friend of mine survived the assault─said he even caught a glimpse of the villain's twisted face! I'm certain he would tell you more had he not left camp the moment his injuries were bound...

dialogue.name: TUTUSI
dialogue.text: ...Aye, now that you mention it, they did just cart in the body of a merchant. Such things are hardly noteworthy around here, though. As such, I failed to take notes.

dialogue.name: ADELSTAN
dialogue.text: ...The attack out on the road? I hear the man who did it was swathed in a robe that was black as midnight─one of Ifrit's tempered, I should think.

dialogue.name: ERMEGARDE
dialogue.text: A friend of mine survived the assault─said he even caught a glimpse of the villain's twisted face! I'm certain he would tell you more had he not left camp the moment his injuries were bound...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twould seem a merchant who lived through the attack has already set out with his goods again. The traders of Thanalan are naught if not hardy...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: So, we have one merchant left alive to tell the tale. According to my inquiries, our intrepid trader will likely be en route to Highbridge─we may yet catch him on the road if we are swift.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We cannot allow Tristan to terrorize the land again. Let us provide Captain Wolf with whatever assistance he requires.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I heard Amalj'aa war cries... Are you unhurt, sir?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT02101
dialogue.text: Yes, thank you, I... Well, aside from the injuries I sustained from a previous incident, I suppose. First the caravan, and now this. Must Thal be so eager to usher me into His hall?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: It is concerning the assault on your caravan that we endeavored to seek you out, sir. Is there aught you can tell us of the attacker?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT02101
dialogue.text: Aye, I should be glad to see him brought to justice. Though I did not see his face in any great detail─concealed as it was in the depths of a black cowl─I did glimpse a lock of silvery hair...

dialogue.name: MERCHANT02101
dialogue.text: By his stature, I marked him of Hyuran stock...and by his fiery servant, a hells-spawned demon in disguise.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: A fiery servant...?

dialogue.name: MERCHANT02101
dialogue.text: Thal's b-balls, th-that's the one! Where do you people find those things!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The villain was in command of Ifrit-Egi, then. And we know the affinity Tristan has for primal flame.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Aye, all the evidence points towards our man!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Thank you for your cooperation, sir. You have been of great help to our investigation.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT02101
dialogue.text: Oh, think nothing of it! Consider it poor recompense for my rescue at the hands of this gallant adventurer!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I must report these developments to my superiors at the Hall of Flames. Pray join me in Ul'dah─there is more I would discuss with you.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Captain Wolf seems most troubled. No doubt this case has forced him to relive terrible memories he would sooner let fade...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...You know of Tristan's older brother, Kahedin? Both were soldiers in service to the Immortal Flames. Both were soldiers under my command.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Our unit was one of many deployed in the mission to destroy the primal Ifrit─an operation that succeeded at a staggering cost. Those who were not incinerated were tempered...with Kahedin suffering the latter fate.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: As you well know, a primal's power is fueled by the faith of its thralls─and the greatest mercy we can grant such unfortunates is a swift journey to Thal's hallowed halls. Tristan volunteered to end the cursed existence of his own brother.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
He returned to Ul'dah with Kahedin's blood on his blade, and I watched, helpless, as the guilt slowly strangled the life in his eyes. No words of comfort could reach him, and when he at last quit the Flames, he was a husk of the man he once was.
Never did I imagine his grief-maddened mind would drive him to such desperate evils.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Tristan was my soldier, and it is my responsibility to stop him. Thanks to your aid, we have mounting proof that he is still out there. When we are ready, we shall make our move.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We are content to follow your lead in this, Captain Wolf. And we should certainly be fully prepared if we are to meet the dark summoner in battle.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: To that end, Forename, I would teach you one of the incantations I gleaned from those repositories of Allagan wisdom. 'Tis a spell of damaging magick, employed in combat by the summoners of eld.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Let us call upon Captain Wolf again once you have mastered its use. It would not do to engage Tristan while stumbling over unfamiliar magicks.

obj.n: ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士

quest.name: その真相は
journal: Dancing Wolf awaits your return, a grave expression upon his features.

Dancing Wolf welcomes your return to the Hall of Flames with news of another attack. According to the report, it seems that the villain you assume to be Tristan has struck again at a mining operation in central Thanalan. Head to the Nanawa Mines, and question the miner who survived the slaughter.

Tired of the constant interruptions to his work, the assaulted miner stubbornly refuses to answer any more queries until you provide the assistance he has requested. The surly laborer puts Dancing Wolf to work hauling rocks, and assigns you the task of retrieving chunks of fire silver stolen by the local spriggans. Investigate the spriggan scratchings, and wrest the rare ore from the clutches of the thieving soulkin.
You have defeated the spriggans, and recovered several chunks of fire silver. Deliver the ore to the assaulted miner at the Nanawa Mines.

Pleased by the return of his fire silver, the miner at last agrees to share the tale of the attack. Y'mhitra arrives just as the laborer begins his story, and once more signals you to summon Ifrit-Egi as a means of confirming the attacker's identity. In response to the question of what motivated the villain's actions, the miner insists that Tristan was after only one thing: crystals. Return to the Hall of Flames, and discuss this worrying revelation.

After reexamining various incident reports, Dancing Wolf is convinced that Tristan was behind several other recent attacks that were mistakenly attributed to the Amalj'aa. With every case involving the theft of crystals, Y'mhitra voices the concern of all present: the nefarious madman harbors plans to call forth a primal. If the atrocities of the past are to be averted in the present, then you must take full advantage of Y'mhitra's studies, and master the recovered wisdom of Allag's summoners.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Dancing Wolf upon reaching level 56.
objectives: Speak with the assaulted miner at the Nanawa Mines.
Investigate spriggan scratchings and obtain chunks of fire silver.
Deliver the chunks of fire silver to the assaulted miner.
Speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Auspicious timing, Forename. There has been news...and none of it good. Our soldiers in central Thanalan have reported another attack.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I looked over the notes for the initial investigation, and it would seem Tristan─or someone who looks very much like him─has struck again. I'll have one of my men contact Y'mhitra with the details, but I suggest we head out to the Nanawa Mines immediately and question one of the surviving victims.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra sent word that she would be along shortly. If only this gentleman was as agreeable...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I am on the cusp of unlocking another secret from the tomestones... Pray continue the investigation without me for now.

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Whaddaya mean, more questions? I've spilled me tale to three different soldiers already! Me work gets further an' further behind every time I gotta stop an' talk to you folk!

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: ...Here's an idea, though: how about you scratch my back, an' I'll scratch yours? That big lad in the uniform there looks like he could lift some good-sized rocks!

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: An' what about you, lasslad─you some sorta mage? We've had some trouble with the local spriggans swipin' our fire silver, an' you're just the womanbloke to get it back. That stuff's as rare as chocobo teeth, you know!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Now just a moment, sir! We don't have the time for these distractions!

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Then maybe I don't got the time to talk to you. Not until there's a little “give” with your “take.”

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I fear he means to be stubborn about this, Forename. Please humor the man, and retrieve his precious ore from the spriggans...

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Aye, I'm gonna need me fire silver back from them spriggans. Always lurkin' nearby, they are, sniffin' about the carts... You'll find 'em soon enough.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> ...This is a picnic...compared to my officer training...

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: You find them spriggans, lasslad? What about me fire silver?

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Oho, you got the whole lot back! Much appreciated!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
My apologies─my studies took rather longer than I─
...Captain Wolf? Is everything all right?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...Everything's fine. Now, let's hear your story, sir.

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Aye, I reckon you've earned it. Well, we was in the mine, loadin' the carts with our haul for the day, when this bloke in robes appears. Doesn't say a word─the bastard just snaps his fingers, an' sets his pet demon to lightin' me mates on fire...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ifrit-Egi... Forename, if you would be so kind?

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Bloody hells! Aye, that's the fiend I saw!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Tis as we feared, then... And this robe-clad man─do you have any idea of why he attacked you?

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Well, lass, there's more than silver to be had from Nanawa─on a good day, we dig up our fair share of crystals, as well. That seems to be what he was after.

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: I'm not ashamed to say that I fled for me life once folk started goin' up in flames. But when I went back to sort out the mess, the cart what had the crystals in it was empty.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...He took them all?

dialogue.name: MINER02102
dialogue.text: Aye, every single one. An' that's all I've got to say about that. Hope you catch the bastard!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Crystals... There was a crate of crystals on the list of goods stolen from that caravan. He must have taken everything else to conceal his intent...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Our quarry grows careless...or simply impatient. It is time I reexamined certain other incidents that we did not think related to this case. Meet me at the Hall of Flames and we shall discuss the matter further.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I can imagine only one reason why a man such as Tristan would seek to acquire a wealth of crystals... Come, Forename─let us not keep Captain Wolf waiting.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Whatever evil our callous foe is planning, we cannot allow it to come to fruition. Let us speak with Captain Wolf, and learn what else his investigations have uncovered.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...I inspected our incident records, paying close attention to cargo manifests that included crystals. We had attributed several recent raids to the Amalj'aa, but the victims were, every one of them, burned to death. Not entirely impossible, considering the lizardmen's affinity for fire, but to find not a single arrow or spear wound...?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, 'tis highly unlikely. Mayhap I should state aloud what we are all thinking...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Judging by the sheer number of crystals involved, we must assume that this villain intends to call forth a primal.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: After my encounter with Ifrit, I learned just how devastatingly powerful these entities can be... And I believe that summoners, with their ability to harness such power, hold the potential to achieve great things.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: But if Tristan truly is mad enough to summon a primal, then that unthinkable act─and the bloody deeds he performed in preparation for it─will cause people to question the motives of all who practice the summoner's art!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: My studies of the tomestones revealed to me a tale of adulation: the summoners of Allag were revered as heroes for their part in defeating the ancient primals.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: But reverence slowly turned to revulsion as practitioners─intoxicated by their own immense power─began wielding the art of summoning as a means to further their own selfish ambitions.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: That is not to say, of course, that all summoners chose to become tyrants. Amongst the common people, however, it became a strongly held superstition that those who meddled in the powers of primals ultimately fell into the embrace of evil.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: This superstition blossomed into outright terror, and that is when the mage hunts began... By the end of the Third Astral Era, the last of the summoners had vanished from the stage of history.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And should we allow Tristan to go through with his plans, then we risk a repeat of that tragedy. I will review the state of patrols on the crystal trade routes─we will catch him!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename. Before I joined you at the Nanawa Mines, I was able to recover another incantation that may prove useful in the coming days. Wield its power wisely...

obj.n: ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士

quest.name: 黒衣の男
journal: Dancing Wolf is ready to go on the offensive.

After noting that Tristan's attacks have ceased since increasing trade route patrols, Dancing Wolf puts forth his plan to lure the summoner into a trap. He has arranged for a lightly guarded caravan as bait, and would have you and Y'mhitra be present to assist in engaging the dangerous mage. Make your way to Camp Bluefog in northern Thanalan, and speak with the captain to learn the details of the ambush.

You arrive in Camp Bluefog, and Dancing Wolf explains his simple plan: the caravan, carrying a shipment of crystals, will conveniently break an axle on its way to the processing plant. You, Y'mhitra, and the captain are to take up positions nearby, and await Tristan's attack. Head to your assigned position, and stay alert for the black-robed madman.

Lured by the promise of easy plunder, a mage and his flame-enshrouded familiar have appeared and assaulted the caravan. Defeat the ebon-clad summoner and Ifrit-Egi, and put an end to the string of callous attacks.
Following a furious exchange of arcane violence, the black-robed villain lies defeated at your feet. Tend now to the wounded courier decoy.

Dancing Wolf and Y'mhitra join you at the scene of the battle, after defeating opponents of their own. Upon inspecting the body of the summoner, however, the flame captain is astonished to discover that the assailant is not Tristan, but Tristan's elder brother, Kahedin. It is then that the Ascian of the Twelfth Chalice appears, lamenting his decision to employ the siblings as pawns. The Paragon proceeds to laud the primal-slaying efforts of the Bringer of Light, before vanishing as abruptly as he had appeared. Return now to the Hall of Flames in Ul'dah, and discuss these revelations with Dancing Wolf.

The identity of the black-robed menace has finally been revealed as the long-dead Kahedin─a reanimated puppet of a powerful Ascian. Though Tristan and his brother are now free of the Paragon's manipulations, Dancing Wolf is intent on exacting vengeance on the callous immortal. Y'mhitra counsels caution, warning that the servants of Darkness are not to be lightly challenged. To that end, the researcher then instructs you in yet another secret of ancient Allagan magicks. Continue your efforts to master the art of summoning that you might benefit from the wisdom hidden within the remaining tomestones.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Dancing Wolf upon reaching level 58.
objectives: Speak with Dancing Wolf at Camp Bluefog.
Lie in wait at the designated location.
Defeat the ebon-clad summoner and Ifrit-Egi.
Aid the courier decoy.
Speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. I hope you are prepared to take action.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Ever since we increased our presence on the trade routes, our black-robed villain has ceased his attacks. Now it is our turn to go on the offensive.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: With the blessings of my superiors, I have arranged for a lightly guarded shipment of crystals with which we will lure Tristan into an ambush.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And I want you there when we spring the trap! I have already sent word to Y'mhitra, and she will meet us in Camp Bluefog. Let us bring an end to this, Forename.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Have you spoken with Captain Wolf? I suggest we follow his orders, and trust in the preparations of the Immortal Flames.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We have been waiting for you, Forename. Let us put Captain Wolf's plan into action!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Forename, you're here. Good. Our “crystal couriers” have just left camp.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: The plan is simple: the caravan will head towards the processing plant, but conveniently break an axle before reaching the east watchtower.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: We three will take up separate positions nearby, and wait for Tristan to take the bait─I've had the driver complaining long and loudly about the lack of a suitable escort for his precious cargo, so we can be reasonably sure that an attack will come.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I trust you need no further explanations? Head to your assigned position, and do your best to keep out of sight.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Is aught amiss? This tree is hardly big enough to conceal the both of us...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: If I've read him aright, Tristan will be unable to resist this lure. But enough talk─take up your position, and keep an eye out for black-robed madmen.

dialogue.name: SOLDIER02103
dialogue.text: ...You're here for the ambush? Uh, it's a pleasure to meet you and all, but you'd best keep your distance─we wouldn't want the enemy avoiding our carefully laid trap, eh?

dialogue.name: SOLDIER02103
dialogue.text: Aaargh! It burns! IT BURNS!!!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Talk to me, soldier!

dialogue.name: SOLDIER02103
dialogue.text: I... I'll live, Captain. He popped right out of thin air... Took me by surprise...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The same happened to me. Another man in dark robes stepped through some manner of portal, and assailed me with spells.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: My position also came under attack─an underling, judging by the ease with which I dispatched him. But I have never before seen such teleportation magicks...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...No! It cannot be...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You know this man, Captain Wolf?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: This is Kahedin─Tristan's brother! But how...? He was tempered...slain...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: (-Haughty Voice-)...And now both siblings have disappointed me. <sigh> I should exercise more care in choosing my pawns.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: An Ascian!? That voice... You were the one who taught Tristan the art of summoning! Have you come to inflict yet more misery upon the world!?

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: ...Tristan? Yes, that was the other's name. I had hoped to groom him─granted him the knowledge of Allag's mages that he might unleash his wrath against the primals. Alas, he was all too easily vanquished...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: No matter. The Bringer of Light has proven a more-than-adequate replacement for my failed god-slayer.

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: With every primal you kill, the beastmen's fervor grows ever hotter. We need but supply the tribes with crystals...and watch as they summon ever more terrible deities!

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: When the confluence of chaos reaches its peak, the world shall be swallowed in Darkness. Our master shall rise again...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...He's gone.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And we should be gone as well. I shall see that my soldier is treated for his wounds, then await you outside the Hall of Flames.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Once again, a Paragon lurks behind the curtain, pulling the strings. I should have suspected...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...I believe some reassessment is in order. We now know that the black-robed menace we thought to be Tristan was actually his brother, Kahedin─a reanimated puppet, under the control of an Ascian.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Both brothers were present at Ifrit's defeat, so Kahedin's aura, too, would have been stained with the primal's essence. Which, if I understand correctly, would explain his ability to command the egi.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: But for that Ascian to raise the lad's corpse and press him into service as his pet summoner... I shall see the blackguard suffer for his cruel depravity!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, the Paragon has many crimes for which he must answer. But we must move with great caution─the power of these immortals is not to be underestimated.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I will return to Gridania, and redouble my efforts to decipher the remaining tomestones. We cannot face an Ascian unprepared!

obj.n: ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
残留する力をその身に

quest.name: 残留する力をその身に
journal: Dancing Wolf seems impatient to confront your elusive enemy.

Dancing Wolf reports that since your victory over the unfortunate Kahedin, the number of attacks along Thanalan's trade routes has considerably diminished. Such a lack of activity, however, has the officer at a loss as to how to track down your Ascian foe. He urges you to instead speak with Y'mhitra, who apparently has other findings to share. Visit the researcher in Gridania, and learn what new secrets her studies have uncovered.

Y'mhitra greets you with great enthusiasm, claiming to have unlocked a good many mysteries during her latest bout of study. She goes on to explain how you might circumvent the intrinsic aetheric limitations that prevented you from summoning Ramuh-Egi by adopting a method used by the ancient Allagans─a technique known as a “trance.” After suggesting that you attempt to infuse yourself with the essence of the terrible Bahamut, she admits that you will need Captain Wolf's assistance to enter what may be the only appropriate ritual location. Make your way to Ul'dah, and speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.

Against his better judgment, Dancing Wolf has agreed to help you enter the contested territory of the Carteneau Flats. Head to the airship landing and petition the elite flyer to transport you to the edge of the aether-soaked wasteland.

Your meditations in the Carteneau Flats are interrupted by the Ascian of the Twelfth Chalice, who vows to deny you the advantage of Bahamut's might. Despite the relentless onslaught of egi, however, you are able to complete the ritual and enter the trance of the dreadwyrm. Wary of your newfound strength, your immortal foe chooses to withdraw rather than risk defeat. Return to Ul'dah, and speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.

Though pleased with the success of your clandestine mission, Dancing Wolf is also frustrated at his failure to exact a proper vengeance. Y'mhitra reminds him, however, that the true destruction of an Ascian is not so easily accomplished. Explore the power of your Dreadwyrm Trance, and prepare yourself for your next confrontation with the malevolent Paragon.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Dancing Wolf upon reaching level 60.
objectives: Speak with Y'mhitra in Gridania.
Speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.
Speak with the elite flyer at the airship landing.
Speak with Dancing Wolf at the Hall of Flames.
Awaken the power of the Dreadwyrm Trance!
Defeat all egi!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. If you've come for word on the Ascian, I fear I've little progress to report. We did, however, hold a service for Kahedin. I assembled the soldiers from his old unit, and together we conveyed his remains to the priests of Thal.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: As for Thanalan's trade routes, there is still the odd raid by bandits or beastmen, but naught that involves men in black robes... I must confess, I am at a loss as to how we might track our foe.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...Ah, have you spoken with Y'mhitra? I believe she had new findings to share with you.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra mentioned she wished a word with you. The lass is back in Gridania, the last I heard...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename, there you are! We have much to discuss!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I have been engrossed in my studies, you see, seeking every advantage for our inevitable clash with the Ascian.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And as I struggled to unravel the ancient knowledge of the tomestones, I unlocked a good many mysteries...including the reason why you were unable to call forth Ramuh-Egi.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: When you summon an avatar, you draw upon your body's reservoir of aether to grant life and form to what is known as an arcane entity─that much we already knew.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I had, however, overlooked the simple fact that our aetheric reserves are finite─thus the magnitude of egi that you are able to summon is limited by the extent of your own life force. Simply put, if the egi is too powerful, then the summoning fails...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: But do not despair! The summoners of Allag devised a method by which one might circumvent this intrinsic limitation.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Rather than attempt to summon a separate, physical manifestation of certain egi, the most accomplished mages discovered that far less aether was required to infuse themselves with the essence of a primal's power.

The technique by which a summoner would achieve this heightened state was known as a “trance.”

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: What say you, Forename─shall we see if you can master this method? It may even allow you to contend with a Paragon...but not if the essence is of an ordinary primal. Nay, we must set our sights on the most potent entity, the most fierce─I speak of the elder primal Bahamut.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You were there at the Battle of Carteneau. You were there on the day of the Calamity when aether infused with the dragon's essence rained down upon the field.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: On the day of the Calamity, the dragon vanished in an explosion so massive that his aether was carried to the far corners of Eorzea. You, among many others, have already been touched by his essence.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: All that remains is to perform the meditative ritual in a place steeped in Bahamut's energies, and you should be able to enter the trance of the dreadwyrm. As for setting foot within the only suitable location, I believe Captain Wolf can assist us... Shall we pay him a visit?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: If we are to unlock the power of the ancient summoners' trance, then we shall require Captain Wolf's assistance. Let us make haste for Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: As I anticipated, the good captain here has agreed to help us enter the only truly suitable ritual location.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
Y'mhitra here is certainly not one to do things by half...
She petitioned me to help gain entry to the aether-soaked wasteland of the Carteneau Flats.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: The Flats are disputed territory, jointly administered by the three member nations of the Eorzean Alliance─and attempting to earn full admittance to the area is a bureaucratic nightmare. As matters stand, I was only able to secure permission to visit the Immortal Flames' airship landing.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: If we wish to enter the Flats proper, we will have to do so under the cover of night. Prepare yourself for a tense journey, then make your way to the landing here in Ul'dah. I have one of our elite flyers standing by.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Mastery of this trance will greatly increase your chances of standing against the Paragon. Pray inform the elite flyer that we are ready to depart for Carteneau.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: If they catch us creeping into the Flats, the General will have my head on a platter. ...But I must have vengeance for my soldiers!

dialogue.name: AIRMAN02104
dialogue.text: I'll fly you to the front door of the Flats, but that's as far as you're authorized to go. Stay on the landing, or face the consequences.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: So this is what became of the Carteneau Flats. Never before have I sensed such tainted aether...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Let us not linger long, Forename. Turn your mind now to Bahamut's terrible majesty─allow his power to seep into your very being...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...Nothing? We may need to deepen your meditations...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: (-Haughty Voice-)Do you truly attempt to harness the might of Bahamut? The essence of the elder primal shall tear your mortal frame asunder!

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: Chaos rises in the presence of power, but you, Bringer of Light, can be allowed to shine no brighter. Come, and be doused in the endless waters of the Twelfth Chalice!

dialogue.name: ASCIANS
dialogue.text: Hmph. I did not anticipate this. You should not have been able to complete the meditations under such duress.

dialogue.name: ASCIANS
dialogue.text: ...But I shall not underestimate you again. Our next meeting shall be our last, Bringer of Light!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We did it... We faced a Paragon, and lived.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And it is all thanks to you, Forename─you, and the towering might of Bahamut that you now command!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Aye, despite the Ascian's interference, we achieved what we came here for. But I'm afraid this is not the place to celebrate─let us return to the landing before the dawn's light finds us in forbidden territory.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twas a daring journey, but I believe the rewards merited the risk. We should return now to the Hall of Flames, and see that Captain Wolf has not been stripped of his station...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twas a daring journey, but I believe the rewards merited the risk. We should return now to the Hall of Flames, and see that Captain Wolf has not been stripped of his station...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: That Paragon did not come across us by chance. We are being watched...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: We have reason to rejoice, my friends─it would seem our clandestine adventure went unnoticed by my superiors. And, more importantly, we seized the upper hand in a battle against an Ascian.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The trance did appear most effective against our immortal foe. For such a hurried night's work, we managed to reap quite a harvest indeed.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Aye, but it is a pity the bastard fled when he did. I would have liked to have settled the score then and there...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twas for the best, Captain Wolf. If we would truly defeat the Ascian, then we must be prepared to destroy him utterly, body and soul...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Bahamut's power shall never be yours!
You die here, mortals!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Thal's teeth!
We needed more time!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You must not abandon the ritual!
Use Bahamut's residual energies to unlock the trance!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You would play with fire...?
Then perish in infernal flames!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Forename, quest with your senses!
There will be pockets of lingering aether!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Find the densest concentrations! Focus!
Will yourself one with Bahamut's essence!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I will cut you down with blades of wind!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Another egi!?
He won't stop, will he...?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Forename, concentrate!
Enfold your mind in Bahamut's wings!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You are persistent, Bringer of Light...
I will bury you in stone!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
For the love of Thal...
Forename! Might you meditate a little faster!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
It's working, Forename!
Find another pocket of aether!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You still do not understand.
The waters of the Twelfth Chalice are endless...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Where does he find such stamina...?
Do not yield, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
...Did he summon three egi at once!?
I should have brought reinforcements...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Continue seeking the aether!
Without the trance, we cannot prevail!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: What just happened!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No! The might of the dreadwyrm...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
It is done! The trance is yours!
Now sweep aside these lesser avatars!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I am sorry, Forename...
He wore me down...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Forename... The trance...
Do not abandon the ritual...

dialogue.name: QIB

quest.name: 闇を打ち消す光を放たん
journal: Dancing Wolf is awaiting Y'mhitra's arrival.

Y'mhitra has been pondering the retreat of the Ascian of the Twelfth Chalice, and shares her conclusions concerning your foe and his black-masked brethren. Theorizing that the lower-ranked Paragon is unable to possess a living being, the researcher suggests luring the villain to an unpopulated area and destroying him for good with a devastating coup de grâce. First, however, you will need to acquire a certain forbidden tome, and study the method by which the power of a trance can be unleashed in one mighty blast. Travel to the Great Gubal Library in the Dravanian hinterlands, and rendezvous with your companions.

As you prepare to enter the Great Gubal Library, you are accosted by the Ascian of the Twelfth Chalice and three of his fellows. The servants of Lahabrea pronounce your demise, and furious battle is joined. Following a murderous exchange of arcane energies, you at last stand victorious over the kneeling form of your foe. The humbled Paragon once more attempts to flee, but you focus the energy of your trance and obliterate the villain with a searing flare of destructive power. Speak with Dancing Wolf, and share this triumph with your companions.

Though still somewhat stunned by your display of power, Dancing Wolf at last feels that vengeance has been claimed for his wronged soldiers. The captain then praises Y'mhitra for her clever deceit, and thanks you both for your invaluable assistance in bringing the Ascian to justice before setting out on the road back to Ul'dah. Speak now with Y'mhitra, and discuss the future of summoning.

With the defeat of the Ascian of the Twelfth Chalice, Y'mhitra believes that the reputation of the summoning arts has been spared an ignominious fate. She is, however, yet greatly concerned by the escalating threat of the primals. Though the perfect solution remains elusive, continue to work alongside the determined researcher in the quest to bring an end to the self-perpetuating cycle of violence.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra once you have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”
objectives: Speak with Y'mhitra at the Great Gubal Library.
Speak with Dancing Wolf.
Speak with Y'mhitra.
Defeat the Ascians!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Forename, I was about to send for you─Y'mhitra should be here any moment.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, wonderful, we're all here! I have been pondering some metaphysical theories, and would discuss my conclusions with the both of you.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ever since our battle on the Flats, the memory of our adversary fleeing the field has been preying upon my mind.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: According to the Scions and their research, the Paragons are effectively immortal. They are said to be aetherial entities with no physical form of their own, instead possessing mortal host after mortal host in an endless procession down the ages...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: But once Forename had acquired the Dreadwyrm Trance, the haste with which the Ascian withdrew did not seem to me the action of a being who harbors no fear of death.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Thus do I pose the question: could it be that the Twelfth Chalice and his black-masked brethren are not as practiced in the art of possession as their red-veiled masters?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: At the time of the battle, our bodies were the only available hosts nearby. Assuming that he also lacks his superiors' facility to flee to the space betwixt worlds, I suspect that our foe's sudden cowardice stemmed from an inability to force his soul into our living vessels.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: That would explain much...including the reason why he chose the deceased Kahedin to serve as his puppet.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, I believe the theory is sound. Shall we put it to the test? If we are able to lure the Twelfth Chalice to a location devoid of potential hosts, then we might succeed in destroying him for good...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Then what are we waiting for!? We must begin devising a plan to draw the villain from hiding!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Not so fast, Captain Wolf! We must first obtain the means by which we can ensure the Ascian's demise─a mighty coup de grâce, delivered before he has the chance to retreat.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename. There is a passage within the last tomestone that describes how the power of a trance can be unleashed in a single, devastating blast.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The technique itself, however, was not explained─according to my research, it can only be learned from a forbidden book found on the shelves of the Great Gubal Library.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...To reach the library will require a long and perilous journey over Abalathia's Spine and into the wilds of the Dravanian hinterlands. But I believe we three are up to the task.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Shall we be on our way, then? The key to defeating the Twelfth Chalice will soon be within our grasp!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Glad I am to come to the end of that road... But it will be well worth the trip once we've secured your summoner's tome. Tristan and Kahedin will be avenged!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We shall need you to attain the peak of a summoner's power if we are to destroy the Twelfth Chalice!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Now that we are all arrived, we can enter the library and begin our search for this forbidden tome...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: (-Haughty Voice-)You have strayed far from the safety of your cities, foolish mortals. Whatever could you be planning?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Again!? Always he arrives at the worst possible moment!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Tis no coincidence, I fear. And this time, he leaves naught to chance...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCEPTER
dialogue.text: 'Twas amusing at first to watch you stumble like clumsy children, but too insistent is your dabbling. Those who will not dance upon our palm shall be crushed within our fist...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSWORD
dialogue.text: No more shall we endure your blinding effulgence. There can be no rival to the encroaching Darkness.

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCOIN
dialogue.text: You have earned the ire of Lahabrea's most loyal servants...

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: Did you imagine the battle ended with our master's defeat? Stand now, Bringer of Light, and suffer the pain of our retribution!

dialogue.name: ASCIANSCUP
dialogue.text: Did you imagine we would stand idle whilst you tore down our master's glorious edifice? Face us now, Bringer of Light, and suffer the punishment for your transgressions!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...Would it not be wiser to retreat, and seek the tome another day?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: They mean to afford us no such opportunity, my dear captain. Either we stand and fight...or we die.

dialogue.name: ASCIANS
dialogue.text: <gasp> How...? We were raised unto greatness by Lahabrea himself...

dialogue.name: ASCIANS
dialogue.text: You defeated my master, Bringer of Light─mayhap it is meet that your strength was beyond us. But the day will come...

dialogue.name: ASCIANS
dialogue.text: My master is wary of your strength, Bringer of Light─and rightfully so, it would seem. But your day will come...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: You'll not escape us this time, Ascian!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Now, Forename! Unleash your power!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It is done! The Paragon is no more!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: A most impressive spell, Forename. But when did you learn how to cast it? Did we not first require the library's tome...?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! My apologies, Captain. But in order to deceive one's enemies, 'tis best to begin with one's friends. There was never any such book. All that Forename truly required was the catalyst of battle to focus herhis energies.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I knew that once the Ascian observed us traveling towards this library, he would assume we sought some long-buried wisdom. He could not risk leaving Forename free to gain even greater power...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And so this entire journey was a feint─a trap to lure him into the wilds. Bwahahahahaha! Well, you certainly had me fooled! Remind me never to cross wits with you, Y'mhitra!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We did it, Forename! The Ascian of the Twelfth Chalice is no more!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...My plan had you been unable to cast the Deathflare? My dear Forename, I never entertained a single doubt.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Together, we have achieved something of which few people can boast─the defeat of an Ascian. Never could I have accomplished this deed alone.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Thanks to your actions, Tristan's case can also be put to rest. Long have I been haunted by the horrors of that Ifrit mission, but at last I feel a measure of peace...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I will return to Ul'dah, and have a gravestone for Tristan laid beside his brother's.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: We may not have his bones, but it will be a place where the survivors from his unit can pay respects to the man he once was. I bid you farewell, my friends─may we meet again under happier circumstances.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I, too, would extend to you my gratitude, Forename. In addition to untold slaughter, you have prevented summoning's tragic history from repeating itself in a new age.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We must take greater precautions against this ancient art falling into the wrong hands. I will work alongside my colleagues in the Sons, and be sure that the spread of summoning is closely monitored.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: If only we could uncover a lasting solution to the primal predicament... There must be a way to break this self-perpetuating cycle of meeting force with force.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: As for myself, I shall continue my research into primals and summoning, and offer the Scions whatever support I am able. I am certain our paths shall cross again, Forename!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the summoner quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Heavensward. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “The Far Edge of Fate.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: In the name of Master Lahabrea, we pronounce your doom!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: We will not surrender to your tyranny!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Bah, I'd hoped to find you anyway.
We've some unfinished business, Ascian!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
You have grown in power, 'tis true...
But it shall not be enough!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Wanderer of the Heavens!
Heed my call!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Thal's teeth, it's raining boulders!
Ware that rock, Forename!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
By the Twelve!
Did that boulder just explode!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Why do you yet stand!?
Yield to the inevitable!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
We will never yield to you!
Your evil ends this day!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I will have vengeance for my men!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I cannot... I am undone!
I have failed you, Master...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
No! Curse my weakness!
My soldiers must be avenged...

quest.name: おののく精霊
journal: Raya–O–Senna seems unsurprised to see you.

Raya–O–Senna suggests that you offer your assistance with resolving some mysterious disturbance that is agitating the elementals. Make your way to the Conjurers' Guild in Gridania, and present yourself to Brother E–Sumi–Yan.

The guildmaster is enthusiastic to receive your proffered aid, and soon explains why: the elementals' disquiet appears to stem from East End, the war-torn region lying on the border between Gridania and Gyr Abania, and he deems a journey into this unstable area best attempted with you at his side. Make your preparations, and meet Brother E–Sumi–Yan at Nine Ivies in the East Shroud.

Upon arriving in Nine Ivies, E–Sumi–Yan confirms that the source of the disturbance is indeed originating from the direction of East End. His questing senses also reveal a guilty-looking Sylphie, who claims to be unable to ignore the keening plight of the forest spirits. The guildmaster reluctantly allows her to join your party, and the three of you make for Castrum Oriens to continue the investigation...

※The serpent officer stationed at Amarissaix's Spire in the East Shroud will grant you passage to Castrum Oriens.
You rejoin Brother E–Sumi–Yan, and he suggests splitting up to search for the exact location of the disturbance. Head towards the southwest, and survey the area for anything unusual.

You peer about for a sign of what might be upsetting the elementals, and are surprised to spot a child and her protective mother in the supposedly treacherous lands of East End. Aside from this unexpected encounter, however, you are unable to pinpoint the origin of the disturbance. Return to Castrum Oriens and aid the guildmaster in learning more about the area's inhabitants.

Though the matter is far from resolved, Brother E–Sumi–Yan feels he has already been absent too long from Stillglade Fane. Sylphie then offers to remain in Castrum Oriens, and take up the investigation in his place. The guildmaster acquiesces...on the condition that you agree to supervise her efforts. The future promises to be full of challenges, and you will need to continue your studies if you are to be sure of meeting them.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Sylphie upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with E-Sumi-Yan at the Conjurers' Guild.
Speak with E-Sumi-Yan at Camp Nine Ivies.
Speak with E-Sumi-Yan at Castrum Oriens.
Survey the area to the southwest.
Speak with E-Sumi-Yan at Castrum Oriens.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I thought you might come, Forename of the white. You sensed it, yes? The agitation of the elementals?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I suggest you present yourself to Brother E–Sumi–Yan at Stillglade Fane─he will no doubt welcome your assistance in identifying the origin of this disturbance.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Go. Speak with Brother E–Sumi–Yan. I am confident that together you will soon discern the source of the elementals' ire.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
Forename, how fortuitous...
Ah, Sister Raya–O–Senna directed you to the guild? Glad I am that she did.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: As I am sure you have felt yourself, the elementals are in an uproar. And whilst I would soon depart on my investigation, the forest's disquiet appears to stem from lands that cannot be approached in blind haste.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I speak of East End, at the very edge of the Twelveswood. Long has this border betwixt Gyr Abania and our nation been held by the forces of the Garlean Empire.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: The Alliance did recently take control of Baelsar's Wall, and thus commands the fortifications in East End, but the stability of the region is yet tenuous at best.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: 'Twould be a far more certain venture were I to have you at my side. Are you willing to make the journey?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Then we need delay no longer. Let us make our preparations, and begin our trek from Camp Nine Ivies.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Pray make ready, Forename. I shall await your arrival at Camp Nine Ivies.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Thank you again for coming, Forename. I arrived some moments earlier and bent my ear to the forest's whispering─although here it might be better described as a “keening.” There is no doubt that we are nearer to the source.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: ...And I am also certain that we are not alone.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Come out! You cannot hide your presence from me.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Oh, Sylphie...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I should've known you would sense me...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Your early failures to attend lessons gave me ample practice at finding those who did not wish to be found. Now, am I to assume that you, too, have been brought here by the plight of the elementals?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Yes, Guildmaster. I'm sorry for leaving without permission, but I just had to know what was causing all this commotion!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: You will return to Stillglade Fane, and leave this investigation to Forename and me. Such is the danger inherent in this task that even I felt compelled to request assistance.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text:
Please, Guildmaster, let me help! Never have I heard the voices of the elementals so clearly before...
They want to tell me something, I just know it!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: And it is that very “something” that I, as guildmaster, am charged to discover. You, as an acolyte, are neglecting your duties back at the guild.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: But how can I ignore their pleas? I feel their unease like...like chains tightening around my chest! Isn't it my duty as a conjurer to protect the forest!?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: ...Their unease? You truly sensed this emotion from the river of their susurrations? And you truly wish to return the forest to tranquility?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I swear by the Matron Herself. I only want to put into practice the lessons you have taught me.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: A noble purpose. But if I were to permit this, you must promise to weigh the consequences of your actions before you commit to them. I would not see a repeat of previous incidents...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Then...I can come!?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I promise I'll be careful! And I'll be sure to ask for Forename's help the moment I need it!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: See that you do. Now, it is past time we braved the borderlands of Gyr Abania. We can travel as far as Amarissaix's Spire, then a serpent officer will guide us through the ruins of the castrum from there.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to continue this quest, you must first undertake the main scenario quest “Beyond the Great Wall.”

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Ugh...it's getting worse. <shiver> This is not unease anymore, this is fear...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: The closer we are to East End, the more certain I am we are moving in the right direction.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: The precise location of the disturbance yet eludes me, however...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
