dialogue.text: Even from the elementals themselves, I sense only confusion. I fear there is naught for it but to conduct a more conventional search.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I will head southeast. Sylphie, see what might be found directly south. Southwest is yours, Forename.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I would prefer we stay together, but time is of the essence. Pray explore to the southwest and we shall rendezvous here anon.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text:
The disturbance...
It seems to be coming from everywhere.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: (-Strange Child-)Ah!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: (-Stern Huntress-)What are you doing!? Come here, this instant!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Forename! What befalls!? I felt a surge of panic coming from this direction.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Whatever it was, I feel nothing now. Did you see anything?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: ...A child? Out here? By your description the mother may be a hunter, but I am curious as to her choice of hunting ground...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...Could it be their fear which has the elementals so upset? In any case, it seems the answer to that has run off into the brush.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Let us return to Castrum Oriens for the present, and learn more of East End's inhabitants.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I didn't think anyone even lived in East End...

dialogue.name: OFFICER02414
dialogue.text: I'm with the unit occupying Castrum Oriens. You've caught me just as I was delivering our interim report.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: This gentleman is an officer stationed at the castrum. Mayhap he will know more of the mother and child you spotted.

dialogue.name: OFFICER02414
dialogue.text: And you believe these folk were living in the forest? I was under the impression that the East End settlement was empty...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: We suspect a connection to whatever is disturbing the harmony of the Twelveswood. Might you spare us some few soldiers to investigate the possibility?

dialogue.name: OFFICER02414
dialogue.text:
Ordinarily I would be overjoyed to aid in your investigation, but I fear our duties on the border demand our full attention.
...My most sincere apologies, Master Padjal.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: How inconvenient. This matter is far from resolved, yet I have already been overlong in returning to Stillglade Fane.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Let me handle it, Guildmaster!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: You would have me entrust this task to an acolyte? You have matured much in the art, it is true, but I can hardly─

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: The elementals are suffering! Someone has to help them! And I'm sure Forename could lend a hand...if I needed it.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: ...What say you, Forename? I had only intended to involve you in this initial foray, but might I ask that you see the matter through to its conclusion?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: My thanks. I foresee hardships ahead, but also an opportunity for new discoveries. Pray look in on Sylphie's progress even as you continue your own studies.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: As for you, Sylphie, I expect you to make regular reports on your findings. May the Matron watch over you both.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next white mage quest will be available from Sylphie upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 禍事を呼ぶ少女
journal: Sylphie seems eager to speak with you.
Sylphie tells you of the hints of the disturbance she felt while accompanying the serpent scouts on patrol. Meet with her near Bittermill and investigate further.

Whilst searching for the origin of the elementals' disquiet, you and Sylphie encounter the same strange girl you spotted once before. The child flees upon being discovered, and you hurry off in pursuit at Sylphie's urgent behest...

You find the trembling child being attacked by a pack of vicious voidsent, and act quickly to dispatch the fiendish creatures. Coaxed by Sylphie's gentle words, the girl then tells you her name─Gatty─and that she and her mother live in the borderland forest. Before Sylphie can tend to her wounds, however, you are both distracted by another surge of power, and look back to find that Gatty has disappeared. Convinced that the girl and her potent aura are connected to the disturbance, Sylphie suggests that a report to Brother E–Sumi–Yan is in order.

Upon hearing Sylphie's summary of events, Brother E–Sumi–Yan agrees with her assessment. He surmises that Gatty's uncontrolled aetherial gifts are likely acting as a beacon for marauding voidsent─the presence of the malevolent creatures subsequently agitating the elementals. Return to Castrum Oriens once more, and help Sylphie with her plan to question the elusive girl at her forest home.

Sylphie hopes that her search will be successful, but wonders if Gatty and her mother will be willing to talk. Thinking back on how the girl reacted to her offer of healing, the acolyte fears that an outburst of emotion might lead to yet another battle with the voidsent...

※The next white mage quest will be available from Sylphie upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Speak with Sylphie.
Chase after the strange child.
Speak with E–Sumi-Yan at Stillglade Fane.
Speak with Sylphie.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Oh, hello, Forename! It's nice of you to worry, but I've been perfectly safe─I asked the soldiers at the Wall if I could accompany them on their patrols instead of wandering about on my own.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: More than a few times I thought I sensed something─the briefest of flickers─but the scouts had their mission, and I couldn't risk getting separated from them to confirm my suspicions.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I need to check one area in particular, some distance away from the patrol route. Do you think you could come with me? Here, I'll mark the spot on your map and we can meet there when you're ready.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: This is the place...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: (-Strange Child-)......

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: <gasp> Do you feel that!? The source must be nearby!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: (-Strange Child-)Ah!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...And you're sure it's the same child?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I don't know what's going on here, but her aura is blinding. Come on, we have to follow her!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...Now where did she disappear to? Let's split up for a bit and keep looking!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除★）

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
Stay away from me!
Mama! Where are you!?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: You poor thing, you must have been terrified! But don't worry! We'll get you back to your mother!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
I'm not supposed to talk to strangers...
Mama says they'll take me away and lock me in a cage.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Is that what she says? Well, I'm Sylphie, and this is Forename.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Now you know our names, why don't you tell us yours? Then we won't be strangers anymore, right?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
(-Gatty-)...My name is Gatty.
You don't feel icky like the bad things...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Well, I hope that means we can be friends! Come on, Gatty, let's go and find your mother. Do you know the way home?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
(-Gatty-)I don't have any friends...
We live in the forest─just Mama and me.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Were you hurt when those creatures attacked? Here, let me see...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Ah, I'll mend that in no time! Watch. A conjurer like me can heal all sorts of wounds.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: (-Gatty-)<gasp> A conjurer!? No! Don't touch me!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: There's that surge again! And this time it's far more powerful. Gatty, we have to leave!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Wha─ She's gone! Did you see where she went!?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: No...? But we barely took our eyes off of her! How did she manage to vanish so quickly?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How did Gatty vanish so quickly?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: She was taken by the voidsent.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: She learned the trick from a moogle.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Taken!? But you didn't see any more voidsent, did you?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...Neither did I. And I'm fairly sure you took care of all the fiends that were attacking her.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Ah, well moogles certainly are good at disappearing, but I've never heard of them teaching the secret of it to anyone else...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...No idea either, huh? She winked out of sight just like she was a moogle.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Hmmm. That surge of power I felt is gone as well. I don't think it's a coincidence that it faded as soon as Gatty left...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Whenever she panics, I feel her aura just kind of expand─and I think the voidsent sense it too. And I'd wager three afternoons of listening to Hearer Nolanel's lectures that the presence of those fiends is what's upsetting the elementals.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Right, then. It's time we returned to Gridania and reported our findings to the guildmaster.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I did my best to explain to the guildmaster what happened in East End...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I have heard Sylphie's report, and you are both to be commended for pursuing this investigation in so dangerous an area.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Judging by your description of Gatty's unusually potent aura, I am inclined to agree with the theory that it is her energies which are attracting the voidsent.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: If, as you suspect, the child lives alone with her mother, then it is unlikely she has been trained to control her power. Fear, panic, anger─any strong emotion might cause her aether to flare dramatically. To the ravenous creatures of the void, the “scent” of such outbursts would be as the sweetest of nectar...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: So, if Gatty were to learn control, then the problem would be solved, wouldn't it?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: We have assumed much, but know little. Without understanding the exact nature of the girl's gifts, I hesitate to propose a solution...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: She said she lived in the forest. I'll head out with the serpent patrols again and see if I can't find her house.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
A fine idea.
Forename, pray continue lending Sylphie any support she might require.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Come on. Let's head back to Castrum Oriens, and we can talk about what to do next.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Sylphie has conducted herself admirably thus far, but I am nevertheless reassured to know that you are keeping an eye on her efforts.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: The guildmaster is right: we need to learn more about Gatty herself.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I mean, how can a little girl like her have the kind of power that attracts voidsent...? Well, first things first, I'll need to find where she lives. And then hopefully she and her mother will be willing to talk to us.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Do you think we'll be facing more fiends before this is all over? I should probably be practicing my spells...

quest.name: 荒れ狂う魔力
journal: Sylphie is eager to resume the search for Gatty.

Sylphie explains that although she has spotted Gatty on several occasions, the girl always flees before she has a chance to speak to her. Using the whispers of the elementals as a guide, Sylphie is convinced that Gatty will soon be found again. Head to the area where she last saw the elusive child and begin another search.
As you scan the area, Sylphie senses a thread of unease to the south. Follow the acolyte and continue your search for the girl.
The sense of unease has grown stronger, leading you further south.

As you survey the area, you become aware that you are being watched by someone on the far bank of the river. You recognize the huntress, but she flees when she sees that you have spotted her. Sylphie gives chase, leaving you no choice but to hurry after them both.

You catch up to Sylphie to find her being threatened at arrowpoint. After a brief exchange, however, the huntress falls to her knees in obvious distress. A frantic Gatty then bursts from hiding, and is revealed to be a Padjal. Her aether flares wildly, the energies drawing in waves of hungry voidsent which you and Sylphie are forced to engage in battle. Speak with the acolyte once more.

Once the fiends are defeated, you learn that the huntress─Gatty's mother, Sanche─fled Gridania with her newborn child rather than hand her over to the Conjurers' Guild. Sylphie warns of the danger the girl's untamed aether represents, and offers to teach Gatty without betraying her presence to the guildmaster. Return to Castrum Oriens, and learn how Sylphie means to proceed.

Sylphie seems determined to allow Gatty to remain with her mother, and you feel compelled to go along with her plan. You wonder, however, if defying Gridania's traditions is truly the safest path for the young Padjal...

※The next white mage quest will be available from Sylphie upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Survey the area.
Survey the area to the south.
Survey the area further to the south.
Catch up to Sylphie.
Speak with Sylphie.
Protect Gatty!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Hello, Forename, I thought you might be along soon. As for Gatty, I've spotted her more than a few times, but she flees the moment she sees me...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: One thing I've learned, though, is that wherever the whispers lead, then that's where Gatty is to be found.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: And since the forest spirits are particularly agitated today, we should have no trouble tracking her down. Come with me to the place we lost her the last time─we can start our search from there.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Please, I have to concentrate on the whispers─it's a little difficult to hear them when someone is gabbing in my ear. Why don't you take a look around?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: It's terribly faint, but I sense a thread of unease leading away from here. Come on, it's this way.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: We're getting close now. Can you feel it? Quiet your mind, and reach out with your senses...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: When you're around, I find I can hear the voices of the elementals more clearly. I suppose it's easier to be tranquil when you have a veteran white mage at your side! Let's move on, shall we?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text:
I rarely venture this far south...
The air always feels so heavy.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: The serpent scouts don't often venture into this area. ...I suppose there aren't a lot of imperial troops wandering around in the muck.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: (-Stern Huntress-)......

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Did you see her? I think that might be Gatty's mother! Come on, let's go!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: Get away from us, conjurer, or I swear this arrow will find a new home in your meddling heart!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Careful, Forename. She seems awfully angry for some reason...

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: I know why you're here, and you'll not have her! Now unless you want to sprout feathers, it's time for you to leave!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: You're Gatty's mother, aren't you? We're not here to take her away─we're here to help her!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: (-Stern Huntress-)I'll not fall for your lies, conjurer! Get away...<gasp>...from us!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: (-Stern Huntress-)Ugh... Not...now...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Mama!?

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text:
(-Stern Huntress-)<gasp> <pant>
No, Gatty! They'll...see you...
I'm fine! It's just...one of my turns...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gatty, you─ You're a Padjal!?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Mama, no! You can't...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Ugh! The aether, it's...it's overwhelming!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: And the voidsent have come to feed! We can't let them hurt her!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: The fiends are drawn to the girl's energies.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I'll take care of the mother; you protect Gatty and strike down those voidsent!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gatty's aura, it's...it's like a floodgate has opened. There are cracks opening right into the void!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I don't like the looks of that big rift! Watch yourself, Forename!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text:
Gatty's energies seem spent.
I think we're in the clear for now.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gatty's fine─just exhausted from expelling so much aether. She'll wake up after she's had a chance to rest.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, you should be resting, too. Your heart's in bad shape, isn't it? I managed to calm the attack, but the condition itself is beyond my art to heal.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text:
(-Gatty's Mother-)It grows worse by the day...
I am grateful for all you've done today, conjurer, but naught has changed: my daughter stays with me. Please, just leave us...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Listen to me: we did not come to whisk away your child. If we'd wanted to, we could've taken her while you lay senseless.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: We came to learn what was upsetting the elementals, and what could be done to ease their disquiet. And it seems the answer lies in stopping the voidsent from coming after Gatty.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: (-Gatty's Mother-)Can you truly stop those monsters from hunting her? The worse my illness becomes, the more often they come sniffing about. Creatures of nightmare they are, with their greedy eyes and grasping claws...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: We will help you in any way we can. I'm Sylphie, and this is Forename. Please, tell us more about Gatty and these...monsters.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: (-Gatty's Mother-)I... No, you Gridanian charlatans are not to be trusted! You saved us this time, it's true, but if you don't go now the whisper of my bow will be the last thing you'll ever hear...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Wait, I'm begging you! We promise not to say a thing to the guild. We swear by the Matron Herself! Right, Forename?

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: (-Gatty's Mother-)The conjurers I've met before were arrogant. Condescending. You, on the other hand, seem far more sincere. I will take you at your word...for now.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: My name is Sanche. It was twelve years ago that I fled Gridania with my infant child.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: She was born a Padjal, and you know what that means...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: She was chosen by fate─destined to convey the elementals' will to the people of Gridania.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: Aye. The conjurers would have snatched her from my arms, and taught her to be a servant of the forest spirits. By Gridanian law, they were well within their rights to do so.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: But my husband was dead and Gatty was all I had left. I could not bear to let her go. And so I fled.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I can hardly imagine how hard that must have been. Living out here in the wilds, raising a child by yourself...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: But while I can understand the choice you made, Gatty's lack of control over her Padjali power is putting you both in danger.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Aether bleeds from her in a torrent whenever she is upset or afraid, drawing in the voidsent again and again. I hate to say this, but there may come a day when you won't be able to stop them...

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: Is there naught that can be done!? We just want to live in peace...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Here's an idea! I'll stay with you and teach Gatty how to control her aether. That way I can continue your treatment, and solve this problem with the voidsent at the same time! All without telling the Conjurers' Guild, of course.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Hello again, Gatty! I used my conjury to help your mother feel better. Would you like to learn some magic, too?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Really!?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: You know magic that can help Mama? Please teach me!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text:
Thank you─this means so much to us.
We can talk more inside the house...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I'll walk them inside, then return to Castrum Oriens. I'll see you back there, Forename.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: When is Sylphie coming again?

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: Thank you again for your aid. Gatty talks endlessly about you both, but I suppose that's only natural. I haven't encouraged guests in the past...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, I sort of took matters into my own hands there. I know it's a lot to ask, but can you please keep this a secret from the guildmaster for the time being?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We should consult Brother E–Sumi–Yan.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I promise!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: If we do that, the guild will take Gatty away from her mother. And we've seen what happens when the girl gets upset.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename! We don't want the guild to take Gatty away from her mother─we've seen what happens when the girl gets upset.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...Is that approval or disapproval? We don't want the guild to take Gatty away from her mother─we've seen what happens when the girl gets upset.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: And besides, Sanche may not be long for this world. Gatty should spend as much time with her as possible. I remember what it was like to lose a loved one...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: But please don't think emotion swayed my better judgment! I've thought this through, and I understand it won't be easy. That's why I need your help...

quest.name: 厳格なる角尊の掟
journal: Sylphie seems distressed.
Sylphie laments the difficulty of teaching Gatty while Sanche's health is in decline, and asks that you lend her your talents. Make your way into Dimwold, and assess the situation.

You arrive outside Gatty's home to find E–Sumi–Yan berating a sheepish Sylphie. Gatty and Sanche, however, are nowhere to be found. Fearing that the two have fled the guildmaster's approach only to invite further disaster, you rush off in pursuit. Travel north, and search the shallows of the Velodyna River.

You locate Gatty and Sanche just in time to rescue them from another voidsent attack. E–Sumi–Yan arrives a short while after with Sylphie in tow, and suggests returning to the cabin to discuss what the future holds.
After considering Gatty's unique situation, E–Sumi–Yan decides to permit you and Sylphie to continue the young Padjal's education at home. Head outside and discuss this development with Sylphie.

Sylphie is delighted by the guildmaster's decision, and thanks you for the part you've played in allowing Gatty to remain with her mother. But there is still much work to be done before the girl learns complete control over her aether─show Gatty a good example, and continue to improve upon your own skills.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Sylphie upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Head to Fletcher's Cabin.
Search for Gatty and Sanche.
Speak with E–Sumi–Yan at Fletcher's Cabin.
Speak with Sylphie.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Forename! I'm working hard at my studies with Sylphie! Will you be teaching me about magic, too?

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: I still have my reservations about this idea, but Gatty seems to be taking to her lessons eagerly enough. She looks forward to your every visit.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename, am I glad to see you! I'm at my wit's end...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Every day I've worked conjury upon Sanche, and she's drinking a potent herbal elixir I had delivered from Gridania. But still her condition worsens...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: And watching her mother's health decline is not helping Gatty to master her magicks─voidsent have been drawn by her untamed aether a few times now, and I've just barely managed to fight them off.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I've reached my limits to be quite honest, and I think Gatty would benefit from your calming presence. Will you come with me back to their cabin?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Brother E–Sumi–Yan has found us out, Forename. I'm sorry for dragging you into this...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Did I not make myself sufficiently clear, Sylphie? My permission was contingent upon your promise to refrain from rash and thoughtless action.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Yes, Guildmaster, and I've done my best to fulfill that promise. I swear, I gave this matter a great deal of thought before deciding it was the best way for everyone!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: ...I will not doubt your sincerity, acolyte. But imagine my surprise when I was informed of your request for an advanced elixir. No mention of such was included in your reports, and thus did I come to investigate.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: And now I find you concealing the presence of a Padjal─even from a distance, the nature of Gatty's aura was unmistakable. A Padjali child without guidance is an exceedingly dangerous thing, Sylphie. You know this.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Her aether, wild and radiant, will grow even as she does...and so too shall the power of the fiends which gather to feed upon it. Should Gatty draw the attention of a greater voidsent, the entire region would suffer from its depredations.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I've seen what happens─the worst episodes are when she's overcome by fear for her mother's health. That's why I judged it safer to keep them together!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
Ah, Sylphie...
I had almost forgotten that stubborn streak of yours. But I do recognize that responsibility for this situation falls not upon your shoulders alone: 'twas my failing as guildmaster to have overlooked the birth of a Padjal in the first place.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...Will you take Gatty back to Stillglade Fane, now?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Such was my intention. I followed the whispers through the forest, yet by the time I arrived here the house already lay empty. They may have marked my approach.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: You mean they're not here!? Sanche shouldn't be walking around with her condition! Her heart is too weak for that kind of exertion...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Then we must waste no time in tracking them down, and not only for Sanche's well-being─Gatty's concern for her mother could consume her at any moment. Do you know where they might have gone?

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: If they meant to avoid us, then heading north to cross the shallows of the Velodyna River would be their only choice. We should hurry!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: Forename, thank the gods! I had one of my turns─just a mild one─and Gatty began to panic. We tried to run, but the voidsent...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
Forename, you're here...
There were strange whispers coming from everywhere around the house... <sob> I got scared, so we ran away...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: You must be Gatty. Those whispers you heard were the voices of the elementals─you need not fear them, though it was wise to heed their warning.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: You...you're B-Brother E–Sumi–Yan! What do you want with us!?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: 'Tis clear that you are well aware of my purpose here. And I understand that you are disinclined to trust the words of a conjurer...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: But pray believe me when I say that neither Sylphie nor Forename betrayed their promise to you.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Simply put, Gatty's aether has grown too strong to be concealed. I suggest we return to the house and discuss how best to resolve this quandary─a solution to which we all might agree.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: It's all right, Mama. The angry whispers are quiet now. We can go home.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: If Gatty says it's all right, then I suppose we should go.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
I've never seen anyone with horns like mine before...
He feels like the ground at the end of a summer's day─warm and comforting. I like him.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: The guildmaster used his art to ease the pain in my chest. I feel much better...but he will not convince me to give up Gatty so easily.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Brother E–Sumi questioned Gatty and her mother the whole way back. He said that Gatty's connection to her magic is entirely instinctual, which is not exactly a safe method for a child...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: From what Gatty and her mother have told me, the girl has received no formal guidance in how to contain her aether.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Gatty's Padjali instincts allow her to suppress her aura when calm, but that will become increasingly difficult as her power grows with age. Eventually, even the briefest onslaught of emotion─a surge of anger, a whisper of fear─will be enough to shatter her control.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: And that's why I thought it best to teach Gatty here at home. Unlike other Padjal, she's lived her whole life with her mother.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Taking her away from Sanche now would be disastrous. I know only too well the effect such a separation can have on a child...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: You agree with me, don't you, Forename? Or do you think we should follow the letter of Gridania's law!?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: There are always exceptions to the rule!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We should leave the decision to Brother E–Sumi–Yan.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: You side with Sylphie in this matter? ...Truth be told, I find myself in agreement.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Then I shall choose what is best for the Twelveswood. ...And in this case, I find myself siding with Sylphie.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Gatty's upbringing is an extremely rare case amongst the Padjal. It seems that it may, indeed, be the lesser risk to allow the girl to remain with her mother...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Then, does this mean─!?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: ...However, if we are to avoid an escalation of these attacks, I must insist that Gatty learn the intricacies of her power under the official supervision of the Conjurers' Guild.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Acolyte Sylphie. I hereby assign you the duty of overseeing the Padjal Gatty's formal education at this abode.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Your status as a member of the guild should satisfy the demands of law and custom. And be sure to thank Forename for herhis assistance─I would not have permitted this breach of tradition were you not accompanied by a white mage of such high standing.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I won't let you down, Guildmaster! Or the Conjurers' Guild!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Pray understand that this ruling comes with a caveat: if Gatty does not show marked improvement within the time period I dictate, then I shall be forced to relocate her to Stillglade Fane.

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Brother E–Sumi! This means so much to us!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Gatty... I see you are a kind child who cares deeply for her mother. Yet you must not lose yourself in another's life.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Look within, and master the magicks which infuse you. Show you are capable of controlling your own destiny, and make your mother proud.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I will! I'll do anything to make Mama happy. And I don't want to disappoint Sylphie or Forename either!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Very well. I will return to Gridania immediately and prepare an education manual for Sylphie.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I'll see the guildmaster on his way. If you need me, I'll be waiting outside.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I'll study really hard, you'll see! Mama will be so proud of me!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: For so long have I avoided just such a confrontation. I...did not expect Brother E–Sumi to be so understanding.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I'm so glad that Sanche and Gatty can still live together. Thank you, Forename. Things might have gone very differently if I hadn't had you around to help.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Still, we have to make sure that Gatty learns to control her aether before too long. We can only expect so much leniency from Brother E–Sumi...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I say we keep working away at our own studies as much as we can, and give Gatty a good example to follow!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除★）

quest.name: 角尊の宝物
journal: Sylphie appears to be overwhelmed.

Sylphie reports that Gatty's training is proceeding as planned, but Sanche's health is in steady decline. Aid the overwhelmed acolyte by picking up the herbal remedy from the independent sutler at Castrum Oriens.
You have secured the potent medicine from the merchant. Travel through the forest and rejoin Sylphie at Fletcher's Cabin.
You return to the cabin to find Sylphie on the verge of panic. /soothe the frantic acolyte and learn what has driven her to such a state.

Following your efforts to calm her, Sylphie tells you of how she returned from drawing water to find that both the Padjal and her mother had vanished. The acolyte then recalls how Sanche expressed a desire to visit a cave known as the Comet's Tail one last time, and sends you there to search for the missing pair...

You find Gatty and her mother inside the cave, and dispatch the voidsent poised to prey upon the Padjal. Sanche appears to have suffered another of her turns, and Gatty is clearly on the verge of panic. Administer the herbal remedy to the prone woman, and wait for it to take effect.

Despite your best efforts, Sanche at last succumbs to the ravages of her illness. Gatty is unable to accept her mother's fate, and the ensuing tempest of aether attracts the attention of an insidious greater voidsent. The fiend, seeking to feed on the outpouring of energy, manipulates the child into losing complete control of her aura. You engage the voidsent in battle without hesitation, whilst E–Sumi–Yan and Sylphie attempt to bolster Gatty's waning spirit. Gatty eventually regains control of her aether, and you succeed in casting the winged horror back into the void. Approach the grieving Padjal, and offer her what comfort you may.

Though devastated by the loss of her mother, Gatty realizes that her newfound control now allows her to leave her isolation in the forest. Hoping to make her mother proud, she vows to study hard, and live a life of happiness as Sanche would have wanted. With Sylphie and E–Sumi–Yan there to guide her, you sense that Gatty has a wonderful future awaiting her at Stillglade Fane.

※The next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “The Soul of Temperance.”
objectives: Obtain the herbal remedy from the independent sutler at Castrum Oriens.
Return to Sylphie.
/soothe Sylphie.
Find Sanche and Gatty.
Administer the herbal remedy to Sanche.
Speak with Gatty.
Defeat Camazotz!
Gatty's life force
Heal Sylphie!
Defeat Camazotz!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I've been studying as much as I can, but Mama's still not getting better. Maybe...maybe if I work even harder!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text:
Ah, Forename...
Each day has become a struggle to rise from bed. I cannot hunt, I can barely─ Promise me you'll care for Gatty.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Come to look in on us, have you, Forename? Brother E–Sumi will also soon be here to gauge Gatty's progress.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Her studies have actually been going rather well─it's Sanche I'm worried about. Please don't say anything to Gatty yet, but I fear her mother may be near her time...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I've suspended lessons for the moment, and had the two of them spend every waking moment together. Treating Sanche has left me too exhausted to teach in any case.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: As for her medicine, another batch should have arrived at the castrum by now. I need to draw the spring water I use to dilute the dose, so would you mind picking up the delivery from the sutler for me? We'll meet back here.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Mama... Why won't you open your eyes...?

dialogue.name: SUPPORTER02418
dialogue.text: You've come on young Sylphie's behalf, have you? I've got her delivery right here─rushed it through on the back of our swiftest chocobo.

dialogue.name: SUPPORTER02418
dialogue.text: Seems her patient's in a bad way, eh? Well, I'll say my own prayers to the Matron and hope the medicine does the trick.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text:
Sanche!? Gatty!? Please, no more hiding now...
Oh, where could they have gone!?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Sylphie seems to be in a panic. Do your best to soothe her.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: This isn't funny! Please! Please, come out...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Sylphie seems to be in a panic. Do your best to soothe her.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Forename! I... Thank you. If ever I needed your calming presence, it's now.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I came back with the spring water to find Gatty's hat upon the floor and the two of them vanished. Sanche could barely move! Where in Hydaelyn could they have gone!?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Where could they have gone?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: They've run away again.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: They can't have gone far.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Run away? But from what? Gatty was doing wonderfully with her training─there hasn't been another voidsent attack since the river.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: You're right. Gatty's been doing wonderfully with her training, so there's no reason for them to run away.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...Ah, I think I might have it! I've heard Sanche talking about a cave called the “Comet's Tail,” and how she wanted to visit it again before...before it was too late.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I said we'd head straight there when she was well enough, but she may have convinced Gatty to help her sneak out.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Brother E–Sumi is likely on his way. I'll go and intercept him while you head to the cave. If you find them there, make sure Sanche takes her medicine!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Mama! You have to get up...

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: <groan>

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Mama, don't leave me... Please, you have to help her!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: <groan>

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Mama... Mama, please... Don't leave me alone...

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: <groan> Ugh...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Why isn't the medicine working!? Mama? Mama! Open your eyes!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I can't... I'm losing control...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: No, I must own my fear.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Feel the ground beneath my feet; the flow of wind and water!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Nicely done, Gatty. You have made remarkable progress since last we met.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Forename, Sylphie, you have instructed her well.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Don't worry! We'll look after your mama!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text:
It's so beautiful...
Thank you for bringing me here...one last time.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Don't say that, Mama! I'll learn conjury, and once you're better we can come here every day!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Forename... It is thanks to your and Sylphie's efforts that Sanche has held on this long.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: And yet, there are limits to the healing arts. Each life comes to an end, and even a conjurer cannot undo that which fate has ordained.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Take heart, however, in knowing that your care and attention is what has allowed these irreplaceable moments between mother and daughter...

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text:
My precious girl...
You have filled my days with love...

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: But I was selfish...and that selfishness has brought you pain. For that, I am truly sorry...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Mama!

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: My love... My light... I pray you find such happiness as I have known...

dialogue.name: SANCHE
dialogue.text: Thank you...all of you. Watch over her...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: No... No. NO!!!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: This can't be happening... I promised Mama...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除★）

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Oh no...

dialogue.name: BOSSWHM700
dialogue.text: (-Sinister Voice-)Mmm... So very close. Heed my words, then...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: How long has this fiend lurked within Sanche, awaiting this very moment...?

dialogue.name: BOSSWHM700
dialogue.text: (-Sinister Voice-)Terrible child. Dragging around your sick mother. You have killed her! Accept the evil you have done, and atone with your very life!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: But, I didn't... I killed her...?

dialogue.name: BOSSWHM700
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除★）

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除★）

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Ignore it, Gatty!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
But I did bring Mama here...
It was me. I killed her...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Aaah!!!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: The voidsent has sunk its hooks into Gatty's spirit. We must destroy it ere her life force is drained away!

dialogue.name: BOSSWHM700
dialogue.text: Revile what you have become, murderer! Surrender your life to me!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: We will help Gatty resist this trance, but the voidsent must be slain!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Remember the elements, Gatty! Let wind and water calm your mind!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
Do not give in to despair!
It is what the voidsent wants!

dialogue.name: BOSSWHM700
dialogue.text: All who stand with you will die! Revel in the depth of your atrocity!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Sylphie!?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
No, not you, too...
This is all my fault!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Aaaaaah!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: No! She's losing too much aether!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
I will try to staunch the flow.
Forename, slay the voidsent!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
The candle of life burns down for us all.
You cannot punish yourself...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Gatty, remember what your mother wanted for you!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: What Mama wanted...?

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Yes, think back on her words!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Say them, Gatty! Hear yourself say them!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: “I pray you find such happiness...”

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
Well done, Forename!
I will rouse Sylphie─pray focus your art upon her.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text:
Thank you, Guildmaster.
Forename...I need your healing touch...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: We won't let you go, Gatty!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Draw on our strength! Remember your mother's love!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I... I'm in control now. Thank you...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text:
Mama, I know what you wanted for me...
And I think I've found it...

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text:
You've done well, Gatty.
Now, let us banish this foul creature from our midst!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Foolish girl! Your right to love is forfeit! You belong to me!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除★）

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Was this foe beyond us...?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I never should've... I'm sorry...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text:
This can't be...
I gave all I had...

dialogue.name: BOSSWHM700
dialogue.text: Your feeble magicks are...ah...AAAHHH!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: With the voidsent vanquished, Gatty has been freed of its debilitating influence. We need not fear her losing control again.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gatty is a fighter, but I think she needs a strong shoulder right now...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: When Mama died, it was as if I'd fallen into a deep, dark hole. My mind was full of screaming...and then I heard your voices from somewhere far away, calling me back.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I heard Mama's voice, too. That's when I knew that she would always be at my side...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I'll do my best to make her proud of me!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: With the strength you've shown, there is already much of which to be proud. Your aether is tranquil. Calm.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: I see no need to enforce further training at the guild...though its doors are open to you, nonetheless. Will you return with us to Gridania?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: ...I'd always thought Mama wanted to live alone with me, away from other people. So I tried to forget about wanting friends, or traveling to other places.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: But now, I think what she really wanted was to let me find my own way. And thanks to Sylphie's lessons, there's no need to hide in the forest anymore.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I will go to Gridania. I want to study more conjury, and learn to fight fiends as well as Forename!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: And I still have so much to learn from Sylphie.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: We'll keep studying together, I promise. Although we both have far to go before we're a match for Forename!

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: Well, well, Sylphie. Making promises to study? 'Twould seem that mentoring Gatty has proven beneficial to you both.

dialogue.name: ESUMIYAN
dialogue.text: 'Tis time we were on our way. We shall hold a memorial for Sanche, then see about settling you into your new life at Stillglade Fane.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the white mage quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “The Soul of Temperance.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next white mage quest will be available from Raya–O–Senna.

obj.n: インドゥルゲンティア
セブンスヘブンチェスト【ILv290】

quest.name: 新たな決意
journal: Professor Erik eyes you with a look of self-satisfaction.

Greeting you with his customary condescension, Professor Erik informs you that Widargelt is troubled by some matter or other. The professor has been unable to prise the details out of the tight-lipped monk, but he believes that you will fare better. Make your way to Revenant's Toll, where Widargelt is based, and make yourself available to your brother-in-arms.

As the professor predicts, Widargelt readily reveals to you his woes. The Ala Mhigan Resistance has invited him to rejoin the cause, and though he is resolved to turn down the offer, the event has set him to thinking about his purpose─what he can do in aid of his beleaguered homeland. O'tchakha and D'zentsa ask that you keep an eye on their master as he goes to meet with the Resistance representative in Little Ala Mhigo.

You arrive in time to witness Widargelt giving Gundobald his answer. Though the old soldier expresses his understanding, saying that fighting is not the only way to serve one's nation, his words leave Widargelt wondering about his own path. Wishing to be alone, he takes his leave and heads for an unknown location. Find him and offer him your support.

You find Widargelt in contemplation before the mark of the Destroyer. As he relates to you how the Fist of Rhalgr, once the foremost faith among Ala Mhigans, has all but died out in his homeland, the monk finally realizes what he must do. He bids you return with him to Revenant's Toll, where he will share his plans with everyone.

Before his gathered friends and pupils, Widargelt reveals that he means to go to Gyr Abania on a mission to revive the Fist of Rhalgr. O'tchakha, D'zentsa, and the professor offer to accompany him, and naturally so do you. Overwhelmed by the support, Widargelt expresses his gratitude and determination, and bids you see to your preparations.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Widargelt in Little Ala Mhigo.
Search for Widargelt.
Speak with Widargelt at Revenant's Toll.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Dim though you are, I would swear you possess an innate ability to sense when you are needed. And on that note, I have a task for you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Your fellow brute Widargelt─some matter or other weighs heavily on his mind of late. Knowing him, it can only pertain to Ala Mhigo, but the stubborn oaf is determined to keep it pent-up inside. Loath to trouble me with it or some such nonsense, I shouldn't doubt.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But you, my friend─you are as a sisterbrother to him. If there is a womanman alive in whom he would be willing to confide, it is you. For the hopeless idiot's sake, I bid you go to Revenant's Toll and place yourself at his disposal.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Good. That will be all for today. You have done well. I am pleased with your progress.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: You always say that, Master. But we're nowhere near where we want to be. Not even close.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Indeed. And besides, any progress we make, we owe wholly to you.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Damn right. Without your guidance, we'd be goin' nowhere fast.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My guidance...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename, I am glad to see you. Things are well here, as you can see. But...hmmm...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha, you may go ahead. I would speak with Forename.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Those two grow stronger every day. Shadows darken their way no more. Their purpose is clear.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Would that I could say the same of mine...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You see, I have received an offer. The Resistance. They ask that I rejoin them. Lead one of their units.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Once, I would have jumped at the chance. But no more. No longer do I live for revenge. You and the professor showed me it is not the way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So I will turn down the offer. I would focus not on fighting, but rebuilding. But what is within my power? Beyond the battlefield, how can I serve my homeland?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forgive me. I should not trouble you with this. It is my answer to find.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But first, I will give the Resistance their answer. My thanks for listening, Forename.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: He still agonizes over it...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Aye, hardly the state of mind to be in for such an important meeting. Isn't there anything we can do?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Not us two─his pride will not allow it. But you, Forename─he opened up to you just now, did he not? I daresay he will do so again. We're terribly sorry to impose, but could you please follow Master Widargelt? Watch over him in our stead?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you watch over Widargelt?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: For you, O'tchakha? Of course.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: For you, D'zentsa? Of course.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Hehe! We are in your debt, Forename!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Wait, what? Who, me?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Um, Forename? Do you, er...reckon you could look in on Master Widargelt for us?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: He is bound for Little Ala Mhigo, I believe.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I doubt not that Widargelt is in good hands. After all, who should know a brute better than a fellow brute?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You would bear witness to my resolve? Very well, sisterbrother. Witness me.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Have you made up your mind, then?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have. Your offer does me great honor. But with respect I must decline. My days of vengeance are over.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: I see. That is your decision, and I shan't press you further. Yet I would be lying were I to say I'm not disappointed. With your mastery of the Fist, your contribution to our struggle would have been immeasurable.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am sorry...

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: Do not be. Remember, fighting is not the only way to serve one's nation. We each of us must find our own path to walk.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our own path...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There is a place I would be. I take my leave of you.

dialogue.name: GUNDOBALD
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain you know Widargelt better than most. If you are indeed his friend, as I mark you to be, I needn't tell you to be there for him.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To find me here... You know me too well, Forename.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The mark of the Destroyer. My people bore it here when the Empire came. The risk was great. But their faith was greater still.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Alas, that faith has all but faded. Wiped away from the motherland. The Garleans suffer not the divine. They allow us not even the solace of worship.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: ...By Rhalgr, I know now. That which I can do for Ala Mhigo. All along, there was but the one path.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Let us return to Revenant's Toll. There I will tell all.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Thank you all for coming. I have found my calling. And I would share it with you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will go to Gyr Abania. And there revive the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Well then, we're coming with you. We won't let you out of our sight─not until we've repaid the debt, at any rate.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Suffice to say I too shall come. The lands of Gyr Abania harbor countless mysteries, and such knowledge as I possess will doubtless serve you in your endeavor.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And you, sisterbrother. Can I count on you as well?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm with you all the way!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm not feeling up to it.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Wh-What!? But Forename, it would be unthinkable without you! Please reconsider!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am glad. Your presence gives me heart. The mission will not be easy. But I will not rest until I succeed. And the Fist of Rhalgr is returned to the land. This I swear.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text:
On that inspiring note, I shall go and make ready.
...And Widargelt─pray do not forget what we discussed.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We will depart anon. Pray see to your preparations, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Glad to see Master worked things out.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: With your help, Master Widargelt has found his path. Thank you, Forename.

obj.n: 力を統べる者、力を担う者
ウィダルゲルトの帰還

quest.name: ウィダルゲルトの帰還
journal: Indecision is writ plain on Widargelt's face.

You inform Widargelt of your readiness to depart, but the monk himself appears unready due to his agonizing over a creed for the new Fist of Rhalgr. At D'zentsa's urging, he decides to strike out in the hope that inspiration will strike along the way. Your first stop is an old training ground for monks called Schism, situated in the Fringes.
The visit to Schism does not avail Widargelt in his quest for a creed, but he forges on undeterred. Follow him to the village of Ala Gannha, where Professor Erik has gone ahead to scout.

Arriving at the village, Widargelt witnesses a heated exchange between two villagers. The experience is the spark Widargelt needed, and he finally comes up with a fitting doctrine to guide the Fist of Rhalgr into a new age. With that, he is ready to proclaim the order's return to the world. As the foremost monk in the party, you have been tasked with performing a demonstration before the villagers. Let Widargelt know when you are ready to begin.

First impressions last. Kick off your demonstration by performing a True Strike on the dummy.

※True Strike can be performed by first using Form Shift.
You have pulled off a textbook True Strike. Follow it up with a Dragon Kick.
You have pulled off a picture-perfect Dragon Kick. Bring your demonstration home with a Bootshine.

Your blistering strikes pave the way for Widargelt's words, and he gives an impassioned speech and wins over the gathered crowd. Speak with Widargelt to learn his mind on the result of this first showing.

In no small part due to your aid, Widargelt has taken a first momentous step towards reviving the Fist of Rhalgr. The monk will remain in Ala Gannha awhile to initiate interested villagers into the fundamentals of the faith. In the meantime, he bids you continue honing your skills, for they will doubtless be called upon again ere long.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Speak with Widargelt at Schism.
Speak with Widargelt in Ala Gannha.
Speak with Widargelt near the training dummy.
Perform a True Strike on the dummy.
Perform a Dragon Kick on the dummy.
Perform a Bootshine on the dummy.
Speak with Widargelt.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Are you ready to depart, sisterbrother?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Good. The professor has already left. He makes for a village called Ala Gannha. There, he will take the measure of the land.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I would strike out soon as well. But one matter troubles me still. The creed for a new Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: With all due respect, Master, but at this rate we'll never get to Gyr Abania.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: ...You are right. Sometimes the answer cannot be forced. Mayhap it will come to me on the road. Very well, let us away.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: En route, I would make a stop. The place is called Schism. Monks once trained there. In revisiting the past, we may better walk the future.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: C'mon, let's get going already!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Oh, have a bit of patience, will you? You are not a child anymore!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: As a child, I came to this place. We faced fearsome fiends, that we might open our chakra.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: In returning here, I hoped there would be a spark. Inspiration for a new creed. But it is not so simple.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Hmmm, the Fist once taught that, through the pursuit of strength, one can approach the sublimity of Rhalgr...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A teaching our forebears followed to their undoing. In pursuit of strength, they sought the power of rule. And by that power they were destroyed. Our creed must rise above that dark past. Or it cannot light the way unto the future. Nay, we must find a new path.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Well, there's nothing like a journey for findin' paths. Let's keep moving, Master. Something will come to mind before you know it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So I pray, D'zentsa. So I pray. But yes, let us continue on to the Peaks. East to the village of Ala Gannha. There Professor Erik awaits us.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Heh, you feelin' it? 'Cause I'm feelin' it!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: My chakra fairly hums for the surfeit of aether. 'Tis plain this was but another ancient battlefield in Gyr Abania's bloody history.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ala Gannha. When I return here, I remember. The day the Temple of the Fist was razed.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: On that day, I was training. Like all the days before. Then without warning, we were attacked.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We all of us fought bravely. Even little ones like me. Desperate to protect our temple. Our home.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But it was all in vain. One after the other, we fell. All the while the temple burned.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Some few of us managed to flee. Me with my closest brother, Adri. We stumbled into this village, smoke billowing behind us. But when I looked around, Adri was not there. I never saw him again.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: ...Forgive me. Now is not the time for sorrowful recollection. Come, let us look for the professor.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA02427
dialogue.text: ...Go on, then, join the bloody Resistance! Add to the pile of corpses! That's the only difference you're gonna make!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB02427
dialogue.text: You're wrong! I'm gonna make a real difference! I'm gonna train hard and honor Rhalgr, and He'll grant me power!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA02427
dialogue.text: That power couldn't save the temple─our home! What makes you think it's going to save us now!?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA02427
dialogue.text: Don't be a fool! No matter how strong you become, you'd still be one man against the might of the Empire!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB02427
dialogue.text: Say what you will, but my mind's made up. I'm not letting the bastard imperials take any more from us. You just...you just take care of yourself, you hear?

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA02427
dialogue.text: Don't be a fool! No matter how strong you become, you'd still be one man against the might of the Empire! They might be beaten now, but they won't stay beaten forever, mark my words!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERB02427
dialogue.text: And you mark my words: my mind's made up. I'm not letting the bastard imperials take from us again. You just...you just take care of yourself, you hear?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Souls crushed to submission. The fire in their hearts extinguished. To rekindle hope within such people... That must be the purpose of the new Fist.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: ...Praise be, I have it. Our new creed.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To those who have had their homes stolen. Their loved ones taken. Naught is more desirous than strength. The strength to protect that which they hold dear.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Well, well, I see you have found your answer, and rather more quickly than I had expected of someone who'd sooner strike, rather than think, with his head.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: With the order's purpose thus established, we may consider the question of place. I regret to say, however, that the old temple grounds are currently occupied by the Resistance, and there is naught to indicate that they will vacate any time soon.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The grounds hold symbolic meaning. A fitting stage for reviving the Fist. But ultimately, the physical location matters not.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: For our mission lies in the spiritual realm. Within people's hearts. There we will rekindle the faith. And all may know the solace of worship.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: That, as they say, is the spirit. Now then, I shall report on how matters stand in the region. But few Fist faithful remain, even accounting for those who practice in secret. Nor has there been any trace of the sect of shadow, not since their misguided leader's downfall. Save for those who came over to the light, it is safe to assume that his ambitions died with him.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We have a long road ahead. That much is plain. But we will see our journey through. One step at a time. And the first step begins here and now.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Great! ...So, er, what do we do exactly?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We hold a demonstration. Give the people tangible proof. Proof that the Fist is returned.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename. First impressions last, and you are the first among us. As such, I would entrust this task to you.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: You may leave it to me to round up the villagers. I shall cry up a veritable storm for the coming spectacle!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha. Take the wooden dummy. Set it up on the village outskirts. And Forename─limber up, and tell me when you are ready.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: People live here?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You'd be forgiven for thinking it's deserted.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A training manikin of Ala Mhigan make has been set in the ground.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Not many came. Far fewer than I had hoped. But no less of a show will we give them for it.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Come, sisterbrother! Your performance will mark the revival of the Fist of Rhalgr!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Lead in with a True Strike! Follow on with a Dragon Kick! Then finish it with a Bootshine!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: True Strike can be performed by first using Form Shift.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: No mercy, Forename! Sweep the leg!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Zentsa, will you calm down!? Oh, please ignore her!

dialogue.name: VILLAGER3333
dialogue.text: Hey, ain't that the Fist of Rhalgr?

dialogue.name: VILLAGER4444
dialogue.text: But I thought all the monks was gone!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Good people of Ala Gannha. I am Widargelt. Proud son of Ala Mhigo. And brother of the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: All know the sad tale of our order. Years ago, the King of Ruin laid our temple to waste. Our faith was lost to the people.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But without faith, it is people who are lost. For to lose faith is to lose hope. But we need hope now, in this bleak age. More than ever before.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So I come before you today. And I beseech you: join me in reviving the Fist of Rhalgr! Let us restore hope to the land!

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA02427
dialogue.text: You can't fool us! You just want soldiers─fodder for the front lines! You're no different from the accursed Masks!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So it was in the past. Our order was seduced by power. Swore allegiance to the royal family. We monks were little more than tools of war.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But that was the Fist of old. The new Fist serves no king. It hungers not for glory. It thirsts not for blood. Nay, friends. It seeks only to protect that which we hold dear.

dialogue.name: VILLAGERA02427
dialogue.text: Protect...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Rhalgr is the Destroyer. As His disciples, there is but one thing we ought to destroy: our own weakness! Therein lies the strength to protect! Therein lies hope!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I will not lie: I am no great warrior. My forebears would put me to shame. But I am not alone. Nay, I have stout comrades beside me. Who are no less dedicated to the cause.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My foremost pupils, D'zentsa and O'tchakha!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And Forename, whose sublime skills you just witnessed!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename, please say a word to the people.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Join us! Let us begin anew!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Are you ready for pain?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Haha, our sisterbrother monk jests. Rest assured shehe is a gentle soul.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To bring you hope, we will give our all! Every onze of our being! This we solemnly swear!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. Your performance paved the way for my words. All present lent their ears. No few opened their hearts.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Already, villagers have come. Seeking to learn of the new Fist. A fine first showing.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our forebears will doubtless be pleased. By restoring the Fist, we honor their memory.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I shall commence the villagers' training at once. Initiate them into the fundamentals of the faith.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: When that is over, we may continue our mission. Till then, pray see to honing your own skills. Ere long, they will be called upon again!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: That went great, I'd say! Everyone was hangin' off every word!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Master Widargelt spoke from the heart, and the villagers couldn't help but be moved. I'm very proud of him.

quest.name: 拳聖、再び
journal: Widargelt has a plan for expansion.

While Widargelt is pleased with his growing membership of students, there are villagers still who doubt the authenticity of his style. In order to win them over, he plans to host a cross-discipline match pitting monks against pugilists. As a well-known face among the Pugilists' Guild, you have been tasked with delivering the invitation. Make your way to Ul'dah and broach the subject with Hamon.

You arrive at the Pugilists' Guild to find not only Hamon and Chuchuto, but Rurukuta as well, temporarily returned from his wanderings. All are responsive to the idea of a cross-discipline match, and the guildmaster formally accepts. Make your way back to Ala Gannha and inform Widargelt of the pugilists' coming.
Widargelt is ecstatic to learn that Hamon has accepted the invitation, and he sets about preparing for the match. He bids you meet him directly in the Fringes at Schism, the chosen venue.
No sooner do you arrive at Schism than cries ring out from the river─D'zentsa and O'tchakha are in danger. Hasten after Widargelt to their aid.

You find Widargelt on his knees, handily bested by a band of men led by the mysterious Theobald, who claims to be the Griffin and the rightful King of Ala Mhigo both. He issues a stern warning against reviving the Fist of Rhalgr, and goes on to reveal that Widargelt is in fact his cousin, Theodred, who was raised at the Temple of the Fist in order to spare him the King of Ruin's wrath. Theobald then leaves, but not before declaring his intent to rule Ala Mhigo with an iron fist. With the immediate danger passed, you may turn your attention to your comrades.

In light of recent events, Widargelt has no choice but to call off the match, and he apologetically sends Hamon and his crew back to Ul'dah. While Widargelt checks on his pupils, take word of these troubling developments to Erik, now returned to Ala Gannha from his fieldwork.

Erik is unable to hide his shock at your report. The veracity of Theobald's words aside, the professor posits that his minions are members of the Corpse Brigade─elite soldiers trained in counter-monk combat, who once served Theodoric as his personal guard. Erik promises to investigate the many claims made, and bids you look in on Widargelt.

You find Widargelt deeply discouraged, not only by the sound drubbing he received but also the shocking revelation of his origin. For now, give your brother monk the time and space he requires.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with Hamon at the Pugilists' Guild.
Report to Widargelt in Ala Gannha.
Speak with Widargelt at Schism.
Follow Widargelt.
Speak with Widargelt.
Speak with Erik in Ala Gannha.
Speak with Widargelt.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You look well, sisterbrother. Stronger than when last we spoke.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our membership, too, grows stronger. Word spread after the speech. Others have come to learn. But it is too soon to be satisfied.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I would welcome more to the faith. But there are villagers still who doubt us. Our authenticity and our purpose.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To convince them, I would demonstrate our techniques. In real combat, by way of a cross-discipline match.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: For our opponents, I have the pugilists of Ul'dah in mind. Assuming they are willing.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are well known in the Pugilists' Guild. If you ask, they will surely listen.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Will you speak with them on our behalf?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You have my thanks. Go well, Forename. And my regards to Master Hamon.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: A thousand push-ups and a thousand squats─that's reasonable to begin with, right?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I hope Zentsa does not scare our new pupils away with her unreasonable expectations...

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Oho! If it isn't a familiar face, and one I'm rather fond of!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Chuchuto, Rurukuta! We have an esteemed guest!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Forename! Gods, how long has it been?

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: Well, well, it seems I picked a good time to take a break from my wanderings. It's good to see you again.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: That it is! Now then, what brings you here, lasslad?

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: A cross-discipline match? Why, that sounds exciting! Don't you agree, Master?

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: <mumble> Gyr Abania so far... As well be the other side of the world... <grumble> Mostly sinewy Highlanders... And male ones at that...

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Oh, that's rich coming from a sinewy Highlander, and a wrinkled old one at that!

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: I, for one, would welcome the challenge. I was growing weary of pummeling Chuchuto senseless.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Says the one on a losing streak!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: But of course we'll go. After all you've done for us, it's the least we could do.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: The sooner the better, I take it, and there's no time like the present. We'll head out at once.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Hurry up and pack your things. We're going to Gyr Abania!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: You go on ahead, lasslad, and let young Widargelt know to expect us. It's on like an Ala Mhigan monk!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I look forward to Master Hamon's response.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The pugilists are on their way? Rhalgr be praised!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: There is much to do. I will make the match known to the villagers. D'zentsa, O'tchakha, be on hand to receive our guests.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And you, Forename. Schism. That is to be the venue. Pray take yourself there and prepare.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: I've been keeping at my training, regained much of my former strength. Still a long way off from my Holyfist days, to be sure, but no matter─I've got years ahead of me! Ohohoho!

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Rurukuta acts all nonchalant, but he's the keenest of us all. Hmph, some things never change!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are here. Good. The people of Ala Gannha expect a quality match. Let us not disappoint them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Soon, the girls will arrive with the pugilists. I also told the professor. But he will not attend. Science before savagery, he says.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: (-O'tchakha-)Aaaaaah!

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: (-D'zentsa-)Seven hells! What are you─ Urrrgh!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! They are in trouble!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The voices came from the river! With me, Forename!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <pant> My techniques... They have no effect...

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: (-Masked Man-)Hahaha...
