dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: (-Masked Man-)Well, well... We thought we knew every ilm of your style. But you, adventurer─you are not like the others.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <gasp> You are the Griffin... The wretch who led countless soldiers to their doom. Good men and women with lives ahead of them. <pant> But...you are supposed to be dead.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: (-Masked Man-)The wretch who died was but a double, and good riddance, too, for he presumed to have ambitions of his own. I am the true Griffin. And my true name is Theobald, Theodoric's heir and rightful King of Ala Mhigo!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Theodoric's heir? King of Ala Mhigo?

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Aye, and in my royal duty, I have come to deliver a warning. Such cults as propagate false beliefs will not be suffered under my reign. Cease any foolish notion of reviving the Fist of Rhalgr. Swear fealty unto me, or you will meet the same end as your treacherous forebears.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Lies! Theodoric's line is spent! And rightful or no, none would bow before you! The people will not suffer another tyrant!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: You wound me, Widargelt. Or should I say...Theodred, dear cousin.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: What!?

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Hahaha! All this time and you didn't know? Neither who you are, nor what became of your parents? This ignorance cannot be borne. Nay, we must rectify it at once. You see, your father and mother─they conspired to betray the royal house. For their crimes, His Grace, my father, put them to death.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: And though your parents were the dimmest of traitors, they had wits enough to know when the game was over. So they sent their precious Theodred, then but a bawling babe, to be raised in safety at the Temple of the Fist. Though my father tended to that squalid little place soon enough.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Y-You dare mock my parents and my home!? Who you claim to be, I care not! I will make you pay!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Have you learned nothing? Your techniques are useless against us. If your defeat suffices not to convince you, look to the proof of your beloved temple's destruction.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Listen well. Ala Mhigo needs a strong ruler─an absolute ruler─to smite her enemies and restore her to glory. That ruler is me. Your feeble Fist has no place in her future.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is not a good time for the match. With apologies to Master Hamon, I must call it off.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha. Pray return to Ala Gannha and rest.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I shall remain behind to receive our guests. Wait with me, Forename.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Whew! Sorry for the delay, my friends. Having been here once before, I thought I had a handle on the route, but 'twas the route that had a handle on me! Hohoho!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Is something the matter?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Aye... Harsh truths have been thrust before me. Calling my very existence into question. As I am, I am no fit opponent for you and yours.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Master Hamon. Far as you have come, it pains me to say this. But I must call off our match.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Well, that you don't do so lightly is plain to see. Whatever has happened must be serious indeed.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: For now, my boy, you'd best focus on yourself. There'll be another time to trade blows.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Come, you two. We're going home.

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: Already!? We've barely gotten here, and by the scenic route besides. Let me rest a moment, will you?

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Oh, don't be such a milksop! With all your roaming, surely this distance is nothing to you!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: And Widargelt? To make it clear, we're merely postponing the match. Whatever it is that ails you now, I have faith that you'll bounce back, ready to match me blow for blow.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Master Hamon is a soul of kindness. I have nothing but gratitude.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Let us return to Ala Gannha. I must look in on D'zentsa and O'tchakha. Meanwhile, please find Professor Erik. Tell him all that has come to pass.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Young Widargelt wants to revive the Fist of Rhalgr, isn't that right? A noble mission, but far from simple, as I'm sure you already know. But when the going gets tough, you have to keep believing─in your cause, and in each other. And if ever you need extra pairs of fists, you can call upon us any time.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: If there's anything we can do, anything at all, you just let us know.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: What!? Let me paraphrase: you are telling me that Widargelt─our Widargelt, the lumbering slab─is in fact Theodred, nephew to Theodoric, the King of Ruin...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And that this man who claims to be the Griffin─presumed dead─also claims to be Theobald, Theodoric's rightful heir─also presumed dead. By the gods, not even a drink-addled bard could make this up.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Outlandish details aside, I have an inkling as to the identity of those who set upon you. They are the selfsame crew that razed the Temple of the Fist: the Corpse Brigade. Trained in counter-monk combat, they served the King of Ruin as his personal guard─though personal agents of destruction would be more accurate. But when their liege fell, they followed in their turn, becoming overqualified bandits.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Even so, it appears they have not entirely forgotten their training. That would explain why, for all their mastery of the Fist, Widargelt and the girls had no answer to them. That you could hold your own, I believe, is due to your pugilistic background.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: At any rate, now is the time to arm ourselves with knowledge. First of all, I shall look into Theobald's myriad claims. As for you, I suggest that you check on your friend. Knowing the oaf, he will be confused and crestfallen to no end.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Please find Professor Erik. Tell him all that has come to pass.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ah, it is you...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have known defeat. Tasted my fair share. But not like this. I was helpless as a babe.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: “The strength to protect,” I proclaimed. But I could not even protect my own. All my years of training. All useless. What have I to offer the people?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text:
And to think...the mad king is my uncle. I am nephew to the man who murdered my parents. Who destroyed our temple. Who brought our nation to ruin.
...Forgive me, sisterbrother. I would be alone.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A training manikin of Ala Mhigan make has been set in the ground.

obj.n: ウィダルゲルトの帰還

quest.name: 何を以て何を成すか
journal: Widargelt remains in the depths of despair.

Widargelt still needs time to process his recent defeat and the revelations about his past. But in spite of his own woes, he manages to show concern for his disciples, and asks that you speak with them and lift their spirits.

You look in on D'zentsa and O'tchakha, who in turn express their concern for their master. Uncertain what to do, they decide to turn to the ever-insightful Erik. While they keep an eye on the despairing Widargelt, they bid you fetch the professor from Rhalgr's Reach, home of the Resistance, where he is making his inquiries.

You find Erik just as he finishes asking Resistance soldiers about the mysterious Theobald. After sharing with you his findings, he agrees to accompany you back to Ala Gannha to have a stern word with Widargelt.

Widargelt has largely come to terms with his defeat; rather, the revelation of his true identity as the nephew of the King of Ruin has made him question his fitness to revive the Fist of Rhalgr. Through a tale about his departed son, Erik teaches Widargelt that a man is defined not by his blood, but by the choices he makes. His vigor and purpose thus restored, Widargelt turns his attention to what must be done. He reveals his suspicion that Theobald is in fact someone known to him: a brother from the Temple of the Fist named Adri, whom he had long believed dead. If it comes to it, Widargelt stands ready to strike him down, and he asks that you train him and his disciples in the way of the pugilist, that they might defeat the Corpse Brigade. Make your way to the old training grounds and begin their training.

Widargelt and his disciples prove eager students, and they quickly grasp the fundamentals of pugilism. As you train, a man named Hewerald arrives bearing the news that Erik has made a momentous discovery pertaining to Theobald. While your students continue their training, you decide to follow the messenger to East End, where the professor awaits.

The meeting with Erik turns out to be a trap, and you are forced to defend yourself. As you gain the upper hand, however, the battle transforms into a hostage situation. Just when it seems you must surrender, Widargelt and his disciples come to the rescue, having used their newfound fighting skills to overwhelm the sentries posted around the forest.
With the enemy thus routed, you may turn your attention to the liberated Erik.
Erik is well considering his ordeal, and your friends set out for Ala Gannha. Join them back at the village and speak with Widargelt to learn of his plans.

Widargelt declares his intent to challenge Theobald and put an end to his tyrannical ambitions. As your brother monk prepares for the encounter, see to it that you hone your own fists and feet.

※The next monk quest will be available from Widargelt upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with O'tchakha.
Speak with Erik at Rhalgr's Reach.
Speak with Widargelt in Ala Gannha.
Speak with Widargelt at Gyr Kehim.
Speak with Hewerald in East End.
Speak with Erik.
Speak with Widargelt in Ala Gannha.
Defeat the enemy!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It's you again, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: My new pupils. They have lost faith in me. And so I have lost them.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But perhaps it is just as well. For I am unfit to teach. I am the mad king's kin. It would be an affront.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forgive me... I should not burden you. But to you, I feel I can speak my heart. Reveal things I would not to others. Not even my closest disciples. Speaking of whom...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa and O'tchakha. Their bodies may have healed. But their pride will yet be raw. They would be heartened for your visit.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. How good of you to come and see us.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Both Zentsa and I are well now, never you fear. 'Tis Master Widargelt that worries us. He will not soon recover from the emotional blow.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Given all that's happened, you can hardly blame him. <sigh> We were supposed to support Master, but in the end we were just dead weight...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Lessons have been suspended since the incident. Not that it matters, though─the villagers have ceased attending. It is a big setback to our mission, but the biggest setback of all is Master's melancholy.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Professor Erik would know what to do, I'd wager. Let's go and consult him. ...But, ugh, I don't want to leave Master by himself.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Nor do I. Forename, might we trouble you to find the professor and bring him back?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I believe he took his investigation of the man named Theobald to the Resistance, at Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have not the right to revive the Fist...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: If only I was stronger, dammit!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, you come at a good time. I've just finished inquiring after our friend, His Aspiring Majesty Theobald, and you are doubtless eager to hear my findings. Ahem!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: By all accounts, 'twas but recently that the man surfaced. None can quite say whence he came, but no sooner did he appear than he declared himself Theodoric's heir and proceeded to recruit people to his cause.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But the prevailing sentiment around the fellow is one of uncertainty. It should come as no surprise, but folk are not exactly keen on the Griffin's return. And lest we forget, few have fond memories of the King of Ruin's reign, nor do they have any reason to love his heir.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: That is all. Now then, what brings you here?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Still sulking into his cyclas, you say? <sigh> Utterly hopeless...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Very well, I shall go and slap some sense into the fool. Come, Forename.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: This won't do. I need to get stronger, else I can't protect anyone. Else I can't protect...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Rain, hail, or shine, Master Widargelt has never skipped training. It must be a veritable storm inside.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Widargelt. A thrashing though it was, how long will you let a single defeat keep you down? As I hear it, you've been neglecting your training─haven't so much as lifted a finger. You would let all that muscle go to fat?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Defeat is painful. This is true. But I am no stranger to its sting. In time, the sensation fades. But this... It is no mere sensation. It is my very existence.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The man who destroyed the Fist of Rhalgr. His blood courses through my veins. That I should seek to revive the order... It is an affront to the dead. I have not the right.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: ...So that is the way of it. I will tell you a story. I once had a son. In many ways he took after me, and 'twas my hope that he would one day follow in my footsteps.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But the boy had grander dreams. Wanting to change the world, he took off and joined the Resistance. And then he died.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text:
His unit was hopelessly surrounded by imperial forces. In order to save his comrades, he swept up a sack of explosives and─
...But the details are irrelevant.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: For long years I lived with regret. If only my son had walked the path of science, I lamented, he might still be here.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But eventually I came to a realization: it was his choice to make, and make it he did. He chose to be a soldier and died a hero. In acknowledging this, I was able to attain a semblance of peace.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: We are defined not by our blood, Widargelt, but by our choices. So your uncle is the mad king. What of it? You are not him. You are you, by whatever name, and there is no limit to what path you may walk. That path may be fraught with hardship, but you mustn't give up.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Behold the soldiers of the Resistance. Even now, they fight tirelessly against the might of the Empire, ever ready to render up their lives for their cause.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Behold the soldiers of the Resistance. Even after their great victory, they continue their vigil, ever ready to render up their lives for their cause.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: These men and women bear a great burden, one beneath which they could buckle at any moment. Yet they stand firm to the very last. I used to wonder, why do they not give up? My son taught me the answer: they believe that the moment you give up on something is the moment you lose it.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: When first we met, you were hells-bent on retribution. Mule-headed though you were, you came to see the folly of your path. But there comes a time when a man must fight. For you, that time is now.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: So find your inner mule, Widargelt, and fight. Fight for that which you believe in.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are right, Professor. I see now what is truly important. Theobald desires absolute rule. If he has his way, the people will suffer. This cannot be borne. It flies in the face of the new Fist.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I would restore hope to the people. But to do this, I must transcend him. I will become stronger. And I will protect that which I hold dear.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to hear it. Suffice it to say I shall aid in whatever way I can.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Something else has been bothering me, Professor. About Theobald. His polearm techniques are distinct. I have seen them before. But when? Where?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: 'Twas a long time ago. When the Temple of the Fist still stood.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <gasp> No... It couldn't possibly be...Adri?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Who is this Adri?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A brother at the Temple of the Fist. And the closest thing I had to family. I had thought him dead. Slain when the temple was razed.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But now you believe that he may still be alive, and is the one who seeks to prevent your reviving the Fist of Rhalgr?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Let us confront him and uncover the truth.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: If it comes to it, could you strike him down?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I looked upon Adri as a true brother. I do not wish for us to fight.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I looked upon Adri as a true brother. I do not wish for it to end that way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But neither can I yield in my purpose. I seek to restore hope to the people. Adri seeks to deprive them of it. If we must stand opposed...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Then I stand ready to strike him down!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But remember, Adri is not alone. He has rallied the Corpse Brigade to his cause, and against them the Fist of Rhalgr is ineffectual. How do you intend to overcome this disadvantage?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If our fighting style will not serve, we will master another. One that is free and unshackled by form.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename, I would ask a favor of you. All you learned as a pugilist, we would learn also. Will you teach us?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Reckon you can keep up?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It's going to be tough.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Give us your worst, sisterbrother! We will take it all in our stride!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If you are ready, I would begin at once. Let us train at Gyr Kehim. As the monks of old once did. I shall summon the girls. Pray meet us there.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Well, it would seem that the storm has blown over. With that, I shall return to Ul'dah to tend to a task of mine own. I trust you will see to the rest here.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Theobald leads the Corpse Brigade. Soldiers trained to suppress the Fist of Rhalgr. Against them, our style is ineffective.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If we are to triumph, we must broaden our horizons. And Forename will help us.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Alright! Let's do it!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: I shall give it my all!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You well know how we fight. Our strengths and our weaknesses. Tell us what we must improve. From the eyes of a pugilist.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What do they need to improve?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Speed.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Endurance.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Strength.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I see... Above all, a pugilist is swift. For each blow he receives, he delivers a dozen.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! Our combinations must be seamless! Ten thousand Bootshines!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I see... Beside the pugilist, we want for endurance. No number of blows must stop us.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! Our endurance must be unyielding! Steel Peak ten thousand times!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I see... Beside the pugilist, we want for power. Every blow must be telling.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha! Our strikes must be harder than stone! Arm of the Destroyer for ten hours!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <pant> So this is how you trained... <pant> It is eye-opening...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But it is not enough. We must learn more. Or we cannot defeat the enemy. Please, Forename! Teach us more!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So our speed is yet lacking? Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So our endurance is yet lacking? Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So our power is yet lacking? Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: <huff> Such brutal training... <gasp> Small wonder you are strong...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But we are not finished yet! Again, Forename!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: (-???-)Pray forgive me my interruption. My name is Hewerald, and I am come at Professor Erik's behest.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The professor? Has something happened?

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Nothing untoward, I assure you. He has made a momentous discovery pertaining to the man called Theobald.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Truly!? We must go to him at once!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Ah, beg your pardons, but the professor bade me bring MistressMaster Forename alone. He believes that you and the ladies should focus upon your training first and foremost.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I suppose he is right. Very well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Go on, sisterbrother. You have taught us all we need to know. All that remains is to practice. Make it second nature.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: My thanks for your understanding. Then without further ado, please follow me.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: No way I'm gettin' thrashed like that again. I'm gonna train harder than I've ever trained before!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: It wouldn't do to always rely on you and Master Widargelt. Nay, we must grow strong and become able to fend for ourselves.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Not far now. The professor awaits beyond.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Hehehehe...

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Hahahaha! I can't believe you fell for it!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Ah, but to be fair, I spoke no lies. The professor did call for you.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: “Help me, Forename,” he said! Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Can't have you meddling no more, see?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You're strong, I'll give you that. But how do you like these odds?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'll put you in your place!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The hells you all waiting for!? Finish herhim!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Stubborn bastard... We'll just have to try something different.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Surrender now or he's a dead man!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Can't even finish a fight you started!? Cravens, the whole lot of you!

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Call me what you will, but no one stands between the king and his throne!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You were slow to return. So we followed. It was right that we did.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Thank Rhalgr we were not too late.

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: You... How the hells did you get past the sentries?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We trampled right over them, how else?

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: Damn it... Your ilk was supposed to be easy pickings...

dialogue.name: HEWERALD
dialogue.text: The day's yours, but it isn't over. Mark my words.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Worry not about us, sisterbrother. Go to the professor.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: <pant> And there I thought you were a demon in battle...

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: The training is arduous, but we will persevere─for Master Widargelt.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. I was on my way back from Ul'dah when they set upon me, and none too gently, the bloody brutes.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am sorry, Professor. It is my fault. You were put in danger because of me.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Haven't you learned anything, you dolt? I am part of this cause of my own volition. For better or worse, I alone bear responsibility for my actions. At any rate, I have done what I needed to do, and you may resume training safe in that knowledge.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Begging your pardons, but may I suggest we leave this place? The enemy may still be lurking nearby.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The wisest thing said all day. Come, let us return to Ala Gannha.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We are stronger thanks to your teachings. Strong enough to face the Corpse Brigade.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We're still nowhere near your level, but I reckon we've improved some!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: <pant> From the training...to our rushing here...to the battle itself... <pant> It has been a day...of exertion...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I thank you again, Forename. For your teachings. Owing to them, we could save the professor.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: He sustained some injuries. But for a blessing, they are minor. The village healer tends to him.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: When he is recovered, I mean to challenge Theobald. For that day, I will train hard. And I will put an end to his tyrannical ambitions. Witness me, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We got the better of the Corpse Brigade this time, and it's all thanks to you, Forename. You and your...ungh...brutal training.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Your lessons have allowed us to transcend the limits of our style, Forename. All you have taught us, we shall practice without cease.

quest.name: 大切なものを守る力
journal: Widargelt's jaw is set in a look of resolve.

With Erik having recovered from his injuries, Widargelt is now ready to issue his challenge to Theobald. To avoid the risk of premature bloodshed, you have been tasked with bearing the letter to his opponent, who has made Rustrock his hideout.
You present the letter of challenge to Theobald, and he haughtily accepts. Take word to Widargelt at Schism.

Theobald arrives at the prescribed hour, and he and Widargelt square off before the gathered villagers. But before fists fly, it is revealed that Theobald is in fact Adri, Widargelt's dear comrade from his time at the Temple of the Fist. Made to feel powerless due to his low birth, he resents Widargelt for spurning his royal blood and the might it represents. Once the talking ends and they engage, it becomes clear that Widargelt has the upper hand, and Adri summons his minions to his aid and resorts to using imperial weaponry. For a blessing, Hamon appears with Chuchuto and Rurukuta, having been informed of the duel, and they join the fray to even the odds. At the end of a long struggle, you and yours emerge triumphant.
To a cheering crowd, Widargelt renews his promise to revive the Fist of Rhalgr. As the dust settles, speak with your comrades to hear their thoughts on the conclusion of events.

Praising Widargelt for his heartfelt speech, Hamon heads back to Ul'dah with his two pupils in tow. D'zentsa and O'tchakha, meanwhile, reaffirm their resolve to grow stronger, that they might better support their master in his endeavors. Last but not least, Erik expresses his gratitude for the role you played in helping Widargelt to forge on in the face of adversity. With the others having taken their leave, you may now give your undivided attention to your brother monk.

Widargelt reflects upon all the lessons he has learned, and bids you farewell as he resumes his mission to revive the Fist of Rhalgr. Till next your paths cross, continue to help others as you have helped him.

※The next monk quest will be available from Erik once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”
objectives: Deliver Widargelt's challenge to Theobald at Rustrock.
Speak with Widargelt at Schism.
Speak with Hamon.
Speak with O'tchakha.
Speak with Erik.
Speak with Widargelt.
Defeat the enemy!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The professor is well again. The time is come. I will issue Theobald my challenge.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: He and his minions use Rustrock as their hideout. But who should bear the letter there?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Who should deliver the letter of challenge?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I will go.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You should go.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You, sisterbrother? Is this wise? What if they set upon you again? No, better that I go.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are right, sisterbrother. It is fitting that I go.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Master, wait. If you deliver the letter, it will most certainly end in blood. Forename should go.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Without a hostage, they can't pull no dirty tricks. They wouldn't dare try Forename again.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Very well. I entrust this letter to you. Take it to Rustrock. And see it to Theobald's hands.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We'll get them back, and we'll get them good!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Master Widargelt will prevail. With your training, I know he will.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Ah, I remember you─friend to the pathetic monks. You are bold to come here. What do you want?

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: ...A letter of challenge? Hmph, a dated practice befitting a dying style, and a lot of effort simply to lose.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: I accept. Indeed, I anticipated that I would have to deal the stubborn fool another beating.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: I will be at Schism. And you may tell Widargelt─nay, my dear cousin Theodred─that he would do well to bring a coffin.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The things you have taught us. I will bring them to bear in the duel.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The letter is delivered? My thanks, sisterbrother.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I have invited the people of Ala Gannha. They, too, shall bear witness.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The fight is to be single combat. But my opponent scruples at naught. Well do we know this. And so we must be prepared for anything.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: But whatever should happen, I am confident we will prevail. For as I trained, I awakened to a new power. The power to protect.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Really? A crowd? Well, if you're determined to make a spectacle of your demise, who am I to stop you? Let all present witness the death of the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Hear me, people of Ala Mhigo! A feeble faith such as this charlatan peddles will avail you naught! Only a strong and absolute ruler can save you! Only I can save you!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Those words may as well come from the Empire! The people need not another tyrant! Nay, what they need is hope!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And hope they may yet have. Hope everlasting in their hearts. That none can take away.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: So I beg you, brother. Give up your aspirations for the throne. Join me in reviving the Fist of Rhalgr. As is your right.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The time for deception is past. But one man I know wields the lance as you do. So take off this mask that you wear. The mask of a dead prince. And show me your face, Adri. My brother.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Hahaha...

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Adri... Long has it been since last I heard that name. I had always thought you dim-witted, but it seems your memory still serves you well, at least.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Why do you so desire our destruction? So much so that you fool even yourself?

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Like you, I was an orphan. The temple was the only home I knew.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: But that home was taken from me, laid to waste at Theodoric's command. The monks, hailed as the realm's greatest warriors, could not withstand the mad king's might.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: It was then that I knew─knew that blood counts for more than all else!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: All the training we undergo to hone flesh and mind... None of it is worth a spit in the face of absolute power! And those who are born without it─those like me─will ever be made to suffer!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: But you─you had it all from the beginning. Born into the royal family, with the blood of kings coursing through your veins. You had the power to lead and to rule. But still you turned your back on our nation's liberation. And for what? For the sake of a Fist that couldn't protect itself!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: I was nobody. Just one of the Griffin's lowly doubles. But if you will not rise up for our nation, then I will! And you have no right to stop me─you, who have forfeited your own birthright!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Hear me, brother! Our blood defines not who we are. The path we walk is ours to choose. And I have chosen not to destroy. But to protect.

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Hollow words from someone born to power! You will never understand what it means to be weak! Never!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am Widargelt! A brother of the Fist of Rhalgr! That is who I am! No more, no less!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I live to revive the Fist of Rhalgr! And by my fist, I will prove it to you!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Well, now. The professor said there'd be a spectacle, but I certainly won't say no to some action. I've been itching for it since our match was canceled.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Enough, Adri! Our goals are the same! Our methods but differ! Together, we can achieve much! We can restore our order!

dialogue.name: THEOBALD
dialogue.text: Adri is dead! I am Theobald, Theodoric's true heir and rightful king of Ala Mhigo! And by your death I shall claim my throne!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To resort to the tools of our oppression... He will stop at naught for power. It is a twisted existence. And we must straighten him out.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Come, my friends! We fight for hope!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Cease this madness, Adri!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Never! I have come this far─I will not stop now!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I will see to Adri! Focus on the others!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Come to me when you are hurt! I will heal you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hahahaha! None can stand in my way!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: More of them! Have care, my friends!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Chuchuto, Rurukuta! We're cleaning up the rank and file!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Stay sharp, Rurukuta!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Hmph, just more fodder for my fists.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: You've been a thorn, adventurer. But I've just the thing to deal with you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Beware, Forename! It senses movement!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: More reinforcements!?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Whatever it takes, by any means...I will be king!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: A king bereft of honor! No Ala Mhigan will accept you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Leave that hunk o' junk to me─Hamooon HOLYFIIIST!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: It's just you now, Adri!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: So much for the dreaded Corpse Brigade. In the end, they're just relics of a bygone age.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: But not I! I will not fall to the likes of you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Enough, brother! It's over!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Silence! I'll not surrender to a craven who has forsaken his homeland!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: He leaves us no choice! Take down the infernal machine!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Damn you! If I must fall, I'm taking you to the seventh hell with me!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: So much...unfinished...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I can't lose everything... Not again...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ack... You can't beat old age...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: I'm sorry...Master...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Ugh... I was careless...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Godsdammit...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: It's in...your hands...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Master Widargelt's gonna win. I know it.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: So it begins...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Adri. When next we fight, let it be as brothers. Let it be face–to–face.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I am weak. Too weak to bear the Fist of Rhalgr alone. Yet come what may, I will not give up. Each time I fall, I will pick myself up.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: From my heart, I ask you this. Will you not join me? Help me to build a new Fist. One that knows not highborn or low. That discerns not shadow or light. A Fist of Rhalgr where all may belong.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Your fiery zeal kindles hope within people's hearts, and doubt not but that many will come to you seeking strength─the strength to protect that which they hold dear, and by their own hands.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Now then, let us return to Ala Gannha. There is still much to do, not the least of all thanking our pugilist friends for their most timely arrival.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: 'Twas a fine speech, spoken from the heart. Lacked polish, to be sure, but that'll come with age and experience.

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: And as good a drubbing as we gave them, the Corpse Brigade will be laying low for a while.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: As will I, I think. At my age, a moment of fun costs a week of soreness.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: You must admit, though, every so often it's good to hurl yourself into a real battle!

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: A real battle? I don't know about you, but I scarcely broke a sweat.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Oh? Then I suppose I was simply imagining all your huffing and puffing!

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Ohohoho! Well, sad though it is to part, it's past time we headed home. But I hope to continue this fine exchange with our friend monks...D'zentsa and O'tchakha especially.

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Young and lithe as they are, I believe they harbor much pugilistic potential. And it'd be my pleasure to personally help them explore it, hehehe...

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: Gods, could you make it any more obvious!?

dialogue.name: HAMON
dialogue.text: Till next time, take care, Forename. And thanks for showing these old bones a good time!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: With your help, we have managed to weather another storm. I daresay we've all earned a moment's respite.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: You know, I can't help but feel that Master is too nice sometimes. After all that Theobald...er, Adri fellow did to him, he goes and begs the villagers to tend his wounds.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: So complete is his dedication to reviving the Fist of Rhalgr, he wastes no energy on such things as anger and retribution.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Right. And at any rate, there's nothing standing in our way for now. We're free to get on with our mission.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: That we are. And what we've begun in Ala Gannha, we shall continue in all corners of Gyr Abania, never resting until the Fist of Rhalgr thrives throughout the realm once more.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: I'd say Master has his work cut out for him. He's gonna need all the support we can muster.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: So let us ever strive to grow stronger, the better to provide that support. After all, it wouldn't do to always rely on Forename.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Damn right! So what're we waiting for? Let's go and train!

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Wh-What? But we've only just─ Er, pray excuse us, Forename...and thank you! From the bottom of our hearts, for everything!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Witnessing your furious struggle, I could not help but wish that I, too, could contribute with my fists. My son, I suspect, felt the same way when he chose to join the Resistance.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But as he walked his own path, so too must I. As a man of science, it is my duty to pursue truth immutable, that the knowledge may one day benefit future generations.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I did my small part for Widargelt's cause. But know that it was mostly you, my friend, who helped him to forge ahead in the face of adversity─who picked him up when fate cast him down.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: And for that I am grateful. You possess a noble heart, and it more than makes up for your lackluster mind.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: With that, I shall head back to Ul'dah. As fine a distraction as it has been to watch youngbloods come into their own, my research will not advance itself.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: As ever, should you wish to partake of my knowledge, do not hesitate to come to me.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: We couldn't have done it without you, Forename.

dialogue.name: CHUCHUTO
dialogue.text: The way your fellow monks fought, it looked not so far departed from our own style. Unless I'm mistaken, you've taught them a trick or three!

dialogue.name: RURUKUTA
dialogue.text: By any objective measure, Master Hamon is strong now, and I can only imagine how strong he used to be. I must work hard if I'm to be worthy of the Holyfist legacy.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The others wish to speak with you. When they are done, I would speak with you also.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The recent trials have taught me much. About myself. About the extent of my debts.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Through adversity, none of you abandoned me. I nearly abandoned my dream. But never again. I owe it to those who stood by me.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: To many I am indebted. And to you most of all. You are my master in all but name. Ever leading by example. Teaching me strength and grace.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I pray that you will help many others. As you have helped me.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I shall resume my mission. With my disciples at my side. Together, we will spread the Fist across the land.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: The journey will be long. But come what may, I will see it through. For I am not alone.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Fare you well, my sisterbrother. Till next we meet.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the monk quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next monk quest will be available from Erik.

obj.n: パシフィストチェスト【ILv290】
ラールガー星導教を継ぐ者として

quest.name: 闘技会への誘い
journal: Jenlyns has an invitation in his pocket and he is happy to see you.

Jenlyns hands you an invitation to the Ul Cup, a prestigious fighting tournament to be held at the Coliseum. According to the Sultansworn captain, the tournament was founded by the first sultan of Ul'dah, and after generations of obscurity, Nanamo has decided to revive it. Gladdened by your intent to participate, Jenlyns instructs you to seek out the tournament registrar on the Royal Promenade.

You speak with the registrar, who confirms your entry to the tournament. He further informs you that the opening ceremony is due to begin shortly, and suggests that you join those participants who have gathered in front of the Gladiators' Guild.

Among your would-be opponents you see faces both new and old, and the affable adventurer that you are, you take the opportunity to greet each of them. With that settled, perhaps a quick visit to the Gladiators' Guild to speak with your old guildmaster is in order.

Welcoming you warmly, Mylla gives you an overview of tournament rules, shortly after which the opening ceremony commences. Making a royal appearance, Nanamo declares the Ul Cup revived and gives her blessing to all combatants. May Nald'thal give strength to your sword arm.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Show the Ul Cup invitation to the tournament registrar.
Speak with tournament participants.
Speak with Mylla.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, precisely the womanman I wished to see.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I have something in my care for you.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: An invitation to a fighting tournament to be held at the Coliseum.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Not just any tournament, mind you, but the prestigious Ul Cup. Founded by His Royal Majesty Sasagan Ul Sisigan, first sultan of Ul'dah, 'tis nigh as old as the nation itself.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder why you are unfamiliar with so old and prestigious a tournament, it's because it has not been held in generations. At the sultana's behest it has been revived, and she now extends an invitation to Eorzea's finest swordsmen.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: It stands to reason that your name would appear among this exalted company, and doubt not but that Her Grace shall be pleased for your participation. So, can we expect you to fight in the tournament?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you fight in the Ul Cup?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Sure, where do I sign up?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I might pass on this one.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Wonderful! By witnessing you in combat, I daresay all of us Sultansworn, both fresh recruits and veterans alike, stand to gain something in our duty to protect.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: As a free paladin, you doubtless have many obligations that extend beyond the Sultansworn's purview.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But if not for yourself, mayhap you would consider fighting for us? By witnessing you in combat, I daresay all of us Sultansworn, both fresh recruits and veterans alike, stand to gain something in our duty to protect.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: And so I make this personal plea: will you not participate in the tournament?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You have my gratitude! Now then, allow me to furnish you with some additional details.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The champion will be awarded a tome said to hold the secret techniques of the first captain of Sultansworn. With such an enticing prize on offer, no small number of invitees have already confirmed their participation─I myself included.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: You should confirm yours as well, by making yourself known to the tournament registrar on the Royal Promenade.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: If you haven't already done so, you will wish to confirm your participation in the tournament. Pray make yourself known to the tournament registrar on the Royal Promenade.

dialogue.name: RECEPTIONIST02571
dialogue.text: Greetings to you, good madamsir. You are come to enter the Ul Cup? Your invitation, if you would be so kind.

dialogue.name: RECEPTIONIST02571
dialogue.text: Yes, everything appears to be in order. On behalf of the committee, I bid you welcome to the tournament!

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: Wait─you're participating, too? To think that I might have the chance to cross swords with a fabled hero such as you! The tournament cannot begin soon enough!

dialogue.name: RECEPTIONIST02571
dialogue.text: You needn't wait long, for the opening ceremony will begin any time now.

dialogue.name: RECEPTIONIST02571
dialogue.text: I am told a number of participants have already gathered before the Gladiators' Guild. Perhaps you might like to join them?

dialogue.name: RECEPTIONIST02571
dialogue.text: A number of participants have already gathered before the Gladiators' Guild. Perhaps you might like to join them?

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: To think that I might have the chance to cross swords with a fabled hero such as you! The tournament cannot begin soon enough!

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I look forward to meeting you upon the bloodsands, my friend.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Forename, it's so good to see you! Am I correct in assuming that you are participating in the tournament?

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Wonderful! Raw though I still am, I also received an invitation─Captain Jenlyns' work, I suspect. But know that I do not intend to simply make up the numbers.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Since last we met, I have trained without cease. Such improvements I have made, I hope to demonstrate to you in a rematch.

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: And what can I do for you this most beauteous of eveningsmorningsafternoons? Shall I sign your flyer with my mark, perhaps?

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: ...A contestant? Really? Well then, you would do well to pray you are not drawn against me.

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: Before my beauteous skills, your defeat is all but assured!

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: I say, are you not the postwomanpostman from before? Such a beauteous surprise this is!

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: Since coming to terms with my brilliance, I've given up provoking my opponents in favor of polishing myself further.

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: I would love nothing more than to pit my beauteous skills against yours, and I pray that I am afforded the chance!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You got business with me? Too bad, I've got none with you.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Leave me be and find someone else to bother. Like Mylla.

dialogue.name: CHILD02571
dialogue.text: You're fighting in the tournament? You look pretty strong, but it's Black Altus that's gonna win!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ahem. That's Lotus. Black Lotus.

dialogue.name: CHILD02571
dialogue.text: Yeah, what he said! He's the strongest and he always protects me!

dialogue.name: CHILD02571
dialogue.text: If you fight him, you better watch out!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Have you spoken with the captain? He is holding on to your invitation.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: ...Already entered! Marvelous!

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: We are all looking forward to witnessing your skill at arms. And if the gods are good, I shall witness them up close and personal!

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, a pleasure as always. Are you perchance entering the tournament?

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Well then, this has become infinitely more interesting. Lest you wonder, I am joining the field as a representative of the Temple Knights.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: For the honor of our order, I have every intention of winning. Do not hold back, my friend─because neither will I!

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Since last we met, I have trained without cease. Such improvements I have made, I hope to demonstrate to you in a rematch.

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: You would do well to pray you are not drawn against me. Before my beauteous skills, your defeat is all but assured!

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: I would love nothing more than to pit my beauteous skills against yours, and I pray that I am afforded the chance!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Leave me be and find someone else to bother. Like Mylla.

dialogue.name: OWYNE
dialogue.text: We are all looking forward to witnessing your skill at arms. And if the gods are good, I shall witness them up close and personal!

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: For the honor of our order, I have every intention of winning. Do not hold back, my friend─because neither will I!

dialogue.name: CHILD02571
dialogue.text: Black Al─er, Lotus is the strongest! If you fight him, you better watch out!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't Forename. That you would visit us at this juncture could only mean one thing: you're entering the Ul Cup.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Good, good! You are one of our very best, and it pleases me to see you continue seeking new challenges.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: And mark my words, this will be a challenge the likes of which you have never experienced.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: This tournament brings together the realm's finest. If you are to rise above them, nothing less than complete preparation will suffice.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Speaking of preparation, have you been apprised of the rules?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Then allow me to explain. The tournament is elimination. You lose, you go home. You win, you advance to the next match, and on it goes until a champion emerges.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Combatants are initially divided into two groups: Nald and Thal. Sounds fancy, but they're simply labels given to two branches of the tournament tree.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Look, Forename. One of your potential opponents.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Knowing is half the battle, and you'd do well to learn all you can of the competition.

dialogue.name: BRONZEBULL
dialogue.text: Oho, if it isn't the womanman who forged me my winglet. 'Tis a fine weapon, and I am wholly satisfied with it...but don't think that this earns you a favor should we meet in the tournament. Indeed, any less than my all would be an affront to both blade and blacksmith.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: ...Oh dear, is it that time already? The opening ceremony is about to commence. Shall we, then?

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Ladies and gentlemen! Today I bid you welcome to the Coliseum for a truly special event!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: To introduce it, it gives me great pleasure to call upon Her Royal Majesty Nanamo Ul Namo!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Generations ago, my ancestor, Sasagan Ul Sisigan, founded a tournament to celebrate the skill of our nation's finest swordsmen. One hundred years have passed since it was last held. By this declaration, I do hereby revive the Ul Cup!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Let it be known that all proceeds from this event shall go towards our continuing refugee relief efforts.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: My dear combatants. My fellow citizens and I look forward to an inspiring performance from all of you. May Nald'thal give strength to your sword arms!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Thank you, Your Grace. Next, I would invite Master Adrien, Coliseum columnist for the Mythril Eye, to share some insights into our combatants. What are your impressions of the field, Adrien?

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Well, Dour, I'd say it's as diverse a field as I've seen on the bloodsands. In addition to everyone's favorite gladiators and your friendly neighborhood Sultansworn, we have an Ishgardian knight as well as an acclaimed adventurer.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Truly a colorful cast of characters, all of whom bring their unique take on swordplay. With such an eclectic mix of fighting styles clashing, would you say that we're in for a veritable treat for the senses?

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Yes, I would, Dour. At this stage it's anyone's guess who will claim the title, but one thing is certain: when the match bell rings, you cannot afford to bat your eyelids! Keep watching this space, for the preliminary rounds are about to begin!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next paladin quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

obj.n: ウル王杯闘技会の始まり

quest.name: ウル王杯闘技会の始まり
journal: Mylla's expectant gaze tells you that the time is come.

Your tournament begins. With eight combatants in each group, you must defeat three in order to reach the final. For your first match you have drawn Bartholomew of the Sultansworn, and Mylla instructs you to proceed to the Coliseum entrance and await the call from the tournament registrar.

As you wait, Bartholomew appears and offers you some sporting words, shortly after which the call comes to take your place in the arena. A succession of grueling confrontations lies ahead; if you have any final preparations, the tournament registrar bids you tend to them now.
After outclassing Bartholomew, you stop Bronze Bull's charge before vanquishing Handeloup of the Temple Knights, thus securing your place in the Ul Cup final.
You return to the Gladiators' Guild to find your three opponents battered but otherwise whole. After trading blows, perhaps it would be a good idea to trade words in the spirit of camaraderie.
Bartholomew, Bronze Bull, and Handeloup join in congratulating you and wishing you well for the battle ahead. As you are about to go your separate ways, you learn that Mylla has been looking for you.

Describing your performance as awe-inspiring, Mylla declares her intent to win through her own group to arrange a final between guildmaster and pupil. Whoever should prove to be your opponent, you must be at no less than your best for the match.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Wait at the designated location.
Speak with the tournament registrar.
Speak with Handeloup.
Speak with Mylla.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: It begins, Forename!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: There are eight combatants in each group, meaning you must triumph in three bouts in order to advance to the final.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: And the opponent for your first bout is Bartholomew of the Sultansworn.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Defeat him, and you will next face the victor of another pairing, and so on. Needless to say each encounter will be more difficult than the last.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: But one fight at a time. The tournament registrar will call you when it's time to take to the bloodsands. Go now, and good luck!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The tournament registrar will call you when it's time to take to the bloodsands. Good luck, Forename!

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02572
dialogue.text: Forename Surname, yes? If you could wait right there, I will let you know when it is time.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: Hah, to think that I would draw you for my very first opponent. I thank the heavens even as I curse them...

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: But no matter who my opponent may be, I shall fight with all my being─for the pride of the Sultansworn. See you on the bloodsands, my friend.

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02572
dialogue.text: It is time, my ladylord. Pray see to your final preparations and let me know when you are ready to proceed.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The tournament registrar will call you when it's time to take to the bloodsands. Good luck, Forename!

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02572
dialogue.text: Are you ready to enter the arena?

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: That concludes all the matches for the Thal group. And what heart-stopping encounters they were!

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Verily, Dour. The crowd expected and the combatants delivered, not least of all the group winner, Forename Surname, who carved a convincing path to the final.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Shall we retrace herhis steps for those who came in late?

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: You read my mind. Forename's first match pitted herhim against Bartholomew. The Sultansworn fought with heart, but in the end he was outclassed by the star adventurer.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Though he can take pride in his effort, unfortunately he had to take his leave of the tournament. There was no getting past Forename, who went on to face the hulking Bronze Bull.

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: A veteran of countless matches here in the Coliseum, you could say he had the ground advantage. From the onset, the man brought his prodigious strength to bear, unleashing wave upon wave of punishing attacks, but Forename calmly weathered them all to emerge the victor.

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: With that, shehe advanced to the Thal group's final match against Handeloup of the Temple Knights. Employing blistering techniques seldom seen this side of Eorzea, the Ishgardian visitor looked dangerous indeed.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: If truth be told, for a moment there I feared for Forename, but the adventurer dug deep to secure victory─and a place in the Ul Cup final! Ahhh, the mere remembering of it sets my heart to racing like a runaway chocobo!

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Take deep breaths, my friend, for there's still more excitement to come. The Nald group matches are due to commence shortly, with the likes of First Sword Mylla taking to the bloodsands.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: What have I done to deserve such a treat!? I won't be missing these matches, and neither should any of you!

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: All unfolds as anticipated. Good.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSAUDIENCE02572
dialogue.text: The free paladin I told you about is living up to expectations, aye?

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: Hehehe, that shehe is. Keep up your winning ways, my friend, and win us a fortune.

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02572
dialogue.text: Welcome back, my ladylord, and may I offer my heartfelt congratulations for reaching the final!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Well fought, Forename! I would congratulate you some more, but first you ought to go and speak with your opponents. After trading blows, 'tis a fine thing to trade words in the spirit of camaraderie.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Forename, you were magnificent. Our match will remain etched in my memory and inspire me always.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: I had absolutely no answer to you. Such precious things you must have protected to become so strong.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: As you know, we Sultansworn live to protect Her Grace. By any measure, this is a vital duty, and ever do I strive to be worthy of the role.

dialogue.name: BARTHOLOMEW
dialogue.text: But crossing swords with you this day, it has given me to think that perhaps it is not enough. Whatever it is that I yet lack, mayhap I shall find it in witnessing you.

dialogue.name: BRONZEBULL
dialogue.text: I thought I had something of a chance, but I was clearly getting ahead of myself. You gave me a thorough schooling, and I mean to take the lesson to heart.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Though my tournament may be over, I shall remain in Ul'dah to watch the matches to come. And I believe I speak for all of us here when I wish you the best of luck. Our hopes go with you now, my friend.

dialogue.name: HANDELOUP
dialogue.text: Oh, a woman named Mylla was looking for you. If you haven't already spoken with her, mayhap you should seek her out.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: A place in the final! I knew you had it in you, but to witness it all unfold was nothing short of awe-inspiring!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The winner of the Nald group will square off against you for the title, and suffice it to say I intend to be that person.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I shall see to it that a match between us becomes a reality, and I hope that I can count on your support!

obj.n: ナル・ブロックの激闘

quest.name: ナル・ブロックの激闘
journal: Mylla is ready for action.

Before she enters the arena, Mylla suggests that you watch every Nald group match closely, as you will eventually face one of the combatants in the final. The tournament usher at the Coliseum will grant you access to the viewing gallery.

You watch from the edge of your seat as the dance of steel plays out between the Nald group combatants. Your fellow free paladin Constaint comes away with a hard-fought win over Franz the Fair, but is left too spent to have a chance against the ever-reliable Mylla. This leaves the group final to be fought between the First Sword and the mysterious Black Lotus. In a quality encounter, neither side yields the other ground, then seemingly out of nowhere Black Lotus claims victory with what can only be described as a sublime shield swipe. So it is that your opponent in the Ul Cup final is decided. As the dust settles, perhaps it would be meet to offer words of consolation to those who fell short, starting with Constaint and Franz.

You have spoken with Constaint and Franz, with the former praising Mylla's fighting style and the latter finding Black Lotus's familiar in its beauteous ferocity. Last but certainly not least, you may seek out your guildmaster.

Though disappointed by her elimination from the tournament, Mylla is pragmatic in defeat. As Franz did, however, she observes that her mysterious opponent strongly reminded her of someone. Curiously, Black Lotus now wishes to have words with you─a marked change from the disinterested tone he took with you earlier. Mylla sees no harm in obliging the man, who asks that you come to the Quicksand.

You chance to witness a tense exchange between Black Lotus and a decidedly obnoxious Lalafell. Noticing you afterwards, Black Lotus gives his hasty assurance that all is well, though he asks that your meeting be postponed. Your business thus prematurely concluded, you may return to the Gladiators' Guild to report to Mylla.

Though Mylla remains curious as to what Black Lotus desired, she turns her attention to your coming match with the man─as should you. With the Ul Cup final fast approaching, you would do well to dedicate yourself to preparing for an encounter that promises to go down in Ul'dahn history.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with the tournament usher at the Coliseum.
Speak with Franz.
Speak with Constaint.
Speak with Mylla.
Wait at the Quicksand.
Report to Mylla at the Gladiators' Guild.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The Nald group matches are about to begin.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: As you will eventually be fighting one of us, I suggest you watch every match closely. The tournament usher outside will grant you access to the viewing gallery.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Now then, I'd best set about my preparations. Let us speak again later.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The tournament usher outside will grant you access to the viewing gallery. Let us speak again after the fighting is done.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERSERVICE02573
dialogue.text: Greetings, my ladylord. Will you be watching the Nald group matches?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Watch the Nald group matches?

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: And so the Nald group has been pared down to two combatants! While we wait for their match to begin, let us look back over the group's notable encounters.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: In the first round, local darling Franz the Fair crossed blades with Constaint, free paladin of Ishgard.

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Though the pundits tipped Franz as the outright favorite, the younger Constaint refused to be cowed, tenaciously staying in the game before landing a single, mighty blow that ended the proceedings. Undoubtedly one of the upsets of the tournament, and most upsetting of all for maidens the realm over.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: By that victory, Constaint booked a meeting with First Sword Mylla, who had predictably triumphed in her own opening match.

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: For those of you who were banking on another upset, however, it was not to be. From the opening moments, it was plain from his sluggish movements that Constaint's earlier exertions had taken their toll.

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, the First Sword was all business. With her textbook-perfect technique and methodical maneuvering, she took firm control from the halfway mark and didn't let go until her opponent was on his knees.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Ah, I believe preparations for the tournament's penultimate match are in order! Mylla, First Sword of the Gladiators' Guild, will take to the arena against Black Lotus, the mystery contestant who has soundly defeated all comers!

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: And Black Lotus advances to the Ul Cup final!

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: In another nail-biting clash, the First Sword showed her class against an unknown opponent. However, Black Lotus kept up with her blow for blow, and seemingly out of nowhere clinched victory with a magnificent parry!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: So sublime was the timing, it calls to my mind the Sword of Nald!

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Ah, now that you mention it, I can definitely see the resemblance. And with that sublime strike, our second Ul Cup finalist has been decided!

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Forename Surname will take on the mysterious Black Lotus in a battle that promises to go down in Coliseum─nay, Ul'dahn history! Please look forward to it─I know I will!

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSAUDIENCE02573
dialogue.text: Sh-She lost! Mylla lost!

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: Bah, so much for the lauded First Sword!

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSAUDIENCE02573
dialogue.text: Wh-What will we do? That Black Lotus could ruin everything!

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSAUDIENCE02573
dialogue.text: If he ends up winning the tournament, we'd be neck deep in debt paying what's owed...

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: Fret not, my friend. We already know Black Lotus's strings. As a matter of fact, we are pulling them as we speak.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSAUDIENCE02573
dialogue.text: Truly!?

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: Do I not always say one can never have too many guarantees?

dialogue.name: OBSERVERSERVICE02573
dialogue.text: Such riveting displays from both the Nald and Thal groups!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Whoever this Black Lotus is, he is no ordinary swordsman...

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: <sigh> To think that one more beauteous than me should be found in Ishgard... Well, there is naught for it but to train harder and grow more beauteous.

dialogue.name: FRANZ
dialogue.text: That Black Lotus fellow, though─there was something familiar about him. A beauteous ferocity I'd swear I've seen before, but I cannot remember where.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Mylla is truly a complete fighter, and she gave me nary a flaw or opening to exploit. I can see why she is the guildmaster.

dialogue.name: CONSTAINT
dialogue.text: Well, my little campaign may be over, but I take heart in the knowledge that yours continues. I shall pray for your victory!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: From technique to sheer strength, that Black Lotus was a class above me in all aspects. What's more, he fought with a ferocious style that resembled...

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: But never mind that. Dwelling on it won't change the result. I was bested in a fair contest, and I shall give credit where it is due. My only regret is that I could not meet you in the final, Forename. It falls to you now to bring pride to our guild's name.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Oh, after the match, Black Lotus came and said that he wished a word with you. The way he mentioned your name gave me the impression that he knew you, but then again many people do.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: At any rate, I don't see any harm in obliging the man. If you can spare a moment, he asks that you come to the Quicksand.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: If you can spare a moment, Black Lotus asks that you come to the Quicksand.

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: What do you want? If you know what's good for you, you will remove yourself from my presence. Right now.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You can threaten me all you like, but I ain't pulling out. It's poor form, see?

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: Well, far be it from me to ruin your form...but there's a trivial matter I would bring to your attention.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You bastard!

dialogue.name: ODDE
dialogue.text: Very trivial, yes? I'm sure you will make the right decision. Hehehe...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You were listening, eh? Don't worry, it's nothing I can't handle.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Look, I know I asked you to come here, but something's come up. We'll have to do this another time.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I know I asked you to come here, but something's come up. We'll have to do this another time.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Well? Did you meet Black Lotus?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: ...Postponed, you say? I wonder what he wanted. If nowhere else, you could always try chatting in the arena. 'Twould hardly be the first time folk got talkative in battle.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I must say, though, the disappointment of elimination is swiftly giving way to anticipation. I look forward to seeing you clash with Black Lotus and, needless to say, come away with the win.

obj.n: ウル王杯闘技会の始まり

quest.name: いざ、決勝戦へ……
journal: Mylla's expectant gaze could only mean one thing: it is time.

Mylla sends you off to the Ul Cup final with words of encouragement, but no sooner do you take to the arena than your opponent is announced as having withdrawn from the match. Though this makes you the champion by default, such an unearned victory rings hollow to you. Perhaps your guildmaster can provide some clarity amid the confusion.

Sensing your dissatisfaction and knowing too well the ways of the Ul'dahn underworld, Mylla decides to investigate your opponent's unexpected withdrawal and recruits your aid. To begin with, she suggests that you speak with the tournament registrar, the last person to see Black Lotus.
According to the tournament registrar, after informing him that he no longer wished to fight, Black Lotus left in considerable haste in the direction of Pearl Lane.

You track down Black Lotus, who, to little surprise, turns out to be a disguised Aldis. He explains that he withdrew from the tournament in order to save a boy he met during his wanderings, whom unscrupulous match-fixers took hostage in the mistaken belief that he is Aldis's own. At this time an unimpressed Mylla arrives, and Aldis goes on to reveal that rumors of your surpassing skills are what drew him back to Ul'dah. His mention of a child leaves her dismayed, but the questions must wait, for the boy has yet to be released. Aldis means to track down the abductors and mount a rescue, and bids you ask after shady sorts in Pearl Lane.

Questioning the locals, you learn that a black market bookmaker has been operating in the area. In order to track him down, you must first go to his lackey near the Gate of Thal and indicate your intent do business.
With the chat mode in Say, enter the password “Doubt the truth” to let the suspicious fellow know you are a customer.
Satisfied that you are a customer, the suspicious fellow directs you to his associate near the Sultantree. And by the sounds of it, that is where you will find the abducted child.
The burly bloke and his cronies set upon you, but they are no match for the Ul Cup champion─by default or no. With the ruffians subdued, you may turn your attention to the child.

Mylla and Aldis join you as you finish freeing the child from his bindings. After a brief but warm reunion, Aldis informs you that he has found solid evidence implicating Odde, the detestable Lalafell from the Quicksand, in the match-fixing attempt. And then to Mylla's relief, he clarifies that the boy is not in fact his own. All is well, then, save for the fact that a dream match between you and Aldis was not to be. However, Mylla tells you not to give up, for she believes she can convince the organizers to host the Ul Cup final. Leaving to entrust the child to the Brass Blades' care, she bids you join her back at the guild afterwards.

Mylla reiterates her confidence that the Ul Cup final will go ahead, and excuses herself to go about making it so. See to it that you are fully prepared for the imminent match, for it will doubtless prove the toughest of all.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Mylla upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Mylla.
Speak with the tournament registrar.
Search for Black Lotus.
Gather information in Pearl Lane.
With the chat mode in Say, enter “Doubt the truth” to let the suspicious fellow know you are a customer.
Search for the burly bloke at Spineless Basin.
Aid the scrubby stripling.
Speak with Mylla at the Gladiators' Guild.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
