dialogue.text: It's time, Forename, the Ul Cup final. You have what it takes to win. Just fight as you always do, and the rest will follow.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERSERVICE02574
dialogue.text: L-Ladies and gentlemen. It is my regret to inform you that Black Lotus has withdrawn from the match.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERSERVICE02574
dialogue.text: In the absence of an opponent, the winner of the Ul Cup final is Forename Surname by default!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTVISITOR02574
dialogue.text: Hey, you don't think that those rumors could be true, do you?

dialogue.name: CRAFTSMANVISITOR02574
dialogue.text: What, that Black Lotus is Aldis, the gladiator who was banished from the Coliseum? Seems a little far-fetched, but you never know these things.

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: In an unexpected turn of events, Black Lotus, the winner of the Nald group, has withdrawn. I repeat, Black Lotus has withdrawn.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: Twelve in a tangle, what in blazes is going on!?

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: We will relay further information as soon as more becomes available. Please bear with us.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: What is the meaning of this?

dialogue.name: OBSERVERSERVICE02574
dialogue.text: A-Apologies, my lady, but I'm as much in the dark as you are. 'Twas the tournament registrar who spoke with Black Lotus on the matter.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Not even the organizers have full grasp of the situation...

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: It isn't uncommon for combatants to withdraw from a match, but when it does happen, more often than not something illicit is afoot.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: While some might consider “default” to be the sweetest word, I know that you do not. Nay, an unearned victory such as this rings hollow and brings you no satisfaction. As such, I have a mind to delve into what will certainly prove to be some dark places. May I rely on your help?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Good. To begin with, let us go and ask the tournament registrar about his conversation with Black Lotus.

dialogue.name: OBSERVERSERVICE02574
dialogue.text: A-Apologies, but I'm as much in the dark as you are. 'Twas the tournament registrar who spoke with Black Lotus on the matter.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Let us go and ask the tournament registrar about his conversation with Black Lotus.

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02574
dialogue.text: Yes, my ladymy lord, Black Lotus came and informed me that he no longer wished to fight.

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02574
dialogue.text: This happened shortly after you entered the anteroom. I assumed he would follow suit, but instead he declared his withdrawal.

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02574
dialogue.text: Stunned as I was, by the time I had gathered my wits and thought to ask for his reason, he had spun on his heels and left.

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02574
dialogue.text: He was headed in the direction of Pearl Lane, I believe. If you wish to speak with him, I suggest you take your search there.

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02574
dialogue.text: If you wish to speak with Black Lotus, he was headed in the direction of Pearl Lane.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Were you able to learn anything?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: (-Black Lotus-)Well, I'd say it's time to come clean. Sharp as you are, you'd probably seen through the masquerade anyway.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Forename, it's good to see you again. As myself, at any rate.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Let me guess: the heartbroken maiden demands to know why I abandoned her at the arenayou demand to know why I abandoned you at the arena. I'll tell you that and more besides, but this stays between us, understood?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Since we took care of business with Leavold and I left Ul'dah, I've been roaming the land like a proper vagabond.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: In the course of which I helped a child in need. You've already met the little scamp. I came upon him one day, all on his lonesome, his face caked in dirt. A war orphan, like so many out there.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Upon learning what I do─did for a living, he decided that he must learn swordplay and begged me teach him. Wouldn't take no for an answer, the stubborn bugger, and he's been following me around ever since.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Now, those that came to me with threats, they mistook the boy for my own and took him hostage, and demanded that I pull out of the tournament.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: If it were just my own head, I wouldn't think twice about risking it, but I won't gamble with someone else's life. The boy may not be my flesh and blood, but he's in danger on my account. And here we are.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: What can I say? In spite of myself, I've taken to the rascal.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I knew it was you. From the moment we fought.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Mylla, my dear! You are as ravishing as ever!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Spare me! All this time and you couldn't bestir yourself to send a single godsdamned letter!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Easy on the anger, now. 'Twould be a right shame to line that beautiful face with wrinkles.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Th-That's neither here nor there! Now, tell me why have you returned!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: <sigh> As hasty as ever too, I see. If you must know, rumors had reached me of a free paladin named Forename Surname whose skills were beyond compare.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Precisely how far beyond compare had herhis skills become, I simply had to see─nay, test for myself. So I made my way back to Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: When I arrived, I learned that the prestigious Ul Cup had been revived. If Forename enters, I'd get my wish. If shehe doesn't, I'd just have to settle for winning the tournament and resuming my wanderings.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: With a little help from an old friend, I acquired an invitation and found myself a suitably menacing full-face helm. Being something of a pariah, it wouldn't do to be seen, you see.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: If you went through all that effort for the sake of fighting Forename, why did you withdraw?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Simply put? To make way for money. Not mine, mind you, but someone else's.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: As you know, a tournament of this scale sees stupendous sums of coin moved, and there are some who'd stop at nothing to ensure that it moves their way.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Well, it turns out that Black Lotus was standing between an especially unscrupulous crew and their fortune. And so they took my boy and threatened his life.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: ...B-Boy?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Aye, well, it's a rather embarrassing tale. Let's save it for after I'm a few tankards in.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Someone wants you to win, Forename. At all costs. While I do not disagree with their choice of champion, their methods don't sit well with me.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ah, but I'm afraid the rest will have to wait. The danger hasn't passed.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Though I did as I was told, they haven't kept their part of the bargain. I mean to mount a rescue, and for this I could use your help.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I knew I could count on you. First of all, we must track down these match-fixing, child-abducting villains. For the sake of haste, let us split up and investigate. If you could ask after shady sorts in these parts, I'll see to the nearby areas.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: A-A child? When the hells did he...?

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENA02574
dialogue.text: Shady sorts taking wagers on the Ul Cup? Haven't seen any myself, but safe to say they're out there. It's Ul'dah, after all.

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENB02574
dialogue.text: What? You here to laugh at me?

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENB02574
dialogue.text: ...Well, there's plenty 'round here hopin' to strike it rich quick. Don't know any bookmakers myself─don't have the coin for that─but someone's bound to.

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENC02574
dialogue.text: G-Gambling? M-Match-fixing? Whatever are you talking about?

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENC02574
dialogue.text: ...K-Kidnapping!? Oh, gods, I never imagined they'd go that─ Ahhh! Me and my big mouth!

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENC02574
dialogue.text: <sigh> Alright, alright... I'll tell you what I know. Least I can do to clear my conscience.

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENC02574
dialogue.text: This black market bookmaker, he has no established base, the better to avoid the authorities, but right now he has a lackey near the Gate of Thal. Say to the fellow the words “Doubt the truth,” and he'll tell you where to go.

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENC02574
dialogue.text: Now, leave me be...and you didn't hear any of this from me!

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENA02574
dialogue.text: Shady sorts taking wagers on the Ul Cup? Haven't seen any myself, but safe to say they're out there. It's Ul'dah, after all.

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENB02574
dialogue.text: As I said, there's plenty 'round here hopin' to strike it rich quick. Don't know any bookmakers myself─don't have the coin for that─but someone's bound to.

dialogue.name: ULDAHCITIZENC02574
dialogue.text: This black market bookmaker has no established base, the better to avoid the authorities, but right now he has a lackey near the Gate of Thal. Say to the fellow the words “Doubt the truth,” and he'll tell you where to go.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: A child... I can't believe it...

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: What're you gawpin' at? Piss off.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, enter the password “Doubt the truth” to let the suspicious fellow know you are a customer.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: ...Oh, a customer. Collectin', are you? Then it's over by the Sultantree.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: Just so you know, it might be a bit noisy. My mate there's, er...babysittin' at the moment.

dialogue.name: SUSPICIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: Collection's over by the Sultantree. Just so you know, it might be a bit noisy. My mate there's, er...babysittin' at the moment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Doubt the truth

dialogue.name: CAUTIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: Yeah? What you do you want?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What do you want?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Your clothes, your boots, and your chocobo.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The child.

dialogue.name: CAUTIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: You want my what!? Whoever this clown is, get herhim!

dialogue.name: CAUTIOUSMAN02574
dialogue.text: One of Aldis's!? Get herhim!

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: CHILD02574
dialogue.text: <sniff> Are you a bad person, too? I want Uncle Aldy! <sob>

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The child is unharmed?

dialogue.name: CHILD02574
dialogue.text: Uncle Aldy, I-I'm so sorry! If only I was stronger...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: That's nothing a little training won't fix. By the way, have you thanked Forename here yet?

dialogue.name: CHILD02574
dialogue.text: Oh, right!

dialogue.name: CHILD02574
dialogue.text: Thanks for saving me, Forename! At first I thought you were one of the crooks, but you're a really nice person.

dialogue.name: CHILD02574
dialogue.text: Oh, and you're really strong as well! I'm gonna train hard so I can be strong too and look after myself!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Allow me to thank you also, my friend. And lest you wonder, I haven't been idle either. I managed to find solid evidence implicating the ex-sellsword Odde, our friend whom you saw me having a chat with. The Brass Blades have been alerted to his shenanigans, and he'll trouble us no more.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Wait, did that boy just call you Uncle?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Aye, well, I'm a little too far gone to be his playmate. What of it?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Wait a minute─don't tell me you assumed he was...you know?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! That certainly explains your black mood!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: To prevent further misunderstanding, he isn't mine. I chanced to help him and we became fast friends, is all.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Oh. Oh! W-Well, it's not like I cared or anything. It's just...given how long you were gone, I wouldn't have been surprised...is all.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! It takes a lot longer than that to grow 'em this big!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Th-This is nothing to laugh about!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ahhh, but it is! <sigh> At any rate, all's well that ends well. It's just a pity the dream match between me and Forename could not be...

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Don't be so quick to give up. You've evidence that you were being threatened, have you not? I believe there's a good chance we can still make it happen.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: The Ul Cup generated such excitement as the Coliseum has not seen in generations. The organizers would have to be hopeless fools to forgo the chance to crown it off with a grand finale.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I will lodge a formal petition in my capacity as guildmaster. The match will take place, just you watch.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Hah, that's my Mylla, as brilliant as you are beautiful!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: The First Sword's as good as her word, my friend─our match is a guaranteed thing. When we finally meet in the arena, let us hold nothing back. And no hard feelings if I win, yes?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I will go and entrust the young one to the care of the Brass Blades. Pray come and see me at the guild afterwards.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: My thanks, Forename. With your help, not only were we able to save Aldis's boy, we may yet spare the tournament an unceremonious end. All that remains is to convince the organizers to host the final. Knowing them, though, it won't require much convincing.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: On the subject of the boy...I would thank you to keep my little misunderstanding to yourself. Ahem.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Now then, I must be about my business. Until such time as the match is confirmed, take what rest you can. You will need it.

obj.n: ナル・ブロックの激闘
さらなる剣術の高みへ

quest.name: さらなる剣術の高みへ
journal: Mylla looks at you with a twinkle in her eye.

Mylla can barely contain her excitement as she informs you the Ul Cup final will go ahead. Your long-awaited match against Aldis will take place shortly; when you are ready, the tournament registrar will show you through to the arena.

No sooner do you arrive in the arena than a damnably curious spectator exposes Black Lotus as Aldis. Though the crowd is initially shocked, Mylla succeeds in rallying everyone behind the match. At this time, Nanamo steps in and gives her blessing for the contest to proceed. With no obstacles left to bar your way, you and Aldis finally square off. At the end of a furious clash, you emerge the victor and are crowned champion of the Ul Cup. Nanamo makes to present you with the promised tome of secret techniques, but Papashan confesses that such an item never existed. The true purpose in bringing together the highest names in swordplay, he explains, was to raise the gladiatorial arts higher, with the ultimate goal of strengthening the realm in the face of multiple threats. At length, Nanamo turns her attention to the question of Aldis's banishment, and by a simple utterance grants him a royal pardon.
And so, after numerous twists and turns, the Ul Cup comes to a close. Mylla and Aldis await you back at the Gladiators' Guild.

Despite having received a pardon, Aldis chooses to continue his journey of self-discovery. Mylla protests, but he will not be swayed; his defeat to you made it clear he still wants for experience, and he will not know peace until he has gained it. As Aldis departs, he expresses his eagerness to meet you again in battle. In anticipation of that day, you resolve to continue striving for greater heights in your art.

※The next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “To Have Loved and Lost.”
objectives: Speak with the tournament registrar.
Speak with Mylla.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: It's official, Forename! The Coliseum has agreed to host the Ul Cup final anew!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: In the interests of maintaining excitement, things are already in motion. And lest you wonder, Odde has since been apprehended by the Brass Blades and cannot hinder the proceedings.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Aldis has been informed and makes ready even as we speak, and you should likewise see to your own preparations. When all is in order, the tournament registrar will escort you through to the arena.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say I shall be cheering you on from the viewing gallery. Good luck, Forename, and give Aldis a kiss for me─with the rim of your shield!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: When all is in order, the tournament registrar will escort you through to the arena. Good luck, Forename, and give Aldis a kiss for me─with the rim of your shield!

dialogue.name: ATTENDANT02575
dialogue.text: This is it, my ladylord─no more sudden changes of plan! Are you ready to proceed?

dialogue.name: ADRIEN
dialogue.text: Ladies and gentlemen! Finally, at long last, the moment you've all been waiting for is here: the Ul Cup final!

dialogue.name: CRAFTSMANVISITOR02575
dialogue.text: Before this starts, I want to know something! Is it true Black Lotus is actually Aldis, the Sword of Nald?

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: What!? Black Lotus, I must ask you to remove your helm!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTVISITOR02575
dialogue.text: Thal's balls, it's really him! What'll happen now?

dialogue.name: CRAFTSMANVISITOR02575
dialogue.text: Nothing'll happen, that's what. Once expelled, a gladiator may not fight in the Coliseum again. There'll be no match.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: (-Aldis-)Aye, that's right. All this time it was me.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: (-Aldis-)I'm the last person who needs to be reminded of my own banishment. If you wish to call off the final, then so be it. I'll not argue.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: (-Aldis-)Nonetheless, I ask you this: will you not let Forename and I fight? We promise to give you a match that the bards shall long sing of!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Oh, come on! One of the greatest swordsmen of our age is about to cross swords with a fabled hero, and you have to even think about it? Every one here must be aching to see them fight! Is this not so?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: If there is any indication of dishonest conduct, I shall take his head myself! But give them a chance, I say! Remember the incredible performances they've given us thus far, and imagine how much finer it will be!

dialogue.name: BRONZEBULL
dialogue.text: The First Sword speaks true! This is a once-in-a-lifetime event! 'Twould be a crying shame to have it end like this!

dialogue.name: MERCHANTVISITOR02575
dialogue.text: Aye, listen to Mylla! I came here for a final, and I want one, dammit!

dialogue.name: CRAFTSMANVISITOR02575
dialogue.text: Me, too! I've watched Aldis since I was a lad, and I want to watch him fight again! Let it happen, rules be damned!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: You have no objections, Forename?

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: I must confess that I, too, have awaited the match with bated breath. There will be time enough afterwards to revisit past misdeeds.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: There you have it, Aldis. You have the blessing of all present.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: (-Aldis-)Don't ever change, Mylla.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: (-Aldis-)Come, Forename! Your opponent is the Sword of Nald!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: A magnificent performance from start to finish! Such exquisite bladework I have seldom beheld!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Now then, perchance you have heard that the champion would be awarded a rare tome, one which holds the secret techniques of the first captain of Sultansworn.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Papashan, if you would be so kind.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Ahem. If I might speak plain, Your Grace...

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: The tome does not exist.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Well, well. I see what you did there, Master Papashan.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You've revived not only Sultan Sisigan's tournament, but his vision as well!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Seems a history lesson is in order. Ahem. During his reign, Sultan Sasagan Ul Sisigan invited swordsmen of all lands to Ul'dah to fight with his own elite in tournaments.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: In time, such tournaments came to attract sellswords, giving rise to a national institution: the grand diversion that is the Coliseum.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: While that was a defining development for Ul'dah, historians believe that, in bringing together expert swordsmen, the sultan's true intent was to advance the gladiatorial arts.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: But when the balance of power shifted away from the Royalists, the royal house lost access to the enormous funds needed to host grand tournaments.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: The revival of the Ul Cup, the promise of a nonexistent prize... All of it was in emulation of Sultan Sasagan's vision.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: You are most perceptive, Aldis. The true purpose in bringing together the highest names in swordplay was to raise the gladiatorial arts higher, as the sultan once did.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: And though we walk in his footsteps, our destination lies a little farther. For it is my hope that not only Ul'dah, but Eorzea as a whole, is strengthened.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: From the Garlean menace to the beast tribes and their primals, the realm is faced with numerous threats.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: If we are to protect our homes and loved ones, we must keep our blades sharp and our shields strong.

dialogue.name: PAPASHAN
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Your Grace. Had you known there was neither tome nor technique, I feared you would not consent to the tournament.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: You should have consulted me from the first. As it stands, we must needs find another means of rewarding our champion.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: My dear Forename. Speak unto me your desire; I shall do mine utmost to bestow it.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you request?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A pardon for Aldis.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: A noble request befitting your kind-hearted self. Ere I grant it, however, there is one thing I would know.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: ...Nothing? Truly? Very well, if the champion desires naught, then the prize shall go to the next in line.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Aldis. Though this was not to be your day, you fought outstandingly and may rightly stand tall. Ere I grant you your prize, however, there is one thing I would know.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: I am given to understand you were sentenced to exile for being party to bribery. Is this true?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: It is, Your Grace.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: I see. Very well, then.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: I, Nanamo Ul Namo, Sultana of Ul'dah, do hereby absolve you of all crimes.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Our fair nation has need of men of your strength and skill, now more than ever. 'Twould be unconscionable to cast you aside.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: And to the champion, Forename, I offer my joyous congratulations! Your victory this day shall long remain in our hearts and minds!

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Though the tournament is come to a close, I pray that all of you shall ever strive to raise your art higher─for the good of all the realm!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: That was a fight to remember. You've truly grown strong, my friend.

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: A well-deserved victory! Congratulations!

dialogue.name: CHILD02574
dialogue.text: You're even stronger than Uncle Aldy! If I'm gonna challenge you one day, I'm gonna have to train extra hard!

dialogue.name: CHILD02574
dialogue.text: You're even stronger than Uncle Aldy! If I'm gonna challenge you one day, I'm gonna have to train extra hard!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: To think that such a motive existed for the tournament... We gladiators, too, must endeavor to do our part for the greater good of the realm.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Hear, hear, my dear. Ah, but the things one must do to arrange a simple match with Forename. Judging by how quickly you've improved in my short time away, had we fought but a few days earlier, I like to think I would've come out on top.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: So. I'm good to return to the Coliseum?

dialogue.name: DOURMEADOW
dialogue.text: You have Her Grace's personal endorsement─I'd say that's about as good as one can get. And as a finalist in the Ul Cup, you would draw decent crowds. We'd be glad to have you back.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Hah, I never dreamed that this day would come...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Well, I suppose I'll resume my wanderings.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: What!? You're given a royal pardon, yet you're leaving Ul'dah again!?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Mylla, you watched Forename and I fight. For all my training during my travels, all the hardships I subjected myself to, I was no match for herhim.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: 'Tis plain I still want for experience, for knowledge and skill, and I won't be at peace until I gain it. Surely you understand this?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Yes, but─

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Worry not, Mylla. I will visit whenever I can. After all, there's a filly back home who whinnies incessantly after me.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: And you, my free paladin friend. Not only did you oblige me with a match, you rescued my boy and defended my honor besides. For that I cannot thank you enough.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I learned much and more from our encounter, and I should be glad if you got something out of it also. Keenly do I look forward to our next meeting, when we can simply square off, with no complicating factors to distract us!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the paladin quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “To Have Loved and Lost.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next paladin quest will be available from Jenlyns.

obj.n: パッセージ・オブ・アームズ
シヴァルラスチェスト【ILv290】

quest.name: 隠された呪文
journal: Lalai is eyeing you expectantly.

Lalai eagerly shares with you a new and most fascinating discovery. In poring over the reunited Books of Nald'thal, she has unearthed what appears to be a long-lost incantation. Entirely unfamiliar to her, the spell is accompanied by only a concise instruction urging the would-be caster to speak the words at Nald's Reflection. Convinced that Master Ququruka meant to bequeath some profound knowledge to his pupil, Lalai dashes off, making it all too clear that she expects you to follow close behind.

At Lalai's behest, you invoke the spell according to the instructions writ in the tome. No sooner have the words left your mouth than a wisp of light emerges from the chalice of the statue of Nald. It then floats across the room, stopping before you in an ominous warning before striking the body of your companion in full force. Not moments later, Lalai is no longer herself, but speaking to you in the voice of none other than Shatotto─the storied mother of black magic herself. No sooner has the mighty sorceress introduced herself to you than she brandishes her staff in your general direction, eager to test whether you are worthy of aiding her in performing some cryptic-yet-vital task. Summoning forth all the strength you can muster, you hold the sorceress and her array of destructive incantations at bay, a development which seems to please her greatly.

Relieved to see that you indeed possess the strength she seeks, Shatotto at last deigns to share with you the true reason for her return. She has scarce begun to describe the impending danger, however, when her strength begins to fade. Moments later, she is gone, and Lalai once again regains control of her own consciousness. At a loss for how to proceed, she proposes that you return to the Sacrarium to further discuss the matter at hand.

Though Shatotto's sudden appearance has raised more questions than answers, one thing is clear: there are dark clouds on the horizon. As Lalai returns to the study of the tomes in hopes of gleaning further answers, you return to your study of the black arts, that you might be better equipped to face the challenges to come.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Join Lalai at Nald's Reflection.
Speak with Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.
Prove your worth by defeating Shatotto!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I am glad you are here. I would consult with you about a matter that has been gnawing away at my mind.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Thanks in no small part to your efforts, the books of Nald'thal have at long last been reunited in these halls, their long-lost secrets just waiting to be unearthed.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Though I have scarcely begun poring over the tomes, I have already made a most remarkable discovery. Each of the twin tomes contained a cipher of sorts, the meaning of which could only be deciphered when the two are referenced in tandem. I will spare you the details of how I unraveled the message─though it truly was among my finer moments, if I daresay so myself.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text:
At any rate, the words─once decoded─are most evidently an incantation, albeit one entirely unfamiliar to me. Beneath it was writ a simple directive:
“Heir to the dark arts, speak these words unto Nald's Reflection, that memories long forgotten may stir anew.”

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: As to what precisely these words are referencing, your guess is as good as mine. Still, Master Ququruka doubtless preserved the incantation and the accompanying message in his records for a reason. And if we are not the heirs to the art of black magic, then who is?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: So I trust I can expect to see you at Nald's Reflection. And do try to hurry, yes? I would prefer not to delay any potentially epoch-making discoveries any longer than necessary.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...And that is all you need know. When I give the sign, you are to chant the words precisely as I instructed. Understood?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Now, Forename!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: That light...!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: (-???-)...You. Yes, you shall serve as the bringer of destruction. As for my vessel...ah, yes. That one should suffice.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...Hm? Whatever was that strange sensation? For a moment, it was as if a great fire burned within me, and then...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Nghhh... Now, it is as if my very mind is being rent in two. And this voice...!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Lalai?-)...Well, well. It feels good to walk the earth for the first time in two millennia. Seems that old coot proved himself useful after all. If he hadn't kicked it, I'd find him and give him a pat on the back.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Lalai?-)And what are you gawking at? You are a black mage, are you not? Surely you possess the common sense to recognize the woman who stands before you. Or will you be needing a hint?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Shatotto-)Some would call me Death's Handmaiden, but I always found that particular epithet so needlessly morbid. Though technically speaking I am but manifestation of a memory, you may call me by the name I used in life─Shatotto, at your service! But I jest, of course─it's you who are at mine.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Shatotto-)I must say, what is it with black mages today and these unwieldy hats? Do they truly believe it makes them look more imposing? Or are they merely compensating for something? In either event, I have no need of such adornments.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Now that's more like it! Forename, was it? Of course it was. Now that we're on a first-name basis, you'll have to tell me all about yourself. On second thought...let's skip that. Time is short, and to be quite honest, I don't particularly care.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: At any rate, as I might have mentioned, I am not the true Shatotto as she once lived, but rather a manifestation of her memory—er, my memory. Needless to say, that still makes me the most powerful sorceress currently existing in your world. You'd do well to remember that if you ever have a mind to cross me.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, then! Now that we've gotten the pleasantries out of the way, what do you say we have a little fun? Prepare to be blasted into a kazillion itty-bitty pieces!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Oh, come now, must I spell everything out for you? I must know if you are sufficiently adept at the dark arts to help me forestall impending doom, and this is by far the easiest way to do so. Not to mention the most fun─prepare for a world of pain!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...Not half bad. That painfully dull expression on your face had me worried, but I suppose you'll do after all.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: “Do” for what? Try to keep up, will you? I abhor repeating myself. Let me start at the beginning. Two thousand, three hundred years ago, the greatest mage our realm has ever known─that would be me─compiled a choice assortment of the most potent offensive incantations and evocations into the school known as black magic.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: You still seem puzzled. I also devised a spell that would allow my memory to one day return. My reasons were twofold─for one, I simply had to see for myself how the art of destruction would be handed down eras after I had inevitably passed. For another, I knew that without my guidance, this realm would one day meet most certain─

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...Oh, this won't do. I had thought the girl stronger than this, but... These eyelids grow heavy, and my consciousness wanes... I suppose I'll just have to take a little nap.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But remember this, my puppet of destruction. You have an important role to play in the battle to come─a battle that will decide the fate of your very world. Till next I wake...shirk not...your study of the art...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: (-Lalai-)Forename...? Where are we? It is as if I just woke from the strangest dream...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: (-Lalai-)And yet, my every limb aches, as if my respite were more exhausting than the fiercest of battles. Did you perchance observe anything odd happen to me?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Preposterous...or so most would say. But you have no reason to tell me falsehoods, and it would certainly explain the curious symptoms I find myself experiencing.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Shatotto, the mother of our dark art─she who pursued the power of destruction to and beyond any limits that could be conceived. Has her consciousness truly taken up residence in my own mind?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...It is no use. I call out, but she does not answer. Whether she slumbers or simply deigns not to answer, I cannot say.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I fear I am at something of a loss. Let us return to the Sacrarium and clear our heads. Mayhap the answers we seek will yet reveal themselves to us.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...I'm afraid it's no use. I have called out to Shatotto within my mind time and time again, but I am met only with silence.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: If only Master were still here, surely he could shed some light on the matter. After all, it was he that recorded for posterity the words we used to summon forth Shatotto's memory.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Wait...that's it. Master himself may not be here, but his writings may yet contain the answer to our queries. It was within the statue of Nald that the memory slumbered─this does not strike me as mere coincidence.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I believe that settles it. I will return to the tomes and see what knowledge can be gleaned, that we might prepare ourselves for whatever task awaits us.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: This holds for you as well, Forename. Whatever Shatotto's motives for returning to us, I cannot shake the feeling that ill happenings are afoot. I suggest you resume your studies with the utmost of urgency.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: Do try not to die, will you? I have need of you yet.

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: You didn't think that was all I had up my sleeve, did you?

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: Come, my minions! Show this one the meaning of pain!

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: Is that all you've got? Did I choose the wrong puppet...?

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: Oh, come now! This was supposed to be easy for you!

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: This one was always my favorite... I'm sure you'll find it a blast!

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: I don't really want to obliterate you, but if you don't move, you leave me little choice...

dialogue.name: SHATOTO
dialogue.text: More! More power! More death and destruction!

quest.name: 迫る星降りの刻
journal: Lalai would share with you the knowledge she has gleaned.

You are discussing the matter of Shatotto's sudden appearance with Lalai when Zhai'a Nelhah dashes breathlessly onto the scene. The Hearer brings grave tidings from the Twelveswood─a pack of golems has escaped from the ruins of the Lost City of Amdapor and now threatens to run roughshod over the forest. As if spurred to action, the memory of Shatotto stirs, and dashes off with Lalai's corporeal body in tow to see to the threat as only she knows how. At the Hearer's behest, you make for the Shroud to see what news the Wailer Alphene has of the threat.

Alphene is at a loss, but the ever-insightful Shatotto surmises that the golems you seek are hiding in plain sight. Fortunately, she has a means to tell inanimate stone from foe. Incinerate any suspicious-looking stone structures with your most potent fire magic, and lay waste to any rampaging golems that might manifest themselves in the process.
Following Shatotto's advice to the letter, you make short work of three meddlesome golems. Seek out Shatotto and hope that she is as pleased with your efforts as she undoubtedly is with her own.

At least moderately impressed with your command of the destructive arts, Shatotto deigns to share with you and your friends the nature of the threat the realm faces. As she tells it, two millennia ago when she still lived, a wayward comet threatened to crash into the city of Mhach─a crisis averted by the power of black magic, an art which she had devised at least in part for that very task. Fragments that broke off the comet hurtled to the earth, and were later unearthed, affording the mages of the realm untold powers. There remains, however, a further complication. Shatotto posits that the stones call out to each other with aetheric signals, augmenting each other's power─a phenomenon which could result in disaster should the comet once again draw near, as Shatotto predicts will happen in the days to come. Zhai'a Nelhah is naturally skeptical, but nonetheless is determined to do his part to see that the realm does not come to peril. Reconvene with your friends at Milvaneth Sacrarium, that you might formulate a plan of attack.

Back at the Sacrarium, Shatotto returns to her slumber, and you are rejoined by Lalai. After a testy exchange with Zhai'a Nelhah─who is skeptical of Shatotto's methods, if not her intentions─she goes off to consult with your beastman allies, encouraging you to devote yourself to your studies that you might be prepared for the trials to come.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Speak with Alphene at Rootslake.
Cast Fire III on the suspicious stones, then slay any golems that appear.
Report to Shatotto.
Speak with Shatotto at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Good. For better or for worse, it would seem Shatotto is still enjoying herself a peaceful slumber. In the meantime, my study of the Books of Nald'thal has proven rather enlightening.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: In particular, I was surprised to learn that while the statue in Nald's Reflection is a relatively recent construction─in historical terms, of course─the goblet it holds in its hands is quite ancient. It would appear that it was within that vessel Mistress Shatotto's soul was sealed away.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Master's record goes on to state that the inner surface of the goblet is inscribed with a message in the glyphs of ancient Mhach. It reads─ah yes, here it is.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: “The power of destruction did rend the baleful star, and peace doth reign near and afar. Yet twenty-three centuries hence shall it come anew, and certain doom is sure to ensue.” A prophecy of sorts, it would seem.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It has been roughly twenty-three hundred years since Shatotto founded black magic, which means it is entirely possible she herself left the inscription. But whatever sort of doom could the prophecy be referring to? I fear it is all rather cryptic...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: (-???-)Lalai! And Forename as well! I would speak with the both of you at once.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...Ahem. While I would like nothing more than to catch up on old times, I come bearing grave tidings. My friends, pray lend me your aid.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't our favorite goobbue-headed Hearer. I would have thought the seventh hell would freeze over before you cast your lot with purveyors of destruction. What have we done to deserve the honor of your groveling?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: This is no time for jest, Lalai! The situation is most dire. Why, a veritable horde of crazed golems has burst forth from the Lost City, and is wreaking havoc on the Twelveswood even as we speak!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Whatever foul sorcery led them to abandon their orders and run rampant, we cannot say. But one thing is certain: if we do not deal with them─and do so swiftly─there is no telling what damage they might inflict upon our forest home.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: That does sound like cause for concern. Very well. I suppose it would not kill us to put the matter of Shatotto aside for the moment and...hm?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...Wait, no! Not now! Unggghhhhhh...!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Shatotto-)I say, how can the girl think straight with this ungodsly fool's cap weighing her down? Or perhaps she can't, and that is why─but of course, it all makes perfect sense!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Shatotto-)Oh, hello there. Did you miss me and my prodigious intellect? Of course you did! Now, look—we haven't much time, so do try to keep pace.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: This surge of aether! Just who─or what─are you?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Shatotto-)Yes, yes, I'm sure there's so much you'd like to know. But where would that get us? I've already heard all I need to know through the girl's ears. We are needed in the South Shroud, yes? Rampaging golems, was it?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Er, indeed... I have tasked a Wailer named Alphene with looking into the matter. With any luck, he has gleaned some knowledge which might avail us in plotting a suitable course of action.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-Shatotto-)Alphene. South Shroud. Yes, I believe the great Shatotto has all she needs. Well, come now, no point in standing around like gawping goobbues when there's work to be done, right? Right!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Shatotto...? Forename. I am most grateful for your aid, do not get me wrong. But if there is anything that you and Lalai have been keeping from me, mark my words─I will hear of it in full when our task is done.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Ah, it's so much easier to think without that excess bulk weighing on my brain. For the life of me, I'll never understand people's obsession with extravagant headgear.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The sheer aetheric energy I feel exuding from the girl is nothing short of astounding. Could it be that cap was reining in her true power all this time?

dialogue.name: ALPHENE
dialogue.text: Welcome, friends. You come seeking news of the golems, yes? Would that I had any to give─I fear not a single one of the creatures has manifested itself before mine eyes.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: So you say, my good man, but it is possible that you do not see the trees for the forest? Sometimes that which we seek is right before us, and we need only attune our vision...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Why, is it just me, or do I spy a number of curious stone structures peeking out from the brush? Yes, I have an inkling that our foe may be hiding in plain sight.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But just how is one to distinguish living stone from the more ordinary type? Why, I do believe the former would take far less kindly to being scorched with a burst of hellsfire. So, the plan is clear, yes? Let's get blasting!

dialogue.name: ALPHENE
dialogue.text: If I understand the woman correctly, the golems have disguised themselves as ordinary stone─and she means to unmask them by haphazardly incinerating every rock in the woods. Well, I suppose 'tis as good a plan as any...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A curious structure of stone stands motionless before you...

dialogue.name: WOODWAILER02589
dialogue.text: There is a calmness in the air─yes, I do believe the danger has passed. I thank you, friend.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Is our friend quite well? I only saw her from afar, but it was as if the girl took some perverse pleasure in causing as much destruction as she could muster.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: That was fun, wasn't it? Now, while I'm not wont to repeat myself, it seems I should make an exception for the slower members of our band. You have the privilege of standing before the archmage Shatotto─or rather, a memory of the same which has awakened after years of slumber to rescue your realm from a fate most dire.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Slower...? Ahem! Lady Shatotto─if that is truly who you are─I cannot deny your arcane prowess. And yet there is much about this matter that does not sit well with me. Pray explain yourself, what is this dire fate of which you speak?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Oh dear, you really aren't very smart. Very well, I shall begin from the very─er, beginning. Dear me, did I almost rhyme? Who does that, anyway? Anyhow, the tale begins some two millennia ago, when the great civilization of Mhach was still in its infancy.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Our scholars ascertained that a mighty comet─awash with unspeakable aetherial energy─was on course to strike our fair home and reduce it to so much rubble. And so I thought to rectify the situation the only way I knew how─by blasting the foul rock out of the sky with the most powerful destructive magic our realm had ever seen.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: This, more than anything, was what spurred me to developing the art of black magic as it is known today. Needless to say, my plan was a remarkable success. A massive chunk of the comet was shattered, knocking it clear off its path and sending it spinning harmlessly off into the heavens.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: The story, however, does not end there. Fragments of the meteor hurtled to and embedded themselves in the earth. While small enough that their impact caused no significant damage, they remained beneath the surface, brimming with aetheric energies just waiting to be unearthed.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Needless to say, these otherworldly stones drew the attention of mages far and wide, who sought to claim their powers for their own. These are the stones that gave the golems their souls─by whose powers many a city–state flourished.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: And yet, these stones held yet further secrets. When two of them were brought together, they would call out to one another, aether reacting to aether to augment their mutual powers to still greater heights.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Mind you, the power of mere fragments─even in a heightened state─would be far too meager to be cause for concern. One threat, however, still lingered: what if the comet─the motherstone as it were─were to return, its circuitous orbit bringing it in shouting distance of our world once more? Would not its remnants─its children─summon it hither in all its destructive glory?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Preposterous! Did your vaunted black magic not knock the comet clear across the skies? Why, it is simply inconceivable that its new path would bring it around back in our direction.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Inconceivable to feebler minds, mayhap, but not my own. In fact, I posit that the comet is drawing nearer every moment─and it is for this very reason that the golems are now running amok.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: If left unattended, the implications for this world would be calamitous indeed. Fortunately, you have an ally in the impending battle─a prodigy who foresaw the danger that was to come, and sent her memory into the future that she might return to save the day.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Do you mean to say that you predicted that this threat would come─over two thousand years ago, mind you─and devised an incantation for the sole purpose of allowing you to return to us in our time of need?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: I do believe I've already said precisely that. Of course, I did not do it entirely on my own. The spell would have been lost to history if crazy old Ququruka hadn't dug it up when he did and recorded it for posterity.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Dear little Lalai and Forename also played their parts as well. Oh, how wonderful it is when one's followers─against their natural tendencies, perhaps─manage not to make an utter mess of things.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I must admit, the whole story still strikes me as a bit far-fetched. I mistrust neither your motives nor your skill, Lady Shatotto, but as a Hearer charged with the protection of this wood, I cannot leave this matter to you alone.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I will accompany you and offer what aid I can. But first, let us return to Ul'dah. I would hear more of the plan you propose before we take action.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Must you? Very well─just promise you will not get in our way. Now come along, my puppets─I have a realm to save, and you're going to help me.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: It does not appear the sorceress means us ill, but I still do not feel entirely safe in her presence. And whatever has she done with Lalai...?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: The Hearer assures me that there have been no golem uprisings elsewhere, and since he clearly is too thick to tell a convincing lie, I am inclined to believe him. This means that we still have time to form a plan of attack.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Ahem! I do pride myself on my honesty, and so I will be honest with you when I say this. Your art is─to put it kindly─not looked fondly upon in our day and age, and your story stretches the limits of believability.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: We cannot stave off this calamity alone, but any entreaties you might make are not like to find a receptive audience. I, on the other hand, have friends in positions of some prominence. I shall reach out to them and see what aid they are willing to offer.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: How charming─he actually thinks he might prove himself useful! In your spare time, might you not ask your astrologian friends if they have any recent calculations on the comet's path? I have no reason to doubt the accuracy of my own, of course, but I was working off two-millennia-old data.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...As you wish. Forgive me for being forward, but might I inquire as to the well-being of our mutual friend Lalai? She is still...in there somewhere, yes?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Oh, she most certainly is. Worry not, the girl's consciousness is just enjoying a short respite. Which reminds me, I really am due for a nap myself! Be a dear and do try not to let things go to hells in my absence, will you?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Shatotto...mother of the art that brought the great floods upon us. Has she truly returned to deliver us from doom?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The progenitor of our esteemed art has chosen me as her vessel in hopes of saving our world from a falling star? I can scarce imagine a greater honor. Come, Forename─we must put our minds together and figure out how we might best do her bidding.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...Wait, Lalai. If we take her words at face value, Shatotto has only the realm's best interests at heart. And yet I, for one, remain skeptical.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Which is not to say I doubt her intentions─or yours, for that matter. And yet, we speak of the founder of the very art which gave rise to the War of the Magi and the Sixth Umbral Calamity. Could it not be that even in seeking to save our realm, she is like as not to destroy it?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Blasphemy! Why, Lady Shatotto had long since passed when the war broke out! Only a blind, blustering half-wit would even think to hold her responsible for─though when I put it that way...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I...I understand this. And that is why I begrudge neither you nor her my aid, such as it will serve to protect the realm's peace. At the same time, I intend to keep close watch on her. One can never be too wary, after all...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: In any event, I will gather what knowledge I can of the threat we face, and I would be most grateful if you could do the same. Might I suggest speaking with your beastman allies─if the idea has not already occurred to you, that is.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I swear, that man's head is made of harder stone than any golem.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Still, at least he is cooperating with us, which is progress of some sort. In any event, I will reach out to our beastman friends. I encourage you to return to your studies in the meantime─if one thing is clear, it is that the task ahead will test us to our very limits.

quest.name: 破壊の責任
journal: Lalai has gleaned new knowledge that may serve you well.

While she waits for Shatotto to wake from her slumber, Lalai would gather further information regarding the falling star. A missive from 269th Order Mendicant Da Za in Revenant's Toll speaks of further golem sightings. Seek out your kobold friend, that you might gain whatever knowledge necessary to stave off attacks that might endanger your beastman friends.

A brief conversation with Da Za reveals that the particular golems rampaging in the area appear to be of Mhachi construction. Shatotto, who has once again assumed control of Lalai's consciousness, expresses her disbelief that constructs she herself played a part in creating could be behaving in such a manner, leading the ever-wary Zhai'a Nelhah to doubt her motivations. You set out for the Tangle, where the golems were last sighted, in hopes of finding further answers.

No sooner have you arrived in the Tangle than Shatotto senses a strong aetheric presence and promptly dashes off in pursuit. Zhai'a Nelhah follows her, meaning to keep an eye on the sorceress and golems both, while bidding you to survey the far side of the bog, to ensure that no menaces of living stone lie in wait.
Your foray to the southeastern reaches of the swamp proves uneventful. Return to the southwest, that you might see how your companions fared in their own scouting effort.

You arrive on the scene just in time to rescue the embattled Shatotto and Zhai'a Nelhah from the mindless wrath of a golem gone berserk. Shatotto, in particular, seems uncharacteristically shaken up by the ordeal. Tend to the sorceress and see that neither she nor her host Lalai has suffered grave injury.

Shatotto and Zhai'a Nelhah have at long last come to something of a mutual understanding, and all it took was staring certain death in the eye together on the field of battle. The conversation turns to the subject of Lalai, and Shatotto chastises the stodgy Hearer for his pathetically hopeless understanding of the fairer sex, causing him to flee from the scene a blithering mess. Shatotto also takes her leave, sensing that she is about to fall back into slumber, and bids you return to Ul'dah to consult with Lalai when she wakes.

Lalai welcomes you back to Ul'dah and explains that Shatotto has once again returned to rest, though not before sharing her plans for the next stage of your mission: to wit, she would venture further afield to fend off any potential golem rampages at the pass. Lalai encourages you to continue your studies with due diligence. Though you know not when the call will come, come it will, and Shatotto will be ill pleased if you are not up to the task.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with 269th Order Mendicant Da Za near Revenant's Toll.
Join Shatotto in the Tangle.
Survey the area from a suitable vantage point.
Make your way to the southwestern edge of the Tangle.
Aid Shatotto.
Speak with Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I trust you have not been shirking your studies? Mistress Shatotto expects much of us, and I would not disappoint her.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: For my own part, I have called out to her intently time and again within my mind in hopes of conveying any and all knowledge that might avail in staving off this impending disaster. Though she does not respond, I have the distinct sensation that she is listening...in some way or another.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Doubtless she will return when she sees fit, but in the meanwhile we can ill afford to bide our time. And so, I have taken Zhai'a Nelhah's advice─I can just see the smug grin on his face as I say that─and reached out to our friends.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Not moments ago, a postmoogle came by with a missive from our friend Da Za of the 269th Order. As luck would have it, it seems he has knowledge that might serve us well─to wit, reports of recent sightings of rampaging golems.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I would ask you to go on ahead and see what he knows. I will call for that holier-than-thou Hearer and join you shortly. Not that I am enamored of his company─far from it─but his insights have proven to be not altogether useless on occasion.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: If only he were not so unbearably smug, the man might almost be─ah! Were you not headed to Revenant's Toll to meet our friend Da Za? We are not exactly suffering from an overabundance of time, Forename.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Forename! It has been eons─eras, ages, eons! I have heard that the spirit of the legendary Shatotto comes alive again inside Lalai, but could this wondrous tale possibly be true!?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: It is indeed, friend Da Za. She is a capricious type, though, and wakes only when she has a mind to─a fact that I have explained some seven hundred times to this mutton-headed Hearer, who still insists beyond all reason that I should be able to summon her at will.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You do me discredit, Lalai. I merely suggested that if there were some means by which we could summon Shatotto at our own convenience─rather than waiting for her to come forth of her own accord─it might serve us in facing the dangers ahead.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Summon her? You speak of the illustrious founder of my art as if she were a mere serving girl! You will watch your tongue in the presence of your betters, Zhai'a Nelhah, lest...unggghhhhhh!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I meant no disrespect. I do not deny the power of your art, nor the good it can do in the right hands. I am simply...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...Too stubborn and stupid to fully accept it? Oh well, I suppose none of us are perfect─myself excluded, of course. 269th Order Mendicant Da Za, I presume! Tell me all you have seen or heard about this rampaging golem.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Are my eyes to be believed─trusted, sworn by, believed!? Is this truly the great Shatotto who stands before my eyes? Yes, yes, it must be!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I...I mean, but of course, my lady! Yes, yes, Da Za will tell all he knows! I saw a strange golem─odd, curious, strange─wandering in the Tangle. And that is not all! It was no ordinary golem─no, no─but rather the same one I saw in a tome handed down from my forebear Da Gu! A golem of ancient Mhach!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: One of my own creations? Why, that is simply inconceivable! I designed them to be utterly rampage-proof, and left copious instructions to ensure that my loyal apprentices─and their apprentices, and so on and so forth─would see they stay that way.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Mayhap your followers were not so diligent in carrying out your orders after your passing? We all know of the chaos and destruction wreaked by Mhachi sorcerers during the War of the Magi. I suspect that poring over age-old documents on the upkeep of golems was the least of their concerns.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Forgive me my doubts, Lady Shatotto, but you seem quite partial to your creations...and your countrymen. If we were to find ourselves locked in combat with a golem of Mhach, do I have your assurance you would not hesitate to strike down our foe?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: You do not trust me─trust us─this I know. I am not deaf to Lalai's ceaseless grumblings. So be it. You cannot help being a simpleton, no more than I can help being the greatest intellect of any era.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: That old coot Ququruka told me what became of Mhachi after my passing when he communed with me a century ago. Do you think I deny the senseless destruction caused by my descendants─with the art I myself wrought, no less? Of course not. For I, unlike some of my present companions, am not a bloody fool.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But even a fool must understand that a tool is only as good or evil as she who would wield it. So answer me this─what could I possibly stand to gain from standing idly by as my own creations wreak havoc on the realm I once called home?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I will grant that there is some sense in what you say. In any event, we thank you for your assistance, Da Za. Rest assured that we shall see to the rogue golems before any harm befalls you and yours. To the Tangle!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Does that overdweller never lighten up? It must be so tiring living each day carrying around a brain of solid stone—burdensome, wearisome, tiring.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: You can say that again, my synonym-abusing friend. Forename. You know the man better than I─and for that, I pity you. Is there nothing we can do to buy ourselves a moment's respite from his inane quibbling? Whatever do you suppose is bothering his puny mind?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He is simply in awe of your power.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Mayhap he worries for Lalai?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, who could blame him? I suppose in some sense I should consider myself fortunate that I did not send him scurrying away with his tail between his legs the moment I first revealed my powers.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Yes, I have observed this as well... Smaller minds are quick to burden themselves with hand-wringing concern for the well-being of others. As if it were not evident that the girl is more than capable of taking care of herself!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: In either event, if he insists on tagging along with us, I suppose it would not hurt to win him over─if only so he does not foul things up at the worst possible time.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Anyhow, I do believe we have some golems to smite into oblivion. The Tangle, was it? I'll see you there─and do try not to get lost on the way.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: This Shatotto is full of mysteries, but one baffles me the most─just what is it about Lalai's cap that she finds so disagreeable? Was there no custom of wearing headgear in her age?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: These lands were far more dry and agreeable in my day. But I suppose much can change in two millennia─especially without me around to keep things in order.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But this is no time to get caught up in nostalgia─we have golems to smash! And search for. Not necessarily in that order, I suppose. Yes, I can sense particularly strong aetheric energies coming from...that direction!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I will accompany Shatotto to ensure that she remains focused on the task at hand. Might you survey the area south of here? These environs afford our foe no end of hiding spots, and I am ill inclined to walk into an ambush.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: While I appreciate the support, friend, I assure you I am quite capable of taking care of myself. Might you investigate to the east of here, as we agreed upon?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Come out, come out, my little minions! It's your old mistress, Shatotto!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You look far and wide, but can discern no sign of golems, rampaging or otherwise. Return to the southwestern reaches of the Tangle and see how Shatotto and Zhai'a Nelhah fare in their search.

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: The ancient golem lumbers toward you!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Ungh... If only this body were my own... I would have razed that oversized block of stone...to the ground...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: I suppose I should thank you for coming to my aid. Had I lost consciousness in the midst of battle, I would certainly have been done for...and poor Lalai with me.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: No, Lady Shatotto. It is I who owe you a debt of gratitude. Had you not drawn the creature's initial strike, I would surely have met an inglorious end. But that is not the least of my failings...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: It is my fault─and mine alone─that we were caught unawares. Though it shames me to say so, my eyes were on you when they should have been watching out for our enemy.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Who is this sorceress who wields such frightful power? Does she truly mean to save our realm─or will she destroy it? These thoughts continued to haunt me...but no more. Seeing you risk your life for me─a humble Hearer you have only just met─I say this with no reservations. You are a paragon of virtue, and a model to all mages, white or black.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Why, I do believe those are the most intelligent words I've heard you utter yet. Keep talking like that, and I might yet learn to tolerate your presence.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But if you think that means I'm going to give you your precious Lalai back, you'd best think again! We still have a falling star to fend off, do we not?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: My...precious Lalai? I have not the slightest idea what you might be implying.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: You wouldn't, would you...? Ahem. Was it not your grand dream to see the white and the black─the arts of healing and destruction─united for the common good? So says Lalai, at the very least. Is the girl not an invaluable piece to the future you would realize?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: This is all well and true, but...“invaluable” and “precious” have different connotations! M-Mayhap not in your time, but the meanings of words evolve over time, you see, and...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Ahem! What I am saying is, of course Lalai is a friend and ally, but the same could be said of Forename here, and... Wh-Which is not to say I do not want to see her again, of course─only that...oh, never mind.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: At any rate, I do believe we've done all we can here. Lady Shatotto, please forgive me for having doubted you. Henceforth, I promise that I will aid you in whatever way I can. And with that, I do believe I must be off...er, somewhere.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: One last thing, if I may, Lady Shatotto. While you are awake and speaking with us, what becomes of Lalai's consciousness? That is to say, is she still in there...listening?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: What a curious question. She is slumbering in the recesses of her mind, much as I am when she is awake. But to answer your question: no, she is not listening─though we do have some rather stimulating conversations from time to time. If you'd like, I can share the details...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: N-No! I mean, never mind! I really must be getting off to─right! That place I was going.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Are all men in this era so odd?What a curious man. At any rate, I feel my consciousness beginning to wane. Lalai will be waking from slumber ere long, and I would return to Ul'dah before she does. I suggest you do the same—your friend has much she wishes to discuss with you.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. As you might have surmised, it is I, Lalai. Mistress Shatotto returned to her repose not moments ago.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Before drifting off to slumber, she imparted to me some details regarding what she sees as the next phase of our task. To wit, she would have us venture further afield to investigate any golem menaces that might be stirring out of eyeshot.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Speaking of menaces, whatever became of that stone-headed Hearer? I suppose it is too much to hope that Mistress Shatotto finally set his robes alight?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: He has come to respect Lady Shatotto.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: He seems to have...feelings...for you.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I daresay it took him long enough. Still, we cannot hold the man's ignorance against him─not all of us are blessed with burgeoning intellects.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I...I will assume I misheard you, Forename. On the off chance I did not, pray inform the man that he had best not act upon these feelings in my presence, lest I feel like scorching his precious flowing locks from his scalp!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Anyhow, I trust you will keep me informed if our Hearer friend exhibits any more impertinent behavior. I will think of suitable retribution─I daresay putting him to sleep and hiding his glasses would send a clear message, and be rather amusing no less.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: In any event, I should return to my research─as should you. Shatotto will doubtless call upon us before long, and our powers must be primed for the occasion.

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ

quest.name: 魔石は求める
journal: Lalai would seek your aid in doing Shatotto's bidding.

Lalai has been in close communication with Shatotto, who is ready to commence the final stage of her plan. That said, even the ever-confident mother of black magic would not go at it alone. And so it is that you and Lalai set out for Burgundy Falls in the hopes of conferring with your beastman allies.

No sooner have your allies given you a warm welcome than you are joined once more by the reawakened memory of Shatotto, who shares her latest insights into the golem menace. It would appear that the greatest threat is posed not by the man-made creatures that you have faced thus far, but rather self-animated monstrosities formed of materials attracted by the burgeoning aetheric power of the gemstones. In hopes of assessing the true nature of the threat, the Hearer Zhai'a Nelhah sets out in one direction in the company of the beastman trio, entrusting you and Shatotto to look into troubling reports from the village of Ala Gannha.
You arrive in Ala Gannha to find no sign of the animated monstrosities you seek. At Shatotto's suggestion, you split up to cover more ground and properly survey the surrounding wilderness.

Your search bears fruit, as you come to discover─and promptly dispatch─two golems made of wood that would seem to prove Shatotto's hypothesis. Venture back to the east and see how the sorceress fares.

You find Shatotto standing over the crumpled forms of two golems who were unfortunate enough to have crossed her path. She congratulates you on your own efforts, then shares a troubling sight she witnessed. As she tells it, the golems are turning upon each other, as if driven by an animal instinct to seek greater and greater power. Your conversation is interrupted by a linkpearl transmission from Zhai'a Nelhah, who claims to have witnessed a still more fearsome sight─a veritable legion of golems assembling in Dravania for purposes unknown. As Shatotto and the Hearer make for the Observatorium to see what has been learned of the comet, you set off on a return path to Burgundy Falls, that you and your beastman friends might discuss your next course of action.

Putting together all the knowledge at your disposal, Shatotto is able to reason out the golems' ultimate goal: they converge as one upon Sohm Al in hopes of summoning the ultimate source of power─the calamitous comet Shatotto blasted out of the heavens some two thousand years ago─back to Eorzea, where they would feast upon its aether. In the face of certain doom, Shatotto reveals her master plan: put simply, you will wait for the golems to cannibalize each other time and again until but a single golem remains. You will then confront this creation─the mother of all golems, as it were─and blast it to tiny fragments with the power of your black magic. For whatever it is worth, Shatotto and Zhai'a Nelhah appear to have the utmost confidence in your ability to succeed in this daunting task. As Shatotto prepares to return to slumber in anticipation of the final confrontation, you, too, make for Ul'dah, that you might speak with Lalai one last time before resuming your studies.

You return to the Sacrarium to find Lalai having regained her consciousness, with a message from Shatotto instructing you to ready yourself well for the battle to come. You take your leave, determined to master the art of destruction to levels heretofore scarcely fathomed.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Lalai at Burgundy Falls.
Rendezvous with Shatotto at Ala Gannha.
Survey the area and slay any golems that appear.
Report to Shatotto.
Speak with Kazagg Chah at Burgundy Falls.
Speak with Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename. The moment you entered the room, I could feel the air crackling with aetheric energy. Excellent─your diligence in your training will surely serve us well.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: And you come at a perfect time. Not moments before you arrived, Shatotto's voice called out to me from the recesses of my consciousness. She would have us begin to lay the groundwork for the final stage of her plan.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: As she made it quite clear that we will require all the aid we can muster, I have taken the liberty of reaching out to our beastman friends. They have convened at Kazagg Chah's residence at Burgundy Falls, where they await our arrival. Let us not keep them waiting.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: To not merely foresee a falling star some two thousand years hence, but project one's own memory into the future to forestall it? Truly, the powers of Mistress Shatotto are beyond the comprehension of our ordinary minds...

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! Great honor! Tremendous honor! Trembling with excitement and awe, Dozol is!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Was Da Za the first beastman to speak with Lady Shatotto? Yes, yes, surely he was! Da Za is Shatotto's favorite─her chosen, her prized one, her favorite!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
