dialogue.text: I am not privy to the finer points of Lady Shatotto's plan, but I am prepared to assist in any way I can.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...My friends. Thank you for coming together on such short notice. Mistress Shatotto would have you know that she is most grateful for your cooperation. In fact, I do believe she would rather speak to you─unnnggghhh!─directly...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, it would seem the gang's all here. I daresay it's time we got this proverbial show on the road. Hearer! Tell me that you've made yourself useful since I last saw your vapid face!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Aye, Lady Shatotto. According to my colleagues in the Eorzean Alliance, patrols have sighted an increasing number of rampant golems afield. Fortunately, none have posed a significant threat─at least not as of yet.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Which brings us to the matter of the comet. A colleague of mine at the Observatorium has confirmed that it draws nearer with each passing hour. Though there is no immediate danger of a collision if it stays on its present course─

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...It is too close for comfort, yes. Fortunately, I─as is my wont─have a plan. I simply hope that you, my friends, are up to the task.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: If the Hearer speaks true, the golems that have been causing trouble near the city–states have been more bark than bite─felled with no great difficulty by middling soldiers. From this, I surmise that the gems set within them─their soulstones─have been small and of meager power at best.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: And yet if my theory holds, a more sinister threat lurks in the realm's far reaches, far from the prodding eyes of Eorzean and beastman alike. This is where we must go.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! Perplexed, Dozol is. Profoundly, deeply perplexed. By people─to do the work of people─are golems created. To travel so far from their masters' domain, these constructs have no reason. True, is this not?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, I'll be─a passably astute observation! But I fear your knowledge is lacking, my squawking friend. Golems come in all shapes and forms, and not all are wrought by the hand of a mortal creator.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Often a gem of sufficient aetheric power will attract all manner of matter─plant, mineral, and animal alike─spontaneously animating it and giving rise to new life. With naught to guide them, these feral golems rove and wander at will. It is these unpredictable specimens that pose the greatest danger.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The larger the gem that serves as their soulstone, the greater their power─and the greater the threat when the comet draws nigh. It would appear our task is clear.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Let us split up and hunt down these abominations. I shall join our beastman friends and make for the west. I will leave the eastern reaches to the two of you─I trust you will be able to fend for yourselves.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: There is one matter in particular I would ask you to investigate. My friends at the Alliance conveyed to me a most curious report, which Lady Shatotto's words just now put in a rather different light.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Over in Gyr Abania─in the hamlet of Ala Gannha─villagers have claimed sightings of, in their words, trees that walk like men. These have gone entirely uninvestigated, written off as the delusions and fantasies of superstitious commonfolk, but if Lady Shatotto speaks true─

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...Which I do, they are golems beyond the slimmest shadow of a doubt. Worry not, for Forename and I will uproot them and reduce every last leaf and strip of bark to smoldering ash. Won't we, Forename?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I will leave the particulars regarding the means of destruction to the experts. I have, however, procured a linkpearl that we might better coordinate our efforts. Pray take it with you.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: And with that, I do believe we are as prepared as we could hope to be. Let us be off, my friends! And remember: should aught go amiss, I am but a linkpearl call away.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: A device to allow that pretentious pudding-head to talk to me even if I'm a hundred malms away? Far be it from me to scoff at technological progress, but some inventions really could have been done without.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: How interesting. While Mhach has devolved into a vermin-infested bog, Gyr Abania is─if anything─looking more lively than I remember it. Not that that's saying much, of course.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But look at me, getting all nostalgic for no reason. After all, my body has long since returned to the dust, and soon even my memory will fade...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But before that, we have a job to do, don't we? I can sense no unusual aetheric presence here, so let us venture a bit further into the field. Come along now, Forename!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Thank you, but worry not─I have this area entirely under control. Be a dear and head to the west of Ala Gannha to root out any stragglers, won't you?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Did you come upon any wood golems, Forename? As you can see, these two had the misfortune of coming upon little old me. But that is not all I saw. Yes, it was a most remarkable─and most horrifying─sight...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: After I delivered a mortal wound to one of the creatures, I saw it extend a gnarled limb, and─with the last onze of its strength─try to rip the soulstone from its cohort's chest.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Yes, it would seem these feral golems have no qualms about cannibalizing each other...which has led me to a quite frightening conclusion. To wit─

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Oh, of all the─whatever could that four-eyed fool want at a time like this!?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, if you have something to report, make it qui─what!?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Yes, it would be wise for you to make a discreet retreat. We will do the same─I would reevaluate our options in light of these most troubling developments.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...Very well. I will join you at the Observatorium shortly. Do gather all the information you can from your colleagues before I arrive.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Gods be good, that Hearer's actually proven himself useful. It would seem he came upon a most startling scene in the hinterlands─a mass influx of golems of all shapes and sizes, as if summoned from all reaches of the realm by some unholy force.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: I have my own theory as to what this means, but I require more knowledge before plotting our next step. One thing I can say is that we should immediately begin preparing for the worst.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: In any event, we must move, and quickly. You return to Burgundy Falls and apprise the beastmen of where we stand. I shall go on ahead to the Observatorium and see what knowledge the astrologians have gleaned, and join you as soon as I am able.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! So many golems, Dozol has never seen! In a flutter are Dozol's feathers. Squaaawk! Squaaawk!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Perhaps the golems are having a feast─a banquet, a revel, a feast! Though feasting on what, I would rather not speculate. No, no, not thinking.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Friends, comrades, brothers and sisters of the black. We stand at the brink of a disaster most dire. Even as we speak, our foe grows in number. Beings of sentient stone and wood gather, summoned by an unknown force, and united for a common purpose─a purpose beyond our understanding...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: (-Shatotto-)Beyond your understanding, perhaps, but not mine. The golems make for Sohm Al!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: In Gyr Abania, I witnessed a most unsettling sight. A golem, with an almost animal fury, tearing into its cohort's chest. Disturbing as it was, it was all too clear what I was witnessing. The creature sought a stronger soulstone, that it might augment its strength and prolong its own existence.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: But the power these creatures seek is not limited to that which they can harvest from their own kind. No, they are forever in search of a more potent aetheric source─and they have finally found one.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: The astrologians at the Observatorium have confirmed my worst fears. The baleful star of our past slowly but inexorably changes course, bringing it closer and closer to this star.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: It is as Lady Shatotto says. The golems call out to it, beckoning it ever closer. According to the latest calculations, any further adjustments to its path and it is all but certain to strike Eorzea head-on.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: The baleful creatures would climb the highest peak in the land, and summon their motherstone to bring disaster to our realm!? Inconceivable!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: And yet it is just so, my friend. Unless we destroy the lot of them, a collision is all but inevitable. And yet there are simply too many─even if we could thin their ranks, they would regrow themselves and regroup in no time.

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: So we are done for─doomed, defeated, done for!?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Do not give up hope, my frenetic friend. Or do you forget that the most brilliant mind to ever walk the face of Eorzea stands with you? Allow me to propose a foolproof plan: we do absolutely nothing at all!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...For now, that is. We know that the golems are feeding on each other in pursuit of greater and greater power. So why not sit back and let this process of unnatural selection take its course, till we are left with but a single foe?

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squawwwk! Out of her mind, Shatotto is! Were that to happen, a creature of untold power and puissance that golem would be!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Quite so. It would be the mother of all automata─the golem equivalent of yours truly, if you will─and by definition one of the most formidable foes our realm has seen. Fortunately, I do believe there is one among us who might stand half a chance against such a monstrosity.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...Forename. Lady Shatotto insists that you hold─nay, you are the key to this entire operation. I am not inclined to doubt her, but I would hear it from your own lips. Can you say with all certainty that you would emerge victorious over this hypothetical golem of mythical proportions?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Can you do this?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend. Your courage inspires me. Pray let me offer my strength, that together we may secure the future of our realm.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I thank you for your honesty, my friend. To tell the truth, I have my doubts as well. And yet, if we stand united, I believe that victory is well within our grasp. Pray let me offer my strength, that together we may secure the future of our realm.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: I doubt Forename and I will have much need of your services, but do feel free to tag along.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: It would be my honor. And with that, I should take my leave. I must warn the people of the nearby settlements to keep a wide berth of the great peak. Mayhap I will even have occasion to smash a golem or two on my journey!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Color me impressed, Forename. Your friends are proving more reliable by the minute. And with that, I should return to the Sacrarium, for my grip on consciousness grows more tenuous by the moment... Pray return when you can, and speak with Lalai upon her awakening.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squaaawk! A crazy plan, Shatotto devises. But just crazy enough to work, it may be!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: We'll blast that golem into dust—ashes, powder, dust! Yes, yes, we will! But just between two of us, I wonder...just how big do you think it will be?

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: You are ever our hope, a shining light against the baleful star that bears down upon us. Ever am I honored to call you friend.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I have called out to Shatotto, but to no avail. No doubt she is deep in slumber, gathering her strength for the battle to come.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: She did, however, leave a message for you. “Slack not in your training, my puppet of destruction, for your powers will be tested as never before.” That is not ominous in the least, now is it? In any event, I trust you will be up to the task.

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ
メンディカント269 ダ・ザ
記憶より託されし未来

quest.name: 記憶より託されし未来
journal: Lalai is steeling herself for the final confrontation.

The enemy gathers, and the time for the final confrontation draws nigh. Confident that you have primed your powers to the fullest, Lalai bids you join her─which is to say Shatotto─the Hearer Zhai'a Nelhah, and your beastman friends before the entrance to Anyx Trine. Prepare as you must and be on your way.

At Anyx Trine, Shatotto─who has once again roused herself from slumber─briefs you on the plan of attack. Before doing battle on the sacred peak of Sohm Al, however, Zhai'a Nelhah would have you seek the blessing of the dragons who call this place home. Shatotto consents to the proposal, and you set off to seek a word with your old friend Vidofnir.

You are relieved to hear that Vidofnir, too, did sense the golem menace, and has no objection with your proposed course of action. Shatotto, for her part, is eager that the dragons will not stand in the way of the destruction she hopes to wreak. As your beastman friends deal with the straggling golems attempting to scale the mountains, you prepare to scale the peak with the sorceress and Zhai'a Nelhah to do battle with the abomination that awaits you.
The mother of all golems is no more, and the comet that threatened to reduce the realm to rubble has sailed safely off to the heavens, with any fortune never to return.

Shatotto congratulates you on your efforts, declaring you a worthy heir to her legacy─and the legacy of black magic itself─before her memory fades away. Lalai offers her own words of praise, before promptly getting into another tiff with her eternal nemesis Zhai'a Nelhah. Leaving the Hearer behind to reflect upon matters of etiquette, you and Lalai set off to share tidings of your triumph with your beastman friends.

The beastmen rejoice upon hearing of your victory, and celebrate a triumphant day in the annals of black magic before taking their leave, proud to have reaffirmed your mutual friendship. Even Lalai and Zhai'a Nelhah come to a grudging but strong mutual acceptance─as the black mage thanks the Hearer for his efforts, and the Hearer promises to work for a day where practitioners of the black arts need no longer toil in the shadows. After Zhai'a cordially departs, Lalai invites you back to the Sacrarium to reflect upon the events of the day.

Reflecting on the Hearer's parting words, Lalai has made a resolution. She vows to follow the lead of Master Ququruka, putting every detail of your adventures together to paper in hopes that one day, the duties of your illustrious forebear and her friends will be known to the realm at large. Expressing her deep admiration for your profound mastery of the dark arts, she flashes a rare smile, deeply moved to have found another important calling in her life.

※The next black mage quest will be available from Lalai once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “A Tearful Reunion.”
objectives: Join Shatotto at Anyx Trine.
Speak with Vidofnir.
Speak with Shatotto.
Speak with Kazagg Chah.
Speak with Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.
Defeat the gemstone golem.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename. I trust you have prepared yourself well. Our foe musters at Anyx Trine. The hour of our final confrontation is nigh.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: The Hearer and our beastman friends are en route to the forelands as we speak, and I would join them with all haste. Come as soon as you are able─Shatotto will be awaiting your arrival.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Deep in the mountains, the golems feed on each other with brutal savagery even as we speak, their thirst for power nigh unquenchable.

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: To fell the feral golems and cast away the baleful star from the sky, whatever strength I can summon from within me is yours.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squawwwk! N-Not with fear do Dozol's limbs shake, but with passion and exhilaration for the battle to come! G-Great passion. Tremendous passion!

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: The golem will not grow too large, will it? I prefer foes to be more compact like myself─tiny, puny, compact.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Why, thank you so very much, Lalai. What with my own corporeal form having long since faded to dust, it is an honor and a pleasure to see my legacy carried on by women, men, and beastmen after my own─oops, was I just speaking aloud?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: You can stop gawking any time now. Or have you forgotten that we have an army of power-hungry golems bent on destroying our realm to dispose of? Fortunately, I have already formulated the perfect plan of attack. You three will see to the stragglers still attempting to scale the mountain. I trust you can handle that much?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: The Hearer, Forename, and myself will scale the summit, where the oversized, augmented agglomeration of golems surely awaits us.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: If I may be so bold, Lady Shatotto, I would proffer a small amendment to this plan. Sohm Al, as you surely know, is a holy place to all the dragons who call this land home─I am ill inclined to wage battle without first obtaining their blessing.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer has told me that Forename has a friend among their kind. Mayhap it would be best if shehe sought the counsel of this Vidofnir before we proceed.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: I can't believe I'm saying this, but that's hardly the worst idea I've heard today! After all, it could hardly hurt to add another powerful ally to our ranks. What are we waiting for, then? Lead the way!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: A master of the dark arts and a confidant of dragons? You never cease to surprise me, friend.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: It's a good thing we have you to preemptively clear up any potential misunderstandings. While I'm confident in my ability to eradicate any foe, incinerating an entire dragon would leave an awful mess.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: An unholy menace doth gather in our midst, threatening to summon doom from the heavens down upon this realm─such is thy plight?

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: I, too, did sense the presence of an intruder in our sacred home. At first, I was content to observe, but the danger hath grown too great.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: ...Warrior of warriors. If thou and thine would take up arms against our common foe, thou dost have my blessing.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, that's a ringing endorsement if I've ever heard one! Hearer─send word to our beastman friends: we commence the operation at once!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: There's no time to lose, Forename. Let's make for the summit and dispose of the abomination that awaits us before the comet gets too close for comfort!

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: Warrior of warriors...I leave the removal of the intruder in thy capable hands.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...Understood. Pray leave the rest to us.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Lady Shatotto. My colleague from the Observatorium has confirmed your suspicions. On its current path, the falling star will sail wide of us─if by the slimmest of margins. And yet that path shifts with every second, bringing us slowly but inexorably to the brink of calamity.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Call it a hunch, but I do believe this imposing fellow might be responsible.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, I'm glad to see that the obvious hasn't escaped you. At any rate, our task is clear: we need only reduce him to dust before he can summon his dear mother any closer.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, Forename? Are you ready to stand alongside the greatest mage to ever live in a battle for the very future of your world? Look sharp─this is our time to shine!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Victory is ours. I only pray it does not come too late.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Perhaps if you had some black magic in your repertoire...but it is no matter. I have the utmost faith that Forename and my efforts were not in vain.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: That light! The Twelve have mercy...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Here it comes...and there it goes! And with that, my friends, I do believe we've been spared a most crushing fate.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Stand tall, Forename─you and I just saved the world. And I suppose I should thank you as well, Hearer, for doing a most remarkable job of not mucking everything up.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: And with that, I believe my work here is done. While I'd love nothing more than to stay and savor our victory a bit longer, all good things must come to an end...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Don't look all sad, now. With such promising protégés to carry on my legacy, I can go to rest knowing that I did not mother the art of destruction in vain.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: You have seen our art wielded for the greatest of good and the worst of evil. Having witnessed firsthand your prowess and the sheer strength of your resolve, I gladly leave the future of our art in your hands. Walk the path well, Forename of the black...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: ...That millennia from now, when we have long since faded to a dim memory, those who follow in our footsteps may yet wield their prodigious powers against any who would bring harm to our fair realm.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Be proud, Forename. Having shared a mind with Mistress Shatotto all this time, I can assure you that effusive praise does not come easily to her lips. I can still scarcely believe she did me the honor of choosing my body as a vessel...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Before meeting her in the flesh─in a manner of speaking─I had assumed Death's Handmaiden was little more than a witch obsessed with fire and destruction. It would seem my impression may have been in error.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: May have been? Does your prudish, pigheaded prejudice know no end!?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Hmph! As charming as ever, I see. I daresay you could learn a thing or two from your esteemed forebear on how to treat a gentleman!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Oh, is that so!? Forename! If you happen to see any gentlemen around these parts, do let me knowI do believe I treat true gentlemen just fine─as Forename here would know.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: At any rate, we are done here. Let us leave this uncultured boor here to reflect for a bit on how to treat a lady.

dialogue.name: VIDOFNIR
dialogue.text: The presence hath lifted─the unholy intruder defiles these sacred grounds no more. Thou hast served us well, child of man.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Our beastman allies await us at Anyx Trine. We must share word of our triumph without delay.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I know not if our beastman friends saw the comet cross the sky, but they are doubtless eager to hear tidings of our final battle. Let us go and set their minds at ease.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squawwwk! Return from battle, Dozol's friends do! Safe from harm, you are?

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: I saw the comet sailing through the sky─hurtling, shooting, sailing! You are safe, yes? Yes, yes, you are!

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: Many golems did come to scale the peak, but they come no more─laid low by our magicks. The heavens, too, are calm─I trust your battle with the great beast ended in victory?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Just so, my friend. Not to boast, but even Lady Shatotto was most impressed with our efforts. Is that not so, Forename?

dialogue.name: DAZA
dialogue.text: Three cheers for Shatotto! Three cheers for Forename! Three cheers for the art of destruction! Huzzah, huzzah, huzzah!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Far be it from me to rain on your parade, but let us not forget that the healer in your ranks played at least a small part in your victory.

dialogue.name: DOZOLMELOC
dialogue.text: Squawwwk! A happy day, this is! Fly home to share the joy with his brothers and sisters, Dozol will! You will visit Dozol again to share magical learnings, yes? Till then, friend!

dialogue.name: KAZAGGCHAH
dialogue.text: I, too, must take my leave. But know that even when we are apart, we always stand as one. Till next we meet, my friend.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I, too, must return to Gridania to deliver my official report. I suppose this is farewell, at least for now.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Well, don't let us keep you. Though...ah, I was wondering if I might express my gratitude to your colleagues at the Observatorium. On behalf of Mistress Shatotto, that is...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Leave that to me. I fear not all of my friends are so open-minded─if they were to learn that I had allied myself with beastmen and practitioners of the dark arts, there is no telling what sort of twisted rumors might spread...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Fear not, Lalai. You have my word that as Hearer and healer, I will do aught I can to work toward a day when you and your fellows can stand proud and receive credit for all the good you have done.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I could not bear to say this in his presence, but our Hearer friend has come quite far, wouldn't you say? I, too, would do everything in my power to make that day a reality.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: And with that, I do believe our job here is done. Shall we return to the Sacrarium?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Once again, I must express my gratitude for all you have done, as well as my profound respect─you have mastered our art to a degree that few of us ever attain.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: While it is not like me to dwell on such matters, I was just reflecting on the Hearer's words. Once again, the truth of the battle we waged will never be known to those we fought to save.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Needless to say, we do not do what we do for accolades or glory. We do it because it must be done─and to sate our own intellectual curiosity. And yet, it does not sit well with me...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: No, I cannot just turn a blind eye while the deeds of my friends and mentors are swallowed by history, never again to see the light.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: When the day will come that we can emerge from the shadows, I cannot say. But for that day─and for the eyes of all who would follow in our footsteps─I would put all I have seen to paper, just as Master Ququruka once did.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: All we have learned of our realm and the arcane, of course─but that is not all. I would write of the bravery of our beastman friends, of a stubborn and self-important Hearer who against all odds proved himself a friend...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Most of all, I would write of the illustrious founder of our glorious art, and the adventurer who she would personally entrust with carrying on her legacy. Why, I daresay the chapter will write itself!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the black mage quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “A Tearful Reunion.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next black mage quest will be available from Lalai.

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Well, aren't you a big boy...? All right, I'll draw him to us─let's cut him down to size!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Be strong, my friends! My magicks will salve your wounds.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: What's this...!? Look out, my friends! Something comes from above!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: A fragment of the comet!? Whatever is happening here!?

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: It's absorbing aether from the fragment! Come back here, you oversized brute!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Brace yourself, my friends! Again, it comes!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Quickly, now! We must destroy it before our foe can reap its powers!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Again!? I swear, if I never see another of these stones for the rest of my days...

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, yes... Less talking and more destroying, I say!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Don't just stand there and gape! Destroy the stone before our foe can absorb its power!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: The golem's strength grows!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Drat! It would seem our foe has drunk its fill. This doesn't bode well for us...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: We can ill afford to allow this monstrosity to sate its hunger any further!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: Another fragment!? Let us blast it from our sight with all speed!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Our foe drinks once more! We must not allow it to absorb any more aether!

dialogue.name: SHATOTTO
dialogue.text: The body grows weak...and the mind must...rest...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Forgive me, my friends...! I have...failed you...

obj.n: メンディカント269 ダ・ザ
メンディカント269 ダ・ザ
セブンスヘルチェスト【ILv290】
ラライの一念、岩をも通せ

quest.name: 時を超えし使者
journal: Y'mhitra has the most fascinating news for you.
Y'mhitra has had word from Saint Coinach's Find that the archaeologists have unearthed an Allagan tome on summoning magicks. Make your way to the camp in Mor Dhona and speak with Rammbroes.

Rammbroes immediately places the ancient book in your hands, declaring that he was able to decipher little more than the fact that it contained the wisdom of Allagan summoners. He bids you take the tome to Y'mhitra in Revenant's Toll, and allow the scholar to peruse its pages.

Y'mhitra carefully cracks open the tome's covers, and the both of you are caught off guard as the book suddenly jumps from her hands and introduces itself as “Principia.” According to the animate familiar, it was created as an instruction manual for promising summoners, but can only share its higher knowledge once the student in question has completed three formidable challenges. The first of these challenges is to be a test of power. Follow Y'mhitra out into the wilds of north Silvertear, and ask Principia to call forth your monstrous opponent.
You have defeated the demon of the tome. Share your victory with the nearby Y'mhitra.

It appears your victory over the tome's demon was more than satisfactory, but despite its glowing praise, “Prin” gives the impression that your technique is far from perfect. Amazed at this evaluation and intrigued by the tale of the familiar's creation, Y'mhitra seems lost in contemplation of the past. Return to Gridania, and rejoin the scholar at Apkallu Falls.

Y'mhitra praises you on your triumph once more, and speaks eagerly of revealing the lost knowledge hidden within the tome. Before you can attempt Prin's next challenge, however, it seems you will need to work on perfecting your technique.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Rammbroes at Saint Coinach's Find.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Principia in north Silvertear and complete the first challenge.
Speak with Y'mhitra in north Silvertear.
Speak with Y'mhitra in Gridania.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename, I've had the most fascinating news. 'Twould seem that the ruins of ancient Allag have yielded to us a tome containing unknown secrets of the summoner's art.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The tome in question is currently being kept under Rammbroes's watchful gaze at our dig site in Mor Dhona. I'll be heading there shortly myself, but I would not begrudge you an earlier peek!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Still here? I'd have thought the existence of an unknown work on the art of summoning would have had you flying along the currents of aether to Rammbroes's side by now.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Ah, I thought you might be along. Here, Forename─a prize such as this should be in your keeping.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: We uncovered it not terribly far from where we excavated the evoker's attire. I've judged the tome to be some manner of manual for summoning magic, but alas, I was unable to decipher the writings. 'Tis fortunate, then, that such a task falls directly within Y'mhitra's field of expertise.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, would you mind taking the book to her yourself? She sent word that she had been held up by some dreary business in Revenant's Toll. Pray do be careful!

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Were you able to find Y'mhitra in town? I can think of no one better suited to unraveling the secrets within that Allagan tome.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...Forename? I sent word that I would meet you in Revenant's Toll. Did Rammbroes not pass along my message?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: My apologies─a trifling but unavoidable matter prevented me from making directly for the dig site. Now, shall we take a closer look at this Allagan tome?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Oh my... 'Tis rather more shabby than what I've come to expect from the great works of Allag, but let's not be discouraged. The content is what truly matters.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: (-???-)A fine observation!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Principia, at your service. I am a humble familiar, humbly familiar with the doctrine of summoning.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...Have we awoken a sentient tome from some ancient library? Forename, we must keep it contained!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Have I somehow given offense? Strange, for I am not equipped with offensive capabilities. Imparting the art of summoning is my function, and instructional manual is my form.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...A manual, you say?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. When opened in the presence of summoners, I am bound to awaken and share with them the secrets of summoning. The young mistressmaster there is in possession of an active soul crystal, yes?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twas the soul crystal that awoke you?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. Only one who carries a soul crystal and has bathed in the aether of an eikon may wield the powers of a summoner. I sensed one worthy of instruction, and was thus compelled to introduce myself.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: “Eikon”... That is the Allagan word for “primal.” Excuse my need to clarify the obvious, but you are a construct created to teach summoning magicks to any potential student you encounter? Why would the ancients have deemed such a thing necessary?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Summoning came into being for the purpose of eliminating beings─specifically those beings known as eikons. Ahem, “primals.” Once these entities have all been vanquished, however, new egi cannot be harnessed. Old summoners perish, and so, too, does their art.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: It was upon glimpsing this bleak future that a certain master summoner set about crafting yours truly. Inscribed with arts of tremendous power, I exist to teach others how to safeguard their existence.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Fascinating... Your creation speaks to the heart of the discipline's rarity. Summoning harnesses the power of primals for the sole purpose of destroying them, and new summoners arise only in an age when primals are rife.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: With the absence of living mentors, a true succession of the art is never achieved. Principia, are you then to instruct Forename in the lost secrets of Allag?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I am eager to oblige, but there are certain obligations. Ere the seal upon my higher knowledge can be unlocked, the student must first overcome the three challenges I am ensorcelled to present.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well, considering how it refers to primals as “eikons,” I'm inclined to believe that we have an authentic Allagan relic on our hands. What say you, Forename? Will you undertake these challenges?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The first challenge is a test of power. This trial is designed to evaluate the raw magnitude of your arcane talent by pitting you against a predetermined opponent of carefully measured fortitude. Also known as “I manifest a monster, and you fight it.”

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, mayhap not terribly wise to attempt that in the middle of town. Why don't we find ourselves a less-populated area out near the Singing Shards?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Are you prepared for this “test of power”? 'Twould seem Principia is but waiting on your word.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I thought we were headed for north Silvertear? We certainly cannot hold the trial here.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Shall we begin the test of power, MistressMaster?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...“MistressMaster”? You treat your pupil as a superior, Principia?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Such was the way in which I was written. Ah, and if my full name begins to tire your tongue, you are welcome to call me “Prin” or “Pia.”

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Oooh, I rather like “Prin.” Ahem, I mean, let us proceed with the challenge!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: A fine showing, MistressMaster. Even the greatest of Allagan summoners would be forced to recognize the extent of your extant power.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: A crushing victory, Forename! Who could argue the potential of modern summoning after that display?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: You have bested the first challenge, MistressMaster. There are few summoners in Allag's long history who boasted this degree of native might!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Furthermore, that you have achieved such potency through naught but the study of ancient wisdom is simply astonishing. With a little polish to your technique, guiding you to loftier heights of power should be astonishingly simple.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I'd thought Forename's technique more than sufficiently polished, but you say there is room for improvement? I see we shall have to adjust our yalmstick for perfection if we are to rival the practitioners of the past.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Indeed. If you would know more of past practices, then you need only ask.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Actually, I do have a question for you...
If you would indulge me, Forename?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Prin, in which age were you created? You appear to lack the technological advancements that were predominant in constructs in the latter days of Allag's civilization...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Another excellent observation. I was penned by Master Sari, a preeminent summoner of his time. He was, in fact, likely the last master summoner of the Allagan Empire's reign.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Were I to date myself by your culture's notion of history, my creation would have taken place at a point just before the empire's collapse. In other words, solidly within the richest era of aetherochemical discovery.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: One might reasonably wonder why this wonderful science was excluded from my invention, and I assure you, there is a reason...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: In the beginning, the Allagans rose to superiority through their mastery of magecraft. It is told that the very first wielders of summoning magic made do with grimoires fashioned of leather and ink and parchment.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: There came a tipping point, however, when the mundane sciences began to progress with ever-growing rapidity. These advances were married with the arcane, and aetherochemical technology was born.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Even as the harnessing of lightning energies gave rise to new recording mediums, techniques were developed that allowed complex arcane geometries to be instantly plotted. Traditional grimoires were replaced by devastatingly efficient and elegant weapons.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The convenience of these tools, however, did not lend themselves well to the instruction of initiates. Beyond such considerations, the new mediums could not be perused without dedicated machinery, and their manufacture was no simple matter.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...And so the summoner who breathed life into you decided that tomestones and the like were not the ideal method for passing on his accumulated wisdom.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. He chose for me the primitive form of a book, and inscribed within my pages a bounty of potent incantations that required no machine to be cast.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Prin. I thought only to satisfy my academic curiosity, but I found myself swept up in your description of the past. ...You truly are the creation of an incredible age.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And thank you for your patience, Forename! Shall we return to Gridania?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Welcome home, MistressMaster. Or should that be, “welcome back”? I am told this is the base of your research efforts with Lady Y'mhitra, but I am unsure of the correct salutation.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Forename, you've been well I trust? I'm trying to bend Y'mhitra's ear, but she seems a little distracted.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...Not that I can blame her. Have you seen this hopping book? I'm fairly sure I caught a flash of teeth in between those pages...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well done, Forename! We are one step closer to revealing a new secret of ancient Allag!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Prin will issue the next challenge after you've had the chance to review your studies, and hone your abilities to a new level of perfection.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...I've decided to keep the familiar here at my side for the moment. Even with as many wonders as Eorzea holds, folk tend to panic at the sight of a fanged tome that jumps around of its own accord.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Oh, and pay no mind to Captain Wolf. He obviously wishes to secure my services for some task or another, but we have more important matters to attend to!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

obj.n: ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
闇を打ち消す光を放たん

quest.name: プリンクの試練
journal: Y'mhitra asks that you lend an ear to Principia.

Y'mhitra directs your attention to Principia, and the toothy familiar announces you ready to undertake the second challenge. Finding herself stumped by the trial's requirement for additional summoners, Y'mhitra is forced to accept Dancing Wolf's proposal to cooperate with his regiment's new summoners-in-training. Travel to Camp Bluefog in northern Thanalan, and report to the flame captain.

After Principia explains the second challenge and its focus on skill, Dancing Wolf introduces you to his cadre of neophyte summoners. Prepare yourself to battle the acolytes' egi, then approach Summoner Crispin to begin the trial.
You have overcome the pair of Ifrit-egi summoned by Crispin and Denise. Approach Summoner Jajasamu, and proceed to the next step of the challenge.
You have triumphed over the formidable Ifrit-egi summoned by Jajasamu. Speak with the lieutenant once more, and prepare to face your final opponent.
You have claimed victory over Jajasamu's Titan-egi. With no aetherial entities left to send against you, the novice summoners look on expectantly as Dancing Wolf waits to congratulate you.

Principia declares your attempt at the second challenge a resounding success. Your opponents accept their defeat with good-natured grace, and seem eager to resume their training. Bidding them farewell, you turn to follow Y'mhitra back to Apkallu Falls.

Upon returning to Gridania, Principia continues its lecture on the history of Allagan summoning and shares the accomplishments of its creator. Y'mhitra seems more determined than ever to see you earn the master summoner's long-lost wisdom, and urges you to prepare for the familiar's final challenge.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Speak with Dancing Wolf at Camp Bluefog.
Speak with Crispin, and defeat the egi.
Speak with Jajasamu, and defeat the egi.
Speak with Dancing Wolf.
Speak with Y'mhitra in Gridania.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Forename, you've been well I trust? I'm trying to bend Y'mhitra's ear, but she seems a little distracted.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: ...Not that I can blame her. Have you seen this hopping book? I'm fairly sure I caught a flash of teeth in between those pages...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Welcome home, MistressMaster. Or should that be, “welcome back”? I am told this is the base of your research efforts with Lady Y'mhitra, but I am unsure of the correct salutation.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename. 'Twould seem that Prin would speak with us about the second challenge.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Congratulations, MistressMaster. You are sufficiently prepared to undertake the next test.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Excuse me, Prin, but...how can you tell?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: By analyzing the patterns of MistressMaster's aetherial emanations, I can gauge the strength and precision of herhis recently cast incantations. Of course, MistressMaster must attempt the challenge itself before I can provide an evaluation to the proper degree of accuracy.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This will be a test of skill. To administer this trial under the prescribed conditions, however, I must request the assistance of several more summoners to play the role of antagonists...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Several more summoners...? In this day and age, that will be no easy feat to arrange.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Come now, Y'mhitra. The solution is right under your nose!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Forename, your deeds have caught the attention of the highest echelons of the Flames. After learning what you're capable of, we've begun an initiative to take our very own summoners into battle against the primals.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: A number of soldiers under my command have already begun intensive training─I handpicked veteran survivors of our expedition against Ifrit, and they've been issued with soul crystals we claimed from the Ascians.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, and Captain Wolf has been howling in my ear for days, begging to enlist your aid as some kind of drill instructor for the aetherially gifted.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: But now you're in need of summoners for this trial of yours, yes? I am prepared to offer my regiment's full cooperation. All I ask in return is a few morsels of advice for the acolytes!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: It seems to me a fair trade. And my enchantments do not restrict me from instructing neophyte summoners in the fundamentals of the art.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Very well... I suppose such an arrangement could prove convenient for us all.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I knew you'd come around! Meet me at Camp Bluefog and I'll assemble the troops for inspection.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: These are the three neophyte summoners who will be assisting with the trial. I have heard Allagan training can be rather remorseless... Do your best, but pray try not to injure them during the fray!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Everything is in readiness for the second challenge, MistressMaster.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: I am told we are to be your opponents for this exercise. It's an honor to meet you, misssir.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Summoner Denise at your service, misssir!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: ...Aye? We ain't started yet, have we?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We should meet Captain Wolf at the camp, then we'll find a nice, open space somewhere in northern Thanalan to conduct the second challenge.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I did warn him, however, that you're far too busy to train his soldiers on any kind of permanent basis.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As mentioned, the second challenge will be a test of skill. I shall be evaluating your technique for flawless execution and executed flaws.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Looks like we're all here! Let's get on with the briefing, shall we?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As you command. This second challenge will evaluate the elegance of your technique as opposed to the magnitude of your Miasma.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: First, I shall infuse the egi of your opponents with secondary enchantments, and then you are to engage the entities in combat.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Prin explained to me that the enchantments store the aether expended during the battle, and allow for an in-depth analysis of your...flair for Deathflares. As it were. In any case, I expect you'll pass with flying colors!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Right, I suppose you should know who you're up against. Designation and rank!

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Summoner Crispin. Private, first class. We're grateful for aught you can teach us, misssir.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Summoner Denise. Sergeant. I'm new to spellcasting, but I've seen my share of combat, misssir! Crispin and I are to fight you as a pair.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Summoner Jajasamu. Lieutenant. Ye've more'n a few admirers in the barracks, Forename...uh, misssir. But that don't mean we'll go easy on ye!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Enough chatter! Quick march to the training ground! Give the word to Crispin and Denise when you're ready to battle their egi, Forename.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: After that, you'll be facing off against the lieutenant's beast. You won't be attacking my troops directly, so give it all you've got!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: All set, Forename? As I said, Crispin and Denise will be your first opponents. Just give them the word.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Our egi are primed for battle, misssir! We'll unleash them as soon as you've given Crispin the command!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: I'll just be watchin' for the now. Ye know, seein' how ye handle the small fish afore ye get to the real fight.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We should probably be in northern Thanalan. Captain Wolf and his summoners will be waiting.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Greetings, MistressMaster. We are conducting the second challenge near this “Camp Bluefog” of yours. Strange, I do not recall teleporting back here...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Prepare yourself, misssir! Denise and I will now summon our servants to battle!

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Aye, a pair of Ifrit-egi for you!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Outstanding! Speak with Summoner Jajasamu to continue the challenge.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
The enchantments were also meant to strengthen the egi somewhat...
Well, that hardly seemed to matter to you!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: An excellent performance so far, MistressMaster. Pray continue with the test.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text:
Your victory was overwhelming, misssir.
Watching you wield the art is simply mesmerizing...

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: We never stood a chance, really, but I was holding out a tiny bit of hope!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Ye finished warmin' up on them embers, then? 'Cause even together, me mates' egi don't hold a candle to the inferno I can summon.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Right. Let's bring the flames!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Your next opponent will be another one of Summoner Jajasamu's egi. The lad's not fond of losing, so expect no quarter!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You held your own easily enough, but that Ifrit-egi was still rather impressive.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: How do you feel, MistressMaster? Dizziness? Itchiness? Nausea? No? Mayhap this challenge needs to be more...challenging. Continue!

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text:
Even Jajasamu's egi was extinguished...
Well, that's that, then.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: It's not over yet: the lieutenant has one more card up his sleeve!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Ah, I had hopes for that one, but ye snuffed him out right quick!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Not much of a trial, eh? Well then, yer lucky I fought another primal durin' me time with the Company of Heroes.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, yer not the only summoner as can command more'n one aetherial beastie! Say hello to yer final opponent: Titan-egi!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: A former member of the Company of Heroes? I'm impressed. He has the makings of a talented summoner.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Allow me some time to chew on the residue of your battles, MistressMaster. Though from the taste alone, I can predict a favorable flavor for the result...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Titan-egi seemed so solid...and then you broke him into little pieces.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: That was a pleasure to watch, misssir. I can hardly wait to return to our training!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: I wish I'd been able to join in the battle with me own self. Not that the outcome would've been any different, mind...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I hope my summoners put up enough of a fight for you! Anyway, shall we hear what the book has to say?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I have ruminated upon the swirls and echoes of your battle, and the picture is clear: your technique is, without a doubt, a thing of exquisite beauty. Consider the second challenge conquered.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Well, that's good news, if hardly surprising! After all, you did sweep through those egi like a storm through a field of dandelions!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Me thanks. Ye've opened me eyes─I see I've some work to do afore I've truly mastered this discipline.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I'm glad to know we've been of service. Now, we really must be returning to Gridania.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Thank you, misssir. This was truly an enriching experience!

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Aye, pray train with us again in the future!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: One last challenge remains. Pray win through this trial, lest the higher knowledge I hoard remain lost.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Congratulations, Forename. With your impressive demonstrations of power and skill, you have already conquered two of Prin's three challenges!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ere we come to the final trial, however, Prin would further our education on Allagan summoning.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: First, I would ask what you know of the rise and fall of summoning in the Allagan Empire─I was made to “cover” rather a lot of history, you understand.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: From our research, we have learned that summoners were initially lauded as heroes for their success against the primals. When certain of these mages began to abuse the art's power for personal gain, however, the adoration of the populace shifted towards an oppressive hatred.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. We speak now of the latter half of the Third Astral Era. My creator, Master Sari, was one of those who expended his energies on the destruction of primals, even as he fled from relentless persecution. Alongside his disciples, he triumphed over Belias and many other lesser entities.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Belias? That was the name of the elder primal from whom Tristan once drew power...
Master Sari must have been mighty indeed to defeat such a foe.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Yet he still knew fear: the thought that the grand discipline of summoning would fade into oblivion was more than Master Sari could bear. And so he sought to preserve its legacy, and provide for his successors.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: My creator was well versed in aetherochemistry and held a particular interest in the technology of information. Broadly speaking, he researched methods for producing arcane geometries without grimoires, and experimented with machine-enhanced egi.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: He eventually abandoned both of these technologies, deeming them unsuitable for the instruction of future generations. Hoping to provide guidance to those summoners yet unborn, he instead began writing and enchanting a work that would survive down the ages. He made me.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Such an accomplished personage...
Why, then, have I seen but scant mention of his name in Allag's histories?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As you have said yourself, it was an age when the adulation of summoners experienced an extreme reversal. It is likely that Master Sari's achievements were struck from the records, even as his loyal pupils were struck down in the streets.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I was shut in a storeroom─abandoned to my slumber like some common treatise on trade agreements in the southern provinces─and thus I can tell you naught of what befell my creator in his later years.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I expected a dry recital on the history of summoning, but you've shared with us your personal narrative. 'Tis clear you hold a great deal of respect for Master Sari.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I am a familiar. I simply relay information as I was enspelled. This lecture is now over.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
As you wish, Prin.
Well, Forename, 'twould seem class is dismissed for the moment. I suggest you recuperate from this day's trial, and look toward preparing yourself for the final challenge!

obj.n: ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士

quest.name: 不可視の脅威
journal: Y'mhitra has an announcement regarding the final challenge.

Principia pronounces that the third challenge is at hand. Although seemingly unable to reveal the exact nature of the trial, the familiar explains that you will once more require the cooperation of Dancing Wolf's neophyte summoners. Y'mhitra contacts the flame captain, and he gladly arranges for the mock battle to take place on Seal Rock. Meet Y'mhitra at the airship landing in Ul'dah.

You arrive in Ul'dah only to learn that Dancing Wolf and his soldiers have come under attack on Seal Rock. A greatly concerned Y'mhitra urges you to inform the elite flyer of this development, and make an immediate departure for the island.
You have rescued Captain Wolf and his soldiers from an ambush sprung by a mysterious and powerful summoner. Regroup with your companions at the airship landing in Ul'dah.

Though it seems impossible, you discover that the enemy who attacked your comrades appears to be Sari─an Allagan master summoner who lived several thousand years ago. Speak with Dancing Wolf at the airship landing in Ul'dah, and discuss this unnerving development.

Dancing Wolf and his summoner squad thank you for their rescue, but the identity and abilities of their attacker remain the source of much confusion. Return to Apkallu Falls and join Y'mhitra as she prepares to question Principia.

After considering the facts at hand, you conclude that the Sari you encountered was most likely a clone of Principia's creator. Whatever the truth of the situation, however, the familiar's most precious summoning wisdom has been sealed behind an arcane lock. Y'mhitra vows to scour Allagan records for clues that will allow you to track this “Sari” down and claim the knowledge you have earned...

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Join Y'mhitra at the airship landing in Ul'dah.
Speak with the Elite Flyer.
Speak with Dancing Wolf.
Speak with Y'mhitra in Gridania.
Rescue the summoners!
Defeat the unknown summoner!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: One last challenge remains. Pray win through this trial, lest the higher knowledge I hoard remain lost.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The time has come, Forename! Prin is ready to administer the final trial.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Yes, your third challenge is at hand, MistressMaster. I shall be glad to at last share the wisdom that has long lain dormant within my pages.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Thus far we've had evaluations of raw power and refinement of skill. What, then, will this third challenge seek to test?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: ...That, I cannot tell you.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Cannot...or will not?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I do not keep this detail from you for the sake of my own amusement. It must be secret─were you aware of the test's purpose, such knowledge would unfairly affect its outcome.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: What I will tell you, however, is that this trial requires conditions that are akin to an actual battlefield.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As such, I must ask that you call fellow summoners to your side, and arrange a location where you might join hands against a most-realistic primal threat.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well, this ought to be welcome news for Captain Wolf. I shall see if his acolytes are available...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Greetings, this is Y'mhitra, I─ Y'mhitra. ...Of the Sons of Saint Coinach? Aye. I have a favor to ask...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well, Captain Wolf was more than eager to accept our request. He even offered to arrange exclusive use of a section of Seal Rock.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: It seems there will be an airship waiting in Ul'dah to fly us to the island. Shall we rendezvous at the landing once you are prepared, then?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This will be the final and most grueling challenge. Pray ready yourself, MistressMaster, that you are not reduced to so much gruel.

dialogue.name: AIRMAN02104
dialogue.text: Captain Wolf and his squad of summoners await you on Seal Rock. Permission has been granted to use the island for your...exercise, but we must ask that you avoid damaging the relics.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This will be the final and most grueling challenge. Pray ready yourself, MistressMaster, that you are not reduced to so much gruel.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Make for Ul'dah when you are ready, Forename. There should be an airship waiting to take us to Seal Rock.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This will be the final and most grueling challenge. Pray ready yourself, MistressMaster, that you are not reduced to so much gruel.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I don't know about you, Forename, but my nerves are beginning to get the best of me! Captain Wolf and the others have already landed on Seal Rock, so let us not delay the challenge any further.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Who could that be? ...Oh, Summoner Jajasamu, how might I─ Pardon!? ...By whom!? We─ ...Lieutenant!? Can you hear me!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Blast! The call was cut off. Forename, our Immortal colleagues are under attack.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Their situation sounds dire indeed. All the summoners are crippled by injuries, and Captain Wolf alone fights to keep the foe at bay.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...Our planned battle has become rather more real than we anticipated. We'd best explain matters to the pilot, and arrange a rescue party!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Captain Wolf needs our help, Forename. We must inform the pilot at once!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The situation sounds grim, MistressMaster. We should make for Seal Rock immediately!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I know not what possessed us to return here, but Captain Wolf and his soldiers are in mortal peril! Quickly now, back to the landing in Ul'dah!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The situation sounds grim, MistressMaster. We should make for Seal Rock immediately!

dialogue.name: AIRMAN02104
dialogue.text: ...Ambushed, you say!? Understood.

dialogue.name: AIRMAN02104
dialogue.text: I'll put in a call for reinforcements, but my ship is ready to depart now if you are. Shall we go in ahead?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Follow me, Forename!
They should be over this way!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I've located a survivor.
Let us ensure his continued survival!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I'll live, I think...
The others! We became separated...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
His wounds are not too serious.
Come, Forename, we mustn't tarry!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Forename, where are you going!?
We must stay together!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Are these egi!?
I've never seen their like!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I recognize them from Allagan times.
But few could summon so many...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Such odd vocalizations.
I have no records of egi speech.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Another survivor located.
The wounds appear grievous!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
We must treat these at once!
Prin, can you, uh, apply pressure?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
We were completely overmatched...
The captain... He drew them away...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
We shall tend to the injured.
Go with haste, MistressMaster!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
Forename! Thank the gods!
I'm in over my head here!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text:
Ah, the “potential” has arrived.
Shall we test the limits of your power?

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text:
So, this is what the art has become.
More. Show me more!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text:
Familiar with Bahamut's power, are you?
You must have another taste!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
We can't avoid those flares!
But they seem weakest at the center of the blast.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
Who is this man!?
He's worse than the Ascians...

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text:
You exceed my expectations.
Shall we try something new?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Wait, those don't look like egi!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text:
Consummate skill. Expansive aetherial might.
You truly are a fascinating specimen!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text:
My energies wane...
This location was not ideal.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: He's just...too strong...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forgive me. I'd hoped to be more help...

dialogue.name: SUMMONINGSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
(-???-)Anomalous potential confirmed.
Commencing scan.

dialogue.name: SUMMONINGSYSTEM
dialogue.text:
(-???-)Latent aetherial capacity: immeasurable.
Standard parameters exceeded.
Reinitializing system.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: What, he wants to go another round!?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Master Sari!? How have you come to be here?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Master...
Surely you do not mean that Sari!?

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text:
Ah, Principia, they have woken you.
...This should suffice.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: What did you do to Prin!?

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: The construct is unharmed. I simply added another layer of...security.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Do not disappoint me, summoner. I will be waiting.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: How odd. The way he vanished was almost as if...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Thal's teeth! What was that all about!?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Bah! We'll discuss this back in Ul'dah after we've seen to the wounded.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
That summoner on Seal Rock, he...
I have so many questions.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text:
My pages are all aflutter.
Master Sari... Here... Now...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Summoner Denise was gravely wounded. Had we arrived but a step or two later...

dialogue.name: AIRMAN02104
dialogue.text: I thank you for saving my comrades. Your decisive action carried the day!

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: That was like to a nightmare. What manner of summoner can command so many egi at once...?

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: I felt Thal's hand on my shoulder for a moment there, but Miss Y'mhitra's magicks brushed it away. Thank you for coming to our rescue!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: That bloke called up an army all by himself, an' I'm pretty sure some of 'em weren't egi. I didn't know that kind o' thing was even possible...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: You arrived in the nick of time, Forename! Thanks to you, my soldiers survived that ambush, and they'll be fit for duty again after a bit of rest.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Aye, you have our gratitude. If you hadn't plunged into the fray like that, we almost certainly would have perished.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Ye said that bastard was “Master Sari,” didn't ye? A summoner of ancient Allag? Did them mages have some way o' comin' back to life?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Alright, Lieutenant, let's not jump to conclusions!

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Well, he was wielding summoning magicks unlike aught we've ever seen before. Maybe Prin has some idea...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...I'll be sure to ask. Come, Forename. Let us return to Gridania.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: What misfortune that such an incident should occur on the cusp of your final challenge...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra surprised me once before with her cunning, but I knew in my gut that that ambush was no part of her agenda─it was too sudden; too brutal. Even worse, we're not even sure of who our foe actually was...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well, what was meant to be Forename's final trial was certainly testing, to say the least. Tell me, Prin: what makes you so sure that that was Master Sari?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Based upon the evidence at hand, there can be no doubt. The vocal and aetherial signatures were identical to those exhibited by my creator.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The only aspect that gives me pause is his behavior. Master Sari was never one to offer harm to others with such callous indifference.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, I would say there is a larger inconsistency to consider here, Prin: your creator supposedly died several thousand years ago.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: There is one other possibility. The greatest minds of Allag unlocked a science known as “cloning,” by which they could artificially create a replicant of a living being.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Seal Rock is, after all, a construction of the Allagan Empire. Assuming the individual you battled was indeed a clone of Master Sari, then my senses would recognize no appreciable difference.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
An exact copy of the original person...
'Twould explain much, but the very thought of it is horrifying.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...Oh, and did he not tamper with your enchantments!? Are you truly unharmed?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: My faculties are undimmed, but the wisdom I was to impart to MistressMaster has been sealed behind an arcane lock. I can do nothing─only my creator holds the key.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Then your secrets are lost to us! If only Forename had been able to attempt that third challenge!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Attempt? MistressMaster has already passed it.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Allow me to explain: the third challenge is a test of the summoner's nature. Thus does the trial require the presence of companions and a realistic threat. Master Sari's ambush did, of course, bring an unexpected dimension to proceedings.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Yet MistressMaster leapt to the aid of herhis fellow summoners without hesitation, and braved considerable danger to see that they were safely rescued─selfless acts that more than qualify MistressMaster as a worthy successor.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I had wondered why power and skill were not sufficient... Sari wished to see his teachings passed on to summoners of noble heart.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. He could not countenance the idea that such knowledge might be put to evil ends. Now you understand why his display of violence so confused me...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, and all the more reason to suspect an impostor. But whatever this man's identity may be, we will track him down and make him remove that seal. Your purpose is too important.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: And I will assist you in any way I can. The Master Sari that made me would not stand to see his memory profaned with such wickedness.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well said, Prin. For an enchanted stack of ink and parchment, you have an impressively developed moral compass!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I possess neither morals nor a compass─I merely follow my enspelled directions to guide worthy summoners. If I give the impression of such characteristics, then mayhap I am overstepping my bounds as a familiar?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: No, no, you're fine, Prin! Forget I mentioned it.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I will see if I can unearth more detailed records of Master Sari. Mayhap the story of his later life will aid us in unraveling this present mystery...

obj.n: ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士

quest.name: 闇に葬られた頁
journal: Y'mhitra seems to be having trouble making headway with her research.

Y'mhitra has been unable to find significant mention of Sari in the usual histories, and decides to call on the assistance of her colleague, Rammbroes. Accompany Y'mhitra to Mor Dhona, and speak with the Roegadyn scholar at Saint Coinach's Find.

Rammbroes considers your situation, and suggests you borrow the unread tomestones from Rowena's considerable stock. Head into Revenant's Toll, and deliver Rammbroes's letter into the merchant's hands.
In exchange for summaries of their contents, Rowena has agreed to lend you a hefty pile of tomestone transcripts. Join Y'mhitra outside and begin sifting through the foreboding volumes.

Y'mhitra discovers a passage of interest almost immediately, but realizes that further assistance will be needed to search through the mountain of material. She resolves to enlist Captain Wolf's squad of summoners, and Rammbroes offers the use of his tent. Return to Saint Coinach's Find and speak with Y'mhitra once more.

With the aid of the summoner squad you learn the history leading to Sari's death, and construct a theory to explain the master summoner's simulacrum on Seal Rock. The acolytes head back to the island to search for further clues, and you return to Gridania with Y'mhitra to await their results.

With the investigation on Seal Rock providing little in the way of new information, you prepare to make an expedition to the research facility on Azys Lla. Judging by Principia's explanation of the seal and the goading nature of the present-day Sari's parting words, it seems that your arrival will not be unexpected...

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Rammbroes at Saint Coinach's Find.
Deliver Rammbroes's letter to Rowena in Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Y'mhitra in Revenant's Toll.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Saint Coinach's Find.
Speak with Y'mhitra in Gridania.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: What misfortune that such an incident should occur on the cusp of your final challenge...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I searched through the usual histories, but found scant mention of Sari. 'Tis as Prin has said: records of his existence have all but been expunged.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: And since my own knowledge is limited to the day I was stored away, we must rely on those lost Allagan records that escaped the purge.
