dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: My colleague, Rammbroes, may be able to help us there. Hardly a day goes past when his team does not lift some forgotten treasure from the ruins in Mor Dhona. Shall we pay him a visit?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, hello, Forename. I've just been explaining our dilemma to Rammbroes here.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Come, we should visit Rammbroes at Saint Coinach's Find. He's sure to have something that survived the purge of Sari's history.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I would tell you the story of spending several thousand years locked in a dark room, but I fear I slept through most of it...

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra has informed me of your search, and I shall be certain to contact you should our discoveries include any mention of this “Sari.” There may, however, be a swifter way to acquire the information you seek.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: I know of a certain merchant who collects undeciphered tomestones with even greater zeal than the Sons of Saint Coinach.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah... You speak of Rowena.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Aye. We have formed something of a symbiotic relationship with her consortium. In return for financing our excavations, we provide Rowena with a selection of our finds. I'm sure you would find her amenable to a request for assistance.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: After all, you would merely need to borrow her tomestones for a time, yes? Here, I've penned a letter with my personal reassurances that her stock will be returned none the worse for wear.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Take that letter to Rowena and ask to borrow her tomestones. I'm sure you will have no trouble coming to a mutually beneficial agreement.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: You have Rammbroes's letter, yes? I'll let you do the haggling...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Forename? Were you not on your way to Revenant's Toll?
...Yes, yes, I will be there, don't you worry.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This merchant you go to see, she deals in Allagan records? How strange to think of history as currency...

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye, what can I do for you?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: ...So you've the backin' of old Rammbroes, eh? Well, I suppose it wouldn't hurt to lend you some o' my tomestones.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: In fact, I'll do you one better and let you borrow the transcripts─courtesy o' the scribes at the Ironworks. As books, they're a damn sight heavier, but you don't need fancy machines when it's all penned down in ink and parchment.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Give me a summary of the contents when you're finished, and I'll consider that as payment. Collectors'll part with more coin if they know what they're gettin', and my time's too precious to waste on readin' ancient history!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Consider it a deal, Rowena, and thank you. Well, Forename, shall we get to work?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Rowena lent you the transcripts? Well, I hope she also lent you a cart to carry them. Both mediums have their inconveniences, I suppose...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Fancy that. I've barely begun skimming the very first volume, and there are already some promising passages. Let us wake Prin, and share our findings, shall we?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, Rammbroes. Have you come to check on our progress?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: This charming tome is Principia, a sentient familiar of ancient Allag.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: A pleasure to meet you, Master Rammbroes. Pray call me “Prin,” if you prefer.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Thank you, Prin. And might I say what a privilege it is to meet such a rare and clever construct.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Clever? Well, yes, apparently Prin was written that way. In fact, we were just hoping to hear an opinion on a new snippet of information I've uncovered.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: 'Twas an order listed in a record of imperial military communications, commanding that “the fruits of the master summoner's research be seized.” It appears that the army had more than a passing interest in Sari's experiments.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Hmmm. And what exactly was the purpose of this research?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Master Sari toiled to wed summoning magicks with aetherochemical technology. For example, he experimented with replacing grimoires with mechanical mediums, and sought to manifest egi of greater authenticity by utilizing high-speed computations.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: ...Simply put, he turned to machines to enhance traditional summoning methods. Is that the gist of it?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. But Master Sari was never one to abuse the success of his experiments, no matter how they magnified his power. He would not place his trust in machines─their inherently complex nature was too prone to error, he said.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The dates on these communications indicate a time in the latter half of Sari's life. Is it possible something could have occurred between crafting you and the execution of this order that may have greatly altered the summoner's outlook?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: There was, of course, the violent wave of anti-summoner sentiment that swept through Allag. It claimed the lives of many of Master Sari's disciples. Following their deaths, he began spending much of his time cloistered within his laboratory...

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Such an incident could certainly be responsible for changing a man. And Principia, you were unaware of subsequent events once you fell into slumber, yes?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: From what we've learned so far, 'tis safe to say that the foe we encountered is related to Sari's research in some way.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And there are likely more clues buried in these records. I shall speak with Captain Wolf, and ask to borrow the sharp minds of his summoner squad─'tis a rather intimidating pile to tackle on our own.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: Well, seeing as you have the transcripts, there is no need to travel far. You are welcome to make use of my tent and the reference materials on Allag found therein.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: That would be an enormous help, thank you! Let's haul these books to the dig site, shall we?

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: I have been checking in on Y'mhitra, and it seems she and the summoners are making good headway into those records.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Some people dislike this manner of task, but I never tire of dredging through pages that transport one to the past!

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: These Allagan records are like to make my skull burst! Opening portals to other worlds, forging new moons...and it's not even fiction!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: I've been ignorin' aught that ain't to do with the military. 'Tis more efficient to have a narrow focus, I reckon.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We should make our way to Saint Coinach's Find. 'Twouldn't do to leave Rowena's transcripts unattended!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: I did not count the days as I slept, but it truly has been millennia, hasn't it? In this age, the Master Sari I knew exists only in my memories...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Our summoner colleagues arrived with a swiftness after I relayed to them our request. 'Tis well to see them recovered from their injuries!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: With everyone pitching in, we stand a good chance of finding something useful...

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Ah, here's the bugger I was lookin' for! This's a record of when the military finally caught up with Sari. It says here the summoner was found dead─killed by someone else, it seems.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Then we have proof of the original Sari's demise in the Third Astral Era. Now there remains the question of who─or what─attacked us in this age...

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: My coin is on one of those “clone” creations! ...Is there aught more to the story, Lieutenant?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, it goes on to describe how the imperial army took over Sari's research, laudin' his experiments as “exceptionally dangerous, but ripe with potential applications.”

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: They shifted operations to an artificial island soon after an' began practical testin'. ...One cataclysmic accident later, though, an' that was the end o' that.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: This artificial island must be a reference to Seal Rock─the very site of our encounter with the present-day Sari.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: During the battle, my creator's simulacrum exhibited the ability to summon multiple egi simultaneously, as well as manifest highly authentic facsimiles of flesh-and-blood entities.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The basis for every one of these unorthodox techniques can be traced back to Master Sari's research into machine-enhanced summoning.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: I'd say we have enough evidence to support a working theory, then. Namely that the Allagan military was using a clone of the deceased Sari to perform hazardous experiments─tests which explored the feasibility of aetherochemically bolstered summoning magicks.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: And when we landed on Seal Rock, we must have somehow awoken the remnants of those experiments!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Mayhap we have solved the mystery of who the attacker was, but now I would know the place to where he fled. What refuge exists for such a being?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: From what I can gather, the results o' Sari's work were bundled off to some secret laboratory called the “Aetherochemical Research Facility.”

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: You know of this place, misssir? Is it far?

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: Azys Lla!? If that's where they were keeping Sari's research, then it's possible the clone may have headed there.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Our squad will fly back to Seal Rock and make further investigations. The relics of the past may hold some hint we haven't yet considered.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: An excellent idea, thank you. We shall return to Gridania for the time being.

dialogue.name: RAMMBROES
dialogue.text: You found what you were looking for, then? Very good. 'Twould seem that many hands made light work. Speaking of which, do not concern yourself with the transcripts─I shall arrange for them to be returned to Rowena with summaries attached.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This simulacrum of Master Sari has sought to obstruct my creator's will, and I shall offer it no quarter. You deserve to learn the wisdom within my pages!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I've received an update from Captain Wolf regarding their investigations on Seal Rock. 'Twould seem that certain of the Allagan relics have shown signs of recent activation!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The mechanisms were too heavily damaged to offer more in the way of useful information, however. I fear we must brave this Azys Lla facility and search for Sari ourselves. ...Is that what he was hoping for when he said “I will be waiting”?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: It is possible. I did not think the detail important at the time, but the lock engaged by Master Sari's simulacrum was not of the strictest tier.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Rather, the seal is one which fades upon the sealer's demise.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Then he was goading us into finding and defeating him? Another challenge...or is it simply a trap?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I am not fond of rushing into the unknown. Gird yourself for the worst, Forename, and I will learn the present circumstances of the research facility.

quest.name: 召喚士の使命
journal: Y'mhitra is ready to depart for Azys Lla.

Y'mhitra tells you what she has learned in preparation for your journey to the research facility on Azys Lla, and informs you that Captain Wolf and his summoner squad will be providing military support. Make ready for the expedition, then rendezvous with your companions at Helix.

You join Y'mhitra and the others on Azys Lla, and the scholar urges you to begin the search for a control panel of some kind. Head towards your assigned area near the statues of the Warring Triad, and seek out a research facility terminal.
You approach a promising control panel only to find yourself set upon by a trio of clockwork soldiers. After defeating your ambushers, you once more stretch forth a hand to operate the terminal...

Your efforts at the terminal are rewarded by the appearance of Sari, who then proceeds to lay his challenge at your feet. Your companions arrive in time to witness the exchange, and Y'mhitra suggests that the “clone” is, in fact, some manner of summoned entity. Her observation seems supported by the evidence at hand, but gives rise to yet another question: who, then, is the summoner? Prepare yourself to face the formidable egi, then speak with Captain Wolf when you are ready to enter the facility.

After a shocking revelation, you discover that the strings of the Sari-egi were being pulled by a sentient machine─an invention of Sari's which describes itself as an “evocation matrix.” All attempts to reason with the warped intelligence fail, and you and your companions are drawn into a battle of surreal proportions. Despite the bewildering capabilities of your opponent, however, you seize victory over the mechanical summoner. Join Y'mhitra by the statues of the Warring Triad, and discuss the aftermath of the battle.

With the evocation matrix destroyed, you have removed the final barrier to learning the secrets held within Principia's pages. Say your farewells to the summoning squad, and return to Gridania with Y'mhitra.

Upon your return, Captain Wolf shares the results of his last-moment investigation. He reports that he salvaged a number of soul crystals from the wreckage of the machine, as well as an accompanying record which explains the master summoner's descent into a bitter pessimism. You muse over Sari's disparate attempts to bequeath summoning to future generations, and the philosophical differences evident in the construction of Principia and the evocation matrix. The familiar itself seems satisfied to have entrusted you with its creator's knowledge, and content to leave the succession of summoning magic in your capable hands. Principia returns to its slumber, its purpose fulfilled...for now.

※The next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “A Tearful Reunion.”
objectives: Rendezvous with Y'mhitra at Helix.
Search for a research facility terminal.
Operate the research facility terminal.
Speak with Dancing Wolf.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Helix.
Speak with Y'mhitra in Gridania.
Defeat the evocation matrix!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: This simulacrum of Master Sari has sought to obstruct my creator's will, and I shall offer it no quarter. You deserve to learn the wisdom within my pages!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I've learned all there is to be learned about the research facility. The time has come to make our move!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: From what my sister and her colleagues have told me, the laboratories are housed in an extremely dangerous quadrant of Azys Lla. We'll not want to wander around inviting trouble, but rather plot the swiftest and safest route to our destination.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: There should be a terminal somewhere that will allow us to pinpoint the section where Sari's research is being stored. Once we arrive on Azys Lla, finding such a terminal will be our highest priority.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, I've informed Captain Wolf of our forthcoming expedition─he insisted that he and his summoner squad provide us with support. Let us make ready and meet them at Helix.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Have these ruins truly existed for thousands of years? It's all so bright and sharp...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: There are beasts from my worst nightmare simply strolling around up here. Prin tells me they would have been contained in the days when the Allagans yet worked at this facility.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Everywhere I turn there's a new wonder. I've pinched myself ten times already just to be sure I was awake...

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: So, this is what ye get when ye fuse the arcane with the mechanical, an' neither is diminished by the result.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Azys Lla...
Sari could hardly have chosen a more distant place to take refuge.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: The name of Azys Lla is known to me. Its facilities were constructed by the oppressors in the military, however, so I was never welcomed there...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Azys Lla is even more fantastical than I'd imagined...
But we mustn't let ourselves be distracted by the scenery! We should fan out and search for a control panel of some description.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: And we can use that to plan the simplest route to our objective, yes?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, then we plunge ahead, swift an' sure, an' bring an end to this bastard clone!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: That is my intention. 'Tis important to note, however, that we have yet to determine if our enemy is truly a clone or not.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Even an artificial copy would appear as a living, breathing being. The man you fought on Seal Rock seemed almost...otherworldly.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I'm inclined to agree with you, Y'mhitra. But no matter what he is, we need to slay him to lift Prin's seal. The job remains the same.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: True enough. Then we should first focus on finding that terminal. Forename, if you would, pray search around the base of the Warring Triad statues.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Keep your guard up─if Sari knows we're coming, he may have prepared a welcome!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Unauthorized access detected.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Initiating countermeasures.

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: Target acquired.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: I predicted you would be the first to find me. A lesser summoner would have been slain...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Sari's clone! It's here!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: ...Clone? Ah, you seek to explain my existence.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: An understandable theory, but I am far more than one of those clumsy creations. You had best abandon this flawed perception, lest it lead you down the path to failure.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: I shall await you inside, potential. You will pass my test─your true final challenge─or you will die never knowing what I truly am.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Thal's teeth! He's gone again!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Did you see that, Forename!? The way he vanished? 'Tis akin to the dismissal of a summoned entity!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: So yer sayin' he's some sort of egi? One what's wearin' Sari's face? But how can he look so solid an'...well, alive?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: With the aid of a computational machine, it would be theoretically possible to reconstruct aether into a near-perfect replica of Sari's corporeal form.

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: He was summoned using a machine...?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. Master Sari's research developed mechanical substitutes for grimoires. In fact, the lieutenant is standing right in front of one.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: ...This thing, eh? It looks a bit like them tomeliths on Seal Rock, only they was much bigger... Gods, can the bugger pop up anywhere there's one of these devices!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye. I think we can now safely assume that this Sari is the product of enhanced summoning magic.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: But our answer leaves us with yet another question: if Sari is the “egi,” then who is the summoner? Even if the grimoire is replaced by a machine, there must still exist the one who commands it.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: We've got to find the master then. If we don't squash the summoner, the bastard'll just bring the Sari-egi back again an' again' an' again...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Whomever the “bastard” may be, he or she must be concealed somewhere nearby. An entity will always be summoned within a certain distance of the summoner─even machine-enhanced techniques cannot circumvent this basic principle.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: That our antagonist chose not to make an appearance on Seal Rock suggests a reluctance to expose oneself to direct harm. In this location, however, with so many computational devices near to hand, I expect the foe's art will be significantly bolstered.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: So the egi will be even stronger than last time? All the more reason to take down this summoner quickly before we're swamped by aetherial horrors.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Well, I've brought a little device that should help─an aetherometer I borrowed from my sister, Shtola. If I can detect the right currents, it should lead us straight to our hidden enemy.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Excellent, Y'mhitra. That may make all the difference. Right, let's be about this, then! Summoner squad! Take the van and clear the way forward.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, we've been waitin' for the chance to prove ourselves. Ye just focus on findin' the summoner, an' we'll sweep aside the dregs!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The summoner squad will see to it that we have a clear path through the facility. Let us move swiftly, and repay their dedication with a resounding victory!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Go forth and defeat this impostor, MistressMaster. The wisdom of my creator belongs to you...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: We've not been idle since that last debacle, misssir. I'm eager to show you the results of our training.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Well, you couldn't ask for a more dramatic locale for a final confrontation. Assuming we survive all this, we'll sure have a tale to tell our barracks-mates!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Whatever support ye need, misssir, we're here to give it. We'll not leave till ye've busted that summoner's head an' got the rewards ye damn well deserve!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Ready for round two, Forename? The terminal has provided us with a direct route to the research storage chamber. We're going to rip through this facility and take Sari's clone apart!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: It is an aetherial entity, Captain Wolf, not a clone. And I must point out that your true objective is the summoner, rather than the servant.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Right, right, I knew that! As we planned, then! Summoner squad front and center─carve Forename a path through!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Aye, Captain.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra, you're in charge of finding whoever's pulling this impostor Sari's strings. Let's go!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Wonderful. You've done well to make it this far.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: The summoner has to be around here somewhere. Y'mhitra, use your gadget─I'll buy you some time.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: We came here to remove the seal you put on Principia. Do as we ask, and this can all end peacefully.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, “Captain.” I'm afraid I can't do that. To do so would run contrary to the purpose for which I was created.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Surely by now you have come to realize my true nature?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: You are an egi in the form of my creator─an existence made possible through a fusion of summoning magic and aetherochemical technology.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: But while Master Sari was the last of the great summoners of Allag, you are naught more than an elaborate imitation. And you are no match for the summoner who now stands before you!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Very good, but your conjecture has missed the mark. What I am is a defense mechanism that is capable of self-enhancement in order to combat ever greater threats.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Shall I phrase this in simple terms? In the event that I encounter a presence with greater potential than Sari, I am compelled to harness that potential through main force, and compose its aether into a new guardian entity.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: You mean to kill Forename and make an egi of the Warrior of Light!?

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Have we reached an understanding? A peaceable conclusion to this encounter was never forthcoming.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: His reasoning has broken down. Your deeds have saved countless lives, and will continue to do so. How can one justify killing you, MistressMaster, when you embody the very principles for which summoning magic was invented?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Y'mhitra! Any luck finding that summoner!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
I've just finished tracing the threads...
The camouflage is impressive, but I am still shocked that we missed something of that size.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Our true enemy...is up there!

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: How observant of you. You have uncovered master summoner Sari's greatest masterpiece: an artificially sentient evocation matrix.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: The complexity of my design simply cannot be compared to the primitive principles used in Principia's construction.

dialogue.name: SARI
dialogue.text: Your defeat is inevitable.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Tough talk for an aging machine whose logic channels have obviously rusted with disuse! MistressMaster, might you and your companions dispose of this unsightly and unseemly amalgamation of refuse?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Three at once...
Stay focused! We can afford no missteps!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
There'll be no false steps from us!
Isn't that right, Forename?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Potential confirmed as priority target for aetherial reconstitution. Evocation reinitialized.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
Thal's teeth, more of the damn things!?
Where does it end?

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Steel yourself, MistressMaster!
The machine means to overwhelm you!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Your combined strength is...unexpected.
Accessing security systems...reviving bioweapon.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
Sari's speech─it's become stilted!
It strains to maintain the charade!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
<buzz> Alert! Alert!
System overload detected. Deploying advanced security measures.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
Uh, I think we made it angry...
But that must mean we're winning!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
<buzz> Exterminate hostile entities!
Ex... Ex... Exterminate!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The system has recognized you as a legitimate threat.
Its primary directive is overridden! It means to destroy you by any means!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
<buzz> <buzz> <beeeeeep>
Exter... <buzz> ...minate...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
The machine is out of control!
One last push, MistressMaster, and victory will be yours!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
What in the seventh hell!
We can't fight all of them!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ignore the Sari-egi! Destroy the machine!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
Reinitializing assessment... Analysis failed...
Retry... Analysis failed... Unexpected error...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: We did it, Forename! We won!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text:
I never doubted you, MistressMaster.
May I suggest we now exit this unpleasant place?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: But I've fought...primals...ugh...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: An inspiring triumph, MistressMaster! Your coordination with Lady Y'mhitra and Captain Wolf was truly a thing of beauty!

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: I wish I could have seen your victory firsthand. As things stood, we were far too busy keeping the rest of the facility's hostiles at bay...

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Congratulations, misssir! Never in my wildest dreams did I imagine a thinking machine would be the villain behind all this chaos.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text:
So a machine built by Sari was summonin' an egi what looked like Sari...
Them Allagans didn't see much use for the line betwixt idea an' reality, did they?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Oh...hello. We were not to meet by the Warring Triad statues? I shall be there─I promise!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: MistressMaster? I thought you were on Azys Lla...? Now that I mention it, I thought I was on Azys Lla...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: A stunning victory, Forename! We've won the day, but Captain Wolf wished to stay behind and conduct a thorough search. I told him it was still too dangerous to wander around alone, but...

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: ...But the captain is a stubborn man. Not to worry, though─if aught should happen, we'll soon charge off to fight at his side.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text: Captain Wolf will call if he needs us, aye. We should be celebrating here! Does this not mean Prin's seal is now broken!?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: MistressMaster's success is indeed something to be celebrated. I was not crafted to experience emotion, but I do feel a certain rustle of satisfaction in my pages...

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Once ye've mastered them high-an'-mighty techniques, ye'll be stronger than ever... Well, I think I'd rather learn by yer example anyway, instead o' from musty scrolls written by some long-dead Allagan summoner!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: It is in the hopes of achieving just such an outcome that I awoke from my slumber. “The art of summoning is for the living,” as my creator was once so fond of declaring.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename, Prin, let us say our farewells for the moment. Thank you for your aid, everyone─we could not have done this without you!

dialogue.name: CRISPIN
dialogue.text: We will wait here for the captain. As much as I would've liked to assist you in the main battle, I am proud that we contributed to your success.

dialogue.name: DENISE
dialogue.text:
So a machine was using machines to summon egi...
Can you even call that magic anymore? Or is it just another form of technology...?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Don't get lazy with yer summonin', now! The next time we meet, I mean to be yer equal in the art!

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: I completed a thorough investigation of the research facility before I left. My findings were worth the time and the danger, I think!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, MistressMaster. It is almost “that time”...

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename! You were only meant to face three challenges, and we ended up chasing your prize into the heavens themselves.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: An unexpected development which you handled with exceptional grace, MistressMaster. And now, at long last, I can finally bequeath to you the highest secrets of summoning! Pray step forward!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: What a momentous occasion! The wisdom of the last of Allag's master summoners is yours!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ere you depart to explore your newfound powers, however, Captain Wolf has a report for us. It should explain much of what occurred on Azys Lla...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Aye, well I wanted to be sure that machine was truly undone, and after poking around inside it I discovered a number of soul crystals. According to Principia, they belonged to Sari's disciples.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: The captain also unearthed a tomestone containing undoctored records of that age. 'Twould seem that following the murder of his students, Sari became increasingly bitter.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: He began to doubt that the future could be safely entrusted to the capricious whims of mortals. Instead he explored other methods by which new generations might be safeguarded from the threat of primals, and committed himself to aetherochemical research.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As you may have surmised, the evocation matrix was the end result of Master Sari's toil. Drawing on its embedded soul crystals and unrivaled computational power, this terrible invention was capable of manifesting a veritable host of aetherial avatars...

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Once he was satisfied with his work, Sari commanded the machine to act as civilization's mightiest guardian. And then he killed himself. His aetherial essence was absorbed, and a formidable egi was added to his invention's arsenal.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: So now you know the truth of it.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text:
What a price to pay to ensure that the art of summoning survived unto the morrow...
After failing to protect his disciples, I wonder if he meant to preserve their soul crystals in their stead?

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Even if that were his intention, he chose the wrong way to achieve it.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Prin here is the embodiment of the hopeful ideals of Sari's younger self. The murderous machine of his latter years is the product of frustration and anger and grief.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, but what shall we do with the crystals? We cannot risk them falling into the hands of another villain like Tristan...

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: If you wish, I could swallow the crystals and hold them safe until another era has need of them. My enchantments would ensure that they pass only into the hands of the worthy.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: Swallow...? You mean to eat them!?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Fear not, Captain: I have no digestive tract of which to speak. And now that I have instructed MistressMaster in the wisdom of Allag, this task shall be the last I perform ere I return to slumber.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Wait...so this is farewell!?

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Correct. Or, mayhap more appropriately, “good night”.

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: As a familiar, I was not enspelled to experience loneliness. I was, however, written with the knowledge that it is best not to draw out a parting of ways with needless sentimentality.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text: No tears for you then, eh, Prin!

dialogue.name: PRINCIPIA
dialogue.text: Summoning magic was created to combat the threat of the primals. The ideal world is one in which I need never again awaken. Wield the art well, MistressMaster.

dialogue.name: DANCINGWOLF
dialogue.text:
...Off to dreamland, just like that. I suppose Prin's purpose is served, and that's the same as happiness to a familiar.
Speaking of serving one's purpose, I think it's time I took my leave.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Aye, the tasks of the morrow beckon to us all. Let us do what we may, so that Prin might rest peacefully for many years to come!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the summoner quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “A Tearful Reunion.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next summoner quest will be available from Y'mhitra.

obj.n: ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
ダンシング・ウルフ大闘士
チャンネリングチェスト【ILv290】

quest.name: ふたりと、もうひとり
journal: Jehantel's eyes light up at the sight of you.

His voice brimming with delight, Jehantel informs you that Sanson, with whom you previously journeyed, has succeeded in gaining official approval for his bard unit. Even now, the young serpent captain rounds up members for its maiden mission, in relation to which he apparently has a favor to ask of you. Take yourself to Quiver's Hold in Gridania and see what your friend requires.

Greeting you warmly, Sanson requests your participation in his unit's first outing. If you would lend him your aid, join him at the Adders' Nest, where he will receive his orders from Commander Vorsaile Heuloix.

An anonymous letter has arrived at the Adders' Nest, which claims the existence of a tome bearing a damning secret pertaining to the Autumn War. In order to curb the growing anti-Ala Mhigan sentiment among Gridanians, the Order of the Twin Adder has decided to dispatch Sanson's newly formed unit to investigate. Head to Nine Ivies in the East Shroud and seek out the letter's mysterious sender.

At Nine Ivies, you make contact with the letter's sender, a native of Gridania named Nourval. The young man claims to be descended from a soldier who fought in the Autumn War, and based on his parents' account, the tome in question is to be found somewhere in Gyr Abania. He offers to assist in the search on the condition that he is permitted to join it, and Sanson relents. Make your way now to Castrum Oriens, which lies on the region's fringes.

At Nourval's recommendation, Sanson decides that the unit will remain in Castrum Oriens for a while to gather information. Take a rest for now, and be ready to depart when your comrades are done making their respective inquiries.

※The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Sanson at Quiver's Hold.
Speak with Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.
Speak with the letter's sender at Nine Ivies.
Speak with Nourval at Castrum Oriens.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, my dear Forename. How good of you to pay me a visit, and a timely one at that. Our friend Sanson, with whom you journeyed─I met with him but recently, and it pleases me to say that his labors have finally borne fruit.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Aye, his proposal for a unit incorporating bards has received formal approval. Even as we speak, he is rounding up members for the unit's inaugural mission.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Now, during our conversation, Sanson mentioned that he had a favor to ask of you. In case you haven't yet heard from him, mayhap you could seek him out first. You are like to find him at Quiver's Hold.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In case you haven't yet heard from Sanson, mayhap you could seek him out first. You are like to find him at Quiver's Hold.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I wasn't otherwise engaged, so I thought I would come along. Go on and see what it is Sanson requires of you.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Forename, it's so good to see you! Our hard work has paid off, my friend: I've received permission to establish my bard unit! Moreover, we've already been assigned our first mission!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I couldn't be more pleased...save for one practical concern: our new recruits yet lack the experience to embark on an honest-to-gods mission.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: In seeking to fill our ranks, I immediately thought of you, Forename. You are an exemplary among bards, and I should be greatly heartened for your participation in our maiden outing.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I've also taken the liberty of requesting Guydelot's transfer to the unit. With your combined experience and skill, we are bound to leave a splendid first impression!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Now then, I will go to receive my orders from Commander Heuloix. May I assume that you will join me?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: May I say that I, too, have a vested interest in young Sanson's success. I should be personally grateful were you to lend him your aid, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Let us see what manner of mission the commander has in store.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: With you on board, our success is all but assured.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: If it isn't Forename[GC Rank] Surname. By all accounts, you were instrumental in the success of Captain Smyth's previous expedition. We are glad for your cooperation.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Now then, allow me to brief you on the mission. Our order has received an anonymous letter, one that makes certain...claims. We would have your unit verify the truth of it.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: (-Anonymous Letter-)There is a tome that holds a damning secret pertaining to the Autumn War. Should you desire it, send your most capable to Nine Ivies. I will be waiting.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: ...The war between Gridania and Ala Mhigo? But that ended a hundred years ago. I labor to imagine what secret could exist that should be so damning even now. Might this not be an ill-conceived prank, Commander?

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Our leadership believes it likely, to be sure, but it is not a risk they are willing to take. Nay, not with the winds of public sentiment blowing as they are.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: You all know that our order is involved in the Alliance's campaign to liberate Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: You all know that our order is involved in the Alliance's relief efforts for the recently liberated Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Well, there are those among the citizenry that disapprove, a small but determined faction that refuses to forget the wrongs of a century past. They still view Ala Mhigo as the enemy, and ardently oppose our reaching out a hand of succor.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Naught potentially incendiary can be allowed to stoke the people's discontent, and we must move quickly. Your mission is to make contact with the letter's sender and ascertain the nature of the secret.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)...You call that a mission? A bloody errand, more like. Couldn't be arsed to handle it yourselves, so you foist it on the eager new unit.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And if the secret proves inconvenient for Gridania, what then? Will you sweep it under the rug, along with all our hard work?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot, mind your tongue! You are addressing a superior officer!

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Ah, so you are the famous Guydelot. Worry not, my friend. Whatever the secret turns out to be, I give you my personal assurance that you and yours will receive due credit for its discovery.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: That's good enough for me. It's been forever since me and Forename last performed together, and I just want to enjoy the moment─no complicating factors, you know?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The Autumn War is an emotional subject for Gridanians, the older generation especially. And for us bards, it is also notable for the involvement of singing archers.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In the course of your mission, I daresay there will be much to reflect upon and many opportunities to grow. I wish the three of you the best of luck.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Without further ado, let us make haste to Nine Ivies...before Guydelot can exercise any more indiscretion.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: There is no telling who─or what─awaits at Camp Nine Ivies. See to it you spare no preparation.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Unless I'm mistaken, this is our mysterious sender.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: This our man, you reckon?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)Well met, friends. I'm Nourval, a humble citizen of Gridania, and I see you received my letter.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We've come as you bid. The tome, if you would be so kind.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)Ah, but I never said that I had it. And to be clear, I do not.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: What? Then why did you summon us here?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)Patience, my friends. I will explain. You see, like many Gridanians, I have an ancestor who fought in the Autumn War. 'Twas he who first learned of the tome in question, after the fighting had ended.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)In turn, I learned of it from my parents, and since then I've dreamed of poring over its pages. Alas, as it lies deep within Ala Mhigan territory, I was resigned never to have the chance.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)But then the brave soldiers of the Alliance took Baelsar's Wall, and the way was made clear. When I heard the tidings, the flames of my boyhood passion were rekindled. Finally, I can fulfill my dream!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)...Or so I told myself, before I thought better of it. I'm no soldier, you see, and the prospect of wandering a war-ravaged land in search of a tome is, frankly, unrealistic. That's why I decided to reach out to your order for cooperation.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)Based on my parents' account, I'm confident that I can track down the tome. And I will help you to find it. I ask only that you take me with you.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)...So what say you? I'm but a commoner and know little of the ways of nations, but it seems to me such secrets as the tome conceals could be harmful to diplomatic relations. Is this not so?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: So if we wish to find the tome, we must agree to your company. Quite a demand to make of your nation.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Heh, you've got stones, that's for sure. I like it!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Are you serious? A civilian is essentially holding us to ransom, and you praise him for his stones?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Look at it this way: we didn't know the tome existed, nor have we the faintest where to look for it. Better to have help than to fumble about blind, I reckon. Come on, Forename, back me up here.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Seems we have no choice.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He sure has stones.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I suppose you have the right of it. Whether we like it or not, we would struggle without Nourval's knowledge.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You, too, Forename? Are appearances truly that important to a bard? <sigh> Setting aside this talk of stones for a moment, I'll not deny that we would struggle without Nourval's knowledge.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Very well, we agree to your terms. And here is ours: you must obey our orders at all times.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)To the letter, sir! You shan't regret bringing me on!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: First, we will make for Castrum Oriens, presently held by the Order of the Twin Adder. Thence we shall make our way into the unknown.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to continue this quest, you must first undertake the main scenario quest “Beyond the Great Wall.”

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And here we are, at the easternmost reaches of the Twelveswood. The journey has scarcely begun, but already I am keenly grateful for your company, Forename.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Soldiers from all nations, all in one place─a veritable gold mine of songs and stories if I've ever seen one!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)The armies of the four nations, united under one banner and one purpose. A sight to stir the spirit!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Well? Where to now?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)Pray do not be hasty, Master Sanson. Before we venture into the wilds of Gyr Abania, we would do well to acquaint ourselves with the lay of the land.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)As a serpent captain, it should be a simple matter for you to secure permission for us to remain here. Just long enough to get our bearings.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Hmmm, I suppose it would only be prudent...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Very well, I will request permission of command.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And I'll get right to bonding with the locals! Always wanted to compare songs from the four nations...and the liquor besides, hehehe!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: (-Nourval-)Master Guydelot is quite a character, isn't he?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Aye, that he is. Pay him no mind. Now then, I will make my own inquiries. In the meantime, you are to lay low and refrain from bothering the garrison. Understood?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Forename, Guydelot and I shall tend to business here. Pray take your ease until we are ready to depart.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 覆面の男たち
journal: Sanson is at his wit's end with Nourval.

Against Sanson's express instructions to lay low in the garrison, Nourval has been doing anything but, approaching and questioning every single soldier about. While Sanson keeps an eye on the froward civilian, he bids you find Guydelot and ask what your fellow bard has been able to glean from the locals.

Instead of sharing his findings, Guydelot saddles you with a task. Masked bandits have been terrorizing the area of late, and your fellow bard would have you investigate a Twin Adder scout who is late to report back. While Guydelot keeps an eye on a suspicious Nourval, he bids you make your way to the northeast of the Fringes towards Schism, where the soldier was headed.
Near Pike Falls, you find the Twin Adder scout at the mercy of the masked bandits, and promptly drive away the assailants. With the area secured, render assistance to the ailing scout.

The Twin Adder scout thanks you for your timely intervention, and observes that the bandits seemed to know of his coming in advance and sought to bar his path. Take word of the encounter back to your comrades at Castrum Oriens.

At Sanson's insistence, Nourval reveals that the tome rests in a place connected to Gylbarde, the renowned general who led the Ala Mhigan forces during the Autumn War. Putting two and two together, Guydelot suggests that the bandits may also be after the tome. The possibility seems to rattle Nourval, who excuses himself in spite of Sanson's protests. At this time, Guydelot reveals that Nourval has been stealing out of the castrum while your backs are turned. Sanson decides to allow Nourval to act freely in order to learn his true purpose, and bids you stand at the ready for whatever may come to pass.

※The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Look for Guydelot.
Look for the Twin Adder scout.
Aid the Twin Adder scout.
Speak with Guydelot.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Though I am but a humble civilian, I shall endeavor to make myself useful.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Gah! I can't believe I'm saying this, but Nourval might be an even bigger pain than Guydelot!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Despite my express instructions to keep out of the garrison's way, what does he do but go and bother every single soldier about? And now everyone here looks at us askance!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: <sigh> I brought a tome to record mission details, but instead I'm filling it with the names of those to whom I must apologize...

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: I'm sorry if I've caused trouble, but it's simply more efficient that I make the inquiries myself. What a man says amounts to only half the story; how he says it gives you the rest.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Besides, I felt compelled to make up for Master Guydelot. All he seemed to be doing was drinking and singing.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Well, appearances can be deceiving with him. He has his own way of acquiring information. Speaking of which, I am curious as to what he has learned.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Forename, might I ask you to look around the castrum for him? I will keep a close eye on Nourval in the meantime.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot will be somewhere in the castrum, making his inquiries with a lyre in one hand and a cup in the other. Please find him and ask what he has managed to learn.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Quite a character indeed, hehehe...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Sanson wants to know what I know, does he? Well, might be as I've learned a thing or two, but I ain't ready to share 'em yet.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Still need to clear up some details, see, and I'm not one for unfinished tales. It ain't bardly, as I'm sure you can appreciate.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Seeing as you're here, though, there is something I could use a hand with.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Of late, masked bandits have been terrorizing the area. Not even Alliance soldiers are safe, it seems. The brazen bastards set on a patrol just the other day.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And now, a Twin Adder scout's late to return, and chances are the bandits are at it again. I want you to go and check things out.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I'd go myself, but I need to keep an eye on our friend Nourval. He's been acting queer since we got here.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: There'll be more to tell later, but for now you'd best be on your way. The soldier was bound for Schism, the ruins to the northeast of here.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Not only does he refuse to divulge his findings, but he sets you a task instead? Well, knowing Guydelot, we must assume he has his reasons. Please do as he asks.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Remember, the Twin Adder scout was bound for Schism, the ruins to the northeast of here. I'll keep an eye on Nourval in the meantime.

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: More of them!

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: That's as far as you go!

dialogue.name: SERPENTSOLDIER02891
dialogue.text: Th-Thank you... They fell upon me with nary a warning.

dialogue.name: SERPENTSOLDIER02891
dialogue.text: They knew I was coming. We alter our patrol routes on a regular basis, but they knew. What's more, it was as though they were barring my way.

dialogue.name: SERPENTSOLDIER02891
dialogue.text: But now is not the time for speculation. I must take word of this back to my superiors. My thanks again, friend.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot refuses to say a word until you return. I tell myself he has his reasons, but gods it's irritating.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: I ask you, how is a man supposed to go about his business when he is constantly watched? And I merely wish to be helpful.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: There you are, Forename. So, what happened? Was it the bandits after all?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Masked bandits in the area, and you had an encounter with them!? Thank the Matron you did not come to harm!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot, why did you not see fit to share this with us?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Aye, well, I knew it was nothing Forename couldn't handle alone. Besides, I had some business of my own, someone to keep an eye on.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: ...I cannot imagine who that might be. Master Guydelot─I owe you an apology. I had assumed in err that you were not doing your work. Unorthodox though your methods may be, there is no doubting their efficacy.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Ain't no trick to what I do. Everyone's got a song what's close to their hearts, and with a bit of camaraderie in the cups, they'll tell you what it is. Then I strum 'em their song over a heart-to-heart, is all.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Thanks to Guydelot, we were able to learn of the recent incidents. So I ask you, will you not have a little faith in us?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: I'm not certain I understand.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Look, Nourval. We've made a stop here at your request, that we might gather information for our search. But not once did you tell us what it is we should look for.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: By now we have more than a solid grasp of the region beyond. What should we do next?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Oh my, did I neglect to tell you? My profoundest apologies. The tome we seek─it's said to rest in a place connected to Gylbarde, the general who led the Ala Mhigan forces during the Autumn War.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Now that you mention it, the masked bandits appeared on the way to Schism. And Gylbarde was a known devotee of the Fist of Rhalgr. Just taking a wild stab here, but might be as they're also after the tome.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: An unsettling notion. Should that be the case, we haven't any time to waste. I will go and make some inquiries immediately.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: W-Wait! I didn't give you perm─

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Leave him. There's something you two need to know.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I got this from a soldier, but Nourval's been sneaking outside the castrum while our backs were turned.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Bastards's been acting right fishy since we got here, and he tensed up good when the subject of the masked bandits came up.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Whatever his true motives may be, we must bring them to light. Rather than reel him in, let us give him some line to act.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: There is no telling what Nourval will do next. While we keep watch, please see that you are ready to deal with anything.

quest.name: 紅葉戦争の秘密
journal: Sanson is poised to pounce upon Nourval.

Following extended surveillance, Sanson and Guydelot are confident that Nourval is in league with the masked bandits. In order to catch the man red-handed, Sanson has contrived to lure him out of the castrum with his guard lowered. Find Nourval inside the stronghold and lead him into thinking that the way is clear.
You inform Nourval that your two comrades are tied up, and the man takes the bait and hastens away. Join Sanson outside the castrum.

Sanson is pleased that his ploy has worked, and even now Guydelot shadows Nourval to his destination. Make your way to the ruin called Gyr Kehim to the northeast and join your fellow bard on the chase.

You catch Nourval meeting with the masked bandits, who have found the tome you seek─the journal of the Ala Mhigan general Gylbarde. Eavesdropping on their conversation, you learn their true purpose: stoking the fires of anti-Ala Mhigan sentiment. Determined not to let this come to pass, your party confronts Nourval's, and at the end of a fierce confrontation, you emerge the victor and with the journal in your hands.

The defeated Nourval flees the scene, but not before revealing that he is descended from Vainchelon. And in turn, the journal reveals that Vainchelon did not die of illness as is believed, but rather was poisoned by Gylbarde at a secret meeting. The revelation comes as a shock to Sanson and Guydelot, who worry what may happen should the truth be made public knowledge. There is clearly much to mull over; for now, return to Castrum Oriens with your comrades.

Back at Castrum Oriens, Sanson shares with you further details from the journal. It appears that one of Vainchelon's sons was present at the deadly meeting, and he alone managed to escape with his life. But rather than tell of events as they happened, he kept the truth of his sire's demise a secret. Even as the man's motive boggles him, Sanson must turn his attention to his own dilemma: deciding what to do with Gylbarde's journal. Though he knows in his mind that the truth is best kept buried, in his heart he is not wholly convinced, and begs you for more time to consider the matter.

※The next bard quest will be available from Sanson upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with Nourval.
Join Sanson outside Castrum Oriens.
Join Guydelot on the chase.
Speak with Sanson.
Defeat Nourval!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Whatever shenanigans Nourval's up to, we're gonna find out.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We've continued our surveillance of Nourval's activities. It's beyond a shadow of a doubt that he has an ulterior motive.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: In order to find the tome, it's past time we took our search to the field, but always he finds an excuse to stall.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Whenever I suggest investigating this ruin or that, he will inevitably claim we haven't enough information. 'Tis plain he doesn't want us out there.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Nay, bastard wants all that outside goodness for himself. But try as we might, we haven't been able to find out where he sneaks off to. Warier than a bird, that one.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, the masked bandits continue ambushing Alliance patrols, and they always know exactly where and when to strike. It's as though they have insider knowledge of patrol routes.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The only explanation being there's a mole in the garrison leaking them intelligence.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And who could that mole be save for Nourval? Every move of his marks him as the prime suspect.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We know little and less of Nourval's plot, but it can only lead to ill. We must needs bring it to light, and swiftly, before he can do any more harm.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: To that end, Guydelot and I have been keeping Nourval close, allowing him no chance to act. By now he will be positively itching to rendezvous with his accomplices.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And this is where you come in, Forename. We need you to feed Nourval some false information─that I am in an Alliance meeting, and Guydelot...a drunken stupor.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Our man will not pass up the chance to sneak out, and he is like to do so with greater haste than usual. This will afford us an opening to shadow him to his destination.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: ...Drunken stupor? Really?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Not so flattering, I know, but you cannot deny that it's believable.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Now then, Forename, pray go to Nourval and plant our misinformation. Once you have done so, come and meet us outside the castrum.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: ...Both of them unavailable? And there I was ready to strike out on the trail of a promising lead!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Well, disappointing though it is, the search will have to wait. Now, if you will excuse me, I have some business to attend to.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: It worked, my friend! Nourval rushed out of the castrum not a moment ago!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: He was headed east, towards a ruin called Gyr Kehim. Guydelot trails him even as we speak. Come, let us join the chase.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: What is he up to?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: It's a good old-fashioned tryst. Let's have us a peek, shall we?

dialogue.name: MASKMAN02892
dialogue.text: We have it, my lord! Turned it up among his retainer's possessions!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: At long last, Gylbarde's journal...and not a moment too soon. I'd just about outstayed my welcome at the garrison.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: When that adventurer caught us falling upon the patrol, I had feared that the game was up.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: But thankfully, the other two were blind fools. All this time watching me, and they didn't see a thing. Hehehe...

dialogue.name: MASKMAN02892
dialogue.text: We've only skimmed the tome, but it seems you were right. About what happened to Lord Vainchelon.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Was there ever any doubt? Once we return to Gridania and make this knowledge public, none shall harbor so much as a shred of sympathy for Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: That shall pave the way for us to propagate Lord Vainchelon's will...and advance our agenda.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: At last we've uncovered Nourval's purpose, and the tome is right before our eyes, no less.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Commander Heuloix spoke of a faction that vehemently opposes our aiding Ala Mhigo. I daresay we have found them.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But how did Nourval come to lead such a crew? And what is this talk of Vainchelon?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: What, the Gridanian general sung about in nigh a hundred songs, who led our forces against Gylbarde in the Autumn War?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Only to die of an illness before the fighting was over. Aye, the very same. Having lost his leadership, we would have lost the war entirely had the other nations not come to our aid.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Don't know about the rest of you, but it seems to me our damning little secret pertains to Vainchelon.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And Nourval seeks to use it to stoke the fires of anti-Ala Mhigan sentiment to some sinister end. This cannot be borne─we cannot let them have the journal! Are you with me?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Hmph, perhaps you are not such blind fools after all. Very well, take your journal.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Aye, take it! Read it! Know the vile crime the Ala Mhigans committed against Lord Vainchelon─against my own blood! And see the folly of aiding such honorless people!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Wh-What do you mean, your own blood?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Did I mishear? Did he just say that Vainchelon was his ancestor?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Aye, that's what it sounded like. Vainchelon, the folk hero loved by all, celebrated in countless songs...and that pain in the rear's his descendant. Never would've guessed. Anyroad, we've got bigger concerns. Let's see what this musty old tome's hiding.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: “To Vainchelon I extended an invitation to negotiate peace. The meeting must be in secret, I explained, for not all of my officers share my view. My opponent accepted and arrived at the appointed hour.”

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Peace? Everybody knows there weren't no peace on offer. The hells' this about?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Wait, it continues: “Without suspicion, he took his seat. And without suspicion, he drank the poisoned wine. The effect was swift and sure, and within moments the man lay dead at my feet.”

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Wait, Vainchelon was murdered? By poison!?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: To this day, Lord Vainchelon remains an object of worship among many Gridanians. Were they to learn of this, the present grumblings against Ala Mhigan liberation are liable to grow into large-scale protests.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: To this day, Lord Vainchelon remains an object of worship among many Gridanians. Were they to learn of this, it would pose a serious and ongoing impediment to diplomatic relations.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: There's no denying that some Ala Mhigans did some terrible things in the past, but what Nourval's trying to do ain't no better. Might be as he's after the truth, but nothing good'll come of this, and certainly not any decent songs.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The truth... Tell me, Guydelot. When we surrender this journal to our superiors, what do you think they would do with the knowledge?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The Seedseers aside, I reckon the brass hats at the Adders' Nest would want to cover it up. Bury it nice and deep and pretend it never existed.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Aye... Nor would I put it past them to exploit the knowledge to gain leverage in dealings with Ala Mhigo. But whatever they may do is none of our concern, is it? Duty compels us to hand the journal over to headquarters...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You're the leader of our merry band, Sanson, and duty compels me to obey your orders, shite though they often are. You decide whether we hand over the journal or not.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot would entrust this decision to me. But what of you, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You should decide.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We should all decide.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Yes, that would only be proper. As the leader, mine is the burden of decision.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: No, forgive me this unseemly display. Guydelot has the right of it. As the leader, mine is the burden of decision.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: At any rate, this ain't the place for moral dilemmas. Let's get ourselves back to the castrum afore Nourval and his mates decide they want to have another go.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Sanson's still trying to make up his mind. Well, not like I'm in a hurry or nothing.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot has disappeared somewhere in the castrum. Giving me room to ponder matters, I shouldn't doubt.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I've since read through Gylbarde's journal, and I'm afraid there is no two ways about it. He summoned Vainchelon under the pretense of peace, and then slew him with poison.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: However, one mystery remains. It appears one of Vainchelon's sons was present at the fateful meeting.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Landrenel was his name, and he narrowly escaped with his life. But instead of crying bloody murder, he announced that his sire had died of illness.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Here is a man who witnessed his own flesh and blood slain, and in the most underhanded manner, yet he concealed the truth. Why did he do this? I do not understand...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But it avails us naught to agonize over the motives of those who lived in the past. Nay, our quandary concerns the future.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: For the future of both nations, the truth is best kept buried. No good can come of digging it up. 'Tis crystal clear what must be done.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And yet, though my mind sees the logic, my heart rebels against the idea. Forgive me, Forename. It seems I require more time to think on it.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Nourval! We cannot allow you to have that tome!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: H-How did you─!? ...No matter! You'll not stand in my way!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: So you want to do this the hard way, eh?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: He leaves us no choice!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Have at them!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Damn! Was more o' them in the ruin!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I leave them to you and Forename!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Poisoned arrows!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Hmph, pesky archers! Somebody deal with 'em!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Now! Fan out!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: How many friends has he got!?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Not good...

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: The time for charades is past! I will show you the technique of my ancestors!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: What is he─!?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Urgh! Wh-Whence comes this power!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Damn... Bastard's full of surprises...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You must...finish this...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Bugger it all... Get that bastard for me...

quest.name: それぞれの決断
journal: Sanson is on the verge of making a decision on the tome.

Having heard your honest opinion, Sanson has made up his mind on what to do with the journal bearing the Autumn War's sordid secret. Go with him to Guydelot, and hear his announcement with your brother bard.

Sanson declares that he will surrender Gylbarde's journal to his superiors, but only on the condition that the truth is made known one day, when the people are ready to hear it. At that moment, a letter arrives from Nourval requesting to speak with you, and you alone. Although Guydelot is highly suspicious, Sanson chooses to believe that Nourval may in fact have something of import to discuss, and bids you meet him near the Percipient One in Dimwold.

As you arrive at the rendezvous point, you are ambushed by masked men, and end up trading blows with them instead of words with Nourval. Hasten back to Castrum Oriens and inform your comrades what has happened.

You return to the castrum to find Guydelot alone. It appears a second letter arrived shortly after you struck out, this time summoning Sanson, and it becomes apparent that he was Nourval's target all along. Follow Guydelot as he retraces Sanson's footsteps in the direction of the Percipient One.

You find Sanson's notebook bearing a message written in blood. As feared, Nourval has taken your friend, and will soon make his price known. Return to Gridania and join Guydelot at the Adders' Nest, where he will petition the order's aid.

Though Guydelot has reported the situation to his superiors, he holds on to Gylbarde's journal as insurance. While waiting to see how the order and Nourval will move, your comrade bids you rest up and conserve your strength, for it will surely be needed in the rescue mission to come.

※The next bard quest will be available from Guydelot upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Guydelot.
Wait for Nourval at the Percipient One.
Speak with Guydelot.
Speak with Guydelot at the Adders' Nest.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Sanson's still trying to make up his mind. Well, not like I'm in a hurry or nothing.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The instant we hand Gylbarde's journal to headquarters, the truth of Vainchelon's death is all but guaranteed to be struck from history...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I've thought long and hard on a course of action─what we should do with the tome─and I believe I'm drawing close to the answer.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Before I make my decision, however, I would ask your honest opinion. Do you think the sordid truth of the Autumn War should be made public knowledge? Even should it jeopardize our relations with Ala Mhigo?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What should we do with the truth?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Make it public knowledge.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Keep it a secret.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Ascertain its credibility.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: An upright choice from an upright womanman. Though Nourval's motives and methods are unconscionable, one cannot deny that there is justice in pursuing truth.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: A practical choice from a practical womanman. As a man of the military, it should be mine also. Though the truth would be lost, it is arguably a small sacrifice to make in the face of potential chaos.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Verily, a sound choice demands a sound grasp of the situation. As ever, you are an island of calm reason amidst a sea of chaos.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. As the leader of our unit, I am now ready to make my decision.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Let us find Guydelot. He will wish to hear it, too.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: When the both of you are ready, I will announce my decision.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: So, you've made up your mind, then? About what to do with the truth?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I have. I shall go to the Adders' Nest and entrust the journal to our superiors' care. Above all, we cannot allow it to be used as an instrument of hatred.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Having said that, neither will I stand for the truth to be erased. I will oppose any attempt to do so with all my being.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Er, I'm not sure I understand. What do you want to do exactly?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I will hand over the journal...on the condition that the truth be revealed one day, when the people are ready to accept it.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Call me indecisive, but I cannot bear to see the tome misused, nor the truth willfully buried.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Well, well, look at you! Sanson the Stiff, standing his ground!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Goes without saying, but I'm with you, Chief. Ain't no one gonna exploit or erase history on my watch.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friends. For trusting in me.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Don't let it get to your head, though, eh? Had your decision not been to my liking, I would've knocked you flat on your arse and resigned from your swivin' unit.

dialogue.name: SANSON
