dialogue.text: So much for “You decide”... <sigh> Never change, Guydelot.

dialogue.name: SERPENTSOLDIER02893
dialogue.text: Captain Sanson, right? Some fellow asked me to pass this letter to you.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Th-This is from Nourval!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: (-Nourval's Letter-)The journal is yours to do with as you wish. But ere you take it away, I would speak with Forename, and Forename alone, one last time. I await you in Dimwold, by the Percipient One.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Oh, this reeks. Tell me it don't.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But if this is a trap, why would Nourval ask for the strongest of all of us? He may truly have something important to say.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Conversely, it would also offer us a chance to convey our intent. I am loath to expose you to danger, my friend, but will you go to this meeting?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I don't like the idea of you going alone, but that'd defeat the purpose of the meeting. At the first sign of danger, though, get out of there fast, alright?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: This may be our last chance to speak with Nourval. Please go to Dimwold and see what he has to say.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: First sign of trouble, you beat a retreat, alright?

dialogue.name: BALLOON
dialogue.text: We've been waiting for you.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Ah, you're back. But where's Sanson?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Another letter arrived right after you left, asked for him to come as well. You're really alone, then?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Swive me! You were just the diversion─Sanson was their real target!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I thought it'd be alright seeing as you'd be there, but I should've gone as well! Gods strike me down for a fool!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: If you didn't see Sanson, they must've nabbed him on the way to Dimwold. Come on, we have to find him!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Sanson's book was lyin' here. They left a message in blood, the godsdamned mummers.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
“We have your friend. We will send our price to the Adders' Nest.”
...That whoreson can take his ransom and shove it up his arse! We're gonna storm their hideout, tear 'em all new ones, and free Sanson!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: We must keep calm.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: We don't know where they are.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Dammit, Forename, how can you always be so calm? It's downright contagious. And you're right, of course. If we charge in, we'd be putting Sanson at risk.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Dammit, Forename, how can you always be so calm? It's downright contagious. And you're right, of course. We don't even know where the bastards've taken Sanson.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: We need help if we're gonna save him. Come on, let's hurry back to Gridania, to the Adders' Nest.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I've just reported the situation. They're gonna call a meeting to talk strategy.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: As for Gylbarde's journal...I'm still holding on to it. Told 'em it's for the chief to hand over. They were none too pleased, fancy that.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Y'see, unlike our friend Sanson, I don't have much faith in the order. Don't trust 'em to act in our best interests. The journal's our bargaining chip, not only with them but Nourval besides.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Would be good to bring old Jehantel into it as well. He'd want to know, and might even have some sage advice to share.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: But for now, we sit tight─wait and see what the order and Nourval will do. And then we plan some doings of our own. Till then, rest up and save your strength, Forename. We're gonna need it.

quest.name: 想い込められし歌
journal: Guydelot is keenly waiting to see how the Order of the Twin Adder will move.

The Order of the Twin Adder has made its will known: they refuse to negotiate with Nourval, effectively abandoning Sanson to his fate. As Guydelot lets vent his fury at the heartless decision, Commander Heuloix emerges as an ally, revealing that he has already recruited the aid of Gridania's martial guilds for Sanson's rescue. Speak with Luciane and Ywain at the Archers' and Lancers' Guilds respectively, and inform them that the mission will soon commence.
Both the archers and the lancers are ready to strike out. Take word back to Commander Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.

In urgent tones, Commander Heuloix informs you that the Order of the Twin Adder has ascertained Nourval's hideout, and will soon deploy troops for an assault. Unless you get there first, Sanson is as good as dead. Make haste to the North Shroud, and join Guydelot at Alder Springs.
With help from your allies, you succeed in subduing Nourval and liberating Sanson. Rejoin your comrades in the North Shroud.

At first, Nourval clings to his hatred for Ala Mhigo, but confronted with the truth of his ancestors' hearts, he is forced to concede the error of his ways. Reaching out to his erstwhile captor, Sanson swears to see to it that Vainchelon's sacrifice is not forgotten. With the situation now under control, turn your attention to Sanson and ensure that he is well.
Thanking you for his preservation, Sanson declares his intent to make good on his promise to Nourval. Return with your comrades to Gridania, and seek out Commander Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.

Commander Heuloix listens intently as Sanson states his terms for surrendering Gylbarde's journal: when the time is right, the Order of the Twin Adder must release the truth of Vainchelon's death to the public. The commander promises to do all within his power to make it so, and encourages Sanson to rise through the ranks that he, too, might join his voice to the cause. While Guydelot keeps watch over his recovering chief, seek out Jehantel at his campsite west of Quarrymill, and report the conclusion of events.

Jehantel expresses his hopes that Nourval will find a new path─one that leads to peace in the world and in his heart. With you and yours leading the way, the ideals of peace and harmony may yet be restored to Vainchelon's line, made bolder still by a true remembrance of the past.

※The next bard quest will be available from Jehantel once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”
objectives: Speak with Luciane at the Archers' Guild.
Speak with Ywain at the Lancers' Guild.
Speak with Vorsaile Heuloix.
Rendezvous with Guydelot at Alder Springs.
Rendezvous with Guydelot at Alder Springs.
Speak with Sanson.
Speak with Vorsaile Heuloix at the Adders' Nest.
Speak with Jehantel to the west of Quarrymill.
Defeat Nourval!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Good timing, Forename. Nourval's demands've just arrived at the Adders' Nest.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: In exchange for Sanson's freedom, we're to release the contents of Gylbarde's journal to the public. Bastard won't be satisfied until all Gridanians hate all Ala Mhigans' guts.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The brass hats're deliberating a course of action as we speak. Not much we can do now but wait.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Command has made its decision.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: You will not wish to hear this...but the order rejects Nourval's demands. He and his band are to be summarily eliminated.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: What!? H-Hold on just a second! You won't even try to negotiate Sanson's release!?

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: As a nation, we cannot bow to acts of intimidation; I'm afraid negotiation was never an option. And here I must repeat the order for you to relinquish the journal at once.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: So what you're saying is, you're abandoning Sanson! You're gonna let him die!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Here's the great Vainchelon, hero to all Gridanians, but you won't even lend an ear to his descendant! Oh no, instead you choose the easy way out! Just kill everyone, even your own man! Wash away the bloody past with more blood!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Just to be clear, I ain't siding with Nourval─there's no excusing his method! But there's no excusing yours either! It's bullshite, that's what it is!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Aye, it's bullshite.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I've lost faith in the order.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Now, now, pray do not so be so quick to despair, for I was simply relaying the outcome of command's deliberation. A deliberation in which the Elder Seedseer had no part.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: As you say, Guydelot, the orders are “bullshite”─not the words I would have chosen, but you speak the truth nonetheless. And I, for one, have no intention of abiding by them.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: The decision was largely influenced by a small handful of our leadership, and not the boldest handful, if I may add. 'Tis plain from the fact that they did not think to bring the matter before the Elder Seedseer.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Captain Smyth is a dear comrade; like you, I would spare no aid in any effort to rescue him. And I am pleased to say that we are not alone in this sentiment. As a matter of fact, I have already reached out to my lancer and archer acquaintances, and they stand ready to aid our cause.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Oho, now we're talking! There's still hope for the order if it has good blokes like you, Vorsie!

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: ...I would thank you not to call me that. Now, the order will move as soon as they ascertain the enemy's location, so time is of the essence. Guydelot, pray take word of these developments to Jehantel.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, Forename[GC Rank] Surname, I need you to bear word to the two guildmasters, Luciane and Ywain.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Tell them that the time is nigh, and pray return here swiftly.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Make haste and bear word to the two guildmasters, Luciane and Ywain. I shall pretend to go along with official orders, all the while gathering what intelligence I can.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: The time is nigh, then? Very well, we shall make ready to depart at once.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: When the call came, full many here offered their bows. There is not a soul here who knows not of you and Jehantel and Guydelot. Together, let us rescue Sanson.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Aye, Vorsaile has briefed me on the situation. Sanson once trained in these very halls, and I should like to hear his excuse for being captured so easily.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: At any rate, you may count on our lances. That Sanson was one of our own is reason enough; this request comes from my longtime friend Vorsaile himself.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: At any rate, you may count on our lances. That Sanson was one of our own is reason enough; this request comes from both you and my longtime friend Vorsaile himself.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: Commander Vorsaile will send further instructions, aye? I shall see to it that we archers are ready to depart at a moment's notice.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: You may inform Vorsaile that the lancers stand ready. I've already handpicked those of our ranks who can keep their heads above unsettling truths.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: There you are, and not a moment too soon. Things have begun to move. Our scouts report that Nourval and his band have since returned to the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: They have made their lair in the North Shroud, near the shards of Dalamud. Even as we speak, the order mobilizes a unit for an assault. We must be there ahead of them.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Set out at once, and make first for Alder Springs; I shall instruct the others to join you there.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: I will remain here to stall our forces as long as I can. Godsspeed!

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: We have received word. We shall strike out forthwith for Alder Springs.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Focus on extricating Sanson. My lancers and I shall keep your way clear.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Set out at once for Alder Springs; I shall instruct the others to join you there.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Whew, we're ahead of the Twin Adder crew. Let's keep it that way and get right to work.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Our guild friends will take down the sentries and secure the area. We're free to get close to Nourval and give him the thrashing he deserves.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Well, well, I was not expecting you two. Here to deliver the Gridanians' answer, are we?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: You wish, you craven whoreson! Whatever your demands are, it ain't got nothing to do with us!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: So you are acting alone. I thought you had some wits. Or do you care that little for your friend?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Kill Sanson before you get your answer, and all deals are off─everything you've worked for up in smoke. Or do you care that little for your goal?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Hmph, mayhap you have some wits after all. But clever though your ploy may be, have you the strength to back it up?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Oh, don't you worry on that score. We're gonna knock you around so hard, all the scales will fall from your eyes.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And if that ain't enough to make you see clearly, I'll even slap in a song─something lively to wake you up from your misguided beliefs!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Why!? Why do you not understand!? Why do you not see the Ala Mhigans for the filth they are!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
Let each spear be thrust for everlasting peace.♪
Let each arrow be loosed for the forest and the trees.♪
And the greatest rule of all, for all men to embrace:♪
Let each life be lived for smiles on every face.♪

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Th-That song... How do you know it!?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I learned it just recently, with a spot of help from Jehantel here. He showed me Vainchelon's grave, which I understand your family's been tending for generations.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The song was engraved on the headstone. It's a fine piece, and it ain't hard to see why your ancestor loved it.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Taking up arms that we might have peace, so the words go. Words that came from Vainchelon himself, as a matter of fact.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: The Autumn War gave birth to a good many anthems, and a good many of 'em borrowed his words. Take a look, and you'll notice a recurring theme: peace and harmony.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: How dare you preach to me of my ancestor!? For generations, my family has sought justice for Lord Vainchelon! You couldn't possibly comprehend our pain!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Not us, perhaps, but I daresay your great-grandsire, Lord Landrenel, could comprehend it better than any man. He witnessed his own sire murdered before his eyes. He knew the painful truth, yet he chose to keep it a secret. Why was this, do you suppose?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It was because he knew that, above all else, his sire desired peace.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Had it been made known that their hero was struck down by treachery, ordinary Gridanians would not have been satisfied with protecting their homes. Nay, they would have demanded justice. They would have demanded blood.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The war would have raged on, leaving yet more death and destruction in its wake. And the peace that Lord Vainchelon dreamed of would have gone up in smoke. Knowing this, Lord Landrenel...

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Spare me your lies! Lord Vainchelon desired Ala Mhigo's destruction! You cannot tell me otherwise!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Tell me, young man, did it not strike you as odd that I knew of Lord Vainchelon's grave? That which your family has kept secret all these years? The explanation is simple: I had the honor of knowing Lord Landrenel.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Like you, he admired Lord Vainchelon and everything he stood for. And what he stood for, first of all, was peace and harmony. If you would honor both their memories, you would do well to honor these ideals.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: No... Th-This cannot be...

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: My ancestors despised Ala Mhigans. Y-Yes, they all did. If not, everything I've labored for...all the blood and tears...have been for naught...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I ask not that you forgive. But know that neither will we forget.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: When the time is right, I will see to it that all know of Lord Vainchelon's great sacrifice. This I swear in Nophica's name.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I ask only that you believe, as your ancestors fervently did, in a brighter future─one of our own shaping, undarkened by shadows of the past.

dialogue.name: LUCIANE
dialogue.text: No thanks are necessary. That your friend is safe and well is reward enough.

dialogue.name: YWAIN
dialogue.text: Nourval plainly inherited his ancestor's skill at arms. I pray that he will be given the chance to use his talents for good.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: Sanson is safe? Praise be to the Matron!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I sent the others back. We can deal with the rest ourselves.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Worry not, Forename, I am quite well. Thanks to you and Guydelot, it ended with only a few cuts and bruises.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: But ere I may rest, I must see to one last task: making good on my promise to Nourval. Come, let us return to the Adders' Nest.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: My apologies for keeping you waiting, Commander. I have Gylbarde's journal with me, and I will surrender it on one condition.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Once the veracity of the tome's contents is ascertained, the order must make the truth public knowledge when the time is right.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: On this we are of a mind, Captain Smyth. Not only will I relay your terms to our leaders, I will speak strongly in favor of them.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: But know that mine is but one voice, and more shall be needed if we are to strengthen our cause. As such, you must rise through the ranks swiftly to stand with me.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: S-Stand with you? I fear it will take me a while to attain that honor. To be fooled and taken captive so easily... I am still green as summer grass.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: 'Tis true that the success of this mission is owed much to Forename[GC Rank] Surname, and you would do well to give herhim your profuse thanks.

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: However, I suggest that you also give yourself more credit. You may have much to learn, but you will learn them in good time. This time, you were faced with numerous trials, yet did you not accomplish your mission in spite of them?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Aye, listen to Vorsie! We came back with the tome─no one can say we didn't do our jobs!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Look at you─a bit of praise, and you're a stunned marmot? That won't do at all! If you're gonna shape the future of our nation, you're gonna have to shape up!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You are right, Guydelot. From leading our unit to fulfilling my promise to Nourval, much rests upon my shoulders. Come what may, I will ever stand tall and forge on.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Forename, I must needs go to file my report, but ere I leave, allow me to offer you my heartfelt thanks. Not only for your invaluable aid, but for being an example to me.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: By following your lead, I shall strive to become the best leader I can be, that my unit's song might one day serve to rouse all Gridania!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: And off he goes. Good that he's hale and hearty, at any rate.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I'll stick with Sanson for a while, make sure he don't tear open any stitches. In the meantime, would you go and let Jehantel know we're returned? I'll be along myself soon enough.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: But speaking of the old man, to think that he knew Vainchelon's son! You don't get to that age and not rub shoulders with a legend or two, eh?

dialogue.name: VORSAILE
dialogue.text: My regards to Jehantel. And...I would thank you not to take up the habit of calling me “Vorsie.” Ahem.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: ...I see. My thanks for bearing word. Though Sanson and Guydelot may not have endeared themselves to the Twin Adder leadership, they have found a stout ally in Commander Heuloix. I must say, it truly stirs the spirit to see the younger generation blaze a new path.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: And I pray that Nourval, too, will find his own path to walk─one that is paved not with hatred, but with hope. That leads to peace both in the world and in his heart. 'Tis what his ancestors would have wished.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: In him I see them, and it calls to mind my days spent learning bow and song under his great-grandsire. A kindly old man who tirelessly tended his father's grave, never forgetting the ideals he stood for...

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Somewhere along Lord Vainchelon's line, those ideals had faded away. But thanks to you and yours, they may yet be restored, and made bolder still by a true remembrance of the past. And the world shall be a better place for it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the bard quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next bard quest will be available from Jehantel.

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: I will suffer none to stand in the way of my ambition!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Your ambition's shite, an' we're gonna make you see sense even if it means beatin' you senseless!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Hmph, you're strong... But I cannot fall! Not until my goal is realized!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Ugh, he's got spirit, I'll give him that...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: But so do we, and we ain't gonna take it lying down! Time to fire things up with song!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Enough with that detestable noise!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Gah! I-I can't move... Break me out of this, Forename!

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Stubborn fools! If you are so eager for death, I will give it to you!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: What's this now? Keep your guard up!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: S-Seven hells! Spread out or he'll skewer us both!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Ugh, bugger me... Finish it off, will you?

dialogue.name: NOURVAL
dialogue.text: Master Guydelot has given up. It's past time you gave up too.

obj.n: リフルジェントアロー
ストーリーテラーチェスト【ILv290】

quest.name: 原初的な彼女
journal: The fire in his eyes suggests Curious Gorge is getting ready for a fight.

Since you last met Curious Gorge, the reputation of the Maelstrom and its warriors has spread far and wide. In fact, an anonymous band of marauders has challenged them to battle at the Wolves' Den. Though no one knows who these combatants are, they seem quite familiar with you and your exploits, as they have requested your attendance as well. Not one to disappoint, Curious Gorge wastes no time in traveling to the Moraby Drydocks to meet with his brother.

You participate in a gripping battle against a poorly disguised Wyrnzoen and his entourage. The dust settles, but one of his marauders refuses to back down. Though Wyrnzoen is at a loss as to why she refuses to yield, the look in her eyes says it all─she has been blinded by the rage of her inner beast. Tossing Wyrnzoen, Broenbhar, and even Curious Gorge into the waters of the pier, you and Broken Mountain are left to subdue this savage beast alone.

Having returned to her senses, the young marauder introduces herself as Dorgono of the Qerel clan. The inner beast is not a foreign concept to her people, but they lack the understanding to control it. Because of this, those like her who are influenced by it are exiled. She has ventured to Eorzea to hone her skills in the hopes of mastering her inner beast. Broken Mountain readily accepts Dorgono as a new charge. Curious Gorge, on the other hand, deems himself unfit to train her and chooses to train on his own.

Broken Mountain fears he has not the time to both oversee the Maelstrom's fledgling warriors and tend to Dorgono's training. He turns to you for assistance, knowing that only you are capable of defeating Dorgono should she lose herself to her inner beast. For now he bids you rest, while he considers how best to go about her training.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Broken Mountain at the Moraby Drydocks.
Speak with Broken Mountain.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! Ever a sight for sore eyes. By the hardened look in yours, I take it you've wasted no effort in honing your axe on the battlefield.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: My brother and I have seen our fair share of battle as well, together with the fledgling warriors of the Maelstrom. Their training is coming along quite nicely.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: In fact, our exploits have earned us admirers of sorts; we recently received an anonymous invitation to participate in battle exercises at the Wolves' Den.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I haven't the foggiest idea of who they are, but it would seem that you do. They mentioned you by name, and insisted you join the fray as well.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Perhaps they wish to settle an old score. In any case, who are we to deny them the opportunity to cower before the might of a warrior's axe?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Come, Forename. My brother has prepared a boat for us at the Moraby Drydocks. If it's a thrashing they crave, let's not hesitate in giving it to them!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Let's not dally now, Forename. It would be rude to keep our hosts waiting any longer.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Good, you're here. As I'm sure my brother has told you, we have yet to determine the identities of these challengers.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Naturally, we refused at first. Our time would be better spent training the troops. In the end, though, I could not deny their enthusiasm for battle and desire to display their combat prowess, and took it upon myself to accept. At the very least I surmised it would prove inspiring to our men.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: With you at our side, it will prove a most enriching experience for all parties involved. I have naught to show our men of how to wield an axe, but I shall do what I can to aid you with my healing magicks. When you have steeled yourself for battle, we may set out to the Wolves' Den.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: (-Wyrnzoen...?-)Forename Surname, as I live and breathe! It's been too long. Word has it you've grown strong since the battle of Salt Strand. Even mastered the forgotten arts of the warrior.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: (-Wyrnzoen...?-)But words are wind. Ready your axe, and prove to me why men should fear the bite of your steel!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: (-Wyrnzoen...?-)So this... <pant> This is the strength of a warrior, the art of battle celebrated in legend. Perhaps if I were a few winters younger my efforts would've proven more than an unavailing struggle. You have met and exceeded all expectations.

dialogue.name: BROENBHAR
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Fellow-)Aye. Pains me to say it, but we're no match fer the likes o' you. Gods help us if the Sahagin ever learned to throw an axe about like that.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Indeed, the student has surpassed the master─the guildmaster. For it was I all along! Hah hah hah!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: ...Not even a quizzical lift of the brow? Surely our disguises were not as bad as all that. Or do you mean to say you've forgotten the face of your former instructor?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Wyrnzoen? By the Twelve, it is you! And Broenbhar! I wasn't expecting to crush Limsa's famed marauders under heel so easily. This was only a warm-up, yes? We've yet to even break a sweat.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: (-Fetching Fighter-)Unnngh...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: (-Fetching Fighter-)Graaaghhh!

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Dorgono! Whatever is the matter?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Those eyes! She wields the strength of her inner beast!?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: She swings like a dream...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Brother!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename. We cannot allow her to leave this pier.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: M-My apologies. The will of Karash burns brightly within me. Too brightly.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Karash...? I'm quite certain that was the reckless thrashing of one overcome by their inner beast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: But that is a phenomenon seldom seen beyond the walls of my village. Who are you, and from where do you hail, friend?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I am Dorgono of the Qerel. My home is...was...on the Azim Steppe in lands far to the east.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: We are unmatched in the ways of the axe. We are a strong people. At times too strong. There are ones like me, consumed by this thing you call the inner beast, the will of Karash. We are the Taken, cursed with an insatiable thirst for violence.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Remarkable! Your people sound not unlike those of my village.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Though I suppose it stands to reason others share this gift. The strength of one's inner beast stems from a primal instinct we are all born with. It is merely a matter of learning to draw it out─a technique we warriors have long since mastered.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Yet you would call it a curse. Have your people not learned to control this power?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The will of Karash, this...inner beast...can be controlled?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Perhaps then I can at last return home!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The Taken are sentenced to exile. That is why I traveled west, to train further in the way of the axe. If I can overcome this affliction, I may have a chance for redemption.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Well, this is certainly an unexpected turn of events. As our most promising recruit, I wished to see how she might fare against hardened combatants. I never thought she could actually defeat the likes of Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Seems to me further time training under our roof would be a waste. Might you be willing to take her on?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Well, we can't very well leave her unattended. If she should succumb to her inner beast, there's no telling what havoc she might wreak.

dialogue.name: WYRNZOEN
dialogue.text: Then I leave her in your capable hands. I'm sure you'll make a fine warrior out of her.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Thank you, sir! I will do anything you ask if it means taming this wretched beast within me.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I... I can't believe I lost. How am I to instruct others when I am still so lacking?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Brother, I'm sorry, but I cannot guide her in the way of the warrior when I myself have stumbled on the path.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: No, let him be. His lack of resolve would only invite hindrances to the task at hand.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: This is a path he must walk alone. Come, let us go.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: With my brother engrossed in his own training for the interim, I fear I will be spread too thin overseeing the instruction of Maelstrom recruits to give Dorgono proper guidance. Gods help us should she be consumed by her inner beast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: A worldly adventurer such as yourself no doubt has other pressing obligations, but you are the only one capable of containing Dorgono should the worst come to pass. Do you think it possible you could spare time to assist me in her training?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Oh, thank goodness. I don't know what I would have done had you refused.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Normally, we would gather to train at the Wolves' Den, but I believe an exception must be made for Dorgono. Yes, both for her sake and the rest of the Maelstrom recruits. For now I would give this some thought. Pray return here in a few days' time, and I should have a solution.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: こじらせ戦士
journal: There seems to be something weighing on Broken Mountain's mind.

Broken Mountain has decided on how he might begin training Dorgono. As he prepares to help her gain mastery of her inner beast, however, he cannot help but worry for Curious Gorge, who claims his inner beast has fallen silent. Sadly there is no time to lament further, for the Maelstrom has requested the aid of Broken Mountain's troop of warriors to rout a band of outlaw Mamool Ja. He sees this as an opportunity for Dorgono, as he believes building a resolve to defend her allies will allow her to gain control of her inner beast. He readies his men, and makes for the ruins of Nym in outer La Noscea.

With everyone assembled, Broken Mountain explains to you his plan. With Dorgono in tow, he means to take his band of warriors along the Long Climb and sweep through the Mamool Ja's main force. Meanwhile, you are to sneak through the heart of the ruins and pick off the sentries. With everyone assigned their orders, you split up, seeking to rendezvous on the path leading toward the Hermit's Hovel.
As you navigate the heart of the Nym ruins, you spy two Mamool Ja brawlers and trounce them swiftly and quietly. Perhaps there are other sentries still in the area.
You come upon another pair of Mamool Ja fighters and take them unawares. As the coast seems to be clear, you continue along the path through the ruins in search of the others.

Broken Mountain and his men are no worse for wear, and Dorgono showed no signs of succumbing to her inner beast in battle. Yet her calm and cool composure was not cause for celebration. Curious Gorge─taking an innocent stroll through the ruins of Nym─happened to see her fighting, and noticed that Dorgono was holding back. Though she only meant to spare her comrades the risk of her inner beast, this means she has yet to harness the power raging within her. Nevertheless, the Mamool Ja have been routed, and Maelstrom shipments may now pass through safely. All that remains is to return to the Moraby Drydocks and rest.

Everyone is safely returned to the Moraby Drydocks─everyone except Curious Gorge. Strange that he would stumble upon your mission in the ruins of Nym. Broken Mountain believes it is related to the source of Curious Gorge's personal dilemma, but assures you it is nothing to worry about. For now he bids you rest, and prepare for the next step in Dorgono's training.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Speak with Broken Mountain at the Floating City of Nym.
Survey the area for Mamool Ja fighters.
Rendezvous with Broken Mountain.
Speak with Broken Mountain at the Moraby Drydocks.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Fortuitous timing, Forename. I've decided on how we might set about training Dorgono. Unfortunately, as you are already aware, my brother will not be present. It seems his situation is more grave than I initially thought.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Ever since his clash with Dorgono, he's been unable to draw upon the strength of his inner beast. He insists revisiting the basics of axework at the Marauders' Guild will restore his abilities, but I suspect his troubles lie elsewhere. The same can be said for Dorgono.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Though my brother and I did not complete formal training in the ways of the warrior, you may recall we at last discovered a way for him to control the savagery of his inner beast: a dire encounter that hardened his resolve to protect his allies, thus allowing him to temper his rage.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: She believes her problem will be solved through physical training, but if we are to succeed in this, we must recreate a similar experience for Dorgono. It may prove perilous, but I can see no other way.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: And we will not have to wait long for the opportunity. As chance would have it, we received a request for aid in routing a group of Mamool Ja now occupying the ruins of the city of Nym.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: They originally came here for want of work. Unable to find it, however, they took to pillaging and plundering, and not even Maelstrom convoys are spared their attention.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: To make matters worse, the area also serves as the front line of ongoing battles with the kobolds. Either of these tribes alone is already a handful for our forces, and we cannot well cope with both.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: That is why our squadron of newly trained warriors has been called to undertake this incursion. Dorgono will be accompanying us, and your presence will be imperative in the event she loses control. When you are ready, make for the ruins in outer La Noscea.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: These Mamool Ja sound like a savage tribe. I wonder if they would prove a match for the Dotharl...

dialogue.name: WARRIOR02901
dialogue.text: By the Navigator, Forename Surname! Tales of your heroism have been an inspiration to us all. It is truly an honor to fight at your side.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text:
Ahhh! Matron's teats, don't scare me like that...
Why am I here? I was merely going for a walk. What would I possibly have to gain from spying on you and Dorgono...?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Good, everyone is here. As far as I can discern, the Mamool Ja have divided into two groups: a primary force targeting the next Maelstrom shipment, and what appear to be groups of sentries posted to warn them of any unwelcome interference.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Being the most skilled among us, I would have you sneak into the heart of the ruins and do away with those keeping watch.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, I shall lead the others along a northerly route toward the Long Climb and engage their primary force. If all goes as planned, we should be able to meet where the two paths join.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If Dorgono should be overcome by her inner beast and shows no signs of regaining control, we will retreat immediately and seek you out.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: If we should come to blows, I beg of you: do what you must to stop me.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: That is all. If there are no questions, let the operation begin!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Yay! Woo yay!

dialogue.name: WARRIOR02901
dialogue.text: Miss SurnameMister Surname, you are unharmed! Of course, I should expect no less from a warrior of such acclaim.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. By the lack of sweat on your brow I assume you made quick work of the sentries. We, for our part, managed to claim a narrow victory over the main Mamool Ja force.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: And despite the chaos and havoc of battle, Dorgono remained unaffected by her inner beast.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I am slave to Karash no longer! I am master of the inner beast!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Master? Far from it.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Brother! What are you doing here? Have you been following us this whole time?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Following!? Nonsense! I was merely...taking a walk! Yes, I was taking a leisurely walk through ruins of Nym when I happened upon your small altercation with the Mamool Ja.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I couldn't help but notice your form, Dorgono. Your battle form, that is. Anyone with eyes could see you were hesitating with every swing of your axe.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You'll never learn to control your inner beast if you're too afraid to push yourself and draw it out. Believe me, I know.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Afraid, am I? Hmph, that's rich coming from the pathetic worm I sent flying into the waters of the Wolves' Den Pier!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Worm!? You ungrateful little... Call me that again and I'll─

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I'll call you whatever I please, worm. If you have any complaints, take them up with my axe.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You... You're lucky I'm feeling under the weather today. When next we meet, I'll have to beat some manners into that pretty little head of yours.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Though you may not like his judgment, I have to agree with my brother. I too noticed you seemed to be holding back.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Though the battle was hard-won, you showed little need to overexert yourself, let alone call upon your inner beast.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I never meant to hold back, it's just, well... I thought it better not to worry the others.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: You needn't be hard on yourself. You did not learn to control your inner beast, no, but we have defeated the Mamool Ja, and shipments to Limsa are now safe. We should all be proud of what we've accomplished today. Now, let us return to the Moraby Drydocks for a well-earned respite.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Your thrashing of the Mamool Ja must have been a glorious sight. Never have I met a womanman so fearless, so strong. Strong enough, even, to overcome me when my inner beast is unleashed.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: If only I could take you to the Azim Steppe, I'd... I have to go.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It seems we will need more than a small scuffle with beastmen for Dorgono to gain control over her inner beast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Would that Curious Gorge were here to assist us. Did you also find it strange he would take time away from training to speak with us? Or rather, with Dorgono...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If my suspicions are true, he faces an obstacle unlike any he has faced before. Though I'm sure it's nothing you need concern yourself with.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: You have done well this day. Rest now, and gather your strength. We will surely need it for the trials to come.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン
ブロークン・マウンテン
ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: オラの中の獣
journal: Broken Mountain has lost his usual air of composure.

The Mamool Ja's defeat at the ruins of Nym was not enough to dissuade them, as Maelstrom Command reports indicate they have now set their sights on Wineport. It goes without saying Broken Mountain means to repel the Mamool Ja once more. It should also come as no surprise that he expects you to accompany him on this mission. Not wishing to waste time, he makes haste to Raincatcher Gully, asking you to meet him there when you are geared for battle.

As Broken Mountain goes over his plan for defending Wineport, Dorgono is disappointed to hear she has been relegated to support. Though he fears the risk of her losing control, he admits that this decision leaves them wanting for muscle. How fortunate, then, that Curious Gorge should again happen upon your gathering in the middle of Raincatcher Gully. With the aid of his axe, Broken Mountain will lead his men on a westerly route past the Severed String, while you head due south dispensing with any enemies who stand in your way.

As you make your way through Raincatcher Gully, you are assaulted by two Mamool Ja warriors. The odds are sadly not in their favor as a few heavy swings of your axe make short work of them. You continue along the path south, your axe at the ready.
Another gang of Mamool Ja fighters soon come into view. Though greater in number, they are still no match for your combat prowess. Still clutching your axe, you venture deeper into the wilds.

Yet another band of Mamool Ja dare to stand in your way. Yet there is little they can do to stand against your terrible might. As you continue along the path, you see a familiar figure in the distance.

You find Broken Mountain and his men, battered and beaten. As he explains it, they were ambushed and Curious Gorge was the first to fall. Dorgono, also unable to escape, is likely fighting for her life against the Mamool Ja. He bids you find them before it is too late.

You find Curious Gorge wounded, Dorgono towering over the mangled bodies of the Mamool Ja. She turns to look at you with what seems to be murderous intent, but suddenly her eyes soften. Lowering her axe she realizes she has managed to suppress her inner beast. Curious Gorge, bearing witness to this mastery of self, sees her accomplishment as a source of ignominy. As he takes leave of the scene, too embarrassed to face the others, Broken Mountain and his men stagger over to congratulate Dorgono. They then return to the Moraby Drydocks to bid her a final farewell.

Dorgono, now able to control her inner beast, means to return home and win back the trust of her people. However, there is still the matter of Curious Gorge and his now dormant inner beast. Broken Mountain is convinced his brother now faces a crisis the likes of which he has never known: he has fallen in love. Dorgono has left him a whirlwind of emotions, but time heals all wounds. Broken Mountain suggests giving his brother space to cope with these emotions on his own.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Broken Mountain upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with Broken Mountain at the Raincatcher Gully Docks.
Survey the area for Mamool Ja fighters.
Rendezvous with Broken Mountain.
Search for Curious Gorge.
Speak with Broken Mountain at the Moraby Drydocks.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename! I'm afraid I have naught but ill tidings to share. The Mamool Ja have returned with reinforcements!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: According to reports from Maelstrom Command, they have their eyes fixed on Wineport. Having been driven out from the ruins of Nym, I have no doubt they mean to take the village as their new base of operations.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: We have fanned the flames of their aggression, Forename, and thus is it our duty to put matters to rights.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I fear they pose too great a threat to consider this part of Dorgono's training. Regardless of what may happen, I expect you to prioritize the Mamool Ja above all else. When you are ready, my men and I shall meet you at Raincatcher Gully.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Hello, Forename. Your axe is looking quite sharp this eveningthis morningthis afternoon.

dialogue.name: WARRIOR02902
dialogue.text: Oh, what a life I have lived to be blessed a second time by your presence. I speak on behalf of all when I say we shall do our utmost to live up to your deeds.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Our scouts tell us the Mamool Ja are still to the south.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: There's no way of knowing which path they will take to reach Wineport, so we must head them off at every available avenue, lest they turn the hamlet into a battlefield.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename, I would ask you to head due south and do away with any enemies you find along the way. The rest of us shall sweep west toward Red Mantis Falls, then south through the Severed String. Dorgono, you will stay close to me in the rear. You will aid me in support, nothing more.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: <sigh> If you insist...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Dorgono, but there is too much at stake to risk your losing control of your inner beast. Yet with you joining me in support, I fear we may lack the strength to do away with the Mamool Ja.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: No need to fear, Brother, for you have my axe!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: What a welcome surprise. Are you sure you're able to fight?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: After bashing boulders and toppling titans with the marauders, I've never felt better!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Ugh, you again. Come to slow us down, worm?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: No more than the horn-mad cow unable to control her inner beast. How about when this is over I show you my inner beast and─

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Enough! Both of you! Brother, if you're sure you can handle it, I would have you take the lead.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Right, then. Let's move quickly. Forename, we will meet where the paths join on the road leading to Limsa Lominsa.

dialogue.name: WARRIOR02902
dialogue.text: My apologies, ma'amsir. We... We've failed you.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Forename? Oh thank goodness, you are unharmed. The Mamool Ja, they...they caught us unawares as we passed through the Severed String. We had no choice but to make haste toward the rendezvous point.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: As I feared, Brother's boasting was just that. He was the first to falter, and failed to keep up as we fled. Him, along with Dorgono.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Please, you must find them. Before they are slain by the Mamool Ja. Or worse...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Please, Forename, do not waste your concern on me─you must find Dorgono and my brother before it's too late!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Grrr...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename... Be on your guard. Dorgono, she defeated the Mamool Ja, but...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Her inner beast has consumed her!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: My strength has failed me, Forename. Please, you have to stop Dorgono.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I─I did it! I've suppressed the will of Karash!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Could it be? She overcame her inner beast through her resolve to protect me?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The flames of her spirit burn so brightly, and yet it feels as though mine have all but guttered out.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Pray return to the others without me. I cannot face them like this.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: We have struck two birds with a single stone─the Mamool Ja have been repelled, and Dorgono has at last gained control over her inner beast.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The power of Karash is now mine to control. Soon, my people will welcome me back with open arms!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I would certainly hope so. Let us return to the Moraby Drydocks and prepare for your send-off, shall we?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I lacked the courage to ask before, but now I must: Forename, would you...would you return with me to the Azim Steppe?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: There is much my people could teach you, just as you could teach us. With your help, we would never need fear the will of Karash ever again.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Please, Forename, say you will join my clan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I cannot abandon my duties here.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Then who would protect Eorzea in my absence?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I must remain here and continue my training.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. It would be selfish of me to ask that you abandon your obligations.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: By the Mother, of course! How could I be so blind? I could never deprive Eorzea of its protector.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: If you would rather train here than at the Azim Steppe, then that is your right.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I...I'm sorry. What was I thinking, making such a silly request?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Forget that I asked. It was foolish of me to think you would give up your life here in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Come, we should return to the Moraby Drydocks. The others are waiting.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Let us keep our earlier conversation between us, yes?

dialogue.name: WARRIOR02902
dialogue.text: I shall miss Dorgono. She was a fair rose amidst a heap of─ Ahem. Forget I said anything.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It pains me to let such a fine warrior leave. Still, I cannot begrudge you for wishing to return home.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: A part of me wishes to stay and repay your kindness. Before coming here, I was certain redemption was beyond my reach.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Now, thanks to you and your warriors, I have learned to harness the power of Karash. At last I can return home and show my people this strength is a gift, not a curse.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Thank you everyone, for everything. Farewell.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Once again we are indebted to you, Forename. Not only have we eliminated the Mamool Ja threat, we've helped Dorgono on her way to reuniting with her people.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Yet there still remains the matter of my brother. He would not dare admit it, but I knew from the moment he laid eyes on her that he was in love. And therein lies the problem.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The only love he has ever known is that for his axe and the thrill of battle. In light of her less-than-favorable treatment of him since his defeat here at the Wolves' Den, I fear his love and loathing for her are at odds with one another.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Unable to get a grasp on his emotions, he's lost touch with his inner beast.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: He will be distraught in her absence, to be sure, but as they say, time heals all wounds.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: All we can do now is wait and hope he recovers. If anything should happen, you will be the first to know.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン
ブロークン・マウンテン
ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: オメを追って
journal: Broken Mountain is beside himself with worry.

Curious Gorge has disappeared, but not without a trace. According to Wyrnzoen, a man matching his description recently boarded a ship bound eastward. Broken Mountain is certain his brother has run off in search of Dorgono at the Azim Steppe. Unable to leave his post in Limsa Lominsa, he asks you to search for Curious Gorge and see that he does not come to harm.

You travel east to the Azim Steppe, and question the people of a small settlement known as Reunion. While many could not distinguish Curious Gorge from the many travelers passing through, one merchant recalls a large, axe-wielding Roegadyn heading west in search of a Qerel settlement.
Curious Gorge was moments away from evisceration when you stepped in to rescue him from a ravenous weasel. He seems no worse for wear as you help him to his feet.
You are relieved to see Curious Gorge is without injury, but there is no time for small talk. Dorgono's people are under attack, and so Curious Gorge rushes off to the west.

You arrive to find Dorgono looking over the ruin of her people's settlement. As she tells it, they are safe and sound at Reunion. Sadly, there would be no homecoming for Dorgono. The ones responsible for besieging their homes were the very same people they exiled from the Qerel clan. They have created an order of their own, the Chaghan, and believe the blind fury of their inner beasts is a gift from their goddess, the Dusk Mother. The Qerel believe Dorgono to be one of the Chaghan now, and refuse to allow her back. She is now determined to avenge her people and earn back their trust. Your help, and even Curious Gorge's, will be indispensable in this endeavor. As she leaves to go track their whereabouts, she suggests you return to Reunion to rest up and prepare for battle.

You speak with Curious Gorge at Reunion, and it seems he has yet to realize the source of his problems. With battle looming on the horizon, one can only hope he comes to terms with his emotions before the fighting begins.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Gather information at Reunion.
Search for Curious Gorge.
Rescue Curious Gorge.
Speak with Dorgono.
Speak with Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: He's gone! My brother is gone!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I spoke with Wyrnzoen, and his men claim to have seen a man fitting Brother's description boarding a ship heading to the Far East.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The lovestruck fool. No doubt he's run off to find Dorgono.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: In his weakened state, there's no telling what misfortune may find him there. Would that I could go and search of him, but I cannot leave my post here in Limsa.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It shames me to ask more of you, but do you think it possible you could find him?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Bless you, Forename. If he is searching for Dorgono, then he is making for the Azim Steppe.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If the plains are as vast as she claimed, you would do well to find the closest settlement and begin your search there. If the gods are kind, someone will have seen him.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Safe travels, Forename. I pray he causes no more trouble than he already has.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: If Dorgono told it true, the plains of Azim Steppe are vast and fraught with peril. When you arrive, make haste to the nearest settlement and see what you can learn of my brother's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: TAMACHAG
dialogue.text: A large man with an axe? You've any idea how many brutes with axes come stomping through these parts?

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: A burly, red-faced Roegadyn? Yes, I remember. He was asking after the Qerel clan, but they haven't lived here in ages.

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: Ah, that unruly fellow in search of the Qerel clan? If he took my advice, he's headed due west to search for their settlement. Or what's left of it.

dialogue.name: TAMACHAG
dialogue.text: A large man with an axe on his back? You'll have to be more specific. There's no shortage of axe-wielding types here.

dialogue.name: MASGUD
dialogue.text: If you're looking for the Qerel, you'll not find them here. I told that boisterous Roegadyn the same.

dialogue.name: CHAMBUI
dialogue.text: I can't say what you'll find to the west, but it's likely not the Qerel.

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Thank you, kind stranger. Had you not arrived, I would have─Forename!? Wh-What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ack, that can wait. Dorgono's people are under attack. Come, we have to help them!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Dorgono is safe, but where are the others?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Forename, you've come! Hope is not yet lost... Though I fail to see why you chose to bring the worm.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Worm!? Why, I... You... Ugh, could you just tell us what happened here?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The Qerel settlement was attacked, but I was too late. This is all there was to be seen when I arrived. You needn't worry, though. They escaped.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I managed to track them back to Reunion. Upon finding them, however, I was greeted with looks of fear and disgust. They would only suffer me long enough to explain the will of Karash is to blame for their woes.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The exiles of Qerel have created a clan of their own─the Chaghan. They offered me shelter when I was first cast out.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Where the Qerel see the will of Karash as a source of rack and ruin, the Chaghan praise it as a blessing from the Dusk Mother.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: They commit all manner of heinous acts when Karash takes hold. Some would even slay their own kin and claim it in the name of the Mother. I could not abide their savagery and soon left. Still, my people mistake me for one of the Chaghan now.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: After all that work, all that training, they would deny me. But I cannot give up! I will avenge my people and earn their trust!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Your opponents are warriors who freely indulge in their inner beasts. You do not stand a chance alone. I will help you!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I have no need of your aid, worm. You would only get in my way with your wriggling and writhing.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Forename's proven axe, on the other hand, would be welcome. What say you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Will you lend Dorgono your strength?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Thank you. Your presence alone is worth a hundred warriors!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I...I see. Then I have no choice but to face them alone...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What are you saying? The Forename I know would never let a comrade rush headlong into danger alone. You must help Dorgono!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Thank you. Your presence alone is worth a hundred warriors!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Aye, and with me at your side, that's another hundred at your disposal. Dealing with the Chaghan should be as child's play.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Do as you like. I only ask you don't slow us down.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: For now, return to Reunion and rest. The Chaghan have grown careless and should prove easy for me to track. When the time comes, I expect you to be ready, Curious Gorge.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Huh? I mean, r-right. You can count on me!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I should not be long, Forename. Soon we will put an end to their madness.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: That woman is insufferable! She's arrogant, rude, pigheaded... <sigh> And she finally called me by name...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ahem. She is also right. Battle against the Chaghan would be folly in my present condition. Let us return to Reunion.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forename. Let me speak plain: why exactly are you here?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Brother worries about me, does he? It seems I've made good company of trouble in recent days.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ever since I was bested by Dorgono at the pier, everything has gone wrong. My inner beast remains dormant, and my ability to fight along with it.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: There are moments when my blood quickens, and I dare to hope that the inner beast would awaken...only to find myself racked by visions of Dorgono and my strength abandoning me.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I know not what is going on inside me, know not how to conquer it. I knew only that I had to follow Dorgono. What in heavens' name is wrong with me?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I think you're in love with Dorgono.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You need to train harder and regain your focus.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: L-Love!? I was hoping you would offer me counsel, not cruel jests.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Could it be as simple as that? I confess I have felt rather unfocused of late, but I'm not so certain it is a mere matter of training.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: <sigh> What am I doing, bothering you with this? I'm sure you have a veritable mountain of troubles of your own to contend with.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: In any case, this problem is my burden. It will not be solved by thrusting it upon others.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: And if I am to be ready for our battle, it must be solved quickly.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I won't keep you any longer, Forename. Do what you must to prepare, and I shall do the same.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: 燃えよゴージ！
journal: Curious Gorge seems surprisingly calm and collected.

In an unusual change of pace, Curious Gorge has taken to helping merchants of Reunion with errands. He has been recently tasked with taking two horses up to Mol Iloh, but is wary of leaving one without a rider. He asks you to speak with the horses' owner, so you might saddle up to assist him.
The sprightly merchant is only too happy to ready his horse for you. Mounted and ready to ride, he wishes you save travels to Mol Iloh.

As you arrive at Mol Iloh, a sheepherder approaches you. His look of satisfaction makes clear that he is the intended recipient of the horse. With the delivery complete, you look for Curious Gorge who should be nearby.

Robbed of his inner beast and ability to battle, Curious Gorge has thought long and hard about what life has to offer off the battlefield. He realizes now the vexing emotion which inhibited his inner beast was the love he bears for Dorgono. This understanding of his feelings has also reawakened his once-dormant strength. To cast aside any lingering feelings of doubt or hesitation, he plans to profess his love to her. To that end, he bids you follow him back to Reunion.

Both Curious Gorge and Dorgono have been waiting for your return. His look of exasperation makes it clear he has buckled under pressure. Your presence offers him a modicum of courage, but before he can say a word, she interrupts him to relay grave news to you─the Chaghan have grown bolder, and now plan to attack Mol Iloh. She means to cut them off before they can reach the settlement and leaves ahead of you. Curious Gorge grows increasingly frustrated with himself, and asks you to give him the one thing certain to dispel his fear─the realm-shattering slap of Eorzea's greatest warrior!
It is all Curious Gorge can do not to fall to the ground from the force of your mighty blow. He is now duly inspired and ready to help Dorgono rout the Chaghan.

You find Dorgono south of the settlement, surveying the area for the Chaghan. The silent operation is foiled, however, by the boisterous bellowing of Curious Gorge as he attempts to profess his love to her. Your cover blown, a fierce battle with the Chaghan soon ensues. The song of steel echoes across the Azim Steppe, and after the final refrain, you find yourselves victorious. Or so it seems. The Chaghan are defeated, but the threat of danger still looms in Curious Gorge who has been overcome by his inner beast. Though he seems beyond reasoning, it is a confession of love from Dorgono that brings him back to his senses.

Love is in the air, and Dorgono asks Curious Gorge to return with her to start anew as part of the Qerel clan. With a heavy heart he declines. Control of his inner beast still eludes him, and he cannot suffer the thought of hurting the one he loves most. He vows to become the realm's second─or third─strongest warrior, hoping to someday be worthy of her affection. Dorgono bids you both farewell and departs to at last rejoin her people.

Curious Gorge is a man of his word, and jokingly warns you that, should you decide to rest on your laurels for even a moment, he intends to rob you of your title of realm's greatest warrior. That said, he concedes you both have earned rest after such a grueling battle. Longing for home, you both return to Limsa Lominsa.

Broken Mountain is relieved to see you both returned safely, hopeful that things would return to as they were. Unfortunately that would not be the case. Still struggling to control his inner beast, Curious Gorge again relinquishes his position as instructor to resume training at Hidden Falls. Though his brother is certain to emerge from his training a warrior transformed, Broken Mountain hopes you will answer their call should the realm want for a mighty axe.

※The next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “To Have Loved and Lost.”
objectives: Mount the merchant's horse.
Ride the merchant's horse to Mol Iloh.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Dispel Curious Gorge's fear with a /slap.
Meet with Dorgono near Mol Iloh.
Speak with Curious Gorge.
Speak with Broken Mountain at the Moraby Drydocks.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Stars in the Dark.”

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Your timing is impeccable as always. I have a task well suited to a womanman of your many talents.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Aside from my training, I've taken to working with the merchants here in Reunion, my most recent venture being the delivery of horses.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I was asked to take a pair of horses up north today, but I'd feel at ease knowing there was a rider in both saddles.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Speak with the sprightly fellow over there and he'll see that you're fit to ride. Make for Mol Iloh and I'll meet you there.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: This isn't a job to be done on foot, Forename. Speak with the sprightly fellow over there and saddle up.

dialogue.name: SHEPHERD02903
dialogue.text: Have you seen any merchants on horseback heading this way? <sigh> They should have been here by now.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Return to the mirthful merchant and mount the horse to be delivered to Mol Iloh.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT02903
dialogue.text: (-Mirthful Merchant-)Ah, Curious Gorge did mention someone would be coming to help. Yes, yes, your horse is right over here. Safe travels, friend.

dialogue.name: MERCHANT02903
dialogue.text: (-Mirthful Merchant-)What were you doing out there? Your horse came galloping back not long ago and looked rather spooked. I'll tolerate no funny business. Understand?

dialogue.name: SHEPHERD02903
dialogue.text: Ah, my horse! Thank you so much. I don't know where I'd be without you adventurers. Is the other burly-looking fellow over there with you?

dialogue.name: SHEPHERD02903
dialogue.text: Don't let me keep you. It'd be rude to leave that friend of yours waiting any longer.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are. Was this not invigorating? The feeling of fresh air on your face, the wind blowing through your hair?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Bereft of the strength to fight, I have been given much time to drink in the beauty of these lands. Much time to think...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Since I was old enough to hold an axe, the path of the warrior is all I have ever known, the pursuit of ever greater strength my only purpose. I realize now how narrow my view of the world was.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I was convinced my defeat at the Wolves' Den Pier was the reason Dorgono has been constantly on my mind, and my wounded pride served only to further cloud my judgment.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But I can see clearly now, the clouds are gone. I finally understand why Dorgono has vexed me so.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I love her, Forename. From the moment I laid eyes on her, she had holmganged my heart.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Overwhelmed with these feelings, it's little wonder she trounced me so at the Wolves' Den Pier.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But I am once more master of my emotions. Already I can feel my inner beast has reawakened.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: If I am to regain my full strength, there is only one thing left to do: profess my love to Dorgono, and in the doing, rid myself of any lingering doubts that may still inhibit my inner beast.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Let us return to town. Hopefully there will be enough time before she arrives to think of what to say.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename, thank goodness you are here.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: What took you so long? Every time I look into those powder blue eyes of hers, I lose all train of thought. Now that you're here, perhaps I can muster the courage to─erm, ahem!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Dorgono! I... I... I lo─

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: What is wrong with you?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Ugh! There is no time for your drivel─the Chaghan mean to strike again!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: They've always been prone to violence, but I fear their recent attack on the Qerel has given them a taste for pillaging. They mean to attack Mol Iloh next!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Quickly! We must stop them before they can reach town!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Damn it all! Again I was distracted by the quiver of her come-hither lips. I'm embarrassed to admit it, but love proves to be more terrifying than any foe.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: This fear, it must be struck out of me. Literally. I want you to slap me as hard as you can, Forename. Crack your battle-hardened palm across my face.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Don't hold back, Forename. Slap me so hard my heart skips a beat from the shock of it.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Don't hold back, Forename. Slap me so hard my heart skips a beat from the shock of it.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Godsdamn, that smarts! Any harder and my heart might've stopped altogether.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: But the fear that once gripped my heart is no more. Come, Forename, Dorgono must know of my love for her. I will shout it from the mountain tops if I have to!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: The Chaghan are close by. Overcoming their forces will be no easy task, but we must be especially careful of their leader, Nayaga. He is able to wield the power of Karash to its fullest.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: When he taps into that strength, he is nigh unbeatable. With our combined might, we may have a chance.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Speaking of which... Curious Gorge, are you well enough to fight?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Better than well, for I am in love─with you! I love you, Dorgono. I love you!!!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Wh-What are you doing, you witless worm!? Keep your voice down!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Your bellowing has given us away!

dialogue.name: NAYAGA
dialogue.text: What have we here? Dorgono. You have some nerve showing your face here. If you value your life, you will crawl back to whatever hole you came out of.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Never! What you have done to the Qerel, your own people, is unforgivable! I will not allow you to bring such ruin to others.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I was too weak before, but thanks to these warriors, the power of Karash is now at my beck and call. I have the strength to put an end to you!

dialogue.name: NAYAGA
dialogue.text: What we do, we do in the name of the Dusk Mother! If you would defy her will, there is only one punishment fit for such heresy.

dialogue.name: NAYAGA
dialogue.text: Oh Nhaama, goddess of the dusk, hear me! Grant us the strength to smite our enemies! For one glorious moment, let the blood spilled here slake your unquenchable thirst!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Forename, Curious Gorge. Prepare yourselves!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Leave it to me, my sweet vixen! I will show them what it truly means to unleash one's inner beast!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: We did it! The Chaghan have been brought to heel. Perhaps now I can finally return home.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: That was quite a display, Curious Gorge. The worm has at last shown himself a warrior.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge...?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Graaaaaaghhh!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: It's over. We have won! You needn't prove yourself to me any longer!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
