dialogue.text: You have always been so strong, so caring. I know I was mean to you before, but in truth I... I...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I love you, Curious Gorge!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Forgive me. Though only for a moment, it seems my inner beast got the better of me. Again...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: So what if it did? The Chaghan have been defeated, and I owe it all to the two of you! When the Qerel hear of this, they are sure to welcome me back with open arms.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I will share with them all I have learned of controlling the will of Karash, and I would do it with you.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Come away with me, Curious Gorge, and together we can start anew with the Qerel!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: How long I have waited to hear those words. <sigh> Yet sadly, I must decline. While it is true we defeated the Chaghan, I cannot dismiss the fact that I succumbed to my inner beast. If I had turned on you when you needed me most, I could never forgive myself.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: A man who lacks such self-discipline is undeserving of a wonderful woman such as you.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I must continue training to master my inner beast and become the realm's greatest─well, second greatest─warrior. When that day comes, I will find you.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Second? Surely you mean third. The honor of being the realm's second greatest warrior is mine, and I doubt you will ever surpass me.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Argh! Just wait and see! I'll rip those horns off that pretty little head of yours and─

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah. Well, you can certainly try. I will gladly fight to keep my title, and can think of no better challenger. Until then, take care of yourself.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I can scarcely believe you overcame that monster Nayaga on your own.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: The title of realm's greatest warrior is rightfully yours, but never forget: should you slack for even a moment, I'll be there to take it from you!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Though I suppose after today's exertion, we've both earned a moment's respite. Let us return home. I yearn for the shores of Limsa, and my brother is no doubt sick with worry besides.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I have caused you and my brother nothing but grief. I mean to apologize, but I fear he will not like what I have to say.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It gladdens me to see you both returned hale and whole. Once more my brother's inner beast burns fiercely within him, and from what he has told me, Dorgono has at last been reunited with her people.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Our ventures in the East were not without trouble, though. Much of which could have been avoided if not for my failings.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I know you wish for me to resume leading the Maelstrom's warriors, Brother, but I am unworthy for the role. I myself am still in need of training, and that is why I would dedicate myself to honing my skills, that I might someday be worthy of the position again.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I suspected you might say as much. Very well, then. If you truly believe this is best, I will not stop you. Find your own path. When you're ready, I'm sure it will lead back to us someday.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Brother! I must be off to Hidden Falls. There's much to do if I'm ever to be a match for Forename or Dorgono.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I sometimes wonder if he will ever be satisfied. Though I confess I admire his fervor. You have inspired him to reach new heights, and I have every confidence he will emerge from his training a new man. Nevertheless, I hope we may look to you for aid should we find ourselves on hard times.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the warrior quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “To Have Loved and Lost.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next warrior quest will be available from Curious Gorge.

obj.n: ブロークン・マウンテン

quest.name: 竜騎士の旅立ち
journal: Ser Alberic is pondering the flow of time.

Having just heard news of Estinien's departure from Ishgard, Ser Alberic laments his aloof nature, but shows some understanding for his actions. As the topic of conversation turns to Heustienne's plight, her father, Montorgains appears. He mentions that he was recently handed a rather peculiar letter, bearing his daughter's name, that was a cry for your aid. You agree to help Heustienne once more and set off to meet her near Mare's Oath.

Heustienne, having learned to suppress the dragon blood's effect on her to an extent, greets you cheerfully, mentioning she has made a new friend. Rather surprisingly, said friend is revealed to be a young dragon named Orn Khai. Heustienne explains that you were called to aid him in his search for his father's consort, who left Eorzea and flew to the east quite some time ago. You agree to help Orn Khai and are advised by Heustienne to try asking Ser Alberic about Dravanian legends concerning areas to the east.

You tell Ser Alberic all you have learned speaking with Heustienne and Orn Khai. He notes that the priest affiliated with the Congregation of Our Knights Most Heavenly is somewhat of an authority of Dravanian legend, and says he shall talk to him on your behalf. You decide to bide your time until Ser Alberic is able to furnish you with a hint as to where to begin your search.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Search for Heustienne at Mare's Oath.
Speak with Alberic.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Word of Estinien's disappearance from the infirmary has reached mine ears.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Whilst part of me is quite capable of sympathizing with his desire to abandon the Holy See, I do wish he had said something ere his departure.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But then, I suppose it is only to be expected. With Nidhogg slain, the Horde's ranks have fallen into disarray, and they are not the threat they once were. Ishgard has scant need of an Azure Dragoon.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Suffice it to say, one would imagine the role of the dragoon shall similarly be forced to change, as we enter this new era of relative peace.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: However, whilst you may have saved Estinien from the great wyrm, my mind is yet plagued by Heustienne's internal strife. May Halone lend her the strength needed to shake free from the dragon blood's fierce grip.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: You are looking quite well, Ser Alberic. And MistressMaster Forename! 'Tis a pleasure to see you too.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Lord Montorgains! Forename and I were just speaking of your daughter.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: That daughter of mine is in fact why I have sought you out. I was recently handed a letter by a merchant that had passed through the Chocobo Forest; if his word is to be believed, he was entrusted with this message by Heustienne herself.

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: The letter was a call for help. MistressMaster Forename, she bade you search for her.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: By the Fury, has she been set upon by heretics once more!?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Alas, there was no more information in her message. Oh, not a day goes by that I do not pray for her safe return...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Forename, I must ask that you take up your lance once more to aid your fellow dragoon. Are you willing?

dialogue.name: MONTORGAINS
dialogue.text: Thank you, MistressMaster Forename. Heustienne awaits you in the Dravanian forelands. Please, help her with whatever she requests.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I entrust you with keeping Heustienne from harm. Head to the forelands and inquire as to her plight.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: So the letter reached my father. I am sorry for having you journey so far just to meet me. As you well know, I cannot return to Ishgard in my current condition.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: That said, the blood's hold on me is not as firm as it once was. This is largely thanks to a new ally of mine. His help has been invaluable in learning to control the dragon within.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: In fact, I have a mind to introduce him to you. Orn Khai, Forename is arrived!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is an honor to meet you, hero of men. Much have I heard of you from my father. He would often talk of the warrior that boasts the strength of a dragon.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Orn Khai has been a great friend ever since he first came across me suffering from the blood's effects. I very much doubt I would be capable of standing here exchanging words with you were it not for his help.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I called you here in order to repay my debt to him. Orn Khai, tell Forename what troubles you.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Yes, thank you. Long before I came into this world, in the age when man and dragon were at peace, my father had a consort.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: But the Dragonsong War tore them asunder. Father belonged to Hraesvelgr's brood, as do I, but his consort was part of Nidhogg's.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: When Nidhogg demanded vengeance for the wrongs committed against him and Ratatoskr, Father asked his consort to fly far to the east.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: She bore no ill will towards man, and while she wanted nothing more than to stay by Father's side, she accepted his request and fled the conflict.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: However, your valiant actions have since put an end to the Dragonsong War. I am positive Father's consort will return if we inform her of the war's conclusion!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Orn Khai requires your aid to search for his father's consort and bring her back home. However, as she left Dravania some thousand summers past, locating her shall be far from an easy task.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Under normal circumstances, I would help Orn Khai myself. But while I am somewhat recovered, I am yet far from being in complete control.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: This is why I summoned you, Forename. Your knowledge of the realm is unparalleled. I beg of you, aid Orn Khai in his search!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: You have my sincerest thanks, Forename!

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. I owe you a debt of gratitude once more. Regrettably, whilst we know she is somewhere to the east, we are entirely ignorant as to the consort's precise whereabouts.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: I would suggest you first try asking Ser Alberic about Dravanian legends, specifically those concerning dragons in the East. Pray report back to me once you have learned something you deem pertinent.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: See if Ser Alberic knows aught of Dravanian legends concerning the East. Pray report back to me once you have learned something pertinent.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Father often remarked that you would have made a fine Dravanian!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Glad to see you safely returned! Were you able to locate Heustienne?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Hmm, I see. She is correct to surmise that formidable dragons are oft made the subject of local legend.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I shall discuss this with the Congregation priest. I have known him to be quite an authority on Dravanian legends.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Although, to think that a dragoon once gripped by the sole desire to slay dragons should now wish to help one. 'Tis a queer new world indeed that we inhabit, though not one I dislike.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But that matters not. I shall seek out the priest at once and raise your query with him. Pray return anon and I shall impart my findings unto you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 眠れる猛竜
journal: Ser Alberic is keen to regale you with Dravanian legends.

Ser Alberic greets you by mentioning that he has finished gathering information on the Dravanian legends that appear relevant to your search. He hands you a piece of parchment detailing the first tale he suggests you investigate, taking care to mention that the Congregation priest emphasized these stories can rarely be taken at face value. You set off to relay this information to Heustienne and Orn Khai.

The legend Ser Alberic has dug up concerns the Slumbering Wyrm of Gyr Abania. Orn Khai is initially distracted upon seeing the parchment, as dragons do not have a written language; they pass down their history through song, which is how he knows the name of his father's consort: Faunehm. Heustienne asks you to accompany Orn Khai to the Fringes to learn more about the Slumbering Wyrm.
The impatient young dragon rushes into the temple without you, and judging by his cries for help, he regrets having done so.

Orn Khai's assailant bested, you resume your search for the dragon of legend. Just as the youthful Dravanian is wondering whether or not the creature you encountered was the Slumbering Wyrm itself, a rather scholarly looking gentleman appears.

The gentleman turns out to be one Professor Erik, and he too has an interest in the legend of the Slumbering Wyrm. He goes on to give you a lecture on the subject─the only noteworthy part of which being that the Slumbering Wyrm was actually a high priest, who passed away over three hundred years prior. Orn Khai soon grows tired of Erik's musings and suggests you head to Coerthas to speak with Ser Alberic.

Ser Alberic apologizes for sending you on a wild goose chase of sorts, but is quick to note that he has another legend you may wish to explore. This one's roots lie far to the east, Ser Alberic remarking that Orn Khai may struggle to make the journey with you due to his modestly sized wings. Orn Khai is, however, undeterred and convinces Ser Alberic to come up with a way to allow him to make the crossing to Kugane.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Ser Alberic upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Present the Dravanian legend to Heustienne at Mare's Oath.
Summon Orn Khai.
Slay the enemy.
Speak with Orn Khai.
Speak with Alberic.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: See if Ser Alberic knows aught of Dravanian legends concerning the east. Pray report back to me once you have learned something pertinent.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Father often remarked that you would have made a fine Dravanian!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, just the womanman I wished to see. We finished examining the Dravanian legends known to us but a short while ago.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: However, the priest bade me make it clear to you that these kinds of legends are oft told in increasingly...colorful ways as the years go on.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Quite common it is for a mere scalekin or puk to, with the Keeper's help, transform into a fearsome dragon. I suppose it should come as little surprise. Legends gain fame by capturing the imagination of the masses; it would not do for an unadorned winged lizard to be the protagonist.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: But let us put the issue of authenticity to one side for a moment. I have summarized the first tale which seemed most relevant on this piece of parchment; pray put it to use in your search. Oh, and lastly, tell Heustienne that she is ever in my thoughts.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Never before have I looked into Dravanian legends with any purpose other than hunting a dragon in mind. Mayhap this is a glimpse of the dragoon's future role in this realm.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Would that parchment happen to be for mine eyes?

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Ah yes, I would never forget Ser Alberic's exquisite handwriting. This information shall be of great use, I am sure. Let us see, it seems he thinks we ought to commence our search with the Slumbering Wyrm of Gyr Abania.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: This is my first time seeing these patterns that men use. Fascinating indeed that you can share information in such a manner.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Dravanian history is chronicled not with letters, but through song. These verses have taught me much about Faunehm─my father's consort.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Faunehm, you say? Well, knowing her name can only aid the search. Forename, pray accompany Orn Khai to the ruins of the Fist of Rhalgr temple in the Fringes.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Ser Alberic states that this is where the origins of the Slumbering Wyrm lie.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: The journey ahead is long, and it will benefit us not to delay our departure any longer. Whistle for me when you have reached our destination and I shall come to your side.

dialogue.name: HEUSTIENNE
dialogue.text: Mayhap I too could learn from Orn Khai's devotion to his father. I have given mine own more cause to worry than I would like to admit.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It would seem man is capable of using lots of styles when creating buildings. I had been expecting something similar to those found in the Churning Mists.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Let us venture inside and see if Faunehm cannot be found.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Your help, if you please!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I know not what it is we are dealing with, but I would be grateful if you could slay it!

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I had been admiring the craftsmanship of man when it suddenly moved towards me. Though I struggle to believe this is what the legends refer to as the Slumbering Wyrm...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, dear Forename! I did not know you too were researching the Slumbering Wyrm!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Researching the Slumbering Wyrm, are we? It is always nice to see others take up an interest in history─even if it is entirely shallow.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: W-Wait, you know of the Slumbering Wyrm? We have journeyed here for the very purpose of meeting that dragon!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Hahahaha! You Dravanians could do with studying up on your history. The time when one could meet the Wyrm has long since passed!

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The high priest Heimart, also known as the Slumbering Wyrm, departed this world over three hundred years ago!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: The Slumbering Wyrm was a mere man!?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But of course! Why would you think otherwise? Heimart was a monk renowned for his mastery of meditation. Though, when necessary, he was quite capable of harnessing his wyrm-like strength to trounce his foes.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: He earned the Slumbering Wyrm alias after...<babble>...hundred men...<babble>...However...<babble>...fell asleep...<babble>

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Well, it seems we must begin our search anew. I worry I too may become a slumbering wyrm should I listen to this tiring man any longer. Let us pay a visit to Ser Alberic instead. Anyone Heustienne holds in such high regard can surely aid our hunt.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I am relieved we were not alone in failing to consider the possibility of a non-Dravanian Slumbering Wyrm...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Good eveningGood morningGood day, Forename. Our friend here has informed me as to the truth behind the legend. My apologies for not looking deeper into the story before bringing it to your attention.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Your next destination lies in the Far East. Tell me, Forename, have you set foot in the region before?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: A port city called Kugane? Sounds positively fascinating. I imagine 'twould be a fine place to begin looking into this next legend. Regrettably, I should not think Orn Khai will be able to accompany you on this journey.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Truly, you have never made the journey? You are so well traveled I assumed you must have visited the city. Well, you shall need to head there if you wish to continue your search. Regrettably, I should not think Orn Khai will be able to accompany you this time.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: But how do you expect to find Faunehm without a dragon in tow?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Your plight is well understood, Orn Khai. It is truly a shame your wings do not match your ambition.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Though...mayhap I have not fully considered all options available to us. We do owe you a great debt for all you have done for Heustienne. Allow me some time, and I shall see to it you are able to follow Forename to the Far East.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: You have my thanks, Ser Alberic! Oh, I wish I could set off this very moment! Perhaps a spot of hunting would be enough to calm me down... Pray call me when preparations are complete!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: At the very least, we now know that Heustienne will not have wanted for company since leaving Ishgard. Sadly, I may struggle to secure passage to the East in quite as timely a manner as he would like. Pray keep your lance arm honed; there is no knowing just what you shall face in Othard.

quest.name: 紅玉海の怪竜
journal: Ser Alberic plans to try his hand at dragon-smuggling.

Ser Alberic reports that he has succeeded in finding a way to have Orn Khai transported across to Kugane. He neglects to inform you of exactly how the young dragon will be making the journey, but ensures you that you will be able to rendezvous with him if you speak to Karaku, the owner of the Bokaisen Hot Springs.

Upon hearing your name, Karaku hastily rushes off to collect a package he says is addressed to you. It is immediately evident that all is not as it seems when the contents of the crate start demanding to be set free. Orn Khai soon escapes from the confines of the box and informs you that the legend of the Serpent of the Ruby Sea is the tale you shall be investigating next. The two of you make your way to Isari in order to see just how much the locals know.

A local fisherman tells you that he is familiar with a faerie tale that mentions the Serpent of the Ruby Sea. However, as his knowledge does not stretch much beyond that, he bids you talk to one of the village's older inhabitants if you seek more information. You spy an elderly woman nearby and head in her direction to see if she cannot aid your search.

As luck would have it, the elderly lady is well versed in matters concerning the legend. According to her, the serpent is no mere faerie tale; it lurks nearby the Coral Banquet and has been to known to eat men whole. Undeterred, you elect to summon Orn Khai in order to share with him your findings.

After hearing that the serpent commonly eats pirates whole, Orn Khai suggests there is little chance that the creature could be Faunehm. Nonetheless, his curiosity gets the better of him and he requests your assistance in searching for the beast of legend. Orn Khai heads off to hunt the bait required to lure the creature out of hiding, while you head for the Coral Banquet.
Orn Khai hurls the freshly hunted bait into the sea and, lo and behold, a menacing creature rises from the ocean depths. You lock horns with the Serpent of the Ruby Sea.
After a fierce battle you finally succeed in slaying the legendary serpent. Inspired by the creature's size, Orn Khai decides to take its carcass back to Bokaisen Hot Springs for supper.

Upon your return to Bokaisen Hot Springs, Orn Khai greets you with the disheartening news that he has already helped himself to the choice cuts of serpent meat. Putting the issue to one side, it is agreed that Orn Khai will remain in Kugane and search for further leads as to Faunehm's whereabouts.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Orn Khai upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Speak with Karaku in Kugane.
Gather information in Isari.
Speak with the wise woman.
Summon Orn Khai.
Speak with Orn Khai.
Speak with Orn Khai in Kugane.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Tide Goes in, Imperials Go Out.”

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. It pleases me to tell you that I have at last discovered a means to have our young friend safely transported to Kugane.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I have reached an agreement with the owner of an establishment in the area─I believe its name was Bokaisen Hot Springs. Converse with him once you are arrived in Kugane and he shall tell you Orn Khai's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I took the liberty of making the little one aware of a few local legends. Hopefully they shall aid you in your search for Faunehm.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Once you are arrived in Kugane, seek out the onsen known as Bokaisen Hot Springs. The establishment's owner will help you rendezvous with Orn Khai.

dialogue.name: KARAKU
dialogue.text: Come one, come all! Burns, cuts, embarrassing rashes─there is naught that the mystical waters of the Bokaisen Hot Springs cannot heal!

dialogue.name: KARAKU
dialogue.text: Ho, you say your name is Forename Surname? Why, a package just arrived for you. I shall fetch it right this instant!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: (-Muffled Moaning-)S-Someone, anyone, release me from this icy prison...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Ugh! What was that blasted dragoon thinking!? It is all well and good for him to tell me to simply sleep through the journey─he is not the one stuffed in a crate of ice crystals!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: And the boat. Oh, how it rocked!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Admittedly he is right in thinking dragons capable of entering a long sleeplike state, but we are not bears! We do not require freezing cold temperatures to achieve this! Ugh, my fangs are like icicles.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: That said, I must admit I enjoyed my best sleep for many a year.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: At any rate, now we are both here, we can resume the search for Faunehm!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Before I was unceremoniously stuffed into that crate, Ser Alberic told me of the legend of Seiryu─a dragon regarded as a guardian of the Far East.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Though something tells me we would not have much luck with this tale either. The story has existed for several thousand years; Faunehm only came to these lands a mere millennium ago.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Ser Alberic agreed that the story most worth our attention was that of the Serpent of the Ruby Sea. This came into being much more recently.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I suggest you visit Isari and try asking the residents if they know anything that might be of help. Whistle for me once you feel you have found something I should know.

dialogue.name: KARAKU
dialogue.text: I am still struggling to believe my eyes. That was a genuine dragon. A more auspicious omen I could not have wished to see!

dialogue.name: ISARIFISHER
dialogue.text: What is that now? Am I familiar with the Serpent of the Ruby Sea?

dialogue.name: ISARIFISHER
dialogue.text: You will struggle to find someone here that is not! Not a day of my childhood passed without my grandmother telling me that faerie tale. These days, hearing the opening line of it alone puts me to sleep in an instant.

dialogue.name: ISARIFISHER
dialogue.text: “All children that dare swim out into the deep blue sea are sure to become the sea serpent's tea.” ...Oh my, I nearly fell asleep there! I imagine that is all any one my age will be able to tell you. Try asking the elderly woman over there if you want to know more.

dialogue.name: ISARIFISHER
dialogue.text: I never thought that an ijin would come asking about the Serpent of the Ruby Sea!

dialogue.name: ISARIOLDWOMAN
dialogue.text: You would have me tell you the faerie tale of the Serpent of the Ruby Sea?

dialogue.name: ISARIOLDWOMAN
dialogue.text: Oh, dear child, that is no mere faerie tale. Head on over to the Coral Banquet if you do not believe me. You shall find a horror beyond your wildest nightmares!

dialogue.name: ISARIOLDWOMAN
dialogue.text: Its nose misses nothing, especially not the blood of men. There is many a tale of wounded pirates falling overboard and being swallowed alive before they could plant a hand on the ship they fell from.

dialogue.name: ISARIOLDWOMAN
dialogue.text: You would do well to make sure any cuts you have are fully healed before looking into this further, child. The serpent's nose misses nothing.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Does it seem like the serpent could be Faunehm?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Hmm, while it is true we dragons do hunt by following our prey's scent, I have not known our kind to swallow men whole. The idea strikes me as awfully...barbaric.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: While I doubt this will lead us to Faunehm, my curiosity has been piqued and I cannot simply leave this mystery unsolved!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is also a brilliant excuse for me to engage in a bit of hunting! We cannot hope to draw out the beast without bait after all. Head to the Coral Banquet and I shall join you shortly.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Father never mentioned you were this slow, Forename! I have already hunted a beast that will doubtless lure out the serpent and I still arrived here long before you.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I shall go ahead and hurl the bloody meat into the sea. Pray deal with any hungry creatures that are drawn to us.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Well. I do not know about you, but that was somewhat bigger than what I was expecting.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: We may have failed to find Faunehm, but in her place we have gained a delicious supper!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Now we have the serpent's meat, let us head back to Bokaisen Hot Springs. The last one back has to prepare dinner!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename, good to see you returned at last. I must confess, I was unable to resist the meat's seductive call and, before I knew it, I had devoured the vast majority of our spoils...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Please do help yourself to whatever is left; I have stored the scra─leftovers in the crate I was sent here in. Pay no attention to anything that may resemble teeth marks, those are indentations created by the ice!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Oh, anyone could see through that lie. I am sorry, Forename. I do hope my greed has not upset you too much.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Why didn't you leave me any good morsels!?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I was never one for meat.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Calm yourself, Forename. Many would count themselves lucky to even have the chance to nibble on the meat of such a majestic beast!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Truly? After hearing of your feats of strength from Ser Alberic, I assumed you must feast upon tonzes of meat everyday!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Regardless, meat is far from our primary concern at the moment. I am beginning to wonder if the day we find Faunehm will ever come.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: But I must not allow myself to lose heart so easily! There are still plenty of legends for us to look into; hope is far from lost. Pray continue to grant me your support, Forename.

quest.name: 漆黒の巨竜
journal: Orn Khai would like to discuss events which may or may not be pertinent to your search.

Orn Khai seems to be enjoying his new surroundings, remarking that the locals treat Dravanians with much more respect when compared to Ishgardians. He also notes that he has made several new acquaintances of late thanks to Karaku. In fact, Orn Khai was just about to set off to meet one such friend when you arrived. Apparently said acquaintance knows something that might aid your search. You decide to accompany Orn Khai and find out what this individual has to say.

Orn Khai's friend is revealed to be Gyodo─a Namazu moneylender. He suggests that you travel to Reunion on the Azim Steppe, for an area nearby is said to be home to a slumbering dragon with scales as dark as the night sky. Orn Khai, convinced you may have finally found Faunehm, sets off for the Steppe and bids you follow him as soon as possible.

You find Orn Khai in Reunion surrounded by Auri children whose curiosity has been piqued by the petite dragon. His hands more than full, Orn Khai encourages you to ask the adult members of the local community about the dragon you seek. You look upon the settlement and wonder whom to engage in conversation first.

It soon becomes apparent that the people of Reunion are not much for small talk. One tells you in no uncertain terms to leave him be if you are not of mind to trade, and another refuses to talk at all. However, the Spinner smiles upon you eventually, as you hear that the dragon is said to dwell near the mountains north of Reunion.

You return to Orn Khai to find him somewhat overwhelmed by all the children's affection. After sharing your findings with him, he agrees the two of you would be best served by searching around the nearby mountains. Once he has freed himself of his admirers, you both prepare to head to Ceol Aen to the northwest.

While searching for Faunehm, you encounter an Oroniri warrior who states that the dark-scaled dragon has thrashed eight of his tribe's finest warriors. You soon find the creature and it is immediately apparent that this is the dragon you have been searching for. Orn Khai calls out to Faunehm, but she is in a frenzy of rage, and words do not reach her.
Following the young dragon's advice, you choose to withdraw from the battle, in order to formulate a more effective plan of action.

Orn Khai is clearly distressed by the state in which he found his father's consort. He bids you leave him alone for a while, to allow him to clear his head and consider how you may free Faunehm from her fury. You begin the walk back to Reunion as Orn Khai takes to the skies once more.

You find a slightly calmer Orn Khai upon returning to Reunion. He notes that the key to getting through to Faunehm is identifying the cause of her temper, and asks that you allow him some time to contemplate what could be ailing her.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Orn Khai upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Orn Khai.
Speak with Orn Khai in Reunion.
Gather information in Reunion.
Report to Orn Khai.
Speak with Orn Khai in Ceol Aen.
Speak with Orn Khai.
Speak with Orn Khai in Reunion.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Hello there, Forename! I must say, I could get used to life in the Far East. Unlike those in Ishgard, Hingans harbor no ill feelings towards us Dravanians.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: You should really hear some of the things Karaku says; he keeps remarking that he wants me to stay here for eternity when he introduces me to new people. It seems he believes quite strongly that dragons bring good luck.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: But what is that expression I see on your face? Could it be jealousy? Oh, Forename, do not worry yourself. You shall be just as popular here one day!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: More importantly, one of the new friends I have made through Karaku mentioned that he knew something that might prove relevant to our search. I was just about to go and meet him now; why don't you accompany me?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Give me a moment, I shall call him now!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is I, Orn Khai!

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: Endless and most sincere apologies to you and yours for the wait, yes, yes. What, what? Forename! Do not worry, no more betrayals, sworn on all the kami in creation I have, yes, yes.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Forename, you have already made Gyodo's acquaintance?

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: Endless and most sincere apologies to you and yours for the wait, yes, yes.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Forename, allow me to introduce Gyodo. Do not be alarmed by his rather slimy appearance for he is perfectly harmless.

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: Come to hear about dragon legends, yes, yes?

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: There is a place that comes to mind. The Azim Steppe.

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: You can get there by following the One River: home to all Namazu.

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: Go way, way upstream and you will reach the Steppe, yes, yes. It is here that a monstrous dragon as dark as the night sky is said to slumber.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: D-Dark as the night sky, you say?

dialogue.name: GYODO
dialogue.text: No more information do I have. Go to the marketplace on the Azim Steppe known as Reunion. You may find the answers you seek there.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: This could be the one, Forename. The Horde was home to many a dark-scaled dragon after all; let us hurry to Reunion!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Well, as these energetic children have come to me, it feels only natural that I try questioning them first.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Perhaps your time would be best spent asking some of the more mature Au Ra if they know anything of the dragon Gyodo mentioned.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Now, now, little ones. There is plenty of me to go around.

dialogue.name: ORONIRMAN
dialogue.text: Come to trade livestock? No!? Then piss off.

dialogue.name: DOTHARLWOMAN
dialogue.text: Woolen rugs! Fine woolen rugs! Bring some warmth to your home!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It seems you would be better served asking elsewhere.

dialogue.name: ORONIRMAN
dialogue.text: A black dragon in these parts? Sure I know of it. The storytellers say the fiend awakens once every few decades and goes on a wild rampage. When it's had its fill of destruction, it returns to its lair in the northwestern mountains and slumbers.

dialogue.name: ORONIRMAN
dialogue.text: If any tribe were able to slay such a beast, it would bring them great honor. We Oronir have had our eyes on it for some time.

dialogue.name: DOTHARLWOMAN
dialogue.text: You are looking for the dragon, are you? I did hear there's been a sighting recently. First one in a hundred years apparently.

dialogue.name: DOTHARLWOMAN
dialogue.text: Not that I believe any of that nonsense! It would not surprise me if the whole story was dreamed up by some fool Oronir in his cups.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text:
Forename...help... These children are not playing nice.
I do not suppose you have fared any better?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: And it's said to live in the northwest?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: If the dragon has truly been sighted recently, our timing is perfect! I am glad we did not come this far only to find it in the midst of a deep slumber.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text:
Let us head for the mountains to the northwest!
Now, now, children. Do you not think it is time you were making your way back to mummy and daddy? We grown-ups have business to attend to!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: This seems as good an area as any to commence our search. Ready to get started, Forename?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Well then, let us see if we cannot─wait, what is that smell?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Are we about to learn that the locals refer to this warrior as a “black dragon”?

dialogue.name: ORONIRWARRIOR
dialogue.text:
<pant> <pant> <pant>
Are you also on the hunt for this dragon?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Hunt!? Perish the thought! We have come to speak with it.

dialogue.name: ORONIRWARRIOR
dialogue.text: Now I've heard everything... Speak, you say? You may be calm and willing to talk, but I assure you that black-scaled monster is not in the mood.

dialogue.name: ORONIRWARRIOR
dialogue.text: It has thrashed eight of our finest warriors. We are disgraced, but I must inform our khan of the battle's outcome.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Well, he certainly was not interested in staying here any longer. Come along, Forename, I think we may have finally found Faunehm this time!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Agh! Faunehm, I beg of you, listen to me!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: She's mad with fury. My voice does not reach her.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: This clash will only end if one of you perishes.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Let us retreat for now and rethink our approach!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: We have come so far, and overcome so many obstacles. Yet, when we finally meet Faunehm, we cannot even speak with her...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: My apologies, Forename, but pray return to Reunion without me. I need some time to take all of this in. Perhaps a spot of hunting would help clear my mind.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Yes, I am somewhat calmer now, Forename, thank you for asking. The key to all of this is discovering the source of Faunehm's rage.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Once we know this, we can decide our next move. Pray give me some time.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I will not allow our journey to end in failure.

quest.name: 紅の竜騎士
journal: Orn Khai is in very low spirits.

Upon approaching Orn Khai it becomes obvious that he is quite down in the dumps. He laments that he has little to show for all his years, and has been unable to uncover the source of Faunehm's rage. However, as luck would have it, it is Orn Khai's despair that allows him to see the truth─Faunehm's current state is a result of having to bear centuries of solitude. Just as he happens upon this theory, the warrior you previously met informs you that some Qestiri merchants have hired a dragon hunter. You hurry with Orn Khai to get to Faunehm before the hunter can.

As you search frantically for Faunehm, you are approached by none other than Estinien, the dragon hunter tasked with slaying Faunehm. He explains how he came to find himself in the area and agrees to lend you his aid upon hearing of your quest to reunite Orn Khai's father with his consort.

The three of you do battle with Faunehm, Orn Khai trying in vain to clear the haze that shrouds her mind, but he does succeed in alerting his father to their presence. Vedrfolnir is able to return his consort to her former self, allowing the battle to reach a peaceful conclusion.

After a millennium apart, Faunehm and Vedrfolnir are reunited at last and free once again to soar the skies above Dravania. You bid farewell to the former Azure Dragoon and your dragon ally, dreaming of future adventures.

※The next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”
objectives: Speak with Orn Khai.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “Heavens Weep.”

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, nice to see you again... Pray forgive me, I have not made any progress in ascertaining the reason for Faunehm's rage.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is truly pathetic... I have been alive far, far longer than you and yet have nothing to show for it.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Surely you did not think me younger than you?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I may be small, but you should know that we Dravanians live far longer than any man!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Wait. We do live an awfully long time─Forename, I think I may have got it!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Dravanians live for eons; I have heard tales from Gullinbursti of dragons going into seclusion for centuries while carrying grief in their hearts. Ultimately, they are unable to bear the strain and it breaks something fundamental within them.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Many a year will need to pass before I come of age to choose a consort, but I believe they help in saving oneself from the abyss of isolation. This is why your kind elects to marry, is it not?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We marry for love.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We marry to save our race from extinction.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I have no idea why anyone marries.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Love? That sounds fairly similar to our reason for choosing a consort.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Wait, do you mean to say you require two of your race to mate!? It is a wonder you have not gone extinct considering the brevity of your lives. It is so much simpler for dragons─only one of us is required to lay our eggs!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Truly? I had considered you more worldly than that, but it seems I was wrong.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Regardless, I am almost certain that Faunehm's fury was caused by the profound loneliness she has endured over this past millennium. Leaving Father's side after they spent so long together must have caused her intense anguish. The question is, how do we heal her pain?

dialogue.name: ORONIRWARRIOR
dialogue.text: I see you two survived your talk with the dragon. Was it as fruitful a discussion as you had hoped for?

dialogue.name: ORONIRWARRIOR
dialogue.text: Not that it matters much. A group of Qestiri merchants have pooled their resources and hired a hunter said to be quite handy with a lance. I've my doubts he's capable of slaying the wyrm, but that doesn't mean I'm not going to watch him try.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I wonder who the dragonslayer in question could be. I struggle to imagine there are that many men with the skill to go toe-to-toe with a dragon like Faunehm...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: However, if he is truly a threat, then we cannot risk him reaching her before us. We may not have a plan, but we have little choice. Come, Forename, let us hurry to where we last saw Faunehm!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Wh-Where is she? We must find her before that hunter does!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)'Tis good to see you again, Warrior of Light.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It would seem that we two Azure Dragoons share one target. Though I suppose neither of us still hold that mantle─old habits do not die so easily.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: The Azure Dragoon of Ishgard!?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: And who exactly is your diminutive friend, Forename?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: A journey to the Far East in search of an ancient wyrm's consort? Quite a tale indeed.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: At the end of my own journey, I chose to continue my travels and eventually found myself in the Far East. It was here that word of the dragon you seek reached mine ears.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: After seeing the future of the Holy See placed in Ser Aymeric's capable hands, I chose to embark upon my own journey. One that would allow me to rediscover my purpose, now that Ishgard no longer has need of an Azure Dragoon. It was during my travels that I came to learn of the dragon you seek.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It had been my intention to act as an intermediary between man and dragon, assuming the beast could be reasoned with. If not, I was prepared to brandish my lance.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Regardless, I would wager that the young one has the right of it. What is more, she is doubtless still suffering from the effects of Nidhogg's hateful dirge that summoned the Horde.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The dread wyrm's hold over his brood was absolute. His unquenchable thirst for vengeance spread through the Horde, leaving none untouched. To think one of them was able to resist his call to decimate Ishgard...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It should come as no surprise that she would succumb to madness; the wyrm spent a millennium in solitude resisting Nidhogg's demands for vengeance.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I can think of but one way she may be saved: we weaken her enough that she is willing to listen to reason.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: We have already tried that approach! It did not work last time and I very much doubt repeating it will change anything.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I do not advocate the same approach, little one. I would have you do more than simply talk to her, nay, you shall use your roar. That is the only way you can hope to let her know the war is ended, that her consort awaits her in the skies above.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: My roar?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You have the two dragoons that bested Nidhogg at your side─there is naught to fear. All you need do is harness your roar to clear the haze that clouds the wyrm's eyes.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I-I shall do my best. Should we fail again, I fear we may not be blessed with another chance. Pray lend me your strength, Azure Dragoons.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Let us depart. The frenzied dragon awaits us on Bardam's Mettle─the time is nigh to free her from war's tragedy!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: With me!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Now, little one! Roar with all your being!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Faunehm, hear my cry!

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Why? Why must we go to war...? I have no ill will, no desire to fight...

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: I have...only silence... A most deafening silence...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is no use! I cannot reach her!

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Do not be so quick to abandon hope, my son!

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: I am come for thee, dearest Faunehm.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Those wings of white... Long have they filled my dreams... Vedrfolnir, my love...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Father...

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Noble dragoons, Orn Khai. I give you my thanks. Were it not for your succor, I would not have been reunited with my beloved.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Allow me to thank you as well. I had truly thought Vedrfolnir lost to me. Mere words will scarce be enough to convey mine appreciation.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: When the conflict began one thousand years past, Nidhogg demanded we exact vengeance upon man.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: However, I refused to allow his hatred to take root within me. I could not bring myself to forget the days when I soared the azure skies with Vedrfolnir, knight on back.

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: A dragon cannot simply shut her ears to her sire's call; to do so would cause her great torment. Thus I bid Faunehm flee to the east, that she might live in peace until the final strains of the Dragonsong War did fade to an end.

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Duty-bound to protect Zenith, I remained behind in Dravania. But ever did I regret not following my heart─and my beloved. 'Twas after she left for eastern lands that thou didst come into this world, my son.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Now I finally see why I was given a name meaning “one born of sadness.”

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Alas, I fear I will never be your match, Father. Faunehm barely even noticed my roar...

dialogue.name: VEDRFOLNIR
dialogue.text: Belittle not your efforts, Orn Khai. I should not have known to come here were it not for thy roar. It reached mine ears, strong and clear, as I soared the skies above.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Father...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Ahem. Well, I suppose you are quite keen to talk with Faunehm. It's been quite some time since you last met, after all.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: L-Let us make haste. I am not used to seeing my father so enamored...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Not quite what I expected when I took on this job, I must admit. But it has been quite something to see what the young dragon is capable of.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I give both of you my sincerest thanks. I find myself especially indebted to you, Forename. Our adventures investigating these legends shall live long in my memory.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: And you, Azure Dragoon. Your strength far exceeds the tales I have heard.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Your words are appreciated, but the appellation is unnecessary. I have long since left that life behind.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: My past experiences with Nidhogg made me eager to see Faunehm saved.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: When the dread wyrm took me as his...vessel, I felt his mad heart's palpitations as mine own. There was no end to the sadness and distress that flowed from his soul. However, it was this ordeal that allowed me to harness the dragon within, whilst retaining my sense of self.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You ought to be capable of the same by now, Forename. It shall doubtless serve you well in battles to come.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: If you are truly done with your old title, then I have a proposal for a new one: the Crimson Dragoon. Much more befitting now that the two of you fight alongside dragons, harnessing their strength as your own!

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hahaha... I can see myself warming up to this new name.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: The best of luck to you, Orn Khai. I expect you to be as strong as your father the next time our paths do cross. Warrior of Light, I look forward to the day when we are able to fight side by side once more. Keep well.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: He shall have nothing to worry about. I will become just as capable as Father so that I may someday soar the skies with a dragoon like you on my back.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Thank you once again for everything, Forename. It is time for me to begin the journey home with Father and Faunehm, but know that I will ever be in your debt. I sincerely hope this is not the last of our adventures!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the dragoon quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next dragoon quest will be available from Alberic.

obj.n: トゥルーブラッドチェスト【ILv290】

quest.name: 消えたトンベリ
journal: Alka Zolka is pleasantly surprised to see you.

Alka Zolka has received a missive from Surito Carito, asking that you come see him straightaway. While he has not expounded upon why, it seems extremely urgent. Make your way to upper La Noscea to learn what is amiss at the Wanderer's Palace.

Surito Carito reveals that his study of the invisible voidsent's corpse has yielded a quasi-cure capable of impeding the spread of the Nymian plague. A miraculous discovery though it may be, he goes on to say that the reason he summoned you is because one of his research assistants, Setoto, has vanished. Worried that harm will befall his friend should they wander too far, he asks that you find and escort the tonberry back. Alka believes there is a chance Setoto has been registered to the Hunt, and suggests you begin your search at the Maelstrom Command.

The Hunt billmaster informs you that the only tonberry currently registered to the Hunt is one by the name of Marberry. Not too long after, R'ashaht appears bearing some interesting news. The Miqo'te commander tells you that Vesper Bay has been awash with rumors of an odd-looking stowaway who scurried off a ferry as it pulled ashore. Whoever─or whatever─it was, has been described as being small of stature like a Lalafell but with exotic features. Perhaps this mysterious passenger is your missing tonberry, and it would benefit you to investigate this matter further.

You and Alka approach a sailor who looks to be a crew member of the boat R'ashaht mentioned. The man confirms having seen the stowaway, which he describes as some manner of rare beast of a gobbie without a mask. He assures you that whatever it was, the Brass Blades are looking for it. While Alka makes a detour to Ul'dah to see what more he can uncover though his contacts regarding this incident, he asks that you inform Surito Carito of all that has happened.

Surito Carito is of the opinion that, if in Aldenard, Setoto will be near impossible to find. He believes it would be best to wait until you come across any additional news on where the missing tonberry might have gone before making a move. Rest while you can because as soon as word of Setoto's possible whereabouts reaches you and Alka Zolka, the two of you must rush to find, and possibly rescue, the tonberry.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Surito Carito near the Wanderer's Palace.
Speak with the Maelstrom Command Hunt billmaster.
Rendezvous with Alka Zolka in Vesper Bay.
Report to Surito Carito near the Wanderer's Palace.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, that you should arrive at this very instant─it is as though the gods themselves have sent you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Not a quarter bell ago I received a missive from Surito Carito. An emergency has arisen at the Wanderer's Palace, and he has requested our immediate presence.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: While the exact nature of this trouble remains unclear, we can scarce ignore his call.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: He awaits us at his usual place. Come, my friend, we haven't a moment to waste!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Alka Zolka, Forename. Thank you both for responding so swiftly to my summons.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forgive my brusqueness, but I believe it best if we cut straight to business. I presume the both of you remember the invisible voidsent we defeated not too long ago?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We could scarce forget such a vile creature.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Well, you'll be pleased to hear that I have finished studying its remains and believe a cure may be within my grasp.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Ah, but mayhap “cure” is a slight exaggeration. What I speak of will only halt the spread of the sickness, not reverse all of the effects it has had on our bodies.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito, you are far too modest a man! Truly, what you speak of is incredible─a miracle, even.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Alas, it is not to be praised for the progress I've made that I asked you here today. You see, Setoto, one of my comrades who has been assisting me in my experiments, has mysteriously vanished.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I am terribly worried. While the rancor has subsided from most of our hearts, we still retain our tonberry forms. Were we to wander too far from our home here, any number of organizations would be more than happy to have us hunted down.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: That is why I would ask that you─my two most trusted associates─locate and escort Setoto back to the Wanderer's Palace before it's too late.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Of course we'll do it. We can hardly ignore the pleas of one of Nym's foremost scholars!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, I have an idea of where we can start. Let us check with the Grand Companies to see if a bounty has been placed on Setoto's head.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Bounty? <sigh> Let us hope it has not yet come to that...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The Maelstrom Command is in Limsa Lominsa. There, we should be able to ask the Hunt billmaster if any tonberries have recently been registered.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We've done this a million times, and yet something about today has me feeling incredibly restless. Please, let us hurry and see what Surito Carito has to say.

dialogue.name: HUNTBILLMASTER
dialogue.text: Good eveningmorningday to you, sir. How might I be of service to you today?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We're looking to save─er─slay a tonberry.

dialogue.name: HUNTBILLMASTER
dialogue.text: A tonberry, eh? We currently have only one tonberry marked for the Hunt by the name of Marberry.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Marberry? If I recall correctly, he was marked for the Hunt from even before Setoto disappeared. The possibility of there being a mix-up between the two is slim. It seems we must continue our search elsewhere.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: [GC Rank] SurnameForename of the Scions, Alka. I wasn't aware the two of you knew each other.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: R'ashaht! Good to see you again. I think I may have forgotten to say so the other day, but I greatly appreciated your help with my training.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: You know I'm always happy to help. I don't suppose you've come all this way to thank me, however. What brings the two of you here?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We're searching for an escaped tonberry and thought it might have been marked for the Hunt.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: A tonberry, you say?

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: While I can't promise this is in any way related, a few days back a disturbance broke out in Vesper Bay. They discovered a stowaway hiding in one of the ferries.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Indeed?

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: Witnesses say that a small green blur leapt from between the crates and dashed out of sight as soon as the ship pulled into port.

dialogue.name: RASHAHTRHIKI
dialogue.text: While of a similar size and build to a Lalafell or Qiqirn, they claim it looked far too alien to be either.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Hm... Thank you, R'ashaht. It sounds like you may have just given us our first lead!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, after me! We make for Vesper Bay with all haste.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I fear for our friend's safety. Please, Forename, do whatever it takes find and escort Setoto back to the Wanderer's Palace before it's too late.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Oh, good. For a moment I thought I had lost you. Let us begin by questioning this man here─he appears to be one of the men from the ferry R'ashaht told us about.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: Yer askin' if I saw the stowaway? Aye. Ye bet I did.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: Now it wasn't just any stowaway what boarded our ship. Nay. I suspect it was a one o' 'em fellas─a gob─without his mask. Either that, or it's a rare beastie ye can't find around these here parts. Not that it matter, mind ye.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: Whatever it was, the Brass Blades are after it, and ye best be sure they'll catch it.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Indeed. Thank you for all your help, sir.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If an organization that large has yet to find the stowaway, we've little chance of succeeding in such an endeavor ourselves.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Rather than blindly rushing about, our time would be better spent gathering what information we can regarding this incident. I shall go and speak with my acquaintances in Ul'dah. In the meantime, I ask that you return to Surito Carito and inform him of all that we learned.

dialogue.name: DARKSAILOR02923
dialogue.text: What in the gods' name was that thing? I ain't never seen anythin' like it.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forename, I can only hope your swift return means you come bearing good news.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: ...Has crossed the sea and is likely now in Thanalan, you say!? What could possibly have spurred our friend to do such a thing?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito, forgive my tardiness.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I made a small detour to Ul'dah to speak with my associates. Unfortunately, they could tell me nothing aside from the fact that the Brass Blades are looking into who the stowaway might be. I've, nevertheless, asked that they keep an ear to the ground and report to me should they learn more.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Alka Zolka. <sigh> If, as you suspect, our friend has fled to the vast continent of Aldenard, there is little sense in us conducting any more searches.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Judging by the Brass Blades' inability to find their quarry, we should have no need to worry about the Hunt or any other institution capturing Setoto for now. Our best option is to wait until we know more.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I am inclined to agree. Should I come across any new information, I will send word to you right away.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: There's a good chance this search will turn into something of a long-term effort. Forename, I suggest you rest while you still can.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next scholar quest will be available from Surito Carito upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: セトトの足跡
journal: Surito Carito stares at you with a puzzled glimmer in his yellow eyes.

Surito Carito wastes no time in informing you that Alka Zolka has received news of Setoto's possible whereabouts. He then tells you to make for the Marauders' Guild in Limsa Lominsa, where the marauder-turned-Royal Marine awaits to disclose to you the relevant details.

According to Alka Zolka, the Brass Blades have managed to track down a creature resembling the description of the stowaway. Luckily for you, their quarry has slipped into the Black Shroud─an area that is outside of their jurisdiction. He then bids you to follow him to Camp Tranquil, where Setoto now likely is, and the two of you make ready to depart.

Alka Zolka reminds you that while the stowaway─who may well be Setoto─is safe from the Brass Blades, the forested area is just as dangerous for a lone tonberry. With precious little time to waste, it is decided the two of you will split up to conduct separate searches. Alka will check the northern part of the Black Shroud, while you scour the south.
You thoroughly investigate the area but you do not find Setoto. Mayhap it is time to move on and continue looking for the tonberry elsewhere.
Despite your best efforts, your search of this area turns up nothing. Perhaps searching the lands further north will yield better results.

You come across a tonberry lying facedown in the dirt surrounded by Coeurlclaw poachers. The pack of hunters are not at all pleased by your presence and warn you not to come any closer to them or their prey. Seeing as they intend to kill and skin the creature before them, it may be in your best interest to stop them.

The poachers are no match for you, and you swiftly dispatch of all three of them. Setoto, on the other hand, did not seem to fare nearly as well as you in her fight against them. Quickly cast Adloquium on her that she might be healed.

Shortly after casting Adloquium upon Setoto, you are joined by Alka Zolka, who is immediately enamored of the young tonberry girl. After commenting upon her beauty, he goes on to ask what motivated her to travel so far from her home in Bronze Lake. She tells you of how in the days before Nym's collapse her father was a scholar and Royal Marine. Suspecting he was captured by the Amdapori whilst on an undercover mission there, she sought to examine the ruins for anything that once belonged to him. Touched, Alka eagerly volunteers the both of you to aid her in her search. Return to Camp Tranquil with the tonberry girl and Alka to discuss how the three of you might proceed.

Alka Zolka will be returning once to Bronze Lake to inform Surito Carito of all that has happened. Before going, however, he makes Setoto promise that she will no longer wander about on her own and asks that you see that she gets plenty of rest in his absence. Once he returns and Setoto is fully recovered, the three of you will be leaving to search Amdapor Keep for a memento of Setoto's father.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Speak with Alka Zolka at the Marauders' Guild.
Rendezvous with Alka Zolka at Camp Tranquil.
Survey the designated location.
Defeat the poachers.
Cast Adloquium on Setoto.
Speak with Alka Zolka at Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. What brings you this way?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Oh? It seems, then, Alka Zolka's last missive somehow failed to reach you.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: He has uncovered information regarding Setoto's possible whereabouts and is currently waiting for you to join him at the Marauders' Guild in Limsa Lominsa. You best hurry.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Well come, my friend. My contacts have but recently caught wind of a rumor that the Brass Blades are once again on the move. It seems they have spotted a creature matching the description of the Vesper Bay stowaway.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Luckily for us, their quarry has fled into the Black Shroud─an area that is out of their jurisdiction.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: While there is still much we do not know, at least we now have an idea of where to begin. Let us immediately depart for Camp Tranquil!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Setoto, I pray that you are safe...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As you may well already know, the only way to reach the Black Shroud from Thanalan is to pass through this area. That means whoever─or whatever─the Brass Blades were pursuing entered the forests from here.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If our hunch is correct and Setoto is in there, we best hurry. A tonberry who has seen little of the outside world would likely not last more than a few days on their own.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: To cover more ground in less time, I suggest we split up: I shall take the north, while you scour the south. Once we're done, let us meet back here.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Try as you might, you do not catch sight of Setoto or anything resembling the missing tonberry.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You spy a fallen figure, small of stature and green of skin. It's surrounded by poachers!

dialogue.name: HUNTERA02924
dialogue.text: It looks like we've struck gold! Haha! If we skin and sell this thing, we're guaranteed a fortune!

dialogue.name: HUNTERB02924
dialogue.text: Seven hells! Don't go celebrating just yet. We've got to kill it first. The hide's so thick, it broke my bloody knife!

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: You are under attack!

dialogue.name: HUNTERA02924
dialogue.text: Oh, no you don't!

dialogue.name: HUNTERB02924
dialogue.text: Piss off! This thing's ours!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: <pant> <pant> Thank you, madamsir. You saved my life.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: That spell... You wield Nymian magicks? Are you perchance Forename─the adventurer in possession of a soul crystal? Surito Carito often speaks of you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <pant> Thank the gods... <pant>...you're safe.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: After my search of the northern reaches turned up nothing, I returned to Camp Tranquil to wait for you. When you didn't appear I began to grow worried and came looking for you. Good thing I did, too. Bloody poachers!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Oh, but how rude of me. I nearly forgot to introduce myself. Hello, Setoto. I am Alka Zolka, Royal Marine and marauder. My friend, Forename Surname and I have been searching for you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: My lady, if I may be so bold as to say so, your radiance─it is blinding. Forename, isn't she beautiful?

dialogue.name: CHOICE
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: CHOICE
dialogue.text: “She”? How did you know?

dialogue.name: CHOICE
dialogue.text: I'm pretty sure she is a he.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It's obvious isn't it? Her glowing skin, her comely face─she is clearly a lovely young woman.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Very amusing, Forename. I suggest you temper your jokes, however, lest the young lady before us take offense!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Now, Setoto, what prompted you to leave Bronze Lake so abruptly?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: As you are likely already aware, Surito Carito saved us. While on the outside we remain as tonberries, he has purged our hearts of the rancor.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: And that is why I left. There is something I must take care of now that my mind is once again my own.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: And what, pray tell, is that?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Over fifteen hundred years ago, back when Nym was still at its peak, my father was a scholar and a Royal Marine. He was dispatched upon a secret and incredibly dangerous mission to infiltrate Amdapor.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: The day he left was the last time I ever saw him. I suspect the reason he never returned was because he was discovered and apprehended by the Amdapori.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: ...And so you came here─to the place the ancient nation once stood.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You do realize that regardless of whether he survived or not, your father, he...

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I know. I am under no illusions that he might still be alive. Even if he somehow escaped Amdapor, unlike those of us sealed away in the tower, the passage of time would have eventually robbed him of his life.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I'm only looking to find something that reminds me of him─a keepsake, if you will.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: ...It sounds as though you loved your father a great deal.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Very well, if this means that much to you, we─the Royal Marines─shall volunteer to aid you in your search! Ahem. Right, Forename?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: The two of you would really do that for me? Oh, thank you! Thank you so very much.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Now let us return to Camp Tranquil. There, we can discuss how to proceed.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Ungh... Father... Is this where it all ends?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Setoto appears injured. Quickly cast Adloquium upon her that she might be healed.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Before we begin searching for a memento of Setoto's father in earnest, I must go to Bronze Lake to inform Surito Carito we have found his dear comrade and that she is safe. Speaking of which...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Setoto, you must promise me you will never again do anything so reckless as wandering a foreign land alone. The realm is a dangerous place─doubly so for someone with your affliction.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Very well. If it really means that much to you, I shall make that promise.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ahem. ...G-Good. That is all that I ask.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, I ask that you look after Setoto and see that she gets some rest that she might recuperate from her ordeal. We shall make for the lost city upon her full recovery!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: With the two of you by my side, I am absolutely certain nothing can go wrong!

quest.name: たったひとつの「家族」
journal: Alka Zolka fusses over Setoto.

As Setoto appears to be fully recovered, Alka Zolka would like to begin the search for a memento of her father. The Royal Marine suggests beginning at Amdapor Keep. If, as you have come to suspect, Setoto's father was captured by the Amdapori while on a mission to discover a way to reverse the Nymian plague, he would have been transported to Amdapor Keep for questioning. It is then likely that some of his remaining possessions can be found there. Make your way to the ancient ruins and look for any items which Setoto might remember her father by.

The three of you pick your way through Amdapor Keep, and you encounter various denizens of the ruins and ancient artifacts─including an Amdapori journal which touches upon taking a Nymian spy captive. From it you are able to conclude that Setoto's father's personal effects have been stored in a mana idol. As you begin dismantling these Amdapori golems, you are confronted by a manasnatcher, one of the hulking creatures that resides there. After a hard-fought battle, it falls lifeless to the ground, and a coffer tumbles from its innards. You, Alka, and Setoto move to open it.

You open it to see that it contains what appears to be Setoto's father's grimoire, clothes, and soul crystal.
