Gingerly taking the crystal in her hands, Setoto begs her father's faerie, Lilac, to appear. It unleashes a sphere of purple light and Setoto falls to the ground, unconscious. After an unsuccessful attempt to wake her, Alka Zolka bids you help him transport the tonberry out of the dangerous ruins and to Camp Tranquil.

You and Alka return to Camp Tranquil with Setoto, and the marauder asks that you use your knowledge to diagnose what is wrong with her. You conclude that, despite the lack of physical injuries, it will be a while before the young tonberry girl wakes. Alka is deeply troubled by the news, and his panicked shouts draw the attention of Landenel of the Wood Wailers, who offers to take Setoto into his care until such a time she has recovered. Requesting that you remain behind with her and Landenel, Alka Zolka leaves you for Bronze Lake to speak with Surito Carito.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Rendezvous with Alka Zolka near Amdapor Keep.
Speak with Alka Zolka at Camp Tranquil.
Find Setoto a memento of her father!
Defeat the manasnatcher!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Setoto! You appear to be doing much better. Even your complexion has returned to normal.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Indeed! I, too, noticed that my skin once again glows a healthy shade of green!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, now that Setoto has recovered, our search can begin. Ere we depart, let us quickly review what we know.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Setoto's father was a scholar in the Royal Marines who had been dispatched on a mission to infiltrate Amdapor. He was to return with a cure to the disease that threatened to engulf Nym─only, he never did.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Yes. I am almost certain he was caught, captured, and then killed by the Amdapori...

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Even if that was not the case, after fifteen hundred years, we can safely assume he is no longer alive. I hold out hope, however, that some of his belongings remain.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: The Amdapori were extremely dedicated to expanding their knowledge of healing magic. Anything in a scholar's possession would have been of incredible value to them, and had your father been captured, they would have confiscated all that he had.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: He would then likely have been transported to a remote and secure location for interrogation. That means...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Our chances of finding anything that once belonged to him will be highest in Amdapor Keep.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Oh, Alka, not only are you terribly kind, but you are keen of mind, as well!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ahem. Thank you. Now, in the final years of the War of the Magi, Amdapor was demolished by the Mhachi. It was overrun with a myriad of voidsent beasts that linger to this day.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As we forge forward, you must be sure to keep your wits about you! Amdapor Keep is fraught with dangers both known and unknown.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: For so long I've been treated like a hideous beast that I'd forgotten what it was like to be thought of as a girl. Alka has reminded me, and for that, I cannot thank him enough.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We've finally made it! Forename, if you're ready, please lead the way.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: So this is Amdapor Keep...erstwhile home to the mages we fought so long and hard against.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: The Presence Chamber... From here we must tread with caution. We know not what dangers lurk in the shadows.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Whatever happens, I shall not leave this place without something to remember my father by.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: <gasp> Forename! This log─I think it's about my late father...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: (-Tattered Log-)The interrogation of the Nymian spy we apprehended is scheduled to soon take place at the Moot Hall.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: (-Tattered Log-)The healing powers his people wield are not like to those of white magic. Regardless of what it takes, we must find a way to determine the mysterious source of his power.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: (-Tattered Log-)We suspect his robes are crucial to his spellcasting. They will no doubt hold some of the answers.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: (-Tattered Log-)For now, however, we will be sealing them away in one of our mana idols.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Then we must begin dismantling the mana idols!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: One of them might be carrying Setoto's father's things!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Rubbish, nothing more...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: All the pages are in tatters. Perhaps we'll have better luck with the next one we find.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Nothing in this bag looks as though it could have belonged to him...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: <cough> <cough> The stench... It's worse than that of spoiled milk!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This book appears to─

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: <grunt> Wh-What's this? My body tingles from head to toe and suddenly I feel so light! It must be charmed!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: This chest is full to the brim with treasure!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: No. This isn't what we're looking for. Let us leave it.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Why are there so many broken mana─ Great gods! That beast! Over there!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: He's spotted us! We have no choice but to fight him.

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Is...is that a coffer!? This thing must have been feeding on the mana idols!

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Setoto, Forename! Perhaps this is it...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Seven hells! We're done for...

dialogue.name: QIB
dialogue.text: Father...forgive me...

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Look! It's a Nymian grimoire!

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: I recognize this! It's my father's! And these...

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: These are his robes! Th-They're from the day he left. All of it has been so perfectly preserved, it's almost as though he were wearing them but yesterday...

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Oh? What's this?

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: ...Is that his soul crystal!?

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Yes...and within slumbers the faerie that has been with my family for generations.

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: I thought I had lost nearly everyone to that godsforsaken war and the terrible disease that followed... Yet, in spite of all odds, here she is─the last of my family, sitting right in the palm of my hand. I would give anything to see her again.

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Lilac...? Lilac, please... Answer me!

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Setoto? Setoto!? What happened? Wake up!

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Forename, something's wrong! She's not responding. We must get her back to Camp Tranquil immediately!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, you're a Royal Marine and an outstanding scholar, besides. Surely, you can diagnose what's wrong with her?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Setoto has no external injuries, and both her breathing and pulse are stable. Despite this, she appears to have slipped into a coma from which she will not wake any time soon.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: She won't be waking any time soon!? No, that can't be! What in the seven hells happened back there!?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Troubled civilians in need of a helping hand, I presume? Might the Wood Wailers be of assistance?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Ah! Well, if it isn't the adventurer! What brings you to this neck of the woods?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, this is another one of your friends, I take it?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: So, in essence, a botched invocation rendered this thing unconscious? The solution to that is simple enough. Just leave it there to rest until it wakes up.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Thing!? Thing!? How dare you speak of Setoto in such a callous manner! And to think that you would suggest we leave this beautiful young lady out here in the open until she wakes up─you must be mad!

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Young lady...? You're quite sure that's what he─er, she is?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Ahem. My apologies. I shall carry the young girl inside and see that she is given a proper place to rest. But before that... This...coat of green mucus isn't contagious, is it?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Green mucus!? That's not green mucus, it's... <sigh> Never mind.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: No, it's not contagious. You should be fine. Thank you for your help, sir. It is greatly appreciated.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: At least for now, we can rest easy knowing that Setoto is safe─or as safe as she can be given the circumstances.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: All should be in order. I've seen to it that your friend has been given a comfortable bed to rest in until she recovers.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, I shall return to Bronze Lake and inform Surito Carito of all that has happened. Perhaps he will be able to shed light on what is wrong with Setoto.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: In the meantime, I would ask that you remain near on hand and keep an eye on her. Don't worry. I shouldn't be away too long.

quest.name: フェアリーの行方
journal: Alka Zolka's face is drawn into tight lines.

In attempting to summon Lilac, Setoto has expended a majority of her aether─a condition one can normally recover from with a bit of rest. Despite having been asleep for quite some time now, however, the tonberry girl shows no signs of improvement, and Alka grows worried that something else is wrong. He asks that you visit Surito Carito at the Wanderer's Palace that the two of you might combine your scholarly knowledge to determine what exactly is amiss.

Surito Carito speculates that the reason Setoto has not recovered is because she managed only a partial summoning. He believes this has resulted in a phantom faerie, which has forestalled her recovery by preventing her aether from being returned to her. Telling you the only way for you to save her is to track down and dispatch of this half-formed creature, Surito Carito leaves you to return to Alka Zolka.

As you are informing Alka Zolka of the current state of affairs, Landenel approaches you with interesting news. He tells you of how a large number of his men have encountered a ghost in the forest─one in the form of a floating purple orb. This description happens to match the partially summoned Lilac at the ruins, and you and Alka decide to investigate. According to Landenel, the Wailers have spotted the phantom faerie in Snakemolt and the Upper Paths. The ex-marauder will be searching Snakemolt, while you have a look around the Upper Paths.
You carefully survey the first area in the Upper Paths for the roaming purple specter. You find nothing. Perhaps it is time to move on.
A thorough search of the next region in the Upper Paths uncovers nothing. Hopefully the last stretch of the South Shroud you have been ordered to inspect will turn up something.

As you scan this last bit of land, something purple and aetherial catches your eye. It releases a hideous shriek and lashes out at you. You quickly defeat it, but alas, it is not the phantom faerie you seek. Alka Zolka no doubt awaits you back at Camp Tranquil. It is best not to keep him waiting.

Alka Zolka also has had no luck in locating the faerie. As the two of you prepare to open up discussions on how you might proceed, Landenel appears, once again. He tells you of how one of his men was just attacked by the phantom faerie, which then escaped into the Lost City of Amdapor. While eager to give chase, due to the darkness that lingers there, the commanding Wood Wailer must first receive permission from the Order of the Twin Adder before any of you can enter. Asking that you make preparations while you wait, he goes to speak with his higher-ups.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Speak with Surito Carito at the Wanderer's Palace.
Report to Alka Zolka at Camp Tranquil.
Survey the Upper Paths for the phantom faerie.
Report to Alka Zolka at Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, something's terribly wrong. Ever since she collapsed, Setoto hasn't so much as stirred.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: According to Surito Carito, the sickness transforms not only the body, but also the quality of the afflicted individual's aether.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As such, attempting to summon Lilac in her current state likely drained her of nearly all her vitality.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: A bit of rest, however, should have been enough to replenish her reserves, and she should be awake by now. The fact that she's not means something else is amiss.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Please go and have a word with Surito Carito, scholar to scholar. Perhaps if you were to combine your wits, you might learn what is wrong. I shall remain here and look after Setoto.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Worry not, adventurer. The green girl is in safe hands.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: So Setoto still slumbers on...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Normally, when scholars summon their faeries, they do so by extracting a portion of the aether circulating through their body and willing it to take shape.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: By releasing that form, they can then dismiss it, and the aether will flow back into their bodies. This is what should have happened to Setoto when she fell unconscious. I cannot understand why she remains asleep... Unless...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: What if she only managed a partial summoning?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: There is a possibility that all of Setoto's aether fled from her body upon calling to Lilac, causing her to then fall unconscious before the faerie could fully manifest.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: That would mean this unbound phantom is out there somewhere, aimlessly roaming the land and preventing her from regaining consciousness.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: You and Alka must hurry to find and dispatch of it before it wanders too far. It may be the only way to wake her!

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: She doesn't seem to be recovering. Poor girl. Mayhap the green ooze has finally gotten the best of her...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If you and Surito Carito were to combine your wits, I'm certain you can find a way to save her. Make haste, Forename. I fear we may be running out of time.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Finally you've returned. What did Surito Carito have to say?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: A partially summoned familiar!? Then, as Surito Carito suggests, we must hunt this thing down and destroy it.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Do you recall how, right before Setoto fell unconscious at the ruins, a purple sphere of light appeared before us? That must be the phantom faerie to which he refers.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Problem is, the moment it materialized it vanished from Amdapor Keep. There's no telling where it could have gone...

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: The two of you are looking awfully somber. What's wrong?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Hm... Does this thing, by any chance, resemble a floating violet orb?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: So you've seen it?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: No, but lately many of the Wailers have been claiming they've encountered a specter in the forest. In fact, the reports have been so numerous in number that I've been given orders to investigate the matter.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Interestingly enough, the description they've given me seems to match this phantom faerie of yours.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Aye. That'll be it, all right.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: While I'd like to immediately begin my search of this faerie-specter, there are a few rather pressing matters I must attend to first.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Not to worry! Forename and I will take it from here. We've already troubled you enough as it is.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Very well, then. My men have spotted the thing along the Upper Paths and Snakemolt. You may want to begin by searching both those places.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: I'm not doing it for you. I'm doing it for the young lady. It's not as though I could simply stand by and watch as a helpless girl fights for her life.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <sigh> It may not seem it, but somewhere in that man is a good heart.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Now then, let's immediately begin surveying the areas Landenel mentioned. You take the Upper Paths, and I'll go to Snakemolt!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forename, please hurry and tell Alka Zolka what I have shared with you. The partially summoned faerie must be stopped at all costs.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You notice nothing out of the ordinary.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Out of the corner of your eye, you see an eerie glowing presence floating toward you.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It releases a hideous scream, and you find yourself under attack!

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: I wish I could accompany you, but unfortunately, I have a few other things I must attend to.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Ah, it's about time you came, my friend! I was beginning to grow concerned one of the beasts in the forest had gotten the better of you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I, myself, encountered a fair few woodland creatures during my search, one of which was a purple sphere of light. Alas, it turned out to simply be a will-o'-the-wisp. By the expression on your face, I assume your investigation went no better?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Where the seven hells did that thing fly off to?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: There you are! Just moments ago, one of my men was attacked by your faerie.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Wh-What!?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: According to him, it disappeared into the Lost City of Amdapor. We won't be able to give chase, just yet, however. Entry into the area is heavily restricted due to the darkness which permeates it.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: We need to receive permission from the Order of the Twin Adder. I shall go and request that right now. In the meantime, I ask that you wait here.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Landenel, with all due respect, why is it that you're so intent on helping us? To put it bluntly, the faerie is our responsibility, not yours.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: I told you before─green of skin or not─I cannot stand to see the young girl suffer. After all, the duty of the strong is to protect the weak.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Now, if the two of you are planning on joining me in this fight against the faerie-phantom, I suggest you begin making preparations. Taking this thing down is going to be no easy task.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Alka Zolka returned from his search a while ago and has been looking for you since. You best go and speak with him.

quest.name: 時をかける願い
journal: Alka Zolka impatiently awaits your arrival.

Alka Zolka informs you that Landenel has officially been granted permission from the Order of the Twin Adder to enter the lost city. Asking that you accompany him to the gates, he then dashes off with you following not too far behind him.

You wait for Landenel to arrive, and together, the three of you enter the portal. Almost immediately you spot the phantom faerie and give chase. Puzzled by its movements, Alka comments that the sphere of purple light seems as though it is attempting to guide you somewhere. It eventually fuses together with Kuribu─one of the guardian statues. After defeating the resulting amalgamation, you glance down to see a blood red gem gleaming upon the ground.

Stooping down, you quickly pocket the red gem that fell from the Kuribu-faerie fusion. Turning back, Alka calls out to you, bidding that you hurry to follow him and Landenel back to Camp Tranquil. Everyone is eager to see if Setoto has finally opened her eyes.

Upon your arrival to Camp Tranquil, Landenel disappears and returns shortly with Setoto in tow. Alka is relieved to see that she is finally awake. Setoto tells you briefly of a dream she saw of her father and it spurs Alka to once more question the half-manifested Lilac's intentions for entering the lost city and seemingly leading you to Kuribu. He then turns to you and inquires as to what you crouched down to retrieve right before leaving Amdapor. You hold out the gemstone and Alka, recognizing its possible value, requests that you to deliver it to Surito Carito for inspection.

According to Surito Carito, the gemstone is the crystal core of the statue you defeated and contains potent white magic. He surmises that Lilac, a part of Setoto's father's consciousness, was driven by a strong desire to see Setoto cured of the Green Death. As such, the phantom faerie led you through the lost city that you might discover this gem, which may contain a remedy to the condition afflicting inhabitants of the Wanderer's Palace.

Certain it holds the key to curing the Green Death and reviving the scholarly arts, Surito Carito vows to begin his analysis of the red gemstone straightaway. He thanks you, going on to say he stands by his choice in bequeathing Lily onto you. While Surito Carito seems to have said all he means to say, Alka Zolka is looking at you expectantly. It seems, he too, has a few words for you.

Alka Zolka is over the moon to see that Setoto is back to normal, and is incredibly excited about what the future holds in store for the Royal Marines. Telling you he feels blessed to have you as a friend, he then suggests that together you return home and train.

※The next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “The Soul of Temperance.”
objectives: Speak with Alka Zolka near the gates to the Lost City of Amdapor.
Speak with Alka Zolka at Camp Tranquil.
Speak with Surito Carito at the Wanderer's Palace.
Speak with Surito Carito.
Speak with Setoto.
Speak with Alka Zolka.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename, you're here! Excellent.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Landenel, mere moments ago, received the necessary authorization for us to enter Amdapor.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: He'll also be accompanying us into the lost city. He claims that in watching over Setoto, he's developed a brotherly affection for her and wants to help. Honestly, I think he's just raring for a fight.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Well, whatever his reasons, I am simply glad for his assistance. The more seasoned fighters we take, the faster we'll be able to dispatch the parasite leeching Setoto of her aether. Now, let us head to the gates─where we will be meeting Landenel.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: It shouldn't be much longer until we receive an answer from the Order of the Twin Adder.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Are you ready, Forename?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Good. The moment Landenel joins us, we'll enter the lost city.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: I presume Alka Zolka has apprised you of all that you need to know, including the fact that I'll be delving into the depths of the lost city with you. Please begin making your way there. I'll meet you at the gates.

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Is it... Is it gone? Haha! It is! We did it! It's another victory for the Royal Marines!

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: The statue's stopped moving and the earlier dread I felt has begun to recede. It appears the phantom faerie is no longer...

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Yes─which means there's a very good chance Setoto's aether has returned to her! She'll be up soon! Let's hurry back so that she might have a friendly face to wake to.

dialogue.name: NCUT
dialogue.text: Forename, what in the gods' name are you doing!? Come, we must return to Camp Tranquil posthaste!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <pant> That fight...<pant>...took a lot more out of me than I thought it did. <pant> Where's Setoto? And Landenel, for that matter...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Setoto, you're awake!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Alka, what's wrong? Are you all right?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: ...Do you not remember? You attempted to summon Lilac, and fell unconscious. You've been asleep this entire time─well, at least until we defeated the faerie you had called forth.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I...I had no idea... I'm so sorry. It was never my intention to place any of you in harm's way.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: ...While I was sleeping I had a dream.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: It was of my father. When the first wave of the sickness hit, person after person began taking ill. I watched as he and the other scholars rushed through the streets, trying to save anyone they could.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Then, the sickness struck me. When my skin began to turn green and my limbs began to shrink, he decided to embark upon a mission to obtain the cure─one he knew was destined to end in failure from the very start.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: He made his way to where all the white mages resided─the enemy nation of Amdapor. In a last-ditch attempt to save me, he infiltrated their borders. I suppose we all know how that story ends...

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: <sigh> Even if he no longer cared for me─loathed me, even─for what I had become, it wouldn't matter. I just wish I could have seen him one last time...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What are you talking about, Setoto!? Your father would have been delighted to see the stunning young woman you've grown into.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Alka. You always know what to say.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: While I've always known I'd never again feel my father's loving embrace, I had thought that maybe, just maybe, I could have at least seen his faerie.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: In my selfish desire to do so, however, I put everyone in danger, including Lilac. Words are not enough to express how sorry I am.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: That reminds me... Setoto, do you have any idea why Lilac was so drawn to the lost city?

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: You need not worry about it, friend. There is likely little rhyme or reason to the actions of a frenzied spirit.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Maybe...but the way she was moving seemed deliberate─almost as though she was trying to show us something. Do you have any ideas, Forename?

dialogue.name: CHOICE
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: CHOICE
dialogue.text: Hold out the gemstone.

dialogue.name: CHOICE
dialogue.text: Shake your head.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: That reminds me, after the battle you stooped down as if to retrieve something. Did you find anything interesting?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: A gemstone? I think this is what Lilac was trying to lead us to!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: We should take it to Surito Carito that he might examine it. He, of all people, will be able to comprehend its significance.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Oh, I nearly forgot! Landenel, sir─thank you for taking care of me when I was unwell.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Think nothing of it. This world may be full of self-serving men and women but don't forget that not all of us are like that.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Should you run into someone or something that threatens to hurt you, be sure to come and find me. Once I run them through with my lance, they should bother you no longer.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Thank you, sir. I'll be sure to do that.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: Go to Alka Zolka. I'll bring out the tonberry girl shortly.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Surito Carito, there is something we would like for you to examine.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Forename discovered this gemstone in the Lost City of Amdapor. It seemed as if to be of great import to the faerie Setoto summoned.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Indeed?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Dear gods... It couldn't possibly be...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Th-This gemstone─it appears to contain concentrated white magicks. How did you find this!?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Ah... From what you described, I can only surmise that this is the guardian statue's crystal core and the source of its power.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Is it possible, then, that this is what Setoto's father sought to acquire by infiltrating Amdapor?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: It is very likely. Had the Nymians managed to attain and analyze one of these gemstones, we could have found the remedies to any number of diseases─possibly even that of the sickness which destroyed our lands.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It is just as I thought. Lilac was acting with deliberate intent. She had guided us to the lost city that we might uncover this...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Normally, a faerie which has failed to fully manifest is nothing more than a sphere of turbulent aetheric energy, incapable of being manipulated by its summoner.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Lilac, however, is in part, a remnant of her father's aether. Perhaps she retained his strong will to see that Setoto was saved.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Lilac... Father... Thank you. Thank you for everything.

dialogue.name: LANDENEL
dialogue.text: You were right, Commander. Truly, the duty of the strong is to protect the weak.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: The two of you have gone to great lengths to bring Setoto safely back to us. For that I cannot thank you enough.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: This gemstone that you brought back from Amdapor at Lilac's behest will no doubt pave the way for a new generation of scholars.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I shall begin analyzing this gemstone straightaway. I will do whatever it takes to discover the cure, and thus carry on Setoto's father's legacy.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: And speaking of legacies, you have shaped up to be a mighty fine scholar, Forename. I cannot help but feel proud whenever I look upon you.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: In my selfish desire to reconnect with my father, I caused the two of you a great deal of distress. For that, I am terribly sorry.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Setoto, there is no need to apologize. Your undying gratitude is more than enough.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Hehehe! Thank you, Alka─for everything. That you should, even now, treat me like the young girl I once was...it is perhaps what I've come to like about you most.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: My apologies, Setoto. I didn't quite catch that. Do you think you could─ Setoto! Are you all right? You're going red! Mayhap you need to lay down and rest?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I-I'm perfectly fine! Although... Alka, the next time the Royal Marines are out training, would it be all right if I joined you?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Of course! You'd be a fine addition to our ranks, my lady. You are the daughter of one of Nym's very own Royal Marines, after all!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: For now this is enough. When the day comes that I regain my original body, however, I pray that you will give me strength─Father, Lilac─that I might one day convey my feeling to him.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: To think that Lilac would retain a fragment of her father's consciousness and guide us to the stone... Setoto must have meant the world to him.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: What a relief it is that Setoto is back to normal.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: While incredibly trying, I cannot help but be glad for our little misadventure. Not only will it aid Surito Carito's efforts to discover a cure, but the Royal Marines have become all the stronger for it! We have even earned ourselves a new member!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I know I don't say it enough, but thank you, Forename, for always being there. You are an excellent scholar and an even better friend!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Now, let us leave this place. It is past time we returned home to continue our training!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: TO VICTORY─COME HELLS OR HIGH WATER!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the scholar quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “The Soul of Temperance.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next scholar quest will be available from Alka Zolka.

quest.name: 奪われた巻物
journal: Oboro has the look of a man who has seen better days.

You find your old friend Oboro at something of a loss. News of his deeds on behalf of Princess Yuki have reached his village, revealing to the elders that he is hale, hearty, and entirely capable of making the journey home. Despite this, they do not seem particularly eager to welcome him back, a development which has the young shinobi feeling decidedly unappreciated. As Oboro laments his plight, he remembers that there is someone who requires his aid─Captain Jacke of the Rogues' Guild, who would investigate some shady Domans that have been stirring up trouble of late. Resolving to assist your friend and mentor in whatever way you can, you set out for Limsa.

Jacke relates to you a curious tale. The Krakens captured a crew of self-styled Doman sailors in the eastern seas, who offered all the treasures in their cargo hold in exchange for amnesty and safe passage to Eorzea. No sooner had the ship dropped anchor, however, than the Easterners vanished into the dark of night, taking with them only an inconspicuous scroll. Petty theft though it may be, the code is the code, and Jacke would see the scroll returned and the men brought to justice. At the guildmaster's behest, you make for the Drowning Wench to see if I'tolwann knows aught of the men's whereabouts.

As I'tolwann tells it, a group of boisterous Easterners visited the Wench not long before, shouting loudly and conspicuously about a profitable transaction they intend to make in Wineport. Jacke will doubtless be eager to hear the news.

Jacke listens to your report with great interest. Though more than a bit leery of how openly the men discussed their shady dealings, a lead is a lead. You set out for Wineport with Oboro and Jacke, taking care to watch your back and with your eyes and ears open.

Your arrival in Wineport is minutes too late─the men have already made off with a haul of wine, and were sighted heading for Bloodshore. Suspecting that it may not be meant for sale, but rather to slake a crew's thirst on a long ocean voyage, Jacke deduces that they intend to furtively sail back home with the ill-gotten scroll. Make for the south of Bloodshore and keep your eyes out for any suspicious Easterners.

You come upon three Hingan swordsman enjoying some of Wineport's finest on the beach. Not taking kindly to the interruption, they immediately draw their blades. Though you are able to make short work of them, the scroll is nowhere to be found. Head north to rendezvous with Jacke and Oboro, with the hope that their search has proved more fruitful than your own.

Jacke and Oboro are no worse for the wear after a similar scuffle with Hingan ruffians, but have gained no insight into the whereabouts of the scroll you seek. No sooner have you begun to ponder your next course of action when you are greeted by the sudden presence of the black marketeer from the House of Sticks, who─much to everyone's surprise─immediately reveals himself to be none other than Karasu Redbeak, Oboro's erstwhile friend and nemesis. As is his wont, Karasu speaks in riddles, cryptically alluding to a greater plot involving the scroll while offering precious little in the way of actual details─save that your true quarry sails for Kugane as you speak. Karasu disappears in a puff of smoke, and Oboro─clearly flustered─suggests that the three of you retreat to the nearby ninja hideout to discuss your next course of action in secret.

At the dock storehouse, you and your two companions come up with a plan. Jacke will sail ahead to Hingashi, with Oboro accompanying as a guide. In the meantime, you will train and hone your skills as a ninja, that you may be ready to answer the call when they need you. Bidding them a safe journey, you resolve to take your mastery of ninjutsu to new levels, as there is no telling what dangers await you across the Ruby Sea.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Yomei upon reaching level 63.
objectives: Speak with Jacke at the Rogues' Guild.
Speak with I'tolwann at the Drowning Wench.
Speak with Jacke at Bulwark Hall.
Rendezvous with Jacke in Wineport.
Search for suspicious Easterners at Bloodshore.
Rendezvous with Jacke.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Oh, alas and alack! Whatever am I to do...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename! As a shinobi, I am loath to admit this, but I did not see you come in.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I have been somewhat distracted of late. Princess Yuki, it would seem, sent a letter to my village praising us for our efforts on her behalf─thus revealing my story of an injury preventing me from making the journey home for the ruse that it was.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But my shame is not that I have been summoned back to the village, but rather quite the opposite. Despite knowing that I am hale and hearty, my elders seem to be in no particular hurry to welcome me back into the fold.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: “Should the time come when we have need for you in Doma, we shall summon for you. Until then, you are to remain at your post and do all in your power to aid our countrymen in Eorzea.” Such were their words.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Is this how far I have fallen? Am I as a falcon bereft of its claws? A dull blade tossed to the wayside by its master? For all I know, I have been all but exiled to this place.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I am sorry, Forename. Heaven knows that you did not come here to listen to my griping. On a brighter note, I just received word from Captain Jacke. It would seem some Easterners are causing something of a stir.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I suppose I should be grateful that someone still has need of my services. Anyhow, it would seem the kami have led you here at a most opportune time. Would you care to accompany me?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I thank you, my friend! Let us make for Limsa Lominsa and see what our friends at the Rogues' Guild would ask of us.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I know not what my countrymen have done to catch Captain Jacke's eye, but I can only imagine it is nothing good...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, if it ain't the dimberest damber of 'em all. I trust ye've been keepin' yer stabbers sharpened? What with you and Oboro on the job, I reckon all'll be bob afore the lightmansdarkmans comes 'round.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Here's where we stand: one o' me little birds in the Kraken's Arms came chirpin' to me a story 'bout some Domans who I reckon are breakin' one code or another.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Seems they─the Krakens, that is─were out snilchin' the eastern seas when they grabbled a vessel flyin' Garlean colors, as they're wont to do. But then came the rub─the crew claimed to be Doman, ye see, and upon whiddlin' their captors' identity, they changed tack, beggin' for asylum on Eorzean shores an' offerin' the entirety of their cargo in full in return for safe passage.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Call him a bene cove or a fool, the Kraken captain took the self-styled Domans up on their offer. Stowin' the Eastern treasures─an' the Easterners themselves─away in the hold, they set sail for Limsa.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: But after pullin' into port, a funny thing happened. No sooner had the Krakens dropped anchor than the “refugees” put on their best beater cases an' skulked off into the dead of darkmans, leavin' all their treasures behind.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All their treasures save one─a scroll of sorts that had been hidin' in a corner, all inconspicuous-like. Carvallain reckons that these Doman “refugees” have played us for some rum fun, an' they're off sellin' the scroll on the black markets for good blunt even as we speak.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I see. So you would have us recover the scroll in question and bring the thieving Domans to justice. I am honored to lend what aid I can, and yet, I cannot help but wonder. Just what could it be about this scroll to make it so valuable to my countrymen?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, we're not goin' to whiddle the scrap just sittin' around here on our daddles, now are we? Let's snilch town and see what the common coves and morts have and haven't seen.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Forename, why don't ye go pay I'tolwann a visit at the Wench? If there's any rumors goin' around about any shifty Easterners, like as not that mort would know.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: You do remember what to order, aye? 'Course a dimber damber like yourself would. Good luck out there, an' keep yer wattles open─we'll be waitin' for ye in Bulwark Hall when yer through.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Welcome to the Drowning Wench! What's your pleasure, misssir?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you order?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A chilled ale.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: A strong ale.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: A weak ale.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Certainly, misssir. Take a seat, and I'll bring it straight to your─ Hm? Changed your mind?

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Ah, you must be here on business. Mayhaps I could offer you something from our underground menu. Now, what's your fancy?

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Guests from the East, you say? Why, yes, I do believe we had some visitors not long ago matching that description. They left shortly before you arrived.

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: I make a habit of pricking my ears up to catch our patrons' every whisper, but the party in question required little such effort. Why, they were shouting of tales of riches and glory in a roar that could wake the dead!

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: Said they were on their way to Wineport to make the transaction of a lifetime─though they weren't keen on going into detail. Just between us, I wouldn't be surprised if there was something less than savory about their business. Speaking of savory, can I interest you in our seafood stew?

dialogue.name: ITOLWANN
dialogue.text: The party of Easterners said they were en route to Wineport. I'd be wary if you plan on following them─they seemed to be a rather unsavory lot.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I wish you an ahoy and an avast, my honored matey! Ah, forgive me─I was just practicing my Lominsan dialect. How do you─er, ye─reckon it sounds?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: So our lads are headed to Wineport, eh? Bene work, Forename. Remind me to slip I'tolwann some extra blunt next time we stop by the Wench for libations.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That said, somethin' doesn't sit right with me. Cacklin' their plans for every drunkard and tavern wench to hear? I reckon our friends might be lookin' to amuse us, if you whiddle my gist. Keep your eyes open and your stabbers sharp, mates.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I am sorry, Forename. I fear we were too late...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, there's a bleedin' surprise. The code-breakin' curs have already bit the blow and hopped the twig, with a caravan's worth of bingo in tow. Word is they were last seen beatin' a path for Bloodshore.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: But what could they mean to─wait a bleedin' moment! What if the grog's not meant for sellin', but keepin' their throats wet on a long voyage? I reckon our lads are tryin' to smuggle the scroll home.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: There's no time to lose! Let's brush off our beater cases an' make for Bloodshore all quick-like. Oboro an' I'll snilch the north side─Forename, you take the south. We have to catch these curs afore they slip from our daddles for good!

dialogue.name: DOMANPEOPLE02948
dialogue.text: Heh... You just had to poke your nose in our business, eh? Guess you leave us no choice...

dialogue.name: POPMESSAGE
dialogue.text: The Hingan swordsmen draw their blades and attack!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: This garb... Why, these men are samurai from Hingashi! Whatever is the meaning of this?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Let me guess. Ye came upon a couple of rough-lookin' coves. These coves came wavin' their stabbers in my face afore I could edge in a word─I reckon 'twas the same for you?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The scroll is nowhere to be seen, nor is anything resembling a ship. If I did not know better, I would say they were a simple group of ruffians enjoying their ill-gotten grog.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-???-)The dim one sees, but does he truly see? No─these unfortunate men were but pawns in a grand scheme, as disposable as the bottles that now litter the shore.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, your true quarry has boarded a trader and sails for Kugane even as we speak, under the auspices of the East Aldenard Trading Company, no less! So cunning a scheme, I wish I'd thought of it myself─or did I? Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: How do ye know all─bugger me, yer the cove from the House o' Sticks!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu Redbeak!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Childhood friends turned bitter enemies, then friends once more─reunited after far too long! Our hero returns, and the audience swoons! O, what a joyous day─or is it?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I'll say this much, dim one: for once, you've managed to surprise me. To think that the oh-so-serious Oboro would lie to his elders to avoid having to make the journey home─only to find he wasn't welcome to begin with! Oh, the irony of it all!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Enough of your preening and prattling, Karasu! I want answers. How did you know we were here? Just what is your connection to the thieves we pursue?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! You mean the thieves who already eluded your clumsy grasp─just as I am about to do? I fear that is a story for another day!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Bah! Ever the slippery bird, that one.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That daft rook's an acquaintance of yours? That's news to Jacke's wattles. Meanwhile, we've got our work cut out for us if we still want to grabble that scroll. Is there anywhere we can have a few whids─ye know, secret-like?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Say no more, Captain Jacke. As luck would have it, our base of operations is but a short walk from these parts. Forename, pray join us at the storehouse.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I reckon this is about the shabbiest, shoddiest shack ol' Jacke's ever laid eyes on─in other whids, the perfect hideout. Aye, Oboro's sharper than he lets on.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu Redbeak... Of all the places I thought our search might lead us, never in my wildest dreams did I think it would lead us to him!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Come square with me, Oboro. Just who is this Karasu cove? Can we trust him, or is he like as not to stick us his stabbers in our back the moment we turn a blind eye?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: N-No! I mean, yes! I mean he's neither─or both? Perhaps I should say...it's complicated.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Judgin' from yer reaction, it sure seems as much. Anyway, if our men have set sail for Hingashi, I reckon we've no choice but to do the same. I wasn't exactly preparin' for a long voyage, but damned if I'll leave this job half-done.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That said, 'shamed as I am to admit it, this is ol' Jacke's first journey to the Far East─I wouldn't know Kugane from a rum doxy's arse, and I don't know a rogue what can do his work without knowin' the lay of the land.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Worry not, Captain Jacke! I have traveled there on many an occasion to procure the tools of my trade from the finest Hingan artisans. It would be my pleasure to serve as your guide.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Your presence would be most heartening as well, Forename. Kugane is a city where anything can happen, and there is no telling what dangers await us there.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I'll agree with that─but mind ye, Forename's a right busy mortcove. What say we do it this way? Oboro an' I will go on ahead, an' we'll send for you once we've snilched out the place and worked out our next plan of action.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: A reasonable plan, Captain Jacke. In that case, Forename, pray check in at the storehouse from time to time. I will send word to Yomei when we require your services. In the meantime, may the kami guide you in your training!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next ninja quest will be available from Yomei upon reaching level 63.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The requirements for undertaking subsequent quests can be reviewed in your journal.

quest.name: 隠密大作戦
journal: Yomei has a missive from the Far East with your name on it.

Yomei greets you upon arrival, and eagerly hands you a letter. It would appear that Oboro and Jacke have safely arrived on Hingan shores, and that their investigation into the stolen scroll has turned up some promising leads. Your shinobi friend and master bids you join him in Kugane to continue the search. After disembarking, seek out Oboro in the alley behind Pier #2.

Oboro relates to you all that he and Jacke have learned. The theft of the scroll was apparently the work of the Garnet League, a band of masterless samurai who turned to banditry after having fled the battlefield in dishonor during the Doman uprising. Easily recognizable by their blood red garb and rough demeanor, they sojourn in Kugane of late. At Oboro's behest, spy upon them from the shadows of the Shiokaze Hostelry and the Rakuza District and see what knowledge you might glean of their plans, and of the scroll's current whereabouts.

Eavesdropping upon the Garnet League men, you manage to learn that they were hired to retrieve the scroll from an imperial storehouse by a Hingan client whose identity is not immediately evident. You also succeed in gathering more information on the Garnet League itself─namely, that it is led by one Zakuro Brightblood, a samurai feared for both her prowess with the blade and her nigh-legendary temper. Oboro and Jacke will doubtless be keen to hear all you have learned.

You and your companions share what you have learned, when you are joined by V'kebbe and Underfoot, who have been summoned to Kugane by Jacke to assist in the recovery of the scroll. Piecing together random bits of information, Captain Jacke devises a convoluted scheme to recover the scroll that will involve a high-wire act and imitation bird droppings, among other curious elements. With no better course of action coming immediately to mind, tasks are delegated amongst your party, and you prepare to move into action.

You carry out Jacke's creative plan to perfection, and send Zakuro running to the baths in utter horror. Infiltrate the Bokairo, and search for the scroll in the changing baskets while a somewhat-unwilling Oboro and Jacke keep Zakuro occupied with their manly wiles.
You search the baskets by the entrance to the baths, but the scroll is nowhere to be seen. Mayhap there is somewhere you haven't yet looked?
You search another set of baskets, but to no avail. Wherever could Zakuro have hidden the scroll?

You search the baskets in the innermost chamber of the bathhouse, where you successfully recover the scroll with Zakuro none the wiser. Make haste back to the alley and share the news of your success with your friends.

Oboro and Jacke rejoice at the success of the mission. The shinobi's mood, however, darkens considerably upon seeing what the scroll actually is─a forbidden summoning mudra and ancient treasure of his village that went missing in the Garlean invasion of twenty-five years past. It would seem that the scroll slept untouched in an imperial vault until it was stolen by Zakuro and her minions at the behest of their mysterious client. As Oboro ponders who outside his village might have knowledge of the scroll, Karasu Redbeak appears in a puff of smoke, revealing that he was the one pulling the strings behind the operation on behalf of his new master, and threatening physical harm to Tsubame, V'kebbe, and Underfoot─who he has captured in the meantime─if you do not return the scroll to him. Issuing an enigmatic warning of some challenge to come, he disappears as quickly as he came, leaving you and your companions at an utter loss. Continue to hone your skill in the art of ninjutsu, that you may be ready for whatever deadly game the crow has in store for you.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 65.
objectives: Join Oboro in Kugane.
Use Hide to gather information at the Shiokaze Hostelry and the Rakuza District.
Report to Oboro.
Keep lookout from a high perch.
Search the bathhouse baskets for the scroll.
Search more baskets for the scroll.
Search even more baskets for the scroll.
Wait for Jacke and Oboro at the rendezvous point.

dialogue.name: YOUMEI
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I have a letter for you from Master Oboro. It would appear that his investigation in Kugane has borne fruit. Here, see for yourself.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text:
(-Letter from Oboro-)Dear Forename,
I hope this letter finds you well. After a long and rather uneventful voyage, we have arrived safely in Kugane. Captain Jacke seems quite taken with Hingan culture, and is enjoying a stroll in the pleasure quarters at this very moment.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: (-Letter from Oboro-)But forgive me, you are not interested in a diary of our travels. As for the matter of the scroll, rumors abound of a band of Doman scofflaws have been causing a stir in town of late. Putting together the accounts we have heard, the good Captain and I are convinced that these are the thieves we seek.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: (-Letter from Oboro-)If the word about town is to be believed, these individuals are far more dangerous than we had imagined. I trust that you have been pursuing your ninjutsu training with your usual diligence? My apologies─of course you have. In any event, we would have you join us at your earliest convenience. We will be keeping an eye out for your arrival. Seek us in the alley behind the second pier ferry docks. Safe travels, friend.

dialogue.name: YOUMEI
dialogue.text: It is good to see Master Oboro in good spirits once more. Ever since the elders commanded him to remain here in Eorzea, he has not quite been himself.

dialogue.name: YOUMEI
dialogue.text: After all, a shinobi without a duty to carry out is as a hawk with clipped wings. It is good to see Master Oboro soaring high once more.

dialogue.name: YOUMEI
dialogue.text: Still, I worry. Though I have great respect for the man, he can often be too trusting for his own good. Pray go to his side, friend, and see that he does not get himself into undue trouble. May the kami carry you safely across the sea.

dialogue.name: YOUMEI
dialogue.text: Master Oboro awaits you in Kugane. I wish you a safe journey.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Forename! What took ye so long? Have ye snilched the rum doxies in the pleasure district? I'm likin' this place more and more by the day!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename! It has been too long. To have traveled so far to assist Oboro in his mission─words cannot begin to convey my gratitude.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename. I thank you for answering my call. Tsubame, too, has made the journey from the village to join us in retrieving the scroll.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: It is an honor to stand by your side again, Forename. Master Oboro will doubtless benefit from your presence, as he always does.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Likewise, I figured we could use a few more dimber dambers on the job, so I've sent for Underfoot and the Stray. Their ship should be pullin' into harbor afore long.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: In the meantime, allow me to share what we have learned. Reliable sources have it that the theft of the scroll is the work of the Garnet League, a notorious band of outlaws feared throughout Doma.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: When the Doman rebellion was crushed one year ago, many a samurai fled the battlefield to escape the Empire's wrath. Dishonored and unable to return home, most turned to banditry to eke out a living. It is the most lethal of these warriors who formed the Garnet League.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Cutting down innocent men for their coinpurses, plundering villages... The men and women of the Garnet will gladly stain their hands with blood as long as it means they will live to see the morrow.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Why they covet that scroll so, I cannot say. What I do know is that if we do not stop them, they are all but certain to leave a trail of corpses in their wake. We must move, and quickly.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Fortunately, they should not prove hard to find. Confident in their ability to cut down anyone who dares oppose them, they take little trouble to conceal themselves. On the contrary, they parade their garnet-hued kimono for all to see. You can distinguish them from the similarly garbed Sekiseigumi by their lack of a hakama and their singularly uncouth demeanor.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Let us split up and cover as much ground as we can. Forename, I would entrust the Shiokaze Hostelry and the Rakuza District to you. Keep to the shadows, and gather what knowledge you can. When we are done with the task, let us reconvene here.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These men look to be members of the Garnet League. They seem to be discussing something...

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: One day she has us sneakin' into a bleedin' imperial storehouse, and the next the Confederacy's chasin' us halfway across the Ruby Sea. Zakuro could pay us twice what she does and it wouldn't be bloody worth it.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEB02949
dialogue.text: Come now. Even you must admit it was quite the little adventure. Though it was fortunate that we came upon those Eorzean pirates when we did─and that they believed our little ruse. In the end, we made it here with our little prize, did we not? We simply took a slight detour.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: We didn't all make it─or have ye forgotten those we left behind at Bloodshore? Cut down by our pursuers, no doubt. The poor bastards... Whose brilliant idea was it to go along with that masked man's plan, anyway?

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: If our brothers could not fend for themselves, they have only themselves to blame. As for our mysterious benefactor, he led us here as promised, did he not? Now we need only wait for our client to show and deliver the goods, and we will never need worry about going hungry again.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: Speakin' of which, just how long does our man mean to keep us waitin'? I'm beginnin' to wonder if someone isn't playin' all of us for fools.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: Now, now. We were late with our delivery, after all. Word has it our client returned to Koshu when we did not show, and now is making the long journey back to Kugane. We owe him some patience, do we not?

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: One day she has us sneakin' into─hey, why don't you mind yer own bloody business?

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEB02949
dialogue.text: My friend here has a bit of a temper. You'd be wise to leave him alone.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Garnet League men are not likely to divulge any secrets in the presence of strangers. Move out of eyeshot and hide yourself in the shadows before approaching them again.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: We're not puttin' on a bloody show here. Piss off!

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEB02949
dialogue.text: I am not in the habit of talking to strangers. If you have business, state it. If not, begone.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEA02949
dialogue.text: I'll believe it when I bloody see it...

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEB02949
dialogue.text: Have patience, friend. Just a bit longer, and the lives we have always wanted will be ours!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These men look to be members of the Garnet League. They seem to be discussing something...

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEC02949
dialogue.text: I-I swear, I just wanted to see what all the fuss was about! Barely put a finger on the thing, and next I knew it, Zakuro's blade was at my throat! I-I thought she was going to cut me down right on the spot!

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLED02949
dialogue.text: Put yourself in her shoes. They say our client is such a dangerous man he's been known to kill those who renege on their agreements. If anything happened to the scroll, her life─and ours─would be as good as forfeit.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEC02949
dialogue.text: Y-You're sayin' she's as scared as us? Zakuro Brightblood, who single-handedly cut down a hundred Garleans in a day during the rebellion? Zakuro Brightblood, who dyes her hair red with the blood of her foes?

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLED02949
dialogue.text: She cuts an imposing figure, this is true. But deep down, she's actually quite the sensitive type.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEC02949
dialogue.text: S-Sensitive!? Don't make me laugh...

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEC02949
dialogue.text: I-I swear, I just wanted to─ah, was I sayin' something? N-No, I don't believe I was...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Garnet League men are not likely to divulge any secrets in the presence of strangers. Move out of eyeshot and hide yourself in the shadows before approaching them again.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEC02949
dialogue.text: Wh-What is it? C-Can't you see we're discussin' important matters here?

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLED02949
dialogue.text: You seem lost, friend. I suggest you get found, and quickly. Kugane is not friendly to those who go looking in the wrong places.

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLEC02949
dialogue.text: S-Sensitive! H-Hah, that's rich!

dialogue.name: ZAKUROPEOPLED02949
dialogue.text: I tell you, she really is quite charming when you get to know her...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Seems the long journey's dulled ol' Jacke's wattles. Hope ye had better luck than I.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: There is an air about you, Forename. I can tell you have grown even stronger since last we met.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It would seem we have everyone assembled. Excellent─let us share all we have learned.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Allow me to see if I have this right. So, in short, the Garnet League lifted the scroll from a Garlean storehouse at the bidding of an unknown Hingan client. They meant to sail straight from Yanxia to Kugane, but ran afoul of the Confederacy─doubtless because they were too poor to pay the Ruby Tithe.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: In fleeing, they were then captured by the Krakens, so they claimed to be Doman refugees seeking asylum. Upon arriving in Eorzea, they made off with the scroll, and eventually found safe passage to Kugane─with Karasu's aid? That one's motives remain as inscrutable as ever...but I digress.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Furthermore, they are led by one Zakuro Brightblood, about whom no small number of tall tales are told. Regardless of their veracity, there can be no doubting that she is a formidable opponent.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: For my part, I heard that she is most protective of the scroll, and keeps it on her person at all times─night and day.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: I heard that Zakuro and her followers have rented a room at the Bokairo, an inn in town famous for its hot spring baths.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All ol' Jacke managed to whiddle is that the cove is right fond o' her flowin' locks. An' that she fancies herself a cup o' tea, makin' the trip from the inn to the teahouse and back at least thrice a day.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That is most...enlightening, Captain Jacke. Now, we must find a way to get our hands on the scroll before Zakuro's client arrives─but how? We could challenge her to single combat, but the Sekiseigumi would not look kindly on that.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Besides, we are shinobi, are we not? We must use stealth to our advantage. We simply need a plan...

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Look out below! Underfoot's on the scene. Good to see ye again, Forename. Can't wait to snilch the new tricks ye've learned from yer friends here.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: What's a mort got to do to get herself some sushi? I'm bloody starved! And what's with all these bleedin' seagulls? I swear, if another one takes a shite on my hair, it'll be seagull stew for dinner tonight!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Wait...that's it! V'kebbe, yer a bloody genius─an' so am I, I reckon.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Gather 'round and lend me yer wattles, friends─ol' Jacke's got a plan!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: First, we catch Zakuro as she's beatin' her way from the inn to the teahouse. Underfoot, V'kebbe, Tsubame─you three'll be in charge of causin' a scene and stoppin' the mort in her tracks.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, Forename. You make your way to that perch atop the markets, an' drop some imitation seagull shite down from above.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: What with her precious locks all mucked up, the mort's sure to make for the hot springs. She can't very well bring the scroll into the water, so we just follow along─all stealthy-like─an' heave it from whatever basket she's stowed it away in.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: For good measure, Oboro and I'll head to the bathhouse as well an' keep the girl occupied until Forename has the scroll safely in 'er'is daddles!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: A most impressive plan, Captain Jacke. But I have one question: how do you propose that the two of us keep Zakuro...occupied?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro, surely you remember our visit to Bronze Lake, and the little show I put on for our pirate friend? It's all quite simple, really.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I am not certain I understand what you─oh. On second thought, I am not quite convinced this is the best course of action...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ahaha! Give yerself some more credit, lad. Now, Forename. Ye'll want to climb up to the roof atop the Bokairo, an' then make your way across to the wire atop the markets.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Here, this white dye should do a suitable seagull shite impersonation. Once Underfoot and the gang lure Zakuro into position, let 'er fly.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All right, lads and lasses, look sharp! We'll meet back here once all's bob.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Quite the plan, eh? Ol' Jacke's still got it in him.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: The pain... Oh, the pain!

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: My poor girl! Whatever is the matter?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Someone, anyone, find a healer! The girl needs help!

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: What was─? Gah! Bird shite!? Oh, bloody brilliant!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Thank you, kind sir and madam. But worry not─I am not ill. You see, I simply haven't had a bite to eat all day.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Ahaha! Is that all, now? Fortunately, the Shiokaze Hostelry is but a short walk away, and I hear their sushi is positively to die for. Shall we?

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: My hair! My beautiful hair! <sigh> Back to the bathhouse, I suppose...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You search the basket, but to no avail. The scroll must be around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What beautiful locks you have! However do you keep them so smooth and silky?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I've seen many a rum doxy in my day, but ain't none what compare to you, milady.

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: Truly? I do not mean to boast, but they do say my beauty is sung of far and wide...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You search the basket, but to no avail. The scroll must be around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Well done, my friends! The operation was, by any measure, a rousing success. That said, I have not seen Tsubame and the others─I do hope all is well.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Now that was some rum fun, if I do say so meself. As for the cove, I wouldn't fret─like as not V'kebbe and Underfoot dragged her off to yaffle on some o' Kugane's finer delicacies.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: No doubt you are right, Captain Jacke. In the meantime, pray show me the scroll, Forename. I would see just what it is that Zakuro's mysterious employer covets so.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Why, this is─are my eyes to be believed!? The forbidden mudra of summoning! I had half-thought it just a ghost story meant to strike fear in the hearts of shinobi who would stray from their path.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Forbidden summoning? I wouldn't know a mudra from me own grandmum, but that sounds right dangersome...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It is indeed, Captain Jacke. The legends say that if the summoner's focus wanes for even a moment, the monstrous beast called forth by this mudra will not hesitate to devour him whole.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Many years ago, it was gifted from our village to the King of Doma─then sealed away, to be used only in the most dire of circumstances. But it was lost in the chaos of the Garlean invasion, and never seen again. So it has been sleeping in an imperial vault all these years...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: So even with this bleedin' all-powerful summonin' at their fingertips, the Domans still couldn't hold off the Empire? Guess it wasn't all it was cracked up to be, eh?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: On the contrary, we never had the chance to find out. Master Gekkai, who led the shinobi, deemed the risk too great and refused to employ it, even as our nation fell.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Whether Master Gekkai plotted his betrayal even then, or whether he had our countrymen's best interests at heart, I cannot say─though I would like to believe the latter.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Nonetheless, it is clear that none in Garlemald knew of the scroll's true power. And so it sat untouched until it was stolen by the Garnet League, at the bidding of some unknown master.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But aside from my fellow shinobi, who out there would know of the scroll's true power? But it matters little now. We have the scroll, and I must return it to its rightful home in my village.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: 'Fraid I can't let ye do that, friend. I promised the Krakens I'd bring the scroll back for them, an' I'll not have it said that Jacke ain't a man of his whids.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: After all, the scroll's been missin' from your village for twenty-odd summers, no? Clearly no one's sufferin' much.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That is hardly the issue, Captain Jacke! This scroll is an ancient treasure─it belongs in Doma!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: It belongs to those what found it, an' that's the Krakens! Gods, if ye ain't a stubborn bastard...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)Gentlemen, gentlemen...must you make such a scene? After all, strictly speaking, the scroll belongs to neither of you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu! Wherever did you─? But never mind. Thank you for guiding us here. You may rest assured that the scroll will safely return to Doma. You have my gratitude.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oh, Oboro─my dear, sweet, deluded Oboro. You grow ever dimmer by the day. Do you truly believe that I do what I do for you?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I did say that I was pulling all the strings in this little puppet play, did I not? Very well, allow me to put it in words even you can understand: the scroll belongs in Hingashi─to the master I now serve.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: My mistake was in entrusting to Zakuro and her lackies what I should have seen to myself from the very start. Oh well, live and learn, I suppose!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: In any event, allow me to propose a simple transaction. You hand over the scroll, and I return your friends to you with their heads still attached to their bodies. A fair trade, no?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu, you craven─!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: On second thought... Ahahaha! Yes, I do believe we could have even more fun. Keep your eyes and ears out, dim one─you'll be hearing from me again soon.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Curse it all! And here I believed the man had turned over a new leaf after leaving Gekkai. But no, it would seem he has simply found another villain to serve.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Once a rook, always a rook, I reckon. An' a sharp one, at that─Underfoot and the Stray aren't the types to get boned so easily.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: As long as we have the scroll, Karasu is not like to cause our friends any harm. And yet, he is as unpredictable an adversary as they come. We must proceed with caution.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename. It would mean much to me if you would remain in Kugane until our work here is through. Pray continue to train in your ninjutsu, and I shall call upon you again when the time is right.

quest.name: 鴉の遊戯
journal: Oboro glances impatiently about him, as if waiting for a tardy guest.

Having heard no word from Karasu since you last spoke, Oboro informs you that he has sent for Princess Yuki of the Yatsurugi clan, in hopes of reinforcing the ranks before setting out to rescue your friends. Despite her most enthusiastic response, however, the spirited princess has yet to arrive. You and Jacke take to the streets of Kugane in hopes of finding the girl before she runs afoul of any unsavory types.

You find Princess Yuki hidden in an alley, desperately trying to avoid the gaze of Akagi, her retainer-turned-bodyguard who has pursued her to Kugane with the intent of bringing her home to her people. At the princess's behest, spin a harmless lie to throw her man off the scent.

You barely utter a few words when Akagi dashes off to board the next ship to Eorzea in search of the princess. Feeling somewhat guilty for taking advantage of the well-meaning but less-than-sharp-witted retainer, you console yourself with the knowledge that you have served the princess well.

Though she regrets having asked you to tell a lie, Princess Yuki is grateful for your actions, for she can now repay both you and Oboro for your efforts on behalf of her and her kingdom. Eager to share what she has learned and begin the adventure, she dashes off to the piers to meet with Oboro as you follow in pursuit.

Princess Yuki is sharing with you and Oboro her knowledge of Hingashi in hopes of identifying Karasu's mysterious employer, when your conversation is interrupted by the crow himself. He gleefully explains that he has prepared a “game” of sorts for you and your friends: you are to rescue your friends from the hideout of the Garnet League and claim the scroll as your prize, or fail and see your friends' lives forfeit. Having no choice but to submit to the eccentric shinobi's cruel and capricious demands, you and your friends set out for the Isle of Bekko.

After a long and hard-fought battle on the Isle of Bekko, you have felled the fearsome Zakuro Brightblood and rescued your Underfoot and the Stray from the Garnet League's clutches. All that remains is free Tsubame and claim the scroll for emerging triumphant in Karasu's game.

Karasu, never to be trusted, is all too quick to renege on his promise and demand the spoils despite your clear victory according to the very conditions he set. With his friend and fellow shinobi's life in the balance, Oboro tosses the scroll to a gloating Karasu, who unceremoniously shoves Tsubame in your general direction. Karasu's enigmatic master then arrives on the scene, and with a few dismissive words, seemingly roasts Karasu to a husk with a breath of fire before your very eyes. Claiming to be Hanzo of the Kagekakushi clan─the only true practitioners of the art of ninjutsu─he ominously states his desire to rid the world of the descendants of “Sasuke the Shamed,” as he dismissively refers to the legendary progenitor of the Doman shinobi.
