As Oboro stands stunned, Tsubame comforts him with a secret entrusted to her by one her elders─namely, that the scroll in Hanzo's hands is but one half of the forbidden summoning mudra he covets. As Underfoot and V'kebbe return home to Limsa, you set out for Yanxia with Oboro, Tsubame, and Jacke, to inform the elders of all you have seen and glean what wisdom you might before planning your next action.

Upon arriving on the shores of Yanxia, you sojourn first in the fishing village of Namai. A clearly preoccupied Oboro states that he and Tsubame will make the trip from here to their village alone, as the elders may not take kindly to the presence of outsiders. The young shinobi promises you that they will return as soon as they are able, and you and Jacke resolve to keep your skills sharp in anticipation of the inevitable confrontation to come.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Jacke upon reaching level 68.
objectives: Search for Yuki around Kogane Dori.
Speak with Akagi.
Speak with Yuki.
Report to Oboro.
Join Oboro on the Isle of Bekko.
Join Oboro in Namai.
Find your friends!
Rescue V'kebbe!
Rescue Perimu Haurimu!
Defeat Zakuro!
Find Perimu Haurimu!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: This Karasu's a dangerous rook, I reckon. It ain't like Underfoot and the Stray to be boned so easy-like.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah, it is good to see you, Forename. I have heard nothing from Karasu since last we met. It would seem we have no choice but to take matters into our own hand.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And yet, in our current state, we are outmanned. In hopes of bolstering our ranks, I reached out to Princess Yuki, pride of the Yatsurugi clan. Her skills and knowledge of these lands would surely avail us in our effort, I thought.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I am pleased to say that she was more than happy to lend her aid─doubtless in no small part due to your own efforts on her behalf.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Judging from her words, she is quite eager to prove herself. Perhaps a bit overeager─I would ask you to keep an eye on her, lest she go running off into some sort of trouble.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Which mayhap she already has, as she should have arrived hours ago. Perhaps she has simply gotten lost on the way, or stopped off for sushi and tea?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Might the two of you be so kind as to search for her in my stead? Captain Jacke, see if she is not in the Rakuza District, and Forename, pray search the markets of Kogane Dori. I will remain here in case she has simply been delayed in her journey.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I fear I have seen no sign of Princess Yuki. Pray search the markets of Kogane Dori while I wait for her here.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Forename! Whatever are you doing here in Kugane? Not that I'm complaining, of course! I'm always happy to see the shinobi who helped bring prosperity back to my homeland!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Yes, thanks to you, my people are doing wonderfully. The only downside of it is that now I have to be a proper princess again. Akagi─he's my personal bodyguard now, you see─was none too happy when I told him I'd be heading to Kugane. In fact...

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: (-Frantic Male Voice-)Yuki! Princess Yuki, come back at once!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Oh, hells! He's on to me!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I just have to help you and Oboro in return for everything you did for me. Surely you understand, Forename? Can you go find Akagi and just tell him that I─I don't know, that I hopped on a ship to Eorzea or something?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: I can't go back home until I've done my duty for you and Oboro. Go tell Akagi that I hopped on a ship to Eorzea or something.

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Forename! Fancy meetin' you here. You're an awful long way from home, eh?

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: Speakin' of which, you haven't by chance seen Her Highness anywhere, have you? I caught her sneakin' out of the castle and followed her here to Kugane, but I seem to have lost her...

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: E-Eorzea, you say!? Gods, what is the girl thinkin'? If anything happened to her, I'd never hear─

dialogue.name: AKAGI
dialogue.text: But there's no time to lose─to the docks! Princess Yuki, wait for me! Princess Yuki!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename, and pray forgive me for asking you to lie on my behalf. I had half a mind to tell Akagi the truth, but then he might have offered to help, kami forbid.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: The man means well, but I hear that we face a most dangerous foe, and I simply didn't have the heart to place Akagi in danger. You understand, don't you? In any event, I do believe we've kept Oboro long enough.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't our favorite natty little lass...

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: You say I've met this man? I can't say he made much of an impression on me.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thank you for leading Her Highness here, Forename. Princess Yuki, thank you for making the journey to Kugane. Before we proceed, I would hear aught you might know of recent events in Hingashi.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: As you doubtless know, though Hingashi appears to outsiders to be a land at peace, beneath the surface rival warlords are ever scheming to undermine each other's power.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: In that sense, it is entirely within the realm of possibility that one of them has employed a shinobi to gain a hidden advantage over his foes.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: But this is merely speculation. Try as I might, I was unable to uncover any tangible evidence as to who might be behind these recent events.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...I see. Thank you, Princess. And so it remains a mystery─what foul master does that treacherous crow serve?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)Now, now, dim one. Is that any way to talk about a dear old friend?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu! You have some gall to call yourself my friend! What have you done with Tsubame and the others!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: But what's this? The dim one is joined by one new companion after the next! Our hero is wounded! Was his friendship not enough? Why are the geniuses of the world so misunderstood!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Anyhow, I was hoping you'd ask! As a matter of fact, I have just the present for you. It's a game I like to call “kill-or-watch-your-friends-be-killed.” Do you like the name? I thought of it myself just now.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The rules are really quite simple. Your precious swallow and the others are being held captive by the Garnet League on the Isle of Bekko. You simply need to march in, cut down Zakuro and her men, and free your companions from their shackles.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Succeed, and I'll forget about the scroll, and you can all go marching happily back to Doma. Fail, and I get the scroll, and Zakuro bathes in your blood tonight.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! Yes, I do believe there's something in it for everyone! I'll be watching from the shadows─do try to keep me entertained, won't you?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Bah, does his villainy know no bounds!?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I'm not keen on agreein' to those terms, but it don't seem we've much choice in the matter...

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: If it's a fight he wants, it's a fight he'll get! Together, we can take those Garnet curs─what do you say, Forename!?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forgive me, my friends. If only I had been quicker to unravel Karasu's schemes, I would not have to place you in danger like this. Still, it heartens me to know you stand with us.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Same holds true for me, lasslad. While I'm not proud we let that rook get the better of us, I feel a lot safer knowin' a dimber damber like yerself is on our side. Let's get Underfoot and V'kebbe out o' there right quick-like.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ever since the elders told me my presence was not needed in the village, I have struggled to find meaning in my daily existence. For whom do I fight? For what greater purpose?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Now, I have found an answer─it is for you, my friends. You, who have stood beside me in the darkest of times. You, who have shown me that there is strength inside me that even I had long forgotten. You, who─

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: This is no time for prittle prattle, lad! Or haven't ye noticed the princess has already hopped the twig? Dust off yer beater cases and let's move!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The man speaks true. Yes, we must be strong of both body and mind if we hope to prevail. To the Isle of Bekko, where our friends await us!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: The lad's not quite all there in the head, is he?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Let's show those dishonorable Garnet dogs what for!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Little to my surprise, it would seem Karasu has alerted our foe to our presence. Let us proceed with caution. There is no telling what manner of treachery the crow has in store for us.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Let us keep to the shadows for now. I would avoid any bloodshed that is not absolutely necessary.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Oh, Oboro, you're no fun at all! Can't I cut down just one? I promise he won't make a peep!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Stow yer blade, lass. 'Least until we know our friends are safe.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Curses! They're on to us! We've no choice but to fight!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It's V'kebbe! Quickly, now! Make short work of the sentries and free her from her ropes!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: To the shadows again, friends! Master Underfoot must be around here somewhere...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: <sniff> <sniff> Something smells so familiar. Did I say I'd stay out of this fight? Oops, I lied!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Blast it all! You'll pay for your treachery, Karasu!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My friends! I will handle these foes! Keep to the shadows!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Stow it, Oboro, before─bleedin' hells, there goes our cover!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: F-Forgive me, my friends...

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Finally, some action! Feel my blade, you honorless dogs!

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Aw, is that all of them? I was just getting warmed up!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, I s'pose there's no point in hidin' no more...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Good work, my friends. Our companions await us. Let us move quickly!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It's Master Underfoot! Quickly, dispatch of the guards!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Thank ye kindly, friends. Those ropes stung somethin' fierce.

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: Ye've got more courage than sense to come this far. Heh...if we fought on the same side, I could see myself gettin' to like you. But we serve another master, and he just so happens to be a demandin' one.

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: Don't give me that look. We've all got to make a livin', an' this is the best way we know how. Now draw your blades! Zakuro'll bathe in yer lifeblood this nightthis day!

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: Hear me, men? Cut down the rats where they stand!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Be strong, friends! Zakuro is a formidable opponent, but we must prevail!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Must your battles always be so boring? Here's a little something to heat things up!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Curses! Beware Karasu's katon, friends! Keep a distance from each other!

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: It took ye bloody long enough! Time to earn yer keep!

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: What do I pay you for, anyway? Cut them down, ye bloody wretches, or I'll skewer you where ye stand!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I'm baaa-aaack! Did you miss me?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Like a dagger in my back. Spread out, friends, and stand clear of the flames!

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: Show the rats no mercy! We will bathe the hills of Bekko in their blood!

dialogue.name: ZAKURO
dialogue.text: Nnngh! Is the blood I bathe in...my own...?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We have...failed. Tsubame, forgive me...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Blades awhirling through the air! Blood watering the fields! Shinobi fighting side by side, all for the sake of their dear friends! Could there be a more moving sight? Our hero is moved to tears...or not.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: But do not worry. As promised, I'll return your precious swallow with nary a feather out of place─once you hand over the scroll, of course.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What foolery is this, Karasu!? We played your little game, and we won, did we not? Are you not a man of your word!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oh, my poor, stupid Oboro! How dim can one man get? Didn't anyone ever tell you that promises are made to be broken─especially mine. Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Now, hand over the scroll, and quickly now! I don't particularly enjoy killing my dear friends, but that's never stopped me before.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: O-Oboro! The scroll...!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Very good, dim one! Yes, I daresay you've played your role to perfection. Fly away home, little swallow─we've had enough fun for the day.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: (-Imposing Shinobi-)Incompetent fools, the lot of you. How long do you intend to keep me waiting for what is rightfully mine?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Lord Hanzo! You couldn't have come at a better time. You'll be happy to know I have just what you've been looking for. Behold!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Our hero has truly outdone himself this time! At long last, the ancient secrets of Hingan ninjutsu will be his! Do tell me, Lord Hanzo─when will training begin? L-Lord Hanzo!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Aieeeeeeeeeeee!

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: (-Imposing Shinobi-)Silence, whelp! The bastard get of Sasuke the Shamed deserve naught but a quick death.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: (-Imposing Shinobi-)Well, well... A brood of Doman dogs who would call themselves shinobi. You stand before Hanzo the Hidden, twelfth lord of the Kagekakushi clan─and you should consider yourself fortunate that I do not cut you down where you stand.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: And you would call your petty tricks ninjutsu? I spit on your ninjutsu. Your very existence brings dishonor to every true shinobi who has ever lived. Yes, those of my clan─the original and true practitioners of the art.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: Be thankful that I have more important matters to attend to today. Enjoy what little remains of your miserable lives─your time will come, and before you know it.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forgive me, my friends... Pray give me a moment to take in all we just saw...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I do not know where to even start. Karasu, killed off before our very eyes? The forbidden mudra in the hands of this Hanzo, who claims to hail from the clan who founded our art, and who harbors a grudge against Master Sasuke─and, in turn, us─for reasons I can scarce begin to understand?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Though it may be small comfort, we can take heart in one matter. In truth, the scroll Hanzo now holds is but one half of the whole─alone, it is all but worthless.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: The other half is tucked safely away in our village, far from Hanzo's peering eye. It is a secret known only to the elders, entrusted to me by the old hermit before I took my leave.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Is that so? Hmph. I would have appreciated if someone could have shared that knowledge with me as well. The old hermit always did like you better...for some reason.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Still, I do not expect this Hanzo to give up easily. Whatever the true nature of the grudge he holds against the founder of our village, it seems to nigh border on obsession.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Our adversary claims to hail from the Kagekakushi clan. Princess Yuki, are you familiar with the name?

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: If I remember the histories correctly, they achieved great renown for their exploits in battle during the Age of Strife. It was said that a single Kagekakushi fought with the strength and skill of a thousand lesser shinobi.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: ...Until one day when a vengeful warlord razed their village to the ground, slaughtering even wives and babes. The Kagekakushi on the battlefield, too, disappeared one after the next. An inglorious end, by any measure.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: If this Hanzo is truly a descendant of the clan, it would stand to reason that he would seek revenge against those who betrayed his ancestors. But how this is connected to Sasuke─I cannot say.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: But if there's one thing I know, it's that I'm not going to just stand by while this Hanzo plunges our nation into another age of war! I will return home and see if there is any more knowledge of the Kagekakushi to be had.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Princess. We are counting on you.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: For our part, we should return to Yanxia. Once Hanzo realizes that he only possesses half of the knowledge he seeks, he is like to turn an eye to our village. We must warn the elders.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: If it's all the same, I reckon I'll join ye. I'm not keen on showin' my face in Limsa till I've got the goods I came for in my daddles.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That said, someone needs to see to it that all's bob back at home...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Underfoot, V'kebbe. Can I count on ye to keep things in order till I've seen to business here?

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Aye aye, Cap'n! Consider it done!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Just hurry back, will ye? I'll make sure there's a Bismarck special with yer name on it.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Bugger me if this journey hasn't been one surprise after the next─and somethin' tells me the best is yet to come. Ye'll be joinin' us, won't ye, Forename? For ol' times' sake?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I cannot thank you enough, friend. The journey to Yanxia is a long one. After we arrive, let us rest up in the village of Namai.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My long-awaited homecoming, for the first time since I left in pursuit of Karasu. Karasu...have you truly left this world for good?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I've seen many a sleepy fishin' village in my day, but this might be the sleepiest...

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro has seemed quite pensive since arriving here in Namai. It would seem that this homecoming weighs heavily on his mind...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tsubame and I will first make the journey to the village alone. Forgive me, but the elders are not like to smile on the sudden arrival of outsiders.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We will report on all that we saw in Hingashi, and gather what wisdom we can. Pray wait for us here. We will return as soon as we are able.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I do not ask for a hero's welcome, but... <sigh> Well, I suppose there is no putting it off any longer...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Seems we're on our own for the time bein'. Reckon I can find some bene bingo an' a couple of rum doxies in this place? Just havin' a bit of an amuse─what with this Hanzo on the prowl, it's best we both keep our stabbers sharpened.

quest.name: 開祖の密命
journal: Jacke wears an expression of mild concern.

Oboro has returned from the village, but to hear Jacke tell it, the young shinobi is not quite himself. Suspecting that he might have wandered off to a nearby waterfall to clear his head─as is his wont─the two of you head off in pursuit.

You and Jacke come upon Oboro under the falling waters of the Heron's Flight. As he dries himself off by the fire, the ninja shares with you just what has been troubling him so. As he tells it, he was given a hero's welcome upon his return to the village, but recent events have left him unable to accept the praise lavished upon him. Jacke comforts him with a tale of your own adventures, the moral of which is that when people give you more credit than you deserve, you might as well take it as an opportunity to better yourself rather than beating yourself up for your perceived failings. With newfound resolve, Oboro declares his intention to learn the secret history of Sasuke, his village's founder, from the old hermit known as Master Kamui. Return to Namai, where Tsubame has prepared a most majestic means of transportation for your journey.

Oboro explains that Master Kamui has sequestered himself in meditation in Plum Spring, a short flight away from where you stand. When you are ready, mount the great falcon whose wings will carry you to your destination.

Despite the troubles you took in seeking him out, Master Kamui is not keen to engage you in conversation, instead demanding that Oboro fetch him three ingredients to brew a medicine to cure his aching back. Though the old hermit seems quite comfortable in the company of Tsubame, it would appear you and your friends have little choice but to do his bidding.

Back in Namai, you, Oboro, and Jacke resolve to split up and quickly dispense with the old hermit's busywork. Fetch a claw from the Doman weasels that prowl the Glittering Basin, while your friends see to the other items on Master Kamui's shopping list.
After a hard-fought battle with the slavering beast, the weasel claw is yours. Return to Namai, and hope that your friends have found similar success in their hunts.

You return to Namai, and are pleased to see that Oboro and Jacke have also managed to procure the rare ingredients sought by Master Kamui. Hoping that this will suffice to convince the old hermit to share his knowledge with you, you set out once again for Plum Spring on the wings of the great bird.

You return to Plum Spring to find Master Kamui in fine fettle, some time in the company of the lovely Tsubame having clearly done the work of the most potent of elixirs. His spirits high, he regales you with the true story of Master Sasuke, he who brought ninjutsu to Doma and founded the village Oboro and his fellow shinobi call home. Long ago, Sasuke sailed across the Ruby Sea to Doma at the bidding of his master, Hanzo the First. Hanzo entrusted his young protégé with a scroll writ with the forbidden mudra of summoning he had devised, commanding him to use it to free the Doman people from tyranny. Sasuke did just that, and then─fearing the mudra's power─cleaved the scroll in two, that the fearsome knowledge contained within never again would see the light of day. At the same time, he founded a village, that he might train his new countrymen in the art of ninjutsu, and pass his legacy on to future generations. Sadly, as his mission─even at the time─was shrouded in the utmost of secrecy, Sasuke's heroic deeds on behalf of Doma never reached the ears of his clansmen, and centuries later, it would seem that the descendants of the Kagekakushi clan have come to see him as a traitor and deserter who stole away to a foreign land with his master's forbidden knowledge. As Oboro puts the pieces together, Princess Yuki and Jacke arrive bearing grave news. The Kagekakushi clan means to sail for Doma to claim what they believe is rightly theirs─and when they come, they will come with an army.

With clouds of war brewing on the horizon, you return to Namai with Oboro, knowing that it is but a matter of time before Hanzo and the Kagekakushi army arrives on Doman shores. You resolve to devote all your efforts to your training, knowing that you and your friends will be tested as never before.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro upon reaching level 70.
objectives: Look for Oboro at the Heron's Flight.
Speak with Oboro at Namai.
Speak with Oboro at Plum Spring.
Speak with Oboro at Namai.
Obtain a Doman weasel claw from a Doman weasel.
Deliver the Doman weasel claw to Oboro in Namai.
Speak with Oboro at Plum Spring.
Speak with Oboro at Namai.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Oboro got back not long ago. Mumbled somethin' about his trip to the village was uneventful, then dragged his beater cases off somewhere or 'nother, lookin' at the ground all the while.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Jacke knows how to read a cove, and somethin' tells me the boy ain't right these days─like he's carryin' the weight o' the world on his shoulders.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: You know the lad better than anyone. You reckon there's somewhere he'd run off to if he were lookin' to clear his head?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Mayhap he returned to his village?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: His hideout in Eorzea, no doubt.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Is there a waterfall in these parts, by chance?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye sure about that? He was lookin' more to me like someone who wanted to be alone. Ye don't reckon there's anywhere else the lad might go?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Yer tellin' me he just up and hopped the twig back to Eorzea without so much as a whid? Not bloody likely. There must be somewhere else he might be...

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: A waterfall? Now that ye mention it, I did hear the sound of runnin' water when I went on a stroll the other day.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I'm not quite sure I whiddle ye, but if that's where ye think the lad is, like as not yer right. Let's go see if we can't ease his cares a bit.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Is that...Oboro? Bugger me, the lad has lost his bloody mind!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I had hoped to spend some more time alone with my thoughts, but it is just as well. It grows cold, and I would warm myself by a fire.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You know me all too well, Forename. I suppose I should not be surprised.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, ye shocked the livin' wits out of me! I was expectin' to find ye in front of the waterfall, not in it!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: At first I did just that, Captain Jacke. But when listening to the flowing water did not calm my heart as I hoped, I took the next logical course of action.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I cannot explain it. I returned to my village, fully expecting to be punished for my deception and chastised for my failure to perform my duty. Instead, I was greeted as a hero─the honorable shinobi who slew the villainous Karasu, traitor to our village and country.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But it is all a lie! Master Gekkai was the traitor, and were it not for Karasu─putting aside the foul deeds he performed in service to his final master─my eyes would have been forever blind to the truth!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That day, I promised Karasu that I would keep the truth hidden, and claim the glory and accolades in his stead. At the time, I thought nothing of it.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But...it is just too much! Perhaps the man deserved to die for his sins─it is not for me to judge. But does he deserve to go to the grave as a hated villain, while I reap the fruits of deeds I can scarcely call my own!?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye really are too serious for yer own good, lad. Let ol' Jacke tell ye a story.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Once upon a time─well, maybe not so long ago─there was a dimber mort by the name of Milala, a captain o' the Yellowjackets who was always more style than substance, if ye whiddle me. Long story short, Forename and me did ourselves a good deed, but the lass took the credit for 'erself.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Did a part of me resent it? Sure, I've got feelings as any other cove. But people in our business─includin' this Karasu rook, I reckon─need people like her. People to stand in the lightmans and claim the glory, while we ply our trade in the dark.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Milala might not have done the deed, but since then, they say she's a new woman─doin' all she can to be the hero that people believe 'er to be.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: In not so many whids, I guess what I'm sayin' is─rather than cloutin' yerself in the nob about glory ye feel ye don't deserve, why not try live up to the person yer friends would have ye be?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Captain Jacke. I must admit, I had never thought of it that way.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Oboro! I...I...forgive me, I have readied the falcon as you requested. Shall we pay Master Kamui a visit?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Allow me to explain, my friends. Since returning here, I have been researching the history of our village─in particular, the life of our forefather, Master Sasuke─in hopes of better understanding our foe and the grudge he bears.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: The tales say that Master Sasuke came to Doma on a mission so secret, no records of it were ever left. Our elders, too, were at a loss. If any possess knowledge of such ancient happenings, they said, it would be the old hermit.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: That is what we call Master Kamui, an elder who retired from his post long ago, and now spends his days in meditation at Plum Spring, pondering the meaning of existence to depths ordinary minds can scarce comprehend.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename. As my student, you too are an heir to Master Sasuke's legacy. I would ask that you accompany me to Plum Spring, that together we may learn the truth about the father of our art. Will you do this?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Excellent. Plum Spring is not far from here, but we cannot travel there on land. Tsubame was kind enough to summon the falconer. Let us return to Namai.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I'm no shinobi, an' I wouldn't know this Sasuke from a hole in the ground, but I'm comin' with ye─if for no other reason than I'm dyin' for a change o' scenery.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye reckon ridin' one o' these things is much like ridin' a chocobo?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: It is said that the old hermit's mastery of ninjutsu is so complete that he requires no food and no sleep, and has conquered death himself. Mind you, it is also said that the source of these claims is Master Kamui himself.

dialogue.name: WARP02951
dialogue.text: I am a falconer in service to the village. It is my honor to serve.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Master Kamui rarely accepts visitors, but the elders have assured me he awaits our arrival. Do not ask me why, but they say he is particularly interested in seeing you, Tsubame.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: In any event, Plum Spring is but a short and pleasant flight away. When you are ready to depart, pray speak to the falconer over there.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: It's pretty an' all, but what's a cove to do for fun in these parts?

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: It is beautiful, is it not? They say that the plum blossoms have been in bloom here since before the dawn of time...

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: My aching back...

dialogue.name: WARP02951
dialogue.text: Do not be afraid, friend. My loyal bird will carry you safe and sure to your destination.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Ride the falcon to Plum Spring?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Return to Namai?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: This is the esteemed Master Kamui. I can scarcely wait to hear what words of enlightenment he would share with us.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: A thousand apologies for the intrusion, Master Kamui. It is I, Oboro. I have come seeking knowledge of Master Sasuke and the founding of our village. If it would not be an imposition, pray share with us your great wisdom.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Obo-who? I don't know any Obo─aiya! My back! Every word I speak is a dagger in me!

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: No, no, this won't do at all. I'll be needing my medicine─the usual, that is. Liver of a Yanxian tiger, horn of a rhino beetle, claw of a Doman weasel! Yes, that always does the trick.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Yes, I simply cannot carry on a conversation in such pain. So be on your way, boys. You stay here, my little swallow, and keep an old man company.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: For every whid bein' a dagger in him, he sure likes his prattlin'.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Oboro... Oboro... Where have I heard that name before?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Enlightenment, my arse! This old coot's a real piece o' work...

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Oboro... Ah yes, the dim little boy who could never quite match the wits and skills of his friend Karasu...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Y-Yes...that is I. It is my honor to bring you the medicine you seek, Master.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forgive me, friend, but it seems we have little choice but to indulge the master. Between the three of us, hopefully it will not prove too trying a task. Let us return to Namai.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I've half a mind to enlighten the old coot with a click in the muns.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: <giggle> Master Kamui, you forget yourself...!

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Come now, my little swallow. It's the only path to true enlightenment!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: <sigh> Playing errand boy for Master Kamui...what a splendid turn of events. In any event, let us split up and make short work of this. I will hunt down a Yanxian tiger. Captain Jacke, pray see to the rhino beetle horn.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename, I would entrust the Doman weasel claw to you. My apologies for troubling you with such a menial task, but I fear Master Kamui is nothing if not stubborn. In any event, let us return here when we have found what he seeks.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: To think I sailed clear across the Ruby Sea to go bug huntin'...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I trust you were able to procure a weasel claw?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thank you, friend. I am pleased to report that Captain Jacke and I were also successful in our hunts. Let us return to Plum Spring and hope that Master Kamui is feeling more talkative.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: If it's all the same to ye lads, I'll be stayin' here, thank ye kindly. I'm like as not to give that ol' coot a clout in the nob, an' I reckon yer elders wouldn't take kindly to that.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: What I wouldn't give for a pint an' a rum doxy at me side!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Is it just me, or does Master Kamui seem rather...spry...given his condition? No matter, let us give the man what he asked for.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Ohohoho! My favorite medicine─never fails to put a spring in an old man's step.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But, Master Kamui, we have not begun to boil the─forgive me. What I mean to say is, it warms my heart to see you well.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: <cough> Ahem! So it was Sasuke's secret mission you wished to hear of, my boy? Let me see what I remember. It was oh, oh so long ago...

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Once upon a time in Hingashi, in the time they called the Age of Strife, there lived a man named Hanzo─Hanzo the first. Leader of the Kagekakushi clan, he crafted a summoning mudra of terrifying power.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Many a warlord did covet this power, that they might wield it to unify the warring states under their rule. Hanzo would hear nothing of it─time and again, he turned down prestigious posts and untold riches, declaring that the mudra would be used only in defense. He recorded his knowledge on a single scroll, and sealed it away far from the eyes of man.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Some time later, a vagabond came to Kagekakushi. After the villagers nursed him back to health, he explained that he had fled across the sea from the land of Doma to escape the reign of a tyrant.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: So it was that Hanzo the First─moved deeply by the traveler's story─called upon Sasuke, his most trusted protégé, to carry the forbidden knowledge across the Ruby Sea and bring freedom to the people of Doma.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Sasuke wielded the power but once, such was its power. In a matter of moments, the tyrant's army crumbled before its might, and the Doman people at last knew freedom.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: But Sasuke felt that his job was not yet done. He resolved to remain in Doma, and established a village here, that he might train his new countrymen to carry on his legacy, and pass down the art of ninjutsu to future generations. That is the untold story of our village's origins.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: As for the forbidden mudra by whose power Doma's freedom was won, who can say why our ancestor feared it so. All that we know is that he was not content to merely seal the scroll away, but took his blade in hand and sliced it clean in two.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: One piece was presented as an offering to the King of Doma, in celebration of the nation's newfound freedom. The other he sealed away in his village─our village─never again to see the light of day.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I suspected as much. Master Sasuke was no traitor or deserter, but a shinobi of honor.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Even at the time, it is said that Hanzo the First told none other of Sasuke's true mission. Though unfortunate, it is little surprise that today, centuries later, his descendants see Sasuke as little more than a traitor who stole away with their greatest treasure and fled to a foreign land...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Thank you, Master Kamui. This has proved more enlightening beyond my wildest hopes.

dialogue.name: KAMUI
dialogue.text: Glad to hear it, boy─but don't think I'll take kindly to you interrupting my blissful enlightenment again. As for you, my little swallow, you're welcome to come back any time.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Sorry to interrupt yer lecherous prittle prattle, but the princess here's got news to share─an' I'm afraid it ain't of the good variety.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Oboro, we must move quickly! Our men afield have reported that the Kagekakushi clan musters their forces in full, and means to march on Doma!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...No doubt Hanzo has figured out where the other half of the scroll lies. There is no time to lose. We must return at once and prepare to defend the village.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: This Hanzo cove doesn't waste any time, does he? Seems our job's simple enough─we need to grabble his half of the scroll before he gets his daddles on ours.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Tsubame has gone to deliver the news to the elders. Meanwhile, Princess Yuki makes for the Ruby Sea to look out for the Kagekakushi army's approach.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We know not the size of our foe's army, nor their strength─only that both are formidable, and then some. Suffice it to say we will be tested as never before. In what time we have, I implore you to devote yourself to your training as if our very lives depended on it─for surely they do.

quest.name: 影隠忍法帖
journal: Oboro is trembling with excitement and trepidation.

The army of the Kagekakushi clan comes, and they come in great numbers. Oboro would meet the advancing army with his fellow shinobi, but he has one grave concern─Lord Hanzo himself is nowhere to be seen. You suggest that perhaps the man means to sneak into Yanxia through the back door─that is to say, by way of the Azim Steppe. Finding your theory a convincing one, Oboro bids you guard the passage while he leads the rest of the shinobi against Lord Hanzo's imposing army.

As you keep watch by the passage to Yanxia on the edge of the Azim Steppe, an old man approaches. Though it appears at a glance to be Master Kamui, the old hermit of Plum Spring, it is quickly revealed to be little more than one of Hanzo's disguises. The Kagekakushi lord gloatingly explains that he used his superior ninjutsu to create the illusion of a false army, luring the most capable shinobi out of the village, then snuck in with his flawless disguise and stole away with the scroll with the utmost of ease. Eager to put to use the legendary power he has obtained, he forms the forbidden mudra of summoning─only to be surrounded by a nest of hopping rabbits. As Hanzo fumes with rage, a very-much-alive Karasu appears on a ledge above, revealing that it was in fact he who was pulling Hanzo's strings all along─the Karasu thought slain at Bekko was but a mirror, and the scroll in Hanzo's hands a cleverly disguised fake. With a sneer, Hanzo turns to face you, still believing his own form of ninjutsu to be superior to the Doman offshoot, but is proven wrong when he falls at the hands of you and Karasu. Looking out over the battlefield, you turn to the eccentric ninja who has again proven himself an unexpected friend.

Karasu offers some rare words of praise for your skill at ninjutsu before walking off to wherever the wind will carry him. No sooner has he left than you are joined by Oboro and the rest of your companions, who joyfully report their triumph over the Kagekakushi clan. Oboro rejoices at the return of the scroll to the village, but soon realizes that Karasu has made off with the true other half. Jacke claims the fake scroll and sets off for Limsa with proof that his job is done, and Princess Yuki─heartened to have repaid her debt to you and Oboro─likewise runs off to Eorzea in search of her hapless retainer Akagi. Oboro expresses his intent to go after Karasu, and asks Tsubame to concoct another tale to explain his absence to the village elders. After a round of farewells has been exchanged, Oboro bids you visit him at his hideout upon your return to Eorzea, where he would share with you a final word.

Back at the storehouse in La Noscea, Oboro shares with you his recent thoughts on his path as a shinobi. Though his mind thus far has often been clouded with doubts, his reflection on the story of Master Sasuke and the origins of his village has given him clarity. He would follow in the footsteps of his honorable forebear, walking the path he believes in even if it means setting aside his commitments to his homeland in favor of listening to his own heart. With a newfound sense of purpose, he resolves to pursue Karasu and the missing scroll. Thanking you one last time for your friendship and your commitment to the path of the shinobi, he bids you farewell for the day, expressing his wish that your next adventure together will come someday soon.

※The next ninja quest will be available from Oboro once you have met the following requirements:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”
※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”
objectives: Keep watch for Hanzo on the Azim Steppe.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must first complete the main scenario quest “The Hour of Reckoning.”

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Hanzo and his bleedin' army can't get their dew beaters here soon enough for my likin'. I'm ready to snatch the scroll an' hop on the next ship back to Limsa.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: It is time, Forename. The army of the Kagekakushi clan marches on Yanxia even as we speak.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Princess Yuki keeps watch from afar, and she says their numbers are legion. We must gather our brothers and sisters of the village and make toward the Ruby Sea to meet them head-on.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: There is one thing, however, that does not sit well with me. As Princess Yuki tells it, there is no sign of Lord Hanzo among the advancing army.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Though we met only the once, he does not strike me as a man who would stay home and let others fight his battles. He is surely plotting something, but what? Have you any ideas, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: He comes from the Steppe.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: He would strike at our blind spot.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But of course! He means to circle around and cross over to Yanxia by way of the Azim Steppe, catching us from behind!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And yet, our foe vastly outnumbers us. We simply cannot afford to spread our forces thinner than they already are.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: If Hanzo means to sneak through the back door undetected, like as not he comes alone. I would trust the defense of the Steppe to you. Go in safety, friend, and may the kami smile on us today.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Can't speak for you, but “gettin' caught between two squabblin' ninja clans” wasn't high on my to-do list. Still, we're on this ship together, so might as well see the voyage through to the end, I reckon. If that Hanzo shows up, grabble his half of the scroll for me, will ye?

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: (-Old Hermit-)Pardon me, my girlboy... I seem to have lost my way. Could you show an old man to Plum Spring? Heh heh...

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: Clearly you're not as stupid as your friends. But it is too late. The scroll has returned to the hand of its rightful owner, and everything proceeds according to my plan.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: As expected, Doman ninjutsu was a sad sight to behold. Where Sasuke's sorry get struggle to wield three mudra, the jonin of the Kagekakushi command four with ease.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: Bunshin-no-jutsu─so we call it in the Hingan tongue. Mirrors, and mirrors of mirrors─in a matter of moments, my few loyal men appeared from afar to be a legion.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: With all but a few abandoning the village to meet the challenge of my “army,” it was simple enough to put on the guise of the old man and walk out with what was rightfully mine.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: That is the difference between a true shinobi and the Doman whoresons who dishonor our name with their very existence.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: But the dishonor ends today. At long last, I shall wipe the earth of the sons of Sasuke the Shamed─the thief who stole my great ancestor's knowledge and consigned our proud clan to ruin.

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: I should not waste my time with a false shinobi such as you. And yet there is a sharpness─an edge─in your technique that your Doman friends lack. Yes, you should make a fine test for my newfound powers...!

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: Come, great beast! Hanzo the Hidden, descendant of your first master, bids you come!

dialogue.name: RABBIT02952
dialogue.text: (-Dread Beasts-)Thumpity thump thump, thumpity thump thump...

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: What─? What is the meaning of this!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)So fearsome, their floppy ears! So terrifying, their sharply protruding teeth! The audience gasps in horror!

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: You! I killed you!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! I thought you sharper than that, my friend! There was some resemblance around the eyes, I'll admit, but the real me is so much more handsome!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The lordling is dumbfounded! So stubbornly proud was he of his precious fourth mudra. Never in a million years did it occur to him that my Master Gekkai had mastered the same technique─a technique he imparted to me.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oh, and if those lovely little creatures thumping about you didn't give it away, that scroll in your hands is quite fake. I couldn't very well let forbidden knowledge fall into the wrong hands, now could I?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Though you only succeeded in killing my mirror, you did try to kill me. I really didn't appreciate that.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: My poor little chick. You always end up doing the dirty work, don't you?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: But worry not─for this time, at your side stands not Oboro the dim or some two-gil rogues, but the most stylishly lethal shinobi this realm has ever seen! What say we cut this self-important sop down to size?

dialogue.name: HANZO
dialogue.text: You dare mock me...? Your every breath brings shame to the ancestors of our art─my ancestors. You will pay for your insolence. Come!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: You've come far, my little chick! I daresay you could teach the dim one a lesson or two.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Spare Oboro the details─I have a reputation to uphold, after all─but it was rather exhilarating to fight on the same side for once. We really should do it again sometime. Till we meet again, exit our hero─stage right!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: What's this you say? Karasu still lives!?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! I knew the slippery bird had another trick up his sleeves!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: All's well what ends well, eh? Seems that Karasu fellow was a right bene cove after all. Reckon yer lucky to have a friend like him.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Lucky!? For all the trouble he put us through, I would sooner have a thousand archenemies!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye'll be pleased to know we made short work of the Kagekakushi “army.” Soon as we realized they was mostly smoke an' mirrors, it weren't long afore we milled what was left of 'em.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: We could not have done it without you, Forename. You are the savior of our village. I thank you from the bottom of my heart.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And we can rest easy, knowing that half of the forbidden scroll is safely back in our hands. But if the half Karasu gave to Hanzo at the Isle of Bekko was a fake, that means...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Curse it all─that confounded crow!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My duty is clear: I must pursue Karasu and recover the scroll. Tsubame, pray tell the elders that I will be returning to Eorzea for the foreseeable future. Do not mention Karasu's name─remember, the official story is that the “traitor” is long since dead.

dialogue.name: TSUBAME
dialogue.text: Do not worry, Oboro. I will see that the elders leave you alone, as I always do.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Sharpened up a bit, haven't ye, lad? Now, if ye don't mind, I'll be takin' the false scroll back with me to Limsa.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: If even that Hanzo couldn't whiddle the difference, ol' Carvallain and the Krakens aren't like to know any benar.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Forename, Oboro─it was my honor to lend my blade to your cause. I wish I could have cut down a few more of Hanzo's henchmen, but oh well...I suppose one can't have it all.

dialogue.name: YUKI
dialogue.text: Now, I must return home to─hells, I've forgotten Akagi! The poor fool's probably tearing the realm upside down looking for me. I must be off, friends!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: The mort keeps ye on yer toes, I'll give her that. An' with that, I'd best be movin' my dew beaters as well.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Then I, too, shall take my leave. My friends, it was as ever an honor to fight by your side.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename. If you are not in a hurry to return to your adventures, I would have a word with you. Pray meet me at the storehouse upon your return to La Noscea.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. Thank you for coming. I have been reflecting on recent events, and contemplating what it means to walk the path of a shinobi. I know you to be the contemplative sort as well, so I would share with you my thoughts.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: When I first came to Eorzea, I thought only of fulfilling the duty entrusted to me by my elders. It would be no exaggeration to say that it was my sole purpose in life.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Meeting you, learning the truth of Master Gekkai from Karasu─these experiences changed me. In the end, I forsook my duty in favor of following my own heart. I faced my old master in combat, and slew him for his treachery.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Even after that, I remained here in Eorzea to follow my own sense of duty. But even though I believed in the path I had chosen, in my heart of hearts a part of me was unsure. Is my true home not my village? Is my true duty not to the brothers and sisters I left behind?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I have pondered time and again the story of Master Sasuke as told by the old hermit, and at long last...it is clear to me.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Master Sasuke could have returned home after freeing the people of Doma from the tyrant's reign─in fact, one could say it was his duty to do so. Instead he chose to remain there, and founded the village where I was raised.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: This was not his duty─at the very least, not a duty tasked to him by his master, Hanzo the First, but rather a cause he took up of his own accord. In this sense, I cannot blame the descendants of the Kagekakushi from viewing him as little more than a dishonorable renegade worthy of scorn.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, Master Sasuke was willing to forsake his legacy and the recognition of his people to follow a path that he truly believed in. I have no intention of abandoning my village entirely, but I, too, would follow in my ancestor's footsteps─in my own humble way.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My first mission that I have given myself is to track down Karasu, and bring the stolen scroll back to the village where it belongs. He is ever an elusive bird, and the task will not be easy, but I welcome the challenge.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But forgive me, Forename─I have rambled on enough. You have proven yourself to be a true shinobi, and more than that, a true friend. I look forward to the day when we can stand together once more.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This concludes the ninja quests for FINAL FANTASY XIV: Stormblood. In order to undertake the next series of quests, you must first meet the following requirements:

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text:
※ FINAL FANTASY XIV: Shadowbringers must be registered to your service account.
※ You must have completed the main scenario quest “Shadowbringers.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: ※ You must have completed the role quest “Courage Born of Fear.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once you have done so, the next ninja quest will be available from Oboro.

quest.name: 真に守りたいもの
journal: Jenlyns has something─or someone─on his mind.

You learn from Jenlyns that something appears to be troubling Mylla of late. As a close friend of the First Sword, the paladin encourages you to seek her out and inquire after the source of her consternation.

Speaking with Mylla, you learn that it is none other than Aldis, recently returned to Ul'dah, who is causing her grief. Before she can go into detail, however, the man himself appears. Having explained that he has been to the Far East to train in the way of the samurai, he challenges you to a duel for old times' sake. The stage is set for Scorpion Crossing in western Thanalan, and you set out to join Aldis there.

You and Aldis square off. As he prepares to draw his blade, however, a look of awe sweeps over his face. To simply confront you, it would seem, is enough to convince him that he is no match for you, and he abruptly abandons the duel and excuses himself. His uncharacteristic behavior leaves Mylla at a loss for words, and she turns her steps back to the Gladiators' Guild, more confounded than when she left.

Eventually joining you and Mylla, Aldis apologizes for his behavior. Having thought long and hard on the reason for your strength, he has finally come to realize that which is dearest to him: the Gladiators' Guild. To that end, Aldis declares that he will give up the itinerant life and henceforth remain in Ul'dah to watch over the guild. Though Mylla appears none too impressed by his presumptuousness, you know that, deep down, she is glad for his presence. Thus do you take your leave, assured in the knowledge that all will be well in the end.
objectives: Speak with Mylla.
Speak with Aldis in Hammerlea.
Speak with Mylla in Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: Ah, if it isn't Forename. How fare you, my friend? Still keeping up your training, I trust?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: The Sultansworn have not been idle either. Seeking ways to better serve our nation, we have joined hands with the Gladiators' Guild.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: We train with one another, helping to hone each other's sword arms. The guild even dispatches its members to assist us in guarding the palace.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: None of this would have been possible without First Sword Mylla's cooperation. She is a dedicated woman─dedicated to her art and to her own─and I have the utmost respect and admiration for her.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: ...So it was with deep concern that I noticed that something troubles her of late. Whereas before she was amiable, she has become given to brooding silences.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: I considered offering to lend an ear, but as a relatively new acquaintance, I did not wish to appear overly familiar.

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: But you, Forename─you are her close friend. Will you not seek her out and inquire after the source of her consternation?

dialogue.name: JENLYNS
dialogue.text: As I mentioned, something seems to be troubling First Sword Mylla of late. If you have a moment, pray seek her out and inquire after the source of her consternation.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: ...Oh, it's you, Forename. It's been a while. What brings you here today?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Jenlyns is worried about you.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Is everything all right?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: H-He is? Gods, was I being that obvious? <sigh> Forgive me, I don't mean to sound ungrateful. It's kind of Jenlyns to worry about me.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Wh-What's this all of a sudden? Of course I'm─ <sigh> Nay, I won't insult your intelligence by lying to you.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: You see, it's Aldis... He's returned to Ul'dah. He's been pardoned, so he has every right to be here.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: But it's just...I just don't understand what's going through his mind.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: (-???-)Oho, if it isn't the very womanman I've been longing to see!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Greetings, Forename! You look well─for someone who's been raising hells the world over!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: ...Hm? I see my attire intrigues you.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: When I took my leave after the Ul Cup, I believe I said something to the effect of still having much to learn. That's what I've been doing─learning.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I remembered hearing tell of the fearsome swordsmen of the Far East. And so I decided to journey there and train in their style.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: I remembered the elderly samurai who was making short work of our gladiators. And so I decided to journey to the Far East and train in his style.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: You never cared for convention or tradition. Is it any wonder we're confused to see you actually look the part?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Hah, I suppose you're right. But you have to admit, Mylla─I look pretty good in this.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: So, Forename. How about you and I have a bout? For old times' sake?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Gladly!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Heh heh, we're of a kind, you and I. When we see a mighty foe, we can't resist the urge to test ourselves!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Not wont to bare steel needlessly, is that it? But I know you need this, Forename─as much as I do. We're of a kind, you and I. When we see a mighty foe, we can't resist the urge to test ourselves!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Now, as much as I fancy a rematch in the Coliseum, we'll have to settle for a humbler venue this time. Hmmm, let's see...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: How about Scorpion Crossing, outside of the Gate of the Sultana? There's space there, if not a lot of people to watch our glorious match.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Oh, don't you even think about fighting in the city!

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: If you must feed your vanity, I'll attend as witness. At the very least, I can explain the situation to the Brass Blades should they appear.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Thanks, I appreciate it.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: And there you have it, Forename. I'll see you at Scorpion Crossing.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: <sigh> I can't believe this... Go on ahead, Forename. I'll follow in a moment.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I hope he's satisfied.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Heh heh, I've been looking forward to this. Come, my friend, let's begin!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Impossible...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: How? How did you become so strong?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I found something worth protecting...

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: I found something I couldn't bear to lose...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You journeyed to another world...and found something you wished to protect?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: You journeyed to another world...and found something you couldn't bear to lose?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Aldis? What's the meaning of this?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: There's no point. As I am, I don't stand a chance against Forename.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: You would admit defeat before you've even fought?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: It's unseemly, aye. But because of my training, I've come to know, Mylla─come to know the power of resolve and the difference it makes.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Forgive me, I need a moment alone.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: This isn't the Aldis I know. He's never once backed down from a fight.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I don't doubt that you've grown stronger since last we met.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: But so has Aldis. That's why he challenged you─to put his training to the proof.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Yet, by that selfsame training, he could see that he was no match for you. I...I don't know what to say.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Well, there's no use pondering things here. Let's return to the guild.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Aldis hasn't returned.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: I wouldn't be surprised if he's left Ul'dah again. It wouldn't be the first time he's disappeared as quickly as he's arrived...

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Don't blame yourself. The problem is Aldis's and Aldis's alone. It's up to him to resolve it, however long that may take.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: At any rate, don't feel compelled to linger on his account. I'm sure you have much demands on your time. Come and visit again when you have the chance.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Sorry for taking off like that.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Truth be told, I'm ashamed to show my face, but there's something I needed to tell you.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: After I left, I thought long and hard on your words. On that which you said made you strong.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: It led me to ask myself, what is it that I wish to protect?

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: And you found your answer?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Aye, I did. Fool that I am, it took me a long time, but I finally realized that it was always close by.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Aldis...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Mylla. This is embarrassing for me to say, but that which is dearest to me, that I cannot bear to lose...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: ...Is the Gladiators' Guild.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: ...What?

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: The old guildmaster, he was as a father to me. And this place is as a home.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: No matter where my path may lead, the guild will always welcome me with open arms. I realize that now.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Aldis! You...you...!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: So, if I'm to protect the guild, it means...well, you know...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: It means...I have to be at the guild. So from today, I'm giving up the itinerant life.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: After all these years coming and going as you please, sending nary a word, you think you can just stay here!? You've got a lot of nerve!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Why, Mylla, if I didn't know better, I'd say you were worried about me.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Sh-Shut your mouth! If you wish to stay, then do as you like! That's what you're good at!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Ah, there's the grimace I know and love. There truly is no place like home.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: But jests aside... Forename─because of you, I've finally realized what's important to me.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: For that, I give you my thanks.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: From hereon, I'll watch over the guild while I continue honing my skills.

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Who knows? If I work hard, I might even become the First Sword one day.

dialogue.name: MYLLA
dialogue.text: Not on your life! No one would entrust the guild to a selfish bastard such as you! And skills or no, you're starting from the bottom like the rest!

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: Aye, aye, whatever you say...

dialogue.name: ALDIS
dialogue.text: It was good seeing you, my friend. Do come and visit again. From now on, you know where to find me.

obj.n: 剛柔のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ
さらなる剣術の高みへ
いつか君が言った言葉

quest.name: ラールガー星導教を継ぐ者として
journal: A concerned Erik has a request for you.

Erik informs you that an Ala Mhigan Resistance soldier had come asking after Widargelt's whereabouts. Fearing that your brother monk may be dragged back on the path of vengeance, the professor bids you seek him out with all haste, and suggests that you try your luck in Ala Gannha.
You do not find Widargelt in Ala Gannha, but it appears he comes often to train the villagers. According to one, the monk had business in Little Ala Mhigo, and you strike out for Thanalan in pursuit.

You arrive in Little Ala Mhigo to find Widargelt standing before a grave─that of Adri, his closest friend turned foe. No sooner do you warn your brother monk that the Resistance is trying to find him than a soldier arrives. Revealed to be a member of Widargelt's old unit, the man invites his former captain to a meeting at Rhalgr's Reach. Widargelt accepts, and asks that you be present for the proceedings.

The meeting proves to be with none other than Lyse. In order to build a unified nation, she requests Widargelt's cooperation as a man of royal blood, but he declines, stating that he wishes to serve Ala Mhigo as a humble monk. Respecting his decision, Lyse instead asks Widargelt to train Resistance soldiers in the way of Fist of Rhalgr, and he happily agrees. At Widargelt's behest, the three of you then pay a visit to the Temple of the Fist. There, Lyse and Widargelt affirm that, though their paths may differ, their goals are one and the same. Satisfied that all is well, you set out back to Ul'dah, where Erik awaits.

Erik is pleased to learn that Widargelt's quest to revive the Fist of Rhalgr is proceeding apace. Thanking you for laying his fears to rest, he declares his intent to observe Widargelt and Lyse as they continue striving towards their goals.
objectives: Gather information on Widargelt in Ala Gannha.
Search for Widargelt in Little Ala Mhigo.
Join Widargelt in Rhalgr's Reach.
Report to Erik at the Goldsmiths' Guild.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename, excellent timing. I have a request to ask of you. Worry not, it is a simple task that shan't overburden your simple mind.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: In no small part due to your valor, Ala Mhigo has won free of imperial tyranny, but something is afoot that gives me cause for concern.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Not long ago, a soldier of the Resistance came asking after Widargelt's whereabouts.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: As you know, the buffoon was once a captain of the Resistance. And he had gathered under him like-minded men and women who burned with an all-consuming hatred for the Empire.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: While the inquiry may have been completely innocuous, we cannot discount the possibility that there are those who burn with hatred still. Who mean to drag Widargelt back on the path of vengeance.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Though the Widargelt as we know him now would not lend such talk an ear, he may not be given a choice. Lest it turn ugly, I want to you to find your brother monk and alert him to the dangers.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The last time we saw Widargelt was in Ala Gannha. If he isn't there still, the villagers may at least be able to direct you to him. Go quickly, Forename.

dialogue.name: SINCEREYOUNGMAN03211
dialogue.text: Wait, aren't you Master Widargelt's master?

dialogue.name: SINCEREYOUNGMAN03211
dialogue.text: Looking for him, you say? He's not here at the moment, but he comes fairly often to train us.

dialogue.name: SINCEREYOUNGMAN03211
dialogue.text: Though he's a hard teacher, he inspires hard work. Thanks to his guidance, I was able to earn my cloth.

dialogue.name: SINCEREYOUNGMAN03211
dialogue.text: Right, his whereabouts. During his last visit, he said that he was going to Little Ala Mhigo next. If you hurry, he might still be there.

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDMAN03211
dialogue.text: <gasp> You're that monk from before! Ahhh, the way you laid the Corpse Brigade low was just glorious!

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDMAN03211
dialogue.text: I wanted to become strong like you, so I went and joined the monkhood. Never once skipped training, I'm proud to say!

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDMAN03211
dialogue.text: Master Widargelt? Last I spoke with him, he mentioned that he was trying to find Theobald.

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDMAN03211
dialogue.text: Fellow disappeared while under the healer's care. Someone saw him staggering out of the village in the early hours. Was headed west, by the sound of it.

dialogue.name: OPTIMISTICMAN03211
dialogue.text: Ah, yes, I remember you, friend. Is there something you need?

dialogue.name: OPTIMISTICMAN03211
dialogue.text: Master Widargelt? He's been traveling around Eorzea, spreading the teachings of the monkhood.

dialogue.name: OPTIMISTICMAN03211
dialogue.text: He comes back to Ala Gannha from time to time to train our people, but I couldn't rightly say when he'll visit next.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: The last time we saw Widargelt was in Ala Gannha. If he isn't there still, the villagers may at least be able to direct you to him. Go quickly, Forename.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Oh, Master Widargelt...

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Gah, wish I knew what to say at times like this...

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename... I did not expect to see you here.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: This grave. Know you who lies here?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It is the man who called himself Theobald. My closest brother, Adri.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: We had brought him to Ala Gannha for healing. But he fled in spite of his wounds. He looked like a hunted man. So do witnesses say.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I do not believe that. Adri was not one to flee. He had used the Corpse Brigade. He knew they would come for him. Rather than wait, he went to them. And now he is gone.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I wanted him to live. To stand at my side again. I...I should have done more.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: You tried your best to have him see the light, like you did for us.

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Aye. You mustn't be so hard on yourself.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Much has happened with you too, sisterbrother. That much is plain. Come, let me hear your tale.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you talk about?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Lue-Reeq.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A hunter who found his path.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: ...So Lue-Reeq chose to sever ties with his kin.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A resolve to which I can relate. I, too, chose my own path. Spurned blood in favor of faith.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Your part in this tale impresses me also. To do battle in a world flooded with light... Yet again I am reminded of your greatness.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Ah, but my apologies. You have traveled far. Is there something you require?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A soldier of the Resistance seeks me? What could his purpose be?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: You don't suppose they're coming after those of Theodoric's line?

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: It seems to me the Resistance would be above such acts. Yet I can offer no alternate explanation.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEWARRIOR03211
dialogue.text: (-???-)Captain! It has been a while, sir!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You... It has been a while indeed. But I am no one's captain. I have long left the Resistance.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEWARRIOR03211
dialogue.text: Forgive me, sir, but old habits. It's hard to regard you as anything save my esteemed captain.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEWARRIOR03211
dialogue.text: But if that is not your preference─Master Widargelt, may I ask you to accompany me to Rhalgr's Reach? There is a matter we wish to discuss with you.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Is that so?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Very well, then. Lead the way.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: D'zentsa, O'tchakha, please wait here. I will return anon.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename, may I ask you to join me?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: You are well regarded in the Resistance. Your presence would give me heart.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCEWARRIOR03211
dialogue.text: Without further ado, then, let us be away.

dialogue.name: SINCEREYOUNGMAN03211
dialogue.text: During his last visit, Master Widargelt said that he was going to Little Ala Mhigo next. If you hurry, he might still be there.

dialogue.name: DIGNIFIEDMAN03211
dialogue.text: Master Widargelt was trying to find Theobald. Fellow disappeared while under the healer's care. Someone saw him staggering out of the village in the early hours, heading west.

dialogue.name: OPTIMISTICMAN03211
dialogue.text: Master Widargelt's been traveling around Eorzea, spreading the teachings of the monkhood.

dialogue.name: OPTIMISTICMAN03211
dialogue.text: He comes back to Ala Gannha from time to time to train our people, but I couldn't rightly say when he'll visit next.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: (-???-)Sorry for keeping you!

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I'm Lyse Hext of the Ala Mhigan Resistance. Thank you for coming all this way.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Forename!? Don't tell me you know Master Widargelt!?

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename is a dear comrade. I owe herhim much and more.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Well, that makes it easier, then! To get right to the heart of the matter, Master Widargelt, we wish to invite you to rejoin the Resistance.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Under the mad king and then the Garleans, the people of Ala Mhigo lived in crippling fear and mutual mistrust.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: In rebuilding the nation, we want to create a place where folk can believe in and support one another. A place where everyone is regarded as a friend.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Even those who are kin to the mad king?

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: We should've reached out to you earlier, I know. But we feared that doing so would incite those who plotted a return to the old rule.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: It's quite all right, Commander. I know your intent is good and true.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: However, I cannot rejoin the Resistance. I would serve my nation as a humble monk. This I have sworn to myself.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: A man named Theodred never existed. There was ever only Widargelt. And he wishes to restore that which was once lost. The teachings of the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I see... Then you must do what your heart tells you.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Let's try this again. I put this request to Widargelt of the Fist of Rhalgr.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I want you to train the soldiers of the Resistance. Though we've won our freedom, we must be prepared to fight to keep it, and I believe that your techniques would serve us well.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I've never trained properly myself, and for what it's worth I'm very keen to learn.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: And I should be honored to teach.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Great! We're in your debt!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: If I might make a request of my own... May I visit the Temple of the Fist? I would pay my respects.

dialogue.name: LYSE
