dialogue.text: Of course! You hardly need my permission for that.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Come on, Forename, let's all go together.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Being here brings back memories. I remember the high priests. My brother and sister monks. All of them gone now. In fire and smoke.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: But you survived, like the temple's stout stones. And thanks to your efforts, the faith has begun to rise from the ashes.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Not my efforts alone. All I have achieved, I owe to many others. Professor Erik. D'zentsa and O'tchakha. And not least of all, Forename.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: I couldn't have come this far on my own either. Like you, I had dear comrades to prop me up and push me forward.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: And I'll never stop forging on─for Ala Mhigo!

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Our paths may differ. But our goals are one and the same. There is no more need for words.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: Forename, the professor worries for me. Please return to him. Let him know that all is well.

dialogue.name: WIDARGELT
dialogue.text: I was instructed to wait here. What could it be that they wish to discuss...?

dialogue.name: DZENTSA
dialogue.text: Hold the fort, D'zentsa. Never do anything fun, D'zentsa.

dialogue.name: OTCHAKHA
dialogue.text: Please take care of Master Widargelt.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned. Were you able to find Widargelt?

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: I see. I'm pleased to hear that his effort to revive the Fist of Rhalgr proceeds apace. Of course, it will still take considerable time for the faith to take root across the land, but Widargelt is young and determined. The day will come when he realizes his dream.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: But to think that it was none other than Curtis Hext's daughter that sought him out...

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: A woman who embraces her lineage and a man who rejects his... Viewed thus, their paths could not be more different, but as they have discovered, their goals are one and the same. Ala Mhigo is stronger for their cooperation.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: In any case, it appears my concerns were unfounded. My thanks for laying my fears to rest.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: For a while, though, I believe I will observe these two souls in their future endeavors.

dialogue.name: ERIK
dialogue.text: After all, I am nothing if not observant.

obj.n: 天眼のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ

quest.name: 戦士の帰還
journal: Curious Gorge is training here, but his mind is elsewhere.

Curious Gorge has been training as hard as ever and has indeed grown stronger for it, yet upon seeing you for the first time in an age, he immediately recognizes that you have grown stronger still. After you regale him with tales of your adventures in the First, particularly those of Granson and Dikaiosyne, he concludes that the reason for his limited growth is love─or rather, that he has been unable to put it out of his mind. Curious Gorge has sent many missives to Dorgono in the Far East, but has yet to receive even a single reply, and so he resolves to go and see her in person...and thus is not present when Dorgono and her father Luvsan arrive moments later, having recently come all the way from the Azim Steppe to thank in person all those who aided the Qerel. Since Curious Gorge is nowhere to be found, you are to proceed to the Moraby Drydocks where Broken Mountain and his warriors can be found.

During the course of their conversation, Broken Mountain admits to Luvsan that he does not carry an axe because he can no longer fight. However, the elder Xaela does not believe all hope is lost, and proposes a treatment that may restore him to fighting condition. A certain type of moss will be necessary for this, and Luvsan believes he saw a suitable substitute on the way to the docks.

The moss in question can be found growing on boulders strewn throughout the general vicinity, and Luvsan bids you gather it by first shattering them with a Heavy Swing, which should render it easier to collect. If nothing else, it is inarguably a more dramatic way of gathering moss than gently scraping it off.
You succeed in gathering the moss in the distinct warrior fashion. Luvsan should be satisfied with the quantity in your possession.

Taking advantage of your privacy, Luvsan confesses that he had an ulterior motive for coming to Eorzea: to confirm his suspicions that his daughter had fallen in love with a warrior of the West. After meeting you, he concludes that you are the suitor in question, and offers to bless your union─at which point Dorgono returns and puts an end to the discussion for the time being.

With all gathered for the ritual, Luvsan offers an elixir to Broken Mountain, who drinks deep. Finally, he instructs you to strike the injured warrior with all your might, assuring you both that it is the only way. Though Broken Mountain is understandably uncomfortable with this proposal, the die is cast, and only a Heavy Swing will suffice.

Broken Mountain weathers your assault, and moments later finds himself filled with newfound strength. He is a warrior reborn, and the beast within is his to command. As all celebrate his successful recovery, Curious Gorge approaches─but observing from afar, mistakes Dorgono's joyful smile as an expression of her love towards you, leading him to succumb to his inner beast and charge. Fortunately, before it turns into a needlessly messy and violent affair, she brings him to his senses with a single blow.

After Curious Gorge recovers, he apologizes for the misunderstanding, and joins in celebrating his brother's miraculous recovery. Sensing that this is the Western suitor, Luvsan silently approves, and declares that it is time to return to the Steppe─alone. Dorgono, however, is to remain in Eorzea, where she will continue to hone her skills until she is a warrior fit to be wed. Needless to say, both she and Curious Gorge are more than satisfied with this state of affairs, and together they return to Hidden Falls to begin their training together.

Curious Gorge reminds you not to grow complacent in your own efforts to grow stronger still, for with Broken Mountain healed and Dorgono in Eorzea for the time being, your competition for the title of the realm's greatest warrior has grown that much more intense. And indeed, the day may come when one of the three will dethrone you...but not yet.
objectives: Speak with Broken Mountain in lower La Noscea.
Speak with Luvsan.
Use Heavy Swing on mossy boulders to obtain shivermoss.
Deliver the shivermoss to Luvsan.
Speak with Luvsan.
Use Heavy Swing on Broken Mountain.
Speak with Curious Gorge in eastern La Noscea.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Oh, Forename...how long has it been? I've been dedicating myself wholly to my training for some time now, day after day after day, but I fear my progress has come to a halt of late.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You look well. A fair bit stronger than I remember, even. What is your secret, my friend? How have you grown so much more powerful?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: So I got sucked into this portal and traveled to another world...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I went toe-to-toe with this fellow called Dikaiosyne...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Wait, wait─ I can tell this is going to take a while. Since I've just finished my training, why don't we speak at length on dry land?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: So there are more worlds than this, eh? That's a lot to take in... And this Granson, ye gods. To see the woman you love taken from you before your very eyes... <sniffle> No wonder he struggled so mightily to pick up the pieces of his life...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: After listening to your tale, I realize what it is I've been missing. The one thing I lack to spur me to even greater heights!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: 'Tis love!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I sent several missives to Dorgono, you see, but she has yet to respond even once! I've waited patiently, eagerly, but still! Still no word has arrived!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Fear has crept into my heart. Has she forgotten me? Has she met another!?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I cannot rest until I know the reason for her delay! I must know! This is no time for training!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Nor can I afford to be patient. Granson's time with his beloved was cut short─who is to say ours will not be as well? Or worse, if it already has...

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: It is decided! I will purchase passage on the next ship for the Far East and return to the Azim Steppe with all haste! I'm coming, Dorgono!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Forename, how fortunate you are here! I have been looking all over for Curious Gorge. The Marauders' Guild told me he trained near here, but I did not know you did as well!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: What do you mean he's going to the Steppe to see me because I never answered any of his missives? Is this a joke?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: No matter how many he sent, I would have never responded. Our people have no written tongue. Whatever reached us was probably fed to the goats. Anyway─let us hope that someone informs him of our arrival before he gets on a ship...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: As for why I have traveled all this way, it was at the behest of my father, who wished to thank you and Curious Gorge personally for fighting on our behalf.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: I am Luvsan of the Qerel, and you are Forename Surname─the khagan who stood with my people against the Chaghan.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: But that is not all, for you also helped my youngest daughter gain control over the will of Karash. No words can express the depth of my gratitude to you.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: You promised not to speak of Karash...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: But I must. My heart broke when she was marked as Taken and exiled. Never again would I see her, I feared. But then she returned! Blood of my blood, master of Karash! My little girl...and it is all because of you.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: In thanks for your deeds, I wish to present to you thirty horses─

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Father, no! It is not the way of Eorzea to give horses as thanks! And besides, shehe is a traveler! They would only be a burden!

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: I apologize, khagan. Now then─I must also express my gratitude to the others. Warriors of the Maelstrom, were they? I believe I recall the way...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: If you have the time to spare, might you accompany us? Having traveled so long solely in the company of my father, I am finding him increasingly exhausting...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Well do I know how difficult my daughter can be, and so I wish to present you with a gift as an expression of my gratitude. I am told you would have no use for horses, but what about fifty goats?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: It brings me joy to see the Lominsan warriors in good health!

dialogue.name: WARRIOR02902
dialogue.text: Gorge's got good taste, aye. If it weren't for him, I'd have a mind to...er...give a polite and wholly appropriate compliment and be on my way.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It is a pleasure to see you again, Forename, as well as Dorgono. I am surprised to see her as you doubtless are, and in the company of her father besides...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: ...I must insist that you accept a small token of my appreciation. I do not doubt my daughter was quite the handful. No less than fifty goats, I think, should suffice for the imposition─

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Fifty goats would be a far greater imposition, Father!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: It really was no bother, sir. A pleasure, honestly─and a regrettably short one at that. So much so that we were hoping we might see her again, so you can imagine our surprise and our delight when you arrived.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: If not horses or goats, then... Wait. Are you not the leaders of these warriors? Yet you do not carry an axe. Why is this?

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: That is...that is because I cannot. Not since I was defeated by mine own brother in battle. He had succumbed to his inner beast─your Karash─and struck a blow with such ferocity from which I have never fully recovered.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: But it is well that he did, for I too was in thrall to the beast at the time. Had he not given it his all, countless innocents may have died by my hand...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: It is not an unfamiliar story. Many a Qerel has suffered a grievous injury which rendered them unable to fight.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: But I am a boo─a healer, and I can help you to wield your axe once more.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: This is in your power? I...I did not think it was possible!

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: It pains me to see a warrior who yet yearns to fight but cannot. Allow me to treat you as repayment for your kindness.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Full glad am I to accept! Thank you, sir, thank you...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: This treatment requires a quantity of shivermoss. While it is not native to your land, I believe a similar type grows here. Let us go and gather some.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: You lot return to your training for now.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I don't know about you, Forename, but I'm bloody excited!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Do you have any siblings, khagan? I am youngest of eighteen myself...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: The moss of which I spoke I spied in this place not long ago. We will need a moderate amount for the ritual to heal Broken Mountain. You and Dorgono can both assist me in this.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Look for mossy rocks nearby and shatter them with a Heavy Swing, then gather up the shivermoss.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Ah, I remember this game! The marauders were always breaking rocks to hone their skills. This will be easy!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Use Heavy Swing on mossy boulders to obtain shivermoss.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: To be fair, you need not actually shatter the rocks to gather the moss, but it hastens the process and makes a somewhat dull process a little more entertaining, do you not think?

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: You wield your axe with great skill, khagan. May I have the shivermoss?

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Very good. Now, before my daughter returns, there is one other matter which I must discuss with you.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: She is a woman grown, and as her father I must think of her future. Of marriage.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Alas, she has shown no interest in any warriors of the Qerel. At first I thought none suited her, but then I began to wonder...was her mind made up? Had she already chosen a suitor?

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Realizing this, I persuaded her to come with me to Eorzea. And now that we have met, I feel more certain than ever. Dorgono has fallen in love with a warrior of another land...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: ...And I could not be happier for her. For who could disapprove of the champion who stood against the Chaghan?

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Forename Surname, khagan of the Steppe, I will not oppose the union of you and Dorgono. I offer you my blessing.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: My heart belongs to the sea.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Did I mention I'm eternally bonded to someone else?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Honestly I'm not all that keen on the whole institution of marriage...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: So there's this bloke called Gorge...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Don't mind if I do!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Hey! HEY! Who are you to decide such things for me!?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I will not marry Forename! I have already chosen a suitor, and it is not herhim!

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Oh! I see... I was so certain that... Ahem. So...who is this other...?

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: We will not discuss this any further! We have the moss, now let us go and prepare for the ritual!

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Pray forgive me, khagan. I spoke out of turn. Dorgono is right─we should attend to the ritual and restore Broken Mountain to the warrior he was.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: I'm so sorry he spoke to you like that. It is a bad habit of his, meddling in affairs that are not his concern...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I know not what sort of ritual this is. Do you? The traditions of the Qerel are a complete and utter mystery to me...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: I have brewed an elixir using the moss. Drink it now.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Very good. Your body is ready. You must now receive of the power of another great warrior. I can think of none more suitable than you, khagan.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: We must awaken the Karash within him once more. I bid you summon the strength of Father Azim and strike Broken Mountain with all your might!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: You bid herhim what now!?

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: All your might! Hold nothing back! Swing to kill! Anything less and he will be crippled worse or die!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Muster all your strength and attack Broken Mountain with a Heavy Swing.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Do not hesitate, khagan! Strike him down as you would your most hated enemy, else this treatment will end in failure.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Do it, Forename! Do it!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: This seems like the exact opposite of what would benefit me...

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Ugh!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Seven hells, what is this...this feeling I feel welling up from deep within? This fire, this passion...this rage!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: The beast stirs again! Its power is mine! It fills me with strength, yet I remain in control! Huzzah!

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: The strength never left you, my friend. The injury was not one of the flesh, but of the heart. Trickery of the mind, a deception of the self.

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: The elixir served only to steel your flesh and dull the pain, so you could stand fast against the khagan's axe. You will not need it again, for the fear that held you hostage has fled.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: I see... It was in my head all this time. It's no secret that fear can cripple a man worse than any wound, but I never thought... Gods, what a fool I've been.

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Thank you so much for helping me to overcome my foolishness, Luvsan. You've made me a warrior again!

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: Thank herhim, for a warrior of surpassing strength and power is indispensable for this ritual. No other could have served as well.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Aye, for there is no greater warrior than Forename!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: How could you, Forename...? You and Dorgono, all this time... It all makes sense now. The letters, the silence. It was you...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Curious Gorge, what is this nonsense you speak? What's gotten into you?

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Graaaghhh! Gaaarrrghhh!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Oh no you don't, you stupid fool!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I am so sorry, everyone. When I went to the docks to find a ship bound for the Far East, I ran into some marauders who told me Dorgono and her father had come.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: So overcome by joy I began searching for them at once, but when I finally found you here, and saw how you looked on Forename with such joy, all my earlier fears came rushing back, and the beast within me seized control...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: It had better not happen again! You're lucky I held back. Next time I won't!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: And Brother! Is it true that you have fully recovered? You are a warrior reborn? Congratulations! It is like a dream come true!

dialogue.name: BROKENMOUNTAIN
dialogue.text: Indeed, Brother, indeed! At first I struggled to believe it, but it is as Luvsan says! I must go and join in the training sessions at once. And do not fear─the beast will not claim me again!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I cannot thank you enough, Luvsan. It has been longer than I can remember since my brother smiled so. You've given us such a gift...

dialogue.name: LUVSAN
dialogue.text: It is the least I could do after all you have done for my daughter. Thank you for your kindness and your hospitality. Our time is short, however, and we must be on our way...

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Having said that... Dorgono. I am reminded that you are still young and want for experience. You are not yet a warrior fit to wed, and so I bid you continue to strengthen your body and mind here, in this land. It suits you, I think.

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Did you hear that? I can stay! We can even train together─I can show you all the techniques we Qerel use to hone our skills!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: Aye, but first I must teach you my methods! You must come with me to Hidden Falls, right this instant!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: You too, Forename! I've a few final words I wish to say to you there.

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: I trust you understand what all this means, my friend. Now that my brother has taken up the axe again, the competition for the title of Eorzea's greatest warrior will be that much more intense!

dialogue.name: DORGONO
dialogue.text: Don't forget I'm in the running too, you know!

dialogue.name: CURIOUSGORGE
dialogue.text: So keep at it, warrior, for the time will come when we challenge you again!

obj.n: 剛柔のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ
いつか君が言った言葉

quest.name: 漆黒の竜に捧ぐ
journal: Alberic is keen to hear of your adventures.

You find Alberic trying to keep warm at the Observatorium, and he welcomes the chance to exchange stories with his former student. Upon mention of Orn Khai, the young dragon himself appears, joining the conversation and listening eagerly as you regale him with your adventures in the First. Your account of Andreia's demise brings to mind the tale of Nidhogg, as he too was driven only by memories of a time long since passed. Orn Khai expresses his profound sorrow that no one would mourn the passing of the mighty wyrm, and suggests consulting Faunehm to learn more of the fallen Nidhogg.

Faunehm answers Orn Khai's call and gladly shares her memories of her sire, Nidhogg. You learn that King Thordan had invited Ratatoskr to speak on behalf of all dragons. When he asked her to recount Nidhogg's views on mankind, she stated her beloved's thoughts on the matter, in particular that their mortal frailty made them unfit for the role of Hydaelyn's guardian. Upon hearing these words, Thordan was filled with rage and slaughtered Ratatoskr, which drove Nidhogg into madness and sparked the Dragonsong War. After concluding her account of these historic events, Faunehm advises that you commemorate him by offering a flower for which he had a particular affinity, the mist lily, at the site of his passing. Orn Khai believes that they can be found growing in Ohl Tahn and wastes not a moment in flying off to gather the elusive bloom.
The flowers you seek grow in the most unlikely of places, peeking out between the cracks of a stark rocky outcrop. Orn Khai will be pleased to hear that the search is over.

Orn Khai is delighted that you were able to find the mist lilies and is eager to offer them in memorial of Nidhogg. Since his eyes were used to summon Shinryu, which you defeated in Gyr Abania, this could be considered his final resting place.

You and Orn Khai arrive at the Royal Menagerie to pay your respects to Nidhogg. As you reflect on past encounters with the wyrm, your mind is cast back to the days spent as an Azure Dragoon, fighting alongside Estinien. Satisfied that the memory of the wyrm's memory has been honored, Orn Khai asks that you share Faunehm's tale with Alberic.

Back at the Observatorium, Alberic is intrigued to hear such a detailed account of King Thordan's betrayal. He plans to impart this newly revealed information to the Temple Knights, as he is a firm believer that matters of historical accuracy are of the utmost importance in building peaceful relations between man and dragon. Though the road ahead will not be an easy one, your friendship with Orn Khai will serve as a shining example that trust and cooperation are possible between your races, and that even former enemies need not be beholden to the past.
objectives: Speak with Orn Khai in Zenith.
Search for mist lilies.
Speak with Orn Khai.
Speak with Orn Khai in Gyr Abania.
Speak with Alberic at the Observatorium.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. It has been too long since last we spoke.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Your visits are far more frequent than those of another former student of mine, however. It would seem he still prefers to keep his own company.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: The same could be said of Heustienne, who has made quite the name for herself as a hunter in Dravania, according to Orn Khai.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Ah, what fortunate timing! Speak of the dragon and he shall appear.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Greetings! Would I be correct in guessing you have returned fresh from one of your adventures?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I traveled to a world beyond our own.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I laid to rest the dreaded Andreia in a land known as Norvrandt.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: To think that such a place could truly exist!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: And that you have fought such terrifying foes. To fall so far from grace... 'Tis a tragic tale, if ever I heard one.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: One similar to that of Nidhogg.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Aye, though nothing will ever compare to his malice. Even death could not quell his thirst for vengeance.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: At least Andreia was not nearly so consumed by hate. I doubt not that Renda-Rae's soul is at peace.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Peace... I wonder if Nidhogg ever found it...

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I fear his soul yet lingers, doomed to wander endlessly.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: That is too cruel a fate, even for him!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I share your sentiments. For as the Azure Dragoon, I once gazed into his heart, as he gazed into mine. Such rage... Such sorrow...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I will not accept this! That none should mark his passing is more than I can bear. What say you, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Perhaps we could honor who he once was, if not what he became.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I, too, was an Azure Dragoon. Alberic speaks true.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Then we are in agreement!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Though I must admit that as part of Hraesvelgr's brood, I have little knowledge of Nidhogg.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: A deeper insight is needed if I am to properly pay my respects.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Hmm... Faunehm is of his brood. If anyone would know, it is her. Let us make haste for Zenith!

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: For better or worse, I am who I am because of Nidhogg. While others rejoiced at his death, I cannot deny that a part of myself died that day.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Faunehm is come.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Welcome, noble dragoon. Orn Khai has explained all.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Pray tell, what was Nidhogg to you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A relentless adversary.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: The wellspring of my strength.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: And much more. For through his power, you are forever joined.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: And yet you were enemies, each sworn to slay the other.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Two souls, entwined by fate.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Though you have faced Nidhogg's wrath and sensed his pain, you cannot know him as we dragons once did.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: We would fain hear his tale.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Nidhogg was without equal, even among our kind.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Destined was he to guard this world from the catastrophe that befell the Dragonstar, in place of his sire.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Destined was he to guard this world from catastrophe, in place of his sire.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: He valued strength above all else, and considered the affairs of mortals beneath his notice.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Only the seven great wyrms were worthy of his attention. And among them, none but Ratatoskr truly understood him.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Her song was beautiful indeed, and she graced both dragon and man with her wisdom.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: She was invited by Thordan, king of men, to speak on our behalf. Ratatoskr expressed our desire to live in harmony. However, it was known that Nidhogg did not share these views.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: When the king asked her how her brother saw mankind, she did not hide the truth. He believed that such frail creatures were incapable of protecting this star, that the task must be entrusted to the seven great wyrms alone.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: And that is why Thordan slew her!?

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Ratatoskr had no intention of sowing discord, but the king could not countenance that his kind would be treated with such contempt, that we dragons would seek to claim this star as our own.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: He turned on Ratatoskr, taking not only her eyes, but her life.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: When Nidhogg discovered that King Thordan had murdered his beloved, his fury was beyond reckoning.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: For all his strength, he could not master his own rage. It utterly consumed him.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Dragons, men─we are all the same. Slaves to our emotion, subservient to our hearts.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Yet there are those who would seek another path, as I once did. I turned my back on my father and his quest for vengeance.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Valiant dragoon, by your strength was the Dragonsong War ended, and by your compassion was a new alliance forged.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Forename and I are living proof that we can live side by side. We shall speak the message of peace to man and dragon alike. And when we are gone, our descendants will do the same!

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Tell them of Nidhogg. His strength, his weakness, his love, his hate. Tell them the truth.

dialogue.name: FAUNEHM
dialogue.text: Orn Khai, you wish to commemorate Nidhogg's passing, yes? As my father once enjoyed the fragrance of mist lilies, perhaps they would make a suitable offering.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: What a splendid idea! Thank you, Faunehm!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I have often seen such flowers blooming in Ohl Tahn. Follow me!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I distinctly recall seeing mist lilies in this very spot. What could have happened to them?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: So there were mist lilies here after all? Then it would appear my memory served me correctly. A pity that the same cannot be said of my eyes...

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: It is of no matter. There is one thing that concerns me, however. In your funerary rites, the offering of flowers and such occurs at a grave or place of significance, I believe. But where should we choose for Nidhogg?

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Gyr Abania... Yes, that could be considered his final resting place, if that was where you fought the primal born of his eyes.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Although I must say, Forename, you seem rather adept at putting down dragons. And primals that resemble dragons. It makes me glad that we are not enemies!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Ahem. To matters at hand, then. I shall go on ahead and meet you in Gyr Abania.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: What a relief to have found you at last! I had become rather lost, you see.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Perhaps we had best hurry on to the Royal Menagerie before I lose my way again.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Nidhogg, we are come to honor your memory!

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Though now that we are here, I am at a loss for words... Forename, is there anything you wish to say?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You will be remembered.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Your legacy will live on in the songs of your people.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: From distant star, a Father bore seven eggs. Great wyrms rose forth, powerful and wise. On blackened wings, one soared on high with a roar that set the world atremble. Guarding their home in the Father's stead, he was fearsome yet just.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Man, wicked and vain, betrayed the wyrm and his kin, slaying his beloved and plucking out his eyes. Thenceforth, he lived only for vengeance, his wrath irrepressible.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A thousand years hence, two champions of mankind were granted great strength by the stolen eyes. Destined were they to face the wyrm, who had risen once more to wage war on his sworn enemy. At the end of their struggle, the wayward son fell silent.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These guardians and their comrades continue to watch over the star, their heroic deeds recounted by minstrels and storytellers far and wide. Even the ancient foe from which the Father of Dragons once fled could not withstand their might.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These guardians continue to watch over the star, their heroic deeds recounted by minstrels and storytellers far and wide.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Forename, I am not blind to the sins Nidhogg committed. I mourn the loss of what he once was, what he may have become had he been dealt a kinder fate.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: Although this was but a small gesture, I am sure that our thoughts have reached him.

dialogue.name: ORNKHAI
dialogue.text: I have much to ponder on the return journey, and I expect that Alberic will wish to hear what we have learned from Faunehm. Perhaps you could visit him in Coerthas?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Were you able to pay your respects?

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: I see... This is the first time I have heard such a detailed account of King Thordan's acts. A betrayal in the moment, but a betrayal nonetheless. A pity he is far beyond the reach of justice.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Though it may be hard to come to terms with the crimes of our forebears, we must accept the past for what it is.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: Of course, I shall be sharing this information with the rest of the Temple Knights. No doubt they will be keen to speak with other members of Nidhogg's brood to verify this version of events.

dialogue.name: ALBERIC
dialogue.text: In the meantime, there is still much to be done in building relations between man and dragon. We will aim to follow the example set by you and Orn Khai, and work together for the good of all. May the Fury guide you both.

obj.n: 天眼のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ

quest.name: 蒼天に響く三重奏
journal: Jehantel is at once jubilant and relieved to see you.

The rumors of your recent trials have had Jehantel worried for you, and apparently he isn't the only one. The old bard invites you to accompany him to New Gridania, there to meet your friend Captain Sanson Smyth and set his mind at ease.

After expressing his delight at seeing you again, Sanson informs you that he and his unit also took to battle at the Ghimlyt Dark. However, the relatively inexperienced bards struggled with their songs when they were hard-pressed. With Guydelot unwilling to instruct his juniors, Jehantel suggests that the two of you put on a performance for them, that they might experience a song brimming with heart. It is decided that Guydelot will also take part, and you set out to find him in Nine Ivies in the East Shroud.

According to Pukno Poki, Guydelot has ventured deep into the woods. Believing that the willful bard is most likely to respond to you, Jehantel bids you call out to him. With the chat mode in Say, enter “Guydelot” to yell out to your comrade at the designated location in Nine Ivies.

You yell out Guydelot's name at the top of your lungs, but the only response is silence. Perhaps you should try again deeper in the woods. With the chat mode in Say, enter “Guydelot” to yell out to your comrade at the designated location in Nine Ivies.

At last, Guydelot reveals himself, and you inform him of the performance. The bard agrees on account of the rare opportunity to perform with you, and the stage is set for the Sea of Clouds. Sanson instructs you to gather at the airship landing in Gridania while he seeks his superiors' permission to use a vessel.

With the airship secured, your party sets out for the Sea of Clouds, to the place where your journey for the Ballad of Oblivion reached its end. With the heavens as your backdrop, you give a heartfelt performance of a piece written by Jehantel and inspired by your own adventures. The song moves your small audience nigh to tears, helping the recruits to understand that which is most important to a bard. Its lesson also moves Sanson to try to better understand Guydelot, and he convinces his friend to guide his juniors in his own time.

Back at the airship landing, Sanson reiterates his desire to help his men become the best bards they can be, before running off in pursuit of the ever free-spirited Guydelot. This leaves you alone with Jehantel, who thanks you for the sublime experience of performing with you. The song, born of your collaboration, woke memories of the passion he had in his youth. And generations hence, your erstwhile mentor believes, it will still be sung, awakening passion in countless more souls.
objectives: Speak with Sanson in Gridania.
Speak with Jehantel in the East Shroud.
With the chat mode in Say, enter “Guydelot” to call out to your comrade.
Speak with Sanson at the airship landing in Gridania.
Speak with Sanson.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Ah, young one, full glad am I to see you hale and whole. The rumors from the front lines had me quite worried.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I would commemorate this happy reunion with a verse, but there is someone who has worried for you even more than I.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I speak, of course, of your comrade Sanson. It would do him well to see you again. If you can spare the time, perhaps we can pay him visit in Gridania together.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It would do Sanson well to see you again. If you can spare the time, let us pay him visit in Gridania together.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Lest you wonder, those men are Sanson's bards─and my former pupils.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Forename, praise the Matron you're safe! I've been beside myself with worry ever since I heard of your mysterious disappearance after Ghimlyt!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We fought the Empire too, my unit and I. Never had I experienced such a bloody battle.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: You have done well to return to us, all of you.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: We owe our survival in no small part to Guydelot. His song spurred all whom it reached on the battlefield, turning the tide on countless occasions.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: For his valorous service, he was awarded a medal from the Alliance. Not that he was ever interested in such trinkets, of course.

dialogue.name: NOVICEBARD03214
dialogue.text: (-Novice Bard-)Lieutenant Guydelot was an inspiration to us all. But us... We may as well not have been present, for all the good we did...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: May I introduce to you our recruits, Forename. They are...disappointed with their showing at Ghimlyt.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: To be sure, they did not shame themselves─far from it. But in moments when we were hard-pressed, their songs faltered and lost power.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I see. As you know, our songs are given power through our fervent desire to aid our comrades.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I do not think that you lacked this desire. It was simply overwhelmed by the terror of being confronted with death.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: In his capacity as their senior, I had wanted Guydelot to train them. But no matter how many times I asked him─nay, commanded─he refuses to do so, saying that their songs do not have heart...

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Is that what he said?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Not to discourage you all, but there may be truth to Guydelot's words.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Remember─if a song is to touch the heart, it must needs have heart. Without it, not even an expertly performed anthem can hope to inspire.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: I believe it would behoove you to experience an exemplar of our songs. And most conveniently, we have an exemplar of our art here with us.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Forename, will you not play for them?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Allow me to beseech you as well, my friend. Guydelot and I have spoken highly of your deeds to the recruits. It would be no exaggeration to say that they idolize you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Rest assured you won't perform alone. My harp shall join yours for a duet awash with heart.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I am truly grateful. Yet if I may be particular, we should have Guydelot participate as well. It is his duty to train them, after all.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: And besides...I believe he would relish the chance to perform with the two of you.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Very well, a trio it is! Pukno Poki mentioned catching sight of Guydelot in the East Shroud. Let us see if we can find him there.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The recruits? They're waiting in Gridania, lest they scare Guydelot away with the prospect of having to teach them.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: Long time no see! You haven't forgotten me, I hope? After all, I'm the one who discovered your talents, kupo!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It appears Guydelot was here but recently.

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: That's right, kupo! He went deeper into the woods, saying, “That Sanson nags like a bloody fishwife!”

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Guydelot respects you more than anyone, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Were you to call to him, I daresay he will answer.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Do I really nag like a fishwife...?

dialogue.name: PUKNOPOKI
dialogue.text: The more things change, the more Guydelot stays the same, kupo!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: If you were to call out to Guydelot, I daresay he will answer. Go on and try, Forename.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter “Guydelot” to call out to your comrade.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Guydelot does not appear to be in the area. Perhaps you should venture deeper into the wood.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: With the chat mode in Say, use your keyboard or the software keyboard to enter “Guydelot” to call out to your comrade.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)Well, well, look who it is.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: What brings you here, Forename? Not some tiresome errand, I hope?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A tiresome errand.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: An invitation to perform.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: I bloody knew it... But I can't say no to you, now can I? What's this errand, then?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Hah, I've been waiting forever for you to ask me that! So, what's the occasion?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Ugh, so Sanson and Jehantel put you up to it. I should've known...

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Those recruits are as stiff as their captain and I don't have any hopes for them...but all right, I'll do it. Anything's worth the chance to perform with you, Forename.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot, there you are!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I take it Forename has apprised you of the performance.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Aye, and I expect no less than the finest venue for this distinguished gathering. You'll secure such a place for us, right, Chief?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: You may depend on it. I myself want the very best for the performance.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Do any locations come to mind?

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: The recruits have shown great interest in our expedition to find the Ballad of Oblivion.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: In light of this, I believe there is no place more fitting than the Sea of Clouds. The view alone would take their breath away.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Sounds good to me! Let's get moving!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Very well, I will go and secure an airship for us. Please gather at the airship landing.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Bugger me, but I'm starting to get excited!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Heh heh, I can't rightly recall when last I felt so enthused for a performance.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: My superiors raised their eyebrows when I mentioned another journey to the Sea of Clouds, but I managed to win them over with the prospect of another song of power. We have our airship.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: If everyone is ready, let us be away. The recruits have already boarded, keen as they are. And who wouldn't be keen for the coming performance?

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: So, what's the plan? What're we going to play to this azure backdrop?

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Well, seeing as we have a vaunted hero with us, I had a mind to draw inspiration from herhis adventures for a new piece.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: That's a great idea, old man! Forename's stories would make for a bloody fine song!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Our recruits yet have limited experience lifting up their comrades in battle. A song that conveys the importance of camaraderie, that sows the seeds of the desire to inspire─such would be ideal, I believe.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What should the song be about?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: A young man who chased after a legend.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: A forgotten hero who avenged her comrades.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: An intrepid soul who faced a mighty foe, staunch comrades in tow... Aye, this is a rousing tale, worthy of being immortalized in song. Why, already the themes and emotions weave themselves into melody and verse in my mind.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Come, my friends! Let us lift our voices together in heartfelt harmony!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
O wayward son, you left hearth and home,
To write your own tale and live on in tomes.♪
Guided by a legend, a hero fallen from grace,
Onward you forged, resolve writ on your face.♪

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
O wayward son, you embarked upon your quest,
At your side a comrade to aid you in the test.♪
But even with this hero serving as your sword,
Hubris was your enemy, estrangement your reward.♪

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
O wayward son, you cast away your pride,
Shedding with the past that had shackled you inside.♪
To the truth before you, you opened up your eyes,
To finally see where your duty truly lies.♪

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
O huntress brave, for vengeance you did cry,
For comrades slain in a hunt gone awry.♪
In your breast a raging storm, impossible to quell,
Save by consigning the beast to the depths of hell.♪

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
O huntress brave, your quarry you did chase,
Though it meant forsaking your newfound place.♪
By your own hands you wished the deed fulfilled,
That the storm within may finally be stilled.♪

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text:
O huntress brave, a decision you did make,
Your hopes and dreams, on friendship you would stake.♪
Laying bare your heart, you set yourself free,
To give your all to others, that the world may ever be.♪

dialogue.name: NOVICEBARD03214
dialogue.text: By the gods... So this is what it means to perform with all your heart...

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: That was moving beyond words. I felt the lesson of the song with my whole being─the lesson that our understanding for one another is what opens the way forward.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Understanding... To think on it, I may have been too insistent in trying to press our recruits onto Guydelot. I didn't try to understand his feelings.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot, this isn't an order, but a humble request. I ask not that you train our recruits, but that you simply get to know them. Through this, you'll come to understand each other's hearts─and forge a bond that will lend power to your songs.

dialogue.name: NOVICEBARD03214
dialogue.text: We should like that very much! Your song touched us to the very core, and we'd like nothing more than to be able to likewise touch others!

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: All right, then. We can get acquainted when I'm in the mood. Now that you know what a real song feels like, I reckon there's hope for you lot yet.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Your adventures make great songs, Forename.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: That was a performance I shan't soon forget. My breast still thrums from the joy of the experience.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I cannot thank you enough, Forename. Our recruits are more motivated than ever before. No sooner did we arrive back in Gridania than they rushed off to train.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: I believe I'll go and join them. I'll continue what you and Jehantel started, and help them to become the finest bards they can be.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Guydelot─you are coming too, yes? You did say you would get to know them.

dialogue.name: GUYDELOT
dialogue.text: Aye, when I'm in the mood─which I'm not. Right now, I need to reflect on my experience─let it really soak in, you know? So I'm going to spend some time alone with my harp.

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: W-Wait! If you're going to play the harp, at least let the recruits listen!

dialogue.name: SANSON
dialogue.text: Forgive me, Forename, but I must be away. Thank you for a wonderful performance!

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Passionate as they are, I doubt not but that they will find their way.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Allow me to thank you as well, Forename. Truth be told, I too had longed to perform with you for quite some time.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: It was a truly sublime experience, as if our music had floated to the heavens and rained down upon all creation.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: The music of that rain, I believe, reached the souls of the fallen. My departed comrades of the Gods' Quiver.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: As it reached the heart of an old man who has long lived in quiet penance. It woke memories of the passion I had in my youth, when I yet stood on the field of battle.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: All of this because of a single song, young one. A song born of your tale.

dialogue.name: JEHANTEL
dialogue.text: Generations hence, full certain am I that the song will still be sung, awakening passion in countless more souls. It gives me great pride to know that I was a part of its creation.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Guydelot

obj.n: 天眼のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ

quest.name: 癒しの力の源
journal: Raya–O–Senna seems in a nostalgic mood.

Raya–O–Senna speaks to you of Alaqa and the Auri woman's efforts to atone for her misguided deeds. The Padjal asks that you look in on Alaqa in Stillglade Fane, and see how she is progressing with her studies in conjury.

Your sudden visit comes as a surprise to Alaqa, who confides that she feels ill at ease with both the art of conjury and her place in the Conjurers' Guild. Fortunately, Sylphie and Gatty soon arrive to lighten the mood and, seemingly inspired by your adventurous tale, suggest a course of action─it seems a training trip to the Hedgetree is in order.

You catch up with Sylphie in the Central Shroud, only to find that some dastardly Ixali plot has riled up the elementals. Drained by her battle with an enraged treant, Sylphie begs you to hurry to the Hedgetree, where Gatty is attempting to soothe the forest spirits' wrath alone...

Finding Gatty battered and exhausted by the elementals' anger, you step in to calm them with your own tranquil energies. While you are thus occupied, it falls to Alaqa to overcome her doubts and perform a healing spell for her suffering Padjali friend. Overjoyed by Alaqa's breakthrough, Sylphie and Gatty rush back to report to Brother E–Sumi, while Alaqa herself lingers behind.

Alaqa seems strengthened by the experience, and determined to continue her studies at Stillglade Fane. Somewhat embarrassed by the sudden onslaught of emotions, she asks that you pass on word of her decision to Raya–O in her stead.

Raya–O listens to your report with keen interest, expressing her pleasure at both Alaqa's progress and the inspiration you provided. With friends such as Sylphie and Gatty at her side, Alaqa's future in the Conjurers' Guild seems destined to be a bright one. As for your mastery of the white, Raya–O warns against complacency, expecting to hear ever greater things from you ere your paths cross again...
objectives: Speak with Alaqa at the Conjurers' Guild.
Meet with Sylphie near the Hedgetree in the Central Shroud.
Speak with Gatty at the Hedgetree.
Speak with Alaqa at the Hedgetree.
Report to Raya–O–Senna at Camp Tranquil.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename, how fare you in your studies of the white? I sense your magicks have grown even stronger since last we met.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Speaking of old acquaintances, do you recall Alaqa? The Auri girl responsible for the taint and its corruption?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: As a form of atonement, she has begun training in the art of conjury. Mayhap you could stop by Stillglade Fane and look in on her for me? I am sure she would be glad of the visit.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: You might also come across Gatty whilst you are in town─considering her unorthodox upbringing, my fellow Padjal has been given leave to roam somewhat more freely than might otherwise be allowed. Do give my regards to her and Sylphie should you see them.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Have you been to see Alaqa? I wonder how her training at the guild is progressing...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: ...Forename, Raya–O–Senna sent you to see me?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Ah, I thought as much. I did not imagine you would seek me out of your own accord, considering how I once wished you dead...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: But I promise I have changed─I am doing as they ask of me. At least, I am trying to...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: My attempts at curing spells are abysmal. I perform the exercises as the Seedseer has taught me, but it would seem I am unsuited to the healing arts...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Being an outsider, it is...difficult...for me to make friends here.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Although there are two young ladies who do seem eager to include me in their chatter.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Alaqa! I didn't know you knew Forename!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Were you two talking about your adventures? I want to hear about adventures!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Oh, me too, me too! Can we stay and listen!?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I...I suppose. If Forename doesn't mind...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Great! What kind of tale will you tell?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What kind of tale will you tell?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The tale of a man who crossed time and space to save the world...and me.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The tale of a woman who flew in the face of everything to save her beloved family.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: He must truly care for you─which I can completely understand. What a lovely story...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: What a wonderful sister she must be. And what a lovely story...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I want to be able to do that─to protect people. But I'm probably going to need a lot more training...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Then why don't we all go and train right now? Together! And we can work on becoming just like the person Forename told us about!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Yes, that's a wonderful idea!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Alaqa, you and Forename both have to come with us! It'll be so much more fun with the four of us!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: If you insist...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: I say we head out to the Hedgetree, and practice listening to the whispers of the forest! Come on, everyone, follow me!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: <huff> <puff> Forename, the Ixal, they─ <huff>

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: ...They stabbed a sword into the Hedgetree! The elementals really didn't like that...<puff>...and before we knew it, we were being attacked by a treant!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: It must be some sort of revenge on Gridania, the Ixal are trying to cause panic or chaos or... <huff>

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gatty wanted to try calming the spirits...<puff>...so we led mister smashy branches here away. I only just managed to...<huff>...to take it down...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: My own conjury was too weak to be of consequence. Sylphie was forced to expend too much aether to ensure the creature's defeat...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Don't worry about me─it's Gatty who needs help! The elementals were furious, and there's no way she can soothe their anger alone!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Please hurry, Forename! She needs you!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gatty is trying to calm the elementals all by herself! You have to help her!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Wh-What do I do...? What can I do...?

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: <huff> <gasp> Forename, thank goodness!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I pulled out the sword, but the elementals lashed out... They won't listen to me...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Please, you have to calm them! If another one of those treants goes after Sylphie and Alaqa...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: <huff> <puff> Ugh...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Gatty, you look hurt! I want to heal you, but I've no aether left to cast spells...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Alaqa, you'll have to do it!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: M-Me...? But I cannot...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: You must! Can't you see she's in pain!?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I want to help, but my conjury is so weak, I...

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: ...I will try! No one should suffer so!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Thank you, Alaqa─I feel so much better now. Your healing was like being wrapped in a soft, warm blanket!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I am glad to hear that, Gatty. To be honest, I did not expect the spell to work at all...but it did.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: And thank you, too, Forename. I never knew the elementals could get that mad... Phew, I've a long way to go before I'm as strong as you.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: “Phew” is the word for it! I think Brother E–Sumi owes us a reward after all that hard work!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Oh, Sylphie...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Alaqa!? I don't think I've ever seen you laugh before. This day really has been full of surprises!

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Alaqa's not much for talking, but she really is the sweetest girl at heart.

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: Alaqa is even prettier when she laughs, don't you think?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Thank you, Forename. If you hadn't come along, I may have lost the first real friends I've ever had...

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: That's what Forename does─she'she's always our hero when we need one!

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: That's right! In fact, both of you were heroes today.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I would hardly say I was heroic...

dialogue.name: GATTY
dialogue.text: I'm serious. We need to tell Brother E–Sumi how incredible your conjury is now!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Again, I think you praise me overmuch, but we should certainly report this incident, and let him know you are safe and sound.

dialogue.name: SYLPHIE
dialogue.text: Let's head back, then. I think I'm ready for a cup of tea and a nice long nap!

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Forename? I may just find my place here after all.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Listening to your tale earlier, I was convinced there was no one in my life I cared about that much...or who cared about me.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Then I saw how Gatty was hurt. I'd never felt my heart beat so wildly─never felt such relief as I did when my spell healed her.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I wonder, was this how the people in your adventures felt too...?

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: I will continue with my studies. And then should you need me─should any of you need me─I will be ready.

dialogue.name: ALAQA
dialogue.text: Would you mind letting Raya–O know of my decision to stay on? I am a little embarrassed to display all this sentiment in front of the Seedseer...

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Forename, you have returned to me with word of Alaqa?

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Ah, I was of a mind to investigate the disturbance myself when it suddenly subsided. 'Twas fortunate you were nearby.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: And I am heartened to hear that Alaqa has at last awakened her talent for conjury. I suspected it was not her potential nor lack of learning which stymied her progress, but a matter of confidence.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Her shift in perspective was encouraged in no small part by your inspiring presence, I am certain.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: Ah, but do not allow such praise to deter you from perfecting your own art! The mastery of white magicks is a road which never truly ends, Forename.

dialogue.name: RAYAOSENNA
dialogue.text: I expect to hear ever greater things from you ere next we meet!

obj.n: 信力のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ

quest.name: ラライの一念、岩をも通せ
journal: Lalai is eager to hear tell of your recent adventures.

Lalai is most intrigued by your tales of your journey to and from the First. In return, she shares the news that she has at long last completed her written record of all the knowledge of black magic she has gathered in the course of your adventures together. However, now she faces a dilemma, as despite her pleas, the Order of Nald'thal adamantly refuses to house such potentially dangerous knowledge within their archives. At Lalai's behest─and that of the Hearer Zhai'a Nelhah, who once again has invited himself to join in your adventures─you resolve to accompany your friend to the Arrzaneth Ossuary.

Upon arriving at the Ossuary, Lalai pleads her case to Prelate Yayake, but her words fall on deaf ears. When you step in to offer your support, the receptionist grudgingly admits that there is one member of the guild who sympathizes with the black mage's argument─and it is none other than Cocobuki, eldest of the five guildmasters. Heartened by the news, Lalai sets off to speak directly with the man himself, in hopes of winning his approval.

Though Guildmaster Cocobuki shares Lalai's perspective regarding the value of her research, he explains that his word alone will not suffice to sway the naysayers. Instead, he proposes that a hearing be held with Prioress Dewlala herself, that the head of the Order of Nald'thal might hear both sides of the argument and render her impartial judgment. Lalai is quick to accept the challenge, and wishes to meet with you outside the Ossuary to work out the details of your argument.

You have barely begun to discuss your argument when Lalai is struck with a bout of dizziness and suddenly collapses. Clearly shaken by the sight, Zhai'a Nelhah swoops the black mage into his arms and rushes off for Frondale's Phrontistery, where he would treat her further.

Puzzling out the details with the help of knowledge you gleaned from your travels to the First, Zhai'a Nelhah believes he has found a way to restore Lalai's aetheric balance and save her from a grim fate. In return, the Hearer asks that you delay the proceedings with Prioress Dewlala by petitioning Master Cocobuki, but his request is cut short when Lalai arrives to insist the hearing go ahead as planned. She entrusts her magnum opus to you and promises to be along shortly. Taking the tomes that are the fruit of Lalai's labors in hand, you set off back for the Ossuary, where your allies and opponents in this cause await.

You are doing your best to keep Dewlala's interest piqued when you are rejoined by Lalai, whose aetherial balance has been restored. Thoroughly won over by the black mage's logical and impassioned plea, the Prioress does not merely agree to housing her compendia in the Order's archives, but orders that a new research group dedicated to studying potential applications of black magic be established under Cocobuki's stewardship. Take your leave of this place with your companions, and revel in your hard-earned victory over prescripts and prejudice.

Cocobuki congratulates Lalai on her success, while also warning her that the true battle to regain people's trust in the art of black magic has only just begun. Lalai restates her vow to work tirelessly toward her life's goal of handing down the art of black magic to future generations, before taking her leave to convey the good tidings to a certain Hearer who also played a role in your triumph.

Zhai'a Nelhah is overjoyed to hear the good tidings, and positively stupefied when Lalai proceeds to offer him genuine words of thanks. The Hearer takes his leave in his typically oblivious and insensitive fashion, upon which Lalai once again thanks you for your efforts on her behalf. Relieved that she need no longer carry on her life's work in the shadows, she asks for your continued support in preserving the art of black magic for posterity.
objectives: Speak with Yayake at Arrzaneth Ossuary.
Speak with Cocobuki.
Speak with Lalai.
Speak with Zhai'a Nelhah near Frondale's Phrontistery.
Speak with Cocobuki at Arrzaneth Ossuary.
Speak with Cocobuki.
Speak with Lalai at Milvaneth Sacrarium.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Welcome back to these halls, Forename of the black. I sense that the dark powers in you are ever burgeoning. Pray tell, where have your travels taken you since last we met?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I traveled to a world flooded with Light.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I felled a great mage in battle.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: A journey to another world, you say? Intriguing, indeed. Consider me impressed...and even a bit envious.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: How you were able to peer into the past of the archmage Nyelbert, and form a bond across the ages with his young friend Taynor. Though the circumstances are not entirely the same, I cannot help but think back to my own encounter with the great Shatotto.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, I, too, have been keeping myself occupied. Why, I have recorded every detail we learned on our last adventure in writing, that we might preserve Shatotto's knowledge for posterity, and avert any similar calamity that may threaten future generations.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Just the other day, I put the finishing touches on the final chapter of the final volume, concluding with Shatotto's departure. There is, however, one lingering...hmm?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: (-???-)Well, fancy that! I come to check up on Lalai here, and who do I find but our old friend Forename.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Well, if it isn't everyone's favorite mutton-headed Hearer. I need neither your support nor your sympathy, but I suppose you've never been one to let that stop you.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Come now, Lalai. You yourself mentioned that you were at a loss for what to do with the records you had scribed, yes? I simply hoped to inquire as to whether there have been any fruitful developments on that front.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...Hmph. So you mean to rub salt in my wounds, yes? There have been no developments, fruitful or otherwise. I consulted with my brothers and sisters at the Order of Nald'thal, but to the last man they refused to even entertain the thought.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: You consulted with... Do you mean to say that you are still a member of the Order!? Why, I had always assumed that you had been excommunicated for your pursuit of the dark arts!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Excommunicated!? Simply for the pursuit of knowledge? Perish the thought! Though, to be fair, there are many holier-than-thou types in the Order who share this pigheaded Hearer's opinion...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Irrespective of this, the fact remains that the Order sealed away countless tomes in their vaults when they forbid the art of black magic. Storing my own writings with them, I would argue, is the most logical option.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: But no─they are too prudish and prejudiced against yours truly to listen to reason. Then again, perhaps if a thaumaturge in good standing with the Order were to put in a good word on my behalf...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...You may indeed find a more sympathetic ear. What do you say, Forename?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Excellent! Then let us hurry to the Ossuary and see if we can't convince that insufferably stuffy Yayake to see good sense.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: A moment if you please, Forename. To tell the truth, the question of where to store her records is not the only matter that concerns me about Lalai of late.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Recently, I cannot help but feel that the aetheric power within her is...shifting, warping in ways that I have not felt before. As for why this is, I cannot yet be sure. Until we discover more, pray look after her, will you?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: My apologies, but I believe it best that I remain here until your negotiations are complete. I shudder to think of the consequences if my colleagues at the Conjurers' Guild found out I was conspiring with the likes of you and Lalai. Nothing personal, of course.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I swear, for a veteran of the Order, she has all the sense of a simpering child!

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Forename! Well, this is an unexpected surprise. And not an entirely pleasant one, though it is by no fault of your own...

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: The unmitigated gall of you, Lalai! Did you honestly believe that dragging poor Forename here─against herhis will, no doubt─would convince me to agree to housing your shameful scribblings in our archives?

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: I have said it once, and I will say it again. Until the day you renounce the depraved teachings of Ququruka, you will find no friends here. I would see those books burn before I give them a home here─for our sake, and for your own!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I swear, despite that pretentious monocle, you remain as blind as a bat to the big picture. Forename of the black! Talk some sense into this overstuffed secretary!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Should the tomes not be sealed away for safekeeping?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Do all in the Order agree with your decision?

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: ...Hm. At least one of us here is capable of communicating like an adult.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: I will grudgingly admit that there is one other who shares Lalai's sentiments. In fact, it is none other than our very own guildmaster, Master Cocoba...Cocobe...er, what was the name again?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Cocobuki! Hah! It does not surprise me in the least. Come, Forename! Let us present our case to someone wise enough to understand it.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: After all you have done for our guild, I felt you deserved an answer to your query, and so I gave you one. And yet I advise you to proceed with caution. Lalai has few allies here, and I would hate to see your pristine reputation sullied by association.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Who cares if everyone else in this place is an insufferable dunderhead? With the guildmaster himself on our side, the argument is as good as won!

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Hm hm hm... I was wondering who might be behind the screaming and stamping that echoed all the way to this chamber. Sister Lalai, was it?

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Yes, it is true. I find myself rather convinced by the young lady's argument. It is all but impossible for us to prevent any and all from studying the dark arts.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Why, then, not keep this dangerous knowledge close at hand, where we keep an ever-watchful eye on those who would pursue it? And yet, I fear that my own view is not a popular one, and my power to influence the others is far from absolute.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: And so I would offer a proposal. Let us state our case directly to the head of the Order─to Prioress Dewlala herself─that she might pass judgment.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: You and Lalai shall argue in favor of accepting the tomes, and those opposing shall argue against. Should all go well, the prioress will agree to the proposal, and the tomes will have a safe home.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: And yet, the plan is not without risk. Should your argument be less than convincing, there remains a chance Dewlala may expressly forbid any further research. Why, if she is in a particularly foul mood, your very place in the Order may suddenly become...quite tenuous.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Hah! As if there is a chance my words could be anything but persuasive. I accept! Pray summon the prioress at her earliest convenience.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Well, that settles it. We'd best hurry and prepare our argument─out of our enemies' earshot, of course. Come with me, Forename!

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: For whatever it avails you, I shall voice my opinion in favor. No doubt Prelate Yayake will take her place at the head of the opposition.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: On another matter, is Lalai quite all right? I could not help but sense the aether within her swirling in a most unusual fashion...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Lalai seems to be in unusually good spirits─I trust the negotiations went well. And yet, something concerns me...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: This is our chance, Forename! We simply must convince the prioress at all costs! The future of our art depends on it!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...Hm? What is this curious sensation?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Lalai! I knew something was amiss. The aether within you is transforming in a most unusual way...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I must admit, I have not felt quite myself lately. My head...it feels as heavy as stone...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...No, this will not do. I'm afraid I must insist that you submit to a full examination before the hearing commences...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Lalai! Lalai, c-can you hear me!? S-Someone fetch a healer or a...wait, that's me!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Th-This is no time for p-p-panicking, friend! We must c-carry her to the Phrontistery with all speed!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I fear it is as I suspected. The aetheric balance within her has broken down entirely...and unchecked energies are now eating away at her from within.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: I can only assume that playing host to Shatotto's memories has put a terrible strain on her─one from which she has yet to completely recover.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Yes, it would seem that her mind and spirit are in mortal peril. I have never witnessed this degree of aetheric imbalance before. I do not suppose you have...?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
