dialogue.text: I saw a world consumed by Light...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I saw a man transform into an unholy abomination...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: ...I see. I can scarcely imagine all you have witnessed in your travels, but an imbalance of aether similar to what I now observe in Lalai would appear to be behind the phenomena you describe.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: If we can assume that the memories of Shatotto taking up residence in Lalai's corporeal form stimulated her aetheric flow, causing it to shift violently in an astral direction...then it only stands to reason we could restore balance by introducing a counteracting umbral aspect!

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: By the Twelve, I think I've got it! And yet, the process will not be quick...nor easy. I suppose we've no choice but to ask Master Cocobuki to delay the hearing...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: (-???-)Delay the hearing!? Have you lost what little wits you had!? Why, if word got out that my condition was the result of my pursuit of the dark arts, it would all but seal Yayake's case against me!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: No, we must proceed as planned, before our opponents are the wiser. Forename, here is my magnum opus─the fruits of all we went through together. I leave them in your capable hands. Go on ahead, and I will be along in due time.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Are you mad!? You can't possibly mean to attend the proceedings in your current condition.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Of course not.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Fortunately, I just so happen to know a Hearer who─despite being an insufferable stick-in-the-mud─has proven himself more than capable in the healing arts.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Lalai...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Very well...leave it to me. I will see that you are back on your feet before the judgment is rendered.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Until then, I suppose it is up to Forename here. Godsspeed, my friend.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: I have heard that we will be pleading our cases to Prioress Dewlala herself. It matters little to me─when she has heard my argument, she will have no choice but to rule in my favor.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Hm hm hm... Lalai will be joining the proceedings a touch late, you say? That is most...unlike her, to say the least.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: She has entrusted her records to you? Very well. With any luck, we will be able to use them to our advantage. Now, allow me to see them. The prioress will be here all too soon...

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Lalai has not even the courtesy to arrive on time to the hearing she herself requested? I swear, the woman's selfishness knows no bounds! I move that her request be dismissed immediately. It is...for her own good.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Her own good...? Yes...it is as I suspected. You speak from your own experience...don't you, child?

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: I recall that you, too, once took an unpopular position in support of your erstwhile Master Mumuepo...one that earned you only the ire of your brothers and sisters.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: Yes...and what of it!? I fought for a hopeless cause that in the end served only to isolate me from my peers. Is it so wrong that I wish to save Lalai from a similar fate? She must abandon this farce at once and return to her rightful place in the Order!

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: To this, I cannot agree. In the short time before these proceedings, I perused what I could of these tomes. In their pages are writ not only forbidden secrets of black magic, but accounts of astounding phenomena the likes of which even I could scarcely imagine.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Lalai conducted her research without the support─or interference─of the Order, and the fruits that research has borne cannot be denied. While our guild could not support a thousand others like her, I see little to gain from stifling one woman's passion, and forcing her to work within such rigid rules and regulations.

dialogue.name: DEWLALA
dialogue.text: The merits of both arguments are not lost on me. And yet I must confess a degree of ignorance about the matter at hand. All know that black magic was forbidden for its role in bringing disaster to our world. And yet, you still practice this art. Tell me, adventurer─is this magic as calamitous as the rumors say?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: How will you respond?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It depends on who wields it, and to what end.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Destruction, too, can bring salvation.

dialogue.name: DEWLALA
dialogue.text: If I understand you correctly, you would argue that in the right hands, even the art of destruction might serve the greater good. And yet, how are we to be certain that this Sister Lalai can be trusted with such potentially ruinous knowledge?

dialogue.name: DEWLALA
dialogue.text: There are times when vast destructive powers are needed...this is your claim? From my observations, I suppose you may be right. And yet, how are we to be certain that this Sister Lalai can be trusted with such potentially ruinous knowledge?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: My apologies, Prioress! By your leave, I would tell my tale.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Black magic is an inherently dangerous art...this I cannot and will not deny. Never would I suggest that even a single mage pursue this path without full knowledge of the perils that lie ahead.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: That is precisely why I have recorded in painstaking detail not only the arcane knowledge I have gleaned, but every last one of the myriad phenomena both wondrous and terrifying I have experienced in its pursuit.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Unbreakable bonds formed with beastmen we once thought our sworn enemy, bodies and souls consumed by the pursuit of forbidden knowledge, an unspeakable calamity revisited upon our world after millennia...! We must leave this knowledge to posterity, that our sons and daughters do not repeat the mistakes of our past!

dialogue.name: DEWLALA
dialogue.text: Those who do not learn from history are doomed to repeat it. This is the crux of your argument, yes?

dialogue.name: DEWLALA
dialogue.text: ...Very well. Master Cocobuki, I hereby order you to establish a research organization under the auspices of your guild to further study the impact of black magic. I also grant you permission to store the aforementioned tomes in your archives─under the condition that Sister Lalai oversees them.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: ...Understood. I will see that both the tomes and Lalai herself find a safe home within our halls.

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: I am still not entirely convinced, but if the guildmaster himself is willing to accept responsibility...I have no reason to oppose.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Prioress Dewlala, Master Cocobuki...I cannot thank you enough. Mark my words: you will not regret this decision. I will see to it that this knowledge is passed down as it should be─that the errors of our past will never be repeated.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: To think the day would come that our art would be recognized once more!

dialogue.name: YAYAKE
dialogue.text: One thing I will say for Lalai: she is passionate about her beliefs. Worry not─I will see that she is treated fairly by her brothers and sisters.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Well, I do believe the proceedings went about as well as could be expected. I suppose this means that Lalai is now directly under my supervision.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: Don't think you'll be getting free rein around here simply because I vouched for you, child. I expect regular reports on any and all of your findings─only through transparency will black magic ever be accepted by doubters and skeptics.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Understood. I shall begin to prepare my first report at once. But before that, there is another with whom I'd like to share these tidings. That is...by your leave, Guildmaster?

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: I believe you know well of whom I speak. He awaits us at the Sacrarium. Come along, Forename.

dialogue.name: COCOBUKI
dialogue.text: I am relieved to see the girl's aetheric balance restored. I suppose it was one of your companions who aided in this, yes?

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Lalai has already shared the good news with me. Why, I could not be happier for the both of you!

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: And so, you see... I simply thought that, well...

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Whatever is the matter, Lalai? This is your moment of triumph! I would expect you to be more...triumphant.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Of course I am! It is simply that, well... Clearly, I could not have...I did not accomplish this on my own, so...

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: Forename of the black. And yes, you as well, Zhai'a Nelhah. You have my...deepest gratitude.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: Well, I daresay this has been a momentous day in more ways than one. Once again, Lalai, my congratulations. And...you are most welcome.

dialogue.name: ZHAIANELHAH
dialogue.text: And with that, I should be on my way. When next we meet, I would introduce my colleagues from Stillglade Fane. Now that you are no longer a pariah, I suppose they would not be averse to exchanging knowledge with you.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: ...And just when I was beginning to take a liking to that dolt.

dialogue.name: LALAI
dialogue.text: At any rate, though my official position may have changed, my mission remains the same: I will do all in my power to preserve our art for future generations. Pray continue to lend me your aid...Forename of the black.

obj.n: 天眼のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ
記憶より託されし未来

quest.name: 新次元の学者
journal: Alka Zolka appears to be on the point of setting out somewhere.

You speak with Alka Zolka, who is pleased to see you again. He invites you to join him at a training session in upper La Noscea, where he will be meeting Surito Carito─and you agree, as one can never know too many martial tactics.

You and Alka Zolka locate Surito Carito near the Wanderer's Palace, where you are shortly joined by Setoto. The plan to train in Nymian mariner stratagems is soon left by the wayside, however, once you relate your experiences in the First. The story of how Lamitt cured stoneblight, in particular, catches Surito Carito's attention, and he exclaims that he may have an idea by which the same principles might be applied in the curing of the Nymian plague. It would not do to neglect any possible avenues that may lead to such a cure, of course, so the remaining three of you readily sign on to test his theory.

You travel to the South Shroud and obtain the root that Surito Carito assigned you to procure with little trouble. As your errand took you farthest from upper La Noscea, it would be reasonable to expect that the others will have completed their own portions of the preparation ere you return.

Alas, you are not the last to arrive back at the Wanderer's Palace─Alka Zolka, it transpires, was delayed by another run-in with a certain infamous goldsmith. Though all of the necessary materials are now assembled, there remains one more step to be taken: the testing of the experimental compound. Surito Carito hypothesizes that, in the unlikely event that he has miscalculated, consuming the concoction could result in an irreversible transformation into a mindless monster. Given the severity of the danger, he volunteers himself as test subject; however, Setoto points out that without him, the rest of the tonberries have little hope of finding a cure. She suggests that the compound be tested on her instead, but Alka Zolka is entirely unwilling to entertain the idea. Both become increasingly agitated, Setoto at last stalking off to spend time alone with her thoughts.

You speak with Alka Zolka, who seems genuinely not to understand why Setoto does not appreciate his objections to her plan. After sending him off to cool his head, Surito Carito privately shares with you that he is concerned that Setoto's willingness to volunteer herself as test subject stems more from her love for Alka Zolka and desire to be a normal girl than it does from the logic she presented. He begs you seek her out and determine whether she has truly thought her choice through.

When you confront Setoto, she admits to being in love with Alka Zolka, but maintains that this is not her primary reason for putting herself forth to test the cure. Rather, her experiences have imparted a keen awareness of the suffering that the tonberries are ever plagued by, and she is determined to help her countrymen─something that she is uniquely physiologically suited to do, as one of the youngest and last to have been afflicted with the disease.

Back at the Wanderer's Palace, Setoto reiterates her commitment to undergoing the experiment. This time, Surito Carito is convinced by her logic, and Alka Zolka by her heartfelt words. Thus, the test begins, Setoto drinking the concoction to destabilize her own aether, Alka Zolka holding the Amdapori focus aloft, and you and your faerie channeling as much restorative aether as you can manage together. Though the experience appears to be excruciating, Setoto bears the pain, and in the end stands before you a Lalafell, with nary a trace of green to be seen.

You speak with Alka Zolka, who is delighted that the cure was successful. He rambles about how admirable Surito Carito, you, and especially Setoto are before rushing off to continue his training, apparently seized with inspiration.

Setoto comments on Alka Zolka's abrupt departure with fondness, and affirms to you that she will find a way to convey her feelings to him someday, though she is in no hurry to do so. At last, she has a real future ahead of her─with ample time to live, to love, and to pursue her dreams of becoming a scholar.

Surito Carito, too, is pleased with the experiment's success. He vows to continue his research, and is confident that, in due course, he will be able to cure many more victims of the Nymian plague with the same methods tested on Setoto. Perhaps on some morn not far in the future, the sun will rise to see all tonberries restored to their former selves...
objectives: Speak with Surito Carito outside of the Wanderer's Palace.
Survey the designated location and slay a verdant treant for its root.
Deliver the revival root to Surito Carito at the Wanderer's Palace.
Speak with Alka Zolka.
Speak with Setoto on the Long Climb.
Speak with Surito Carito at the Wanderer's Palace.
Speak with Alka Zolka.
Speak with Setoto.
Speak with Surito Carito.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If it isn't Forename, in the flesh! It has been quite some time, hasn't it?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: R'ashaht keeps me apprised of any tales of your heroism that reach her ears, and I must say─they never fail to inspire me to reach for greater martial and tactical heights.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I have thus been seizing upon every opportunity to hone my skills, be it through employment or study. In fact, I have an appointment with Surito Carito shortly to review mariner stratagems for securing thoroughfares and byways. Would you care to join me?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Excellent! It will be a pleasure to train alongside you again. I shall meet you at Camp Bronze Lake─Surito Carito awaits us there.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: This is just like old times, isn't it?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: My, what a pleasant surprise! I was unaware that you would be joining us today.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Heavens, is that Forename I spy?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Setoto! A true pleasure to see you! Have you come for the exercises as well?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Of course. It may have been well over a millennium ago that I began my studies, but I am still a student with much to learn.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Though I am somewhat hampered by the small matter that is my inability to summon a faerie whilst trapped in this grotesque form...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You are hardly grotesque, my lady. And I'm confident that there is some way you might once again call forth a faerie─we need only find a way to tap the Royal Marine spirit within you. Come hells or high water!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I... Let us hope you are right.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Doubt not that he is. But first, given how rare this opportunity is, might I suggest that we begin by asking Forename to regale us with tales of herhis recent endeavors? There is much we might learn from them.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you talk about?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Giott's growth.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Lamitt's journey.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <sniff> Lamitt, she... And then Giott... <sob> I'm so proud of them...

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Lamitt's drive to save her sister, no matter what it cost her... It reminds me of my father.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I can scarce believe you traveled to another world entirely. Were it anyone else, I would doubt the veracity of their words, but I can only envy you. You must have gained much insight into the nature of our own star.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: The concept of stoneblight fascinates me. Highly contagious, transforms the body... I cannot but draw parallels between it and the Nymian plague.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: What were you able to discern about the magic utilized in curing it?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Hmm... Perhaps the application of a high concentration of aether...but how? Might crystals serve to amplify? Assuming so...

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: It may work! The similarities of stoneblight to our own affliction─this may well be the key to a cure for the Nymian plague.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: You mean to say that my body...and my ability to cast healing magic could be restored?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Precisely. It will be a complex process involving trial and error, of course, but I assume you are interested nevertheless?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Very good. Your assistance will hasten the process considerably.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Setoto, I would have your aid in preparing the experimental compound.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: We will require instruments that allow for a high degree of precision. Alka Zolka, you must consult an expert goldsmith to procure suitable supplies.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I believe we might make use of revival root, as well, though I know of no better source of it than the aged treants of Snakemolt. It will be something of a walk, I realize, but can I entrust this task to you?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: A challenge befitting the Royal Marines─and to it we shall rise!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: This is the closest thing to hope that I have felt in a very long time.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: ...though the concentration needs exceed anything we have previ─ Ah, Forename. Yes, upon reflection, I am quite certain I require that root. The larger the cutting, the better.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Were you able to procure the root?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Thank you─I expect this will be sufficiently potent. Now we only need await Alka Zolka's return, and...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Apologies, I've only just escaped... I am acquainted with a goldsmith of some repute, and he agreed to fashion the instruments in return for my massaging him with salamander oil. Again.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: However, the goods themselves should be more than adequate.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Ah. They're a bit oily, but presumably that will come off.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: In which case, we can prepare the compound at any time. However, the matter of what follows is problematic.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Problematic? In what sense?

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Though I am fairly confident in my theory, the experimental compound is just that─experimental. I did state before that this process would involve trial and error.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: As the Nymian plague does not affect beasts, to test it on any but a tonberry is impossible. Yet, as its ingestion will result in disruption to the body's aetherial balance, there is a possibility that the subject may find himself worse off than before.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I have no intention of inflicting such a fate on any of my brethren, naturally. And so, should I be warped beyond recognition as a result...the task of destroying me will fall to you.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You cannot honestly believe we would agree to that!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: ...What if you were to test it on me, instead?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Absolutely not! You heard what he said─the test subject might very well become a monster!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I am prepared to take the risk.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Well I'm not prepared to let you!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: So you would rather Surito Carito do it? If the test does fail, and he becomes some sort of abomination, who would remain to continue researching the cure? It follows that I ought to be the subject.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: And I'm supposed to accept that?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: It's not your choice to make!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Please, calm yourselves. The admixture will take some time to prepare, in any case. We can discuss this later, when we have all had the opportunity to think.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Fine. I will do my thinking elsewhere, if it's all the same to you.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I had hoped everyone would be amenable, but I suppose life is rarely so simple.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: I don't understand─I'm merely trying to prevent her from placing herself in harm's way!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: ...I believe you too would be well served by a reprieve. Perhaps a bit of exercise?

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: If you insist.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: <sigh> This would be a far sight easier if they were honest with one another.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: As you doubtless are aware, Setoto is quite enamored of Alka Zolka. She seems...disinclined to pursue the matter, however, her current condition being what it is.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Though she raised a salient point, I would not have her volunteer if her primary goal is to remove that perceived obstacle. Were Alka Zolka to be forced to slay her, only to later learn what it was all for... It doesn't bear thinking about.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Might you go and speak with her? I expect that she is fuming somewhere in outer La Noscea. She has a tendency to wander when she's distressed.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: If you were able to coax Setoto's honest feelings from her, I would be in a better position to decide whether this is truly something I can ask of the both of them.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I...apologize for my earlier conduct.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I have no intention of changing my mind, though. My logic is sound.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It is. But are the reasons you gave truly why you volunteered?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Is it? Love makes us do foolish things...

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Are they─ Ah. I see.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: ...That obvious, is it?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Since it's come to this─yes, I am in love with Alka Zolka.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: And maybe, were things different, I could be content with that. If we might walk, hand in hand, without drawing the attention of every would-be hero within ten malms. If my compatriots were just as free to pursue their own happiness.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: As it is, however, his insistence upon protecting me above all else─it chafes.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I am no fool. I know that others, Alka Zolka included, are stronger than I, and I am not so proud as to refuse aid on principle.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: But it's not enough to merely live, insulated from harm. I want─I've always wanted to help people. Now more than ever, knowing firsthand the terrible toll this blight takes on all of us.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: It is not simply my own desires that make me so adamant─truthfully, there is no more suitable subject on whom the cure might be tested. I had not yet seen twenty summers when I was afflicted, so if it has unanticipated effects, my body will be best able to bear them.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Moreover, I was one of the last to fall to the plague before we entered our lengthy slumber─meaning my illness is less advanced. If this potential cure shows results, they will present in me most quickly.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: To say the thought that it could fail does not frighten me would be a lie. Yet...if there is a means by which I might save my people from suffering, I cannot ignore it. You've followed the path of the scholar─you understand, don't you?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You do make a compelling argument.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes, I think I know the feeling.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Thank you. Talking this through with you has helped to clear my head, I believe. I'm ready to speak with the others.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: <huff> <puff> There! I...<pant>...I've finished running through Sergeant Tolga's...<wheeze>...thousand-step training regimen!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Ah, you have returned. How are you feeling?

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: More confident than ever. You must test the cure on me.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Alka, please. I am not making this decision in haste, nor do I take it lightly. Truth be told, I'm terrified.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: But I need to do this. Forename agreed─it must be me.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Hmm... Yes, I must admit, your reasoning is sound.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I appreciate that you worry for me, Alka. It means more than you know. But this is my duty─my battle to fight.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: You can trust me to meet this foe with all I have─I vow not to quit the field until the bitter end. But if the time comes when I am no longer myself... I need to know that my fate is in good hands. In your hands.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: As you wish. I will be at your side, as any true mariner would. But know that I fully expect you to seize victory─come hells or high water.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I will. Thank you, Alka.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Very well. If the both of you are resolved, I will abide by Setoto's decision.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: But before we begin, I must explain how the process is meant to work.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: First, Setoto will drink the compound I devised. This should destabilize the aetherial composition of her body. Once she has done so, Alka Zolka, you must stand at the ready with this, the gemstone retrieved from Amdapor. It shall serve as a focus.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forename and Lily will channel their restorative magic through the focus, amplifying it. In theory, being exposed to a sufficient volume of curative aether will encourage Setoto's own aether to attune to it and set itself to rights.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: If all are clear on what must be done, let us commence!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: Oh... Oh, it burns. It burns!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Forename, Lily, now!

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Fight it, Setoto!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: AAAUGH! <pant> Ah...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: You are truly radiant, Setoto. Inside and out.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I was nearly certain that it would work, but to see the result is another matter entirely. I can scarce believe my eyes...

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: I feel the breeze on my skin! Oh, it's wonderful.

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: To think, after all this time, the endless research, we have a cure for the Nymian plague! That Surito Carito even managed to devise such a thing is remarkable enough, but to see it succeed...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: Without Forename's skill as a scholar, it never would have been possible. And Setoto! Your kindness, your conviction, your strength of spirit...

dialogue.name: ALKAZOLKA
dialogue.text: It inspires me to train with even greater fervor!

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: That is so like him.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: And he's still utterly oblivious to my feelings, I'm sure.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: It's all right, though. I never truly expected to have another chance at the life I once envisioned for myself─and now that I do, I intend to enjoy it. There's no need to rush through all of the best parts.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: That goes for my vocation, as well. I intend to relearn the scholarly arts, starting from the basics. And with my aetheric balance restored, I should be able to summon Lilac properly. Someday, we will be the salvation of those in need─I swear it.

dialogue.name: SETOTO
dialogue.text: For the moment, however, I have much training to do if I am to be fit for the Royal Marines. To that end─I'm off to find Alka!

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Having labored for so long, so fruitlessly, and then to see the cure realized at last... I find myself at a loss for words.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: I will need to monitor Setoto's condition for a time, of course, lest there be adverse effects that were not readily apparent. But this is progress. Astounding progress, toward the day when we might see all tonberries restored to their former selves.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: In the meanwhile... Inexperienced in matters of the heart though they are, you needn't worry overmuch for those two. I have confidence that they will sort themselves out in due time.

dialogue.name: SURITOCARITO
dialogue.text: Fare you well, in whatever worlds your travels lead you to─and thank you.

obj.n: 信力のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ

quest.name: 朧げな秘策
journal: Oboro is wearing a shite-eating grin on his face for reasons you can only begin to imagine.

You reunite with Oboro, who cheerfully proclaims that he has at long last devised a plan to get the better of his longtime rival, Karasu Redbeak, and recover the half of the forbidden mudra scroll currently in the flamboyant ninja's possession. Splitting up so as not to attract attention, you make for the Hermit's Hovel─a bathhouse where Karasu has recently taken up residence─where Oboro means to elaborate on the details of his plan.

Upon your arrival, Oboro eagerly explains how he intends to thwart his rival. Oboro intends to distract Karasu in the midst of his daily bathing ritual, allowing you to sneak into the bathhouse and make off with the scroll─a strategy not unlike the one you employed on a previous adventure back in Kugane. Wait in the shadows at Oboro's instruction, and be prepared to make your move when Karasu has been lured away from the scene.

Oboro's ruse is a great success, as Karasu is all too willing to join him in a leisurely chat over some Hingan rice wine, leaving the bathhouse entirely unattended. Infiltrate the structure and sort through Karasu's belongings in search of the scroll before the wily ninja wises up to the situation and returns.

You succeed in finding the scroll alongside other considerably less helpful documents also scattered throughout the hovel. Make a discreet retreat and return to the Long Climb that you might rendezvous with Oboro and ascertain that what you found is indeed the authentic item.

Oboro rejoices upon seeing the scroll in your possession and declares the entire operation an unqualified triumph. He invites you to return to the dock storehouse that you might discuss matters further in private, and goes off on his way.

As Oboro revels in his triumph over his bitter rival, the two of you are joined by your mutual friend Captain Jacke of the Dutiful Sisters. Heartened by the unexpected reunion, the jovial rogue invites the both of you for celebratory dinner and drinks at the Bismarck, an offer which Oboro accepts gladly. Make your way to Limsa Lominsa, where you might share a fine feast with your companions.

At the Bismarck, your revelry is interrupted when Oboro rushes into the establishment half-naked. You and Captain Jacke quickly deduce that the “Oboro” whom you reunited with after the operation was none other than Karasu in disguise, a suspicion which is quickly confirmed when the savvy ninja reveals his true identity. The crow, victorious again over his erstwhile friend, offers a few mocking words, then turns into a bat and flaps away, leaving Oboro dejected and stark naked in the middle on the tavern floor. Jacke offers a few words of sympathy, and invites all of you back to the Sisters that you might find the poor man some clothes.

You arrive at the Sisters to find Oboro decked out in clothes from Captain Jacke's personal wardrobe, a particularly garish outfit to which the fashion-challenged ninja has inexplicably taken a liking. He fills you in on the particulars of his inglorious defeat at Karasu's hands, resolving in the end to get his revenge on his rival. After Oboro takes his leave, Captain Jacke encourages you not to be a stranger in La Noscea, as both he and your ninja friends will like as not have need of your services again.
objectives: Speak with Oboro at the Long Climb.
Keep lookout for Karasu behind the Hermit's Hovel.
Search inside the Hermit's Hovel and retrieve the scroll.
Wait for Oboro at the Long Climb.
Speak with Oboro at the dock storehouse.
Wait for your friends at the Bismarck.
Speak with Oboro at the Rogues' Guild.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: You thought you'd evaded me for good, did you!? We'll see who has the last laugh! Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Forename...!? By the kami, don't sneak up on me like that! That is, of course I felt your presence. Yes, I was simply...deep in thought, that is all.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: But I daresay for good reason! For you see, I have finally tracked down that elusive bird, and am ready to seize him by the wings and take back what is mine!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I speak, of course, of that blasted Karasu. Ever since he escaped with half of the forbidden scroll, I have not let up the search for a moment. Today, at long last, I have found him! Truly, this is reason to rejoice, would you not agree?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: And yet, the act of stealing the scroll back will not prove so simple. Which is why your arrival is truly a gift from the heavens! You will aid me in the task, will you not? It will be just like old times!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Once again, I owe you my gratitude. Now, let us get down to brass tacks, as Jacke would say. My shinobi have ascertained that Karasu has once again returned to Eorzean shores to ply his trade─such as it is─in the shadows of the black markets.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Furthermore, they say he has taken up residence in secret at a secluded grove in La Noscea known as the Hermit's Hovel. You know the place, yes? Let us meet up there, and I will share with you the ingenious details of my plan. I will go ahead on my own─we do not want to attract attention, after all.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I thank you for coming, Forename. Now, without further ado, let me explain precisely how I intend to recover the scroll from Karasu's clutches.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: My colleagues and I have been observing the man closely for a fortnight or so. Though one would assume otherwise, he is actually a man of remarkably consistent routine.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: He carries the scroll in a case that never leaves his side. Save, that is, for when he goes for his daily bath─at precisely the same hour each day...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I had a mind to lift the scroll from his possessions while he was otherwise occupied─much as we did with Zakuro that one time in Kugane─but would you believe it? Almost as if by magic, no sooner has he entered the baths than he is out again, scroll at his side and fully dressed in that garish garb of his.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: This is where you come in. Worry not: this will not involve any high-wire walking or elaborate disguises. I simply intend to invite the man to share a drink, and thereby delay his departure. In the meantime, you are to sneak into the bathhouse and steal away with the scroll.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Ingeniously plotted, would you not say!? I need only lull Karasu into a false sense of security with my impeccable acting skills, and the scroll is as good as ours! What could go wrong?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: So let us put the plan in action. Let us make for the hovel─separately, of course. Find yourself suitable cover, and wait for me to lure the crow away. We shall meet again here once you have safely recovered the scroll.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: As you can see, I have everything entirely under control. Find yourself cover─Karasu should be arriving any moment.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oho, but what's this!? Our hero arrives for a relaxing soak in his favorite spring, only to be stared down by his self-styled rival and realm-renowned oaf Oboro the dim! Have you not yet had your fill of being outwitted and embarrassed by your betters?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Spare me the bombast and bluster, Karasu. I stand before you today with an offer...an offer of peace.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: We are countrymen, and there was once a time when we called each other friend. Has our conflict not persisted long enough?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: So let us lay down our weapons for a day. Let us soak in these soothing waters, reminisce about times gone by, and see if we cannot put our petty differences behind us. Why, I've even brought a bottle of Hingan rice wine for the occasion...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Astonishing! Incredible! Has the dim one lost his wits? Does he believe that a few flowery words are enough to pull the wool over the crow's keen eyes while he steals away with the scroll? The audience gasps at the sheer audacity!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Believe me or do not, the choice is yours. But this I swear: I have no interest in seeing the two halves of that accursed scroll reunited.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: On the contrary, with one half safely sealed away in our village, and the other in the hands of the realm's most elusive ninja, the forbidden mudra will never be wielded again─and I would not have it any other way.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Furthermore, I have recently found enlightenment of a sort. At long last, I have realized that your skill with ninjutsu far exceeds my own─even had I once desired to steal the scroll back from you, I am now painfully aware that doing so is entirely beyond my abilities.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Oho! Well, color me surprised! The boy's actually grown half a brain since last we met!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: But aren't you being a bit naive, Oboro? After all, what's to stop me from simply returning to our village, effortlessly incapacitating our elders, and seizing the other half of the scroll for myself!?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I know you too well, Karasu. It is not power that you crave, but freedom. You have worked too long, too hard to cast off the shackles of our village to risk losing it all over a single scroll.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: The audience gasps! Why, I do believe that's the single most intelligent utterance that's ever escaped the dim one's lips!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Very well, then. I'm feeling generous today, so I do believe I'll entertain your offers. Though for your sake, I do hope that the rice wine you've brought is a good vintage. I simply can't abide poor taste in beverages, you see...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You found a scroll! It's entitled Mastering Doman Mahjong: A Primer for Prentices. This doesn't appear to be the item you were looking for...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You found a scroll! It's entitled Big Ears and Bushy Tails: On the Breeding and Rearing of Rabbits. This doesn't appear to be the item you were looking for...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You found a scroll! It's entitled Oboro's Dullest and Most Dim-witted Moments, as Chronicled by Karasu Redbeak. This doesn't appear to be the item you were looking for...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You found a scroll! It's entitled The Wandering Minstrel's Greatest Mysteries Revealed. This doesn't appear to be the item you were looking for...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The bookshelf appears to be quite sturdy. Perhaps you could use it as a foothold to reach the room above...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Ah, you return, friend! And with the scroll safely in your grasp, no doubt. Let me examine it, that I might ascertain its authenticity.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Yes...yes, there can be no doubting it. This is indeed the forbidden mudra I sought! After all these years, finally have I outwitted that accursed crow!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)And yet, we must be wary. No doubt, Karasu has already realized that something is amiss. Let us reconvene at the storehouse before he can pick up our trail.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Welcome back, Forename. Do forgive me if I am a bit giddy. I still cannot quite believe that I outwitted Karasu for once. My plans have a habit of...firing back, as they say.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Why, you should have seen him! So convincing was my act, that by the time we were through he was stumbling and slurring his words so much that you'd think he'd downed a whole bathtub's worth of rice wine! Ahahahaha! Hahaha! ...Hah.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: (-Roguish Voice-)Gods' piss, lad, shut yer gob! Every cove and mort for malms can hear ye blabbin'...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Ah, Captain Jacke! A pleasure as always. Do forgive me my outburst. I was merely celebrating with our mutual friend here my most remarkable triumph over the accursed Karasu!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ho there, Forename! Always a pleasure to see a dimber damber like yerself back in town. I trust yer stabbers haven't dulled none since last we met?

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Anyway, between this reunion an' Oboro's hard-won victory, I reckon we've got cause to celebrate. What say we drag our dew beaters back to town and yaffle ourselves a bite at the Bismarck?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)A splendid idea, my friend! Why, I would enjoy nothing more than to share this joyous moment with my boon companions. To the Bismarck, then─and the first round is on me!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: That's the spirit! I'll send ahead for Underfoot and the Stray─the more, the benar after all! Aye, been too long since we had a right little rogue family reunion.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)An upstanding fellow as ever, that Captain Jacke. Ah, but it is somewhat bittersweet, is it not? Now that my long-standing pursuit of Karasu has come to a close, I find myself in search of a new mission─a new purpose in my life, such as it were.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I have no intention of returning to the cramped confines of my village...and yet, I am uncertain where my abilities might best avail the people of this realm. Pray tell, what sort of adventures have you been occupying yourself with of late?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I traveled to the First.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I did battle with a great hunter.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)What's this you say? There exist worlds out there other than our own...!? If you are having a jest at Oboro's expense, old friend, let it be known I do not find it amusing!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)But no...I can tell that you say this in earnest. Consider me intrigued, though forgive me if I am not in a hurry to seek out a means to travel there. No, I will bide my time here in Eorzea, and carefully ponder my future.

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)At any rate, we mustn't keep Jacke and the others waiting, yes? I will make for the Bismarck as soon as I have attended to my affairs here. Why don't you travel on ahead?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)...And just like that, the scroll was mine again! And so I say, who is the “dim” one now, you damned crow!? Ahahaha!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye, aye...ye've told the tale thrice over already. Is the mutton here yet? I'm right banded, I say...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)And I will tell it over and again, my good captain! After all, it is no small feat to triumph over Karasu─quite possibly the most supremely skilled shinobi our village─nay, our world has ever known!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ye can say that again...wait, ye already have.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: M-My friends! Be on your guard! That Oboro is a fake!

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Wait, what in the...? There's two of 'em!

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)What nonsense is this!? The sheer gall of this man! Clearly, if anyone here is a fake, it is the madman standing in the middle of this fine establishment stripped down to nothing but his undergarments!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: I don't know, Jacke... They both look right convincin' to me...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Which is the true Oboro?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The one in his underclothes.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The one fully dressed.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Aye, Jacke's glazes say the same. Only the real Oboro'd be daft enough to stumble into this place stripped down to his skivvies.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: I wouldn't be so sure o' that, Forename! No, ol' Jacke reckons that one's too dimber to be the real Oboro...

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: (-Oboro-)Oh, fine then. I tire of this drab old disguise, anyhow.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Karasu! Does your villainy know no bounds!?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: Villainy? You wound me, Oboro! Why, after I learned the art of illusion from that overstuffed Lord What's-his-name, I simply thought I would put it to use and have a little fun. We did have fun, didn't we?

dialogue.name: KARASU
dialogue.text: I must say, Oboro, your friends are far more entertaining than you are. I daresay you could learn a thing or two from them. But ah well, I suppose all good things must come to an end. Till we meet again...farewell!

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: ...Off like a crow in the night.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Don't be too hard on yerself, boy. He had us all rooked.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Anyhow, now that all's bob, I reckon it's about time we took our dew beaters to the Sisters. You come along too, Oboro. I'll get ye somethin' to...cover yerself up a bit.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: What do ye say, Forename? I reckon the lad's lookin' sharper than ever.

dialogue.name: PERIMUHAURIMU
dialogue.text: Say what ye will, but Jacke's fashion sense is certainly one of a kind.

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: That's one o' Jacke's favorite outfits. The poor colt...

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Captain Jacke was kind enough to lend me some garb from his personal wardrobe. They are rather, er, how might I describe it...?

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Sophisticated! Stylish! Dashing and delightful!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Did I tell ye or did I tell ye!? Ol' Jacke's got ye lookin' benar than ever before! Every rum doxy in Limsa won't be able to take 'er glazes off ye!

dialogue.name: VKEBBE
dialogue.text: Nor can I...an' not in a good way.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: In any event, I owe you all─especially you, Forename─an apology for this most unfortunate turn of events.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I had thought my plan flawless, but unfortunately I had neglected to account for one thing: the possibility that Karasu's tolerance for Hingan rice wine might be considerably higher than my own.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: I cannot say for sure precisely what happened. All I know is that one moment we were engaged in a most delightful conversation, and the next I was lying on a cot in the hovel with nothing but my undergarments on me.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Suspecting that something was amiss, I dashed back to the dock storehouse as quick as my legs could carry me, only to find neither you nor Karasu present...and my personal wardrobe completely empty, to boot.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Hah! A dimber damber as always, that one. Gettin' you some new duds was one thing, but cloyin' that scroll back from Karasu is goin' to be a whole 'nother matter.

dialogue.name: OBORO
dialogue.text: Damn it all! But mark my words─that scoundrel will not get away with his villainy this time. No, I must return to the storehouse at once and draw up a plan to retrieve what is rightfully mine!

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Ahahaha! For all the lad's whingin', damned if he didn't actually seem pleased with this turn of events.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: Well, Forename. Reckon ye've got adventures ye'd best be gettin' back to, eh? Just promise me ye'll drop in on Oboro and lend him your daddles from time to time. He's a good lad, but he's got a habit of trippin' over his own two dew beaters, if ye whiddle me.

dialogue.name: JACKE
dialogue.text: ...Heh. Now ye've got me soundin' like the boy's father. Anyhow, don't be a stranger here at the Sisters, either. Gods only know we can always use a dimber damber like yerself.

obj.n: 天眼のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ

quest.name: 失われた聖遺物
journal: Judging by the look of relief on Keiten's face, you have saved him a great deal of time.

Walking the streets of Kugane you happen across Keiten, who seems rather relieved to see you. As he explains it, Hancock has been searching for you, and asks that you come to the Ruby Bazaar to discuss an urgent matter.

Hancock speaks with you of the state of affairs in the Empire, and of the disarray that has allowed resistance groups to rise up and fight back. One such group, unfortunately, lacks the means to do so, and has beseeched Lord Hien for assistance. He, in turn, would seek your aid. Unfortunately, Hien can prove difficult to find even at the best of times, which is why Hancock suggests speaking with his attendants at the House of the Fierce.
You arrive at the House of the Fierce, but, as expected, Lord Hien is nowhere to be found. Thankfully, one of his attendants is at the ready, wasting no time in escorting you to him.

Lord Hien introduces you to Marsak, a member of the Bozjan Resistance. To hearten his people, and give them the strength to overcome their Garlean suppressors, he intends to reforge the weapons belonging to Gunnhildr's Blades, the legendary guard of Bozja's ruler from the Third Astral Era. Such an ambitious plan requires great minds and still greater heroes to bring it to fruition, which is why Lord Hien sought you out. Never one to turn away those in need, you agree to help.
Marsak is ready to return to Bozja, and would have you accompany him. He bids you prepare before meeting him at the airship docked at the Doman Enclave.
objectives: Speak with Hancock.
Speak with the Doman attendant at the House of the Fierce in Yanxia.
Speak with the Doman attendant.
Speak with Marsak.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: MiladyMilord! My, what auspicious timing. I intended to send a missive to the Rising Stones, but it seems that is no longer necessary.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: Master Hancock wishes to speak with you regarding a matter of grave import. I can but imagine what other duties yet demand your attention. Still, he would request you meet him at the Ruby Bazaar at your earliest convenience.

dialogue.name: KEITEN
dialogue.text: Master Hancock requests your presence at the Ruby Bazaar at your earliest convenience. Though he would not elaborate, it seems to be a rather pressing matter.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And so shehe returns at last. From what Tataru has told me, you've come rather a long way, to put it mildly.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And while the Scions remained locked in slumber, she sought aid from all corners of the realm. In fact, it was I to whom she first turned when searching for a champion to assist her in your absence.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Though as you have no doubt surmised, I did not call you here to discuss such matters.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: I have received word from Lord Hien that the Bozjan Resistance, our comrades in the Eastern alliance, seek the aid of distinguished heroes in their fight against the Empire, and naturally, your name immediately sprang to mind.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: The Bozjan Resistance, you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I didn't realize they were part of the Eastern alliance.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Indeed, from a small nation found in the southern reaches of Ilsabard, to the west of Dalmasca. They were no doubt among the first to fall to the Empire.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Yet it would seem their hearts have yet to give way to despair. And with the Empire now in disarray, they would seize the opportunity to fight back.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Indeed. Though the city-state has long since fallen to Garlean machinations, the remnants have agreed to join the cause.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And with the Empire now in disarray, they would seize the opportunity to fight back.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: If you would know the details in full, I think it best you speak with Lord Hien. His endless list of commitments makes him a hard man to find, however, so perhaps you can have one of his attendants at the House of the Fierce track him down for you.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Those at the House of the Fierce familiar with Lord Hien's busy schedule may be able to help locate him.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: Greetings, my ladygood sir. Lord Hien has been expecting you.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: When word reached us from the Bozjan Resistance, Lord Hien knew at once there was but one womanman to whom he could turn.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: He left to the Coattails not long ago─the view of Doma Castle helps to calm his mind. This way, if you please.

dialogue.name: DOMAMESSENGER00000
dialogue.text: This way, atop the broken bridge. He will be most glad for your arrival.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Do you remember when first we shared a view of this castle together? Still under the Garleans' control, perhaps, yet for all their wickedness, its beauty would not be so easily sullied.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: It is good to see you, my friend. You must forgive me for forgoing pleasantries, but our guest here is in dire need of your help.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Marsak, of the Bozjan Resistance. A pleasure to make your acquaintance.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: As you have no doubt already heard from Lord Hien, my people seek to reclaim our homeland from the Empire.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Under his auspices, and that of the Eorzean Alliance, we aim to do just that.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: However, we recently received word that the IVth Imperial Legion has been making plans of their own.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: It has long held the provinces of Nagxia, Dalmasca, and Bozja in an iron grip, using its Dalmascan headquarters to house the bulk of its forces.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Until recently, that is.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: They appear to be diverting resources and manpower to their forces stationed in Bozja. In fact, three battalions are en route as we speak.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We thought perhaps to strike before they can fully assemble, but the Bozjan Resistance lacks the means to drive them off on its own.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Aid from the Dalmascan resistance groups may have sufficed. Sadly, even Fran of Lente's Tears has been unable to bring an end to their infighting.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: All hope is not lost, however, for Lord Hien has made a most intriguing proposal.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: An idea not my own, I must confess. We have our old friend Gosetsu to thank.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: As the Empire tightened its grip on Doma, our people were at a crossroads. Would they lay down and surrender, or stand up and fight?

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: You sought me out, that I could become the spark that lit the fire of rebellion.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: The same must be done for the Bozjans.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: They require a standard under which they can rally. A symbol of hope to steel them for what is to come.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Lacking a living figurehead such as Lord Hien, my comrades and I looked to our nation's past for inspiration. There, we found the answer we sought: Gunnhildr's Blades.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: They were the elite guard of Queen Gunnhildr, possessed of weapons blessed by the gods. Their exploits would become legend after defending our peoples against the Allagans in the Third Astral Era.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: The strength of their steel was matched only by their dedication to the queen. Should one lose their life in her service, their holy blade was then passed on to a successor.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: In time, their title would lend itself to the most renowned of their weaponry─the gunblade. But in truth, each member of her guard was master of a unique weapon.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Though these sacred relics have been lost to time, I would see them forged anew! Armed thus, our people would know no fear, and drive back our oppressors just as Queen Gunnhildr did the Allagans.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: An admittedly lofty and otherwise unattainable goal for one such as I. Which is why I have traveled far and wide in search of great minds and greater heroes who might lend us their aid. We would be honored to have one of your renown at our side.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: We value the Bozjans' commitment to the cause, and I would see their plans come to fruition.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, duty demands that I remain here. I could not in good conscience leave knowing the Empire yet threatens the border to Ala Mhigo. Should you choose to accompany him to Bozja, might I ask you also act as a representative of the Eastern alliance in my stead?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Leave it to me.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'll do what I can.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you, my friend. If there is aught else you require of the Eastern alliance, you need only ask. Safe travels to you both.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: An airship to our base has been prepared for us at the enclave's dock. I hope to see you there soon.

obj.n: 楽欲の僧院 オーボンヌ
グンヒルドの剣と「紡ぎ手」

quest.name: グンヒルドの剣と「紡ぎ手」
journal: Marsak is ready to depart.

You agree to lend your strength to the Bozjan Resistance, and Marsak wastes no time in preparing a ship to ferry you to their base of operations. He bids you meet him at the Doman Enclave when you are ready to embark.
You find Marsak waiting for you patiently at the dock. Prepared to depart, you speak with the ferryman who ushers the two of you onto his airship.

No sooner do you arrive at the Resistance camp than you find yourself face-to-face with Bajsaljen, leader of the Bozjan Resistance. He and his comrades explain to you their plan─to reforge the legendary weapons of Gunnhildr's Blades. Despite the scarcity of recordings relating to Queen Gunnhildr and her guard, they have made great strides in reproducing their vaunted arms. The key to their completion is a holy inscription engraved upon them, any traces of which were lost when Bozja Citadel fell many years ago. For their plans to move forward, they have enlisted the aid of an old friend─Mikoto.

In perhaps a few too many words, and a demonstration assisted by Gerolt, Mikoto expounds further on their plans. Borrowing the long-forgotten techniques of Bozjan seers, you must use a special crystal focus to enter the memories of those who may have seen the holy inscription required to reforge Gunnhildr's weapons. The problem, however, is that anyone who had glimpsed the inscription perished when Bozja Citadel was destroyed. Or so they thought. While contemplating the possibility of survivors, Mikoto is struck by a vision of the future. In it, she sees Cid Garlond, convincing her that he is the eyewitness you are searching for.

While strangely reluctant, Bajsaljen understands that Cid Garlond is likely your only hope of forging Gunnhildr's weapons. And so he bids you go to Rhalgr's Reach and speak with the Ironworks engineers there to find him.

Speaking with a fledgling engineer in Rhalgr's Reach, it seems as though Cid is too preoccupied to help. Thankfully, Jessie happens to overhear your conversation and clears up any misconceptions regarding his present commitments. Before taking her leave, Jessie asks that you proceed with caution, fearful of what horrors may be unearthed from Cid's past.
Arrangements have been made for Cid to meet you at the Doman Enclave. As you make your way to meet him, you cannot help but wonder what secrets his memories may hold.
objectives: Speak with the airship pilot at the Doman Enclave.
Speak with Mikoto.
Speak with Bajsaljen.
Speak with the Ironworks engineer at Rhalgr's Reach.
Speak with the Ironworks engineer.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: When you have finished your preparations, meet me at the dock and we can be on our way.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Our destination is Gangos, the Resistance's present base of operations. To ensure we remain unnoticed by the Empire, this ship is one of the few permitted to travel 'twixt Doma and the other provinces. Should you have need to travel to Gangos in the future, I ask you come here to do so.

dialogue.name: AIRSHIPGUIDE
dialogue.text: Coming aboard, misssir?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Travel to Gangos?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: (-???-)That we should play host to the liberator of Doma and Ala Mhigo herselfhimself. I did not think you could be persuaded to help us.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Bajsaljen, leader of the Bozjan Resistance. Not the best choice for the job, if I'm to be frank, but I will bear the title all the same.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Bloody hells, man! Ye won't inspire much confidence speakin' like that!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Haha, you're quite right, Master Gerolt! While you're here, won't you come and welcome our guest?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Huh...? What in the seven hells are you doin' here!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Don't I know ye from somewhere? ...Ah, I know! Yer that lassbloke what saved Eorzea from the Garleans or some such. Forename, was it? What's the matter? Ye look like someone pissed in yer porridge.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Eorzea's greatest hero and her finest blacksmith. With the two of you here, our plan is sure to succeed. Would that Queen Gunnhildr were here to witness this.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, Forename... Just between us? I'm only here to pay off me debts to that black–hearted snake Rowena.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She's been sellin' supplies to the Resistance, and they happened to mention they were in need of a smithy. So she went and told 'em I'm the greatest bleedin' smithy in the realm, with skills that'd put Byregot Himself to shame.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Can't rightly say I'm even half o' what she claimed, but I'll do me damndest. They're happy to ply me with good grub and even better booze, so play along, will ye?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Now that you're both here, I believe it time our plans be made clear. Misija?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Yes, of course. Our goal is to reforge the weapons wielded by Gunnhildr's Blades. Simple in principle, less so in execution.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The weapons themselves and most of the texts denoting the history of Her Majesty and her guard were lost to the devastation of the Fourth Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: That said, we have managed to obtain certain pieces of information, and coupled with Master Gerolt's knowledge and expertise, we have made great strides in reproducing these vaunted blades of eld.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We've worked out the manner o' weapons they wielded, their shape an' weight─even the materials needed for me forge. But we've learned bugger all about what gives 'em spirit.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: It is said Queen Gunnhildr etched a holy inscription into each blade, thus granting them the power of the gods. Unfortunately, no records of any such engravings remain, but there is still hope.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Though naught but pale imitations, there once existed replicas which may very well have borne these inscriptions. Alas, they were lost when Bozja Citadel fell.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Do you know of the Bozja incident?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: It sounds vaguely familiar...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Yes, I do. Though admittedly I do not recall it in detail.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: A bitter chapter in our history, for it would mark the end of Bozja as we knew it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: That a worldly adventurer such as yourself would know of this is of no surprise. If I may, I would share the tragic tale of our homeland.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Fifteen summers past, the Garleans were conducting experiments, seeking a means to make contact with the lesser moon, Dalamud.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: They believed the satellite to be possessed of immense power, and a lunar transmitter was erected in the hopes of harnessing it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: But when the transmitter was activated and the signal sent, Dalamud responded with an immense blast of raw energy. The destruction wrought defied reckoning.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The citadel, the relics of Queen Gunnhildr's kingdom... Naught was left but smoke and ash.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hope ain't lost yet, though. The citadel's been wiped off the bloody map, aye, but there's still a way for us to find those inscriptions. Or so I've been told.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: An explanation better left to one far more knowledgeable than I.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I reckon I'll leave the lass over there to you. Scholarly types like her have a knack for rubbin' me the wrong way, an' I can't hardly understand half o' what they say in the first place.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: 'Tis good to see you again, Forename. Though I had hoped to accomplish more before your arrival.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Wait, don't tell me. Your name is...

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm sure your help will be as invaluable now as it was aboard the Prima Vista.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Have I truly left so little an impression? It is I, Mikoto, of House Jinba. Do you not recall our journey together to Rabanastre?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: You are far too kind. If not for your heroism, Ramza and Alma would have...would have...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: From the onset of our endeavor, it was abundantly clear that one versed in aetherology would be essential. We relayed this to the alliance, who then introduced us to Mikoto. She is said to be one of the most brilliant minds among the Students of Baldesion.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And yet it is my ineptitude that demands your presence here. <sigh> I was all but certain that Gerolt and I alone would suffice in this, alas...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Ahem. The matter she speaks of concerns a long-forgotten practice of the holy men who once inhabited these lands. Utilizing uniquely aspected crystals, these seers were able to provide succor for those with ailments of the mind.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: They possessed the ability to shape their very memories, removing those deemed harmful and replacing them, that the patient may find some semblance of peace.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: I too dismissed the notion that such practices could exist. That is, until a recent excavation unearthed compelling evidence of their work: the crystals we believe were used in their healing.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, we were unable to discern how they are meant to be used. It was at this juncture that we petitioned for Mikoto's assistance.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, lass? Made any progress?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: My initial analysis suggests the crystals were artificially created at some point in the distant past. The materials used suggest they were most likely produced by the ancestral peoples of this area.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: What's more, their aetherial signature is strikingly similar to the oscillatory activity of brain waves which, when made to resonate with the distinct-frequency NRR–type harmonic vibrations of an individual's─ Ah. I've done it again, haven't I?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I think...a simpler approach is in order. Ahem. Every living being is comprised of corporeal aether of the flesh, incorporeal aether of the soul, and the aetherial residue of their memories.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Were one to be possessed of only corporeal aether, they would be but a walking corpse. Conversely, entities comprised of only incorporeal aether are referred to in layman's terms as ghosts. In either case, they may also retain some of their residual memories.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, zombies and ghosts. I follow.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: These crystals are able to isolate and resonate with the aetherial signature of memories. This allowed the seers to probe the minds of their patients.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's all well an' good, lass, but what if their mind ain't what it used to be? Or they was too deep in their cups to remember what yer lookin' for?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: An excellent question, Master Gerolt. We are all possessed of two types of memory─explicit and implicit.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As their names suggest, explicit memories refer to an active remembrance of previous experiences, while implicit memories are acquired and stored passively.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: For example, when making a new acquaintance, their appearance will become part of your explicit memory, allowing you to recall that information. Should a great deal of time pass without meeting, however, such recollection can prove difficult.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Yet in that moment, your mind also takes record of the sounds and smells of the location, the temperature, and so on.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Hmm... Perhaps a demonstration would better explain this phenomenon.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Without a seer?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Don't we need some sort of spell?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Thankfully, that will not be necessary.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: When I was first told of the seers and their practices, I was immediately reminded of your ability to peer into the past.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I believe these people were blessed with a similar gift, and it is for that reason they were chosen to serve as seers.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Though I too am possessed of the Echo, I lack the ability to peer into the past as you do, and thus have been unable to wield the power of these crystals.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's why we called ye here.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Until now I could do naught but posit theories. With your help, however, I may now put them to the proof.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And you, Master Gerolt, shall be my first test subject.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text:
Forename, I would like you to recall the last time you experienced the Echo. Concentrate on that feeling.
Master Gerolt, I need you to recall a memory of the past. It may be anything you like.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye better not go pokin' around in there, diggin' up somethin' unsavory like, ye hear, lass?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Please, Master Gerolt. Focus!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: This is...most unexpected. For reasons I cannot yet explain, it appears the Echo has allowed me to accompany you into his memory.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: You're a skilled smith, Gerolt, there's no denyin' that. But you hold money about as well as your liquor.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well what bloody good is money if ye can't spend it? A man has to live a little, Rowena.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Aye, and it wouldn't hurt for a man to use his head, neither. With all that talent o' yours, I reckon you could've amassed a small fortune by now. Could've been you sittin' on the Syndicate instead o' Godbert.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As if I'd ever want to be anythin' like that dodderin' old, half-dressed─

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Didn't realize me memory was so sharp.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As you can see, implicit memory is surprisingly comprehensive. From the clear skies and ocean waves, down to the exact words of your conversation─everything appears to have been perfectly preserved.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye...ye weren't listenin' to that, were ye?

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Every time someone gives you good advice, you turn around and do the complete soddin' opposite! I used to like that rebellious streak of yours, but now I see you're just a bloody idiot. <sigh> Honestly, I don't know what I ever saw in you.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Whatever it is ye think ye saw, it ain't as if I've changed since then.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: And ye haven't neither... Still as beautiful as the day we met.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Whoa, hold on a minute! I ain't never said anythin' like that! I swear on me last mug of ale!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Implicit memories, while quite comprehensive, are not always true to fact. In the case of painful or otherwise undesirable experiences, they can be obfuscated to protect oneself from hard truths.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Our perception of reality can also distort them as well, even when first committed to the mind. Then, as time passes, such distortions can grow. Happy memories become more joyous, sad ones all the more bitter.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Explicit memory is particularly sensitive to such misrepresentations of events, for man is wont to remember what is most convenient for his worldview. That is why we seek the implicit, for there we are most like to find the truth.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The truth!? Rowena and me were only here a week ago! Don't tell me my memory's that bleedin' unreliable!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: A self-imposed delusion, perhaps. As I said before, the mind has ways of concealing painful memories.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I, er... I ain't feelin' so well. If you'll excuse me.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As you can see, these crystals allow us to choose specific points in a person's past to observe at will. Unlike the Echo, however, what we see will not always be as it really was.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Yet there still remains the matter of finding one who has seen the replica weapons and their inscriptions.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: At this present juncture, we might as well be looking for a ghost.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: After the Garlean invasion of Bozja, it was all but cut off from the world. None were allowed in or out, meaning all of its residents─and likely any who may have glimpsed the weapons─died when the citadel was destroyed.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: ...Hmm. What about soldiers stationed there who were away at the time of the incident? Bah, even if we were able to find them, I doubt they could be persuaded to cooperate.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Ahh!

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: No, please! Lord Varis... Nooo!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: You...saw it too? My visions, they...they are not of what has come to pass...but what is yet to be.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Could it be the crystal allowed us to share my vision as well?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
