Thanks to your efforts and Cid's cooperation, everything is in place to begin reforging the blades of Gunnhildr, arms Gerolt would now refer to as Resistance weapons. Before setting to work, however, Gerolt asks you to expound on your exploration of Cid's mind. This insight makes clear to him that the weapons require a final ingredient before they can be completed─a special powder highly conductive to aether. Much to his dismay, the one best suited to acquiring this for you is none other than Rowena. At the risk of incurring more debt, he asks you to meet with her in Kugane to make an arrangement on behalf of the Bozjan Resistance.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.

Rowena has heard the details of your predicament from Gerolt, and is willing to provide you with the powder you require. It will, however, come at a cost to the Bozjan Resistance. You are unsure of what this means for Bajsaljen and his comrades, but the deal is struck nevertheless. With matters settled in Kugane, you return to Gangos, eager to see the fruits of Gerolt's labor.

Though you are too late to behold the masterful strikes of Gerolt's hammer on his anvil, you are fortunate enough to witness the final touches to the inscription. Armed as one of Gunnhildr's elite guard, you will soon be ready to help liberate the people of Bozja.
objectives: Wait for Rowena at the Umineko Teahouse in Kugane.
Deliver the Thavnairian scalepowder to Gerolt at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Forename Surname? I am Zlatan. It's an honor to meet you. I've not much experience with the forge, but it is my hope that I might improve working under Master Gerolt.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The first step in my training appears to be getting him to remember my name...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer here. Good. Ready to get workin' on the Resistance weapons, lasslad?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Fire in the Forge,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Gerolt again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Ye like the name, “Resistance weapon”?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It crossed me mind to call 'em Gunnhildr's blades, but after talkin' with Misija, we figured it'd be too confusin', seein' as that's also the name o' the queen's guard.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Anyroad, yer timin' couldn't be better. Before we get to workin' in earnest, I was hopin' ye could tell me a bit more about what went on in Cid's noggin. I've heard a fair bit from Mikoto, but I'd like to know if you saw any different.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmm... Sounds like I was right to ask ye before settin' to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems to me those fancy markin's in the weapons are mainly for show. I can copy 'em, aye, but that won't be enough.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Like as not they were carved into the hilts as well. And to make sure the spell can take hold, ye'd need a finish with fine powder what's conductive to aether.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: For material like that, I reckon ye'd need to consult the alchemists o' Radz–at–Han... <sigh> And I can only think o' one person with close contacts there.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Rowena...?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Oh gods, you don't mean...?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, the demoness o' coin.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But not to worry, lasslad. It just so happens she's been keepin' up a steady shipment o' supplies here on contract. If we say we need the powder fer the Resistance, might be as we can convince her to waive the costs.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: She ain't usually one to do business fer charity, I know, but it's worth a try, eh? I'll see about getting in touch with her, and after I do, you can go and meet with her an' figure out the rest.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well ye don't expect me to go and meet with her, do ye? Workin' on the Resistance weapons's kept me too busy by half, and Drake here─ Er, I mean... Uh... What was yer name again?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Zlatan, Master Gerolt. My name is Zlatan. But more importantly, what if Mistress Rowena doesn't agree to a charitable contribution to our cause?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'm sure if you an' Bajsaljen ask her nicely she might come 'round. But never mind that─we've important work to do.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: As fer where to find Rowena, afore she left Gangos, she said she'd be stoppin' over in Kugane on business. How's about I have her meet ye at the Umineko Teahouse? If we're lucky, a nice cup o' tea'll brighten her mood.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Afraid I'll have to leave Rowena to you, lasslad. Me tryin' to bargain with her'd be like squeezin' blood from a stone.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I fear Bajsaljen will not take well to Master Gerolt's plan. But I suppose it is for the sake of the Resistance...

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: (-???-)I was wonderin' when you'd show up. Gerolt told me everything.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: And luckily for you, my business here was at the Thavnairian Consulate. Here you are. This should be enough powder for one of those Resistance weapons you're forgin'.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I've got to hand it to Gerolt. Seems he spends half his time getting deeper in debt, and the other half avoiding payment.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Fine by me, though. Thanks to his schemin' I've a little more leverage over the Resistance and, by extension, him as well.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Pass along a message to Gerolt and Bajsaljen for me, won't you? If they require more material for these weapons, I'd be more than happy to supply them. For a fee, of course.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: Same goes for you. I know you adventurin' types are always lookin' to be prepared for any sort of encounter, so if you're thinkin' of forgin' another of these Resistance weapons─and I suspect you are─you know where to go.

dialogue.name: ROWENA
dialogue.text: I'll see to it my girls in Revenant's Toll and Idyllshire keep their shelves stocked. Until next time.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It has long been our wish to see the blades of Gunnhildr reforged, and it is for that purpose Bajsaljen has agreed to covering the required expenses. I but pray we are ready when Mistress Rowena demands recompense.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The weapon's nearly finished, Forename. Just needs a nice coatin' with that powder to finish the inscription.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: O' course she bloody found what we needed. As much as I hate fattenin' her purse with another man's coin, least now we can do our part fer the Resistance.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Feast yer eyes on some of me finest work to date. Best of all, the inscription'll react to yer aether.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A right fine weapon to rally the Bozjans: [???]. I reckon Gunnhildr'd be proud.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: A right fine sword an' shield to rally the Bozjans: [Error] and [Error]. I reckon Gunnhildr'd be proud.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: That I should behold the glory of the fabled blades born anew... Hope is not yet lost.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: All in a day's work for yer ol' pal Gerolt. 'Course, this is only the beginning.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Your skills with a hammer were truly a sight to behold, Master Gerolt. And to see Forename wielding one of their holy blades thus, it is as if I stand before one of the heroes of eld.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: When the time comes to do battle with the Empire, our brothers-in-arms will look upon you and know courage. On behalf of the Bozjan Resistance, I offer you my humblest thanks for your aid thus far.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'd love to start fresh on another weapon, but I had to use every last morsel o' the powder on that one.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Meaning we would find ourselves indebted further to Mistress Rowena were we to acquire more... I must consult Bajsaljen before we proceed further.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Looks like we're takin' a short break then, eh? If you find yourself wantin' for another weapon, though, come an' speak with me helper here.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I think I've earned meself a nice, big flagon of ale tonight! To, uh...celebrate the forgin', o' course!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A repeatable quest is now available from Zlatan at Gangos. This quest may be accepted to create Resistance weapons for other jobs.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, Thavnairian scalepowder can now be purchased from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

obj.n: シタデル・ボズヤ蒸発事変
新たな「レジスタンス・ウェポン」の製造

quest.name: 新たな「レジスタンス・ウェポン」の製造
journal: Zlatan is gravely concerned by the potential cost of forging additional Resistance weapons.

At the mention of forging additional Resistance weapons, Zlatan's expression turns to one of staggering guilt. Knowing their coffers cannot bear the weight of additional debt, he accedes to your request on the condition that you procure the required powder. How the deed is to be done, he leaves entirely to your discretion.

Through means perhaps better left unspoken, you acquire the requisite powder for Gerolt's work. Newly armed, he bids you set out into the world and hone your skills with this newly fashioned Resistance weapon. And when the time comes, he will help you to reach new heights of martial perfection.
objectives: Obtain Thavnairian scalepowderDeliver the Thavnairian scalepowder to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Resistance Is (Not) Futile,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: You wish to forge another Resistance weapon? We do have a surplus of materials from the first, but there still remains the matter of the powder.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: When we first resolved to undertake the forging of these weapons, we understood it would come at considerable cost. But it is no exaggeration to say that a single weapon has greatly taxed our coffers.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It shames me to ask this after you have done so much for our cause, but... Might we prevail upon you to procure the powder on our behalf?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hopefully, acquiring the means to barter for additional powder shouldn't be too taxing a task for a worldly adventurer such as yourself.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: You wish to forge another Resistance weapon? Oh dear...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It will take time, but we should be able to gather the required materials. Save for one... If you would be willing to acquire more powder, we will see to the rest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thavnairian scalepowder can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: My apologies for placing such a burden on you, but we simply cannot afford to accrue further debt from Mistress Rowena.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Thavnairian scalepowder can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I take it you have paid visit to the House of Splendors?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Excellent. I will have Master Gerolt set to work at once.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Linin' Rowena's pockets again... <sigh>

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Better your coin than the Bozjans' I suppose. If yer sure about this, we'll get to finishin' yer weapon.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Some o' me best work, if I do say so meself. [???]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Some o' me best work, if I do say so meself. I call 'em [Error] and [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If what we've learned about the blades o' Gunnhildr is true, ye can make 'em stronger dependin' on what manner o' monster you felled with 'em. Should hold true for yers as well.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So once ye've put 'emher through theirher paces, come back an' I'll see about toughenin' 'emher up.

quest.name: 荒鷲の巣作戦
journal: The look of resolve in Marsak's eyes tells you the time for battle draws near.

The rebirth of Gunnhildr's Blades has sparked a fire within the Resistance, their forces drawing ever closer to Castrum Lacus Litore. Having recently reclaimed Utya's Aegis, an outpost on the southern front, Marsak has asked Sjeros to escort you there, that you might assess the situation for yourself.
With little preamble, Sjeros agrees to guide you to Utya's Aegis, where Bajsaljen plans to introduce you to a rather remarkable group of soldiers.

Bajsaljen is proud to present to you the new Gunnhildr's Blades, though the members present do not comprise the guard in its entirety. The remaining members have already taken to the field, laboring to advance the front line toward the castrum. Having thus explained the situation, it occurs to Bajsaljen that you have yet to see the fortress with your own eyes. Seeking to rectify this, he invites you to look out over the battlefield and behold the object of their struggles.

As you look upon the castrum, towering in the distance, Bajsaljen speaks to you of their initiative to reclaim it, Operation Eagle's Nest. Before you join his troops in the field, however, he asks that you speak with Mikoto.

You find Mikoto in the company of Misija, and they have exciting news to share─an analysis of the crystal focus has proven that it can be recharged. The problem, however, is the means to do so requires infiltrating imperial territory. Nevertheless, plans to restore the crystal focus are well underway. Plans that will require your assistance to succeed.
Mikoto appears fearful of the dangers yet to come, but she understands that you both must do what needs be done. She bids you safe travels as you ready to brave the Bozjan southern front.
objectives: Speak with Sjeros.
Make for the Bozjan southern front and speak with Bajsaljen.
Speak with Bajsaljen.
Speak with Mikoto.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: It is good to see you, my friend. Though it came at great cost, I am pleased to say Master Gerolt has succeeded in reforging the weapons of Gunnhildr's Blades. Indeed, the queen's illustrious guard has at last been reborn.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: When the deed was done, word quickly spread to every faction of the Bozjan Resistance. As we had hoped, it has reaffirmed their resolve to press on and see our home returned to its former glory.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: In fact, our troops have already reclaimed Utya's Aegis, an outpost in the Bozjan southern front. When you are ready, I would ask you make for the front lines to better assess the situation for yourself. Sjeros can show you the way.

dialogue.name: SERAOUSH
dialogue.text: Ah, Blade Surname. I've been expecting you. If you'll come with me.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now travel to the Bozjan southern front. The battle for Bozja may be joined in parties of up to eight players, or solo.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that all ventures to the front lines of battle are item level synced. Gear exceeding an item level of [#1] will be adjusted.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I am glad you could join us, Blade Surname, and not a moment too soon.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Allow me to introduce to you Gunnhildr's Blades!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text:
High mage Xeven, master of flames. The fury of his art rivals even the fieriest hells.
Isolde, the eagle eye. In brightest day or darkest night, no enemy will escape her sight.
Stanik, the unwavering blade of Bozja. The foes dashed against his shield are beyond counting.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text:
Velibor, the baleful blade. His unbridled fury can fell entire cadres with a single stroke.
Aggie, the iron fist of Bozja. A young prodigy whose martial skills put even those most seasoned veterans to shame.
Blaz, the merciful blade. No foe, however terrible, will dissuade his blade from finding its mark.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Rest assured, this is not the guard in its entirety. A number have already taken to the field and would benefit greatly from your presence, if you are willing.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: With Gunnhildr's Blades and the Warrior of Light leading the charge, it is only a matter of time before Castrum Lacus Litore is ours.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, I believe you have yet to see the castrum. If you'll follow me, I'll show you the object of our struggle here on the southern front.

dialogue.name: XEVEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. It is an honor and privilege to make your acquaintance. I very much look forward to fighting at your side in the days to come.

dialogue.name: ISOLDE
dialogue.text: Pleased to meet you, Blade Surname. When the battle is joined, rest assured Gunnhildr's Blades will be at your back.

dialogue.name: STANIK
dialogue.text: Hahaha, at last we meet, Blade Surname. Let us give the imperials a good thrashing, yes?

dialogue.name: BLAZ
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. You honor us with your presence. Though my ancestors hail from Doma, Bozja is my home. With you at our side, I am confident we will see it free.

dialogue.name: VELIBOR
dialogue.text: It is good to have you with us, Blade Surname. A warrior after my own heart, if the tales of your renown are true. When the fighting starts, I will be sure not to get in your way. I trust you will show me the same courtesy?

dialogue.name: AGGIE
dialogue.text: An honor to meet you, misssir. Never in my wildest dreams did I think I would be chosen for such a duty, but I won't let you down! Promise!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There it is. Castrum Lacus Litore, to use the Garlean moniker.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Its true name is Alermuc, which means “eagle” in Bozjan, as they too once made their home in these mountains. To our people they are a symbol of strength and good fortune, both of which were sorely needed when the Empire first invaded.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But we needn't dwell on past failings. Now we have a chance to reclaim what is rightfully ours. To remind the people what it is we stand to gain, I have chosen to call this initiative “Operation Eagle's Nest.”

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Like the great eagle we must strike hard and swift. And with you at our side, I have no doubt we shall see this through to a glorious end.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But before you rush into battle, I believe Mikoto wished to discuss the crystal focus with you. Good tidings, perhaps?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Mikoto requested you speak with her as soon as possible. Something to do with the crystal focus, I believe.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I have rather exciting news to share. As you may recall, the energies of the crystal focus were spent on our exploration of Cid's memories.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: After careful analysis, we have concluded that it can, in fact, absorb aether in a similar fashion to the auracite we discovered in Ivalice.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: This assumes, of course, we have a suitable source of energy matching its aetherial frequency.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: And therein lies the problem. Crystals bearing such a specific aetherial signature are quite rare. We could never hope to amass the quantities needed.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Were we to locate an aether current of the correct frequency, however, charging the focus would be a matter of course. Unfortunately, such currents exist only in regions of Bozja rife with imperials.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Mikoto wished to wait until the fighting died down, but as I explained to her before, time is a luxury we can ill afford.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I'm sure you understand better than anyone that the bloodshed will only cease when a victor is decided, the death toll climbing ever higher on both sides.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The horrors of this war weigh heavy on the hearts of our people.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: A burden which could be eased were we able to employ the crystal focus, healing wounds not of the flesh, but of the mind.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Plans to locate an aether current are well underway, but I suspect your help would see them expedited. Might we ask for your assistance in this endeavor?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Pressed for time as we are, Cid has already begun work on a monitoring device to locate a sufficient source of aether.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I would join him and see to the final preparations. In the meantime, I would ask the two of you to investigate a location I believe to be near an aether current.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Sorry for interrupting, but a few of our soldiers wished to have a quick word before you depart. I expect their intelligence will prove useful when you're in the field.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCERECORDER
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. Might I speak with you before you leave for the southern front? Of course, I can wait until you've concluded your business with Miss Mikoto.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text:
I appreciate your willingness to help, but must you always place yourself in such peril?
...I'm sorry. I understand you only do what must be done.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: We all have our roles to play, and I promise to fulfill mine as best I can. Stay safe out there, won't you?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Speak with the Resistance secretariat or Sjeros to learn more about battle on the Bozjan southern front.

obj.n: シタデル・ボズヤ蒸発事変

quest.name: 「クリティカルエンゲージメント」に挑め
journal: Dmitar has a plan to thin out the enemy ranks.
objectives: Defeat 4th Legion slashers.
Defeat 4th Legion nimrods.
Speak with Dmitar.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Greetings, Blade Surname. I take it you will soon be joining the others on the southern front, yes?

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Though my duties have kept me here for the most part, I have heard tell of the carnage wrought in battle by enemy soldiers and their warmachina.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Indeed, the imperials often prefer to wait until their intended target has been weakened before sending more troops to deliver the final blow. Yet for all their cunning, they are remarkably predictable.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Let us suppose you destroyed one of their warmachina, and the enemy receives word of your victory. They would no doubt assume the effort has left you exhausted, perhaps even badly wounded. A perfect opportunity to send reinforcements and overwhelm you.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: But what if, unbeknownst to them, we are prepared for the arrival of these additional troops? It would be an opportunity to further diminish their ranks.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: I would ask you venture out onto the battlefield and fell two 4th Legion nimrods and two 4th Legion slashers.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Should they decide to send reinforcements, there will be no element of surprise to favor them.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By defeating warmachina on the Bozjan southern front, there is a chance to initiate critical engagements, which are special encounters limited to a small number of participants.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Victory in critical engagements will increase your mettle, as well as earn you various spoils.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Should you happen upon a critical engagement and wish to join, you can participate by selecting the mission via the Resistance Recruitment window.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: It should take no more than the defeat of two 4th Legion nimrods and two 4th Legion slashers to draw the Garleans' attention. And when they come, we will be ready for them.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned, and none the worse for wear, I see. I expect that's more than we can say for any imperials who dared cross your path!

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: But enough about them. I wish to ask if you noticed any peculiar crystalline objects in your time on the battlefield. Bozjan clusters, we call them.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: The Bozja incident wrought a most unexpected change in the land, which we believe is what caused these clusters to appear. Our quartermaster would have any samples we can find for further study into this phenomenon.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: We haven't much, but you can be certain she will see you rewarded for anything you can offer.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon defeating warmachina, there is a chance you will obtain Bozjan clusters.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: These clusters can be exchanged with the Resistance quartermaster to gain priority when players are selected for participation in critical engagements. They may also be exchanged for various goods.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: If you don't mind my asking, have you taken time to report to my commanding officer?

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Considering all you've done to help us thus far, I'd say you've more than proven your mettle. He's certain to want to hear about all you've done out there.

quest.name: 「ロストアクション」を放て
journal: Dmitar would share news of a peculiar find in the southern front.
objectives: Obtain a forgotten fragmentDeliver the forgotten fragment to Dmitar.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Resistance rank can be increased by reporting to the Resistance commander after earning sufficient mettle.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: You've come at a good time, Blade Surname. I have a rather interesting report to share with you.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: While out on reconnaissance, our scouts happened upon relics we confirmed once belonged to Gunnhildr's Blades!

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: It was long believed the queen's guard possessed crystals within which they stored the knowledge of their fighting techniques, and this discovery has removed all doubt. These forgotten fragments, as we call them, may very well turn the tide of the war in our favor.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: You see, much to our surprise, Master Gerolt claims to have experience working with similar crystals, and believes that the memories contained within can be extracted.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: He has set fast to work on a means to do so, and assured us it won't be long before their secrets are revealed to us.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: With their weapons and techniques at your command, you would be a true successor to the legacy of Gunnhildr's Blades.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: This assumes you are able to procure more of these fragments, of course.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Judging by our scouts' report, it will not be an easy task. It would appear that, wherever they could be found, formidable beasts were not far behind.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Still, it may prove beneficial to rid the battlefield of such creatures, not only for the sake of our fellow soldiers, but for the chance to acquire any fragments that may be in the vicinity. I wish you the best of luck.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Unidentified forgotten fragments can be obtained from felling monsters in the wild, as well as from skirmishes and critical engagements. They can also be traded or sold on the market board.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: If you can find even a single fragment, we can begin the next step.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Unidentified forgotten fragments can be obtained from felling monsters in the wild, as well as from skirmishes and critical engagements. They can also be traded or sold on the market board.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: How did you fare searching for forgotten fragments?

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Well done, Blade Surname! Well done, indeed.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Now, before you can begin the extraction process, these shards must first be appraised so that we can tell what sort of memories they contain.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Henceforth, be sure to hand any fragments you find to one of our appraisers.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: In fact, one of them is stationed by that tent over there.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Actions extracted from forgotten fragments are stored in the lost finds cache.

obj.n: 未鑑定ロストシャード:新鋭
未鑑定ロストシャード:支援
未鑑定ロストシャード:強化
「クリティカルエンゲージメント」に挑め

quest.name: 荒鷲よ、舞い上がれ
journal: Dmitar has exciting news to share from the southern front.
objectives: Speak with Dmitar.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Blade Surname! We received word from the field─the Empire's forces have fallen back!

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: In fact, our troops have pushed forward far enough as to claim an enemy encampment near the southern entrenchment.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: My commanding officer has instructed me to give you a brief tour of the site at your earliest convenience. I will await you there.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Welcome to Olana's Stand. If you wish to travel between here and Utya's Aegis, feel free to use that aetheryte shard over there. I would suggest attuning to it before you leave.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: And one last thing: while we've made great strides in our fight against the Empire, there's still much to be done before we can retake Castrum Lacus Litore.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: I expect the enemy will only grow more determined as we advance forward, but we must press on. For Bozja!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Resistance front line advances, allowing you to participate in new skirmishes and critical engagements.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Mikoto after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.

obj.n: 未鑑定ロストシャード:熟練
未鑑定ロストシャード:治癒
未鑑定ロストシャード:催眠

quest.name: 覗覚石と観測装置
journal: Mikoto and Misija are ready to put their plan into action.
objectives: Survey the designated area.
Investigate the designated location.
Speak with Mikoto.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Apologies for the delay, but as you can see, the aether-monitoring devices have finally arrived.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Oh my, Forename! Suddenly, I'm glad the chief insisted I make the delivery.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I believe you and Miss Mikoto ordered these? The spectrometer needs a touch more fine-tuning, but it should be ready in no time at all.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: The sensors are to be placed at key locations close to the largest aether currents in the region. Once Lilja has finished making the final adjustments to the spectrometer, we can activate them remotely and isolate the aetherial signature we are looking for.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: It may seem somewhat far-fetched, but the theory is sound. Think of the aether currents as streams flowing underground which, at certain locations, converge into larger rivers. The streams can prove quite difficult to trace. The rivers, less so.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: As you might imagine, because these rivers are a confluence of myriad streams, it is no simple task to filter out and extract aether of a specific frequency.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Which is why before anything can be done, we first need a thorough analysis of the aether flowing through these larger currents.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Once the signature we're after has been isolated, we can then trace it back to its source.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: One current flows here under this very camp. After setting sensors at two additional sites, we should be able to gather enough data to isolate the desired signature.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Once traced back to its source, we should find something of a reservoir. Hopefully with suitable stores of aether to charge the crystal focus.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, the two remaining sites where we intend to place sensors are presently points of conflict with the Empire.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Might we ask that you go and set them?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I'll mark the locations on your map.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Once the sensors are in place, use this linkpearl to contact us.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I know this all sounds rather hazardous, but if anyone can make a success of this plan, it's you!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Looking about the area, there seems to be no way to cross the ravine. If you would reach the site of the aether current, you must enlist further aid from the Resistance.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Cross the ravine?

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Cross the ravine?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Initiating the data collection protocol.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)We've confirmed activity on our end. The sensor has burrowed into the ground, yes?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: (-Mikoto-)Excellent. The rest we can handle from here. Return to base, and be careful.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. With the first sensor in place, Misija can begin... Wait, where did she...?

dialogue.name: HROTHGARSOLDIER03946
dialogue.text: ...And why is it that you get to stay here, safe and sound, while the rest of us throw our lives away out there?

dialogue.name: HROTHGARSOLDIER03946
dialogue.text:
Oh, how she must have begged and pleaded for the commander to let her stay.
“Please, Commander Bajsaljen, don't make me go. I'll do anything to remain here at camp!”
Pathetic...

dialogue.name: HROTHGARSOLDIER03946
dialogue.text: Though I suppose you've never been one above begging, have you?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: We'll see who's begging when I gut you like a fish.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: That's enough! All of you!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Our fight is with the Empire, not our brothers- and sisters-in-arms.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Should I hear so much as a whisper of such demeaning remarks again, you will find judgment not before a court-martial, but here before my blade's edge. Am I understood?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Misija!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Let me speak with them. I'm certain they did not mean to make such crass remarks.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: So you would defend them, then?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Not as such, but you know how soldiers can be, especially those of supposedly gentle blood. They probably think of it as idle banter, is all.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: You and I are from different worlds, Marsak.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Overhear them, did you? <sigh> What an embarrassment.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Those buffoons are an unfortunate reminder of our past. You see, Bozja rose above its humble beginnings to become a prosperous nation, due in no small part to contributions of the nobility. To outsiders, it exemplified the qualities of an ideal republic. Appearances can be deceiving, however...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: The disparity between nobles and commoners proved a chasm that could never be filled. Even under imperial rule, vestiges of that great divide would remain.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: I wished to believe everyone shared my vision of a unified Bozja, where all are equal in dignity and rights. But there are those who long for the status and privilege of that supposed golden era, when wealth and power were one and the same.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: And for every one of the “haves,” there were a thousand “have-nots.” Misija's family was of the latter. As a child, she walked for hours each day to and from school in the hope of a better life. The imperials recognized her dedication, and saw fit to educate her.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Her talent has earned her no small amount of envy from her peers. Nevertheless, she is a faultless example of what a good soldier should be. That anyone would take her being lowborn as justification for ridicule is absurd. I will not stand for it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Might I ask that you keep this between us? While I am loath to sweep such matters under the rug, to address them here and now could very well undermine all we have fought so hard to achieve.

dialogue.name: AMIGART
dialogue.text: Can you believe Bajsaljen and Marsak, espousing this nonsense about dignity and equality. Do they honestly expect us to forget our lineage? All that our forebears had achieved before it was taken by the Empire?

dialogue.name: ZWYNBHRUDA
dialogue.text: I understand your pain, my friend, but for now we must hold our tongues. Wait for our moment. When the Empire is at last driven out, then we can deal with Bajsaljen and the others.

dialogue.name: VORON
dialogue.text: We've been made to mingle with these baseborn bastards long enough. It is our right to govern this new Bozja, and the commander must be made to understand that.

dialogue.name: AMIGART
dialogue.text: Oh... Blade Surname! Have you need of something? We wished to speak privately, if you don't mind.

dialogue.name: ZWYNBHRUDA
dialogue.text: Is there, uh... Is there something you need, misssir? If not, we really should be leaving for the front lines.

dialogue.name: AMIGART
dialogue.text: You were responsible for reviving Gunnhildr's Blades, were you not? I've been meaning to offer you my thanks. The people of Bozja appreciate all you've done for us.

dialogue.name: VORON
dialogue.text: I look forward to fighting at your side to drive out those imperial bastards. We'll show them, won't we?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: The very moment our analysis of the aether current is complete, you will be the first to know.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Though I am afraid we must ask you to delve deeper into enemy territory to reach the next site.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: A fool's errand unless we can drive the Empire's forces back further. I trust we can count on your assistance in that regard?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Of course we can! At least, I think so. We can...right?

quest.name: 第三の地脈
journal: Mikoto has located another aether current.
objectives: Investigate the designated location.
Speak with Mikoto.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to accept this quest.

dialogue.name: AMIGAR
dialogue.text: Can you believe Bajsaljen and Marsak, espousing this nonsense about dignity and equality. Do they honestly expect us to forget our lineage? All that our forebears had achieved before it was taken by the Empire?

dialogue.name: ZWYNBHRUDA
dialogue.text: I understand your pain, my friend, but for now we must hold our tongues. Wait for our moment. When the Empire is at last driven out, then we can deal with Bajsaljen and the others.

dialogue.name: VORON
dialogue.text: We've been made to mingle with these baseborn bastards long enough. It is our right to govern this new Bozja, and the commander must be made to understand that.

dialogue.name: AMIGART
dialogue.text: Oh... Blade Surname! Have you need of something? We wished to speak privately, if you don't mind.

dialogue.name: ZWYNBHRUDA
dialogue.text: Is there, uh... Is there something you need, misssir? If not, we really should be leaving for the front lines.

dialogue.name: AMIGART
dialogue.text: You were responsible for reviving Gunnhildr's Blades, were you not? I've been meaning to offer you my thanks. The people of Bozja appreciate all you've done for us.

dialogue.name: VORON
dialogue.text: I look forward to fighting at your side to drive out those imperial bastards. We'll show them, won't we?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Your timing is perfect as always. We've just located a third current.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I'll mark the destination on your map. This third site should provide us ample data to trace an ideal aetherial signature.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I should also mention this site is host to ancient Bozjan ruins. Our data suggests they date back to the Third Astral Era, but I cannot say for certain. What I can say is the undead are known to roam the lands there at night, so stay on your guard.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I wish I could accompany you, but I would only slow you down. Please, be careful out there.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: (-Misija-)Very good. Starting data collection protocol.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: (-Misija-)All systems are fully operational. You're free to return to camp.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Ah. Welcome back, Forename.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: From what we can discern, the sensors are still fully operational, but the spectrometer is not receiving any of their data.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: One of the contact plugs to the transmitter appears to be damaged. I can fix it, but in all honesty, it would probably be faster to get a new one from our facility in Doma.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Shall I head to Doma, then?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Leave it to me!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I'll hear none of that! Running errands is my job, not yours.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: If it's all the same to you, I think it best if I go. There's still work for you to do here, Lilja.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Are you sure?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: So long as the control panel is broken, there is naught else I can do. What's more, this affords me the opportunity to finally see Doma.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Well, who am I to deny you your first trip there? I'll let Jessie know you're on your way.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: All right. A new contact plug is ready and waiting for Misija. Sure was nice of her to save me the trip back.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Having her around to help has truly been a blessing. I dare not think how long it would have taken to analyze the crystal focus, let alone locate the aether currents.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And of course, your contributions to the Resistance have been invaluable as well. Once the spectrometer is operational again, it won't be long before the crystal focus is working. I'm sure of it.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, at the ruins of Bozja...

dialogue.name: IMPERIALCAPTAIN03943
dialogue.text: Hurry, now. The commander hasn't all day.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: At last, the lady of blades... Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Simply exquisite. Time has done little to mar her beauty.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALPATROL03943
dialogue.text: We've captured an intruder, sir. We believe them to be of the Resistance.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Stand aside.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALPATROL03943
dialogue.text: ...Sir?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALCAPTAIN03943
dialogue.text: You heard the commander! Stand aside or I'll report you for insubordination!

dialogue.name: IMPERIALPATROL03943
dialogue.text: S-Sir!

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Is this indeed the blade we have been searching for?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Yes, there can be no doubt. Only the blade of the queen herself bore these inscriptions.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Then our plans proceed apace... Excellent.

dialogue.name: IMPERIALCAPTAIN03943
dialogue.text: Sir, I've just received word from Sicinius. They...they've found it.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Very good. Then let us return to Castrum Lacus Litore.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Another relic?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Nothing for you to concern yourself with, my dear.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Y-Yes, of course. Forgive me.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: I trust your absence will go unnoticed?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Sir. I tampered with the spectrometer per your instructions, permitting me the opportunity to leave their base. I will return after a brief trip to Doma.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Well done. Legatus Gabranth will be certain to hear of your deeds thus far.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: But lest you forget, though victory is close at hand, any mistakes will have dire consequences. Am I understood?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Yes, sir!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I'm afraid it will be a while longer before the spectrometer is operational. But never fear. You will be the first to know when we are ready to resume our work.

quest.name: 荒鷲よ、翔け抜けよ
journal: Dmitar has more good tidings to share from the southern front.
objectives: Speak with Dmitar.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: I am happy to report our soldiers have dealt another heavy blow to the Empire's forces.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: Our front line has again pushed forward, and seized another outpost at Old Bozja. My commanding officer has asked that I take you to the site. If you would follow me.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: This is Lunya's Stand. The Garleans made us work for it, but it's finally ours.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: If we can continue to keep pressure on the Empire's forces, I imagine they will have no choice but to retreat back to the castrum ere long.

dialogue.name: DMITAR
dialogue.text: That means we've no time to rest on our laurels. They're certain to do all in their power to slow our advance. I hope we can count on you to keep fighting the good fight.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The Resistance front line advances, allowing you to participate in new skirmishes and critical engagements.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The next quest can be accepted by speaking with Mikoto after reaching Resistance rank [#1] or higher.

obj.n: 未鑑定ロストシャード:献身
未鑑定ロストシャード:暗殺

quest.name: エーテルスポット
journal: The look of satisfaction on Mikoto's face suggests all is going according to plan.

Mikoto and Misija have at last found a suitable source of aether to charge the crystal focus. Its extraction will prove to be a delicate process, which is why Mikoto insists that they accompany you to the site.

You reach the extraction site only to find your two companions being assailed by Garlean soldiers. Weapon in hand, you rush in and give the imperials a terrible thrashing, forcing them to make a hasty retreat. The danger passed, you check to see if Mikoto and Misija are injured.

With the extraction device ready, Mikoto sets the crystal focus in place, patiently waiting for its reserves of aether to be restored. After a few moments, Misija removes the focus from the device, confusing Mikoto. Her confusion quickly turns to panic, however, when Misija draws a gun on her, ordering you to lower your weapon. Unwilling to risk Mikoto coming to harm, you do as you are told. In a flash, Misija and Mikoto are gone, along with the crystal focus.

You return to camp, alone and empty-handed, much to the dismay of Bajsaljen and the others. For lack of soldiers to pursue Misija and rescue Mikoto, Bajsaljen believes their best course of action is to proceed as planned and storm Castrum Lacus Litore.
Resistance scouts have yet to find any sign of Mikoto, but it is no reason to give up hope. When the castrum falls, Bajsaljen is hopeful Mikoto's rescue will follow shortly after.
objectives: Rendezvous with Mikoto.
Rescue Mikoto.
Speak with Bajsaljen.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: It worked, Forename. We've found a matching aetherial signature and traced it back to its source!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Lilja is working on a device that will allow us to charge the crystal focus using the area's ambient aether.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As you might expect, its extraction will be delicate work. As such, we would accompany you to oversee the operation ourselves. Shall we be off?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: ...We were too careless.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Ugh... My head...

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: My apologies, Forename. Our preoccupation with the extraction device left us all but oblivious to their approach. It will not happen again.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)Are you all right? I heard screaming.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: An ambush by the Garleans. Thankfully Forename arrived before we came to harm.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)<sigh> Another missed opportunity to see herhim in action. At least you're all unharmed.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Lilja, have we reached our destination?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I'm picking up a huge rise in levels of NR-G108 waves. It's definitely the place.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Then let us begin.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: How much longer until its energies are fully restored?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: An excellent question, but unfortunately a rather difficult one to answer with certainty.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Considering the high concentrations of aether it has absorbed thus far, I would imagine it has sufficient stores to suit our purposes. We must be mindful, however, that the naturally occurring aether of this location will take time to restore itself should we need to charge the focus again.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Again? No... I don't think that will be necessary.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Pardon?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: One false move and she dies!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Misija? What... What are you doing!?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Oh, don't worry. I still have need of you yet.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Though if shehe refuses to stand down...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: A wise decision.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: B-But... It doesn't make any sense! Why would she...?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: She did what!? No... No, I cannot believe it!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: By the gods... And you say she stole the crystal focus as well?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: I fear we have little time to determine the how and why of her betrayal. Mikoto's rescue must be made a priority.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Be that as it may, Misija may not have been working alone. I need you to bring me a list of any close acquaintances she had within the Resistance. I have questions for them...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Yes, sir!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If I am to be completely honest with you, we haven't the troops to spare for Mikoto's rescue. We're stretched far too thin as it is.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But we cannot very well leave her to the mercy of the Empire. That they would capture her alive suggests a plan requiring her expertise and preternatural gifts.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Until we can determine precisely where she is being held, I believe what few resources we have would be best focused on storming Castrum Lacus Litore.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Once the castrum falls, her safety can be more easily assured. We will focus all our efforts on her rescue thereafter. You have my word.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, at Castrum Lacus Litore...

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: ...And I'm tired of sitting about with our thumbs up our arses!

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Why wait for reinforcements when we could wipe the Bozjan Resistance off the board in one fell swoop? Even with just the troops stationed here at the castrum, they wouldn't stand a chance!

dialogue.name: ALBIREO
dialogue.text: You have already demonstrated gross insubordination by leading charges into the field against orders. Soldiers have been court-martialed for far less, and such behavior ill befits one of your station.

dialogue.name: ALBIREO
dialogue.text: I need not remind you that our true objective is the subjugation of Dalmasca and the seizure of its resources, not to engage in petty skirmishes with these Bozjan curs.

dialogue.name: ALBIREO
dialogue.text: They will be dealt with in due course, but only once the Dalmascan resistance has been annihilated.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Who do you think you're talking to, boy? I know full well that we need to bring Dalmasca to heel, and I've said from the beginning that invading Bozja was a waste of time. The sooner we get this over with, the better.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: A waste of time... Yet who was it front and center during the invasion? I hope you have not forgotten the soldiers you sacrificed for the sake of this “waste of time.”

dialogue.name: ALBIREO
dialogue.text: Retaining our foothold here is essential to our plans. Now that Doma and Ala Mhigo have reclaimed their independence, the Bozjans have been inspired to follow suit. Should they succeed, the Dalmascans will be next. We cannot hope to withstand a united resistance from all sides.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Don't waste your breath, Albeleo. The only thing this rabid dog understands is bloodshed.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Watch your tongue, or it's your blood that'll be shed next.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Snarl at me all you like, but there's no escaping the truth─the Empire is doomed to fall, and before long the IVth Legion will have no home to return to.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Your point being...?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: If Gabranth is to build his new nation, we have to regain control of these provinces.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Well, you know our dear boy Noah better than most. And I'm sure you've made plans of your own for this new nation he's building.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: I don't appreciate your tone. Are you implying that I would betray his trust?

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Oh, would you stop? If anyone hates this pedantic pageantry more than me, it's you.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Perhaps. But so long as I have a hand to play, am I wrong to keep it?

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: That's the way of it, eh? Fine, stay here and hatch your schemes. My place is on the battlefield.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: Very well, if that is your wish. But when the dust settles, and the judgment bells toll, I pray you will be ready to answer for your transgressions.

dialogue.name: ALBIREO
dialogue.text: Are you certain this is wise?

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: A dog he may be, but he is not without his uses. I daresay there is none more loyal to Gabranth and the IVth Legion. What's more, he is not so foolish as to seek out the false glory of an honorable death in battle.

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: He and his beasts should prove an adequate distraction for our enemies. In the meantime, I leave the castrum in your hands. Should the Bozjans advance this far, I trust you will not disappoint me.

dialogue.name: ALBIREO
dialogue.text: By your leave.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Our scouts have yet to find any trace of Mikoto, but I promise we will bring her back safely. For now, let us focus our efforts on retaking the castrum.

obj.n: 未鑑定ロストシャード:決意
未鑑定ロストシャード:祝福

quest.name: リリヤ、奮闘する！
journal: Lilja appears lost in thought, but you are certain there is only one thing on her mind.
objectives: Investigate the designated location.
Speak with Lilja.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Listen, Forename. I don't want to get your hopes up, but I think I know how to find Mikoto.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: You said Misija waited until after the crystal focus had absorbed aether from the area before making off with it and Mikoto, right?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Well, if we can use this equipment to trace the aetherial signature of the charged crystal focus, maybe it will lead us to Mikoto too. That's assuming, of course, they're being kept in the same place.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: We're going to want to cover the entire southern front, and for that, at least two more sensors need to be set up out there. Think you're up to it?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: I found two spots that should give us maximum coverage. Here, let me mark them on your map. I know it's a long shot, but we have to try...right?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Gods, I hope this works...

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)All set? Then I'll start up the remote scanner.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)That should do it. One more, and with any luck we'll track down the crystal focus and Mikoto.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)Perfect! Come back to base, and I'll see if I can't track down the crystal focus.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)All set? Then I'll start up the remote scanner.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)That should do it. One more, and with any luck we'll track down the crystal focus and Mikoto.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: (-Lilja-)Perfect! Come back to base, and I'll see if I can't track down the crystal focus.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: ...Ah. You're back.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Trouble tracking down the crystal focus?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: What's wrong? Do we need another sensor?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: No. No, everything went according to plan. I managed to locate the crystal focus.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: The thing is...

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: It is as we feared. The crystal focus is being held at the castrum.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Makes sense when you think about it, what with it being the enemy's main stronghold and all. Sorry for wasting your time out there, Forename.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Nonsense, Lilja. For all we knew, the focus could have very well been moved to Dalmasca.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: But thanks to you and Blade Surname, we have removed all doubt as to its whereabouts.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: That's true, I suppose.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: The reason for Misija's betrayal yet eludes us, but the Garleans are not like to understand how to make use of the crystal focus. Not without assistance.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Meaning Mikoto is, in all likelihood, being held at the castrum as well.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Then there's still a chance to save her...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, at Castrum Lacus Litore...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Yes, over there.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: <groan>

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Misija...? Where...?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: You're going to answer a few questions for me. We can start with how you are able to glimpse into the future.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Misija... Why? Why are you helping the Empire?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I'm the one asking the questions here. Now answer!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: No. Not until you tell me why.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I don't think you understand your situation here. Or are you truly that naive?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Is it for power? Renown? Have you always been on their side?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I know you, Misija. You're a woman of conviction, and you wouldn't do something like this without good reason.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: If you know me as well as you say, I would hazard you already have the answer.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: ...You would truly place your faith in Noah van Gabranth?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I've read about him and his father, the famed knights from the Republic of Landis. They say he was a man of vision.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: He was made legatus of the IVth Imperial Legion, and from what intelligence I could gather, he pays no heed to the race, parentage, or creed of his followers.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And that same impartial judgment extends to the provinces under his control, if I am not mistaken. Havens for those seeking a life free of prejudice and hate.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: But do you truly believe equality can be found under an imperial standard?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: My, my. The dutiful bookworm can read between the lines. Perhaps I gave you too little credit.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I can but posit theories and conjecture, for I will never truly know of the indignity your family suffered. Nor can I speak on the alarming disparity between the nobles and commoners, even before Bozja succumbed to imperial rule.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As I understand, it was a country where the needs of the few outweighed those of the many. The wealthy were free to forge their own futures, while the poor were free only to die should they fail in their daily struggle to survive.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And even if some few nobles were opposed to the nation being governed by an oligarchy, their peers would never relinquish their power and wealth for the greater good.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: While that Bozja is no more, I realize there are those among the Resistance who yearn for the halcyon days of their forebears, who would judge you based on your lineage rather than the content of your character.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Their voices are but echoes of a reprehensible past. You should understand better than anyone the future Bajsaljen and Marsak mean to build, a way forward paved with dignity and equality. Times change, Misija. People change.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: No, people don't change. They only fool themselves into believing they can.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I was ridiculed, marginalized, treated like an “other.” By the mere virtue of being highborn theirs was the righteous path, mine the immoral.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Bajsaljen and Marsak claim they want to put an end to the discrimination, but there is no escaping their true nature.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Their hatred must be driven out with force.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Would putting your faith in them be such a terrible thing?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Oh, if you knew the depths of their malice. Their treachery.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Perhaps I should tell you the tragedy of Queen Gunnhildr, and the great betrayal of her followers.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I'm sure you've heard the legends of Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: The blessed blade that could only be wielded by Queen Gunnhildr. Yes, I've heard the tales.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: When her kingdom came under attack during the Fourth Umbral Calamity, she brought the full might of the blade to bear to save her people, and in so doing, gave her own life.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: A bittersweet end to her reign, but I fail to see what that has to do with anything.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Before the Fourth Umbral Calamity, Gunnhildr's Blades foresaw their coming doom. As the kingdom's acting political body, they saw it as their duty to save their people at any cost, and so devised a plan to save Bozja using the power of the holy blade.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The queen's body would serve as a conduit for the blade's power, allowing them to summon a god.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: No... You don't mean...?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: A primal summoning, yes. Though perhaps it would be more fitting to call it an eikon. The blade was, after all, originally a relic stolen from the Allagans.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: An eikon...heavens forfend.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: There was one problem, however. The queen knew that, once she took in the power of this god, there would be no turning back. She was a coward, and despite her duty to protect the people, she chose her own life over theirs.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Yet Gunnhildr's Blades would not see their efforts come to naught. For they soon realized the sacrifice need not be the presently reigning queen. Nor did they need to be of noble blood.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: And so a lowborn shrine maiden was chosen to ascend the throne. Obedient to a fault, she did not hesitate to give her life to forestall the coming Calamity.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Would that this tragic tale end there, but I'm afraid it takes a rather bloody turn.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: You see, despite sacrificing herself to save Bozja, the new queen did not die, nor was she consumed by the eikon's power.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: There was a woman of Ishgard, Ysayle, capable of such a feat. But to embrace the power of the eikon and retain her sense of self...that would mean this queen possessed the Echo.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: And her power struck fear into the hearts of Gunnhildr's Blades, for a god now walked among them.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: But rather than the puppet the Blades had wished for, she was pure and free, and for that, she was slain.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: The Blades would not─could not─risk her discovering the truth of her ascension. That she was but a sacrificial lamb to save their highborn brethren.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: They claimed the queen had gone mad, drunk with the god's power, leaving them no choice but to slay her. She was then buried, along with the blade, and the truth.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Where did you hear this?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Let's just say it's a bit of family history.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Now, answer my question─how are you able to see the future?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I... I don't know. I've never been able to use it of my own volition.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I suppose it doesn't matter. We'll drag it out of you soon enough.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text:
Just thinking about what they might be doing to Mikoto, I... I...
Please, you have to save her!

obj.n: 聖剣セイブ・ザ・クイーン

quest.name: 聖剣セイブ・ザ・クイーン
journal: Bajsaljen is determined to take Castrum Lacus Litore, and would have you join him.

The Resistance has fought valiantly to force imperial troops to fall back into the castrum, and at last Operation Eagle's Nest can be seen through to completion. Bajsaljen is ready to lead Gunnhildr's Blades into the belly of the beast, and he can think of no better soldier than you to accompany them.

※Players may enter Castrum Lacus Litore via the associated critical engagement.

Your defeat of the imperial soldiers is almost effortless. Before you can plot your next move, however, Misija appears before you with Mikoto, as well as the crystal focus and the legendary blade Save the Queen. Using Mikoto as leverage, Misija coerces you into activating the crystal focus to explore the memories of the holy blade. Her intent is soon made clear when, moments later, Queen Gunnhildr emerges as a primal-like entity, enslaving the minds of the soldiers bearing the title of her guard. The threat of the queen proved too great, forcing the Resistance to retreat from the castrum.

After regrouping at Utya's Aegis, you discuss the events that took place in the castrum. Mikoto explains that Misija discovered a way to alter the memories of Save the Queen, thereby allowing her to call forth Queen Gunnhildr in a fashion not unlike primal summoning. Having now lost both the castrum and Gunnhildr's Blades, the Resistance must think long and hard on how next to proceed.

The Resistance suffered a grave defeat at Castrum Lacus Litore, but they are not discouraged. Marsak informs you that reinforcements from Dalmasca have recently arrived, with more en route from the Eastern alliance. Though it will take time, the Resistance will not rest until Bozja is free from imperial rule.
objectives: Clear the critical engagement “the Battle of Castrum Lacus Litore.”
Speak with Bajsaljen.
Speak with Marsak.
Speak with Bajsaljen.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A Resistance rank of [#1] is required to proceed with this quest.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The time has come, Forename. This day, we shall take Castrum Lacus Litore!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: On behalf of the Resistance, I offer you my humblest thanks. We could not have come this far without your aid.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: What say you, my friend? Are you prepared to rout the Garleans?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You couldn't stop me if you tried.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: You all seem to have it under control, but if you insist.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The battle for the castrum will no doubt be the fiercest yet, but do not forget your training. Do not forget all we have fought for. You are Gunnhildr's Blades, and by the queen's grace shall we prevail this day. Now, let us make ready for battle. For Bozja!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Reports suggest a powerful mage presently commands the castrum, and the continued presence of Lyon sas Helsos will no doubt prove troublesome, to say the least.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Still, with you at our side, I am confident we will be victorious in the end.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may now access the critical engagement “the Battle of Castrum Lacus Litore.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This critical engagement will be initiated when a sufficient number of players with access to Castrum Lacus Litore are present on the southern front.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Furthermore, by completing other skirmishes and critical engagements, the time required before the Battle of Castrum Lacus Litore can be initiated again will be reduced.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be sure to prepare lost actions from the lost finds cache, as they may prove key to turning the tide of battle.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If we succeed, southern Bozja may very well be freed from the Empire's grasp. With you at our side, I have little doubt we will emerge victorious in the end.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Something troubles you?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Their soldiers fell so easily, fled so quickly. This all seems...too easy.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We struck before their reinforcements could arrive, as planned, and our soldiers fought valiantly. If you believe our victory came easy, it is because your plan was executed to the letter, sir.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Perhaps...

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Is... <pant> <pant> Is Mikoto...all right?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We must split up and search for her.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: (-Misija-)I don't believe that will be necessary.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: You are outnumbered and outmatched, Misija. Release her, and we may yet be lenient with you.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: I'm not here to bargain, Bajsaljen.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Please, Misija. Whatever your grievance may be, I am certain we can find a solution. But you have to let her go.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: We can build a better Bozja, Misija. Together.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Ever the optimist. And likely the first to go when this is all over.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Forename. If you would see her unharmed, come over here. Nice and slowly.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: (Ready the Blades, and wait for an opening.)

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: How I have waited for this moment.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Forename, I'm so sorry...

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Careful. It would be a pity if I were forced to sully a holy relic such as this.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Would you care to enlighten our friend here as to its history?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: What is she planning? And what is that queer-looking blade?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Here.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: We are going to take a little trip into the memories of this blade. If you wish to keep Mikoto in one piece, that is.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Mikoto!

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Do it! Do it now!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Misija intends to explore the memories of that blade? Perhaps while she is occupied we can─

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: No. It sounds as though Mikoto and Forename will be going with her. Interrupting them may have dire consequences. We must wait for our moment.

dialogue.name: BLADESOFGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text: Is it done, then?

dialogue.name: BLADESOFGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text: She does not breathe, and her pulse has ceased.

dialogue.name: BLADESOFGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text: We were fortunate to catch her unawares. Were we to have incurred the wrath of the blade, she may have destroyed us all.

dialogue.name: BLADESOFGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text: A quick, painless death. Like as not, she did not even realize what happened.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Is this...the memory of the last queen?

dialogue.name: QUEENGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text: 'Tis true the blade possessed a terrible power. But was this the only way?

dialogue.name: QUEENGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text: I thought myself able to control it, to harness its power for good. And yet...it seems I was found wanting.

dialogue.name: QUEENGUNNHILDR
dialogue.text: At the very least, I shall take heart in the knowledge my people are safe.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text:
Naught but lies and deceit. They used you, betrayed you, slaughtered you, and dragged your name through the dirt.
Now, rise, my queen. Exact your vengeance, erase their accursed legacy from the pages of history!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: No! Leave her be!

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Go! Claim what is yours!

dialogue.name: STANIK
dialogue.text: Death to the deceivers... In the name of the queen...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Retreat!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Mikoto, no!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Marsak!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Forename! We must withdraw and regroup!

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: All of you, run!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Misija always seemed so kind, and caring. Why did it have to come to this?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I would like to believe the Empire has deceived her somehow but... I know it's not that simple. We have to stop her, Forename.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: If I hadn't seen it with my own eyes, I wouldn't believe it...

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Nothing is ever simple with you, is it? I only came here to deliver a message from Lady Fran.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: I don't understand what's going on here, but I don't intend on staying long enough to find out. I suggest you keep your time here brief as well.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We were so close. So bloody close... Misija will pay for this.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: So the legends of her power are true, then. We thought them mere faerie tales.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: It wouldn't be the first time one turned out to be true. Trust me.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: But she is the protector of Bozja! Why would the queen do such a thing...?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Misija. She has planted a seed of hatred within the queen.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: The queen's memory was altered, then?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: That hatred seemed to be reaffirmed when the queen looked upon the soldiers bearing the weapons of her guard. Misija was likely anticipating that reaction.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Death to the deceivers they said... Gods, what happened all those years ago?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Let us not dwell on the past. The Blades must be saved.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I'm afraid the effects of tempering cannot be undone... Or rather, a cure has yet to be found.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Damn it all. Was this part of her plan as well?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
