quest.name: 預言者の唄
journal: The look in Marsak's eyes tell you the fight for Bozja is far from over.

Operation Eagle's Nest has failed, and the IVth Imperial Legion once again has the Resistance on the back foot. Bajsaljen is not one to be discouraged, however, and has already begun considering counter-strategies. Believing your counsel essential, he has requested an audience with you.

A report from Bwagi reveals the imperial legion's strength is not what it seems. In fact, they are now starved for resources, which has prompted allied forces from Dalmasca and Nagxia to launch an assault and thus slow the arrival of reinforcements to Bozja. The meeting is soon interrupted when a fatigued soldier enters, warning of yet another sighting of Queen Gunnhildr. For reasons as yet unknown, this prompts Mikoto to run off, likely to the southern front.
What Mikoto expects to find on the battlefield remains to be seen, but the others bid you go and find her, fearful she may discover more than she hopes for.

You find Mikoto unharmed, spying on Misija and a group of imperials. Once again, the vision of Queen Gunnhildr appears, though her power is noticeably diminished from your previous encounter. As you turn to leave, Mikoto's gift of the Echo offers an insight into the future─she sees the Resistance cornering Misija, who is unable to wield the power of Save the Queen. Mikoto would waste no time in relaying this news to the Resistance.

Mikoto is convinced the apparition Misija has used to drive back Resistance forces is born of the memories of the late Queen Gunnhildr. She goes on to explain the fabled blade Save the Queen was likely designed to function in a similar fashion to the auracite you encountered in Rabanastre. Assuming this is true, Misija's plans cannot come to fruition without a substantial cache of crystals, meaning there may yet be time for the Resistance to strike back.
objectives: Speak with Bajsaljen.
Speak with Marsak on the Bozjan southern front.
Speak with Mikoto.
Speak with Bajsaljen at Gangos.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: It pains me to say it, but we have reached a stalemate on the Bozjan southern front. The IVth Imperial Legion seems content to play the waiting game, perhaps to conserve their strength until reinforcements arrive. We must act before their ranks are replenished.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: There is much we wish to discuss with you, though I daresay Bajsaljen could explain it better than I.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Allow me to cut straight to the heart of our troubles.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Though we were forced to abandon the castrum, it was our hope that Misija's display of force there was no more than an act of desperation to buy them time. But since then, Queen Gunnhildr has been quick to join the fray each time we engage their forces, leaving us little choice but to retreat.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: We have sustained heavy casualties. Many of those not slain outright have been made slaves to Misija's will.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I fear she could defeat our forces utterly if she so chose. Our Dalmascan allies, however, have information to the contrary.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: To put it plainly, we believe the IVth Imperial Legion has all but exhausted its resources.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: In the wake of Emperor Varis's death, the war of succession has brought the whole of Garlemald to the brink of collapse.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: As for Gabranth, he has refused orders to return to the capital. Apparently, he harbors dreams of building some new nation on the ruins of Dalmasca.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Hmm... He may once have played the loyal servant to Solus, but there was no love lost between him and Varis. It seems his allegiance to Garlemald died with the Emperor.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If what you say is true, cutting ties with Garlemald has deprived his forces of any troops or supplies they would otherwise have received.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien was quick to reach the same conclusion and ordered an assault on the IVth Imperial Legion.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: That would explain why reinforcements from Gabranth have yet to reach the Bozjan southern front.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Exactly. Even as we speak, allies from both Dalmasca and Nagxia endeavor to halt their advance.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Nevertheless, our foes on the Bozjan front have Gunnhildr's Blades at their command, giving them the upper hand. Would that there were a way to free them from Misija's control.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text:
I discussed this at length with Mistress Krile, but I am afraid a cure for their condition yet eludes us.
<sigh> If only I hadn't been captured by Misija... None of this would have happened.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: There may yet be hope, Marsak. I recently received word from the Scions that a cure for their affliction has been found.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text:
However, the procedure would require a great deal of preparation, and that is to say nothing of the difficulty in employing this treatment in combat.
<sigh> If only I hadn't been captured by Misija... None of this would have happened.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: The fault lies with me. I am the one who failed to see through her deceit. You are not to blame for any of this.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, no use moonin' about feelin' sorry for yerself. Next ye'll be sayin' we should've never reforged the blades of Gunnhildr.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCESOLDIER04025
dialogue.text: (-Resistance Soldier-)Commander! We've received word of another summoning!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Mikoto, wait! Where are you going?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: It must be the summonings─ But we can think about that later!

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Please, Forename! You've got to stop her!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: If the queen were to appear, we would only be a burden. You must go on without us.

dialogue.name: VORON
dialogue.text: (-Voron-)Lowborn traitor!

dialogue.name: ZWYNBHRUDA
dialogue.text: (-Zwynbhruda-)Don't, Voron! You'll only provoke her!

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: How the tables have turned... Now, hold still. This won't hurt a bit.

dialogue.name: AMIGART
dialogue.text: (-Amigart-)Wait, please! Don't!

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Something wrong, Misija? You've spared two of your captives.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Do it!

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: Apologies. Seems I misspoke.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: If you've come to bark orders, don't bother. The next step in my plan has already been set in motion.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Now, if you'll excuse me.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: I certainly hope she knows what she's doing. That eikon of hers is all we have left to buy us time until reinforcements arrive.

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: But what on earth could this new plan of hers be? Oh, I do so love a good scheme. Alas, I've been strictly forbidden from helping her...

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Let us return to Gangos. I have seen...more than enough.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Not another step! We have you surrounded!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: It's over, Misija. We know full well the crystal's power is spent!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: ...Another vision. Did you see it too?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Come, Forename. We must inform the others.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Now that Blade Surname has arrived, would you care to elucidate your findings, Mikoto?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: To speak plainly, I believe the apparition summoned at Castrum Lacus Litore and again on the southern front is not what we would call an eikon or a primal. Not in the strictest sense of the term.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The hells are ye talkin' about, lass? I've heard me fair share o' tales about primals, and what ye've all told me o' this Queen Gunnhildr fits the description to a bloody tittle.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: According to our records, Queen Gunnhildr wielded the power of the blade not to summon a god, but to become one, that she could protect our people.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: So she made herself a vessel for its power, then?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Misija claimed that after the Fourth Umbral Calamity was averted, the queen was able to return to her mortal form.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Tales passed down through the ages state much the same. It appears Queen Gunnhildr was able to call upon its power at will.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Then that would mean that a living vessel is required to wield the blade's true power. But that does not explain why it instead manifested in the form of Queen Gunnhildr.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Based on our experience in the castrum and what we observed on the southern front, I believe the blade was imbued with the queen's memories in the form of aether at the moment of her death, and that the crystal focus was used to draw them out.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Does that not sound familiar, Forename? Aether absorbed into a vessel, and thereafter used to call forth unspeakable monstrosities.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Precisely. It is a phenomenon quite similar to the auracite we discovered in Rabanastre.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As you may recall, Argath Thadalfus harbored a burning desire to rule, which was made manifest in the ruins of Lesalia.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Aye, it was the same for my brother, Ba'Gamnan. His guilt over the deaths of the prince and princess served as a catalyst for his own grisly transformation.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: ...I see. From what we have learned of the holy blade thus far, it has much in common with auracite.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: This is merely conjecture, but I suspect that Save the Queen was actually crafted from auracite, and altered to amplify the desires of whoever wields it.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: But who would be capable of such a feat?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I cannot say with any certainty, but together with the crystal foci, it is reminiscent of ancient Allagan technology. How it found its way into the hands of Bozjans is anyone's guess.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Now hold on a bleedin' minute. Let me see if I'm understandin' this right.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer sayin' that thing you saw in the castrum weren't no primal, but a mere sliver o' the queen's aether what was left over in the blade?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: It seems like it. But on the other hand, Misija can keep conjuring it up as many times as she wants.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Considerin' what it was designed for, that shade o' the queen is the least of our worries.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Indeed. Misija's ultimate goal is likely to become a vessel for the blade's power, much like the queen did to avert the Fourth Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: With apt preparation, Forename could likely vanquish this shade of Queen Gunnhildr.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: But if Misija should succeed in bringing the full power of the blade to bear...

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Are you suggesting there's a chance shehe could lose? Impossible! Why, I can't even count the number of stories I've heard of Forename's god-slaying adventures. What's one more notch on herhis belt?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I would rather it not come to that... Thankfully, Misija has yet to find a store of crystals suitable for her plans.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And I doubt she will─for the time being, at least─if the blade was designed in like manner to the crystal foci. We must act now, while there is still time.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: New entries have been added to the Field Record under Collection in the Duty section of the main menu.

obj.n: 未鑑定ロストシャード:探索
聖剣セイブ・ザ・クイーン
ゴッド・セイブ・ザ・クイーン

quest.name: ゴッド・セイブ・ザ・クイーン
journal: Bajsaljen would waste no time in dealing with Misija.

Mikoto is convinced that Misija has exhausted the power of Save the Queen, and her vision of the near future suggests both Misija and Save the Queen can be taken into custody without bloodshed. Marsak readies their soldiers and sets out for ruins on the eastern edge of the southern front in the hopes of catching Misija unawares.

Events play out exactly as Mikoto foresaw. The Resistance manages to corner Misija who is unable to summon Queen Gunnhildr to battle. What Mikoto failed to see, however, is that this was all according to Misija's plan, for she too can now peer into the future. Imperial enforcements soon arrive, and a terrible battle ensues there in the ruins.

No sooner do you bring low Misija's imperial soldiers than more arrive to take their place. But your battle was only meant to stall for time, as they manage to open a door leading deeper into the ruins, prompting Misija and Gunnhildr's Blades to escape into the shadows. You follow her into the heart of Delubrum Reginae, where you hope to put an end to her schemes and retrieve Save the Queen.

Deep within the heart of the ruins, Misija at last finds what she was searching for─a massive crystal rife with the aether needed to summon the full might of Save the Queen. Yet for all its power, the ancient blade proves no match for you. With the day won at last, you take the now-dormant Bozjan relic and an unconscious Misija back to Gangos.

Misija has been placed in solitary confinement awaiting trial, and Bajsaljen believes it best if Save the Queen remain in Mikoto's care for the time being. But there will be no reprieve to study its inner workings, for an imperial warship can be seen approaching in the distance. Bajsaljen orders everyone to withdraw to Gangos and prepare to make a stand.

When the Resistance next steps onto the battlefield, they will be joined by their allies from the Far East. Considering all that is at stake, there is no question that your strength will be needed when that day comes.
objectives: Speak with Mikoto.
Enter Delubrum Reginae.
Speak with Marsak.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If Misija yet lacks what is required to fulfill her plans, then we must either wrest the blade from her grasp or destroy it. Should the situation call for it, we may need to cut her down in the process.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: What if it were possible to take both Misija and the blade into our custody without conflict?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: As I understand it, there have been markedly fewer sightings of the queen's apparition, correct?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Yes, and with good reason. With no means of combating such a foe, our troops have barely set foot outside of our encampments.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I believe that Misija has her own reasons for making only sporadic appearances. She must use the crystal focus to conjure Queen Gunnhildr, and therein lies the rub, for its reserves of aether are not without limitation.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Then perhaps she fears the crystal focus nears exhaustion. But what prevents her from simply restoring its aether and resuming her assault?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Well, it just so happens the crystal focus requires aether of a very specific sort. We were only able to find one source, and that's still depleted from when we used it.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Before we returned, Forename and I chanced to spy Misija commanding Queen Gunnhildr to enslave a group of soldiers, but the apparition vanished after turning only one of them. I suspect the crystal lacked the energies necessary to complete the task.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's all well an' good, lass, but Misija ain't no fool. Until she figures out how to get the crystal focus workin' again, she won't be showin' her face again.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: She will. At least...I think she will. Forename and I shared another vision of the future.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Heading to the ruins in the midst of a storm? But for what?

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Well, it looks like that part of the vision is already coming true. Thunderclouds are gathering above the southern front, and a nasty downpour won't be far behind!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Then we must make ready before the rains come in earnest. Marsak, ready the men.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I understand your trepidation, Mikoto, but you must have faith in your gift. We will stop Misija. I promise you that.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: It was not by Forename's hand alone that we survived our ordeal in Rabanastre, lest you forget. We each have our part to play, and yours is no less important than any other.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Speakin' o' which, you'd best join the others and set out afore the rains come.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Yes, of course.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Everything appears to be in order. Are you ready, Forename?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Upon speaking with Mikoto, several cutscenes will play in sequence.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It is recommended that you set aside sufficient time to view these scenes in their entirety.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You must be a Disciple of War or Magic of level 80 or above to proceed.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I'll be with you in two shakes of a Hrothgar's tail.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Am I ready? I was waiting for you!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Not another step! We have you surrounded!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: It's over, Misija. We know full well the crystal's power is spent!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Forward, men!

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A trap!?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Come out, Mikoto! I know you're here!

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: You thought your visions of the future would offer an advantage, but you are not the only one possessed of such gifts. Not any longer.

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: A scholar you may be, but you were a fool to come here. Your precious knowledge will avail you naught against the kiss of cold steel!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Do not be unnerved. Without the queen to aid them, victory may yet be ours! To arms!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Travel to the underground ruins?

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Well? Have you broken the lock yet!?

dialogue.name: IMPERIALMACHINIST04025
dialogue.text: Yes, ma'am! Opening it now!

dialogue.name: ROSTIK
dialogue.text: (-Seasoned Gunbreaker-)I hope you don't mind me butting in.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Rostik!? What are you doing here?

dialogue.name: ROSTIK
dialogue.text: I couldn't let you lot have all the fun!

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Another one come crawling out of the woodwork!

dialogue.name: MEESIYA
dialogue.text: Gunnhildr's Blades, to me! You are to protect this blade with your lives, in the name of the queen!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Where are they going?

dialogue.name: ROSTIK
dialogue.text: Go on ahead. Leave their toys to us!

dialogue.name: ROSTIK
dialogue.text:
Ah! We've met before, that day with Radovan!
But now is not the time. Go on ahead. Leave their toys to us!

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: We'll be right behind you. Now go─Mikoto needs you!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You can now participate in the 24-player duty Delubrum Reginae.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This duty can be joined solo, as a party, or as an alliance by speaking with Mikoto in the underground ruins or Sjeros in Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Players will be matched automatically even after leaving the underground ruins or Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: It should be noted that, although this duty is in a separate instance, lost actions can still be used after entering.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Be sure to prepare lost actions from the lost finds cache, as they may prove key to turning the tide of battle.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You may also speak with Mikoto and Sjeros for further details about Delubrum Reginae before entering the duty.

dialogue.name: RESISTANCESCOUT04026
dialogue.text: If you mean to enter the ruins, I will guide you to the entrance, but I've been ordered to go no further.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Travel to the underground ruins?

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Blade Surname! Mikoto! Are you all right?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Is she...?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: No, merely unconscious.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Let us take her with us back to Utya's Aegis without delay. I fear imperial reinforcements will be upon us ere long.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: It was far from easy, but thanks to the two of you, we have succeeded in reclaiming Save the Queen.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: But it was a victory bought with great sacrifice. Under the blade's influence, many of Gunnhildr's Blades were transformed beyond recognition. At least now their suffering is at an end...

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: A heavy loss for the Resistance, 'tis true, but having wrested Save the Queen from the hands of the IVth Legion, we may resume our offensive unimpeded.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: And we must do so quickly, while they remain few in number.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: What will become of Misija?

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: For now, she will remain in solitary confinement in Gangos.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: First and foremost we must deal with the threat of the IVth Imperial Legion. Once they have been routed, she will be made to stand trial for her crimes.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Espionage, primal summoning, the tempering of Gunnhildr's Blades... She has much to atone for.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: As do many of our people, I would say. For it was the callousness and cruelty of those seeking the glory of our forebears that drove her to side with the Empire. Nevertheless, it is no excuse for her transgressions.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: As for Save the Queen, it should go without saying we mustn't allow it to fall into the wrong hands again.

dialogue.name: ROSTIK
dialogue.text: I thought perhaps it could be destroyed, but I've yet to leave so much as a scratch on the accursed thing.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: I think it best if you were to take it, Mikoto. No doubt its study would prove a most illuminating experience for you. Unless, of course, you would rather it be locked away. I shall defer to your judgment.

dialogue.name: SCREAM04026
dialogue.text: (-Frantic Voice-)Mikoto, nooo!!!

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Mikoto! Is something wrong?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: No... No, I am fine. Merely tired is all.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Then I bid you return to Gangos and rest. You have more than earned it.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Wh-What in the world!?

dialogue.name: RIAN
dialogue.text: About damned time. Now that we command the skies, they're done for.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Quickly─we must withdraw to Gangos!

dialogue.name: MENENIUS
dialogue.text: At last, victory is within our grasp.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Gods preserve us. I did not think they would go so far as to deploy a warship.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Though the odds are stacked against us, we have come too far to abandon our home. I will send word to Lord Hien, that we may begin preparations to make a final stand.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: If we fail, it will be the end for Bozja. When the final battle is upon us, I pray we can count on your aid one last time.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: You can now exchange Bozjan coins for gear by speaking with the Resistance supplier at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: For subsequent ventures into Delubrum Reginae, speak with Sjeros in Gangos.

obj.n: 戦果記録:ミーシィヤ第二集
戦果記録:グンヒルド第二集
戦果記録:ロスティック
シーサイド・ランデヴー
ロストホルダー拡張計画

quest.name: 錆に隠れし黄金色
journal: Annes seeks relics of a particular sort, and she suspects you may know where to find them.
objectives: Enter Delubrum Reginae.
Deliver the enigmatic Bozjan relic to Annes.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to undertake this quest, you must have amassed  mettle.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have currently amassed  mettle.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: Blade Surname! A pleasure to make your acquaintance. My name is Annes.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: Zlatan has told me much of your difficulties working with Gerolt. N-Not to say that he is difficult to work with, mind. Ahem. He has also told me all about your exploits on the southern front.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: And that is precisely why I am here. I believe my research on tools and weapons from ancient Bozja may be of assistance to you.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: The recently discovered ruins of the Bozjan palace are no doubt rife with such relics. If you should happen to explore its depths, I would be most grateful if you could bring back anything you find.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: Safe travels, Blade Surname. I look forward to your return.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: This quest can be completed once per week, with completion status being reset every [Reset]SundayMondayTuesdayWednesdayThursdayFridaySaturday at 12345678910111212 p.m.a.m. (Earth time).

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The item Annes seeks can be obtained by completing the raid “Delubrum Reginae.”

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To enter Delubrum Reginae, speak with Sjeros in Gangos.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: It is good to see you, Blade Surname. The relics you retrieved from the ruins have been of great help in my research.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: Since you seem to have quite a talent for unearthing ancient artifacts, perhaps you could widen the net─so to speak─to include tools used in Bozjan rituals. They would certainly be a boon to our work.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: Naturally, some relics are more useful than others, so any that we do not require for our work are yours to keep.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: I would be most grateful for any relics you can find that may have been used in ancient rituals. But do be careful down there. There may be all manner of traps set to protect the place.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: You are returned! And in one piece, I see. Were you able to recover anything of note from the ruins?

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: Extraordinary. Simply extraordinary. My, and what is this...?

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: There seems to be some sort of ancient coinage mixed in with the accoutrements you've brought. While collectors may be fascinated by this ancient currency, it falls beyond our field of study, so you are welcome to keep it.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: In any case, you have given us more than enough to work with for the time being. Thank you, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: You have a fine eye for antiquities, Blade Surname. My, and what is this...?

dialogue.name: ANNES
dialogue.text: More coinage! As agreed, you may do with it as you will. Thank you again for all your help.

obj.n: ゴッド・セイブ・ザ・クイーン

quest.name: ロストホルダー拡張計画
journal: Kriv believes he knows a way to increase your arsenal of lost actions.
objectives: Obtain pieces of Garlean synthetic fabricDeliver the pieces of Garlean synthetic fabric to Kriv.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: Blade Surname, yes? I don't believe we've met. My name is Kriv. I understand you are familiar with the fruits of my research in memory.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: As a matter of fact, our quartermasters have told me much of your findings on the front lines.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: And thanks to said findings, we believe it now possible to expand the lost finds holster even further than previously believed.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: Though I suppose it only fair we give credit to the Garleans, albeit begrudgingly.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: You see, in salvaging gear and supplies from the front, we discovered their uniforms are made using synthetic fibers that are remarkably nonconductive to aether. We believe it may be suitable for insulating the holster, thus allowing us to safely increase its capacity.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: Unfortunately, we are struggling to procure sufficient quantities of the material to test our theories. With your help, however, I believe we may be able to put them to the proof.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: We require more of their synthetic fabric to see our work complete. If you should find any when next you leave to the front lines, please bring it back to us.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Garlean synthetic fabric can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Save the Queen areas.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: Please, Blade Surname, if you can retrieve any of their fabric─any at all─it would be a boon to our research.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Garlean synthetic fabric can be obtained by participating in skirmishes and critical engagements in Save the Queen areas.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: Once we have the necessary samples, we may begin the testing procedure.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, this will do nicely. Now, may I examine your holster?

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: And...there. Everything appears to be in order.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: Here you are. I pray your now-expanded arsenal will help further turn the tide of battle in our favor.

dialogue.name: KRIV
dialogue.text: With Mistress Mikoto and Master Gerolt's assistance, we will surely have more to offer you in the future. Safe travels, Blade Surname.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The maximum capacity of the lost finds holster has been increased by 10.

obj.n: ゴッド・セイブ・ザ・クイーン

quest.name: 二番目の召喚士
journal: Y'mhitra is eager for news of her sister.

After gratefully listening to news of her sister and other recent events, Y'mhitra informs you that Summoner Jajasamu, a member of the Immortal Flames' summoner squad, would appreciate your counsel on some undisclosed matter. It seems the lieutenant is currently on leave and taking his ease at the Carline Canopy...if you have a moment or two to spare.

You meet with Summoner Jajasamu, and the veteran mercenary speaks of his experience fighting alongside two young folk blessed with a resistance to primal influence. He seems bothered by the thought that their presence on the front line is less a choice than an imposed duty, and would have you ask their feelings on the issue. Arenvald, the more approachable of the pair, is to be found in Rhalgr's Reach.

You locate Arenvald with little trouble, and together you pay a visit to Fordola's cell in the city. The ensuing exchange reveals much about the young warriors and the motivations which drive them, but the ever-bitter Fordola soon bids you leave her be. Relenting to her wishes, you and Arenvald withdraw outside to the streets of the Ala Mhigan Quarter.

Putting aside Arenvald's revealing sentiment at glimpsing Fordola's true feelings, it would seem you've been given an answer to Jajasamu's concerns. Return to the Carline Canopy, and report to the lieutenant.

Upon hearing of Arenvald and Fordola's determination, Jajasamu himself resolves to provide the finest support he can muster─even if that means becoming the “second-best summoner in Eorzea.” He bids you send his regards to Y'mhitra before going on his way.

You return to Y'mhitra, and although she cannot claim you as a mentor, the scholar nevertheless seems inspired by the effect you have on your colleagues. To perfect the summoner's art and encourage the hearts of others─this is the proud burden you are fated to bear.
objectives: Speak with Jajasamu at the Carline Canopy.
Wait at the designated location in Rhalgr's Reach.
Speak with the prison guard.
Speak with Jajasamu at the Carline Canopy.
Speak with Y'mhitra at Apkallu Falls.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To accept this quest, you must abandon the summoner job quest “To Be Second Best.” Open the corresponding entry in the journal or duty list and select “Abandon.”

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Forename! I was just about to contact the Scions to ask after my sister, and here you are to provide a report in person! What news?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: ...To the First!? One of the thirteen reflections, you mean...!?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I had thought my field of expertise a complicated one, but I struggle to comprehend the enormity of your tale. Still, Shtola seems to be faring well enough, and for that I am grateful.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Ah, yes! Before I forget, I actually had a message to pass on to you.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Do you recall Summoner Jajasamu? Formerly of the Company of Heroes and current member of the Immortal Flames' summoner squad? He commands both an Ifrit- and Titan-Egi, and is likely one of the more seasoned...ahem. Well, I am sure you remember.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: He is in Gridania on leave, as it happens, and asked me to direct you to the Carline Canopy should you stop by for one of your unpredictable visits.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I believe he wished to consult you on some private matter... 'Twould be kind of you to lend him an ear if you've a moment or two to spare.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Have you spoken with the lieutenant? I believe he wishes to speak with you summoner-to-summoner.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: ...Bloody hells! I was just thinkin' about ye, an' there ye are! Y'mhitra had a word on me behalf, I take it? Well, let's not stand on ceremony...

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: I'll not mince words with ye─I need some advice concernin' summoners in mortal combat.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: They tell me ye've a special nature what prevents primals from enthrallin' yer mind.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: So what I want to know is, what's yer thinkin' on bein' sent out to the front lines every time a beast tribe scrapes together a pile o' crystals?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: That's just the way of things.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: I'm happy to be able to help.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Such is yer fate, ye mean? So ye give in to the inevitable, and fight because it's yer duty to do so?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: So ye just see it as yer rightful place? Folk need yer help, an' ye've been blessed with the means to help 'em...?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Well, that's one way o' lookin' at it. Me, I'm in it for the coin─have been ever since I sold me spells with the Company o' Heroes.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Most o' the soldiers I march with ain't much different. We're happy to put our lives on the line as long as there's a purse waitin' for us at the end o' the day. The pair what joined in on our last skirmish, though...now there's a whole 'nother story.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Ye've heard of Arenvald an' Fordola, aye?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: The lad's one o' the Scions, same as you. No mystery there.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: As for the lass...she's a bit more complicated. Former officer in the imperial army, captured by the Resistance an' steps away from the noose. Fightin' for Ala Mhigo as a conscript now, which is the only reason she's still breathin'.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Barely more'n sprouts, the both of 'em, an' they was deployed with the Flames to assist with downin' Ifrit.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: From what I hear, they share yer resistance to primal influence. An' that's why─that's the whole reason they had the dubious honor of standin' in the thick o' the flames.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, me an' me fellow summoners was cowerin' in the shadows, sendin' out our egi to support these youngsters what've seen less than forty summers between 'em.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Can't say I cared much for the experience. It bothered me to think they was bein' made to fight a battle what weren't theirs, just because o' who they are.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Do ye think ye could talk to 'em for me? Ask how they feel about the whole thing? Yer about the only person I can turn to...

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Me thanks. Ye'll find Arenvald in Rhalgr's Reach, an' he'll know where to find Fordola. I'll tell him to meet you by the aetheryte.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Arenvald was in Rhalgr's Reach last I heard. If ye could ask 'em me questions, it'd sure help me sleep at night...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Ah, Forename. I've been told you need my help with something. If you give me a moment, I'll meet you over by the aetheryte.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Forename, I heard you had returned from Jajasamu! What can I do for our honored champion?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Jajasamu said that...? Aye, we joined them against Ifrit, but I'd thought him more annoyed by our presence than concerned for our well-being.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Hm, why don't I save you some time and include Fordola in this conversation. We can visit her in her cell over in the city.

dialogue.name: GUARDS04033
dialogue.text: If you're waiting for the lad in silver armor, he should be out of there soon.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: She still snarls like a chained dog...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Amidst all that growling, though, she gave us a glimpse of her true self. Enough that I'll know when to lend a shoulder, even if she wouldn't let me see her suffering...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: N-Now don't be getting the wrong idea! Same age, same homeland─I can't help but care a little about what happens to her!

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: A-Anyway, I have my own training to think of. Give my regards to Summoner Jajasamu!

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Ye've been to see them two youngsters, then?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Huh... So, that's the way of it, eh?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Well, I shouldn't be surprised considerin' the example they've been given to follow.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: An' now that I know how they're approachin' these fights, I can adjust me own tactics accordingly. One's passionate, an' the other's reckless, so they'll both need some watchful support.

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: I'll do what I can to stand in for ye, though I doubt I'll ever replace ye. Aye, they'll call me “the second-best summoner in Eorzea”─how's that for humble!?

dialogue.name: JAJASAMULALASAMU
dialogue.text: Right, I think it's past time I was on me way. Give me best to Y'mhitra, Forename, an' thanks for humorin' me request!

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: Everything went well with the lieutenant, I trust?

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: I won't pry into the details, but I am glad to see you looking so content.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: To master summoning is an arduous journey, yet I imagine the going is made far smoother with a mentor such as you. I am somewhat envious of your younger colleagues.

dialogue.name: YMHITRA
dialogue.text: And if I am to mirror their progress, I must not allow my own scholarly research to fall by the wayside! Good day to you, Forename!

obj.n: 天眼のメガマテリジャ
武略のメガマテリジャ
雄略のメガマテリジャ

quest.name: 聖剣による閃き
journal: Recent events on the southern front have Gerolt feeling inspired.

The Resistance has graciously allowed Gerolt to examine Save the Queen. Impressed by its craftsmanship and capacity for memories, he has been inspired to incorporate what he learned from the holy blade into the Resistance weapons. The process will require a great deal more memories, however, and for that he would ask you to consult with Zlatan.

Zlatan would discuss the matter of gathering more memories after you are duly prepared. Though he has yet to elaborate on what manner of memories may be required, you suspect a trying experience yet awaits you.
objectives: Speak with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Made it back in one piece, eh, Forename? Same goes for Misija, 'cept she's been taken off to the gaols. I s'pose that's the last we'll be hearin' of Queen Gunnhildr an' all.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: That Save the Queen should be returned to us at last... Words cannot well express our gratitude.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ahem. But that is not to say our work is finished. Far from it.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: We were lucky enough to be given a look at the blade itself. To say it's perfect is a damned understatement.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: An' its capacity fer memory's unlike anythin' I've ever seen. A quality I reckon's worth tryin' to replicate.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We could never hope to match the efficacy of Save the Queen, there is no denying that. But if there is even the slimmest possibility of improving the Resistance weapons, we must try.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, and if all goes to plan, we can do a mite more than simply increasin' their power. I see no reason why the memories can't be used to better attune the weapons to the one wieldin' 'em.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Excuse me, but I think I misheard you. Did you say that the Resistance weapons can not only be refined, but tailored specifically to Forename's preferred style of combat?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In theory. The finer details can be hammered out later. First, we need to see about increasin' the weapons' capacity fer memories.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: I see... Might you humor me with further explanation of your plans? There may be something in my research that proves of use in the refinement process.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Rowena's got me in enough of a bind as it is, and relyin' on one of her lackeys is only gonna make things worse. Then again, I haven't much of a say in the matter, do I...?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: But sod all that for now, let's talk about the job at hand.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If any o' this is goin' to work, I'll have to recast yer weapon. I've got a shape in mind, so while I'm readyin' the forge, I need you to go an' gather more memories o' the dyin'.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bugger me if I knew where to find 'em, though. Might be ol' Zatro here can─No, that ain't right. Uh... Wait, don't tell me...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: For the last time, my name is... <sigh> Never mind. If it please you, Blade Surname, we may speak on the matter of memories later.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I know he's cross with me forgettin' his name, but can ye blame me? Only thing I do remember is letters ain't supposed to fit together like that. It ain't right, lasslad. It just ain't right...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As Gerolt mentioned before, we would ask you to gather more memories while we see to preparations for a new weapon casting.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: With regard to what manner of memory would be appropriate for this latest endeavor, we may discuss that when you are ready to depart.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A new Resistance weapons quest is now available from Zlatan.

obj.n: 猛々しき記憶を「レジスタンス・ウェポン」へ
ゴッド・セイブ・ザ・クイーン
形を変えし「レジスタンス・ウェポン」

quest.name: 形を変えし「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
journal:
Zlatan is ready to see you on your way.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

You consult Zlatan about what manner of memory would be ideal to further enhance your Resistance weapon, and he suggests those that come from battles of great peril, such as one might expect in a large-scale assault. He is confident fifteen such memories will suffice. Where they should be collected, however, he leaves to your judgment.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Loathsome memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in critical engagements on the southern front, or by completing Crystal Tower alliance raids.

Gerolt has readied his forge for your return, and he is quick to begin working when you hand him the memories. With his customary flourishes of clanging and banging, your Resistance weapon is given new form, the energies emanating from it nearly palpable. Though he is quite satisfied with his work, he believes there is yet room for improvement. It is his hope inspiration will strike again before you next call on his services.
objectives: Obtain loathsome memories of the dyingHonorbound Recollection and Tenacity RecollectionSamsara RecollectionSkullrender RecollectionDreizack RecollectionBrilliance RecollectionIngrimm RecollectionSoulscourge RecollectionEspiritus RecollectionAkademos RecollectionHoneshirazu RecollectionLawman RecollectionWoeborn RecollectionSolstice RecollectionHoshikiri RecollectionTalekeeper RecollectionCrownsblade RecollectionEnchufla RecollectionWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the loathsome memories of the dying to Zlatan at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “Change of Arms,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Change of Arms,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “Change of Arms,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Are you ready to seek out memories for your weapon? Excellent.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We have come to the conclusion that those formed at a moment of great peril─such as some manner of large-scale assault─would best suit our purposes.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Battles on the southern front will no doubt suffice, but I imagine a worldly adventurer such as yourself can think of other places to find them. If you can track down fifteen such memories, we should be well on our way to forging a new weapon for you.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to refine another Resistance weapon, I presume? Then I will have Master Gerolt ready the forge.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As before, the work will require another set of fifteen memories.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Loathsome memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in critical engagements on the southern front.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing Crystal Tower alliance raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: With memories of sufficient intensity, we are quite certain no more than fifteen will be required for the task at hand. Where you choose to find them, be it on the southern front or elsewhere, I will leave to your judgment.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Loathsome memories of the dying can be obtained by participating in critical engagements on the southern front.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: They may also be obtained by completing Crystal Tower alliance raids.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ah, you are returned. Before we begin, might I ask you to remove your weapon?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Master Gerolt has readied the forge, along with all other requisite materials. May I have the memories you have collected?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Wonderful. And the weapon, if you please.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Very good. Master Gerolt will be delighted. Or whatever passes for delight in that ale-sodden mind of his.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right, then. If these here memories are as potent as I think they are, this should make for interestin' work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Lookin' to spruce up another Resistance weapon, are we? Well, can't rightly say no after ye went through the trouble o' gatherin' all these here memories.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Right, then. If these here memories are anythin' like the last bunch, this shouldn't take too long.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems the memories've taken to yer weapon well enough. And they've transformed it into a right fine piece of art. I call 'em'er, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Seems the memories've taken to yer weapon well enough. And they've transformed it into a right fine piece of art. I call 'er, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course we can't forget 'er counterpart, [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Turns out the queen's inscriptions are more powerful than I gave 'em credit for. Wouldn't surprise me if they've a bit more untapped potential.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: You have outdone yourself once again, Master Gerolt! Why, it is almost enough to overlook your deplorable drinking habits. And you believe the weapon may be improved upon even further?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Can't say fer certain. Perhaps if, uh...if I were to take a little stroll about the camp─ye know, to clear me head an' such─might be as I'll be struck by inspiration.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Did you not say the very same thing shortly after Blade Surname left to collect memories? As I recall, it was a very short stroll to the storehouse. Where you imbibed the entirety of our last keg of ale...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: No, I believe you've had enough inspiration for one day, Master Gerolt. Instead, I believe it behooves us to share your latest accomplishment with the others before promptly returning to work.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Hmph.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: <sigh> Not even a pint for all me efforts. Well, don't let us keep you. I'm sure you're itchin' to try that fancy new weapon o' yers. If afterward ye decide it still needs more work, come back and I'll see what I can do.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: As always, it is an honor and a privilege to see you work, Master Gerolt. It is quite clear there is still much for me to learn about the art of smithing.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Yer praise is appreciated, but what I need now ain't compliments, but mead. Or mayhaps if ye'd let me fix up a kettle or two fer a nice change o' pace...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: It is weapons the Resistance needs, Master Gerolt, not kettles. Surely, devising methods of improving the Resistance weapons would be a better use of your time?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Speaking of which, if you should find your weapon wants for refinement, do not hesitate to come and speak with me.

quest.name: 窮状を救いし、球状の物体
journal: Judging by his furrowed brow, Gerolt's plans to further improve your Resistance weapon may at last be taking shape.

On the surface, Gerolt's plan is seemingly simple─a more selective use of crystallized memories to better align with your preferred style of combat. However, the means to analyze the aetherial properties of these memories yet eludes him. Enter Regana, accompanied by an Allagan node commissioned from Garlond Ironworks designed to do precisely that. Though daunted by the potential ramifications of accepting further help─financial or otherwise─Zlatan can see no other way to proceed with Gerolt's plan. As Regana explains, the node will use gathered memories to create a registry with which you can modify the Resistance weapon as you see fit. Hoping for an adequate sample size, Gerolt suggests searching for two types of memories, eighteen of each.

※Memories of the dying can be found from certain FATEs and alliance raids.
※Haunting memories of the dying can be found from FATEs in the Gyr Abania region, or the Shadow of Mhach alliance raids.
※Vexatious memories of the dying can be found from FATEs in the Far East region, or the Return to Ivalice alliance raids.

You return to Gangos with an ample supply of memories for the node, which wastes no time in analyzing and allocating them. When you offer up your Resistance weapon, however, it warns of aetheric instability, and the near-certain corruption of your weapon should you proceed. Zlatan believes the solution to this problem lies in the crystal foci, which used a sealant of heated aetherial siltstone to ensure its stability. Regana notes there was a time when pottery made from this stone could be found in all corners of the realm, suggesting the ruins of Bozja may not be the only place where they can be found. Of course, there is only one among you capable of scouring such dark depths.
objectives: Deliver memories of the dying to the Allagan node in Gangos.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Aye, I know why you're here. Yer lookin' to better tune the weapon to match the way ye like to fight. Lucky fer you, I've a plan.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: The process ain't that different from what we've done before, mind, but we need to be a mite more particular about which memories we use.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Easier said than done, I imagine. How is shehe to know what effect the memories will have before they are applied?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: That's just it, lad. SheHe can't.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: First, we need to find a way to analyze the aether trapped in 'em. Bugger me if I know how, though.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bah, all this ponderin' an' postulatin' ain't fer me, lad. If it's all the same to you, I think I'll head to the store─ Erm, take a stroll to clear me head.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: (-???-)There will be no need for that Gerolt. I believe I have the solution you are looking for.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Regana, what are you doing here? And where in the world did you acquire such a device?

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Ever since laying eyes on it, I was intrigued by Mikoto's recording module, and so as part of my arrangement with the Resistance, I commissioned an Allagan node of my own from the Ironworks.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Even by Allagan standards, it really is quite remarkable. But what interested me most is its highly advanced data analysis protocol.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Thanks to modifications by the Ironworks engineers, it should have no problem analyzing the aetherial properties of any crystallized memories found by Forename, and subsequently infusing said aether into the Resistance weapons.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: So yer sayin' with this floatin' Allagan trinket here...my plan would actually work!?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, wouldn't be the first time I had help from one o' these Allagan trinkets. If you're sure it'll do the job, then I say we put it through its paces.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Thank you, Regana, thank you! I never imagined the House of Splendors would go so far to help our cause.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Well, our help is not without its price, I assure you. And make no mistake─when all is said and done, this Allagan node will be returning with me to Mor Dhona.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: We will always have use for an efficient worker that follows instructions to the letter. One that doesn't need frequent strolls along the beach or a constant supply of ale. At this rate, certain artisans may find their services are no longer required.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I...cannot say I like the implications of that, but aiding the Resistance must come first. You have our full cooperation, for the time being, at least...

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Splendid. Then let us return to the matter of analyzing the crystallized memories.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Your part in this is quite simple: you need but provide a sufficient sample size of crystals to the node. It will create a registry of any memories it is supplied, analyzing each entry for its combat potential.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: When the analysis is complete, we can readily assess the manner in which each memory would affect the Resistance weapon, thereby allowing you to choose those most suitable to your needs.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: And for that, we'll be needin' memories.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Variety bein' the spice o' life an' all, I think it for the best if ye look fer two types o' memories. Eighteen of each should do. At least, I hope it will.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Memories of the dying can be found from certain FATEs and alliance raids.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Haunting memories of the dying can be found from FATEs in the Gyr Abania region, or the Shadow of Mhach alliance raids.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Vexatious memories of the dying can be found from FATEs in the Far East region, or the Return to Ivalice alliance raids.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: If that's not a flagon of ale or crystal memories in yer hands, I'll have to ask ye to leave me be for now, lasslad.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Please insert memory samples for registration and analysis.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Processing...
Processing complete. <blip> <blip> Initiating memory analysis...

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> <blip> Memory analysis complete.
Memory registry compile complete. Zero anomalies detected.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: So far so good. Now to determine which memory is best suited to Forename's weapon.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Warning. <blip> Probability of successful infusion estimated at 3.2%. Do you wish to proceed?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: What in the seven hells!? No! Why is the chance o' success so bleedin' low?

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Aetheric instability detected within the weapon. <blip> Infusion of additional aether will result in aetherial corruption.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: It's unstable? But I followed the old Bozjan techniques to the letter!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hmmm...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: We unearthed a number of tomes in the ruins beneath the southern front, one of which pertained to the fashioning of crystal foci.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: To ensure the stability of aether held within them, they were said to be coated with a solution made with aetherial siltstone.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Were they now? Then I suppose we'll have to do the same. Good on ye, Zra... Zala... Erm...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: <sigh> I am glad to be of help, but there is still the matter of tracking down the siltstone...

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: Naturally, the ruins of Bozja would be a good place to start. I have also heard that in ancient times, pottery made with aetherial siltstone found its way to lands far and wide. Unfortunately, it has all but disappeared from circulation in today's markets.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: In that case, whoever bought those pots back in the day might have left some lyin' around, maybe even in ruins o' their own.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Oi, if we were to feed you relics made with aetherial siltstone, reckon ye could whip up a coatin' for the Resistance weapon?

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Provided sufficient quantities, production of aetherial sealant is possible.

dialogue.name: REGANA
dialogue.text: My, what an ingenious solution. You impress me, Gerolt.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course there's only one person here what can safely plumb the depths o' dark, dank ruins an' come out in one piece. Best ye consult with Zalatan about which ruins ye go about plumbin', though.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Zlatan, Master Gerolt... Zlatan.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Ahem. When you are ready to depart, Blade Surname, we may discuss the matter of where best to excavate the relics we seek.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A new Resistance weapons quest is now available from Zlatan.

obj.n: 形を変えし「レジスタンス・ウェポン」
「レジスタンス・ウェポン」は新たな道を

quest.name: 「レジスタンス・ウェポン」は新たな道を
journal:
Zlatan is ready to see you on your way once more.
※Changing classes or jobs will prevent progress during this quest.

While relieved to know the Bozjan ruins are not the only place where antiquities made of aetherial siltstone may be found, Zlatan is no less discomfited knowing the arduous task of procuring them must fall to you. Gerolt is confident that fifteen relics should suffice for your plans, and so you set out in search of dark, perilous ruins, hoping his guess is on the mark.

※You may not proceed with a class or job that is different from when you accepted this quest.
※Timeworn artifacts can be obtained by completing the raid Delubrum Reginae, or the deep dungeon Palace of the Dead.

You return to Gangos with a hard-earned assortment of artifacts. Loaded into the Allagan node, along with the Resistance weapon, the refinement process thereafter is surprisingly painless. Almost suspiciously so. Zlatan and Gerolt then discuss the feasibility of repeating the refinement process, prompting an equally suspicious recording from the Allagan node, extolling wares from the House of Splendors that would save you the trouble of finding more artifacts, albeit at a price. Zlatan would not forbid you from purchasing from the House of Splendors, but he is understandably keen to avoid any unnecessary dealings with the notoriously unscrupulous Rowena.
objectives: Obtain timeworn artifactsLaw's Order Bastard Sword and Law's Order Kite ShieldLaw's Order KnucklesLaw's Order LabrysLaw's Order SpearLaw's Order Composite BowLaw's Order CaneLaw's Order RodLaw's Order IndexLaw's Order CodexLaw's Order KnivesLaw's Order RevolverLaw's Order ZweihanderLaw's Order AstrometerLaw's Order Samurai BladeLaw's Order RapierLaw's Order ManatriggerLaw's Order ChakramsWith in your inventory or Armoury Chest, deliver the timeworn artifacts to the Allagan node at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please note that upon completing the quest “A New Path of Resistance,” you will receive a Resistance weapon for an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please ensure you have changed to your desired job before speaking with Zlatan.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as another job.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Undertake this quest as an [Job]a [Job].

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please speak with Zlatan again when you are ready to undertake this quest.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error] and [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You have already received [Error]. Please change to a different job and speak with Zlatan again.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “A New Path of Resistance,” please ensure that [Error] and [Error] are either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: In order to accept the quest “A New Path of Resistance,” please ensure that [Error] is either equipped, in your Armoury Chest, or in your inventory.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Who would have thought that the answer to our prayers would be found in ancient pottery of all places?

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: And thanks to the efforts of merchants countless years ago, such relics may be found far beyond the region in which they originated. Considering the present state of Bozja, being able to search for them in other locations may prove beneficial to us.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: I say “us,” but I am afraid the task of procuring them must fall unto you, Blade Surname. Though I dare not ask why, Master Gerolt is quite confident that fifteen artifacts made from aetherial siltstone are likely to contain the requisite amount to coat your Resistance weapon. I trust you know better than I what ruins are worthy of exploration, so I will leave the rest to you. Safe travels.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Come to refine another Resistance weapon? Then we will have need of more aetherial siltstone.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: After your last foray, I trust you know where best to search out the antiquities required, so I will say no more. The node will be ready and waiting for your return.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Timeworn artifacts can be obtained by completing the raid Delubrum Reginae, or the deep dungeon Palace of the Dead.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Unable to initiate aetherial siltstone extraction. Please insert artifacts.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Timeworn artifacts can be obtained by completing the raid Delubrum Reginae, or the deep dungeon Palace of the Dead.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Weapon not found. <blip> Please relinquish weapon to proceed with enhancement.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Please insert raw materials to begin aetherial siltstone extraction.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Scanning...
<blip> <blip> Aetherial siltstone detected. Please insert weapon.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Weapon detected. Preparing aetheroinsulation coating.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: Weapon aether stabilized. <blip> Please select memories for desired attribute adjustment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you do?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Adjust Resistance weapon attributes.

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Inquire about the refinement process.

dialogue.name: A3
dialogue.text: Nothing.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: By supplying the Allagan node with timeworn artifacts, you may raise the four available attributes of your Resistance weapon as you see fit.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: When you are satisfied with the allotment of attributes, select Allocate to complete the process.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Choose carefully, as redistribution of attributes will require the procurement of additional materials.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> <blip> Scanning registry... Readying memories for extraction...

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Applying aetheroinsulation coating...
<blip> <blip> Initiating aetheric memory infusion...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Well, I'll be damned. It worked!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'll give the Allagan ball o' bolts credit─any smith worth their hammer'd be proud of a weapon as fine as this. I'll call 'em'er [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: I'll give the Allagan ball o' bolts credit─any smith worth their hammer'd be proud of a weapon as fine as this. I'll call 'er [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: And what better to partner 'er with than [Error]!

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: 'Course if somethin' ain't right with 'emit, tell it to the node, not me.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
<blip> Warning. <blip> Warning.
Subsequent memory infusions require reapplication of aetheroinsulation coating.

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Meaning Blade Surname would need to acquire more siltstone.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: And there is no better place to procure said siltstone than Rowena's House of Splendors!

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
Our stalls are stocked with the finest relics, containing high concentrations of aetherial siltstone, which are certain to meet all your weapon forging needs. Visit your nearest House of Splendors representative today, and receive a discount on your first purchase!
If quality is what you seek, then come to Mor Dhona and let Mistress Rowena add a touch of splendor to your life.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text:
This advertisement was brought to you by Rowena's House of Splendors.
The House of Splendors is not responsible for damages, injury, or painful
death incurred through the use, misuse, or inability to use their products.
Offer is void in the void where prohibited or not prohibited.

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Bloody hell... Is nothing safe from that money-grubbin' witch?

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Guess I should count meself fortunate. 'Least I got to keep me name, unlike the rest o' her bloody underlings. <sigh> Though I reckon she'll come fer that too afore long...

dialogue.name: GEROLT
dialogue.text: Remember, lasslad─if somethin' ain't right with 'emit, tell it to the node, not me.

dialogue.name: MEMORIZESYSTEM
dialogue.text: <blip> Additional aetherial siltstone required for reapplication of aetheroinsulation coating. Artifacts from Rowena's House of Splendors recommended for maximum efficiency. <blip> House of Splendors representatives are standing by!

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: Hmm... That would certainly save you from the undue burden of traveling the world over in search of the requisite antiquities. Of course, that is to say nothing of the payment expected in return...

dialogue.name: ZLATAN
dialogue.text: From what I gather, placing ourselves in their debt, financial or otherwise, would be ill-advised.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Aetherial sealant can be obtained from Auriana at Revenant's Toll or Hismena at Idyllshire.

quest.name: 谷間のゆり
journal: Marsak has new intelligence on the imperials' whereabouts.

Resistance scouts have confirmed the IVth Legion has abandoned Castrum Lacus Litore, and are now consolidating their forces at Zadnor. Despite the presence of the imperial fleet, Bajsaljen intends to confront the enemy, with Camp Vrdelnis as the staging ground.
As per Marsak's instructions, you speak with Sjeros, who is to act as your escort to Zadnor.

Thanks to the Ironworks' ingenuity and contributions from the Dalmascan resistance, Cid was able to erect a barrier to protect Camp Vrdelnis from aerial assaults. Bajsaljen has a mind to push the front line forward, however, and any outposts established hereafter will also require similar protection. Thankfully, the Ironworks already has a plan of action, which Lilja is eager to explain.

The Resistance seeks to secure new outposts closer to the imperials' base of operations, but to do so will require further barriers and a sufficient source of energy to power them. To that end, Cid and Lilja ask you to place devices in the field to redirect the flow of aether towards the proposed outposts.

Using the Ironworks' latest creation, the Resistance should be able to obtain all the power they need to maintain a barrier surrounding each outpost, assuming, of course, the devices actually work. You steel yourself for yet another foray into the battlefield, that you may carve the first foothold in enemy territory.
objectives: Speak with Sjeros.
Speak with Bajsaljen at Zadnor.
Speak with Lilja.
Speak with Mikoto.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Blade Surname. We have at last determined the whereabouts of the IVth Legion's remaining installation here in Bozja. Our scouts reported sightings of their forces rallying at Zadnor to the north, which seems to indicate that Castrum Lacus Litore has been abandoned.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: We deployed our vanguard to advance on the enemy stronghold, but the way is barred by a fleet of warships.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Now that Queen Gunnhildr no longer poses a threat, Bajsaljen intends to deploy the troops previously held in reserve. We will be joining them in Zadnor shortly.

dialogue.name: MARSHAK
dialogue.text: Our first port of call is Camp Vrdelnis. When you are ready, Sjeros will escort you there.

dialogue.name: SERAOUSH
dialogue.text: I've been expecting you, Blade Surname. If your preparations are complete, let us depart for Camp Vrdelnis.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You now have access to Zadnor. Like the Bozjan southern front, Zadnor can be explored in parties of up to eight players, or solo.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: To embark on your journey to Zadnor, speak with Sjeros at Gangos.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Please be advised that all excursions to Zadnor are item level synced. Gear exceeding an item level of [#1] will be adjusted.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming. I understand this is your first time in Zadnor, yes? Even before the IVth Legion relocated here from Castrum Lacus Litore, it was hardly the most hospitable of places.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: To see it now, one can scarcely believe it was once a rich and fertile land. Sadly, it was not spared the ravages of the Fourth Umbral Calamity.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: In the wake of the disaster, this plateau became rich in earth-aspected crystals. Miners were keen to seize the opportunity, and they quickly exhausted the supply of this valuable resource. As the settlers had no other reason to continue living in such harsh environs, the region eventually became uninhabited.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Until the imperials decided to establish an outpost here, that is. Just when we thought ourselves prepared for their next assault, they usher in a fleet of ships from Dalmasca led by the Dalriada. It has yet to move since dropping anchor.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: There is no denying the strategical advantage of their present location, but we are not yet convinced it is fit to serve as a new base of operations.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: Regardless, rather than speculate over the imperials' schemes, we must take decisive action. Now is the time to deliver the final blow to the IVth Legion.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: If we are to succeed, we will first need to deal with the warships stymieing our attempts to advance.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: (-Familiar Voice-)Well, it's a good thing you have us to help with that.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: See those floating rock formations? One might think them a result of the Fourth Umbral Calamity, but they were actually caused by the Bozja incident.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: When Dalamud struck the citadel, vast quantities of energy permeated the site, likely carried to every corner of Bozja via aether currents. Certain regions were affected more severely than others, and, well...the results are self-explanatory.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Thankfully, we've managed to tap into that energy to erect a barrier to protect from aerial strikes, much like Seiryu's Wall.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: As you can see, the barrier only extends to the boundaries of this encampment, but it should keep us safe for the time being. Words can ill express my gratitude to Cid for all he has done for us.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: I can't take all the credit. This wouldn't have been possible without the equipment supplied to us by the Dalmascan resistance.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: What's more, the idea to use the land's residual energy came from Lilja, one of my newest engineers. So you see, it was a collaborative effort.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: But as you said, the barrier can only cover so much ground. If the Dalriada decides to do more than loom ominously in the distance, our troops on the front line won't stand a chance.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: If only it were a matter of combating their fleet with one of our own. As things stand, the Eastern alliance is in no position to lend us any of their ships, and the Bozjans have next to none in the first place.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: We may not have a fleet, but we do have an abundance of residual aether at our disposal.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: If only there was someone who could help us. Perhaps a world-class engineer and master of innovation or some such... <cough> <cough>

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: And pray tell, where might we find one of those?

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Yes, yes, point taken. After all, I can't have newcomers like you stealing my thunder. I'll see if I can turn that idea of yours into a workable solution.

dialogue.name: BAISHAEN
dialogue.text: We would be lost without the aid of Garlond Ironworks and the Eastern alliance. Their goodwill must be repaid with naught less than victory.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Now that you're here, we've a favor to ask of you. I volunteered to do it myself, but a certain someone insisted I stay put.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: Your enthusiasm is appreciated, but I'd rather go myself than put any of my workers in harm's way. Besides, this is no job for an engineer. Long story short─the Resistance means to advance on the enemy's position, and to do that, they'll need protection.

dialogue.name: CID
dialogue.text: We aim to erect additional barriers at each outpost they establish along the route to the IVth Legion's base of operations. The trouble is, the residual aether alone may not be enough, so we plan to divert the currents further afield.

dialogue.name: LILJA
dialogue.text: Although the theory is sound enough, we haven't had a chance to put it into practice.

dialogue.name: CID
